The main grip for your phone is expandable, so it is likely to take just about any sized phone (up to 3.3 inches).  This grip is then attached to the main mount.  The main mount consists of the circular plastic that attaches to your windshield (or dashboard) and the circular plastic that holds your phone.  These two are connected by a ball valve that rotates 360 degrees.  In fact, you can rotate your phone 360 degrees horizontally and vertically to make the perfect viewing fit.Suction cup grips have always been a nuisance for me.  You hit a bump in the road and everything drops to the floor making for a hazardous situation.  The "Press-n-Twist Lock" powerful suction cup mount usually attaches securely.  You can try to slightly wet the suction mount on your windshield or for the most egregious situation, simply glue it to your windshield.  (You can scrape it off later if you need to).  If you do glue it to your windshield or dashboard, use a rubber cement and not super-glue and always use the spare plastic mount for attaching it.  Make sure it won't fall off before you go driving.Item generously supplied by manufacturer for an honest review.
summary: Compact and Versatile - Be Cautious With Attachment

reviewerName: Nathan Andersen "Gadget lover and author of S...
reviewText: I don't normally place calls while driving, since I find that holding a phone up to my ear can be distracting. Even when I turn it on speaker, I have to set it down and then it's harder to hear and harder to be heard. What I do use the iPhone for while driving is to get directions. Apple's Maps (say what you will about the quality of the maps themselves) does a good job giving verbal directions, but sometimes I like to see where I'm going and, again, I don't like to have the distraction of holding it in my hand while I'm driving.This compact mount does a good job holding the phone where I can see it, but it isn't a distraction because I can still see the road -- right on the lower part of the windshield, just left of center. It will, of course, stick anywhere on the windshield using the suction mount. You can also mount it on the dashboard or any other flat surface if you first mount the included pad, that has a sticky side you can expose by removing a plastic cover. Once on, it creates a permanent flat surface that the suction can grip onto, as easily as it grips onto glass or smooth metal.In order to get it to stick, you need to clean the smooth surface, press it on hard, and then twist a knob that secures the suction. There's a grip that holds the phone secure, and it can be swiveled around to orient it as you like.It is made of plastic, and I do wonder whether it will be durable. I haven't experienced problems with the suction that some others have reported -- but the climate where I live never gets very cold, and it's in the cold that there seem to be problems. For me, then, this works just fine to secure my iPhone where I can see it and speak into it.I was provided a sample of this product for reviewing purposes.
summary: Easy to mount, lets me see my iPhone for calls and directions

reviewText: I've been using the Bolse Mini Holder for about a week.  Initially, it would not hold a suction, but I sprayed some water on the suction cup and it's stayed put on my beanbag ever since.  For those without a beanbag, this unit will mount on the windshield or on the smooth plastic disc (included) that sticks to the dashboard.The Bolse will comfortably hold my iPhone.  It will also hold my Tom Tom XL 340, but the  4.3" screen stretches the limit of its ability.  Anything wider than 3 1/8" will not fit.This holder sits a little higher off my beanbag than the holder that came with the Tom Tom, and it has more give (i.e., the Tom Tom feels springy to the touch).  This all took a little getting used to, but it hasn't caused me any problems and I don't even notice it now.With the iPhone in the holder looking at me, the "head" will nod up and down.  The "face" will rotate 360 degrees to adjust from landscape to portrait positions and back.  It can't look left and right but is overall very adjustable.When folded up, the holder is compact and doesn't take up much space.  It could be stored just about anywhere.I'm happy with the Bolse Mini.  It's small yet versatile enough to hold either my cell phone or GPS.  The grip and suction are solid.  I use it with confidence that my phone will not fall.This product was provided for review by LowerPriceUSA.
summary: Solid holding power

reviewText: This car mount is very portable and compact. It is easy to remove, fold it up and put it in your bag. It works by rotating the base to activate the suction or to loosen it.  I live in Virginia, our for-season weather sometimes makes the suction cup looses its holds with the changing temperature. What I do is I normally mount it on the dashboard. It comes with a rounded base that has a sticker on rhe bottom to attach to your dashboard.  Once in placed, you can place the suction cup on the smooth top for horizontal installation. You can also attach it directly to your windshield.  When I do that, I make sure that the bottom part of the GPS or smartphone touches the dashboard to support the weight so it just doesn't falls off.The holder is adjustable so it doesn't matter if you have a case for your iPhone or Touch, it will fit snuggly on the mount; my 3GS iPhone has a Mophie battery/case which makes it bulky and heavy. It also rotates 360 degrees with a ball pivot you usually see on camera tripods.  The sides are padded to prevent scratches on your device.Cons:- Suction cup is more stiff than others I have tried.  It works OK but you have to put more downward pressure while rotating the base for suction grip.Sample item was provided by the distributor for this review.
summary: OK smartphone car mount

reviewText: This Bolse Mini Windshield Car Mount Holder is easy to install on a car window or any smooth surface. You simply press the bottom to your surface and twist the base which activates the suction. And if you want to put in on a surface that's not completely smooth, there's a stick-on mount included. This would be good for dashboards where there is too much texture for the suction to work properly. I have a slim case on my iPhone 4S and the two padded side grips are adjustable so even with a thicker case it would probably fit well. This is very compact when folded so you can easily throw it in a briefcase or purse if you want to use it for traveling. With multi-angle 360 degree rotation you can position your phone any which way where you can most easily see it. It's great when using the phone as a GPS or when using the speaker phone because it enables you to tilt it closer.But this holder isn't just for the car. I've used it on the side of my hutch-type computer desk to keep my phone in view, but off the surface of my desk while I'm working. It sure saves time not having to search under papers when the phone rings. (Also makes it easier to screen cell phone calls.) I've tried it on the bathroom mirror to keep my phone handy when getting ready in the morning and on the outside of the frig just to keep track of my phone when I'm in the kitchen. I've only had one instance of the mount not sticking and that was on the windshield of my car when the temperature outdoors went from warm to cold over the course of a couple hour drive. It could be that I didn't clean the surface well enough because in the office it will stick to the side of my desk all day.I was provided a sample of the product for review.
summary: Handy little holder for my iPhone

reviewText: Windshield mounts are currently illegal in many states (including New Jersey where I live), so do a Google search before you order this if you want to use it on your windshield. As a practical matter I would not mount anything on my windshield anyhow because the presence of a mount or the telltale marks it leaves when you remove it is just an advertisement to a potential thief, who may break into your car looking for an electronic gizmo not knowing that you have taken it with you.I also don't like using sticky friction mount tape on my leather dashboard because if you decide to stop using the gizmo, that tape always leaves a mark. Also, using friction tape makes it impractical to keep switching the mount between different cars, which is something I want to be able to do.So when I received this at no cost from the manufacturer in exchange for writing a review, I knew that I would not be putting this on the windshield. This does work, but maybe not all year round depending where you live. Here is what to keep in mind.1. I always deduct a star for a product that comes with no instructions. In fact I am glad that another reviewer did a video review to remind me how to adjust the suction cup. It's been so long since I used one of these devices that I had forgotten. And if you never used a mount, instructions would be nice.2. Another reviewer correctly notes that suction cups don't work well in cold weather. There is either difficulty getting them to stick in the first place, or to stay on once in place. I had that exact same difficulty, and wound up positioning this in a storage bin in my console. I like having my phone in this holder rather than just laying in the storage bin.3. This accommodates various size phones. It accomplishes that by having a spring loaded mechanism that you just push apart to fit your phone. It is easy to put the phone in and take it out.4. I use this on an iPhone 4S in a thin case, and it works just fine. I can easily insert the charging cord into the bottom of the phone while it is in this holder.5. Although you cannot adjust the tension on the ball pivot, with a phone as light as an iPhone 4S that is not an issue. And I'm not sure if there is a cell phone heavy enough where the lack of that adjustment would be a problem.6. I can easily remove this to use in another car.Bottom line: This works okay, but may not be practical to use in the winter months if you live in the Northeast where we get frigid winters or some other part of the country with similar winter weather because the suction mount will not work well.
summary: Works okay

reviewText: Advertised for use on iPhones, I tested this on an HTC EVO 4G, and it worked just fine. I'd place this in the category of screen protectors (which I've never totally understood for touch screen devices!) or notebook/netbook case skins. You can accessorize in this way...but I'm not sure why you'd want to once you've passed beyond a certain age...which I have).Anyway, works well as advertised, but I don't see a particular benefit in using it.Note: This item provided at no cost for review.
summary: Works as advertised; not my kind of accessory though..

reviewText: For some time now I have been buying the different kinds of IOs device plastic raised home stickers that come in unique patterns such as animal and cartoon faces, smiley faces and famous images like Hello Kitty, to even different kinds of foods! Here is an example:Bubble Home Button Sticker Yummy Pack. The are cute, but sometimes the do not work well when pressed because they are bubble shaped and raised. When I pressed down they seem to not make a good contact with the actual button - I had to press down very hard sometimes. Since they are thin, the aluminum stickers sit flat and make much better contact. I have a teal/blue sparkly case that matches perfect with the teal/blue home sticker. The FREIQ Aluminum Home Button Sticker stays put and does not slide off or will come off unless you want to take it off.Another plus since the aluminum stickers sit flush with my iPhone 5, it will not accidentally bring up Siri when I slide into my pocket or carrying case. With the bubble raised stickers this use to happen to me all the time because the sticker stuck out so far.Now They just need to come out with cute images on the home buttons instead of just the plain ole Apple "Home" square logo.
summary: Lovin' the aluminum version much better

reviewText: I put one of these on my iPhone and my daughters iPod and they work really well. They stay on and don't move or fall off. They stay on so well, they are actually hard to pry off when it's time. They are thick and are designed to stick on top of your home button, so they do cause the button not to lay quite as flush with the phones screen as it does without this sticker-button on it. But they are very well made, and look just like Apples home buttons. I love the blue one, which is kind of an aqua color. My daughter wanted the purple one on her iPod. I stuck them on a few days ago and they are still holding strong. Very cute iPhone/iPod accessory to add some color to your device!A product sample was provided for an unbiased review.
summary: Fun colors and stays on well

reviewText: These FRiEQ Aluminum Home Button Stickers allow you to add a bit of color to your iPhone "Home Button", which is neat since you can match the color to your case.The stickers secure well to the existing button and we have not had any issues with it coming off, even after weeks of use. These do not provide any additional functionality, but do look very cool.Recommended!CFHNote: Review samples provided by manufacturerRecommended
summary: Fun Accessory - Recommended

reviewText: These aluminum stickers are perfect for anyone who wants to personalize the look of his/her iPhone, although the feel of them takes some getting used to.  They come in a small pack of four, and they are easily removed from the packaging card.  You put your chosen sticker over the home button of your phone (I have an iPhone 5, and it fits), and press into place.  Although they are easier to place than a screen protector, I did have to place and remove a few times to get the inner home symbol aligned to my liking.I like that these are aluminum, not plastic or paper, because it makes the button feel like it could be part of the original equipment.  It also resists scratches and dings from fingernails.  Once in place, the button does not slide.  It does take a little bit of effort to remove, but once I got a bit of fingernail under the disk, the whole thing lifted off without leaving behind any residue.These are marketed in part as a "protection" for the home button, although I question how much that's really needed.  They raise the button area, making the button slightly easier to find without looking than the iPhone's recessed home button.  Again, I'm not sure how many people need one for that reason.  To me, the real reason for purchasing these is to personalize the look of the iPhone, something many people, particularly teenagers and young adults, like.  If you coupled, say, the pink one with a pink or otherwise matching case, then the iPhone would feel uniquely yours.  Because these are stickers, don't expect to change the colors frequently  They aren't meant to be used as a daily fashion choice since their stickiness will be compromised by multiple uses.  Still, when I returned the one I took off to its spot on the packaging card, it stayed put, so the stickiness lasts longer than your usual paper/plastic kind of stickers.These would make a great stocking stuffer for someone who likes to jazz up his/her phone.  Note:  I received this from the manufacturer.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Who would've guessed this as a method to jazz up an iPhone?

reviewText: These FRIEQ home button stickers for an assortment of iOS devices spells F-U-N.  These type of stickers are probably for the kid at heart in all of us.  They aren't really expensive, but have that delightful charm I really couldn't resist.  My problem was trying to decide which sticker I was going to put on my iPad.  I finally settled on the purple (of course) and put it on my home button.  When removing the stickers from their paper storage holder, simply slip the tip of your fingernail beneath one edge and pull lightly. The easiest way to position the sticker is to lick your pointer finger to get it into the position you want, carefully apply, and press it down.If you miss and get it into a position you don't like, simply pull the sticker off and start again.  Some people are actually collecting these reusable stickers to personalize their iOS devices.  The FRIEQ home button stickers are quite functional in one regard.  If you are trying to find your home button in a darkened room, the colored buttons make it quite easy to spot.  The purple sticker adds a bit of charm to my iPad and when I get tired of it, I can easily swap it out for a different color.The nice thing about these home button stickers is that they are made of 100% aluminum.  As I mentioned before, they are reusable, a factor to keep in mind if you are counting your pennies.  They are also lightweight and scratch-resistant (I tried).  The black and silver home buttons are complimentary colors to the iOS devices, but jazzing them up with the blue or purple now makes them look less drab.  Necessary?  Maybe not, but they are certainly a fun way to add a bit of personality to your iOS device.Review sample provided by the distributor.
summary: The FRIEQ Aluminum Home Button Stickers are a fun way to add a bit of personality to your iOS device ...

reviewText: Apple's iOS devices are not the most customizable when it comes to their appearance. They generally come in only two colors - black and white. It is possible to use bumpers, cases, and sleeves to add soem personality to the sides and the back of your iDevice, but for the most part you cannot do much about the appearance of its front. These little stickers make some customization of the front possible.These stickers can add some color and character to your iOS devices. They come in four different colors and they can easily be applied to your home button. They make the home button look and feel raised, which soem people might prefer to the default indented kind. For the reasons of style I would not apply anything except the metallic and black stickers to the "bare" iDevice. The other two would probably go well with matching iDevice cases/sleeves. I put the metallic sticker on my old iPhone 3G to check out what it looked like. It looked nice enough, and the raised feel definitely had its charms. I would personally not use any of these stickers on any of my latest and coolest iDevices, but if you are into this sort of thing you might want to give it a try.
summary: Adding Some Color and Character to your iPhone, iPod or iPad

reviewText: When I received the FrieQ Home Button Sticker, I was initially unsure that I would like it.  After three and a half years of owning the comparatively bulky iPhone 3GS, with an even bulkier case, I have been enjoying the sleek look of my new iPhone 5 over the past month.  I have not yet even put a case on the phone because I love the clean, simple look.  I thought that this product might mar that look, but I was very pleasantly surprised when I applied it to my phone a week ago.The first thing to note is that these are not "stickers," as most of us think of the term. They are a very thin, quality-looking aluminum.  The silver, blue, and magenta (called purple in the product description, but not how I would describe it) stickers have a slight (i.e. not gaudy) metallic hue, while the black has a glossier-look.I decided I would go all out with the magenta, and I love the look and feel.  It fits right into the indentation of the home button, with the edge of the sticker slightly raised so that you can identify the button by feel.  I actually think the home button is easier to use with this sticker - it seems to take a lighter amount of pressure to get the home button activated.  Due to a family incident that occurred a week ago, I have had this phone in my hand on a near-constant basis: making calls, texting, e-mailing, using the internet.  The button has stayed firmly in place.I'd recommend this product to anyone who wants to add a simple dose of style to their iPhone, iPad, or iTouch, at a great price (currently) at just over $2 per sticker.  With the four stickers, you can save the others for when you want a change, or you can do what I did: My mother chose the blue sticker for her iPad, and she loves it, too.  I tried to offer the other two to my father and brother for their iPads, but it's not really their thing.  No matter - I'll be seeing more relatives over Christmas who will be more appreciative. :)This product was provided to me by the manufacturer with a request for honest feedback.
summary: A simple touch of style

reviewText: This review of on the FRIEQ Aluminum Home Button stickers for iOS devices. These little stickers have a couple of purposes, one of them is obviously to define your device as your own and add a bit of customization to it. This works well if you have two of the same devices too! For example, I have two daughters and each of them have an iPod Touch (they are the same generation) so they relatively look very similar, but now with these home button stickers their devices are defined by the color of the home button! This was a really nice way to note the difference of the two and with 4 stickers included they had their choice of color. Now as far as the sticker its self, it looks very nice and fit perfectly on my devices, as long as you carefully place them you shouldn't have any trouble with them. They also make the home button easier to push and it has a nice feel to it. Overall these are some inexpensive ways to get your device to stand out from the rest and it makes the button easier to press. I can recommend these and I give them a 5 star rating!** ATTENTION **I tried these on one of my devices that had a Griffin Survivor Case just to see if it would still work with the sticker on it, the result was that after I placed the sticker on the device and I placed the case back on the home button became extremely difficult to use and had little to no functionality. This is just a caution if you own one of these cases, aside from this if you don't use one of these cases then the buttons work great!I hope this review has helped you out!I was provided a sample for testing and evaluation, my review of this product is honest and the words stated above are my own.
summary: Make your device stand out!

reviewText: This is my first experience with an IPod Touch home button sticker.These aluminum stickers are shinier & more vibrant than  pictured; very tasteful looking, in my opinion.To apply, I cleaned my home button with a cloth that was slightly dampened with rubbing alcohol; then attached the sticker. These stickers have staying power and can be hard to remove.To remove, you can try prying them up at the edge with a needle, straight pin or similar device. In my experience the adhesive didn't cover the edges of the sticker.I removed 1/2 a star because the black sticker was unusable. It had some sort of defect with the adhesive.3 1/2 starsThis product was provided for my unbiased, honest review.
summary: Bling for an IPod Touch 4G...3 1/2 stars

reviewText: Add a little aesthetic personal feel to your iPod, iPhone or iPad.  These four aluminum buttons come with a strong adhesive to easily attach to your device.  They personalize your device with the choice of four colors (white, black, blue or purple).  It actually makes them look like a different type of device.The feel of the button is nice in that it is slightly raised.  Removal of the button is not that easy.  I would suggest using a corner of a razor blade very carefully if your fingernail does not work.  But if it's going to fall off, you have three others to add.  Just clean with a bit of alcohol/Q-tip, dry and apply the new button.  At the price, it's a fairly inexpensive gift or self-indulgence.  It's shiny too!  Product generously supplied by manufacturer for an honest review.
summary: Shiny Aesthetically Pleasing Touch!

reviewText: It's never occurred to me to try and dress up the home button on my iPhone. These little home button stickers fit perfectly. They're made of shiny metal, so they don't feel cheap, and the sticker holds up well under usage. I've had one on my iPhone for about a week and it doesn't show any sign of wanting to fall off. It's become part of my phone. Instead of a depression when I feel for my home button, I feel a raised, round button. The function of the button isn't affected at all. Cute.This product was provided for review by LowerPriceUSA.
summary: Dresses up my home button

reviewText: If you are one of those who like to accessorize your iPhone or iPods, then this may pique your interest. I didn't realize there are thousands of these stickers already being sold in the market, ranging from funny, cute or even tacky and tasteless. This set is the more decent and plain looking ones. It comes in four different metallic colors. Make sure to clean the home button first. It adds a little height and texture on the button, making it easier to press. Will it damaged the iPhone if you decide to remove the stickers? I was able to remove and replace it by another color by just poking the edge with the tip of a needle to lift it off. Sample item was provided by the distributor for review.
summary: Cool metallic home buttons

reviewText: SOIGEN's turned out to be the best, most protective, closest to 'naked' feel case I've come across and our kid who until now resisted any 'skin' on his iPhone 5 loves it.It protects your phone from all sides other than the screen and your phone snaps in and stays in there. The interior has a nicely velvety coating that protects the phone from any scratches or bruises and the outside finish is nothing short of spectacular.Five stars without reservation.
summary: Good protections

reviewText: This SPIGEN Slim Armor Case is good looking and, more importantly, provides decent protection for the iPhone 5. The case is easy to install and leaves unobstructed access to all of the buttons, camera, and ports.This is professional looking case that nicely compliments the black iPhone.Recommended!CFH
summary: Good iPhone5 Case - Recommended

reviewText: I like this iPhone 5 case and it seems like it's built to last. It's sturdy and has a tight fit. Feels good to the touch. As others cited, the holes are small for some connectors like headphones. I think those holes will be forced a little bigger with more and more use. It's an outstanding case.
summary: attractive and strong

reviewText: I need a case to protect my phone from scratches and minor impacts.  But it bugs me to add so much bulk to the iPhone.  Bulky cases diminish the slim factor of the iPhone.This Slim Armor is a great case, because it has effective rubberized protection for the phone without adding a lot of bulk.  The inside of the case is a rubber shell.  The exterior is a thin plastic shell that covers all but about 3/4" at the top and the bottom of the phone.  I have two of the colors: semi-gloss black and gunmetal.  The black is nice, but the gunmetal is the most attractive case I've ever seen for any of my iPhones.Installing the case is simple, so if you like to swap out cases, this won't be too much of a chore for you.It also comes with three glossy "jelly bean" stickers to add some bling to the home button: one orange, one white, and one black.I like the minimalist protection from this case.
summary: Great iPhone 5 case

reviewText: I'm a huge fan of slim, bare-bones iPhone cases because I hate the idea of destroying the elegance of the iPhone design.  Still, I need to protect my phone.  This Spigen case is a fantastic example of a case that can look almost naked, subtly two-toned, or distinctive, depending on which model you choose.  I love mine; however, because I have two Slim Armor cases, one (gunmetal) that fits and works perfect and one (metal slate) that doesn't fit right, quality control may be an issue; read on for details.First, make no mistake:  this is not a heavy-duty case designed to encase your phone in thick rubber and plastic.  It makes the iPhone only slightly thicker while protecting the back, sides, and buttons.  There are adequate cut-outs for camera, speakers, control, and cables with button covers for the volume control that somehow work despite going through the removable backplate and the main frame.  The gunmetal color provides a subtle contrast between the black of the main case and the matte gray of the plate.  In most light, the contrast is slightly more evident than it is in the product photo.The case is easy to slip on and off, and the plate is easy to swap in and out to change the color of your case without changing the actual case.  (You can buy replacement backplates in a variety of colors.)  I like this exchangeable backplate design because I can change the look of my phone in mere seconds.This would have been a five-star product if I had only the gunmetal case.  Or it would have been a one-star product if I had only the metal slate version.  When I inserted my iPhone 5 into the metal slate case, it didn't fit properly.  No matter what I did, one side of the screen didn't fully fit and was slightly lifted, making the glass vulnerable on the edge.  I decided to pop my phone into the other case to see whether the bad fit was a design flaw or a defect.  It immediately became clear that the problem was a manufacturing defect of millimeters.  If you decide to buy this case and if it doesn't fit right or if the buttons aren't properly aligned, exchange for a new one.  This case can and should fit perfectly.I really love this case on my black iPhone 5 for its elegance,  If you are looking for maximum protection, however, look elsewhere.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Low-Profile Protection with Changeable Backplate

reviewText: I have always been an anti-case kind of guy. My thought is that teams of engineers work hard to get my phone to be so small and so slick. It don't want to put some clunky protector on top of it and spoil all their had work.This case looks great and give a MODERATE level of protection. It should have no problem protecting your phone from a fall from pocket height. If you accidentally leave it on top of your car and drive off though, you're probably doomed.
summary: Love it!

reviewText: It has seemed to me lately that most of the "protective" cases available tend to increase the size and weight of the phone to near unrecognizable proportions, so I'm delighted with thisSPIGEN SGP SGP10089 Slim Armor Case for iPhone 5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Gunmetal.  While I probably would prefer one of the multitude of different colors available, this gunmetal on black has a clean, sophisticated look that every man I know will appreciate.Great fit, great protection, great choice!
summary: Love the Slim Line!

reviewerName: Jeri Zerr "formerly a Road Warrior of the Nth...
reviewText: Spigen is a name I've begun recognizing for quality construction in cell phone cases. This case is tough and rugged to stand up to the common abuses of daily activity (within reason - it certainly won't protect the phone from a nuclear blast or a semi running over it... but what will?)The opening for the lightening port is ample for all the common chargers.. the Spigen is a good case which will last me quite awhile.
summary: Perfect fit, the lightening port opening is perfect for my charger.

reviewText: This is my second Spigen case for the iPhone 5. As usual I'm very impressed with the packaging that the case came in. The packaging is a clear hard plastic case with a folding hook in the back and the packaging is much more substantial than the iPhone case itself!The case itself is just 2 parts: an inner case made of TPU (Thermoplastic polyurethane is a mix between hard plastic and soft silicone. It's soft, neoprene-like and provides the shock absorption) and a polycarbonate midsection with a gunmetal finish. The midsection part can be removed from the TPU and other midsection parts exchanged for customization. Also included are 3 jelly bean buttons.It's a pretty neat case, futuristic looking. If you like this kind of case, go for it.
summary: Excellent!

reviewText: Gives great protection without adding bulk.  This case is very cool looking and actually makes my phone feel more comfortable in my hand than it does without the case.  The holes are where they belong and I've had no problem with any of my phone functions.  Great quality case!  Good protection without encasing my phone like a museum exhibit.
summary: Sleek

reviewText: The Spigen Slim Armor  Case is an all-plastic hard-shell.  It does a very good job of protecting iPhones against scratches and bumping although I am not sure the case itself would stand up to being dropped onto a hard surface.It is easy to apply and has three little jelly buttons to choose from to cover the main button—a nice touch.  All the ports and openings are in the right spot, perfectly aligned.Overall, it's a unique protective case.  The gunmetal and metal slate colors both have an elegant, metallic appearance--quite different from the usual colorful phone cases.  The slate is almost black with just the slightest hint of blue, much less blue in person than it looks in the photo on Amazon.
summary: Elegant protective cases

reviewText: This is a thin but sturdy case. It is thin in the sense that it does not add much bulk to the iPhone and you won't feel there is a brick in your hand. The cover was easy to put on and protects the iPhone very well. I did find that the cover interfered with the flash and that is a bummer. Overall, it is a good case. But, I found myself removing the cover a lot to charge the phone in a charger stand and for taking pictures.
summary: Great case for the iphone

reviewText: Great packaging - perfect for gift giving.  This is housed in a clear heavy plastic that calling it gunmetal (refers to the color) make me think it is also bulletproof.  It is heavy that I was sure that the body is actually made with metal.Included are three jelly button stickers if you want to decorate your home button other than the plain white or black.  The case is absolutely beautiful.  Your iPhone5 will have full protection on all four corners.  The logo at the back is clean and just makes the case more elegant.I only have a couple of issues which prevents me from rating it full five stars.  The 3.5 mm hole is small and deep.  I have several headphones or earphones and half of them doesn't fit.  The other thing is the slippery texture of the silver plastic (by the way it is plastic, not metal) that makes up most of the middle part.  Top and bottom of the case are silicones,  but mostly you hold it on the middle which makes it slippery.  The hole for the mute/ring switch is also hard to reach.  You would need your nail to switch it.  The latter is not a big issue though because  that switch is not used very often.
summary: Elegant case with a couple of issues

reviewerName: Richard C. Drew "Anaal Nathra/Uthe vas Bethod...
reviewText: I have both the Metal Slate and Gunmetal. The color refers to just the plastic insert. The cases are identical (obviously) apart from the color. Metal slate is basically black and only slightly lighter than the rest of the case. Gunmetal is a little lighter. Both re glossy, while the rubber portions are matte.My original and third party lightning connectors fit, as do a variety of headphone jacks. Spigen obviously made a change recently, as older reviews complain of the openings being too small.These are excellent quality and flawless. I honestly don't think you'll find a better case. They offer plenty of protection.  The volume up and down, plus the power switch are fully covered.  Bottom line, it's a great case that will last the life of your phone.
summary: Perfect fit, well made, thin with decent protection

reviewText: My job takes me on the road ... a lot. I often find myself transferring my car charger from my iPad, to my iPhone, to my speakers ... trying to keep everything charged up.This is particularly important now that I tether my iPad to my iPhone, draining both of them significantly and quickly.Having this handy battery (with LOADS of power) along makes a huge difference, especially since I can plug in both my iPhone and iPad and keep them both powered up! It comes with a single twelve inch cord, so to charge a second IOS device, you will need your own cord as well, but it includes one 30 pin connector for the IOS as well as several other connectors.However, besides the USB ports, it has a Micro USB cable that wraps around the bottom and charges at the same time.OK, I probably won't be charging three at a time, but this has been a very efficient power back up for my own personal use. The only thing I find missing is some efficient way to carry the cords with the battery, other batteries often have a carrying case to keep everything together. However, for the price and for the quantity of charge, I would be able to recommend it.I am grateful to have received this battery from the manufacturer so that I could consider it for a review. It has passed all of my tests with no problems.
summary: Three at a time ... Wow!

reviewText: Imagine being able to simultaneously charge 2 iPads at the same time - with this powerful beast you can!  With all the gadgets we all have now,  we all need battery banks for those times we are not around a power source to recharge.  My family goes camping and we do a lot in the wilderness such as fishing and hiking.  When you have teenagers who are constantly texting on their cellphones and playing on their iPads since they can't leave home without them, battery banks a most have.You are probably wondering how long would the Incredi Charge I-10 extend the life of my gadgets.  Well here is an example; I was able to recharge my iPhone 5 to a full charge almost 7 times until I had to recharge the battery bank.It is high quality and high efficiency for being so small.  Compatible with many types of devices such as digital cameras, cellular phones, tablets, GPS, MP3 players, etc.  Prevents over-charging, over-discharging, and short circuiting for ultimate protection.  Comes with two USB ports, a built-in micro USB charging cable and four additional connector plugs (Nokia, Mini USB, Galaxy Tab, Apple 30 Pin) or you just use your own USB charging cables like I do for my iPhone 5.This is a powerful unit bundled up in a small little package!  A truly amazing product that anyone with lots of gadgets needs or would love to have.I received a sample unit to test and evaluate in exchanged for an honest unbiased review.
summary: Powerful, Sleek and Reliable

reviewText: In the age of smartphones, battery packs like these have become so handy. I do so much on my phone that if I'm on the road, I can drain my cell phone battery before the day is even over. I listen to iHeartRadio on my phone a good part of the day, and am always calling and texting, as well as checking and replying to emails. So I now always take along a spare battery pack in my bag with me in cause any of my devices need recharging. What really makes this pack stand out is the low cost for a battery that has so much power. They've included tips for several devices. With some searching, you can usually find a low cost battery pack, but they usually don't also include a set if tips for all your different devices. Most battery packs like this end up costing quite a bit more. This battery pack even has a charging tip for Apple devices (not the lightning tip, the larger one that fits my iPhone 4s).In addition to the Apple tip, there are also Mini and Micro USB tips, as well as others. The majority of my devices all take either the Micro or Mini USB tips, or the Apple tip. So this battery pack is an all in one package for me. I'm able to charge my iPhone 4s and any of my other devices, including my Samsung digital camera. And each time I've used it, it has had more than enough power to charge my devices. Lots of power for a small pack!A sample unit was provided for reviewing purposes.
summary: Lots of power for a great price, with multiple adapter tips for charging your devices

reviewText: Power banks have become pretty much a commodity item, with many different vendors offering them. They all pretty much work the same (e.g., store up a charge and then allow you to use that to recharge a device) with the distinguishing features really coming down to aesthetics and, of course, capacity.This power bank does a good job on both fronts. It's rated at 10,400mAh. While I can't verify that quantitatively, it seems to be pretty accurate, as it was able to bring my Fire and phone to full charge without running out of juice.Design-wise this is one of the more attractive power banks I've used. The body is white plastic with black edging. It sort of looks like a large flip phone folded up. The plastic is high quality and feels substantial.It has a 4 light system to serve as a battery gas gauge. There are 2 5v USB output ports, each rated at 2A. I especially like that it has a built-in micro USB cable that stores neatly alongside the edge of the case. It is on the short side, however, measuring 4 inches from base to tip.The power bank itself is pretty compact, measuring about 3 inches by 4.25 inches and an inch thick. The edges are beveled to help make it seem smaller than it is. It weighs 8.5 ounces. Not lightweight, but quite good considering it's 10,000+ mAh capacity.It comes with an assortment of adapters as listed in the product specs. It does NOT include a wall charger adapter, nor does it include features such as a flashlight or a carry bag. But, it's also priced pretty well, so I'd rather have a lower price than features that don't directly impact usage as a power bank.There are only a couple of misses. I would have liked to see at least one of the output ports rated at 2.1A, and a longer built-in cable. But those aside, it's a nice power bank. Well worth a spot on your short list if you're shopping for one.[manufacturer provided sample for review]
summary: Good performance and attractive design

reviewText: These things just keep getting better.I've been using small chargers like this one for the past year or so. They started out kind of bulky and the plastics were cheap. I've been impressed with Incredicharge in the past, and now they've stepped it up again.This 10,400 mAh charger provides a TON of charge life. In the past I've been pretty happy with my 8,000 mAh and 5,000 mAh chargers. I even have an 11,000 mAh charger, but it's a bigger device (about the size of a Nintendo DS). This 10,400 mAh charger is just a little bit thicker than my other two smaller chargers, but has much more capacity.This works great for any USB powered device. It also charges hungrier devices, like the newer iPads and the Kindle Fire HD.One fantastic innovation for this new model is an integrated Micro USB cable. It's so subtle that I almost missed it. It just flips out of the base and gives you a nice little 4" cable. I like this much better than having to schlep around my 1-meter USB cable.If you're new to chargers like this one, you'll be amazed at how convenient they are. They're perfect for air travel and they're great in the car when you have your family along and everyone is fighting over the AC outlet. Last week my wife needed emergency surgery, which meant that I had hours to kill in the hospital. I had my daughter bring my laptop bag down to me with my charger in it. This was a lifesaver, because people were calling, texting, and emailing me all day asking for updates on my wife. It would have been a real hardship if I couldn't charge my phone and tablet. And then once she was recovering at home I spent a lot of time on the couch with her (many many hours). I used up the charges on my phone and tablet multiple times a day, so it was great to be able to charge them right there on the couch while I sat with my wife. Once you get hooked on these chargers, you'll never leave home without one.I hate to comment on prices, but this one is currently $19.95. I don't know how long that price will last, but it's really incredible. I'm going to buy a couple of these as gifts.Disclaimer: I was provided this item for review (free). It's an amazing product though, and the price is unbelievable. So I'll definitely be buying more.EDIT (6/11/13):  As I mentioned before, I really love this charger and I love the price.  I ordered a second one of these for my daughter to use at school.
summary: Outstanding Charger

reviewText: The bottom line on the Incredi Charge battery is this: it works. In the past I've tried several different reserve power supplies for my gadgets, and I have not been impressed with many of them. However, since I've tried out two precursor to this battery (Incredicharge I-5000 and I-8800) I've been very impressed with this line of batteries, so I was expecting a really good product. Indeed, my expectations were justified, and this is one of my favorite such batteries. In fact, in terms of the combination of price, capacity, size and design it might be my single favorite such battery.In order to test this battery charger I decided to completely drain my small electronic devices so that I get as clean of an idea of this battery's efficiency as I can. (As an aside, when you really want to discharge them, the consumer electronics has become really robust in recent year. It took me much longer than I thought it would. I had to blast music from my iPhone for hours and hours ...) I discover that I was able to fully charge all of my small electronic devices with plenty of power to spare. Full charging usually takes between one to two hours. I've tested this battery with iPhone 4S,iPhone 3G,Motorola KRZR,Motorola RAZR,Kindle Keyboard,Mobee Magic Bar, Samsung Galaxy S3 andJabra SPORT Bluetooth Stereo Headset. Finally, I've done the "iPad Test": I tried to fully charge myiPad (First Generation) (32GB, Wifi + 3G), and I was indeed completely successful in that regard. Oftentimes I was able to fully charge two or three devices with just one Incredi Cahrge fully charged battery. I was also able to charge two devices simultaneously.To fully charge this battery it takes about six hours. This is much longer than some other such batteries that I have tested, and I think this is primarily due to the fact that it relies on USB connection for powering. The best way to charge this battery is to leave it plugged in overnight. You can plug it into your computer or a stand-alone USB charger.Incredicharge battery is very well designed and very compact. It's slightly thicker than two iPhone 4/4S, and about as long as those. It looks very elegant and sophisticated, and it is not out of place even with the most fancy consumer electronic devices. It's also fairly light, and overall very convenient and portable.The battery comes with a whole selection of different attachments, and they can be used with almost any small electronic device on the market. It would be useful to have a little bag to accompany all these attachments, but this feature is not a deal breaker for me.Overall, I am very pleased and impressed with this battery supply. It is effective, portable, and very affordable. I would recommend it to anyone who travels a lot or uses their gadgets on the go all the time.
summary: Another Great Incredicharge Battery

reviewText: I've seen a number of different battery chargers in the past year, and they all worked well, but with almost every one, there was some feature missing that I wished it had. It's obvious that the designers of the Incredicharge I-10 External Battery Pack listened to consumers, because this one has every feature that I've wished for. (Okay, there's no flashlight, but how often do you really need one on a charger?)Note that no AC or vehicle charger is included, but most users have several of those already. What is included is a set of the correct plugs for virtually every model cellphone and tablet sold in the US, including Apple. And here's one thing that makes this unit stand out: it has the capacity and the hardware to charge up to three devices simultaneously. There are two USB ports, plus a built-in cable with a Micro-USB plug. I charged the unit to its full capacity, and for a test, I connected it to a Kindle Fire HD 7" tablet, a Kindle Paperwhite e-book reader, and my wife's iPhone 4. I didn't attempt to measure the charging speed, but each of the three devices was charging steadily for the two hours that they were connected. It's not too likely that most people would need to charge three devices at the same time, but the Incredicharge has the capability to do it. (The rated total output is 2A. Since most mobile devices require 1A-2A, the power output is easily sufficient for two devices simultaneously, but in a pinch, it will charge three.)This is one of the best-looking portable chargers that I've seen, in a smooth white case with black trim. At 9 ounces and dimensions of about 4.25"x3.0"x0.9", it's also fairly compact and lightweight for a 10400mAh device.In a crowded field of tablet and cellphone chargers, the Incredicharge I-10 External Battery Pack stands out for its slick appearance, capacity, and the versatility to charge up to three mobile devices simultaneously.A product sample was provided by the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: Stands out in the crowded field of cellphone and tablet accessories

reviewText: I've tried an Incredicharge powerbank in the past and they had some bugs to work out in the manufacturing. I'm pleased to say that they have gone back and returned with a wonderful product! This is a hefty powerbank, just slightly larger than a deck of cards. It comes with the powerbank, a USB to micro USB cord and four additional plugs that attach to the end of that cable.The charging power is great. Two on board USB ports plus the built in micro-USB cable. Packed with power you will never be without power during a long business day, a road trip, hike, or especially - a power outage.The flexibility is great and will allow you to use the plugs and cords included or use your own USB cables specific to your devices.This is a 5 star product. Incredicharge gets a bonus star for including the built-in micro USB cable (which is what powers most of my devices) but looses a star for not including some kind of carry pouch. Considering there are five parts that are not attached, it is too easy to lose something. A pouch should not have been a big deal to include but luckily, I have plenty of extra small bags around to stash the powerbank and parts for safekeeping.I was provided a unit for evaluation and an honest review.
summary: HUGE Power, Great Benefit to have a Built-In Micro USB Cable

reviewText: With 10,400 mAh, this is one of the most powerful external battery available (I have seen 12,000 mAh maximum so far).  It came 50% charged and took about 2 more hours to fully charge - as shown by four tiny, but bright blue LED lights.  It will charge two items at once.  I was able to charge my 'iPhone 4S' fully from nearly empty in about 4.5 hours and my iPad mini in about 6 hours (separately).Encased in a glossy white case, it is easy to keep clean and has two USB outputs (each 5v/2A) for double charging.  There is an easy on/off switch and if you forget that it is on, it will turn off in less than a minute.  There is also the (fairly typical) 3.5" Micro USB cable that fits in a tight groove alongside the battery.  This is one of the more common Micro USB plugs, although the device also comes with five other attachments for, Apple (30-pin), mini USB, Nokio, USB A to Micro USB and Galaxy Tablets.Please see my `customer image' for more detail.  I am truly surprised at the price of this battery, as most batteries at this high an mAh are much more expensive.  Product generously supplied by manufacturer for an honest review.
summary: Powerful Bargain!

reviewText: If you're like most of the population in the developed world, you own small electronic devices. If you own small electronic devices, you ought to own a power bank. I'm surprised more people don't own them. I'm even more surprised so many people ask me what they are for.What are they for? Well, when you're on the go and don't have a USB port handy to recharge your iPhone, iPad, or Bluetooth speaker, plug it into one of these. They're small enough to fit in a pocket or purse. Carry them around and charge your device while on a hike or navigating the crowds at Disneyland.Power banks come in many different sizes. The higher the capacity, the better it can charge larger devices, like iPads. The smaller the capacity, the more lightweight and compact they become.Some will come with a variety of connectors for different types of phones. Others come with nothing but the bare minimum, or maybe they'll have accessories like a carry pouch, or added perks like an onboard LED light. Some have multiple USB ports, some have onboard charging cords.Pay attention to the amperage of the ports. They are usually either 1 or 2 amps. If you only have a 1 amp port, be prepared for a slower charge.The Incredicharge I-10 comes with following adapters:* 30-pin Apple* mini USB* Nokia* Galaxy* USB A to micro USB cableIt also includes an onboard micro USB cable, neatly stored. Micro USB is the most universal connector. If that's all you need, you will never be without the proper cable.No pouch nor LED flashlight is included. Although I think a flashlight feature would be superfluous, a pouch would be nice.I plugged in Kindle Fire HD 8'9" tablet, my Kindle 3G, and my iPhone 4S. That overwhelmed it and it turned off. I thought that meant it could only charge two device at once. However, if I replace the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet with my generic 9" Android tablet, it charges three devices just fine. So, it can charge up to three devices at once, depending on what they are.Charging one at a time, the power bank can give my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet a full charge with enough juice left over to give my iPhone 4S a 60% boost.The Incredicharge is attractive and well-built, as compact as a 10400 mAh power bank can be - about the size of a small men's wallet. I recommend it for tablet owners. It's easy enough to carry around, but heavier than what I'd want to always have at the ready in my purse. I keep it in my car instead. For those who don't need that kind of capacity, there are smaller "lipstick" style power banks that have just enough oomph to power a cell phone and are small enough to carry anywhere.My brother saw this power bank and was impressed. He's used a lot of power banks and liked the look of this one. I like the looks of it, also.This product was provided for review by ProA Marketing.
summary: Fast Charge, Lots of Power

reviewText: I was scared to actually dip my phone in the water when using this case so I used waterproof watch instead.  I dipped it in the water for over 5 minutes and took it to the pool by my house and it worked great! No leaks.  I finally was brave enough to put my phone in there (Samsung Note 2) and started to use it.  The plastic is thin and conductive enough to still be able to touch the screen and control the phone.The case opens with just a quick snap at the top and you can pretty much fit any phone in there.  I fit the Galaxy Note 2 in there without an issue. I like that the strap is large enough to actually just put this over your neck.The one thing that scares me is the thickness of the plastic and the type of plastic used.  I've seen this type of plastic in the past where when it's overused or dried out it cracks.  So I'm actually afraid of it cracking and leaking later in the future.  Now, I do not know this will happen or anything.  I'm just concerned.  But I guess only time will tell.I received this item for an honest review.
summary: Great waterproof case - easy to open

reviewText: This waterproof case is rated for 100 feet submersion. I tested this case submerging it in water, and the content remained dry.  This case fits a thin smart phone with a regular battery but the phone with an extra large 3800mAh Extended Battery did not fit.Update 3/31/2013. Since I originally wrote this review I discovered a different model of FRIEQ case that does fits a phone with extended battery. Here is a link to the product page for itFRIEQ Universal Waterproof Case With Waterproof External Earphone/ Accessory Jack and Armband for Apple iPhone 5, Galaxy S3, HTC One X, Galaxy Note 2 - IPX8 Certified to 100 FeetThe size of this case is 4" by 7". The case is flat so if you are measuring your device you need to allow room for thickness as well as length + width.I used Nexus Galaxy phone for testing. Several notes about the phone. The Nexus Galaxy phone is not officially listed as a phone which would fit into this case. However Nexus Galaxy phone is similar in size to Galaxy SIII and Galaxy SI SGH-T989 (it fits cradles made for these phones). In addition Nexus Galaxy phone is normally used with an extra large battery (Hyperion Verizon Samsung Galaxy Nexus 3800mAh Extended Battery) which makes it significantly fatter than a standard battery.I tested both configurations with the large battery as well as with the large battery removed (so the phone would be the thickness of the phone with a regular battery). Not surprisingly, the case was a good fit without the extra large battery. The larger battery was not a good fit. It was so tight that I stopped the insertion in fear of tearing the case.Whether you like water sports, skiing, or just want to keep the phone dry in a pouring rain this case will do a nice job. If you are using an extra large battery on your phone this case is not a good fit. I am not deducting stars for not fitting the extra large battery, however, since the product description did not state that it would fit. But if you are using a large battery and wondered about the fit - now you know!I was provided a sample case for testing and for writing a fair and unbiased review.Ali Julia review
summary: Fits a slim phone.  A phone with extended battery does not fit.

reviewText: I enjoy the beach, boating, family bike rides and pretty much anything to do with the outdoors. I am always searching to a place to put my iPhone where it will be safe and protected from the outdoor elements. Not to long ago my husband and I spent 4 hours scavenging in a huge dirty, dusty junk yard jumping from car to car and disassembling some. I was scared of losing my iPhone 5 or getting dirt into it, so I put it in my bra. I wish I would of had the Frieq Universal case because I could of hung my iPhone around my neck by the lanyard cord and not worry about dirt or the moisture that accumulated from my sweat.This case is awesome to say the least. I am able to text, take pictures and of course decline phone calls since you really can't make or take calls since no one will hear you being that it is air tight (this is a good thing). No worries about sand from the beach, water damaged while boating, swimming or snorkeling. I have cases that are like this that are made specifically for cameras to go underwater with and they cost 4x as much. This case a terrific bargain and a must have for the outdoor enthusiast.Disclosure:  I was given a sample to test and evaluate in exchange for an honest review.
summary: A must have accessory for the outdoor enthusiast

reviewText: Both my iPhone 4S and a Samsung Galaxy S4 fit easily into this case when not in their respective Otterbox cases. The clear window on each side, allowing for picture taking if you were under water, is a nice feature of this waterproof case. The screen touch functionality was OK, but not stellar. No surprise considering I have glass screen protector on both phones that were not removed during testing.In all honesty, this is a lot like a sturdy zip-loc bag - but nicer! I see it as a good choice for on a rafting trip or a day at the beach, but not for long term submersion and use underwater.I did a test with a crumpled up Kleenex and some quarters (to keep it submerged) in my bath tub. After 10 minutes - no leaks - the Kleenex remained dry. It does appear to be waterproof, which is the purpose of the case-bag.Please be sure to test out ANY 'waterproof' case prior to putting your valuable electronics inside them.  Ideally, you'd have a waterproof or water resistant case on the phone that goes into this pouch. (Tough to fit it in the FRIEQ case then though.) Overkill maybe? But I like to protect my investment.Other waterproof cases to consider:OtterBox Armor Series Waterproof Case for iPhone 5 - Retail Packaging - Realtree Max 4/GreenandLifeproof iPhone 5S Fre Case-Red/Black - Carrying Case - Retail Packaging - Red/Black.NOTE: I was provided this item by the manufacturer in exchange for my honest review.
summary: A glorified baggie, but it works

reviewText: After testing this out with an already water damaged iPod touch belonging to my daughter, I decided to go ahead and go for the full test and try it with my iPhone. I'm happy to say that it does indeed work and keeps any water from getting to your device.The black pouch has clear windows on both sides that are sensitive enough that you can even go through your phones menu while it's sealed securly inside. The top of the pouch has a large plastic bar across it with two large switches/locks for opening and closing the pouch. This method seems to rule out the possibility of human error when using it. It even comes with a long strap/lanyard for looping around the top of the case. The included strap is tucked inside a piece of cardboard inside the pouch when it first arives. Be sure to pull it out before discarding the cardboard or you'll throw away your neck-strap as well!This pouch will be perfect to use while we are out fishing this summer and for our family trip to Florida in a few months. I can now safely take my iPhone to the water and not be afraid that a moisture will ruin it. Very high recommended!A sample was provided for an unbiased review.
summary: Works! Perfect to take while out fishing or to the beach

reviewText: This FRiEQ Universal Waterproof Case easily fits our iPhone4 or HTC EVO 4G and allows full access to the touch screen and controls. We live in the North-East and get our fair share of snow that we need to move by hand and over the years have dropped sensitive electronic devices in the snow piles.This case is well designed for easy access and provides very secure and watertight protection, but also provides visibility to make the device easy to find when dropped. My submersion testing showed no leakage after an hour sitting in a sink full of water (tested with paper-towels, not my phone). I have great confidence that this will provide the protection we need!Highly Recommended!CFHNote: Unit provided for review by manufacturer
summary: Great Protection - Highly Recommended

reviewText: I have to admit that I was very nervous about this product. There's no way that I could afford to replace my iPhone (received via contract) and so a product of this nature HAD to work. There are many MANY horror stories about waterproof enclosures of all kinds - indeed Amazon reviews are the main reason I haven't purchased a cheaper enclosure for my DSLR despite a burning desire to start underwater photography! So with some trepidation, I tested the product. I would like to thank LowerpriceUSA for sending me a copy of this product for reviewing purposes.BUILD/QUALITYWell, the good news is that this case is made of good quality plastic. Giving it a through inspection I was pleased to see that any seams were about an inch wide, meaning that an inch of glue (or whatever they used to seal it) would have to fail before any moisture got in. I was intrigued by the top closing mechanism - it didn't look very secure at all, but if you can imagine a sandwich bag with the press-to-lock seal, and then imagine a clamp locked into place over that, you will have a good idea of how water is shut out.DESIGNHappily, I want to report that the touch-screen is still fully functional with this case on. This means that you don't have to open the case when in wet/sandy/dirty/snowy conditions, and still have full use. Now obviously it's a little hard to push buttons on the top and sides (at least it is on the iPhone), but it's still doable, and the home button is easily pressed. The clear plastic on both sides means that you will still have the use of front and back cameras...it looks like my underwater photography dreams may begin to come true! The two rotating locks are relatively hassle-free, although it takes some getting used to.PERFORMANCEAnd now we get to what's most important: does it work? There's no point buying a well-made, stylish waterproof case if it doesn't keep water out! The first thing I did was load up some regular facial tissues into the case and seal it. I then went to the sink and ran water directly over the top seal for a good few minutes. After drying it off completely (to make sure the outside wasn't a source of moisture), I opened it up and was pleased to find the tissues still bone-dry. Encouraged, I closed it back up and this time submerged the case in the sink for 10 minutes. Again, I was very pleased with the results! Finally, I put my phone in (fingers crossed/praying fervently/etc.) and submerged it again. I was VERY happy to see that not a drop of water had entered the case, and that I could still use the touch-screen underwater! Now I haven't tested the claims that it is effective to 100ft, but I may just have to load it up with an old iPod and give it a shot this summer! It is also important to note that by leaving some air in when sealing the case, this will actually float - perfect for those using this while boating etc.OVERALLI don't think I would ever recommend a water-proof enclosure for electronics without some sort of reservation, but so far the case survived the sink test, and I think for beach/boating/all-weather use it will be just fine. As far as it being your snorkeling partner, I will let someone with more experience comment on that. Overall, I was very pleased with the quality, design and performance, and look forward to testing this further when the weather is nicer!
summary: Nerve-wracking, but passes the test!

reviewText: There are times when you are in conditions that could easily ruin your smartphone. The Frieq Universal Waterproof Case wallows you to pack your smartphone without fear of having it damaged by the elements. It is certified to depths of 100 feet so you can text while snorkeling or diving... if that is your thing. More importantly you can also use your smartphone in a downpour without fear of being damaged. Another use is for the pool - the Frieq case will allow you to float on a raft in a swimming pool without fear that an accidental dunk will destroy your  phone.All is not completely perfect. i found closing the case to be a bit cumbersome. It took me a couple of minutes to get the case lined up and sealed.Other Notes-- Will allow you to use your touchscreen while in the case.- Lanyard allows you to wear the case around your neck- Offers protection at depths up to 100'Final verdict - A nice accessory for anyone camping, hiking, canoeing, snorkeling, or other activity which may put your smartphone at risk.4 StarsNote - I received this product for reviewing purposes
summary: Waterproof Functionality

reviewText: This waterproof case takes a little getting used to; right out of the box they feel strange. If you need to protect your phone from water, this is the way to go for the least money and easiest to use case.The trick with this case, it won't fit tightly and be bubble free against the phone. Using the touchscreen takes a little time to get used to the extra layer of plastic. You won't be able to type as fast as with no case.This case will work with iPhone 4 through 5. It is just about the easiest case to install. Flip two switches on the front of the case. Separate the two plastic parts, slip your phone into the bag, and try to squeeze out the air, close the two plastic parts, and flip the switches. It is really that easy to put on. The opening is sealed if those two switches are fully inserted and the tabs point outward.All the controls work fine through the case - volume, power, reset, and the home button. Of course you can't charge the phone or use headphones with the case in place. For reasons I will never understand, you can hear the speaker very well with this - it doesn't change the volume very much at all.The case is waterproof, it doesn't leak. I'm not sure I would use this diving to 100 feet. On the other hand, if I accidentally dropped my phone in a pool or lake, I'd be super happy that the phone was protected.I've used a waterproof case with my iPad for a very long time. That case is made of much more robust material. The vinyl is covered with a fabric that makes it virtually indestructible. The clear plastic is about twice as thick. And the seal at the top is a double ultra heavy zip lock style closure. I trust that I could abuse that case a lot and it would still work fine. The Frieq case is made of much thinner vinyl - about the thickness of pool toys. The seams look like they are welded very well. For the long haul, I'm not sure this will stand up to a lot of abuse. This seems more like a really great inexpensive a few time use case as opposed to something long term.I wouldn't hesitate to use this for camping or protecting my phone from rain. I wouldn't use it diving for a long time. It works perfectly for taking underwater pictures in say a pool. If I were going to be in a wet environment for a long time, I'd probably want something a bit sturdier. Overall it is a good case.I was provided a review sample.
summary: Good

reviewText: If you've ever been in a quandary about what to do with your phone, ID, and money while boating, hanging out on the beach, or having fun in a water park, this FRIEQ waterproof case is a nice option.  It's huge -- I guess to make it universal -- and my iPhone 5 looks small inside, but that also means I have a little room for money and an ID.  The best part is that I can use my phone without removing it from the pouch since the plastic does not prevent capacitive contact.  I can swipe, call, check email, etc. without taking it out of the pouch.Of course, I didn't want to test this on my iPhone in case it didn't work.  I folded up a square of tissue paper, inserted it, flipped the latches closed, and submerged it in water for a hour.  Since tissue paper picks up water easily, I expected to see a few drops through the window.  There was nothing, not a drop.  The only time it got wet was when I opened the latches and pulled it out.  The paper brushed against the water that had collected around the opening.  If you do get wet while wearing this around your neck, take a lot of care when opening the pouch and removing your phone.I was surprised by how large this is:  4" x 7 3/4".  The top/latch portion is 1/2 " thick when closed.  There are two things that would make this close-to-perfect:  an adjustable length lanyard for hanging around my neck, and an easier way to line up the latches when fastening them.  (Note: The manufacturer provided this product for review.)-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: FRIEQ-ing Huge -- And Very Useful (5- stars)

reviewText: Ever since I accidentally washed my iPhone a few years ago, I've been very cognizant of its limitations when it comes to the exposure to the wet environments. Now I will (hopefully) not make the same mistake again, but I do occasionally take my iPhone to a beach. Usually I make sure that I am far away from the water, but I do dread the prospect of getting my most precious gadget wet. The Frieq universal waterproof case is designed to give me a piece of mind. So far it has been proven very reliable.The case is pretty large and made out of very durable plastic. It can fit most smartphones. I've tested it with Galaxy S and iPhone 3G, and I was also able to put iPhone 4S inside. I am not sure if it would fit a larger smartphone, such as Samsung Galaxy Tab.The two latches on top of the case make it easy to shut it off and seal it - you just have to twist them and everything is taken care of. The top attachment on the case might be the weakest link in the long run - I am not sure how it would handle repeated opening and closing.To test this case I had dunked my iPhone 3G into a big water-filled pot. There was no leakage and the phone continued to function. I was even able to use it while inside the case, but NOT while it was submerged.I think this is a great case to have if you engage in a lot of outdoor activities, especially near water. It's an ideal case for a beach or for fishing. It can also probably be used for other more water-intensive activities (swimming, snorkeling, kayaking, etc.) But in those cases I would go for something even more robust. Overall, a pretty good phone case.
summary: Can't Complain

reviewText: Only so much can be said about a waterproof case for an iPhone - either it works and fits and does what it promises or it doesn't. With FRIEQ products it almost goes without saying that the product description will be fortified when the product is put to use.  For those who may be concerned the iPhone 5 series fit snugly and perfectly. The ports necessary for operating the phone are easily accessed without removing the phone. It comes with a detachable carrying strap.As far as specs are concerned the waterproof case comes with windows on both sides facilitating taking pictures or videos withot have to check position of the phone. The design is such that the case opens and closes at the top with well marked sliding buttons leaving a comfortable port for slipping the phone into place. The top then closes and seals watertight. This is a reliable waterproof case keeping your phone safe down to 100 feet! Excellent value backed by dependable support from the company. Grady Harp, March 14
summary: Sleek, Sturdy, Dependable

reviewText: Before I was willing to test this case by submerging my iPhone in a container of water, I first tested it by filling the case with paper towels.  I dunked the case, swished it around in the water, and left it submerged overnight.  In the morning, there was not a drop of water in the case.  I tested it the same way with my iPhone with the same results.The case has two clips at the top that open like levers.  When closed, the case is fully sealed from water.  Fortunately, it's easy to tell when the clips are fully closed because they lie flush with the case.  And it's designed in a way that would make it very difficult (I can't say impossible) to open the clips accidentally.When your phone is in the case, it's amazingly easy to use the touchscreen, requiring just a slight bit more pressure than normal.  It's not just typing and pressing icons that's easy, but even scrolling and swiping.This case is great for divers, as you can take photos with your phone inside the case.  But I would also use this case just to bring my phone onto a boat or even the beach.  Anytime I bring my phone to the beach, I'm scraping grains of sand from crevices in my case and the phone itself months later.  With the FRIEQ waterproof case - problem solved.I was provided with a sample of this product with a request for an honest review.
summary: Truly waterproof

reviewText: This is my review of the FRIEQ Waterproof Case, at first I didn't want to trust this case with the life of my device as anyone wouldn't; however, for reviewing purposes I gave it a shot. I placed my HTC EVO 3D inside of the case and it fit well, the first thing I noticed is that the device is still fully functional in the case. The screen works as if the phone were outside even when under water. I obviously can't test this 100 feet underwater, so I can't guarantee that claim to anyone; however, I ran it about 4 feet deep under water and it worked perfectly, this is quite impressive. I left it there for about two minutes, I tried the phone again and it still worked flawlessly, screen responsive and everything. The case it's self is nice in design, it comes with a lanyard that you attach to the case. I can highly recommend this product to anyone that needs a water proof case! I rate this product 5 stars out of 5 stars!I hope this review has helped you out!I was provided a sample for testing and evaluation, my review of this product is honest and the words stated above are my own.
summary: I actually tested this with my phone

reviewerName: Jeri Zerr "formerly a Road Warrior of the Nth...
reviewText: As a former member of a SAR team, I realize the importance of keeping multiple means of communications available in the field yet want to be able to protect the precious cell phone from catastrophe by dropping it into the body of water or using it during stormy conditions.  The Frieq waterproof case held up well to protect my cell phone while still allowing use of the touchscreen to make calls or check text messages for updated instructions.  I received this case from LowerPriceUSA, this is an honest review after I have been using the case for a few months as storms repeatedly hit our area.
summary: great for first responders, disaster environments, SAR personnel or stormy conditions!

reviewText: I go camping quite a bit and I like to take the occasional picture with my phone instead of a point and shoot camera.Only problem is....I run the risk of damaging my phone and even worse for water damage.I got this case for reviewing purposes and did not expect much based on the design and the advertised protection from water and basic damage but it seriously knocked it out of the part for my expectations.It did really well when we were in a fairly wet area and even though my pack was waterproof, the extra protection really kept me at ease. I even once dropped my pack into the water and everything got wet (even my matches) but the phone stayed squeaky dry.Great pickup for people who like to go out and need a little protection for their phones. Or just don't bring your phone at all. Nah.Pros:+ Affordable+ Easy to use/operate+ Really does protect phone from water!Cons:- The lanyard isn't the best (Best to have this in your pack)
summary: Perfect for Camping and Outings - A must have!

reviewText: I go kayaking a lot over the summer and take my phone and camera in an Outdoor Products 3-Pack Ultimate Dry Sack. Which does a great job. But every time I want to look at my phone, I risk opening the bag and dropping something in the water. This waterproof case will do a wonderful job of keeping my Droid Incredible 4G dry and yet visible and easily accessible.It was easy enough to get my phone, in its case, inside and seal the top with two lock tight grips. The lanyard is silky soft and long enough to go around your neck. I recently dropped my phone in a snowbank and luckily it was okay. Although I probably wouldn't use this on a daily basis, if I am outside in the snow, rain, doing yard work or water sports, this is a definite addition to my accessories. Easy to use, held up to my testing in a minimal submersion and nice to have the visible window.When your phone can cost $200-$600 to replace, this is an investment you can't afford to pass up.I was provided a unit for evaluation and review.
summary: Great Idea, Well Made, Perfect for the Outdoor Enthusiast!

reviewText: This FRIEQ Universal Waterproof Case for smartphones is basically a thick vinyl pouch with plastic bars at the top that secure with two ridged thumb clamps. At the top is a hole to attach the included detachable lanyard so it can be worn around the neck.Most importantly, this case is truly waterproof.
