It seals tightly enough that I can't squeeze air out of it when it's inflated and when tested in the sink underwater, not one drop gets in. This makes it perfect for outdoor activities at the pool or beach or even for hiking in the rain. The size is generous with the pouch roughly 3 1/2 in. x 6 1/2 in. so that it will hold all standard cell phones plus keys, money, and credit cards.The clear window allows use of touch screens and cameras while the phone is protected inside the case.I had looked at hard waterproof cases before and have used Aloksaks but this one is lightweight but durable and seals tightly and securely—no guessing about whether it's sealed or not.A sample was provided for unbiased review.
summary: Lightweight, waterproof, & durable

reviewText: This is one of those cases that make you wonder why it took so long to invent.  A waterproof case that still allows you to work your smart phone and take pictures?  The manufacturer states that this is waterproof to 100 feet, making me feel more secure when using it outdoors. I have "fried" a phone and a digital camera while camping, simply because it rained all day and the humidity was so intense. I consider my smart phone my entertainment center and life-line. So when I go camping, canoeing or lying at the beach, I can take my (iPhone 4S) and still play with it and take nice outdoor photos.The FRIEQ has a very tight seal at the top that takes a little concentration to open and close it. Both sides are completely clear for seeing and using your iPhone (yes, you can still use your apps through the plastic window).  For carrying, there is a small hole at the top for a lanyard.  FRIEQ states that this will protect your phone down to 100 feet.  As a SCUBA diver, I don't doubt this (but won't test it).  What happen is the deeper you go, the greater the water pressure, meaning a tighter seal.  Most leaks occur on the top twenty-five feet of water with these kinds of devices.  Also, just like the buttons/levers on those throw-away underwater cameras that don't work past the recommended depth, your apps on your phone won't work well at a deeper depth.  This waterproof case is best used no deeper than twenty feet.When you think of how much time and effort and use you put into your smart phone, this ten dollar protection unit is a no-brainer. If you really want to test it, you could snorkel or leave it out in the rain when camping.  This is one of the best inventions for full outdoor protection for your smart phone. Product generously supplied by FRIEQ for an honest review.
summary: Universal Use And Protection!

reviewText: If you use your smartphone on a boat, beach or near a pool, this is a good thing to have. Your device will be protected from water in this completely waterproof case.The Frieq waterproof case will handle smartphones up to about 5.3 inches. I have an iPhone 4. I like that the clear panel on both sides of the case lets me see and use the touchscreen nearly as easily as if the phone were not in the case. I can still take photos and video through the case too which is really cool. In the past when kayaking, I'd have my iPhone with me in a ziplock sandwich bag. It worked fairly well for protecting against splashes but there was one time where my phone fell into the water and the zip wasn't locked. Water got in the bag, but didn't damage the phone since I was pretty quick retrieving the bag. I was very lucky that time. Now that I have this waterproof case, I will feel much more comfortable taking my iPhone with me in my kayak.This is really great for protecting your smartphone whenever you know you're going to be on or near water. Or how about while hiking or camping and you get caught in a downpour. The case is rated IPX-8 which means it is rated for complete submersion and is waterproof up to 100 feet for up to 30 minutes. I'm not so sure I'd trust this to protect my phone while scuba diving but maybe while snorkeling. It's certainly going to keep your phone dry from rain, accidental drops in water, etc.The clips that close the case are a little finicky to operate but not too bad. It takes a leap of faith to actually put your phone in this then deliberately submerge it but it's rated IPX-8 so that is the assurance that it can handle it. There is also a neck strap/lanyard included for carrying the case.This is great and inexpensive insurance for protecting your smartphone, small camera, mp3 player or other small electronic device from dunks. I'm a little surprised that there was no instructions included in the package but I guess it's fairly obvious how to open and close the clasps. But usually there are necessary statements that companies like to make to ensure you have made sure there is no foreign matter impeding the closing of the top, etc, etc.
summary: Waterproof pretection for your smartphone or small camera

reviewText: This FRIEQ waterproof pouch is absolutely wonderful.  I put an old phone inside and went into our hot tub for half an hour.  Not only did it keep my phone bone dry, it stayed afloat.  Together with the strap, I won't have to ever worry about losing my phone in the water.My iPhone screen retains its touch sensitivity through the plastic.  I don't know how it does that.  I took photos through the case.  Sometimes, movement was a problem, which caused the photos to come out distorted.  But if I can keep the camera still, the photos come out fine.I plan to go gold panning this spring and I want to take my iPhone with me to take photos.  Gold panning is a wet and dirty job.  I'm glad I will now have something that will protect my phone while I'm out there in the river.  Great case, very effective.This product was provided for review by LowerPriceUSA.
summary: WaterPROOF

reviewText: Basic waterproof case.  I tested this on the sink before actually using it for my iPhone5.  It is inexpensive but it works great.  Now my son and I are alternately using it for my iPhone5 and his iPhone 4S on days that we want soaking in the tub.  A number of times I had almost drop my phone while browsing for music to play on the portable Bluetooth speaker by the sink.  That's not a concern anymore.It is a little tricky how to seal  and unseal this phone protector at first, but you'll get used to it quickly.  The front plastic may need a little practice, it is much thicker than your regular protector.It would be perfect at the beach, not only it will protect the phone from water but also protect it from the sand.  Heat may be a factor though as it is completely enclosed.I was provided a sample of this product, so I could use it and write my unbiased review.
summary: Unafraid of water

reviewText: Take your iPhone, Galaxy S3, Galaxy Note 2, Droid RAZR/MAXX, Nexus 4, EVO 4G LTE or any smartphone up to 5.3 inches along when you go to the beach, boating, fishing camping, or just around the pool. This Frieq Universal Waterproof case will keep it safe and dry, even if you drop it in the water. (It's IPX8 Certified to 100 feet (30 meters) I tested mine by putting a piece of folded paper towel in the case, sealing it and submerging it in our bathtub. (You didn't think I was going to put my phone in there before making sure it was really waterproof, did you?) Even when holding it under the water for several minutes there was no leakage. The paper towel was completely dry. Not only does this case keep your phone dry, but you can use the phone while it's in this case because the plastic on the front and back gives you a clear view and the buttons work just like they do when the phone is out of the case. You can even hear Siri speaking to you or take a photo through the plastic.It has a snap and lock closure on the top and comes with a neck strap so you can wear it around your neck or over your shoulder. Although this is meant for a smartphone it can just as easily carry a small camera or mp3 player or calculator. What a simple, easy to use, inexpensive way to protect your device when you're around water!I was provided a sample of this product for review.
summary: Take your smartphone to the beach (or camping or hiking)

reviewText: These are very effective cleaning pads for touchscreen surfaces. They far outperform the thin freebie microfiber cloths included with many products.After some sessions of touchscreen navigation on a Kindle Fire (that may have included some multitasking with a bowl potato chips!) the screen was left none too pretty...Three circular swipes (with fingers inserted in the pouch) and the screen looked out-of-the-box pristine.Really nice wipes.I received this product at no charge for review purposes...but still a great value if you have to pay for them!
summary: Turns grungy touchscreens shiny again...

reviewText: This is a great cleaning pads.  I love how well it cleans without the use of any chemical or water.  You simply just take the black end of the cleaning pad and wipe your screen.  All the spots and dirt really lift off the screen.  I've used this on my laptop and phones and it works very well.  My hands sweat all the time which is gross but because they do my screen always gets fingerprints and gross dirt on the screen from my sweaty fingers.  So when I actually put this to use, it really picks up that dirt.My laptop screen always gets dust on it and doesn't seem to come off all the time with just a regular napkin so it's nice to have a microfiber one to clean it.  I'm still not sure why they give you three in a pack because you only need one to clean everything LOL.  All in all works great - I would recommend this to buy and share with your friends.  I was given this item for review.
summary: Great Wipes - Cleans very well

reviewText: FRIEQ Microfiber cleaning pads are unique because each pad is a little pocket.  To demonstrate how they work I am attaching a video and a collage of 4 photos (which can be located by following 'customer photos' link under the main photo.  The video demonstrates the cleaning pads cleaning my tablet.  They remove the smudges very effectively.Photo #4 and #4 show before and after photos of the phone, where the cleaning pad took care of cat hair and smudges.  Photo #1 shows the content of the entire package - it contains three pads.  I put one near the computer, one in my purse, and gave one to my husband.  Photo #2 shows the pads next to the ruler.  Their size is 2.5" by 5" (the entire length) with 3" pocket. The material feels like suede. It really holds what it picks up well, I noticed this particularly with cat hair!  The pads are washable.I tested using this pad for cleaning my glasses but did not like it as much for that use as I did for the tablet and phone. I like cleaning my glasses by rubbing on both sides of the glass at the same time rather than swiping. This motion with the pad on both sides of my eye glasses was a little awkward.  It worked, but holding the pad was not convenient for me.  By comparison when I cleaned the tablet/phone the pad's pocket felt like a natural fit for the motion.I received a sample for evaluation and writing an honest and unbiased review.  I hope my demonstration gives you a good idea of the effectiveness of this cleaning pad.Overall, I found them very effective in cleaning, and their small size in convenient for carrying around.Ali Julia review
summary: Effective in cleaning, convenient size for carrying around.

reviewText: These are powerful little screen cleaning pads.  They remove dirt, dust and stubborn fingerprints. They are non-streaking and non-abrasive.  Made of a durable microfiber that is very well stitched together so there will be no fraying or tearing. Works great on screen protectors as well.Being able to insert three to four fingers into the convenient pocket makes it easier to control the movement of the pad to thoroughly wipe the surface clean.After wiping away dust and dirt, I wave it briskly to remove loose dust and grime of the pad.  Easy to take along and store in my iPad carrying case.  Have been using to clean my iPhone, iPad and Kindle.  I know it will also work great on my computer monitor, flat screen HDTV, sunglasses and anything else I want to have a mirrored streak free finish.
summary: AWESOME!

reviewText: The screen on my Kindle Fire is always a mess. With as much swiping and pressing I do on the screen, when it's turned off it looks like some kid with mess fingers was playing with it. I find myself always taking my shirt and trying to wipe of the screen a little in an effort to remove the long swipe finger marks all over it. This microfiber cleaning cloth that fits over your fingers cleans the screen beautifully! All the messy finger marks and smudges are buffed away and the screen is left looking crystal clear. There are 3 cleaning pads in each box, so you can keep one with each of your devices. I keep on cloth in my Kindle Fire case so I have it with me when ever I have the Kindle. I keep on with my iPhone charger so I can clean the screen on that when I charge it each night. The third I keep with the chargers for all my kids handheld video game devices (Nintendo DS's and PSP). They get their screens very messy and I keep a cleaning pad just for using with their things.The design is perfect for staying on your fingers when cleaning. It will fit all hand sizes and of course cleans screens of devices of any size. These are super handy and far better for your screen than using a less soft fabric that could cause light scratching. They work extremely well and I high recommend them!A sample was provided for an unbiased review.
summary: Love these for cleaning for my iPhone and my Kindle Fire

reviewText: It's funny how you don't realize how much you will use something until you have it (literally in this case) in your hand! Apparently I have been going around with dirty screens for years, and not really cared! Not any more, that's certain. I would like to thank LowerpriceUSA for sending me a sample of this product to review.QUALITYWhen it comes to cleaning cloths, quality is absolutely important! A cheaper "soft" material can actually leave micro-abrasions, something that is quite common on camera lenses (I'm a collector of vintage lenses). So, it's important to know that you are using a high-quality cloth, and I really must say that this FRIEQ cloth is really top-notch! It is lint-free, and soft enough to be used on almost any glass.DESIGNI really like the design of these cloths - by making a little enclosure for your fingers they allow you to put some pressure without the cloth slipping out from under you meaning your fingers smudge the glass all over again! With the FRIEQ cloths you can really give your screen a good cleaning, putting in a little elbow-grease as necessary!PERFORMANCESo far I have used these cloths on an iPhone, an iPad, my DSLR LCD screen and a couple of camera lens filters, and each time it has done its job! By being a little thicker these really are suited for flat surfaces without ridges (getting in the corners of lens filters was a little difficult due to the raised threads), but for 99.9% of applications they will absolutely work wonders.OVERALLI can absolutely recommend these cleaning pads - they work wonders and the MRSP for a three-pack is highly competitive! Recommended without reservation!
summary: Excellent!

reviewText: I've got a lot of screen real estate to keep clean, not easy when you have little kids.  I'm always wiping screens and have tried everything including eyeglass cleaning materials.  This is the best fiber I've used so far for cleaning.  The fingerprints come right off.  Normally to get fingerprints off we have to smudge them around awhile until it's gone.  This is by far faster and easier.I clean my iMac screen, my two side screens, my iPads, my phones and my Kindle Fire with these pads.  I recommend these pads.  I was provided a promotional unit.
summary: 3 pads included.  Nothing I've tried works like this

reviewText: I was surprised by the fact that I like these microfiber cleaning pads. I just assumed that my t-shirt works would well anything that I could buy, so why spend the money? Well I was wrong the Frieq Microfiber Cleaning Pads clean my ipad extremely well. A few wipes and every smudge and fingerprint disappears from my iPad screen. Trust me, it works better than my t-shirt and my breath!Notes- Comes in a three pack - which is nice once you realize how much use you will get out of the cleaning pads.- Nice design allows you to put three fingers in a pouch which makes it even easier to clean your screen.- In addition to use the cleaning pads for my iPad I also used it on my Samsung TV and my MacBook Pro- Lintless - which is a bigger benefit than you realize.Final Verdict - Again, I liked these cleaning pads much more than I expected. They are very effective in cleaning all of you devices5 StarsNote - I did receive this product for reviewing purposes... but it did not effect my review... if I did not like the product I would have rated it poorly.
summary: Works Better than I Expected

reviewText: I've come to love these mobile accessories from FRiEQ.  They even figured out how to take something as mundane as a microfiber cloth and make it unique.I'm not a clean freak, but I like to keep the screens of my mobile devices clean and free of smudges.  I clean the screen on my Kindle Fire a couple times a day and clean my glasses whenever they need it (at least 3-4 times a day).  I try to keep a few soft cloths squirreled away in places where I need them most: in the kitchen, my laptop bag, and my desk at work.  A set of cloths like these are perfect for multiple locations.So what's unique about these?Well, first of all, the quality of the microfiber cloth is very good.  The design is interesting too.  It's actually a small mitt that you put your hand (or just a few fingers) into.  At first I thought this would make it difficult to use these on my glasses, but there is a flap that extends past the opening of the mitt and folds over.  So I can put my fingers into the mitt to get the front surface of my glasses, and then I can fold the flap over and get to the back surface of my glasses.These are great.  I'm putting one of them in my Kindle Fire case so I'll have it wherever my tablet is.I was provided this item for review.
summary: Handy microfiber cloths

reviewText: I'm always looking for a better way to clean the screens of my iPad and iPhone. While my home office favorite is iEraser Tablet Screen Cleaner, the block is too bulky to carry everywhere. That's where the Frieq microfiber cleaning pads come in. The design is simple: a 3" x 5" rectangle of double-layer microfiber with an equally soft pocket on the back for your fingers. Your hand provides the structure for a thorough sweep of the screen. It works well and, because of the size, quickly. I have some microfiber cloths that are too thin or too small to be efficient. These take care of that problem.The product photo shows four fingers inside the pocket. I have small hands, and my four fingers fit snugly. People with large or broad hands will likely only get three fingers inside. As a experiment, I tried using three fingers, and I was still able to quickly clean my iPad screen, although I had to take care not to touch the screen with my not-included finger. The manufacturer might want to consider making a larger size for bigger hands.I love that I can tuck one of these pads in my briefcase or inside my iPad sleeve without taking up valuable space. (The manufacturer provided the product for review.)-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: I love these cleaning pads!

reviewText: I'm constantly using my iPad and as a result, it usually looks like something a toddler has been playing with.  Before I even tried to use the Frieq screen cleaning pads I took a close look.  It was covered with oily fingerprints and was a big smudgy mess. I have a film screen cover on my Kindle Fire so that's not problematic, but my iPad is a whole `nother critter.  When I was on vacation this past month I found myself actually huffing on it like I would a pair of glasses, trying to get just a tad of moisture on it so I could wipe it down.  That sort of practice and lint-free cloths will get you nowhere fast.When I used one of these screen cleaning pads on my iPad this morning I was amazed at the results.  It was like the Magic Eraser of the screen cleaning pad family.  It was a no hassle clean and a couple of swipes completely cleaned the screen.  There was no residue left behind and whatever oils the Frieq cleaned off appeared to be absorbed into the microfiber.  While I was at it, I added aFrieq Home Button Stickerto my iPad for good measure.  A good cleaning and a pretty in purple aluminum sticker made my iPad look as good as new.  The Frieq screen cleaning pads will fit all hands, using two or more fingers, and are easy to store.~  Premium microfiber material.~  Soft and comfortable, reusable.~  Easy to grip and use.~  Cleaning solution not required.~  Effectively removes fingerprints and residue from screen.~  Works with Cell Phone, LCD, Mp4, PSP, iPad, and most touchscreen tablets.~  Specifications:  5.12 x 3.15 inches (13cm x 8cm)~  Recyclable packaging.Sample provided for review from the distributor.
summary: These premium microfiber screen cleaning pads are as handy as a Magic Eraser ...

reviewText: This is one of the best small hand-held device cleaners that I've come across. It is great for your iOS and Android devices, but it also gets the job done with computer screens and similar larger screens. The microfiber cloth is smooth and effective at removing fingermarks and other smudges from the device screen. The little pocket at the back gives you extra control and grip on the cloth. I've used it for a few days now and can't think of going back to my old cleaning cloth.
summary: Best Glass Cleaner I've Come Acorss

reviewText: These FRIEQ cleaning pads literally fit like a glove.  Or maybe, a mitten.  For cleaning my Kindle and my iPhone, I typically use a more traditional microfiber cloth or the edge of my t-shirt.  Needless to say, it works much better than my t-shirt.  It also works better than my microfiber cloth.  These FRIEQ pads slide onto the ends of your fingers.  I find that this method allows for much faster cleaning of smudges since you are able to more easily concentrate pressure where you need it.  The small size also makes these very portable.I highly recommend this to anyone with a touchscreen device.  You will likely find, as I did, that these outperform the cloth-type cleaners.I received a sample of this product with a request for an honest review.
summary: Much better than the corner of my T-shirt - ingenious design

reviewText: I have been using these microfiber cleaning pads now for about 3 days now, but I knew since the first day that I tried them that they were great! I cleaned my iPad's screen which was a disaster from all the finger prints that were on it in just a couple of seconds with these cleaning pads! I was really impressed when I looked at my screen afterwards, not a single scratch or smudge on it! I love how you get three of them, I keep one for my phone, the other for my laptop, and for my iPad. These work amazingly great and they are very convenient to carry because you don't need any other thing. I have used other cleaning pads that worked O.K, but they all required some sort of water or had a chemical on them, this cleaning pad is re usable, and doesn't require any of that! I highly recommend these cleaning pads, you won't be disappointed with them I can assure you that!I hope this review has helped you out!I was provided a sample for testing and evaluation, my review of this product is completely honest and the words here are my own.
summary: Wow, these work great!

reviewerName: Jeri Zerr "formerly a Road Warrior of the Nth...
reviewText: I have been using these microfiber cloths for a few months.  I had not realized how handy it was to keep an extra one in each of our vehicles so I can clean the screen on our cell phones when waiting for the kids or when I have a few minutes to kill between appointments.  I HIGHLY recommend keeping a microfiber cleaning pad handy and convenient. No cleaning solution is required.  If the screen is especially grimy I will use a dampened napkin or paper towel or baby wipe first, then once dry I use the microfiber cloth to finish the job and polish the screen.The Frieq microfiber cleaning pads have held up well and have performed great. I am happy and would buy in the future when I need to replace these.  I received this pack for reviewing purposes, so far the pads barely look used so should last quite awhile longer, even with frequent use to clean multiple touch screens (cell phone, GPS, Kindle, tablet, etc).
summary: Has been very handy, much more so than I realized!

reviewText: What a clever idea! To make a cleaning cloth to fit over your hand for ease of use. This super soft cleaning pad does a wonderful job of polishing up any screen - Kindle, Kindle Fire, smartphone (and even glasses!).This comes as a three pack which means you can leave one on your desk, one in your pocketbook or "manbag" if you have one and one near your comfy chair. Or, if you misplace one, no worries, you have two to spare.Very nice idea, well executed and finished.I was provided a sample for evaluation and review.
summary: Makes for Super Sparkly, Clean Screens!

reviewText: Every time my iPhone or iPad get smudged with fingerprints, grease or dirt, I simply rub it across my jeans or shirt.  It's not the most attractive or efficient way to clean an expensive device.  These 3-pack cleaning pads are very well made.  Look at the price and then think about how important it is to clean your device properly.  It's a no-brainer bargain.Simply place your fingers in the pocket and clean your device.  The `premium' microfiber removes all residues.  NO scratches, no smudges, no worries.  It will work with any device that has a clear screen similar to an Apple product.  Have one at home near your office desk, one at work and extra around the house.  They don't need to be cleaned often, but s simple solution of ordinary dish soap and water sand air drying should handle that.  It a nice little accessory hat I never would have though about before.  The cleaning pad will easily fit in an iPad case or similiar.  Product generously supplied by manufacturer for an honest review.
summary: Protect Your Expensive Device For A Few Bucks

reviewText: Fingerprints are the bane of touchscreens. It's funny how some people aren't bothered by the fingerprints while others, like me, are. I've noticed that after a few hours of looking "through" fingerprints, my eyes are more fatigued than normal. So I try to keep my screens clean.Since I also wear glasses, I usually have the small cloths they give you at the optometrists office to clean my glasses. I'd try to use those tiny cloths to clean my iPad screen and it just didn't work. They are simply too small to really be effective. Plus just one cleaning of the iPad screen makes the tiny cloth so dirty that it can't really clean my glasses very effectively anymore. The other option was to use one of those ginormous micro-fiber shop cloths... wow those sure are convenient to carry with you aren't they?So along comes Frieq with these perfectly sized little cleaning pads. They are micro-fibre, they have a convenient pouch you can slide your fingers into and you can wash them when they get too dirty to work effectively. Plus, you get 3 of them in a package. Cool. My only tip is when you wash them, do not use fabric softener otherwise you will leave a haze of fabric softener on your screen when you attempt to clean the screen.I think these are a brilliant solution to a "problem" I didn't even know I had. They are small yet large enough to do a great job cleaning an iPad screen. Of course they'll work on your notebook screen and smartphone display too. I like these a lot.I was provided a sample for review.
summary: Effective, perfectly sized pads to clean your devices' screens

reviewText: Three of these Frieq cleaning pads come in a box.  I gave one to my husband, put one in my purse, and left one in my office.  They are more substantial than some of my thin microfiber cloths, so they don't ball up in a little mass at the bottom of my purse and get lost.It doesn't take many swipes with this cloth to polish the greasy fingerprints off my screen.  I tested it against my gold standard Fuzzy Wuzzy on a particularly messy screen.  They both took three swipes to clean it.  It definitely outperforms the whole drawer full of cheap freebie cloths I have.My long, skinny fingers fit inside the pouch, but that can be a problem for those with bigger hands.  My husband can fit two fingers comfortably, three if I asked him to.It's not necessary to use the pouch or to insert all digits.  The cloth can always be grabbed from the outside and used like any other regular cleaning cloth.  Placing the fingers inside merely helps me position my hand flat against the screen and apply more even pressure against a greater surface area (i.e., I clean more screen more quickly).This is a good size cloth for me, more portable than my Fuzzy Wuzzy, which is too big a clump in my purse.  I now carry the Frieq cleaning pad with me everywhere to use on my iPhone, which can always use a good cleaning.This product was provided for review by LowerPriceUSA.
summary: Better than regular cleaning cloths

reviewText: This came in a three pack. They are made of very fine microfibers. It has a pocket where you can put two or three fingers so you can swipe it to the screen of your cell phones or tablets. They work great and there won't be any lint left at all. If the case of your cell phone is thin enough, you can even slip it inside the pocket. Sample item was provided by the distributor for review.
summary: Lintless

reviewText: Even though consumers now have an abundance of devices with screens designed to be touched, we go out of our way to avoid actually touching them. As proof, consider the wide array of aftermarket stylus and protective films that enable this counterintuitive behavior...Still, use cases exist where users might really need alternative to their finger for touch screen input (consider environments where gloves must be worn, or the needs of some mobility impaired users).This stylus arrives nicely packaged. It has a brushed surface, and touch screen response was fine when tested with both a Kindle Fire an HTC Evo. Stylus users with smaller hands may prefer a more slender alternative (one is shown for comparison in the accompanying video).Overall, nice stylus for touch screen control and and data input.Note: This item was provided at no cost for review purposes.
summary: Good functionality for those who prefer using a stylus...

reviewText: This stylus is 4.7" long and 1.75" in diameter at the grip point.I am attaching a collage of three photos (which can be located by following 'customer photos' link under the main photo) that I will be referencing in this reviewI LIKE---------------1. Comes in a nice looking box (Stylus shown in the opened box in Photo#1).  The presentation looks nice for an inexpensive but impressive looking gift.2. Sensitivity and performance was good. I most frequently use the stylus for typing and editing text as it gives me best precision for positioning insertion point between characters.I DO NOT LIKE---------------1. This stylus is quite heavy. It weight 1.4 oz my digital scale (by comparison the weight of this FRIEQ stylus FRIEQ New Conductive Fiber/Rubber Hybrid Stylus (Black) is 0.4 oz).  I had two issues with this heftier weight: (1) the weight made it less comfortable to hold when used for a long time, (2) if the stylus dropped on glass surface it has potential of damaging it.2. It has no clip to secure it while carrying it around.  Given that this stylus is rather heavy it would be better if I could secure it.3. This stylus as the name implies has a wide grip.  I am a female with small hands and I did not find it comfortable to hold.  Note that my husband found it comfortable.  Photo #3 shows my grip as I use this stylus.Overall, this stylus is best suited for people with large hands. It has an "expensive" look when presented in its box, so it makes a nice small gift.I was provided a free sample for evaluation and unbiased review.Ali Julia review
summary: Nice looking, but has some usability issues

reviewText: The Freiq Wide Grip Capacitive Stylus is perfect for larger smartphones, iPads, e-readers, wascom tablets or even the new touch screen computer monitors.  I would not recommend this kind of stylus for a smartphones like an iPhone or an MP3 players like an iPod since it is quite large and you will have a hard time seeing around this one.Imagine holding a permanent marker - that about describes the size of this stylus.  It is quite heavy and sturdy, but it will not damage or scratch your screen.  This is not a stylus to use to make thin lines and precise drawings, this baby is used to make a bold statement.The only concern I have is holding the stylus for long periods of time.  It is quite heavy and I can see people's hands cramping up after long periods of use.  I have not use it for extended periods of time.  Since I use it with paint/Drawing apps on my iPad, I use several different sized stylus depending on the size of the stroke I want to draw.
summary: Perfect for Large Smartphones, iPads, E-Readers or Wascom Tablets

reviewText: This is not your everyday stylus. It's large and wide and even though it's made of aluminum, it's got some weight to it. I wasn't sure how well it work work for me at first since I actually have pretty small hands (I can often fit into kids/youth size gloves). It turns out I love the large size of this stylus! I can get a great grip on it even though it has a very smooth surface. My hand doesn't get fatigued as quickly as is does when I use smaller ones, and the rubber tip works great with both my Kindle Fire and my iPhone 4s, even with my iPhone having a screen protector on it. It's larger size more resembles the tip of a persons finger so devices seem to respond to it really well. For those who want an ultra thin and small stylus, this isn't the one for you. But it's great for those with large hands, and even for those of a with small hands! Love it!A sample was provided for an unbiased review.
summary: Love this large/wide stylus

reviewText: This FRiEQ Wide Grip Capacitive Stylus comes in nicely packaged in a well made presentation box and is ideal for younger users using drawing programs on larger screen tablets. We use this with a Kindle Fire and theDrawing Padand our 10 year old test subject liked it better than the finer point stylus we compared it against.The stylus is about the thickness of a larger crayon and the large tip works great for making bold strokes, but can not really be used for finer writing, like writing or signing your name (on the "Square" credit app, for example).The tip is also not replaceable, so it will be discarded once it eventually wears out.Recommended, for younger users.CFHNote: Unit provided for review by manufacturer
summary: Thick Grip Stylus - Recommended

reviewText: Before I get to the review, I should mention that if you don't like/don't want to use a thick stylus for your touch-screen device of choice, this definitely isn't the one for you! It is hefty and thick - something that could either be good or bad depending on what you are looking for! I would like to thank LowerpriceUSA for sending me a sample of this stylus to evaluate.QUALITYWell, I usually like to start my reviews with the quality of an item, and let me begin by saying that the FRIEQ Wide Grip stylus loses no points here. It is made of a nice (heavy) aluminum that feels good in the hand. The rubber tip is thicker than many other styli that I have tried, and seems less prone to wear. I will, of course, update after further use. The stylus comes in a nice black box, making this ideal as gift to that techy in your life!DESIGNWell, this is honestly where the Wide Grip stylus lost one star. Beginning with what I love about the design, I would like to mention that I LOVE thicker styli. I am a daily user of a Wacom graphics tablet, and so switching from a thicker pen to a thin stylus has always had an air of unnaturalness to me. I find the FRIEQ stylus very easy and natural to hold, much more than holding the typical thinner styli available on the market. I also like the weight to it - again I find this more comfortable over time! There are two main concerns that I have with the design. The first is that the beautiful aluminum finish is very hard to hold on to, generally speaking. Especially during the winter - dry hands are almost certain with central heating going and using an easily dropped and heavier stylus over a $400 iPad is a little too much of a liability. I'm not saying that this FRIEQ stylus is hazardous by any means - I just feel as though I am constantly having to check my grip. The second concern is that the tips don't seem to be replaceable - something that I may or may not care about depending on how long the stylus lasts.PERFORMANCEI can honestly say that I had no issue using the FRIEQ stylus. It has a thicker tip, meaning it is not ideal for phones use, however it definitely works as it should and is an absolute joy on tablets. I had no problems with jerky movements (i.e. you're trying to draw a straight line and it jumps), and in terms of performance I have no complaints!OVERALLI would love to see the manufacturers take a little width out of the center of the stylus, replacing it with a rubberized grip, but other than that I really like this stylus, and it has become my new favorite in terms of usability! I would highly recommend this as a cheap experiment for anyone looking for something a little sturdier in a stylus - you may just fall in love with it! Recommended, and hoping that we might see a grippier 2.0 version!
summary: Really quite decent, could be great!

reviewText: Wow this is solid, a little heavy and all aluminum.  I like the feel a lot.  It's thick, therefore more ergonomic.  I received a unit as a promotion and submitted this review on my own initiative.  I think anybody wanting a thicker stylus or wanting something aluminum to match their Mac products will like it.
summary: High quality solid aluminum

reviewText: I've seen some very creative products from FRIEQ. This one has me steepling my fingers and scratching my chin.  Hmmm.Just because I'm a red meat eating, beer swilling, knuckle dragging guy doesn't mean that I don't appreciate art.  And that's precisely what this is.  As soon as I took this from its package I knew that I was staring at a piece of art.It's simplicity is elegant, which is dissonant with with its bulky form.  This stylus is roughly the size and shape of a cigar, but it has a heavy heft, more like a hand tool.  It actually feels like a chisel or a punch.  And it makes a solid sound when you set it down.  It's all black, not completely smooth but not very textured, and has no other features like a pocket clip or anything.This minimalist design is striking.But what about its function?When I first noticed that it has a rubber tip, I thought, "uh oh, I'm not going to like this".  I don't like the way rubber tipped styluses skip across the screen.  But this one is different.  In spite of the rubber tip, it glides better than other rubber tipped styluses I've used in the past.This stylus is interesting and it's a conversation piece...and it's functional.I was provided this item for review.
summary: Interesting

reviewText: This solid, metal, heavy stylus is ideal for large hands or anyone who feels that a slender stylus is just too difficult to grip.  The rubber tip is extremely sensitive -- I can swipe through an iPhone or iPad menu with the barest of touch.  The matte, all-black (except for the Frieq logo in silver) look adds elegance to an otherwise functional device.  I call it my stealth stylus.  If I were to drop it on a dark carpet or under a desk, I might need a flashlight to find it.The stylus is approximately 4 3/4 " long and 1/2" thick.  Some people, of course, will find the thickness difficult to grip while others will love it.  For me, the biggest drawback is the lack of a rubberized or textured grip since the body's one-piece construction makes it a little slick despite the matte finish.  The inability to change the tip doesn't bother much as it does other reviewers since it takes only a light touch to get the job done.  I don't see the tip wearing out quickly.I have small hands, so the chubby body is not ideal, although the sensitivity of the rubber tip is excellent. Since this is marketed as a wide grip, however, and since people who don't like this kind of thickness aren't likely to purchase it, it deserves close to 5 stars.  (Note: The manufacturer provided me with a sample to review.)-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Like Handling a (Sensitive and Elegant) Jumbo Crayon (5- stars)

reviewText: This is very solidly bult and effective stylus. The capacitive tip enables it to work on most touch-screen devices. I've tested it on iPad and iPhone, and it performed more or less as expected. It did require a bit more of a pressure to be applied than I would have liked, but not to the point that it would make it unusable or even uncomfortable to use.The stylus is built out of a single piece of solid aluminum. It definitely feels very well built and durable - at least when the body is concerned. I am not sure how will the tip perform over time, but thus far I have no reason to believe that it would not last.This stylus is a great writing/drawing implement for those of us who prefer wider grips for ergonomic reasons. However, it feels a bit heavy - which may be a bonus for some users. It also lacks a rubberized grip surface which I would prefer - the smooth body can feel a bit slippery.Overall, this is a simple, solid product that will get covers all the basics of what a good wide-grip stylus ought to be like.
summary: Solid Wide Stylus

reviewText: Whether you like this stylus or not is going to come down to a question of personal preference - do you prefer a thin or thick stylus?  I've only used the thin kind before, so using this Wide Grip stylus took some getting used to.  Holding it for the first time took me back to elementary school, because it feels like one of those big pieces of chalk we used as kids.I used it on both my Kindle Fire and my iPhone, and it works like a dream.  The amount of pressure required to get your device to respond is just right.  The only drawback is the lack of a gripping material on the stylus which makes it feel a bit slippery.  I should also note that this stylus is quite hefty.  It weighs 1.5 ounces, more than three times the weight of a more "traditional"  thin stylus that I own.  The good news is that you are much less likely to lose the FRIEQ Wide Grip stylus; believe me, if this puppy hits the ground, you will surely hear it.I was provided with a free sample of this product with a request for an honest review.
summary: Thick or thin?  That is the question.

reviewerName: Jeri Zerr "formerly a Road Warrior of the Nth...
reviewText: The FRiEQ stylus is well made and very easy to use for larger hands, especially easy to use for someone who has larger hands with impairments which limit the gripping power on smaller items. The "point" is wider, hence it is best used on the larger devices.  I found a couple issues trying to click on tiny font links on a small smart phone - it's just too big for those very tiny links.  When used with larger applications such as tablets and interactive computer monitors, it is a GREAT stylus. I love the packaging, makes it appear to be a much more expensive product - ideal for gift-giving such as office parties or a token of appreciation.I received this sample from LowerPriceUSA, this is an honest review after I have been using the stylus for a few months.
summary: Perfect for larger screens, especially helpful for anyone with larger hands that has a hand impairment.

reviewText: This is a very nicely packaged and finished stylus in a reasonable price range. It comes in a sturdy presentation box with a magnetic close flap - not that packaging makes the product but if you are giving it as a gift, this looks good.The stylus is pretty heavy but the heft can be a good thing if you are looking for a weighted product. It is thick which makes it great for someone with trouble gripping - like a senior, disabled person, or a young child. It has a solid feel aluminum body and a large tip.I have used a Wacom graphics tablet with a pen stylus for 20 years and my graphics pen is thick but much lighter. I didn't have any trouble using this stylus but if I didn't need a thick one, would probably lean towards a standard size stylus.A nicely made product with a great feel if you understand what you are buying.I was given a sample product to test for review.
summary: Thick Stylus for the Young or Old

reviewText: I have just discovered my all time favorite capacitive stylus:  the wide grip FRIEQ.  It's beautiful, feels like a metal rod - solid with a good weight to it.  You'd think "wide grip" means fat tip and poor precision, but it's so not true!  It's got the best sensitivity of all my styli.  Precision is so good, I take it with me everywhere and use it on my Fire HD all the time.  It works just as well or even better than my finger.  The only problem is it has a tendency to roll off my desk, but its superior performance makes that a minor annoyance.  Trust me.  I've used a lot of styli.  Nothing beats the wide grip FRIEQ.This product was provided for review by LowerPriceUSA.
summary: My all time favorite stylus

reviewText: It looks like a stylish big hunky black crayon. It is made entirely of aluminum.  I would say it is  practically indestructible except for the rubber tip.  I am using this with an iPad 2 and it acts very responsive.  It is a bit heavy which sometimes makes me concerned about accidentally dropping it on the iPad screen.This thing is housed in a nice box with magnetic flap for closing.  The packaging is decent enough as a nice gift.Sample item was provided by the distributor for this review.
summary: Stylish crayon for your tablets

reviewText: This Frieq Wide Grip Capacitive Stylus is a substantial size that is great for people with large hands who find it difficult to get a good grip on a tiny stylus. It is also good for kids who are used to coloring and drawing with a larger instrument. It reminds me of a fat crayon. It's made of aluminum and has an attractive black matte finish with a rubber tip. This stylus works well for scrolling or selecting while browsing webpages. It works very well for typing on my iPhone. It's heavier than your average stylus and has a nice solid feel to it. It is a little wide for some of the small detail on a smartphone but I like using it on my Kindle Fire and it would probably work great on an iPad.  One thing that is missing is a pocket clip, which would have been handy. On the other hand, a clip would have spoiled the sleek look of this solid black stylus.I was provided a sample of this product for review purposes.
summary: Wide grip is nice for kids or people with big hands

reviewText: I really really like this case.  I've actually just finished review this other case that was very similar in design but after a few weeks it just died out and never worked again.  This one is lighter and works even better AND the case is much easier to take on and off the phone. I'm able to get a full charge out of this battery or at least a very close full charge.  It's basically protection with a case and it works sooo well too.  I'm extremely impressed and extremely happy with this charger/case. I really think everyone who runs out of batteries mid day should have one of these too.  I am very happy to give this a two thumbs up - I received this item for a honest review and would be more than happy to recommend this to anyone.
summary: This is really awesome and light weight

reviewText: I spent twelve days traveling and meetings. I not only needed to use my iPhone as a phone, but I use it as a hot spot for my iPad! It is my life on the road. While using an Unu battery, I was able to run my phone for up to three full days (my own use) at times, although two days was the normal max.One of the key features I love is that you don't have to take the case off when you synch it to the computer. I also appreciate having the ability to use the standard micro cord to charge my phone. The only feature that bothers me is having to use an adapter for my headphones (which is included).I received many compliments on my case, and many people commented on the fact that it was not only beautiful, but also practical!  I love the gold version even more than the black one I had been using. It makes my phone even more classy, gives me the gold case I couldn't get, AND, it has a glittery front protective cover. When my phone is turned off, it glitters and gives extra class to my phone. When the screen is "live," the glitter disappears, so it is not distracting at all. [Edited - in certain lighting, the glitter is more obvious even when the screen is on, giving a pixie dust feel and look to the screen]A very, very attractive alternative, and very much appreciated.I received a complimentary sample to test for a review.
summary: More power - and more battery life - beautiful as well

reviewText: My boyfriend has this case in black and loves it.  He travels a lot and claims that it more than doubles his battery life.  The only issue he ever mentioned is that it makes it slightly harder to push the mute button on top.This gold color I was afraid would be wild or maybe too ghetto-fabulous for our advanced age.  But it really isn't.  It is a very subtle, nice looking gold case.  It isn't shiny or slick, so it doesn't get fingerprints either.This is a great case and a lifesaver for people who travel and can't be by their charger every minute.Sample provided for unbiased review.
summary: Now in Gold

reviewText: I was surprised at how nice this gold colored case looks with a black iPhone in it.  It also feels good to touch and grasp in hand.  It doesn't attract fingerprints.  It's a lot lighter than it looks.My iPhone 5, shown in video, has 1,440 mAh.  This external battery has 2,300 mAh.  Together that's 3,740 mAh.  Together that's 260% of the power that my phone has alone.  This battery added another 160%.For over a week I had my phone in this battery case and there was no need to take it out.  There is also a screen protector in the box, and a charging cable - the only charging cable needed.I recommend this external battery case without qualification.  Sample received for review.
summary: Great-looking iPhone 5 external battery case

reviewText: *Disclosure: I was contacted and given a sample of this product by uNu*I see lots of battery packs, as well as plenty of extended life batteries w/cases.  This one, which is similar to theuNu Aero Seriestries to make a balance between adding size and being of value, while at the same time trying to work within the limitations of what what can do with the fruit of Apple.  Like the Aero series, I think uNu did a good job at meeting their goals with this product, but could have done a couple of things better.  The case itself is a nice snug fit, not easily dislodged once it's wrapped around your phone.  Fatter than the Aero Series model, true, but packing a bit more battery too.  For whatever reason, uNu decided against using a lightening connector on the outside of the case for charging and syncing, and went with micro USB instead.  You can still charge and sync, no problem, but if you bought extra lightening cables, extra iPhone specific cables, those are going ot be useless with this case.  Due to the the iPhone not having a user replaceable battery, the DX case acts as its own entity. Clearly written in the instructions, it's made plain that in order to get the extra juice, one must manually turn it on.  For those that...uhm...don't read instructions, it's not at all obvious.  It would be nice if the whole thing worked together with the phone a bit better.  Like maybe an app that could monitor the phone's battery and then kick on the extra one as needed.  Not being an Apple developer myself, I suspect that Apple does not allow the level of access to the hardware needed to make this possible.  Also worthy of note, when charging, the phone's battery charges first, then the external.  Always.  Further, the external battery has its own charge level indicator.  There is no other way to check if the pack is fully charged or only partially.  Again, if only it were more seamless.
summary: What's the charge, officer?

reviewText: I used to own Mophie Juice packs for my iPhones 4 and 3G, but when I bought my iPhone 5, those kind of battery cases weren't available because of the lightning connection.  I kinda forgot about the convenience of those, and moved instead to external power banks as a source of back-up power. With the uNu Power DX, I'm back!  Although it adds length, especially at the bottom, width, and weight, none of them are bad enough to be deal-breakers.  I've seen Otterbox cases that were more bulky than this.  The uNu Power DX keeps my iPhone up and running for twice as long.The fit is perfect, and the lightning connector goes into the phone smoothly and firmly.  The top and bottom sections meet without noticeable gaps -- other than a thin seam, of course.  Because the case charges using a microUSB connection, you don't need an extra lightning cable when you go on the road, although you do need to remember a microUSB cable, the kind that charges Kindles, Bluetooth headsets, and many other electronics.  The camera cut-away is both deep for protection and angled away for unobstructed shots.  The speakers have open slots.  If you have earphones/headphones that use  a right-angle connection, then you can use the included adapter.A small design issue is the on/off button.  I like to have my battery case charged but not charging my phone so that I can use it in case of emergency.  To do this, I have to insert the phone -- it starts charging automatically -- and then hold down the silver button in the back for several seconds until the iPhone indicates that it is no longer being charged.  (The light also goes off in the back.)  I'd rather have an on/off switch the way my old Mophie cases had so that I can be sure that I'm not depleting the battery.Once I start using data-hungry apps (anything set to push or to retrieve lots of data), my iPhone 5 battery depletes itself in less than a day.  The uNu Power DX ensures that I can make it through a day or two without needing to plug in my phone.  (Note:  I received a sample for review.)-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Perfect Fit, Much Needed On-Board Power (5- star)

reviewText: This battery case will protect your phone and keep it charged.Having a 2300mAh battery places this battery case in the lower range of batteries, but also keeps down on the weight. There is enough power to charge your iPhone 5 from empty to full with some juice left over.The design is very clean and simple, but very effective. The body is very sleek, and just big enough to cover the phone. The case fits the phone like a glove, as if it was made by Apple.The case has its own micro USB charging port, so this might not go over well for some, but not a deal breaker for me. There is a LED indicator on the back that shows the level of battery life. In order to use the battery, you must press and hold down the power button. Your phone will charge as it normally would as if it were plugged into a wall charger.This battery case will protect you phone and keep you charged up when you need it most.CONTENTS:uNu Power DX External Protective Battery CaseScreen ProtectorMicrofiber Cleaning ClothUSB Charging CordHeadphone Extension CordUser ManualFEATURES:Battery Capacity: 2300mAhBattery Type: Lithium IonInput: DC 5V/0.5AOutput: DC 5V/1ACharging Time: 3-4 HoursDimensions: 5.70 x 2.64 x 0.65in (144.78 x 67.01 x 16.51mm)Weight: 2.9oz (82.21g)Warranty: 1 YearPOWER LEVEL INDICATOR:4 Lights: 75-100%3 Lights: 50-75%2 Lights: 25-50%1 Light: 0-25%I was supplied a sample for the purpose of review.
summary: Protect You Phone While You Charge It

reviewText: Battery cases all do a pretty good job adding battery life, but many are bulky or ugly or both. Luckily, the uNi Power DX is neither of these. It's great looking and doesn't add too much heft to the phone at all. I wasn't sure if I'd like the gold color, but it turns out I LOVE it. It adds some nice understated classiness to the phone without making it look too blingy or flashy. All in all it's a great case at a reasonable price. Good times!
summary: Works great, looks great!

reviewText: Sometimes it is just difficult to match the package insert and that is most assuredly the case with uNu's new product for iPhone 5/5S. Not only is the thin, lightweight but very durable case well designed (it is a quick slide to insert or remove the phone form the case), but having a 2300mAh built in battery means no more losing charge with your iPhone - an additional 10 hours of talk time or play time. The design is so well integrated that the port for the USB charging cable is exposed in the case so the phone needn't be removed to charge the battery: an LED light visualizes how much charge is present. There is a screen protector built into the package, a headphone adapter, and the most sensitive volume adjuster around.With all of these features you would expect a clumsy appearance to the case, but uNu keeps the profile of the iPhone 5 and keeps it all sleek and sassy. This is simply the best addition to your iPhone 5 you can find. Highly Recommended. Grady Harp, January 14
summary: Delivers what it promises! The finest battery case charger available

reviewText: So, you get a convenient extra charge, plus a beautiful, effective case to protect your phone!  And, it is a battery you don't even notice is there, nestled on the backside of the case.When I really thought it through--after I looked at all the external battery chargers I've accumulated--I realized the combination was unbeatable.  Plus it meets Apple's performance standards.For a mere 3 ounces, with this particular uNu Power DX phone case, I get up to an entire extra charge for my phone with its 2300mAh, decent protection for the phone and a very attractive case.  This case covers all the bases, plus the manufacturers have thrown in a screen protector, too.A few extra millimeters at the bottom of the case add another worthwhile feature:  Those few mm adapt the lightning port of the iPhone 5 into a regular micro USB port .  The package comes with a quality USB cable and headphone adapter, to make things even simpler for you.New technology, optimized in the charging circuit, allows you to charge your phone at 1A / 5W speed, which doubles the charging speed of the previous  DX case.I have several external batteries that will give me 2300-2400mAh, the one with the lightest weight looks like an over-sized lipstick case and weighs 2.75 ounces.  The batteries go up in weight and size from there.  And, except for the most minimal of phone cases, for weight you can hardly beat this one that gives substantial protection.I understand the convenience of an effortless 2300mAh charge:  It allows ten EXTRA hours of talk-time, or eight hours of browsing, or seven hours of game-play, or 11 hours of video, or 42 hours of music-play.  I see 2300mAh as convenience and not as emergency power.  Personally, I feel most comfortable (as in peace-of-mind) when I have this 2300mAh backup right on my phone, a 7800-8400mAh in my desk drawer, and a 17000-20000mAh in my vehicle's console.  (With the way the weather is acting up lately, if you travel--airplane, airport, road-trip, whatever--you are crazy not to take advantage of all the external battery power you can afford.  You never know where you might get stuck without a working plug-in.)About the color and look of this case:  They call it gold.  I think it closer to a metallic champagne color.  It is matte, not shiny, so it is a very sophisticated-looking case.  Easy to hold, too.  Plus all the openings are adequate to allow access and no reflection in the camera's eye.  There is an on/off button on the back to start charging.  And there is a LED bar to gauge the amount of charge.  I especially like the way the top portion of the case slides out to allow the phone to slide in.  It seems sturdier than those cases that have a back and then a frame that snaps into place around the sides.  I think it will last longer.uNu does great with its product pages, too:  So easy to read and understand.  Very straightforward and what they claim is actually the way it is:  No gimmicks, no misrepresentation--ever, no come-ons.  I have found the company to be trustworthy and the representatives friendly.*I received a sample product from uNu.
summary: Light weight, thin battery tucked neatly inside your phone case

reviewText: I have a couple of other battery cases for the iPhone 5 but what stands out for this one is the looks. With the great gold color case, it really looks spiffy.It fits like a glove and has beveled edges so is pretty sleek. All the openings fit well. Putting the iPhone in is easy. Just take off the top half of the case, insert the phone in. Snap the top back on and that's it.It charges with a universal micro-USB cable. There is a colored indicator on the back. Red means low, blue is medium and green is full. The battery gives you an extra charge's worth so pretty much I can have my phone on all day.Overall, a beautiful battery case that is a joy to carry around. Highly recommended. [Sample provided for review purposes.]
summary: Beautiful!

reviewText: The uNu Aero is has several features that other cases I've used don't have.  Not only does it have a 2000 mAh battery that in practice almost doubles the capacity of an iPhone 5S, it charges wirelessly when laid on the power pad and allows data transfer by USB rather than Lighting cable.  It also protects the iPhone all around from bumps and scratches and reduces fingerprints.What surprised me is that it is less than 5/8 in. thick.  It still looks thin, but with the rounded edges and soft touch finish, the Aero case makes the iPhone much easier to handle and more comfortable to hold, especially for long periods of time.  The case is very easy to fit onto the phone and to remove.The power pad is very convenient and extra ones are available.  The icon on the screen and the LED both signal that it is charging and it charges both the iPhone battery and the Aero battery.  It can also be charged from a USB port or USB wall charger without using the power pad.There are LED indicators for remaining reserve capacity.  To recharge the iPhone, just hold down the button on the back of a case for a few seconds.A pigtail extender for the audio port is included so that a standard Apple-compatible headset can be used with the case on the phone.  All other functions are readily accessible.A sample was provided for testing and unbiased review.  I definitely recommend the uNu Aero for providing almost double battery life, wireless charging, and an attractive and functional case, all in one well-designed and -manufactured accessory.  It makes the iPhone better.
summary: Functional and convenient—makes the iPhone better

reviewText: This is such a beautifully designed battery case that it is quickly becomming my favoirte battery case that I've reviewed so far.Included with the battery case:- Audio Extension Cable- USB to MicroUSB charging/data cable- Screen protectorThe case is a two part design. The iPhone slides down inside the larger bottom piece, slipping securely onto an integrated Apple Approved lightning connector. A smaller top cap slips over the top of the IPhone, slides down and clicks onto the bottom case securing iPhone into case. Done.I like this design better than many of the other cases out there that have a frame that snaps around your iPhone and then snaps to the case. Those types of cases can pop apart if your phone drops onto the floor. That is very unlikely to happen with this case because there is no frame to pop off and the top is probably not going to pop off even in a drop scenario.The battery is a 2300mAh Li-ion battery that will fully charger your iPhone effectively doubling the life of your iPhone, I no longer have to worry about my iPhone battery running out of juice mid-day as it usually does.The case has a LED on the backside and next to that is an on/off button. When connected to a power source, the LED blinks to indicate that charging is taking place. When the battery pack is fully charged, it stops blinking and remains lit. If your iPhone happens to be in the case when you plug it in to charge, your iPhone will begin to charge first and once it is fully charged, the battery in the case will charge until it is fully charged.LED legend- Green 60%-100% remaining power- Blue 30%-70% remaining power- Red 5%-30% remaining power- Blinking Red <5% remaining powerDuring the day if you notice your iPhone's battery is getting low, you simply have to push the on/off button on the back of the case for at least 3 seconds to beging charging your iPhone. It's that simple. Once your iPhone is starting to be charged you'll notice a lightning bolt icon to the right of your iPhone battery level indicator (top right corner of the display.) The battery case provides 1A of current for charging and performance is great.The battery case has a rubberized coating and chamfered edges that make it feel great and secure in the hand. All the coutouts are accurately placed and I like that the case has channeled the iPhone speakers to fire out the top of the case towards you instead of leaving the sound exiting out of the bottom of the iPhone.This is a perfectly integrated case and battery solution for your iPhone5/5sI was provided a sample for review.
summary: Perfectly integrated battery & case for your iPhone5/5s

reviewText: UPDATE 02/07/14: Although my case is still working please see the comment to this review by 'Skylark' before making a final purchase decision.I received a review sample and was overwhelmed by the large number of substantially positive reviews already posted. I will attempt to highlight the reasons why I love this case/battery combo without repeating the excellent points made of other reviewers. My tests were made with an iPhone 5S.Foremost, this manages to provide effective protection and an extended battery in a compact package. It manages to keep the thickness of your iPhone 5S to a slim 15.5mm and less than doubles the weight (the 5S weighs about four ounces on its own and this adds another three ounces.)It's the way the protection actually works that is impressive. The back is padded, the case is sufficiently raised to protect the screen face, and the clever way it snaps in place all work to protect your phone. Compared to the sibling product -uNu Aero Series iPhone 5S Battery Case- that I also tested this one offers the best protection.Of course, back-up power is another top feature. The battery pack enclosed in this case is nearly  1.5 times the capacity of the built-in battery of the iPhone 5S, which easily doubles the use time of a fully charged phone plus this case/battery combo also fully charged.The devil is in the details: I also love the cut outs that are truly precision cut and placed. This case is a perfect fit over your phone. Plus you have the added advantage of charging with a more common micro USB cable, but if you want to use the Apple Lightning cable it's a simple matter to remove the iPhone 5S from this case and charge it with the native charging cable. Unlike some cases charging cables and data syncing work with the case on with every cable I tested.Some folks hate the recessed 3.5mm phone jack and the fact that you needed an extender cable to access it. The necessary cable is provided, but since do not use the phone jack (I prefer bluetooth) I have no issues with it. If you do use your phone jack you may not care for this aspect of the design.Overall, this is a well made case/battery combo that is functional, attractive and does exactly what the manufacturer promised - a rare combination.
summary: Superb design and engineering

reviewText: The Unu DX Protective case is an iPhone 5 case and battery pack rolled into one.  It is capable of providing you phone one full charge plus a fraction more.  If you are running out of juice just press and hold the switch at the back and you will see the blue LED lights up and your phone will start charging.  Included in the box is a microUSB cable for charging your battery pack, audio extension cable and a bonus screen protector.You do not need to remove your phone from the case if you need to sync, just attach to your PC using the included microUSB cable.Charging the case:Connect the case to a USB power source using the included microUSB cable either to a wall outlet or PC.  If your phone is not fully charge, it will charge the phone first then it will automatically charge the battery case once the phone is fully charged.Remaining charge indicator:Quick press on the button at the back. Green represents 60-100% charge, blue represents 30-60%, red less than 30%, and blinking red is less than 5%.Pros:- Convenience. No need to plug anything on the go as your extra battery is always with your phone.- sync through the case- sleek look- snug fitCons:- Because it incorporates a 2300 mAh battery, expect to add some bulk to your phone.  Not much on the width but it adds a little more on the height and weight.- Buttons will be accessible except for the audio jack (that is why an audio extension cable was included in the box) but will be deeper to reach.- Maybe hard to remove the phone.  Even with a 2-piece design, the phone is too snug fit that you may need a rubber band to get a nice grip to pull the phone.A sample of this product was sent to me for review purposes.
summary: Extra juice for your iPhone5 wherever you go

reviewText: Four and a half SUCCESSFUL Stars!  The UNU 2300mAh capacity DX charger case works great at providing a full on-board 100% recharge for the iPhone 5/5S as well as providing physical protection for the iPhone itself. And there is no loss of radio-frequency reception using it. After testing this charger case for weeks and charting the recharge time and rates, this is one of the best iPhone chargers available at this time. Adding only 3 ounces of weight and just over 1/2 inch to the length of the iPhone5, it fits comfortably in pants or shirt pockets. The DX protective case offers more protection for the back and sides of the iPhone than most cases, plus the slightly elevated case lip around the iPhone5 front area prevents the iPhone screen from directly touching a flat surface, if laid face down. A screen protector with fingerprint cutout comes with the uNu DX package and gives the iPhone all-around protection. Users can recharge the iPhone at any time to boost it back to 100% but the charging rate is very slow at higher levels.A power-depleted iPhone 5 was 'up for use' in 5 minutes at 4% charge and the iPhone reached 100% charge for at just over 2 hours when charged by the uNu Power DX case. To initiate the fully-charged DX case delivering power to the iPhone, the on/off button must be pushed for 3 seconds, there is an audible tone from the iPhone, and the blue light (for the black case) or green light (for the gold case) begins blinking for a while indicating the case has begun charging; when the case is depleted the light on the back of the case becomes a blinking red light when the on/off button is pushed. I have, as a test, charged the iPhone from the 95% level (it took about 20 minutes to get from 95% to 100%), so it takes much, much longer to charge at the higher % levels if you are trying to "top off" at 100%, compared to the "1% per minute" rate at the 0% level. When the case and iPhone are depleted of power and both are charged together, they must be connected to a power source, and then the iPhone is recharged first, followed by the DX case. The case takes about 7 and 1/2 hours to charge on its own; the IPhone takes about 2 hours. Be cautious of ITunes App Store "battery aps", they will tell you to stop charging when the iPhone is fully charged: "to prevent overcharging disconnect your iPhone now", however, the case must continue to be charged. If you are worried about overcharging the iPhone, then remove the iPhone and charge the case separately. The case will not begin charging the iPhone until you push the on/off switch. When the case is charged alone, the red light begins blinking, then turns to a blinking blue or green light, then to a steady blue or green light when fully charged. There is no capability to get an exact readout for power remaining in the case, so fully charge the DX case to get the best results when you need to charge the iPhone. The uNu DX rechargeable external battery case is Highly Recommended. Four and a half SUPERB Stars! (Black or Gold color DX Protective-Rechargable external battery cases for iPhone 5, with charging cable and different types of connector heads, as well as a headphone extension cable. Screen protector with fingerprint cutout is also provided to provide all-around protection. Wall power connector is not provided. This item was provided by the manufacturer for testing and an impartial review.)
summary: UNU DX IPHONE5 CHARGER: A VERY EFFECTIVE 2300 mAh CHARGER and PROTECTIVE CASE

reviewText: The 2300mAh built-in battery provides excellent value and doubles battery life. . It features 1A powerful output, integrated charging switch and battery level LED indicators. The charges also doubles as an excellent case! Another big advantage of this is converts iPhone to a microUSB capable device. Cutouts for all function buttons and headphone jack are accurate. A free headphone adapter is provided for any 3rd party headphones. The style is very ergonomic and only 1.5 cm is added to the overall solution.uNu's design are very stylish and sleek. I was impressed with the design as well as value this case provides. Using for couple of days, I did not have to charge - a big book while traveling long distance. I was able to sync with iTunes/copy pictures as well as charge with no issues. Having USB charging basically gives much more options as these are cheap and much easier to obtain spares in office situations. Overall highly recommend!I was provided this product in exchange of a fair and honest review.
summary: Very stylish/Excellent Value

reviewText: If you are looking to extend your battery for roughly one full charge (great for those days when you are using the phone frquently) and want one that comes with a decent screen protector, that allows for your touch to be read just as you'd expect if you didn't have a screen protector on, this is a great case to own.It is easy to charge, it adds some length to the phone, but other than that, it does a great job protecting the corners of the device, the back of the device and when you install the screen protector, the front as well. If you just want to protect the screen from scratches, the case itself has enough extra over hang to be able to lay it on a table without worrying about scratching it.Overall, this is an easy to use battery, adds a marginal amount of weight and offers good protection to your phone.Highly recommended.I received a free sample for review purposes.
summary: Great case, great battery, good protection

reviewText: First off, I would like to thank uNu for sending out this case to me for free for reviewing on Youtube.When I first received the product, I was greeted with a very nice box. Inside, you get a free screen protector, the case, a micro usb cable, and lastly, a headphone jack adapter. All of these extra additions in this box come in handy. As for the case, it is well constructed and provides you with 2300 mAh for charging. That can charge the iPhone approximately 1.5 times! The case also has nice cut outs for the speakers, lock button, volume rocker, toggle, and headphone jack. On the back, there is a button for turning the case on, as well as a nice LED to indicate how much charge is left. When using this case, installation was very easy and the case felt natural in my hand. In the end, I definitely recommend this case to anyone that needs extra juice for the iPhone 5 or 5s.
summary: One of the best cases money can buy.

reviewText: I seem to be reviewing a number of battery units for charging phones and mobile devices of late. My latest is the uNu Power DX External Protective Battery Case for iPhone 5S. I wasn't sure how much I'd like this, as I know it places more bulk and weight on my iPhone. I wondered if it would be a hassle for the backup power should I need it (it's not often that critical that I do). I'm pleasantly surprised, however... the Power DX works better than I expected, the bulk is less than I thought it would be, and there are a couple of nice side benefits with the design.The case pulls apart to allow you to drop the iPhone into the lower portion. The top portion of the case then slides over the top of the iPhone and clicks into place. The ease of removing the case was important to me for something a little further down in the review. The cutouts for the buttons and camera lens are slightly recessed due to the thickness of the case, but this acts as a nice level of protection from damage or accidental pressing while in your pocket or purse. The only cutout that is a bit problematic is the one for the headphones. The bottom cutouts are deep, and a headphone jack that is L-shaped would not fit directly into the cutout. An extension adapter is provided for those situations, but it's one more thing to keep track of. If your headphone has a straight jack, you shouldn't have a problem. For me, I rarely use headphones, so I don't much care either way.The surprise and major benefit on this design is that the charging plug is a micro-USB slot. That means you can charge AND sync your iPhone 5 with a micro-USB cord, and the need for a lightning cable is eliminated. I've tried both charging and syncing in iOS 7, and it works without a hitch. That feature alone may be reason enough to strongly consider this as your regular phone case.I mentioned earlier that I appreciated the ease of which I could remove the iPhone from the case. My bedside clock has a dock for iDevices, and I have a 30-pin to lightning adapter on it. If I choose to let the phone charge overnight, I need to remove it from the case as the micro-USB slot doesn't work for me in that situation. However, I've found that with the extra juice provided by the case, I'm only recharging every other night instead of every night.All things considered, the Power DX is a very nice case with some features that are quite useful. I even liked the gold case, as it's a subtle brushed gold look, not a shiny gaudy piece of bling. After having it on my phone for a week or so, I'm not sure I'm going to take it off any time soon.Disclosure:Obtained From: ManufacturerPayment: Free
summary: This case offered up more benefits than I expected...

reviewText: What's in the box:-uNu Power DX 2300mAh battery case for iPhone 5-micro USB cable-headphone jack extender-screen protector-user manualReview:This battery case is great and provides enough power to charge my iPhone 5 105% in my test.
