It took me a few minutes to figure out exactly how the charging cable attached to the headset. The other end is a USB connection, so it can be charged through your computer's USB ports. Or if you have aUSB wall charging adapter, you can use that with the charging cable to charge the headset with a wall outlet. There is a red LED light on the headset that identifies if the battery is charged or not. I tested the headset to see if it could be powered on while plugged in and charging and it couldn't.Sound and conclusion:The music from these headphones sounds great with everything I've tested them with (hard rock, classic blues and a mix of a few others). They're great for wearing while working out, walking the dog, cleaning or working around the house, or anything other activity where you don't want to be tethered with a long headphone cable running from your headset to your phone. It pairs on the first time every time, and my headset has great Bluetooth reception, letting me go easily 15+ feet away before the signal starts to fade. I've been so pleased with everything about these, and have had nothing but good results with them. Definitely a 5 star product in my book!A sample of this product was provided for reviewing purposes.
summary: I've had nothing but good results with the Bluetooth reception

reviewText: The DonoTwin headphones are attractive and well made. They were a little heavy in my ears but the sound quality is great. I had no connection issues while I vacuumed, did dishes, and generally futzed around the house. They synced fine with my computer and I listed to both itunes and spotify with no problems.These are really nice and fairly comfortable, I don't find any ear buds to be totally comfortable, maybe I have weird shaped ear canals or something, but in general these were more comfortable than many.Sample providedRecommended
summary: Nice sound quality

reviewText: I have tried a variety of bluetooth earbuds and heaphones - and they have all been pretty similar. They offer ok sound performance, but they rarely have enough volume to allow me to use them while mowing my lawn. The DinoTwin T1 are different - they offer bluetooth connectivity but they are able to cancel enough of the ambient noise so that I can mow my lawn while listening to Pandora.Notes-- Pairs easily with bluetooth devices - simply hold the power button until the earbuds flash red.- Sound quality is very solid but not quite exceptional.... the frequency response covers the entire spectrum - the bass is not booming but it does offer clean sound. While it does not offer the soundstage of some of the earbuds at higher price points it is more than acceptable.- The noise canceling capability was better than expected - I used the DinoTwin while on my riding lawn mower, and while they do not cancel all of the noise of the mower they did cancel enough of the noise to allow me to listen without much disturbance.- Offers 4 hours of listening time- Inline remote for answering calls- I really like the innovative connector that clips onto the earbuds for charging. It did take me a minute or two to figure out how they connected, but once I figured out how they connected I was amazed at how well it worked.- Comes with a variety of earbud tips and tabs for a variety of ear sizes.- I did have an issue that the earbuds became a bit uncomfortable after about 3 hours of use - not a big deal but they do feel a bit hard in my ears.- The earbuds fit, but I did need to adjust them on occasion.- The bluetooth range isn't 30 feet, but I typical keep my bluetooth device nearby when I use the earbuds.- Oddly the cord seems to be a bit short - while it is long enough to go from ear-to-ear. The shorter cord does mean that you don't have to worry about tangles.Final Verdict - The Dinotwin earbuds are effective bluetooth earbuds. They offer solid sound performance, noise canceling, and bluetooth connectivity for a reasonable price.4 1/2 StarsPlease Note- I received this product for reviewing purposes
summary: A Video Review of the DinoTwin T1 Earbuds

reviewText: UPDATE 9/13:  I intitially gave this 5 stars since it worked very well, but durability issues have caused me to drop the rating down to 2 stars.  After just a couple of months use, the sound in the left bud became muted or cut on and off. Powering it on/off would sometimes cure it, but oftentimes not.  More significant is that the battery life has gone down drastically -- a full charge will now only last for less than one hour.I still like the design, but the durability is suspect. 2 stars.>>>>Original review>>>I'm really impressed with these bluetooth earbuds. I use bluetooth buds mainly for when I'm exercising, and am picky about comfort and having them stay put. These excel on both counts. They come with three tip sizes (small, medium and large) which allowed me to adjust the fit (small works best for me). They have yet to jar loose even when doing cardio work. But, even with the tight fit, no ear fatigue or soreness. Excellent!Pairing them with my Fire was simple - just press and hold the center button and the Fire picked it up in a couple of seconds. It retains the pairing without any problems.The build quality appears very good. It has a rubberized feel to the cable, which makes it comfortable and sweat resistant.The charging cradle is very nicely designed. It has a clip that attaches to the right bud and makes contact with two small pins. Just put on the clip and plug it into a USB port. The clip and cord are very compact and easy to carry/store.The sound quality is decent. These are not audiophile-quality buds, but I found the sound to be excellent for movies, and quite good for music. Decent amount of bass, and relatively clear mid and high range. Good separation. I was especially impressed with the sound isolation. With these in my ears and the sound off, I could just barely hear a loud treadmill in operation.The range was good. I maintained a connection at several feet without any drops, and was able to go further with just an occasional minor drop out.Comfortable, good quality sound, secure fit, good range, great sound isolation and easy to use. A great value for the price (currently about sixty bucks). This should definitely be on the short list if you're looking for bluetooth buds for the gym.[manufacturer provided sample for review]
summary: Good at first, but durability issues cropped up

reviewText: I love earbuds, but I don't love wires. For years I've worn earbuds while I wait for my train or walk to the bus. I even wear them when I go grocery shopping so I don't have to listen to the junk they pump through the sound system at the store. But earbuds connected to my phone in my pocket aren't completely practical. It's always a shocker when I catch the cable on something (or drop my phone) and the buds rip out of my ears. These Bluetooth earbuds completely solve this problem, because now I don't have any wires tethered to my phone. This really gives me some freedom. For example, I can set my phone on the kitchen counter and listen to these while I move around in the kitchen while I cook. That's very handy.I was doubtful at first. I had questions, like:* How would you charge them?* How frustrating is the pairing?* Do they sound any good?* Does the charge last very long?I really don't like proprietary cables, but there really isn't any alternative way to charge these earbuds. You get a USB cable with a clip and two contact points (+/-) on the other end. You line up the + and - contacts and clip the cable to one of the buds. They charge up pretty quickly, but it's probably easier just to let them charge overnight. I keep a one-gallon ziplock baggie in my laptop bag with all of my proprietary cables, so I'll just drop this one in with the mix.I've paired them up with my iPhone and my Windows laptop. The iPhone pairing was done literally in seconds. The Windows pairing took a little longer, because Windows is a pain. It worked just fine though. So now with these paired to my PC, I can listen to them at my desk and not have a long earphone cable connected to my machine. That's pretty nice.The sound is great. I was surprised. These sound way better than I expected for this price range. I regularly use two other very high-end sets of earbuds that run in the $200 range, so I expected to be disappointed by the sound of these. I was pleasantly surprised though. These sound just fine. They don't have the same range as my more expensive earbuds, but I'll settle for a slight drop in quality in exchange for the incredible convenience of these Bluetooth buds.Just to be conservative I plugged these in to charge every time I used them very long in one day. Since I realized I had no idea how long the charge actually lasted, I decided to stop charging them and drain them all the way. I've been using them for at least a couple of hours a day for a few days. Today the charge died and I had to plug them in. I realized though that I forgot to make a note of when I stopped charging them or how many actual hours I was using them for. So my very unscientific answer is: hmmm, seems like it was at least 4-5 days at 2-3 hours per day. Sorry that's not very helpful. The reality is that the charge lasted quite a while--longer than I'd expect for something so small.I have a couple of people with birthdays coming up and I'm seriously considering giving sets of these as gifts, because they are very practical and they seem a lot more extravagant than they actually are.I was provided this item for review.____________________________EDIT:  11/4/13Mine just died.  I've used and abused these earbuds and I guess they just couldn't take it anymore.  I've used these for hours a day since I got them almost six months ago.  The power button was always a little difficult to turn on, and it got more difficult over time.  Now they just won't turn on at all.  I've tried and tried, but they just won't power on.  That's a shame, because these have been such great earbuds and I've come to rely on them.  Oh well.  They were fantastic while they lasted.
summary: I love these buds

reviewText: I've been using stereo Bluetooth headsets for listening to the music in the gym ever since the first such device came out and the mp3 players started including Bluetooth as an option. In my opinion there is absolutely no other way to unobtrusively listen to the music while you exercise. However, all the headsets that I've used so far have one major problem: they all fail due to the moisture within a very short period of time. So this is one of the main reasons why I was excited to try out the DinoTwin headphones in the first place: their unique charging cable promises to remove one of the main sources of failure for the sports headphones: the charging jack. Only time will tell if this feature is indeed effective at this task, but so far I have been very positively impressed with these headphones.The sound quality of these headphones is one of their main attractions. First of all no wireless headphones of this size will ever be able to deliver the deep, clear sound that you expect form some of the higher end headphones, but these headphones sound richer and more vibrant than almost all the headphones I've tried before. They were on par or better than the Motorola S line of Bluetooth sports headphones, and miles better than the Jabra headphones.These headphones seem to feature passive noise canceling technology. They are pretty good at minimizing the outside sound while in use, and even when they are turned off. Several times I was in a situation where someone tried to talk to me while I was wearing them, and I had to take them off in order to hear what the person had to say.These headphones are probably the most reductionist ones that I've seen. They are just made out of two oversized earbuds and a connecting cord between them. This, IMHO, is the ideal form factor for the sports headphones. The earbuds are pretty large and stay firmly in my ears even during the moderately fast runs. The connecting cord loops around the ears, which gives the headphones extra stability. I've used them while running for several weeks and they stay firmly in the position. They score high on both the form factor and the comfort level.I have not used these headphones much for phone calls. In general I fund Bluetooth headsets to be quite inadequate for voice phone calling. The ones with solid noise cancelling (like these) are actually even worse for the purpose of phone calling - they don't provide the kind of audio feedback from your own voice that we are used to. The mic on these headphones also seemed below average, but then again, I was not going to use them for telephony anyways, so this aspect of the headphones neither bolsters nor diminishes a case for them.Even though these headphones paired easily with my iPhone, they did exhibit some issues. I was not able to turn them off while I was close to another Bluetooth device that my iPhone was paired with. I also found them to have a limited connectivity range, and the battery power, although adequate for two to three workouts, is a bit lower than some of the other headphones that I used in the past.I will be monitoring these headphones for the foreseeable future. If they manage to survive a year of use in the gym, and their battery power does not significantly diminish over that period of time, then they might be the best overall sports Bluetooth headphones that I have come across. However, until then a few issues that I came across mean that I cannot give them more than four stars out of five.
summary: Really Good Sports Headphones

reviewText: I'm still amazed at the degree of miniaturization found in electronic gizmos today. I thought putting a Bluetooth transceiver in an SDHC memory card was amazing enough, but even more remarkable are the DinoTwin Bluetooth wireless headphones, which have built-in Bluetooth, a rechargeable battery, and a microphone. But the Bluetooth isn't just a gimmick - the sound quality of these earphones equals or surpasses any wired earphones that I've used, and the absence of a cable connecting the earphones to the sound source allows a freedom of movement that makes using conventional earphones seem hopelessly old fashioned and way too restrictive.My primary interest was in using the earphones with my tablet for music. They paired very easily with my Nexus 7 (no password required), and they worked perfectly in playing my music playlists. All functions of the earphone controller worked, including volume control, pause/play, and forward/back. The sound quality was as good or better than I've heard with any earphones, and the bass notes were excellent. With some music, there was noticeable distortion at the maximum volume, but this volume was loud enough to hurt my ears. At normal sound levels, there was no noticeable distortion. The maximum range is stated to be 10 meters (33 feet), and that appeared to be accurate, since I roamed all over our house with no dropouts. While walking around, I tried using the built-in microphone with a dictation app on my Nexus 7, and it worked very well. (I was a bit skeptical about the microphone, since it's located on the right earphone instead of on the cord, but it picked up my voice just fine.)The quickstart manual that comes with the earphones is thorough enough, but the photo showing how to connect the earphones to the charging clip doesn't really make it clear how to do this. I referred to the picture on the Amazon product page, which shows the connection clearly.The medium-size earbuds that were installed with the earphones worked for me, but the accessories included a set of small and large earbuds. With the three sizes available, these should fit almost anyone comfortably.I'm impressed with the DinoTwin earphones. They appear to be very solidly made, and the designers have done a marvelous job of putting a lot of technology into such a tiny device.A product sample was provided by the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: A very capable set of headphones with the freedom of Bluetooth

reviewText: These are the first Bluetooth wireless headphones I've owned, and I have mixed feelings.THE GOOD-Sound is good, but not excellent. Bass needs improvement. Some songs sound great; others sound too treble-y.-Lightweight and comfortable. I didn't have the problem another reviewer did about the cord getting caught on clothes or earrings. The cord doesn't get in my way.-Pairing is simple.-I'm not having any trouble with staying connected. I tested this and found I could walk two rooms away from my iPhone and still listen to music. When I got halfway through the second room, it began cutting out.-Noise canceling is good.-Volume is good. I'm not in a loud gym, but I find that it's plenty loud out in the neighborhood.-Very compact and efficient.-The red is easy to spot... if I toss these in my bag, they won't easily get lost.THE BAD-Can NOT get them to stay in my ears. I've tried the small and medium earbuds and the silicone flaps that are meant to keep them in, but they absolutely refuse to fit me unless I sit perfectly still. I have small ears.-I wouldn't bother using these to speak on the phone. The sound from the mic is too quiet and garbled. Listening to voicemails is fine.-Not thrilled about the proprietary charger. It's sort of interesting in the way it clips on and charges, but the "interesting" factor soon gives way to the problem of having just one charger and what happens if it breaks or gets lost? Would have been much better to have it work with a standard USB micro charger, though I understand that would have required the headphones to be a bit bigger.In short, if you don't have tiny ears, and you really just want to listen to music and not talk on the phone, this might be a good pick.
summary: Mixed Feelings

reviewText: I am thrilled with these headphones! They paired perfectly with my Droid phone and I started listening immediately. I was blown away with the quality of sound, comfort of the earbuds and the wireless capability.The sound is really incredible. Probably the best I've heard from small earbuds. There are controls on a very small black rubber inline strip located on the cord. Pause, forward, backward, volume + -, and call answer.The charging system is an incredible feat of engineering and involves a little clip that slides along the cord and clips down on one of the bud heads where two very small contact points are positioned. It takes a couple of hours to charge and there is an indicator light to let you know if they are still charging or all done.A very comfortable silicone cord that is just long enough to connect the earbuds and short enough to not get in the way especially when tucked behind your head.It comes with three sizes of rubber tips and two sets of bud positioning tabs that help to hold them in for more vigorous activity. I haven't quite figured out the positioning of these but the earbuds stay in for me so it's not an issue.I used them while mowing the lawn. They helped to cut out the noise and stayed clear and connected for the most part. They occasionally cut out for a fraction of a second. They stayed put and never fell out. Depending on your sound source, they do cut in and out during general use but it was usually when I was moving around a lot. It gets a little annoying at times but I still love to use them.I love the cord free bluetooth ability. I've had too many cords pull out quickly from my phone while doing activities.Highly recommended!!I was provided a unit for evaluation and an honest review.
summary: Convenient, Great Sound, Easy to Use

reviewText: The idea of a Bluetooth ear bud is a great one. This set charges and pairs, but I had some difficulty. The first thing you do is charge the headphones. The instructions say it takes two hours, but I found I had to leave mine in for eight hours and still the red light showed they were not in full power. I tried this three different days, plugging it in for several hours until the tiny LED light finally showed blue. Then it took me three times to pair it to my iPhone 4S. It simply would not pair. Finally, it did and I was able to place the headphones in my ears. This could have simply been my headset as no other reviews seem to have had this problem.The fit is very comfortable as the ear buds are angled in the perfect manner to fit without falling out. The little black handle on the connecting strand was easy to control simply by touch. They were volume up, volume down and the Multi-function button. It does allow you to: Answer a phone call, end a phone call or reject a call. You can redial the last number with one touch and transfer between your headset and cell and voice dial (which is cool).The sound was very well balanced, but the loudness was medium and I had my phone volume up to the maximum. There are other Bluetooth ear buds/headphones on the market, but of the two I have owned, they both have the same issue - low volume. For the price, I can't say they are a great deal, but if you want low-volume headphones, then you may like these. Headphones generously supplied by manufacturer for an honest review.
summary: Great Invention - Needs Improvement On Sound

reviewText: This is my first set of Bluetooth earphones. I am impressed. Pairing was very easy. I use it with both my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet and also my iPhone 4S. The connection is good, the sound is clear and full. I don't have to recharge it often.Fit is perfect. I don't have trouble with it falling out. There are smaller and larger ear pieces included, in case they don't fit.Control is typical of earphones. There are three buttons that do everything. The basic functions are intuitive, but things like muting the mic, voice dial, etc., require the owner's manual.I don't make many calls with the earphones, anyway. Sound quality is fine on the earphone side, but the caller on the other end is forced to listen to a garbled voice. My son says it's "fuzzy." It doesn't cut in and out like a speakerphone. It's just difficult to make out the words.For music, these earphones beat the wired variety any day. I love being free of wires. I can set my phone down and walk away from it. What a great idea.This product was provided for review by ProA Marketing.
summary: Great for music

reviewText: The DinoTwin is a very decent Bluetooth earbuds.  It doesn't have a brick that houses the battery and Bluetooth receiver where you plug the earphones.  Instead both functions are built-in in the earbuds itself making it a very compact package.  Well, I have a very similar earbuds from Plantronics - the BackBeat Go, so, I will do a little comparison between the two.Both earbuds sounds great which applies to both listening to music and phone calls.  It has bass that you can feel and treble that is crisp. Both earbuds are also very easy to pair.Charging - the Dinotwin has a unique proprietary cable to charge their earbuds.  It has a USB clip that clamps to one of the earbuds. It is cool and impressive but I prefer a regular microUSB cable that I can easily replace if the cable is misplaced.Looks - DinoTwin certainly has its own stylish design.  Red flat cord with integrated controls.  The BackBeat Go is sleek black and has smaller barrels next to the ears.Price - at the time of this review, DinoTwin is more reasonably priced at twenty dollars less.A variety of sizes of silicone buds are included if you want a better fit.Sample item provided by the distributor for evaluation review.
summary: Great sounding stylish earbuds

reviewText: I actually received this item and thought only good things when I first saw it.  Presentation is very nice. I like the box and I like the simple design it has.After charging the battery, the battery pack automatically charged my Samsung Note 2 the second it was plugged in.  I didn't have to hit any buttons or do any special tricks - it was just plug and play.  I started from 74% and charged til it was completely full.  I didn't time how long it took to do the full charge but I did notice it took a full bar down from the battery pack to charge my phone.Charging the battery pack was very simple too. I just plugged it into my current phone charger to charge and it worked fine.  I was able to use my existing home charger's cord which was a good thing because the cord that came with it actually pulled apart LOL.  It wasn't a good impression but it was such a minor thing that it didn't bother me at all.This is a great little charger and I'm so happy to see something this tiny that works so well. I received this for an honest review.
summary: Nice light weight battery pack

reviewText: During a recent snowstorm many in our area lost power for up to four days. Whether you live with snowstorms, ice storms, tornadoes, earthquakes, hurricanes, or just anywhere you might lose power, you DO need a backup source of power.I am grateful that one of my sources of power during this outage with this very nice HIPE which not only was able to charge my phone, but was also able to charge my iPad! In case you aren't aware, the iPad needs the 5V/1A output, so it takes specific types that are able to do it.Amazingly, I was offered a complimentary sample of this to consider for a review shortly before the storm. It charged well, it was there when I needed it, and it did what I needed it to do. I am happy with it, and am grateful to have received it. I keep it charged because you never know when you will need this kind of backup in your life.
summary: iPads and Snowstorms ...

reviewText: If you're like me and use your smartphone to death every day, then bringing along some extra juice for it is almost a necessity. To keep phones small the sleek, the internal battery can only be so large. Well a few hours of talking, someFruit Ninjaand a handful of emails later, and you're getting the pop up warning that your phones about to die. Being tethered to a wall outlet is not usually an option, and that's where this power bank comes in.With this Hipe battery backup, you can bring along enough extra juice that if you need to recharge your phone more than once, you can. It's small enough that you can keep it in a handbag, laptop case, tablet case, briefcase, car glove compartment or just about anywhere else. It's smaller than my iPhone 4s, but can charge it several times with one full battery charge. The cable that comes with it is USB on one end, and micro USB on the other. You charge it by plugging the micro USB end into the port on the battery pack, then the USB end into your computer or a USB wall adapter. Once charged, you can use this pack to charge up any of the devices that have a USB charging cable while you're out.The Hipe battery pack is light weight enough that I can keep it in my purse, that was when I'm out and my phone starts to go dead, I can just plug it in to charge right inside my handbag. No need to leave my iPhone in the car charging from the travel adapter, thus risking someone seeing it an deciding to try and take it, or even just missing phone calls and texts. With this pack, you're taking the power with you, and can charge your devices anywhere.A sample was provided for reviewing purposes.
summary: Affordable way to bring along some extra power

reviewText: This external battery has a lot going for it:- Easy to use.  Plug a USB cable into the battery and the other end into your device.  (no buttons to press)- Charges with a standard USB cable.  Some external batteries require an uncommon cable to charge.  I've discussed this with several manufacturers and their logic is they don't want users to confuse the battery input from the output.  I am willing to accept that "risk" and avoid the problem of a misplaced cable rendering the battery useless.  (I have several like that sitting in a drawer at home.)- It looks snazzy with its sleek, Apple-like appearance and using the four letter logo as a charge indicator.- I've used it to charge a number of USB-chargeable devices including iPhone 3s/4/4s, iPad 3, and Kindle Fire HD.- It is very reasonably priced, given the capacity and features.The single shortfall:- It will not charge a Blackberry Bold with the included cable.I, like so many reviewers before me, received a sample of this product in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Almost perfect for some and absolutely perfect for many

reviewText: You never know when you are going to need a little extra battery power for your iPad/iPhone/Smartphone. Just recently I was at a LONG (+8 hours) and BORING meeting. I passed the time by checking my email, checking the weather, viewing maps, and etc on my iPhone. Unfortunately, after about 5 hours of heavy usage the battery on my iPhone was starting to get weak... but never fear, I pulled out my HIPE EB-5200 and it was like having an additional battery (plus some).The thing I like the best about the Hipe EB-5200? It is certainly the value... you can easily spend 2-3x on a similar type of battery pack. The Hipe EB-5200 does everything you need at a very low price.Notes-- Even though the Hipe EB-5200 has a 1.0mA output it was able to charge my iPad (albeit slowly). In fact, 5200mAh is enough to nearly fully charge an iPad 2.- Works perfectly with my iPhone and more than doubles my battery life.- No device charging cables are included.- The Hipe EB-5200 is charged from a USB power source. Although I did have a bit of an issue with the charging plug pulling away from the cable. Not too big of a deal and it can be fixed with a little glue.- It does have an indicator showing you how much charge that remains in the battery pack.- Small and lightweight... just a little bit larger than a couple of pencil sharpeners. It is both small and light enough to easily fit into  backpack, purse, or pocket.Final Verdict - The Hipe EB-5200 is a very inexpensive way to have a back-up battery pack. While I did have a small quality issue (again nothing major) I would still highly recommend it for anyone who is looking for a small, effective, and inexpensive battery back-up.4 1/2 StarsPlease Note - I received this product for reviewing purposes
summary: A Video Review of the HIPE EB-5200

reviewText: The HIPE 5200mAh battery is good looking, compact, and works well.In the crowded world of lithium ion external batteries it is the small features that make a huge difference. Just about everybody puts the same battery inside these devices since there are a limited number of manufacturers of the batteries. Once a capacity is decided on, the critical choices are the charging port, case design, bonus features, output ports, and ability to charge an iPad (or the 2Amp rate).To decide on capacity, the most common units are around 5000mAh - that will fully charge an iPhone a little over two times and an iPad realistically 40%. This size tends to be the least expensive and a lot of good value for the buck.This particular unit won my heart over with the design. I like the rectangular shape with the nicely rounded corners. It is handsome in a simple elegant manner. The white smooth plastic case feels rich and doesn't show finger prints.It also wins over so many other vendors that use a small circular charging jack. I like the micro USB charging port over the jack, but I really would prefer the sturdier more common mini USB port. Either way, the battery uses a standard cable that is easy to come by.The front panel is simple and effective. Micro USB charging port on top, a standard USB jack on the bottom, and HIPE with blue lights behind it to indicate the state of charge to four levels. There is a white power button in the middle that is used only to display the battery state of charge. When a USB cable is plugged into the unit, the unit automatically turns on and displays the battery charge. There is no need to press the button to begin charging a device.There are no bonus features on this unit, no LED light or flashlight, and no second USB port. The blue HIPE lights are pretty bright; they make a decent night light while a device is charging.The box includes the battery and a micro USB cable. There is no USB AC adapter. You will have to either supply one (the iPhone AC adapter works perfectly) or charge the battery with a computer. The battery charges reasonably fast. Oddly, I like the box a lot. The cardboard is heavy and thick, and the whole thing looks elegant. For an inexpensive battery, this is all nicely done.I was able to charge my iPhone 4s at least twice on a full battery charge. In a pinch, I was able to charge my first generation iPad, and got about an extra 30% power into that beast. The great news, the battery is not limited to 1Amp output - so the iPad charges at the higher 2Amp rate, I like that.I've tested a lot of these batteries lately. This is the most elegant of the bunch and the one I will most likely take in my laptop bag. Another vendor has a battery that has a built in flashlight and still another with a larger capacity battery with two output ports (that is my favorite for travel).Hipe has built a useable nice battery.I was provided a review sample.
summary: Handsome

reviewText: A couple of years ago my children got together and gave me an 64 Gig iPad for Christmas and I must say, it is probably the single best present I've ever received.  Where I go the iPad goes.  My pictures, my accounts, my datebook, contacts, all of my music, a dozen films, miscellaneous shorter videos, all of my knitting and crochet patterns, my 3000+ recipe database, my family cookbook and about 10,000 other books all live on the iPad and go with me wherever I go.  In fact, I sometimes think that iPad should be grafted to my arm.A single charge on an iPad is good for 10 hours of use, no matter what you happen to be using it for.  Around the house that is just fine, but when my iPad comes on a road trip or hops the pond to the UK then a recharge is often in order.  Sadly, the usual car chargers are very slow (and I have to compete with recharging the phones!) and airplanes have no electrical outlets. Enter theHIPE EB-5200 5200mAh (5V/1A output) Portable Power Bank External Backup Battery and Charger, which arrived on my doorstep from the manufacturer about 10 days ago.I've had the opportunity to use the unit a number of times.  It takes just over 3 hours to charge theHIPE EB-5200 5200mAh (5V/1A output) Portable Power Bank External Backup Battery and Chargervia the USB port on my iMac (required cord included.)I've charged the iPad with the unit several times.  The first time I happened to be in the middle of something, so continued to use the iPad for about 3 hours directly off the charging unit, after which I fell asleep.  (I often fall asleep with the iPad beside me.)  When I woke up I found the HIPE empty and the iPad with a 47% charge.Most recently I recharged the iPad and deliberately did not turn it on during the process.  Recharging from a 5% red line warning took just over 3 hours (about the same amount of time as it took to charge the HIPE in the first place) and delivered a 73% charge, enough to extend the usage hours from 10 to 18.  The unit is small enough to fit in my purse.I'm off to Boston on Thursday (8 hours in the car plus waiting at the airport) to fetch my grandchild from the airport and am heading back to the UK soon myself, so I'll be giving the HIPE a workout.Grandma's $0.02 - TheHIPE EB-5200 5200mAh (5V/1A output) Portable Power Bank External Backup Battery and Chargeris a great way to take extra charging power along.  Highly recommended.
summary: Have HIPE, Will Travel!

reviewText: Many folks who are on the go with a smartphone or tablet - especially those devices with an always-on 3G/4G connection - will at some point drain the battery and need a portable recharger. These range from about 5,000 mAh to 12,000 mAh. The tradeoff with the higher-capacity units is size, weight, and price. The Hipe EB-5200 battery pack is one of the lightest (4.7 ounces) and most compact (3.5"x1.6"x0.9") units that I've seen. The solid white, rounded case looks good and is easier than most portable rechargers to carry around.The user guide indicated that the battery pack should be recharged with a DC 5V 1A maximum input. I have several AC chargers laying around, and I used a charger for an old e-ink Kindle reader (DC 5V 0.85A), which worked fine.I used the Hipe unit to recharge a Samsung smartphone and a Kindle Fire HD 7". I did not attempt to quantitatively measure the recharging time, but with the Samsung smartphone, the phone was charging at about 0.5% per minute for the period I observed, and the phone can be used while it's charging. My smartphone's battery has an 1800mAh capacity, and the Kindle Fire's battery has 4400mAh capacity. Theoretically, the Hipe EB-5200 should have the capacity to completely recharge the smartphone two times, and about one time for the Kindle Fire HD's battery. Those numbers should be typical for most smartphones and 7" tablets.Overall, I was very impressed with the HIPE EB-5200 portable battery. The build quality appears to be very solid. With its light weight, compact size, and low price, the unit should appeal to many users of mobile devices who need a battery boost by the end of the day.Note that no AC wall charger or car charger is included. The Hipe recharger does include a 7" USB/Micro USB cable that can be used for recharging both the EB-5200 (from a wall charger or car charger) and a portable device (from the EB-5200). If you have a mobile device that does not have a Micro-USB charging port (such as an Apple iOS device), you'll need to use your own cable.I received a product sample from the manufacturer for evaluation and review.
summary: A lightweight, compact unit that's ideal for small mobile devices

reviewText: Keeping powered on the go is one of the hardest things for the gadget obsessed.  Imagine being out on-the-town with friends when you reach for your cellphone and find it completely dead.  TheHIPE EB-5200 5200mAh Portable Power Bankwill keep you powered longer, and help you avoid situations like that.The first thing you'll notice about the HIPE power bank is the size; it balances the right size with a good amount of power.  This is the perfect size for tossing in a day bag or purse, or keeping in your pocket for unexpected needs.  The unit's design is very simple with an on/off button, an in-port (Micro-B) for charging the unit and an out-port (USB) for charging your devices.  What's great is that it can be recharged with a Micro-B USB cable which a lot of tablets and phones use today.  This is perfect for taking on trips where you don't want to bring a specialty charging cable along just to recharge the power bank.  Included in the box is a one (1) foot USB to Micro-B cable used for recharging the unit.  It can be recharged either via computer or with a wall USB charger like the one included with your Smartphone or tablet.One feature found on this unit, which is not common to find on most power banks, is that the charging port is automatic.  This allows the unit to turn on, beginning a charge the moment you plug any device into it, and it will auto-shut off when you unplug your device.  It's an amazing feature that saves you time in both turning the unit on and off.  The unit also features an LED display that indicates the charge level by how many letters of the product name "HIPE" are illuminated.This power bank is great for use with small devices.  This can provide up to two full charges for many mobile phones, and will provide a good amount of charge for most tablets.TheHIPE EB-5200 5200mAh Portable Power Bankis priced right and it is very compact for the amount of charge it can provide.  The portable power bank is great for anyone who has any device with a battery that can charge via USB.Disclosure: I received a sample product from the manufacturer for the purposes of providing this review. A review in exchange for the review sample was not promised. The views and opinions expressed in this review are my own, and in no way represent the views or opinions of the manufacturer or vendor.
summary: Great Option Considering Capacity, Price, and Size...

reviewText: Finally, a small powerful battery that you can take anywhere and receive a powerful charge.  The HIPE took a little over an hour to fully charge - it has `hipe' spelled out with four blue LED lights to show the extent of the charge (25%, 50%, 75% and 100%). The push button on the side shows you how much energy is left.  It truly only measures 1" X 1.5" X 3".  It also comes with proprietary mini USB plug and a standard USB plug on a 12" long cord.  It's a Lithium-Ion battery that seems like it will last a very long time.  The charging slot is 1A USB which is fairly standard and can really charge any device that has a standard USB.I could fully charge my iPhone 4S in about 1.5 hours and my iPad mini in 4.5 hours.  Not many batteries like this can charge an iPad mini.  There are many other tablets and phones listed on the specification page that are compatible (Samsung, iPhones, etc.).  You need to hang onto you regular 30-pin iPhone connector with the standard USB plug.This battery will give you a few charges on your iPhone.  I still have not seen how many charges my iPad mini will get, but I would be happy with just the one.  There was still about 25% juice left after that charge.  Also, compare the prices and you'll see what a great deal this battery is not only in price, but in size and compatibility.  It's a keeper.  This unit was generously supplied to me from the manufacturer for an honest review.
summary: Small, Powerful & Compact!

reviewText: The Hipe EB-5200 battery pack is a great looking battery pack with a single focus: to give you 5200mAh of juice to charge or extend the life of your USB chargeable devices. The output is 5V/1A. It has a high enough output to provide power for a tablet although not enough capacity to fully charge a tablet such as an iPad. But it will charge an iPhone. and phones with similar battery capacity, approxmately 2 times.The enclosure is glossy white and attractive in its simplicity. On one end is a micro-USB charging port and the USB 5v/1A output port. A 13" USB to micro-USB cable is provided, suitable for either charging the battery pack or for use as a cable to attach to a device using micro-USB for charging the device. The cable that came with my battery pack was of poor quality and the cover detached from the cable end when I was removing the cable from the battery pack.A LED under the HIPE logo on the same end as the ports gives you an indication of the state of charge of the battery pack. Depending on how many LED"s are lit, indicates charge:4 lights = 75-100% charge.3 lights = 50-75% charge2 lights = 25-50% charge1 light - 0-25% charge.A momentary press of the small white button beneath the LED logo turns the display on long enough just so you can determine the charged state of the battery. The button serves no other function.The feature I really like about this battery pack is the fact that it is auto-sensing. You do not have to turn it on to charge a device or remember to turn it off once a device has been charged and the cable disconnected from the battery pack. The unit is auto-sensing. As soon as you plug a cable into the battery packs' USB output port, it turns on and is ready to charge your device.When charging is complete and you remove the cable from the battery pack, the battery pack powers down automatically. However, if you leave a cable plugged in, the battery pack will not automatically power off. In this case the battery pack will be in a state of slow discharge. The takeaway here is to always remember to disconnect the output cable when you are done using the battery pack.When the battery pack is charging, the HIPE logo LED will blink.You are able to charge a device at the same time the battery pack is being charged.This is a well-designed, compact and good performing battery pack. The 5200 mAh capacity is a nice size as it remains relatively compact in size yet provides a good deal of power.If I had not received a defective cable this would earn 5-stars. But since I did have a defective cable, my rating is 4.5 stars.I was provided a sample for review.
summary: A minimalistic battery pack with auto-sensing circuit

reviewerName: Nathan Andersen "Gadget lover and author of S...
reviewText: This is a compact and convenient little USB charger, that powers smartphones and other devices through a USB cable.It looks good, feels like it's the same kind of white casing that Apple used to use for some of it's laptops. So it doesn't feel out of place hooked up to an Apple tablet or smartphone - or any kind of smartphone for that matter. It's small, and lightweight, so it would fit easily in a purse or pocket.It tells you how much charge is left. When you turn it on, the letters to the "hipe" logo light up led-blue. One letter means 25% power remaining, two means 50%, all four means it's fully charged.It delivers 5V, which is pretty standard for USB cables, and 1 Amp, which is just right for my iPhone, and will power my iPad (even though it would be slow to charge it up). I also tried it with my Drift Ghost action camera and it supplies power, but won't charge it.It's got a 5200 mAh capacity - compare that to the roughly 1400 mAh capacity on the iPhone, and that means you can charge it up over three times or power it up for over three times what the regular battery will do. Not bad, eh?Well-built, compact, nice-looking and convenient. I guess I'm saying: believe the hype about the hipe...? Anyhow it works great for me.Note: I was provided this unit from the manufacturer for the purpose of testing and review.
summary: A compact and convenient charger - that works great for delivering power to tablets and for charging and powering smartphones

reviewText: The Hipe is a 5200mAh backup battery for just about any device that needs to be recharged. In most cases you will need to have your OEM charge cable with you, unless your device can be charged via Micro USB. This means the iPhone and other iDevices will require you to still carry around your charge cable (not the adapter if applicable, just the cable).Recharge time on the battery is about 6 hours total. The included manual recommends you recharge the battery completely before trying to use it for the first time. I assume this is because of the fear of battery "memory." I recharged the battery per their instructions (out of the box it was about 60-90 minutes). Once it is depleted, then the charge time is about 6 hours as mentioned above.The battery is bang on simple to use. When you want to charge, just plug the microusb end into the battery's "input" connector then connect the standard USB end into any wall adapter you might have. You can also recharge via a USB port on a PC, though if you are using your laptop on battery power, realize you will be draining your battery further when charging the EB-5200 this way. It's also faster to charge with a 2 Amp charge over a 1 Amp, and this is also the case when charging via USB on a PC.When you want to recharge your phone or other device, simply plug the device's USB charge cable into the Output port on the battery. Once it is connected, press the Power button on the battery and the device should begin to charge. While your device is charging, the word "hipe" is illuminated. As the different letters in the word go out, this indicates the power level of the EB-5200. When none of the lights are illuminated when you press the power button on the battery, it means the battery is drained.At the full capacity of 5200mAh, you should be able to get at least 2 complete recharges of an iPhone with this device.The external battery, for a battery, is pretty light. It's designed small enough to fit in your pocket so in theory, if you keep the phone in your pocket as well, you could charge the phone while both are in your pocket. If you have a hip holster and a long enough charge cable, you could leave the battery in your front pocket and connect the power cable to the phone on your hip.I have another backup battery I've used and I must say, it is nowhere near as nice as the Hipe. It also is a lot more finicky about recharging my phone, unlike the Hipe.Recommended.I received this device for free from the manufacturer, in exchange for a fair and honest review.
summary: Excellen

reviewText: Very simple to use, the Hipe CS-5200 portable power bank can charge any device that utilizes a USB power cord, and takes the standard 5 volt DC input.  About the size of a large pack of gum, the power bank is basically a rechargeable Li-ion battery unit, with a mini USB input jack for charging the battery, and a standard USB output jack for charging devices.  Capacity is 5200 mAh/3.7 volts.At one end, in between the USB ports is a small white "test" button, with the "hipe" logo above it.  When pushed, a blue LED behind the "hipe" logo lights up, indicating how much power available in the power bank.  Each of the letters in the word "hype" has a separate LED.  If all four letters come on, the unit is near full power, three indicates approximately 75%, two just 50%, and one 25% or less.  The blue indicator lights also come on, whenever a USB cord is inserted into either of the USB ports.  If none of the lights come on, the battery is either depleted, or dead.To charge the unit, you simply plug power into the mini USB input jack.  When all four letters in the "hipe" logo glow blue, the bank is fully charged.  A short mini USB/USB cord is included for charging.  It's convenient for a laptop, but might be too short for some other situations.To charge a device using the power bank, you just plug a USB cord into the output jack.  When the "hipe" logo lights up, is indicates that the power bank has juice, it is not an indication that your device is fully charged.  You will need to check the device itself to make that determination.Some other battery banks have accessories like USB cords with interchangeable attachment heads.  Made in China, the Hipe 5200 is pretty bare bones.  Its main virtues are its relatively low price, and its small size and rectangular shape, which makes it convenient to carry.  It provides good value for the price, seems to have a decent amount of charging capacity, and could be quite useful when you are on the go, or on a trip, providing you remember to bring all the required cords.
summary: compact, no frills, portable power bank...

reviewText: Aleratec headphones fit my ears very comfortably and stay in very well. The earbuds are quite small, have a low profile and do not stick out of the ear. The package includes several ear gels to fit people with different size ear canals. In the attached video I put them next to a ruler for size reference.I tested these earphones with iPad Mini, Galaxy 7.7 tablet and Sansa Clip+ MP3 player. All three worked well, and the quality of the sound was good. To test the bass handling of any speaker or headphones I use Bach's Toccata and Fugue in D minor. Some headphone break up and crackle playing the deep bass in this music, however these ear buds handle this piece of music well. They produced good sound with out distortion. Both bass and mid tones sounded good.The cable length is 47 inches, 13" before the split. The cable is flat and does not tangle. The headphones are light and weigh only 0.5 oz on my digital scale. The package includes a carrying pouch.The cord has an in-line button that allows you to switch between music and incoming phone calls. The same in line control has a tiny microphone. I would have liked to see a volume control and pause/resume button on that control, but unfortunately that functionality is not available.I received these ear-buds from Aleratec with a request for an honest review, be it positive or negative. I liked these ear-buds, especially the fit. The sound and comfort is better than some of my more expensive ear-buds.Ali Julia review
summary: Comfortable fit, good sound

reviewText: Look out Monster, Beats and all those other high dollar headphones because Aleratec has come out with a pair of headphones that offers everything yours do at an affordable price with maybe even better quality in sound!I am truly amazed in the quality and sound in these headphones. They have the flat tangle-free cord, comfortable ear gels that come in 3 different sizes and a nice velvet carrying pouch.The sound is incredible...if you don't believe look at all the other reviews. The sound is surreal and rich sounding with a deep bass you can feel in your tummy. The microphone and control for telephone calls are easy to use and work perfectly. Mic picks up your voice clearly and the music goes back on playing when the call ends. These headphones are a 5+ star rating all day long.Comes with 90-day free phone tech support and one-year warranty.Sample provided for review.
summary: Style and Sound at Affordable Price

reviewText: These are packaged well enough that they make a great gift--they come in a velvet pouch, and a nice box.But lets cut to the chase of how they perform in the event these are going nowhere--they work.First, for music the sound is crisp and clean and clear with true ability to pick out tones that might not appear as clear in lesser models.But what's great is that you can be listening to music on your smart phone and when a call comes in--boom, you switch right to microphone.That won't work well anyway if the earbuds don't have a perfect fit and these ensure that they do, with a variety of sizes enabling you to switch out the buds until you find YOUR perfect earpiece.I find that the right angle of the earphone helps these stay more comfortably in place than some, comforting well to the fit of one's ear.The tangle-free cord is great as well--hands free calls, great tunes, good bass clarity, great fit, and great components in all regards.Product provided by Aleratec, review is my own honest and unbiased opinion.
summary: Great for work: hear your tunes but then you are able to switch to calls

reviewText: These Aleratec TunePhonik iMX5 In-Ear Headphones are exceptionally good (not a comment I often make) and are a very good value at the selling price!While far from an audiophile, I do enjoy classical music, '80s rock, and audiobooks, all of which these handle very well. These come nicely packaged and look like they should be much more expensive than they are. The physical construction of the earphones is quite good as well and they are excellent at blocking external noise. These also have a built-in microphone and work well on both ends when using them with my iPhone 5.These are so good that my son now uses them to listen to whatever teenagers listen to today.Highly recommended!CFHNote: Sample provided to review
summary: Exceptionally Good - Highly recommended

reviewText: I sensed this was an extraordinary product when I opened the box. It was like opening the box for good headphones. The flat red cable immediately signaled that these were earbuds unlike any other.The earbuds are a light plastic type of material that bends extremely easily. They're not stiff in the least, and this creates comfort when wearing them. I could wear these all day without developing physical fatigue, I believe. There are 3 replacement tips of varying sizes. All of them bend easily and thus I'm guessing they'd all work for the average person.The sound is definitely the best of any earbuds I've used. I think all the connectors are high quality and produce the difference. This is a rich, full sound. I tested the switch that allows me to answer the phone and it seemed seamless and with good sound quality again.In my opinion, this set of earbuds with the replacement tips is a great value proposition. I think a lot of people will be happy with them. I received a sample and this is my honest opinion.
summary: quality materials and sound

reviewText: I got these earbuds hoping to replace an aging set of $100  Sony earbuds.  I used them once and was really quite astounded with how well they sound, how nice they look, and how well they fit.  Then my girlfriend tried them and now I can't get them back!  She came in the house yesterday wearing them and when I said, "Nice earbuds" with intended sarcasm, she gleefully responded, "These are the best earbuds I've ever had.  I LOVE these earbuds!"  Then she smiled, put them back in her ears, and danced away.  Sarcasm = Fail, Earbuds = Gone Forever.They really are amazingly good quality for the price, and they look really nicely made as well.  They are every bit as good as my old Sony's. Looking at them and listening to them you'd never guess that they were so affordable.  I suppose it's a really good thing that they are so inexpensive, because it looks as though I'm going to have to get a second pair if I ever plan on being able to use them!
summary: If only I could use them...

reviewText: .Compared to myJBuds J3M's (which sell for $15 on a good day), these ear buds are a few ways nicer, and I find nothing to complain about.I'm not a sound geek, but I listened to the same tunes many times over with each set. They both sound great, with noticeably fuller bass on the Aleratec.Maybe these are 5-star ear buds. I'm just not sure enough to say that.The neon red ribbon cable is rubbery and bright. It looks like somebody's having fun, and when you seem to be talking to yourself in public, people can quickly do the ear-bud math. They're always a little rumpled or random looking, though, and they're not "tangle-free." Maybe tangle-resistant.A microphone and control button are totally worth the extra $5 or whatever. Better phone-call experience on both ends. Less hassle when your music or podcast is interrupted.- - - Advantage Aleratec - - -* Bass is stronger- Right angle jack- Button is easier to feel out- - - Middle Ground - - -- Vibrant red. Love it or hate it.- Tangle resistant cord: Aleratec might be a little better- Cord noise while exercising: Aleratec might be a little better- Aleratec comes beautifully packaged- - - Advantage JBuds J3M - - -- Choice of colors- 4 ear cup sizes provided (Aleratec provides 4 pair of ear cups in 3 sizes)- - - Warranty - - -Both have a 1 year warranty, but Aleratec provides nothing written on the box or enclosures. Or even in the amazon listing, last I looked.- - - Pricing - - -There's an "Online Price Alert" that will email you whenever this or any amazon product dips below your target price. Google it. Or try camelcamelcamel, which also shows price history.- - - Disclosure - - -The manufacturer gave me this item for review. I believe my review is impartial.~~~ Comments & questions welcome ~~~
summary: Compared to JBuds J3M: More Bass, Hot Look

reviewText: These headphones do a wonderful job for playing music and also for using to talk on the phone. While on the phone I noticed that these are loud and clear and this set is much better than the stock headset that I received with my phone because I found it louder than my other set.My music sounds good and I love the fact that the wire on this is flat and does not kink.Very high quality headset. And I highly recommend it.
summary: Very nice sound quality and the wires do not kink!

reviewText: I was really looking forward to these headphones. My old iPhone headphones were getting a bit worn out, and they were never really good headphones for gym use to begin with. The Aleratec headphones looked pretty hip and sporty, and seemed like the kind of headphones that I would enjoy using while working out. In that regard I have not been disappointed. The long, sturdy and rubberized tangle-free cables are capable of withstanding all the use and abuse of the gym workout. I can just stuff them into the pocket of my gym sweatshirt and be reassured that I would not have to waste any time untangling them when I’m ready to start my workout. The headphone gels fit securely and comfortably inside my ears. The extra long cable is great for the times when I am running on the treadmill and place my iPhone on the treadmill’s console.One of the most impressive things about these headphones is the sound quality. I usually don’t expect much from in-ear headphones, especially at this price range. However, I was pleasantly surprised by the richness and vibrancy of sound coming from these small headphones. I listened to various music genera on iTunes radio – classical, pop, electronic, etc., and these headphones were able to handle all of them quite well, to the point that I forget that I am wearing the headphones and just lose myself in music.There are a couple of things about these headphones that I didn’t quite like. I do miss the ability to control the volume and skip tracks directly on the headphones cable. Furthermore, when I used these headphones to make phone calls, people at the other end of the line were not able to hear me very clearly, although I was more than satisfied with the sound quality. This means I will probably go back to my iPhone headphones when it comes to placing phone calls.Overall, however, I am really happy with these headphones. I will continue to use them daily, which I think is the highest form of endorsement that I can come up with.
summary: Compact, Comfortable, Great Sound

reviewText: It doesn't seem logical that an inexpensive set of earbuds ("in-ear headphones" if you prefer) would be as durable and have the sound quality of a much more expensive set, but that's been my experience with the Aleratec TunePhonik iMX5 earbuds. To my ear, the audio quality was excellent, with some of the better bass sounds that I've heard from a pair of in-ear headphones. The earbuds fit comfortably and were effective in keeping out all but the loudest ambient noise. The ear gels that came on the set were comfortable for my ears, but there were three other sets of varying sizes, so almost anyone should be able to find a good fit.Obviously, hard-wired earbuds like these don't give the freedom of movement that Bluetooth earbuds have, but I still occasionally use an MP3 player and an ancient radio that don't have Bluetooth (and with hard-wired, there's no internal battery to die). And the thin, limp cable seems to be less prone to tangling than round wires are. There's a small drawstring bag for holding the headphones when you're not using them.For whatever use you have for them, if you're looking for an inexpensive set of quality earbuds, the Aleratec TunePhonik iMX5 In-Ear Headphones are definitely worth a look.A product sample was provided by the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: To my ear, they're as good as more expensive brands

reviewText: This headset is very nicely packaged which makes it a great idea for a present. It comes with a carry bag and extra silicone buds to adapt to most ear sizes. The should is very nice and crisp. Good highs and lows as well as bass. You can also use it to answer phone calls but I haven't tried that part yet.There is one part of them that seems a little out of place. The angled plastic at the earbud top is made of a hard, super shiny plastic, not the usual material that I see headphones made out of. Initially, I thought it made it look cheap but some may find it stylish. It certainly did not detract from the great sound quality.A nice set in a good price range.I was provided a unit for evaluation and an honest review.
summary: Great Sound, Stylish, Comfortable

reviewText: I am just amazed at the sound of this `stereo headset' (not `ear buds').  This is based on the sound from my iPhone 4S.  Most equivalent sets give a good high and midrange, but stink with bass. The `Aleratec' manages to really give a solid bass boost and a bass drum feel that is perfectly synced and balanced with the mid and high range tones.  The drivers really must be high premium.  The acoustic sound and precise bass will make you toss out any other set of ear buds.  Only a good headset around your ears can produce a better sound.Unlike other ear buds, the 3.5mm jack is set at a right angle to prevent accidental pull-outs.  The bright red cord is flat, not round, so you won't get all tangled up like with typical ear buds; i.e., iPhone ear buds.  This is a nice design correction.The in-line microphone is an easy click to switch to phone calls and switching between music and calls is easy and feels intuitive.  When a phone call comes in, the sound of voices sound normal; not too tinny or bassy. The `noises isolation' actually works very well with the exclusionary action of outside noises.You know those Apple ear buds that always fall out of your ear?  These fits in your ears perfectly without fear of falling out while running or biking.  The simply design just works - these inventors know their stuff.The nicely packaged box (this is a great gift for birthdays, holidays or, um, new dates) also comes with extra ear plugs Gels (S, M, L) and a nice black felt bag for all.  Compare the price to other headsets or ear bud packages and you'll find that the quality and value is perfect.  This company knows how to market the right product with the right price.  Bottom line is the sound is just really perfectly real and perfectly balanced.Product supplied for a fair and honest review and this one was very easy.
summary: Highest Quality & Value I Have Ever Found!

reviewText: The Aleratek TunePhonik iMx5 stereo headset is a great sounding headset with very good sound isolation. It has a flat cable that is 3.9' long with gold plated, 3.5mm tip and inline control/microphone. The control lets you play and pause music, answer calls from your smartphone and to initiate calls.Included are 3 extra sets of gel tips (S, M & L) in addition to the Medium tips that are already on the headset and a small carrying pouch with drawstring.These sound great for headsets at this price level. The frequency response is 20Hz-20kHz. I found the sound to be very good to my ears and have some other more expensive headsets that these compare quite favorably with.The inline microphone is not terrific but will allow you to answer or place a call. I found the sound to be a little muffled but it was certainly decent enough.The flat cable is virtually tangle-free which I really appreciate. However I do notice rubbing noise being transmitted into my ears when I'm walking or running with these. One easy way to reduce that is to get a cable clip and attach it to your clothing right where the cable splits. This keeps the rubbing to a minimum thus less sound transmitted into your ears from the rubbing.Sound quality was great with these. Judging sound is a very personal thing but my ears were very happy with the clarity and balanced sound these produced. They were comfortable in my ears and they do not protrude very much. The gel tips are secure and have never accidentally fallen off the body of the headset. I felt that these do a pretty good job of passive noise reduction.I'd say these are a great value.
summary: Nice sounding and comfortable headset with great sound isolation

reviewText: I received a review sample and put these through their paces. I want to disclose that I enlisted the aid of a friend to test these because she loves ear bud style headphones and is a demanding consumer.Both of us tested the sound quality and we were both impressed. For me the albumKind Of Blueis the acid test because of the number of instruments and the dynamics and subtleties of the music. After I connected these to the 3.5mm jack on my Galaxy Note II I was treated to spectacular sound quality. While these are not noise-canceling phones the ambient noises in my car were completely attenuated.  My friend tried these out with her iPhone 4S and could not only clearly hear folks to whom she was calling, but they confirmed that she was coming in crystal clear on their end. That confirms that the microphone is of the same excellent quality as the phones.I found these to be extremely comfortable, which is saying a lot because I am not an ear-bud person. In fact I fell in love with them, but gave them to my friend as a token of my appreciation for her help in evaluating them.Construction is impressive. The 3.5mm is gold plated and the cable is heavy-duty with strain reliefs. Even the in-line mic switch is sturdy.There are some wonderful touches in the packaging and included components starting with one of each size of ear gels (small, medium and large). The phones also come with a nice carrying pouch that is not only attractive, but also functional.Overall these are premium quality earphones that will please even the most finicky audiophiles. They are a perfect solution for folks who use their phones as an MP3 player because you can immediately switch into answer or call more with a flick of a switch.
summary: Comfortable with exceptional sound quality

reviewText: I've received a number of consumer grade headphones to review, from low-end to high-end, but this was the most surprising.  At a value price, I expect headphones that, while potentially worth the cost, are better for something like jogging or yard work than actually listening to music for the pleasure of it.  The iMX5, while not comparable to high-end headphones, are shockingly good and very worth considering for audio ranging from classical to podcasts.  This comes from their ability to reproduce a wide range of frequencies, coupled with a good earbud design that allows the speaker to sit properly and isolate outside noise.  There is enough bass for thumpy pop music, but loftier instruments and voices are not lost.  There is a depth to the sound that is not common in cheaper headphones.  Overall, a joy to listen to.The design is also above the standard for the price.  The flat cord makes it easy to store without tangles, and it is light and comfortable to wear for long periods.  If you are looking for headphones in this price range, Aleratec has created a compelling product.
summary: Good Sound, Excellent Value

reviewText: The first thing I noticed when I put on the Tunephonic earphones is how well it blocks out sounds. Not that I can't hear any ambient noise, but my husband can have the TV or the radio on and I am oblivious in my own little world.It's really a simple device. It plugs into the audio port - you will be wired. There are no controls for anything other than pause or play. No making phone calls, no skipping forward, no Siri.But what it does, it does well. I like the fit. It's comfortable and doesn't fall out. It comes with four sets of ear buds of various sizes and a velvet pouch. The music sounds great to this average user. I'm no audiophile, but I like it.This product was provided for review by Aleratec.
summary: What It Does, It Does Well

reviewText: I didn't expect anything when I opened the box as I have never heard of Aleratec. But wow! Not a lot of earphones surprises me greatly at this price range. The iMx5 rivals the audio quality of well known brands that sells for 99$ and up. The sound is clean and the bass is thunderous. It is very pleasing to listen to even it hasn't been broken in yet when I first put it in my ears. I flipped to all kinds of music from heavy metal, easy listening to classical symphonies - it just sound gorgeous.You get multiple earbuds to choose from whichever fits best in your ears. A soft pouch is included to carry the earphones along with your MP3 player. The cord is made of red flat tangle-free wire with in-line microphone and telephone controls. It is gold tipped and angled that it doesn't get easily unplug when it gets accidentally tugged.The packaging for this product is superb; maybe not like Apple but they still did a very good job. The box is sturdy and opens up using a magnetic flap. In short, it would make a very nice gift any time of the yearA sample of this product was sent to me for review purposes.
summary: Quality earphones comparable to more expensive brands

reviewText: The sound with these Alerted TunePhonik iMX5 Earphones is quite surprising given their reasonable price. They sound better than much more expensive in ear headphones that I own. They have the added feature of control buttons to switching between phone calls and music on your smartphone. The microphone is very sensitive and according to callers on the other end, it picks up my sometimes quiet voice even in the car while driving. I had a similar set of earphones that I've used in the car (I only use one while driving.) But I often end up scrunching the cord into the console when I get to my destination and the cord becomes tangled to the point that it takes several minutes to untangle each time I want to use them again. These earphones have a flat, tangle-free cord that never gets tangled even though it's a nice 50 inches long. This makes it really useful in the car. The controls make it easy to switch back and forth between music and phone calls and when the phone rings it cuts to the call. It works well with Siri on my iPhone to make calls.I've also been using these earphones on the treadmill. It has good noise cancelling ability that blocks out most of the sound of the treadmill and the range and crispness of the music is excellent. I've tested it on classical, rock, and easy listening music along with some exercise tracks and it does very well on all of those. The earphones come with three different sized sets gel earners adapters. They are very comfortable to wear while exercising and stay in my ears even when moving around a lot. A velour storage bag with drawstring is included. These earphones would make a nice gift because of the high quality and are attractive packaging. But once you've listened to music with them you may not want to give them away!
summary: Excellent sound and I love the flat cord

reviewText: These are really nice headphones. The sound is perfect. There is no distortion, even with hard hitting bass at full volume. They are rugged and can handle toting around in a back pack with ease. They have a nice oversized pouch, and four different size ear gels to ensure a great fit.  Another feature they have  is a very snug fit and muffle external sound. Also it has a right angle jack which is good because it is low profile allowing for less chance of snagging it on something and it is harder to accidentally pull it out of the jack.The cord is flat and sturdy and the perfect length, a little better than three and half feet.  It has an in-line microphone with a control switch to answer the phone. I have used this feature a lot. The clarity of the phone calls is clear for both sides. A lot of features and a really great product.  By far the best sound quality I have experienced for this price!I received this product for an honest review.
summary: Great Stereo Headset!

reviewText: I got the opportunity to try out a new pair of in-ear headphones that work *very* well at an excellent price point. The Aleratec TunePhonik iMX5 In-Ear Headphones deliver full rich sound, a comfortable wearing experience, all contained in an attractively engineered product. They definitely beat the standard earbuds you get from smartphone and tablet makers.The iMX5 has a soft, comfortable earpiece that comes with three sizes of what they refer to as "ear gels". I found that the Small size works the best for me, having the right mix of comfort, stability in the ear, and noise blocking. The cord is flat instead of the normal rounded cording, and it makes all the difference in the world when it comes to tangle-free use. The built-in microphone on the cord is also high quality, as it picks up and records sounds across the full range of fidelity without turning everything into a tinny-sounding voice.Using them on my iPad, I got the full range of sound. The high range is crisp along with the mid-range, and the bass tones had more vibrancy than I expected. Whether it was music across genres or watching movies and TV episodes, the headphones delivered all the sound I could ask for.The TunePhonik iMX5 either matches or out-performs other more expensive in-ear headphones in every way. It's hard to go wrong at this price, and I'm guessing they'll become your everyday headphones in short order.Disclosure:Obtained From: ManufacturerPayment: Free
summary: Great in-ear headphones at an excellent price...

reviewText: I thought I'd test this out on my Samsung Note 2.  I currently have a car that has USB ports for charging purposes already but I thought I'd give this a go.  So far, it works well.  The 2 amp ports are fairly strong.  For those of you who don't know, 2.0 amp is recommended for heavier duty items like a tablet or an iPad.  Usually when I use the car's charging ports and I do something intense like watch stream Pandora or something with my bluetooth on and GPS - my battery drains more than it charges even if it is charged.This one did no different but it did keep a good flow of charge to maintain or be close to maintain while doing all those intense things.  On the 1 amp port, it wasn't so great but that is expected.  My phone's battery drained still when streaming and having a bluetooth active connection to the car.  Of course, I expected as much.It's a nice quiet charger.  There is no fan or humming noise so I much enjoyed the silence =).  The charger sticks out more than I would like but it makes up for it by having 2 ports to charge simultaneously.  Overall, it's a good charger.  I think for the price you can't go wrong.  I've purchased similar ones in the past that have single port 1.0 amp and they cost as much as this so the value is definitely there.  If I was in the need for it, this is one I would look at.  A total of 3 amp output?!?! I think it's a really good deal.I received this item for a honest review.
summary: Nice quiet and works well

reviewText: I tested Bolse 3.1 Amp Dual USB Car Charger with Nexus 7 Tablet (JellyBean 4.2.2), Samsung Galaxy 7.7 Tablet (ICS 4.0.4), and Samsung Galaxy Nexus cell phone (JellyBean 4.2.2).I own several car chargers and ran the same set on tests on each of them to provide unbiased results as the numbers speak for the performance of the unit.To test Bolse car charger I ran my 10 minute test for each of my 3 devices on each of the 2 ports for a total of 6 tests. I repeated the same tests with a data cable and with a charging cable. The results of these 12 tests are included in the tables below.I am attaching a collage of 4 photos labeled with numbers 1 through 4 under customer photos that I will be referencing in this review. You can locate this photo by following 'customer photos' link under the main photo.Photo #1 shows the charger on a gridded mat next a pen for size reference. The car charger is 3.5" long. The charger's face is 1.25" by 1".Photo #2 and #3 show how the charger fits into our two cars. It has a relatively log neck and fits very well in both car configurations. It goes in firmly, forms a good contact, and stays plugged in well even over rough roads. The charger has two outlets labelled 1.0 AMP and 2.1 AMP.Photo #3 shows one of the tables during the testing. I use Battery App by Elvison to determine how each device recognized the charging source. 'AC' status means the charging is at full charging rate. 'USB' status indicates charging at a lower charging rate. 'Discharging' status means that the charging rate is below the power that the device is consuming so it slows down the discharge rate but does not re-charge.My methodology is to charge each mobile device on each port of the unit for 10 minutes and measuring how much each unit was charge in that 10 minute period.
