Based on this comparison this unit measures up very well.➨ Overall:------------------Great size power bank to have on the go. Very good performance for a unit of such a compact size. When I exercise this is the power bank I take with me.Ali Julia review
summary: Tested with Nexus 7 Tab, Galaxy Nexus Phone, Galaxy 7.7 Tab, iPad Mini and Sansa Clip+ MP3

reviewText: This Yubi Power Bank is just the right size for taking along in my handbag. Portable battery packs like these are so handy when you have a smartphone you use quite a bit throughout the day. Like most people, I use my phone (an iPhone 4s) for so much more than just talking to people. Each day my phone is tasked with everything from checking emails to ordering things online. Should I want to listen to music, use the maps/GPS applications, listen to iHeartRadio or play some application games, my phone's battery drains even faster. But plugging it in to a wall outlet to charge half way through the day is not always an option. That's where a little battery pack like this come in so handy.A bit longer than a tube of lipstick, it actually more resembles long lip-gloss tubes. This means is will easily fit into even the smallest of handbags. It's great when I'm out going places for the day, or meeting with someone, and all I have with me is my purse. I can plug my iPhone into this to charge it, while it sits right inside my bag. This lets me keep my phone with me, and not have to leave it in my car to charge via a car-charger.These small chargers are such a great idea. Bags, briefcases or even just inside your pocket, it will fit anywhere and is a realistic way to take along extra power for your phone, or any other device you can charge via USB. Very handy and invaluable for smartphone users.A sample unit was provided for reviewing purposes.
summary: Handy way to bring along some extra power in your bag

reviewText: I was attracted to this powerbank initially because of the size and pretty color, I admit it. However, it charged up my phone easily and still had power left. My son took it with him to college and it charged up his phone too. The compact size is great for tossing in my purse or backpack or beach bag. This summer we are hitting the beach a lot and this will be perfect to take along on the beach or hiking trails. I don't have to worry about my phone dying and not being able to recharge it until we get back to the hotel, or find electricity if we are camping.Received sample.
summary: Great size

reviewText: Yubi Power supplied me with this product in exchange for my honest feedback.This power bank comes in multiple colors. You can get it in red, blue, black or Silver. Red caught my eye so I choose it. I like the finish, it's a metallic red that sort of glitters to and it has a very smooth feel to it. It's by far the smallest power bank that I have used so far. It has 2500 mAh power certainly isn't going to fully charge my iPad 2 but it will give you several more hours of usage while you are on the road and can't give it a proper charge. It comes with a short USB cord for charging and will fully charge in a few hours. It will charge my iPad 2 about 1/3 of the way. If you have an iPhone or iPod Touch then this battery would give you a much larger percentage of a charge. It has a light on the front that will flash red when you are charging the power bank, blue when you are charging another device from the power bank and green when the power bank is fully charged. As I said before I use this power bank with my iPad 2 but you can charge a wide range of devices with this. Anything that can charge via USB cord can be charged with this power bank. It also comes with a black drawstring carry bag that is soft inside and out. The bag is plenty big enough to fit the power bank and the USB cord for carry or storage.Overall I think this is a very good little power bank. I love the small size of it because you can very easily take it anywhere. It looks attractive and seems to be made well. Don't expect a ton of power but if you are looking for extreme portability and only need a little power for travel or emergencies and such then this power bank may be a wise choice.
summary: Great for travel or emergencies, provides several hours of use on my iPad 2

reviewText: As many people claim, good things come in small packages and this 2500 mAh Yubi USB power bank is one of them.  Yes, I love the larger battery packs, but if I don't have to carry one when a small one will do the trick, why bother?  This compact battery pack also comes with convenient velvet-like pouch that will keep dirt and dust from getting in the ports.I quickly charged it up overnight by connecting it to my PC and I was good to go.  Another thing I liked about this small power bank is that unlike many, its capacity is labeled on one end (paper) and both ports are labeled as well.  Mind you the ports are not easy to confuse, but I do like the fact that they are clearly marked.  A blue LED light on the face indicates a full charge and there is also an on/off button.  Looks good, works good, is good.SPECS:~  Input:  DCRV  800mA~  Output:  Dc5V  1000mA~  Battery:  Li-ion Cell~  Dimensions:  3.70 x .87 x .87 inches (94 x 22 x 22mm)~  Weight:  90gLED indicator:*  Red:  Charging*  Green:  Fully charged*  Blue:  Charging deviceFEATURES:~  Built-in high-tech, high efficiency cells, powerful with long cycle life.~  Intelligent display of LED to indicate the charging status.~  Ideal for most digital devices with Dc5V input, such as iPhone, Smart phone, MP3, etc.Sample provided for review.
summary: Great little power bank for those on-the-go needs ...

reviewText: We have two young daughters.  They have completely taken over all of the portable electronics in our house.  If you are like us, you probably always have something that is low on batteries at all times.  A typical scenario in our house is someone piling the kids in the car to go to the store, or the mall, or out to eat or wherever and grabbing the iPods, only to find them dead.  Noooooooooooooo!  These are the only things that keep us sane!  So that is where a portable charging solution would be great.I was provided a Yubi Power YP250AS 2500mAh Power Bank for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.Initial Impression:  The product looks great.  I received a Silver model and it has a very nice outer metal body with plastic ends.  It looks and feels very solid in your hand.  It has one power button, one LED that lights in three colors, a micro USB input for charging the Power Bank and a normal USB Output for charging your electronics.  It is about the length of two C Batteries but not quite as thick and not very heavy at all.  It is very compact and sleek looking.  It also came with a small 9 inch Micro to Normal USB cable for charging the unit which is nice so you don't have another long cable laying around.  I doesn't have any kind of capacity gauge so you just have to have it charged up when you need it.It came with some charge to it so I plugged it into my computer and charged it until it was full.  The indicator light was red while it was charging and turned green when it was full.  It only took a few hours to top it off for the initial charge.  After it was full I did some testing.Test #1:  I took my old 3rd Gen iPod Touch that had about 15% battery left and started charging it.  The battery in the this older iPod model is smaller than current models so it should charge a little faster.  It is an old battery and isn't as strong as it used to be but it still lasts a while.  I checked it every 10 minutes or so and got the following readings.Starting Point = 15% ChargeAfter 10 Minutes = 55% ChargeAfter 20 Minutes = 85% ChargeAfter 30 Minutes = 90% ChargeAfter 45 Minutes = 100% ChargeLike I mentioned before, the old battery in this iPod isn't that great so the times/percents may not be perfect, but the important thing is it quickly gave the smaller battery on my old iPod a usable charge.  The following tests with an iPhone 5 have much more consistent results.Test #2:  I plugged in the Power Bank into my computer to charge it again and it was fully charged in the morning and ready to go.  Took the fully charged Power Bank and plugged in my mostly depleted iPhone 5 that had only 15% charge remaining.  I got the following readings.Starting Point = 15% ChargeAfter 15 Minutes = 31% ChargeAfter 45 Minutes = 65% ChargeAfter 75 Minutes = 88% ChargeAfter 95 Minutes = Full ChargeOverall, great results.  It was averaging about 1% per minute which seems pretty good for a 1 Amp charger.  The Power Bank had plenty of juice to fully charge a pretty low iPhone 5 without any problem.Test #3:  We took the discharged 3rd Gen iPod Touch and threw it in my Wife's purse with the Power Bank and checked it when we got to our destination where we would need an iPod to keep our daughter occupied.  It had increased the battery level to around 60% in about 20 minutes which gave us enough power to survive the trip.  It charged the iPod touch quickly and the Power Bank gave off very little heat if any in the purse.  I can see this scenario happening several times a week.Test #4:  At work, we are not allowed to plug in any unauthorized/personal electronics into the USB ports of our work computers.  That leaves me with the only option of climbing under the desk with a charger block to charge my phone at work.  Not really the best option.  While I'm at work, my Phone sits on my desk receiving emails and texts and I occasionally use it for web browsing, apps or remote access using LogMeIn.  There is no WiFi available and the LTE really eats up the battery fast.  I decided to plug in my phone to the Power Block while it was sitting on my desk and it successfully kept my Phone fully charged all day.  It was great.  I had a full battery at the end of the day.  It is a great option for charging your phone when you don't have a power plug handy.Conclusion:  Overall, the Yubi Power YP250AS 2500mAh Power Bank worked great during my initial tests and usage.  The product is compact and easy to use.  It looks and feels like a high quality piece of equipment.  The current price of $14 is competitive with the other Power Banks of this size that are available on Amazon, but the Yubi Power product looks like it is built a lot better than its competition.  I can see this as an excellent option for a long plane trip or other travel where you do not have access to a power plug.  My biggest problem is going to be trying to get this thing back from my Wife.  I will probably have to get a second one.  Highly Recommended!
summary: A Lifesaver for Those of Us with Chronically Dead Electronics!

reviewText: First, I got this in red, but it walks a very thin line between metallic red and hot pink. I would have called it hot pink (and awesome). It's shimmery and really pretty. It really is just a bit bigger than a tube of lipstick and can easily be carried in a pocketbook or glove compartment.I charged this with the included micro USB cord, then used it to charge up my iPhone, which was nearly dead. In under an hour, the iPhone was fully charged.The bottom of the power bank tells you the input (5V 0.8A), output (5V 1A), and what the colors mean when the unit is lit up-- red: charging, green: fully charged, blue: charging device.I find this super-handy not only for travel when you won't be near a power cord, but also for my "back seat traveler": my 6-year-old loves to play apps on my iPhone in the car, and the phone often goes dead. I CAN plug it in the cigarette lighter and stretch the cord way back to her seat, but it's inconvenient and she often knocks it out. Now all I have to do is plug it in to this little device instead.Disclaimer: I received this in exchange for an honest review, and I'm pretty darn glad I did.
summary: Sleek and Useful

reviewText: This Yubi Power 2500 mAh power bank is perfect for someone who needs a charger without a lot of bulk. 2500 mAh is enough to charge my iPhone one full charge.It comes with a pouch and a short micro USB cord. I used my own 30-pin charging cord for the iPhone. Any phone that charges with a USB port can be charged with this power bank.The only problem is the power bank does get hot. Most power banks warm up when they charge a device, but this one is uncomfortably so. I wouldn't say burn, but I feel like taking it out of my purse to let it cool off. It seems like many smaller power banks are like this, but I especially noted it with the Yubi Power. Leaving it on the counter to charge my phone works for me.Otherwise, the power bank is fine. I carry it around in my purse sans pouch. It's so small and lightweight, I don't even know it's there.This product was provided for review by Stanley Global.
summary: Small and Portable

reviewText: If you want to travel light and still bring a power pack with you for your phone, this charger is a great candidate.  It is slightly bigger than a box of gum.  Just bring your phone's charging cable and you have extra power when you need it.  It comes with a short microUSB cable and a pouch.The YP250A comes in many colors, I got the bright red aluminum which looks very attractive.  The number on the model stands for the charging capacity - 2500 mAh. Output is 1 amp.  I have another mini charger that is round and annoyingly rolls off the table, this charger will not have this problem as it is  square in shape.  The LED on top of the power button displays the char ging status: red for charging, green for fully charged and blue when charging a device.It uses a regular micro USB to charge its lithium-ion which is a big plus.  If you lose the cable you can just easily grab one around the house or  purchase one.The YP250A is a nice looking very capable charger.  Its portability and ease of use is a big plus.
summary: Colorful capable mini charger

reviewText: The Yubi Power YP250A USB Power Bank is a very compact, convenient to use, portable battery powered charging unit.  The dimensions are 3.7" long, by 0.85" square.  On one end of the unit, there is a USB port for output, and a mini-USB port, for recharging the battery bank.  Utilizing lithium ion batteries, the capacity of the device is 1500 mAh, with the standard output of 5 volts DC.  The YP250A is extremely easy to use, you turn it on, and then simply connect your USB powered device to it.Controls consists of a power button, above which is a small silver colored bar, with red, blue, and green, LED indicator lights behind it.  When the unit is turned on, the blue LED coming on, indicates that power is available.  If the red LED comes on, the battery bank needs to be recharged.  When charging an external device, the blue light remains on until your device is fully charged.  After this, the blue LED turns off, and the green LED comes on.A 9" long USB cord is provided for recharging the power bank, and can also be used for charging a device utilizing a mini-USB input.  When the battery bank is being recharged, the red LED stays on, until the batteries are fully charged, after which the green LED turns on.  A second accessory, is a carrying pouch.Except for instructions printed on the back of the box, there is no documentation provided with the unit.  There is also a warning that when carried in a pocket or purse, the contacts of the USB ports, can accidentally be shorted out, by contact with metal objects.  Should the device fair to work, recharging is recommended to restore the unit to proper operation.The YP250A is available in red, blue, silver, and black.  The unpainted brushed metal housing, appears that it might be easily marred, by incidental contact with other objects.  The provided pouch is rather large, but using it might be a good idea, as it would help prevent accidental shorts, and also protect the finish.This product was provided to me for review purposes.  The best features are the compact size, simplicity of use, fairly quick recharge time, and relatively low cost.  Power capacity is adequate for those times when you need a little extra power, or on a short trip.  Just remember to bring any USB cords you will need.  I'm not sure how it would affect costs, but my suggestions to the folks at Yubi would be to go with a nice smooth painted enamel finish, add some brighter colors, and reduce the size of the pouch a bit.
summary: compact, portable, auxiliary power source...

reviewText: This is a very cool designed phone holder.  I like that it's very smooth looking.  The curves on this makes it look very sexy.I tried to have this hold my Samsung Note 2 but it won't do it.  It will hold a Samsung S3 and the iPhone 4 of course.  So basically the Samsung S3 is going to be the largest phone it can hold.  The main thing that I do not like about this is the spring in the adjustable phone grip.  It is difficult to open and makes a squeaky noise when it opens and closes.  It's almost like nails on a chalkboard for me.  I tried letting my dad use this and he was having a difficult time trying to open this to put his iphone 5 in there.  I wish the spring on it was a little looser and that the spring didn't make so much noise. I really had to drop it a star because of it. I think it should be easy to open not only for people my age (33) but for older people as well.The suction cup holds very well without a problem and it is very easy to use. I just really wish the made that spring looser and less noisy when you open/close it. I was given this item for review purposes only.
summary: Really nice phone holder.

reviewText: We have been using my iPhone quite a bit for directions recently and I haven't found a good place to put it. So, when I was offered a chance to review this, I figured I would try it.I was very impressed. First of all, it attaches by suction. But that isn't all. It also has a sticky surface around the bottom to allow it to hold even better, not a "permanent - going to ruin my dashboard" kind of sticky, but a removable kind of sticky. The combination makes it easy to use and very sturdy.What I like best, though, is the full rotation, so I can view it horizontally or vertically.I very much appreciate the complimentary sample I was given, and will be making great use of it in the car where I have it mounted.
summary: It sticks to the job

reviewText: The best feature of this cradle is that it sticks well not only to the windshield but to the dash board.  I am fairly short so I often have trouble reaching the windshield mounted cradles and cannot adjust them easily.  This cradle solves this problem for me.The cradle can be rotated 360 degrees and adjusted in many different ways very easily.  The suction is strong and is easy to operate by a lever on the base.The width of the holder adjusts from 3.5" to 5.5". The depth of the holder is 0.5".I am attaching a photo collage of two phones in this holder. One of the phones is a regular slim phone (with a gel skin) another phone has an extended life battery which makes the phone much thicker. The depth of the holder works with a regular slim phone (with or without a gel skin) but the phone with extended battery does not get a firm grip. The holder's sides only reach as far as the battery, they do not on the frame of the phone.I received this phone holder from the manufacture for evaluation, testing and review.  Based on my experience I recommend this phone for any smart phone without extended battery.The photos referenced in the review can be located by following 'customer photos' link under the main photo.Ali Julia review
summary: Sticks to the dash as well as the windshield

reviewText: I've found myself needing to travel for work quite a bit in these last 6 months, much more than I used to. And on one of my last trips, I discovered the maps application in my iPhone 4s. I was thrilled to learn it would give me audio directions while I'm driving, pointing me right to my destination. Since I don't own a vehicle GPS, this app has become indispensable to me. In addition, with Siri built into my phone, I can simply press a button and tell her where I need to go, and she starts the route and gives me turn by turn directions. What could be better? A cell phone car mount to hold up my phone, that actually sicks to the windshield, and this one does.Gone are the days of using a traditional suction cup, where you have to wet the back of it to try and get a perfect seal on the glass. The cup on this mount uses a kind of vacuum seal that's achieved by pulling a lever down while the cup it pressed against the intended mounting surface. This creates a surprisingly strong seal. However, keep in mind that during especially cold times of the year (a.k.a winter) a drastic drop in surface temperature will likely cause the plastic in this cup to contract, thus loosing it's suction. So if you use this all year, then say it falls off your windshield right after Christmas, you might need to wait 'till the temperatures warm up a bit to make sure you don't have problems with it holding its grip. Otherwise the drastic surface temperature changes between day and night may keep it from staying properly affixed.So between the Maps app in my iPhone to route my trips, Siri to talk to me the whole way there, telling me where I need to turn and how far I have to go, and this car mount to keep my phone right in front of me so I can easily hear and access it, it's like having a built in GPS system. It even holds my iPhone 4s in it's case, aOtterbox Defender Hybrid Case. My phone never comes out of it, so the mount being expandable enough to hold my phone while encased is what put it over the top, and makes it PERFECT for me. Love it!A sample unit was provided for reviewing purposes.
summary: Between this, Siri and the Apple maps application, I finally know where I'm going

reviewText: This is a great dashboard cradle to hold your phone if you use it for music or GPS, etc. in your car.It can also work to hold your phone at an office desk for easy access as well.I like the wide tilting of this phone especially...meaning if you have it in place, you can easily maneuver it at quite a range to each side.  Equally smart is its rotation--to 360 degrees, you can mount your phone vertical or horizontal and it stays there.While some holders don't work with a case on your phone, this one does.  It mounts sturdy and easily.That said, check your vehicle dash to ensure you have a spot to hold your phone as you may actually want to mount this on your windshild instead, which is also doable.The shiny black is attractive and stays dust-free in the car.  It doesn't wobble or come off as easily as many.  Works well for me.I was provided this by the manufacturer for honest and unbiased feedback, good or bad.
summary: works on a variety of phones which means it can stick with you even if you change phones, nice shiny look

reviewText: *DOWNGRADED - PLEASE READ AT THE END OF THE REVIEW.*This is the fourth smartphone mount I have reviewed this year, and it is by far my favorite! I would like to thank LowerPriceUSA for sending me a sample to evaluate - they did so on the understanding that I would give my honest and unbiased feedback.CONSTRUCTION, QUALITY AND DESIGNThough it is made almost entirely out of plastic, this FRiEQ smartphone mount has a really slick finish, and seems very durable. I have both the white and black mounts, and without being gaudy they are rarely missed when people are in our car! The phone gripping mechanism is strong enough that I can rotate it without worrying about my phone slipping out, but the soft padding alleviates any worries about scratches to my phone itself. This mechanism also allows you to keep any cover on your phone that you may have. It struggled with an otterbox (those things are huge anyway) but with my regular hard-case I had no issues.The mount can be rotated and pivoted, and does so with ease. This is particularly handy for those moments when the sun happens to be reflecting off of the screen into your eyes - a quick push is all it takes to avoid a potential accident! Again, despite it being easy to change the position of this mount, your phone will stay where you put it if you don't want it to move!THE SUCTION CUPNow I have to be honest and say that I am one of the unfortunate few  who will not be able to use this on their dashboard. For some reason, no matter how hard I try (cleaning before placement, etc.), this simply will not stick on our older Subaru Outback. We tried on family members' dashboard and it went on just fine, so I guess it's the luck of the draw, and no stars removed! Still, the suction cup is enormously powerful, and whether you use it on your dashboard or windshield, that sucker is not coming loose! Unlike some previous generations of FRiEQ mounts, the cold does not affect the suction as much as it used to- definite points there! The suction mechanism is easily operated by a lever, and the washable gel pad was surprisingly easy to clean, dry and use again! Usually I don't trust washable adhesive products, but going with 3M was a good move, as FRiEQ now gets to benefit from 3M's high standards of performance.OVERALLDespite being one of the few people in the world with a problematic dashboard surface, these are definitely my new favorite dash mounts. Their versatility, ease of use and strong performance allow me to easily recommend them. Sure, they're a few dollars more expensive than other brands, but FRiEQ is fast-becoming a trustable name in electronics accessories, and I personally find their performance to absolutely merit the few extra dollars spent.*UPDATE*So after just a little bit of use, the spring mechanism that clamps down on the phone gave way - the mount doesn't have tension any more. It's sad, because this is my favorite mount! I have contacted the manufacturer and will be reviewing their warranty process. For now, I'm withdrawing my hearty recommendation and stating to proceed with caution - it's quite possible that this is a fluke so we'll see when/if I get a replacement.
summary: By far my favorite mount!

reviewText: There are few things more frustrating, and potentially dangerous, as driving along and having your windshield mounting system fall from the windshield. It is distracting, may cause profanity, and it risks damaging your smartphone/GPS/or other device.The FRiEQ Universal Dashboard/Windshield mount is probably the best on that I have ever encountered. It is easy to mount to your windshield - and I have not had an issue with it staying place (I will amend this review if I do have a problem).Notes-- It is worth mentioning again - this mount is very easy to apply to your windshield - easy enough to do one-handed.- Pivots and rotates very easily. I have had other mounts fall apart or disassemble when I tried to rotate the device (i.e my smartphone) for better viewing. That is not the case here - the FRiEQ device is easy to position.- Like all mounts, it is difficult to stick to cold surfaces.- It is a little bigger than a few others that I have tried, but it is still small enough to fit in a backpack.Final Verdict - Probably the best windshield mount that I have ever used. It has a nice look, pivots easily - and works well.4 1/2 StarsPlease Note - I received this product for reviewing purposes.
summary: A Video Review of the FRiEQ Windshield Mount

reviewText: I've tried other windshield/suction-disk devices, including an older version of this Frieq mount, but this one is the first that I truly like. The padded grips on the side don't feel as they will crush/break my iPhone 5, and the easily rotated orientation allows me to switch from landscape to portrait mode -- and everything in between. And I can orient the face of my phone for optimal viewing while I'm driving or toward the passenger seat for assistance from my husband. The gel pad and the lever connects the mount securely to the disk I already have installed on the dashboard of my car, and it also attaches well to the windshield, something that comes in handy when I'm using a rental car.The mount is solidly constructed, and it looks great. Because it comes in both black and white, you can match it to the color of your iPhone/other phone or to blend in better with a light or dark dashboard. This is one cell phone mount that is worth the purchase. Note: The manufacturer provided a sample for review.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: An Easy, Secure Way to Use Your Phone as a Navigation Device

reviewText: One of the things I like the best about this dashboard mount is that it works.  It works without having it fall down the first time you hit a bump or even a couple minutes after you put your phone it it.  You don't have to drill anything into your dash and there's not sticky mess that will adhere to the dash or windshield after removal (or fall) .  There are no difficult instructions to follow and installation is almost intuitive.  Switch up, no suction, switch down ... you get a firm hold.FEATURES:~  The phone holder itself can be rotated 360~  You can view your phone in either a portrait or landscape mode~  It can be moved in an up or down position~  A spring-loaded clamp will keep your phone secure~  Rubber-coating on the inside of the clamp will prevent your phone from being scratched~  The mount can be used on the windshield or the dashboard~  Quick and easy installation, removal~  The width, 3.5" to 5.5", will accommodate several devicesCONS:~  Will not hold devices such as a Tom Tom that have mountings on the back (not intended to).I tried this on the dashboard as well as the windshield and was surprised with the suction I received.  I've tried a couple of these mounts without much success.  This one you can even leave your case on provided it doesn't exceed the width.  One cautionary note would be to not put it on the dash in the airbag areas.  I do love this one because it does what it says it does ... works.Sample provided for review by the distributor.
summary: Finally a dashboard mount that actually works!

reviewText: A dashboard/window mount is really only as good as it's ability to hold (both to the window/dash and your device).  If the unit can't stay securely anchored to a window or dash while driving, it doesn't matter if it will fit your phone or not.  TheFRiEQ Premium Stylish Universal Dashboard Windshield Car Mount Holdertackles both requirements with flying colors.This mount is well designed both stylish and functional.  This mount will allow you 90 degrees front back movement, 90 degrees rotation side to side, and a full 360 rotation for having your phone, GPS or whatever it may be in portrait or landscape position and anywhere in between.  This mount is very versatile holding devices from 2.5 to 3.5 inches.  The hold on your device is sturdy, however it will require both hands to remove and place inside the mount.  The cradle holds tight to your device and this is great for ensuring it won't fall out while driving.The mount is solidly constructed.  I really like the suction cup design in this product. Between my radar detector and other devices (my state has very liberal laws on the use of windshield mounted devices), the suction cups can get dirty easy when moving from one vehicle to another.  I like how this suction mount can be restored to like new condition with warm water and allowing to air dry.  The hold of this unit is very strong and a definite plus.Available inblackorwhite,  the FRiEQ Premium Stylish Universal Dashboard Windshield Car Mount Holder is a great addition to any vehicle.  The great hold and versatility makes it a fully functional great buy.Disclosure: I received a sample product from the manufacturer for the purposes of providing this review. A review in exchange for the review sample was not promised. The views and opinions expressed in this review are my own, and in no way represent the views or opinions of the manufacturer or vendor.
summary: Sleek Mount With Strong Suction And Flexible Adjustments...

reviewText: Wow, I couldn't believe how easy it was to get this to stick to my windshield. And once it was stuck and the suction was reinforced with the push down lever, it was on good and didn't come off until I wanted it too.The base is a nice circular shape, no sharp edges, smooth, shiny finish. Its phone arm has an almost infinite number of positions. It is moveable with just enough tension to make it easy to move but very firm when you stop moving it. In other words, it doesn't flop around and doesn't need tightening. My Droid Incredible 4G phone doesn't do anything to weigh it down and make it shift. It holds it firmly in place.The phone holder is also a spring tension mount. My phone slips in with a little push and then it is held firmly in place. It is really nice to be able to shift my phone around for viewability and have it lock into place each time without having to tighten something.This whole mount has a smooth finish, soft edges, and a solid feel.I have been using a holder with a snap close phone mount and a push button release. That allows me to remove the phone very quickly. This mount take just a little more effort to get out of the tension mount and my gel case adds to the difficulty sometimes. But otherwise, the mount is very nicely made, super easy to use and like it says in the description, it is stylish!This is also a great way to have your phone in a viewable position on your desk. It suctioned to my desktop easily and positions my phone for easy viewing while I work.I was provided a unit for evaluation and an honest review.
summary: Solid Suction Power, Great Ability to Position, Firm Hold

reviewText: This FRiEQ Dashboard Mount has excellent suction on flat, smooth surfaces. I use it on my desk, mirror & in the car to hold my IPod Touch 4G. If the 3M gel pad gets dusty or doesn't want to suction/stick, simply rinse it with warm water or clean it with rubbing alcohol & let air dry. The pad is not sticky & won't leave any sticky residue. The gel pad suction might lessen in extreme cold weather, but strengthen with heat.The holder adjusts from 2.25" - 3.25" & will hold items, in their case, in that size range.  Using two hands, I don't have any problems adjusting the holder to put my IPod Touch in.The cradle rotates 360 degrees and can be moved in several ways.To Use:~Clean the (dashboard, mirror, windshield, desk, etc.) surface before attaching the cradle. Surface needs to be flat & smooth. If installing in your car, do not install in areas of airbag operation.~Remove tape/plastic piece from bottom pad.~Push down on the round section & press lever downward.This item also comes in blackFRiEQ Premium Stylish Universal Dashboard Windshield Car Mount Holder for Smartphones including iPhone 5, Samsung Galaxy S3, S2, Verizon Galaxy Nexus and more - BlackI will update my review if my opinion changes.I was provided a sample for an honest, unbiased review.12 month warranty
summary: Secure, strong suction... Adjusts from 2.25" - 3.25" wide (approximate measurements)

reviewText: The FRiEQ Dashboard Smartphone Cradle is sturdy and has a strong and easy-to-apply suction base with a reusable gel surface.  The cradle itself is easy to open but holds the phone firmly and has a soft-touch plastic lining on the claws for a good grip and to prevent scratches.  The arm and cradle each swivel about 90 degrees for 180 degrees total and then the cradle rotates 360 degrees for almost universal adjustment.The quality of construction is more precise than on some similar devices, with moving parts that stay put.  It's available in black or white to complement the decor or the phone.Most people use these cradles only in their automobiles but they can also be used on a desk to hold small electronics such as a calculator at a convenient angle and safe from spills.  When mounted on a vertical surface such as the side of a desk, file cabinet, or even a computer case, the cradle functions perfectly as an unobtrusive headphone stand, and this is what I use mine for.The only caution is that it needs to be mounted on a smooth, clean surface.  Attaching it to a textured dashboard won't work as well as on a smooth surface such as glass or metal.A sample was provided for unbiased review.
summary: Not only for smartphones but makes a great headphone stand, too

reviewText: The FRIEQ Dash Board Cradle is one of the most compact suction mounts available. The main grip for your phone is expandable, so it is likely to take just about any sized phone; iPhone and other android Smartphone's.  The innovative 3M Gel Pad attached to the mount gives a strong suction to any vehicle dashboard and windshield.  There is no extra sticky flat pad needed for your dashboard in order to use this.  The easy one-touch lever securely locks the suction to your windshield.  To release it, you don't have to struggle with the suction.  Simply unlock the lever for an easy un-installation.  The phone holder (clasp) rotates 360 degrees and has wide tilting and up/down tilting.  It can be placed to suit any viewpoint for the driver.Suction cup grips have always been a nuisance for me. You hit a bump in the road and everything drops to the floor making for a hazardous situation. The one-touch lever is a powerful suction cup and attaches securely.  Also, the look is an attractive shiny black gloss.  Item generously supplied by manufacturer for an honest review.
summary: Securely Sticks To Your Windshield!

reviewText: This is no ordinary suction mount.  It's made with a gel pad that gives it supreme holding power.  Those plastic suction cups don't compare -- not even in the same league.I've been using the FRIEQ windshield car mount for my iPhone 4S.  It holds via a spring action "hand" that makes it a perfect fit every time.  No fiddling with knobs.  The low profile means I can have it on my dashboard beanbag and not have it obstruct my view.The mount has a great range of motion.  I can rotate my iPhone to landscape or portrait position or anywhere in between.  I can tilt the face in any direction or move the arm up and down.  There is enough friction to keep the mount in the position I set it but not so much friction that adjustment is difficult.  The only thing I can't make it do is swivel around the base.  I would actually like to have that feature, even though I can get that movement by rotating the beanbag itself.This is really a nice dashboard mount.  It's small and simple, easy to adjust, and does everything I need.This product was provided for review by LowerPriceUSA.
summary: Excellent holding power

reviewText: I have been through a lot of windshield/dashboard smartphone holders. There are some that looks very sophisticated that seems to fit them all. Some are very simple and small. I lean more toward the later. I just gave one away that although very well padded and heavy duty, it was so bulky and the release button is difficult to reach.This suction cup smartphone card holder is very simple. You can place it on the windshield (unless it is considered unlawful in your state to put anything on the windshield) or place it on top of the dashboard, which is what I did. I found out that no matter how good the suction cup, eventually it falls down. It may take months, but through rain, sunshine and snow, it still falls down. Putting it on the dashboard proved to be a safer bet. One con, it didn't come with a round sticker plate that you stick to your dashboard. Luckily I have a couple already in placed that came with my old GPS.You can place your smartphone even with a case (depending how bulky your case is). It can rotate easily 360 degrees using a friction ball, landscape to portrait and back with one hand.Limitations:- for bigger and heavier phones, or if you have a heavy case, the friction ball may tend to tilt down. You may need something that has a knob to twist and lock it in position.-There is no release button to open the grip that holds the phone. You will need both hands to either place or remove your smartphone.I was provided a sample of this product, so I could use it and write my unbiased review.
summary: Almost perfect

reviewText: I like being able to use my smartphone for things like GPS navigation when I'm driving, but I never have a good place to put the phone that doesn't take my eyes off the road. When I was asked if I wanted to review the FRiEQ Premium Stylish Universal Dashboard Windshield Car Mount Holder for Smartphones, I said yes, hoping it would be the answer for those types of situations. I quickly found out that it *is* the answer, and will be permanently left in the car now... I love it.The things I normally don't care for on mounts like these is that they are built for a single size or type of phone, and you pretty much have to take off any phone cover in order to use it. Not with the FriEQ, however... The two side braces for the phone have one side that is fixed and one side that is spring-loaded and expands out to nearly four inches wide. Therefore, it's pretty irrelevant as to how wide your device is with the cover on it. Just push the side of the phone against the brace that expands out, push it until you can get the phone anchored against the other brace, and the tension between the arms will hold it tight.The base has a latch on the back that works the suction cup base on the bottom. I'd guess that if your dashboard is pebbly or not very smooth, it might not hold as tightly as it should. But for our dash, which is smooth, it held like a rock. The armature between the phone holder and the base also fully swivels and moves through a 90 degree of up-and-down motion, so I can't think of any configuration where you wouldn't be able to attach the mount and not be able to swivel the phone into an optimal viewing angle.Bottom line, I can't find anything to dislike about the FRiEQ. It looks nice in black, it blends into the coloring in our car, it's easy to work, and it does exactly what it's supposed to do (and it does it well). I'm guessing that if I find that the FriEQ is missing from my car, it will probably have "mysteriously" traveled to my son's car... in which case he can go buy his own. This reviewer is not sharing this item...Disclosure:Obtained From: MarketingPayment: Free
summary: Oh, I *really* like this...

reviewText: First things first: I received this as a 'for review sample'. I don't believe that it affects the content of my review or my final rating but it's fair to state it.I don't know if I qualify as an audiophile but I am definitely a sucker for good sound and can't stand the opposite. Within that context, the more little Bluetooth speakers I received for review, the more skeptical I've become on the wisdom of someone spending actually money to acquire such a device because the sound tends to be 'not good', their stereo rarely rises about the level of 'pretend', lack bass, the controls tend to look and feel cheap and some aren't much louder than the phone's or tablet's own built in speakers. Yes, there are exceptions but they almost always tend to be on the 'high end' of the price spectrum.Enter EasyAcc's entry. It's somewhat midrange pricewise and yet it delivers some very, very good quality, crisp, loud, stereo sound with decent bass. And it's quite good looking too if appreciate the Zeppelin shape. The explanation for my Four Stars rating is because 'sound' matters to me so much vs. everything else so I am really subtracting about 3 stars for other issues but the EasyAcc starts with a seven stars rating for its sound - unbelievably good for a device this size at this price point.Here is the list of features that are likely to disappoint you and could make you to look elsewhere if they are important to you. All based on my experience, of course.- Terrible, awkward interface. There is a Mode button that switches between Bluetooth and other modes such as Radio, line mode or USB/SD card but it's difficult to know where you are because there are no visual clues whatsoever except for some pulsating blue light that should indicate that the device is paired or about to pair via Bluetooth.- Radio didn't work for for me. We don't get too many stations here but EasyAcc got me none. Don't know why. Also, there doesn't seem to be a way of storing favorite stations. Going back to the interface, the manual claims that it can store up to 35 FM stations but I am unaware on how to store them and, since there is no visual feedback, assuming that stations can be stored, it should be impossible to determine which stored stations you are currently listening to, its frequency and it shouldn't be that easy to switch from, let's say 'station 5' to 'station 25'.- USB/AC card interface doesn't work. I plugged in a USB stick I use to play music in my car and plays well on both Windows and Android devices but nothing came out. As far as I can tell, IF this could be made to work, there is no random play mode, no way to search for a specific album or artist and no way to switch to another song other than sequentially move from 'song 1' to 'song 2' and so forth.- Standby time of only 18 hours. If you turn it on it's likely to stay on until the battery runs out, regardless of it receiving any input.But enough negativity. There are some other good thing to note, besides the great sound:+ Comes with a pretty good 800 mAh lithium battery that charges off any USB charger.+ USB charging wire and 3.5 mm audio cable included.+ Can play while charging+ Supports headphonesTo summarize: sound is great for something this small and it makes up for almost all shortcomings. It's also pretty. Almost Everything else is mediocre or less.
summary: Brilliant sound but read carefully about other promised features

reviewText: This is a nifty speaker because it can do so much. It can be an MP3 player by playing MP3s from either USB FLash & SD Card.  It can be a bluetooth speaker for a phone or tablet.  It can also work as FM radio.In the attached video I show MP3 operation, FM radio, as well as streaming music via bluetooth.♫ ♫ ♫ My favorite use for it is as MP3 player with external speakers listening to audio books.  I listen to audio books when I do house chores and the chores go a lot faster when you have a great book to listen to. The speaker works well for this purpose because it automatically remembers where you stopped and picks up from that point the next time you start listening.  It remembers the bookmark even after you recharge the speaker, which is not the case with some of my other MP3 players.  You can listen to MP3 while the device is being charged.  The only negative I can say here is that there is no display, so you don't see what chapter you are on.♫ ♫ ♫ I tested bluetooth with my Samsung Galaxy tablet and iPad mini tablet and both worked well.♫ ♫ ♫ FM radio is the weakest part of the device in my experience, probably because it does not have a large antenna the reception of many stations has a lot of static.  FM tuner can tune  87.0-108.0 MHz, however the radio has no display so you can't see what station you are tuned into.The speaker can be made quite loud.  How to control the volume is not documented in the instructions.  There are 4 buttons on top of the speaker the buttons on the right control the volume as well as perform next/previous function. If you touch and release the buttons quickly it does next/forward, if you press and hold the buttons then you can control the volume (left is volume down, right is volume up).  The left most button changes mode (play from memory, bluetooth, FM radio).  The button which is second from the left performs pause operation as well as answer the phone.To help me make evaluate and compare different speakers I always use the same pieces of music to test the speakers.  This way I can compare the speakers using this "apples-to-apples" comparison. As a stress test for the bass I use Bach's Toccata and Fugue in D minor. The second piece of music (Tchaikovsky) does not have a lot bass and allows me to test the mid-range. EasyAcc handled both pieces of music very well. Some speakers cannot handle the bass of the Fugue and break up, but EasyAcc sounded good through out.♫ ♫ ♫ The speaker weights 8.7 oz.♫ ♫ ♫ It is 8.5" long and 2.75" wide at the widest point.I received this speaker for testing and review from the manufacturer.  I use the MP3 player functionality almost daily and I am very pleased with it.Ali Julia review
summary: Very good sound,  excellent as MP3 player and bluetooth speaker

reviewText: I've tried a lot of Bluetooth speakers, but this is the first one I've used that has both a USB 2.0 and SD card inputs and a FM radio built-in. I tried this speaker using my iPhone 4S after inserting the included rechargeable lithium battery and charging the device for approximately 2 hours. (Charging time is 2-4 hours according to the included packaging, with a standby time of up to 18 hours and a music playing time of up to 3 hours.)I was happy to see that this speaker shipped with fairly clear operational directions, which I've found to be lacking in some of EasyAcc's products that I've previously reviewed.  Key functions are clearly outlined in a step-by-step format that's easy to follow for basic operation of the speaker.Lacking in the directions is a Quick Start Guide.  There's no mention of inserting and charging the battery prior to your first use. An overview of the controls and connections are good, but the diagram is so small, it's tough to tell what numbers correspond where on the device. A list of functions includes: "Without external power, the built-in battery can play music for a long time."  (I got a giggle out of that one!)The speaker itself has a good build quality with a DC-5V mini connection for charging (cord included) via USB 2.0 port.  A headphone port, aux line in (cord included), SD card port, and USB 2.0 connection for flash drives, are all on the back of the unit next to the On/Off switch.The speaker was immediately recognized by my iPhone and connected quickly without the need for a password.  Once connected, a blue light blinks on the front of the device.  There's a Mode button that when depressed releases the Bluetooth connection and engages the FM radio.  Directions for use are outlined in the included Operational Manual, as are directions for use in the Line Mode, and the Micro SD Card/ USB modes.Overall, I like this product.  It's a bit larger than some other Bluetooth speakers, but it does have the added capability of accessing music on a USB flash drive or a SD card, and the included FM radio capabilities.Sound quality is good.  Not the best I've heard from EasyAcc:EasyAcc Wireless Bluetooth Speakers Portable Outdoor Mini Bluetooth Speakerphone system for iPhone / iPad; Android Smartphones; HTC One / Samsung Galaxy S4 / Sony Xperia; Tablets, MP3 Players, Laptops, Blackberry Smartphones, Handheld Game Consoles, Por...is better sound-wise, but this one has more features for about the same price. This speaker uses the older 2.1 Bluetooth standard versus the newer 4.0, however this should not be a big issue for most users as that change really addresses energy efficiency as much as anything, which extends a products battery life.NOTE:  I received this speaker from the manufacturer in return for an honest, unpaid review.
summary: Feature-rich 2.1 Bluetooth speaker w/ FM radio, SD & USB inputs

reviewText: I've had a few small speakers like this EasyAcc speaker, all were similar in price and size, but none of them were Bluetooth. Bluetooth speakers always tend to costing a bit more, so right away this speaker has features that many others in the same price range don't.The speaker comes with everything you need to use is, including a 3.5mm cable for using the speaker with your non-Bluetooth devices.  I appreciate that this was included, as some companies (including pricey brand name companies) tend to leave this out, assuming people will buy one if they want to use it. With the cable being included, this broadens the number of devices you can use this speaker with right out of the box, significantly. While I have Bluetooth in my iPhone and my tablet, I don't in my little iPod shuffle, and I love to play music from it. So all I have to do is plug the included 3.5mm cable into the headphone jack of my iPod shuffle and the other end into the Auxiliary port on the back of the speaker, and I'm able to play much the same as if it was connected via Bluetooth.A rechargeable battery in included with the speaker, and a USB charging cable that lets you recharge your speaker from any computer with an open USB port. Should you want to recharge the speaker using a wall outlet, you can buy cheap adapters like thisUSB wall adapterand use the USB charging cable that comes with the speaker to recharge it without the need of a computer.One feature that I love is the card reader port on the back! I've never had a speaker with a card reader, and this is such a great idea. The card reader makes this speaker even more portable, since when using an SD card for your music, you don't need to bring/use any of your Bluetooth devices or hook anything up with the 3.5mm cable. It's a terrific idea, and sets this speaker apart from others like it.The sound quality is about on par with the price. It sounds like basic speaker, and won't be confused with any super high prices portable systems. But it sounds nice and I especially like it for listing to my daily news talk radio shows through the iHeartRadio application on my iPhone. It's the perfect size for in the kitchen, at a desk, to take in a bag or anywhere else where space in limited. It's a handy little radio, and with the SD card reader it sets is apart from the others in it's class.A sample was provided for reviewing purposes.
summary: Awesome little Bluetooth speaker. Even has an SD card reader!

reviewText: I have been sent several different types of bluetooth speaker, but when offered the Gen Olive I accepted the chance to review the speaker because it is so attractive.  Happily this is a case of beauty inside and out. The speaker quality is nice and crisp. I love the addition of a place to put a card so I can carry my music with me.Small and portable with clear sound this speaker is a keeper.
summary: Good sound quality

reviewText: Other reviewers have gone into tremendous detail about the details.  Let me add what impressed me:- This paired with my iPhone quickly and without any problems.- The sound is as good, and maybe a bit better, than I was expecting from a $25 speaker.- The speakers are protected by a solid grill.  I can toss this in a bag, backpack, etc, and not worry about damage.- There's a built in FM radio.  Now you can catch Car Talk or The Midnight Special without having to take along a radio.- It had slots for an SD card and Thumb Drive and will play MP3s contained there in. (D*rn it, I'm going to use my five years of high school)- I can control music (forward, reverse, and pause) playing from your iPhone (and probably most other BT-connected devices though I haven't tested them all) from the speaker.- I can connected this speaker to non-Bluetooth devices with the included stereo cable.  (OK, this one isn't *that* impressive.)- I can replace the battery.  I don't know that I'll ever need to do it and it's nice to have the option.- The manufacture provided the speaker to me for this review.- I can take calls, through my phone, using the mic that's built into the speaker.- The speaker works while it's charging.  If I use one of the new high capacity, compact sized batteries, like theEasyAcc 5000mAh 2.5A Dual Port Fast Charging Ultra-Slim...I can keep this speaker going non-stop for about 30 hours.- It has a "real" (slide) on/off switch.  I prefer this to a pushbutton.
summary: Surprising features, decent sound, solid construction and design, decent price

reviewText: I think bluetooth speakers are a hit this year for gift gifting for teens and young adults but I love them personally for travel, outdoor tunes, and in rooms where I might not use a big speaker system but want music like doing work at my desk or working out.This handsome little gadget has some features you might not find in other bluetooth speakers, but also offers a great price for all it does.First, the sound is really booming.  This is great if you want music outside, on the beach, when hiking, on the hotel deck etc...It does have the built-in microphone so you can still take calls, but the caveat is this one also offers......FM radio playing!That is a feature not easily found on the bluetooth speakers of many brands.This offers nice sound and quite frankly looks more costly than it is with sleek looks and cool accent colors and a nice looking giftable box, yet it is lightweight enough to make it great for the backpack, glove box, or picnic basket.Great for travel, you get the sound you want but won't panic if it winds up lost either due to it being more affordable.And a great stocking stuffer for the college student or spouse for that matter.  What I like about bluetooth gifting is that if you are like me, you can enjoy a few of them so it's the kind of gift that is just fine if you already own one but if you don't,  you will wonder why you didn't get one sooner.Great for the bathroom while you get ready for work and always ready when it's time for play after work from doing your prancercise (kidding) to hanging by the pool.Clear and loud sound and nice features.Product provided by EasyAcc. Review is my honest and unbiased opinion
summary: Rarely do you find a radio on a bluetooth speaker as well..this one has it all

reviewText: For value, versatility and volume-weight, I like this.  I have a couple better bluetooth speakers but use this one more often.  I don't even use the bluetooth connection.* How I'm using it: After testing this bluetooth speaker for its full functionality, I am using as a wire-connected external speaker for my Kindle Fire HD.  This Kindle has a sleep function that allows the Kindle to auto-turn off for a selection of time settings.  I like to listen for awhile as I fall asleep and then have it turn off itself.  I've got this wired to my Kindle, even though I could connect with bluetooth.  I'm using the 3.5mm audio cable that came in the box.* With cell phones: I tested it with my cell phones and it worked well in some ways but adds to the small time lag inherent with cell phones.  Pairing was simple using the instructions.  The speaker sound was adequate for me (I'm no audiophile) and the effective range is 10 meters.  But the microphone sound to the other end was POOR because the effective range was probably 1.5 meters.  I like to move around when I'm on the phone so this is useless to me for cell phone conversations.* Radio is serviceable with reasonable sound.I was provided a promotional sample.  This is my honest review.  In my view, the price coupled with volume-weight made this 5-stars despite the lack of long effective microphone range.For longer battery life, be careful to: (1) Fully charge battery before using first time.  (2) Do not use speakers when charging.
summary: More than adequate for many portable uses

reviewText: This high quality Bluetooth Speaker comes with: Quick Start guide, Mini USB Cable, and 3.5mm Audio line. Since I already had a charger base for a USB cable, I just inserted the cable into the base and the unit fully charged up in about 2 hours.**This is my very first Bluetooth Speaker set and I am so very impressed on so many levels! The sound of these speakers is just amazing for many genres of music I play, my podcasts and my audio books, the sound has such richness and depth.+ Pairing - This speaker is very easy to pair with my Tablets and phones and even my MP3 players! So I first paired up all the units so I can use these speakers with any device I choose to.+ Excellent Sound Quality - The treble is excellent and the bass is very good. Though this is a small sized Bluetooth speaker set, I am amazed at the overall richness in sound. The sound will go quite loud if needed and I learned quickly how to adjust the sound on these speakers: To turn down the sound do a long hard press on the back button (the sound shares the button with the back and forward buttons). To increase the sound, do a long hard press of the forward button.**Note that to turn up or down the volume say on your phone or tablet's player, you can also press the volume up in the player to increase the sound. However, I did this first AND then pressed the volume up in the Bluetooth Speaker.+ Other Uses For This Bluetooth Speaker Set:1) Plug in a flash drive and play MP3 songs from there. What is does is make the Flash drive like a portable MP3 Player. So I have a favorite extra song Flash Drive (16gb) that I tried out and played all of my music played great. So I have several Flash Drives dedicated to music and podcasts so now, I can use these speakers to play my on the go music from my flash drives!These songs were not in folders, just in a long playlist as each flash drive has a long playlist on it.2) Plug in a SD Card adapter with a micro SD card inserted or you can plug in a standard sized SD card with your favorite MP3 songs on it. So I found a couple of SD cards (1GB and 2GB and copied my favorite music with instrumental and the other favorite songs). So I tried each of these in my EasyAcc CSR Bluetooth Speaker and the sound is superb!3) Portable entertainment center - So I use this with my phone and tablets of course, however, since I have 2 SD cards and 2 flash drives filled with music, I can use this as a stand alone portable stereo.For me, I bring this speaker all around my home: Kitchen, back porch, bedroom on nightstand for easy listening to fall asleep (I use my soft instrumental music with the SD card plugged into this speaker and and plays all night long. In the morning I recharge.This unit is perfect for taking on trips, like in a hotel room, park, beach or wherever you want to enjoy music wirelessly!If you like to travel and love to listen to music on the go (Bluetooth with your device or using your SD card, Flash Drive, look no more, I believe that you will love this EasyAcc Bluetooth Speaker unit!Note: I was supplied the Easy CSR Bluetooth Speakers for testing and evaluation, and agreed to review the item, therefore this is a fair and honest review as I truly am amazed by this product!
summary: Bluetooth Speaker With Excellent Sound Quality! Very Unique Bluetooth Speaker and So Much More!

reviewText: The EasyAcc Bluetooth speaker is decent. Considering the low price, well this thing is outstanding.Even if a speaker is cheap or beautifully designed, if the sound is nasty, there is nothing worthwhile about that speaker. This little speaker surprised me, the sound was much better than I expected. The sound is actually stereo, yes two speakers that put out real live stereo is a rare thing in teeny portable speakers (even expensive ones). Oh this isn't audiophile sound, at this price point you'd have to be crazy to expect that. But dog gone it, this speaker is easy on my ears. It handles loud volume fairly well - it takes some pretty high volume before this speaker falls apart. There is a little bit of bass, not ground thumping, but clear. The midrange is this speaker's strong suit, lyrics are clear. The highs are not harsh. A darn good speaker.I've seen the chip this speaker uses on a few other Bluetooth speakers - the first clue was FM radio, chip reader, long presses on buttons to change volume, and a few other odd things. This is the best implementation of that chip I've seen yet. Instead of a micro SD reader, they included a full size SD card reader - nice. The buttons are much better than others, with a solid feel. I don't really care about the FM radio, that's just a silly function to add.Design-wise, I'm torn about this; you'll either love it or hate it. The skinny football shape makes it easy to carry and pack in a carryon bag. The speaker grills are metal so they will stand up to abuse, you'd have to work at ruining them. The orange accent around the grill, ah, I don't like that so much. I really dislike the choice to make the EasyAcc logo in bright white paint, but make the buttons a dark gray. It should be the other way around - I have to squint to figure out the buttons. White icons would be much better. When paired over Bluetooth there is a blue light that flashes underneath the floating key block. Ah you know, in the end, if I get tired of listening to the speakers, I can play catch with this.Pairing was easy or exactly like any other Bluetooth device. The speaker shows up as FB Wireless (yeah, that's intuitive). The buttons on top controlled the music on an iPhone 4s.The speakerphone doesn't work very well. Volume had to be turned way up to hear a conversation. The microphone did a good job on the other end. In a pinch this will work. When my phone rang the music muted. Pressing one of the top buttons answered the call and hung up the phone.The battery is an interesting deal. Most of these speakers have an enclosed battery that can't be easily changed without a screwdriver. EasyAcc decided to use a replaceable battery. The only way this is even remotely useful is if you happen to have one of about 30 different ancient Nokia phones. The battery is a BL-5C used in the N-Gage, N91, and 30 other Nokia phones. There were only about 56 million of these phones made, way back in 2007. The chances of you having a functioning phone are slim to none. And hauling around a charger for that battery is even sillier. It is infinitely easier to just plug this into a USB port with the included mini USB plug. The battery cover fit tightly and would take a lot of work to pop off accidentally.Overall, I like this speaker. Stereo is a major bonus, something no speaker at this price point offers. For casual listening, this is a good choice.I was provided a review sample.
summary: Stereo!

reviewText: I was provided an EasyAcc CSR Bluetooth Speaker for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ Great sound quality at high volumes for a wide range of music styles.  One of the best I've tested.♦ Has a replaceable rechargeable battery that charges with a standard Mini USB cable (included).♦ Tons of connection options including Bluetooth, Aux cable (included), SD Card, USB, built-in FM Tuner.♦ Integrated controls on top of speaker for pause, play, fast forward, rewind, volume and speakerphone.♦ Has a good range, at least 20-25 feet. I had to walk pretty far across my house before it lost connection.♦ Frequency and bass response is good for this size speaker, just don't expect booming bass.♦ Not the smallest, but fairly compact.♦ Decent stereo and surround effects.Detailed Review:♦ Look - The product came in a professional looking box with product information on it. Inside the box was the Speaker, an instruction manual, a Mini USB charging cable and a Stereo Aux cable. The top of the speaker had several buttons (a play/pause/speakerphone button, a rewind/down volume button, a fast forward/up volume button and a mode button). The back has ports for charging, USB, SD Card, Aux, Headphones and a power switch.  The bottom has a door for the rechargeable battery that is replaceable.  The speaker is not the smallest bluetooth speaker I have tested, but it looks really nice.  It looks like a long football.  The orange trim was also nice and it had a blue light on the inside of it.♦ Installation - I had no problem pairing the speaker to my iPhone 5 on the first try without bothering with the instructions.  Everything went perfectly and reconnecting was automatic. I plugged in the included Mini USB charging cable into the unit and into my computer to give it an initial charge before testing it out.♦ Use and Performance - Once the speaker was charged, a did a variety of tests to try it out using my iPhone 5.Test #1 (Sound Quality Test) - I tried out a variety of music from some Disney kids songs to Michael Bublé to Excision Bass Heavy Dubstep (the Destroid album), and it all sounded really amazing to my ears. The best sounding Bluetooth speaker I have tested.  The volume got very loud with some decent bass response. It handled the high volume with no distortion at all with the bass heavy music. It had good bass sounds for a speaker of this size, but not booming bass (this is not a negative because no tiny speaker can produce booming bass). I was really happy with the sound.Test #2 (Sound Performance Test) - After I got past the basic sound quality, I tried out a few more technical tests. I put speaker directly in front of me and started playing a Dolby HD Surround Sound test video. It sounded really great and produced some decent stereo or surround sound effects, even though the speakers were pretty close to each other.  The decent stereo performance was a nice little surprise.  I also played a frequency test file that started at 20Hz and found that the speakers started producing sound around the 45-50Hz range which was pretty low for such a small speaker. The sound continued to get better as the frequency got higher and got pretty painful at the higher frequencies. Very good results for a small speaker.Test #3 (Use Test and Other Features) - I tested Bluetooth range by walking through my house and got about 20-25 feet around some walls before the sound dropped out. Walking back started the sound back up immediately.  Once the sound testing was done via Bluetooth streaming, I tried out the sound and functionality from the other various audio inputs.  The Aux input cable from my iPhone sounded just as good.  I then plugged in an SD Card into the port and the songs on the card started playing immediately.  I was able to control the songs and volume through in integrated buttons with no problem.  I did the same thing with a USB Flash Drive and it worked exactly the same way.  It also had an FM Tuner included with the push of the mode button.  I got some staticky voices to come through, but I really didn't mess with it much.  I was very happy with all of the other inputs.  Quite an impressive variety of options.Conclusion:Overall, I love the sound of this Bluetooth speaker.  It is one of the best I have tried out.  It really sounded great with the variety of music that I tried.  It also has an amazing variety of input options and a replaceable battery.  If you are looking for a great sounding Bluetooth speaker, this one is definitely worth a look. Highly Recommended!
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy!

reviewText: Several weeks ago I received a sample ofEasyAcc CSR Bluetooth Speakers with Built-in microphone  [ FM function,color:Orange] from the manufacturer.  Ever since it arrived we have been putting this great little speaker through its paces with about every bluetooth gadget we've been able to dig up- iPads, iPhones, Android phones, a Samsung Galaxy tablet.  I even mated it with the Bluetooth on my computer.  It also has a built in FM radio that will scan for best reception while saving up to 35 radio addresses,  as well as both SD card and USB stick  receptacles for input.  And did I mention that you can answer your phone - and it will support call waiting & teleconferencing?  Last, hardly least,  you'll find an earphone plug.  (Earphones are not included.) This baby does it ALL!The sound is fantastic - and loud if  you want it to be.  It also has great range - the longest of any I've tried.  While the instructions say 10 Meters, I took mine all over my apartment, down the stairs and out onto the porch.  (I would have gone farther but it is bitter cold and I was barefoot.)  The unit is easy to charge via the included USB cable, either from your computer or by way of an outlet adapter.  Charging takes a couple of hours.  Controls are large, well labeled and fairly instinctive.I did notice one little quirk.  You can change from Bluetooth input to FM readily, but once done you have to go back and pair the speaker to your device again in order to return to Bluetooth mode.Grandma's $0.02 -  A bit larger than some, but worth the space.  Highly recommended
summary: Full Featured With Fantastic Sound

reviewText: I've used a number of Bluetooth speakers, but none of them had the versatility of the EasyAcc CSR speakers. In addition to the Bluetooth connection, the speakers accept input from a 3.5mm audio cable and directly from SD memory cards. There's also a built-in FM radio.I first tried the Bluetooth connection. The speakers paired easily with my Nexus 7 tablet and played music from one of my favorite playlists. Even at maximum volume, the sound clarity with four watts of total output was quite good, and the two speakers are separated enough (about 6") to give decent stereo. Next I ended the Bluetooth connection and connected the speakers to the tablet with the audio cable. That worked well, and in this hard-wired mode, the volume can be controlled from either the audio source or the CSR speakers.After copying a few MP3 music files to an SDHC memory card, I inserted the card into the slot on the back of the speakers, turned on the speakers, and played music. The music began playing automatically as soon as I turned the power on to the speakers. That's remarkable - I've never seen another set of portable speakers with that capability.There are a number of powerful FM radio stations in our town, so I had no problem bringing in FM stations. I have to say, though, that it's a little clunky looking for favorite stations without a tuner. But the seek function did work pretty well.There's also a 3.5mm headphone jack on the back of the speakers.Another unique feature is the replaceable rechargeable battery in the speakers. It's a Nokia BL-5C Extended Li-Ion battery, and they cost about $5 at Amazon to replace one or to have extra ones charged up to carry with you. The battery can be charged inside the speakers from a DC 5V source and the included charging cable. The user manual doesn't specify the maximum current, but I put it on a DC 5V~1.0A charger for a couple of hours, and it was fine.My only negative comment - and it's a minor one - is that the bottom of the speakers has four little plastic nubs to rest on. A rubberized base would make it more skidproof if it's bumped.With attractive styling, excellent sound quality and volume for its size, the multiple media inputs, and an FM radio, this is perhaps the most versatile portable speakers that I've seen.A product sample was provided by the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: One of the most versatile Bluetooth speakers I've seen

reviewerName: Joel Avrunin "Electrical Engineer who loves S...
reviewText: This little speaker is quite impressive.  Combined with your iPhone or iPod, you can really carry around some serious entertainment.  The speaker is obviously a little light on the bass, but given the small size, I was actually surprised by the fullness of the sound.  I put it on a living room shelf and it really filled the room from my iPad which was connected very easily via Bluetooth.The speaker uses a removable battery on the bottom which appears proprietary, so you need to charge it in the speaker itself using the included mini-USB cable.  There is no USB power adapter, so you'll need to have one of those available to charge.  The speaker has a "mode" button to allow you to cycle between the various states - bluetooth audio, direct phono plug in, built-in FM radio, or built-in MP3 player.  Obviously there is no display, but the FM radio and mode switching was serviceable and quite usable.The only problem I had was that I copied a bunch of MP3's onto an SD card and while they played, the speaker had a tendency to "skip" on the MP3 files.  I don't know why, but the playback just was not smooth on known good files.The result is that I ding the speaker 1 star - I can't recommend it for MP3 playback, but for the low price, it is more than sufficient as a bluetooth speaker.  On a side note, my son ran upstairs with the speaker and I couldn't believe that the bluetooth still worked.  It has an excellent range.Note: I was provided a free sample of this for review with no promise of a positive review.
summary: Just about everything you could want in a bluetooth speaker - not perfect but quite good

reviewText: First of all, It's a very good design. It feels good in the hand and is easy to carry around. Because it's all round and there are no edges, you can slip this in your bag or in a cubbyhole in you car, etc. for carrying around and for placement.The biggest reason why I give this 5 stars is its versatility. I've reviewed many such speakers but none I have is as versatile as this. You can play music from:a) USB drive from its USB slot.b) SD card from its SD slot.c) FM radio from its built in FM tuner.d) Any audio device with a 3.5mm jack.e) Any bluetooth compatible device.It's basically a radio and speakers for every single device I have. As a bonus, it has an earphone jack and a mic so you can answer phone calls on it.The speakers come with a 3.5mm audio cable, charging cable and battery. The battery is detachable so I guess you can change it with a fresh one for more playing time as you shouldn't charge and play at the same time.It's easy to charge, just plug in the cable and the red LED will show. I found FM radio reception to be strong and clear. Sound quality is fair for this price and the size of these speakers, they are only 2W each. At home, listening to the radio on a quiet day, they were perfect for me.A couple of things that I miss is a wheel for volume control and a simple LCD screen but I don't often see them because manufacturers are trying to bring the price point down. You can get better sound with bigger speakers and a bigger box, but this appears to be a perfect compromise for speakers of this size and price.Overall, I have to give this product the highest marks for size, design, portability and versatility at this price. I received a sample from the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: Versatile!

reviewText: There are plenty of options for wireless Bluetooth speakers available on the market.  After trying theEasyAcc CSR Bluetooth Speaker, I have found it to be very useful and the one I take everywhere.Aesthetically pleasing in orange or blue, the unit looks really great.  Pairing the unit was really easy; after turning Bluetooth on under settings in my tablet, I found the speaker, connected and was instantly wirelessly streaming music.  This speaker also paired with my phone and made an excellent hands-free speaker system for my office since the unit includes a built-in microphone.Even if you have an older device such as an MP3 player without Bluetooth, you can still connect it to this unit using the included 3.5mm cable.  This unit also has a standard SD card slot for loading music on a card and playing it all day long from the speaker.  Even more cool is the built in FM tuner for listening to broadcast radio.  This unit has a removable rechargeable battery and a USB charging cable has been included in the package for convenience.Speaking to the quality and richness of sound from the speaker system, I think this product does a really good job.  The reproduction and quality were quite impressive for such a small unit.  The unit does have bass and it is very nice and powerful considering the size.  The volume is adjustable and is loud enough for use in outdoor spaces like a patio or near the pool.Generally, theEasyAcc CSR Bluetooth Speakeris a very worthwhile investment for use has a hands-free office speakerphone, or for the musicphile.
