Quality of construction is very solid and even the metal grilles are durable.There is a threaded universal mount receptacle underneath so it can attach to a speaker stand or even on abicycle handlebar mount.  There is also a loop on the back with a carabiner so it can be clipped to just about anything.This little speaker now sits on top of my Mac Mini (which dwarfs it!) and stays charged through USB.  The Bluetooth pairing is completely painless and almost instant—no need to read the directions.  It is so easy to unplug it and move it around.  The only tip is that with a computer, it may be necessary to specify the ECOROX as the audio output in the system preferences.  There are buttons on top to adjust the volume and change tracks as well as to pause to answer a phone with the built-in microphone when streaming music from the phone plus LED signals for power, charge, and Bluetooth.Audio quality is very good for something this tiny at 3 watts per speaker.  It works best if the volume is turned all the way up on the audio source and then the controls on the speaker are used to adjust the volume to taste.  It is loud enough to enjoy while pedaling around or in noisy environments and I have to keep it turned way down on my desk.Overall, this is a very well-designed mini-speaker that sounds quite good and is versatile and durable enough to go almost anywhere while the compact size makes it ideal for use on a desk or in a dormitory or bathroom.A sample was provided for unbiased review.
summary: Cute but tough waterproof mini-speaker

reviewText: UPDATE: 6/22/2013 - I have updated my video review to include a direct A-B comparison of the sound of the EXOROX with that of the ECOXBT. As you'll see, there is a difference but overall the ECOROX sounds pretty awesome and holds its own both in sound quality and loudness with its bigger brother.----Grace Digital really hit the ball out of the park with this little speaker. It's an outdoor enthusiasts dream come true. You want music while you're on your paddleboard? Check. Want something that can survive a camping trip? Check. How about a great sounding small wireless speaker that just sits on a shelf or counter in your house? Check.This little thing packs a big punch in the sound department. Hard to believe it sounds so good given it's diminutive size.The case is rubberized and can really take a beating. It's a solid and durable enclosure... not a sort-of, wannabe tough, but a real solid tough. It's also completely waterproof achieveing both IPX7 and IPX8 ratings (Google it.) Bottom line is that this can go underwater and won't be phased, as long as the port covers are closed properly.Speaking of ports, there is a Micro USB charging port and a 3.5mm Aux in port, both in the same, rubber seal covered area on the bottom of the speaker. The thing charges in just 2.5 hours and will play for at least 10 hours. That's some serious music time.The frequency response is great and the ECOROX has a bass radiator in addition to the two small front facing stereo speakers. This thing cranks out 3W RMS per channel with a 125 Hz to 18000 KHz frequency range. That means it gets pretty loud and sounds good doing it. Bass in particular is outstanding for a small speaker as the ECOROX is.I really like this speaker and it will certainly replace the useage of some larger and not as good sounding bluetooth speakers that I"ve acquired over the last year.Awesome job Grace Digital. This is a great little speaker.I was provided a sample for review purposes.
summary: Sound rivals that of it's bigger sibling, the ECOXBT. Rugged, waterproof

reviewText: I tested the ECOXGEAR Bluetooth speaker on my iPhone and Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet. It puts out a lot of sound for something that's only 5 inches long. At maximum volume, I could hear it loud and clear from the other rooms in the house. The connection is good, I like the bass, there's no static, and it's not tinny. I could actually use it for a party.It could be used anywhere, really. Like its larger cousin, the ECOXGEAR ECOXBT, it looks like it could survive being run over by a truck -- perfect for the rugged outdoors. It even comes with a carabiner, to hang on a hook or backpack.The ECOXGEAR can also be mounted, but you'll have to provide your own mount. It can fit on all of my tripods. When I want it to look cute next to the hot tub, I put it on a mini tripod and adjust. It will work on any mount that will hold a standard camera.The speaker is waterproof, meaning it can fall into the water and survive. It's not meant to play submerged (not good at all, don't try). Actually, the speaker floats. I put it in the pool and the hot tub and I can vouch that it still plays after those ordeals. I even use it in the shower, where it works perfectly.Lastly, there is a phone function. When calls come in through my phone, I can answer it. I tested it with my son, both from the speaker end and the phone end. The sound through the speaker is good. It picks up everything. The problem is the other end, where it's touch and go. The sound is sometimes good, sometimes difficult to hear.I like the ECOROX because it's small and portable and packs a punch with the sound. It's the best Bluetooth speaker of its size that I've ever owned.This product was provided for review by Grace Digital.
summary: Big Sound In a Small Package

reviewText: Grace Digital's ECOXGEAR ECOROX Waterproof Wireless Bluetooth Speaker is a more compact version of theirECOXGEAR ECOXBTspeaker system, which despite having smaller speakers, delivers sound quality that is still quite good.  The ECOROX can function either via Bluetooth, or hard wire connected, using a standard 1/8" audio input cord.Looking at the photos, you may not appreciate how small the ECOROX really is, as the dimensions are approximately 2.5" high, 5" wide, and 3" deep.  With a rugged housing, with mostly rubber trim, this unit is designed to be taken with you wherever to go.  The speakers are supposed to be submersible and float on water, however I did not verify this, but exposure to a little rain, shouldn't be an issue.Beneath a rubber strip on the back of the unit, is a mini-USB port for charging, and the audio line in jack.  A mini-USB cord is included, as is a carabiner clip, which can be attached to a swiveling nylon loop on the back of the unit.  The speakers also have a 1/4" female screw fitting on the bottom, so it can be attached to a tripod or stand.Assessment of sound quality is a very subjective matter, but for speakers with a total output of 6 watts, the performance is pretty sweet, as the unit can produce reasonably high volume, without excessive distortion.  The ECOROX isn't intended to be used to provide entertainment at a party, and the larger ECOXBT is capable of much higher volume, but the ECOROX is fine for casual use.  It works well for either voice or mid-range music, however as is to be expected for speakers of this size, there may be some issues with music with heavy, or intense bass levels.The rubber sealed control buttons are well laid out, convenient to operate, and have a positive click feature.  There are also tiny colored indicator lights, for various functions.  Once your Bluetooth device and the speakers are synched up, connection usually takes a few seconds at the most.  When connected via Bluetooth to your phone, the speakers can also be used to have a conversation.  You simply hit a button, and talk into the speakers, which will transmit your voice.When connected via Bluetooth, the volume can be controlled via your device, or by using the volume control buttons on the unit.  You can also use the ECOXBT with an iPod, or other MP3 player, by connecting via the aux in jack.  When hardwire connected, the volume buttons on the speakers do not work, so you will need to adjust the volume using the controls on your MP3 player.The unit is powered by a lithium ion battery, which can run the unit for about 10 hours.  There are no provisions for AC power, but the unit can operate while connected to USB power.  The ECOROX is available in different color schemes, and can receive signals up to about 30 feet away, however there has to be a clear unobstructed path (line of sight) between the two devices.  If there are walls or other obstacles in the way, you may experience reception problems.If you listen to music, play games, or browse the internet via your smart phone, these speakers could enhance the experience.  Targeted at those with a more active lifestyle, the ECOROX and ECOXBT speakers, cost a bit more than some low end models.  Those into hiking, camping, boating, water sports, or the outdoors, might want to consider the ECOROX, which is very handy, and doesn't take up too much space.The folks at Grace Digital graciously provided this item to me for review purposes.  They also manufacture amounting bracket, so the speakers can be conveniently mounted to your bicycle handlebars using the fitting on the bottom.  I'm not sure that this is something I would do, however I plan to buy one of these brackets, so I can mount a camera to my bike and shoot movies.
summary: the ECOROX is a compact and relatively powerful bluetooth speaker system...

reviewText: Recently my auto charger for my iPad had an "accident" which involved the cord breaking leaving me without a way to charge my iPad. Of course it happened when I most needed it, my iPad was at 30% and I was headed for a meeting. When I slipped into a local store to pick up a charger (like this one) I was surprised that a majority of those sold were 1.0 amps, not 2.1 amps - great for my iPhone, but less than I needed for my iPad.This charger - with two USB outlets has a total output of 2.1 amps and will fully support my iPad in the 2.1 amp side although it slows down some if I charge my iPhone into the second port.Because it is so small it fits nicely in the glove compartment and is handy whatever I bring with me, since I simply need to plug in my own cord. It fits tightly in my outlet in the car and worked well when I tested it.Based on the price at the time I am writing my review, it is a good deal. I received a complimentary sample to test in order to provide my review.
summary: Handy - charges my iPad ...

reviewText: This gadget really came in handy on a recent family vacation that took 4 hours driving to arrive.  Having 3 teenage kids in the vehicle playing with their smartphones and iPods I knew they were going to crying to recharge their electronics.  Since most cellphones and MP3 players only use about 1.0 Amps to charge, using the Etronic dual 12 Watt USB charger was the perfect solution.Since the car charger is only 2.1 amps it can only charge either two smartphones, MP3 players or even a digital camera since they require less amperage.  The iPad and most tablets require a least 2.1 amps and 10 watts to charge at a decent rate.  If you plan on using the charger for your iPad or tablet, do not connect any other device to the other open USB port or it will charge both devices at a very slow speed.The blue lights that indicate where the USB slots are located are not overly bright and make it easy to find during night driving.  The charger does not sit flush to the socket, but it does not stick out too bad.Overall great little gadget to have.Sample received for review purposes.
summary: Handy for long car rides

reviewText: It seems you can never have enough USB charger ports, since every electronic gadget I own seems to need one. My Jeep has two cigarette lighters in the front dash, but even that is not enough, especially when there are two people trying to charge cell phones, GPS systems and MP3 players.=== The Good Stuff ===* The dual USB ports is a nice feature. It lets me keep two cell phone chargers "live" at all times, a great convenience. I have never had any issues charging two iPhones simultaneously with this adapter.* The "nose" of the device is long enough that it fits all the way into the lighter, with about an inch and a half sticking out. That works great for me, because my lighters are mounted very low on the dash, so they don't get bumped. If your lighters are more in the line of dashboard traffic (like near the radio), this stickout length might be problematic.* The device seems reasonably well made, and is made of smooth white plastic with no rough edges. I have been using it for a couple weeks, and have had no problems with it.=== The Not-So-Good Stuff ===* One port is a high-current (2.1A) port, the other is rated for a lower (1.0A) current. The 2.1 was enough to charge my iPad, something I seldom do in the car. I did not try to charge both an iPad and a phone, but I was able to charge two iPhones at the same time with no problems. The only problem is that the labeling on the two ports is quite small-no way you could read it from the drivers seat unless you are part Eagle. If you do plan on regularly charging a high-current device, you will need to mark the port somehow.=== Summary===All things considered, a handy little device that does what is claims to do. It seems well made, and has shown no problems so far. My dash is black, so I would have preferred a different color, but not really a big deal to me.Disclaimer: I received this sample as a sample direct from the manufacturer for review. I have no interest, financial or otherwise, in the manufacturer or any of the principals in the company.
summary: Works OK. Seems Well Made.

reviewText: Yes, I'm happy with this charger.  I like having my ipod plugged in the same time as (always) one of our cell phones needs a charge.  I don't know about amps and such but I do know that this usb charger works great for us.  It also is nice because our older car does not jave a usb charger and this works good in that car too.  Now, I need another one so each car can have it's own.
summary: Get one for each car.

reviewText: .It's a nice simple car charger that re-fuels my iPad at close to full speed (see Note 1). However, there are some good 3.1-amp chargers for under $8 (see below). Those will charge a smartphone and an iPad at full speed simultaneously.3 or 4 stars is fair. A good-enough car charger at a nice price.PROs:- Compact- Nice PriceOKs:- Power status light is not too bright- Styling is plain, unobtrusive. No black version available.- Socket fit: OK in most 12v sockets. Tighter fit would be nice (see Note 2).- 1 year warrantyCONs:No real CONs, just some...Nit Picks:- The labels for 1.0A and 2.1A ports are very hard to read- No documentation or printed warranty enclosure was provided.- Unclear how each port handles Apple vs Non-Apple protocols- - - Alternatives - - -There are some nice 3.1-amp car chargers priced at $8 on a good day-PowerGen Dual USB 3.1A Car ChargerWHITE $8-Anker Dual USB 3.6A (2.1A + 1.5A) Car Charger(compact)-CoverBot Dual USB 3.1A Car Charger(lowest cost, also highly rated)- - - Disclosure - - -The manufacturer gave me this item for review. I believe my review is impartial.- - - Notes - - -Note 1: Charged iPad 3 from 46 to 62% in 60 minutes. That's close to full speed.Note 2: Socket fit - It's probably secure enough, but not as tight asPowerGenand some others, which have additional plastic spring-tabs. In one of my car sockets, the charger comes out of socket when trying to pull the USB cable out of the USB port. Minor hassle.About the reviewer: I try to be impartial and directly compare other products. 30% of my reviews are 5-star reviews. For reviews of free samples from manufacturers: 11% are 5-star reviews.~~~ Comments & questions welcome ~~~
summary: A good-enough car charger at a nice price

reviewText: I confess, I have half a dozen or so of these types of product laying about which I've gotten at various times.  This Etronic model is very similar to a couple others I've gotten over the past year.  Two ports, either piping 2A to one or 1A to both.  Visually, it's nothing special, fairly bland.  Off white housing with a blue LED to indicate it's active and to help you find it in the dark.  There are small engraved markings to indicate which port is capable of doing 2A, but it's not easy to read from a distance.  I ended up using from brightly colored paint to highlight the higher powered port, just to make it more obvious.  The material and construction are solid, no bending or flexing of the housing when a moderate amount of force is applied.  Running it on charge cycles with multiple devices over the course of a week, I ran into no issues, and the unit was barely warm to the to touch the whole time.  I pulled out a current meter and did some measurements to verify the units output, and it meets its claims.If you're in need of one of these type of things, or are thinking of getting one for someone else, this model isn't a bad way to go.  Definitely better than most of the bargain models I've come across, both in construction and likely reliability.*Disclosure: I was contacted by Amazon seller Mega Merchant, and given a sample of this product specifically for the purpose of reviewing it.*
summary: Can't complain

reviewText: When I received this, I was at first concerned that this charger would be slow since it has two ports, however, it charged at a good rate of speed TWO devices. Discovered that this particular charger has a total of 2.1 AMPS, which easily charges my Galaxy Tab 2 as well as my Galaxy Grand smartphone. It does take slightly longer because of this, yet, they both charge nicely.Also this charger does not stick out so no more hitting my knee when reaching over in my car.This charger I now keep in a zip lock bag with a USB Cable for my tablet and a micro cable for my phone so I will always have my dual car charger with me.So as I received this charger as a complimentary sample and I am happy to say that it is a very good charger and an excellent choice if you like to carry around two devices and need to charge them in your car.
summary: Dual Car Charger For My Tablet and My Phone - Gets The Job Done

reviewText: With USB charging becoming the default option for almost all small (and some large) consumer electronics devices, it is becoming increasingly important and indispensable to have an easy access to the USB charging plugs when you travel. More and more cars nowadays come equipped with at least one USB outlet, but the older cars are still unable to provide you with that kind of charging convenience. Fortunately, there are many USB chargers out there that can plug directly into the car lighter port, and this Etronics charger definitely has a lot to offer. It is well made, compact, and allows for a simultaneous charging of a smartphone and a tablet. The dual ports are conveniently accessible and easy to use. I've used this charger with my iPhone 4S and first generation iPad and was really satisfied with the experience. The charger is now a permanent addition to my road travel kit. Highly recommended.
summary: Compact and Effective USB Car Charger

reviewText: I was provided an Etronic 2.1 Amp / 12W Dual USB Car Charger for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ The charger is pretty small and only sticks out of your car's charging outlet about an inch and a half.♦ Has two ports for a total of 2.1A output (a 1.0A port and a 2.1A port share the total output capacity).♦ Fast charging speeds when charging a single device, and slightly slower when sharing the 2.1A output with two devices including an iPad.♦ Very compact for travel if you need to take a car charger with you on trips (renting a car at your destination for example).Detailed Review:♦ Look - I received a sample product that did not come in a retail package, so I cannot comment on the packaging or if it normally includes an instruction manual.  I only received the car charger.  It is a clean white car charger with a blue company logo on the top and two USB ports on the front.  The two USB ports are very faintly marked as a 1.0A port and a 2.1A port, but share the 2.1A total capacity. It also has an LED power indicator light on the front. It looks nice and small and it appears to have a very nice build quality.♦ Installation - As with any car charger, you basically just plug the unit into you car's charging outlet. It had a nice, tight fit and easily maintained the connection to the charging outlet.  It only stuck out about an inch and a half.  The white color matched my Apple Lightning cable, but just make sure the white color works for you.♦ Use and Performance - Once installed, I did some basic tests to see how the Etronic car charger handles various charging situations. During my work commute, I took my iPhone 5 that had 30% charge remaining and I did a stand alone test using both ports for 10 minutes each. Both ports increased the charge on my phone by 10% in ten minutes or 1% per minute. I was even streaming music to my car and received a call during charging, so charging performance was very good.  I then tried out the charging of my iPad 2 in the 2.1A port that is built for tablet type devices and the iPad indicated immediately that it was able to charge with the Etronic car charger and had no problem charging up. When charging both devices, it wasn't as fast as some 3.1A total output dual USB car chargers because it shares the 2.1A total capacity, but it did a fine job for the low price.Conclusion:Overall, this is a nice 2.1A Dual USB Car Charger. It is pretty small and has a nice quality build. The unit looks great and performs very well. If you are looking for a reasonably priced dual port USB car charger that has fast stand-alone charging speeds and works well with an iPad, this charger is worth consideration.
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy!

reviewText: This very inexpensive portable car charger is a real boost to families who need to charge phones or iPads etc while on the road. This slick little charger plugs into your car port and has two USB ports for charging two devices at the same time (and equally well! - because the design provides 2.1 amps - 1 amp per port).  The electronic design has circuitry that prevents over heating, over current and over charging: once a device is fully charged the process stops automatically. And as with many other ETRONIC devices there is an LED light that assures you the charger and the devices being charged are correctly placed and ready to charge.No more hauling our devices into the coffee shop or restaurant and asking for a table near an outlet. The upkeep and charging of the specified devices is all fulfilled by the little device in your car - iPad, iPhone, iPod, HTC, Blackberry, MP3 Players, Digital Cameras, PDAs, Mobile Phones.The packaging is well designed and can be used to store the device when not in use (in the glove compartment or seat divider), the instructions are clear, and just to reassure you that you have made a sound purchase, ETRONIC backs its product with a 1 year warranty. Another very fine product from ETRONIC. Grady Harp, October 13
summary: Keep one in the glove compartment!

reviewText: It seems hard to believe these days that there ever was a time that people got into their cars to go somewhere without dragging along half an electronics superstore with them.  We spend a lot of time in the car, which means we travel with a selection of iPads, Kindles, a tablet or two, and a range of cell phones, no two alike.  Trips longer than a couple of hours might even see us drag along a tiny DVD player - and of course all of those things invariably run out of juice and need to be charged.  For quite some while now we've traveled around with a box full of various car chargers - one for the Android phone, a different one for the older iPhone/Pod/Pads.  Still another for the new iPhone.  Yet another for this and that.  All of them with great long coiled cords to tangle together.  And forget charging to different devices at the same time!Then several weeks ago I received thisEtronic 2.1Amps / 12W Dual USB Car charger Designed for Apple and Android Devices (White)to test.  What a relief!  No more gaggle of tangled cords or arguments over whose device needs charging the most.  With two USB receptacles, this little gadget will charge two different devices at once and since each device uses the same USB charging cable that it came with, just one little gadget will cover them all.Grandma's $0.02 - An inexpensive replacement for your own gaggle of car-charging cords.
summary: Inexpensive and Compact Solution

reviewText: I charge my devices at home, but I always like some "insurance" power when I'm in my vehicle.  At the very least this charger will keep my phone and my AT&T; NetGear Unite card working.  Recently, I've also been using this charger for myXBOOM Mini Portable Capsule Speaker with Rechargeable Battery and Enhanced Bass+ Resonator - Black.What I like about it?  It slides easily into the auxiliary power slot in my truck.  With my old charger I had to use a lot of pressure to get it in and out of my vehicle's auxiliary power portal and I didn't like having to do that.  I never leave a charger plugged in if I'm not charging, so it doesn't matter if the charger comes out with the USB cord.I also like the subtle blue LED light that provides just a bit of light to guide your hand to plug in the cord.  Too bright a light is distracting.This simple little charger works just fine and I'm glad I have it.**I received a sample product from the distributor.
summary: More than adequate for my needs

reviewText: Etronic  2.1Amps / 12W Dual USB Car Charger is a handy charger to keep in the glove box of the car. It is small and ready to be plugged into the litter plug as need to charge either the phone or a tablet on a trip. The feature that my last charger did not have is the indicator light that indicates it is ready to charge.  I used it on a two-day trip over the holidays and it worked just fine to charge both the phone and tablet.Devise supplied to me for an honest review.  My experiences are my own and not influenced by receiving the devise as a gift.
summary: Etronic  2.1Amps / 12W Dual USB Car Charger

reviewText: The Etronic 2.1Amps / 12W Dual USB Car charger Designed for Apple and Android Devices (White) is an awesome device in that it allows both me and my wife to charge our phones on longer drives.Pros:Small size and duel portsWorks very well in efficient matter.Comes with a 1 year warrantyLight comes on when plugged in letting you know you have connection.Keeps me and the wife from fighting over whos phone is more important!!! (a fight I always lost)Just so you know:Does not come with usb to phone cords.I was given a free sample in return for a honest and fair reviewGreat product that I will keep using in the foreseeable future. A++
summary: Great charger!

reviewText: With so many mobile devices being used today, car chargers are a necessity for most people. Most of these devices do not include car chargers, so there's a big market for these chargers. The Etonic charger is a typical example of a dual port car charger, with its two charging ports providing a maximum 2.1 Amps. In most cases, that's sufficient power to recharge two phones simultaneously. I plugged in my Android phone and my wife's iPhone 4 on a forty-five minute drive, and the charger recharged both phones even while they were in use - one for GPS and one for telephone calls. On the way home, I switched the iPhone with a Nexus 7 tablet, and while both devices were charging, it was at a noticeably slower rate than with two phones, which was expected for a charger with a maximum total output of 2.1 Amps.Only 2 inches long, the Etonic is one of the most compact car chargers that I've seen. It has a very solid feel, and it slid into the car's power port easily but securely. The two USB ports are marked "1.0A" and "2.1A," although the labels are a bit hard to read. Bear in mind, though, that although the two ports may be interpreted as having a total of 3.1A total output, the total available output is actually 2.1A.Note that the charger does not include a charging cable, which you'll have to provide yourself.The verdict: The Etonic car charger is fine for charging one or two phones, or one tablet. It's a well made, durable charger that should give good service for years.A product sample was provided by the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: A compact, reliable car charger

reviewText: Hate sharing the one slot for your phone to charge while in the car?This product kicks major butt and is incredibly easy to use, great for multiple devices, and charges your devices fast and well.I would highly recommend this product for anyone who needs more than one slot for your devices.I use this for my smartphone and Mp3 or I can have a friend charge on the go as well.Simply, affordable, and invaluable for everyday or for the long holiday trips.
summary: Simple, Charges well, Perfect for on the go or everyday in your car.

reviewerName: Joel Avrunin "Electrical Engineer who loves S...
reviewText: First, this isn't a terrible product.  You get a nice compact car charger with two USB ports.  The charger can supply 2.1A, which is enough for you to charge a full size iPad from your car cigarette lighter.  The charger has a bright LED to let you know it is plugged in and charging.  It is uncomplicated and worked for one device such as my iPad with no issues.  The plastic is solid and the device feels rugged and well built.The problem is that you typically buy a 2 port charger to charge 2  devices.  The entire charger is just 12W, meaning that if you plug in a second device such as an iPhone, it can't supply 2.1A to the first device (the iPad) anymore.  It will charge both, but at a very slow rate.For a few bucks more, you can get theAnker 18W / 2.4A + 2.0A (3.6A max) Dual Port USB Car Charger for Apple Android and USB-Charing Devices - The First and Smallest Adapter to Provide Simultaneous, Full-Speed Charges to iPads and Smartphones [White].  At 18W, it can charge both an iPad on the 2.1A port and an iPhone on the 1A port simultaneously.  You can also get theBolse 4.2Amp 20W High Output Turbo Charge Dual USB Port Car Charger for iPad, iPhone 5, Samsung Galaxy S3 / S4, Amazon Kindle Fire, etc.orPawtec Signature Mini Dual USB Car Charger 5V 3.1A / 15W High-Speed For iPhone 5S/5C, iPad/Mini, Galaxy S4/S3/Note 2/3, Nexus, iPod, All Android Devices, All iPhonse, Smartphones & Tablets - BLACK.In short, this device is fine as a single port charger or charger for two low-power draw devices.  But when you can get a charger for the same price that can supply more power, it just seems that this one is a bit outdated.Note: I was provided a free sample from the manufacturer in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Underpowered for people who actually want two USB ports

reviewText: USB car chargers are a must have nowadays and dual chargers are even better. This is an Etronic 12W dual charger. One port is 2.1A for devices needing more power such as iPads and the other port 1A for smaller devices such as smart phones.This is a sleekly designed charger. Nothing is wasted. When plugged in, there is a blue light that tells you it's on. I tried a variety of USB cables and all fit perfectly. Once the battery is fully charged, the light will go off. The device also incorporates circuits that prevent overcharging and overheating.The current price is a very good one. I received a sample from the manufacturer for review purposes and the sample has convinced me it's a great buy!
summary: Excellent!

reviewText: It does what it says. My Android phone fits one slot, my wife's i-Phone the other. As others noted, the time can slow as 12W is the total power given over to charge.Unlike other reviewers, however, mine lacks an LED light unless the very soft light inside the ports themselves suffices as such, and the absence of such a feature must be included in my evaluation. Other such plug-in chargers (I had one but it was stolen when left in the car to be parked--and given the compact sized, these can be easily lost, too...) feature a light that may emit one color when charged and another when full. Mine did not.Provided by the distributor for review, my charger came in only a plastic baggie with no instructions or packaging. Mine, I suspect, may differ from yours. But it matches the picture shown on Amazon for Etonic 2.1 Amps/ 12W Dual USB Car Charger for Apple and Android Devices (White).
summary: Works as advertised

reviewText: In the car, I'm always in need of charging something while I'm out and about or on the road for business.  TheEtronic 2.1Amps / 12W Dual USB Car chargeris a truly affordable option for me to keep in the bag for the unexpected while on the road.Designed in solid plastic, this unit is quite durable and features plenty of power for the typical user.  The unit features 2 USB charging ports; one rated at 1Amp and one rated at 2.1amp.  The dulled indication lights are great for insuring the unit is plugged in right, but not too bright as to distract during night time driving.  The unit is very compact making it perfect for cars that have the cigarette lighter located in inconvenient spots.The unit is easy to use.  I used the USB cable that came with my phone and the one that came with my Nexus 7 and was charging immediately.  It is important to note that this charger does provide a total of 2.1Amps of power.  If you use both charging ports together at the same time, the charger will split the total 2.1Amps between the ports.Overall, this is a fantastic budget charger and is great for anyone that needs to keep a spare in your bag for any random occasion.  Just this past weekend, I found the charger extremely useful in a rental car I had that did not have any USB charging ports.  That made this product a true life saver.Disclosure: I received a sample product from the manufacturer for the purposes of providing this review. A review in exchange for the review sample was not promised. The views and opinions expressed in this review are my own, and in no way represent the views or opinions of the manufacturer or vendor.
summary: Affordable, Extremely Useful, Nice Product...

reviewText: I've tried a number of different car chargers. Some last, some don't. Some are really bulky, others are flimsy. This is a solidly built, two USB port charger. When plugged in securely, it illuminates in the middle with a gentle blue LED. I've been using it for a few weeks now for a hands free headset and my cell phone with no trouble at all.It stays put and doesn't pop out too easily but will pull out when given the right amount of effort.It has a sleek, smooth, white finish and is small enough to keep in a car pocket, glove compartment or center console.Overall, a good product at a nice price. I was provided a unit for evaluation and an honest review.
summary: Good, Slim, Dual USB Car Charger

reviewText: The Etronic Dual USB Car Charger fits snugly into our Malibu's cigarette lighter socket. It measures approximately 2 3/4" long & doesn't protrude as far into the console as some USB car chargers.  If you don't have too much room in that area, this car charger should work for you.This charger has 2 labeled USB ports (1A & 2.1A); however, it has a total output of 2.1 amps so if you're using the 2.1A port for your iPad or power hungry tablet & the 1A for your phone, mp3 player, etc, your iPad will charge slower than it would if it was the only device charging.  That being said, you can still charge two devices at once...it's just that charging might be slower.This charger has very important circuit protection: over-heated, over-current, & over-charging protection.  Charging will be automatically stop when battery is full.I charged my old LG Cosmos prepaid phone & my Kindle Fire HD at the same time with no problems.The ports are labeled, but the labels are hard to see.  Just remember that the 2.1A port is on the bottom of the charger.Nice charger which performs as advertised.5 starsIf my opinion changes, I'll update my review.I was provided a sample for an honest review.
summary: Charge two devices at once...Fits snugly...Over-heated, over-current, & over-charging protection

reviewText: This compact dual port USB car charger from Etronic is the simplest one I've seen and it's ideal for charging electronic devices on the go.  It has a clean, streamlined design that fits securely in the cigarette lighter port.There are two USB ports, one for 2.1 A devices and one for 1.0 A devices;  I filled in the labels on the ports with a Sharpie so they would be easier to see.  Total power output is 2.1 A.This little charger is 2 1/2 in. long and less than 1 in. tall so it is unobtrusive when in use and will easily fit in a pocket or in the automobile's ashtray.It's so easy to use that no directions are needed!
summary: Compact and straightforward car charger

reviewText: The Etronic USB car charger is light, small and useful. It has two USB ports so you are able to charge two devices at the same time. I prefer 2-3 ports adapters as it makes life easier when you have to charge more than one item. It cuts down on the clutter and charges your electronics fast. It has two clearly specified USB ports (1.0A & 2.1A) for those finicky Apple devices (the iPad).The adapter has a blue light that turns on when it is plugged in. At the current price of less than $10, this is a good purchase option.Note: This item was provided for review purposes.
summary: Efficient 2 port adapter

reviewText: This is one of those items that is easy to lose, so you may be here looking for a replacement.  This is a good one!  The build quality and look are a bit better than you'd expect for the price, though nothing spectacular.  Like others, it includes both 2 and 1 Amp ports.  It would be great it they had used different color LEDs to distinguish which is which, or maybe an asymmetrical design.  Otherwise, I have no complaints!I didn't pay for this personally, but if I lose this one I'd gladly pay for the next.
summary: For Us Losers

reviewText: This is one handy little charger! It's small enough to tuck away in your purse or even your pocket. It works perfectly and is compatible with several different devices. We used it with our iPad, iPhone, and Kindle Fire and it worked great with all three. One end of the USB plugs into your car port and the other side has outlets for two different devices. Yep, you can actually charge two things at one time! The built in circuits make certain it does not overheat or overcharge your device. Once it's adequately charged, it simply stops feeding juice into your device.  This is a affordable option that works great and prevents having to lug around a dozen different chargers when you're on the go.
summary: Awesome charger!

reviewText: I've used the Etronics car charger to charge my iPhone, Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet and power bank. It works fine, but feels a little slow. There's a 1 amp port and a 2.1 amp port, but it's hard to see the markings unless we pull it out and look at it in the light. If two products are plugged in, it gives a maximum of 2.1 amps, thus the slowness.Speaking of light, the blue power light is a little dim in bright daylight. It's hard to tell it's on. Also, the plug is not flush with the dashboard. That makes it easy to find. If you want one that looks like it's more a part of the car, this will not work.The car charger functions as advertised. I haven't had any problems with it. I find it useful on road trips, when the children are busy on their tablets or handheld games.This product was provided for review by Mega Merchant.
summary: Works As Advertised

reviewText: Its a  dual usb car charger not the reinvented wheel so it is very similar to every other car charger out there. If you've got 2 devices that are in need of charging during travel and you've got this then your in luck.It charged my phone and my husbands phone very quickly which is always nice since I always seem to leave the house with a low battery. This particular product doesn't come with the cord so if you need one keep that in mind. However most phone chargers have the removable cord these days so it may not be an issue.Overall its a sharp look nice and small and gets the job done. Its "currently" reasonably priced so if you need one like this go for it.**I was provided a sample of this product to test and review. All opinions are honest and my own.**
summary: It is what it is

reviewText: Note: I received a sample product for review.There are a zillion USB chargers out there. This one stands out for a couple of reasons.1. It's sturdy. So many of these fail quickly. This one looks like it's going to last (given the usual caveats of not driving a truck over it or otherwise abusing it). It's well made in critical areas and won't come apart. This is a big deal, bigger than it sounds, as you'll know if you used some of the other cheesy stuff out there.2. It has overload and overcharge protection built in. It won't fry your expensive stuff, drain your car battery to nothing, or start a fire.3. It has great capacity (with one limitation). One port gives you 2 amps, the other 1 amp. The limitation is that a total of 2 amps is provided so if you're using both ports together, you get 1 amp out of each. If you need a fast charge just use the 2 amp port by itself. If you're less pressed for time, charge your phone and tablet simultaneously.4. It is very inexpensive. You really get a lot for your money.If you're looking for a 2-port car charger, I can recommend this one. It's a great value and performs as it should.
summary: Good design, works well, great value for the money

reviewText: This is an ideal companion for long road trips. With so many chargers, and cables I always try to minimize the clutter in car near the dashboard area. with that in goal, 2.1A Dual USB Car Charger is an ideal companion for long road trips. An advantage of this is this has circuit design with over-heated, over-current, over-charging protection and charging will stop battery is full. Excellent quality and looks very durable. I was able to charge a smartphone and a MP3 player on the go. I use a retractable USB cable which has micro-mini-USB-iphone tips at the end for even more clutter saving.This white dual USB car charger is highly recommended! I was provided this product in exchange of a fair and honest review.
summary: Awesome for reducing clutter and for long road trips

reviewText: I like this product. It works great with my Iphones. It is handy and easy to use. I like the fact that it has two ports for charging more than one device at a time. The two ports have different amp output. One is 1.0A and the other is 2.1A. I used both with my cell phones and they charged in both ports. Recommended.I received this product for an honest review.
summary: Handy!

reviewText: The Etronic dual USB charger works just as you would expect.Plug the charger into the port on your car, plug your Apple/Android/other USB chargeable device USB end of the charging cable in, plug the device in and it works.For your Apple devices, you will want to use the 2.1 A rated port, which is labeled, but can be difficult to read in lower lighting conditions. You can plug any device into the 2.1 A port as well, but the Apple devices really want that 2.1 A port.The 1.0 A port can be used on devices that allow that as well. I've charged a non-Smartphone on it and it works just fine.The design is slick, understated and best of all, it does exactly what you want it to.Highly recommended.I received a review sample in exchange for a fair review. I review everything I receive as if I've paid for it. If I need another car charger in the future and this one breaks, I'd definitely put money on it.
summary: inexpensive and can charge an Apple or Android device

reviewText: The Etronic USB car charger is a decent, inexpensive solution for anyone who needs to charge a USB device in the car. These days, quite a few cars come with USB ports built in, but they don't always charge certain devices effectively (or at all). The USB input in my Honda Fit does charge my iPod Classic and my old iPhone 4, but it doesn't work consistently with my iPhone 5s and it never works for my friend's Android phone. The Etronic USB charger solves the problem and provides the correct voltage to most effective charge either an Apple or Android device.It's small and easy to toss in the glove compartment when you're not using it. My main complaint is that it's difficult to tell which port is which. On the face of the unit, there are tiny letters etched into the plastic that tell you which port is which, but it's very hard to read unless you hold up the unit and look at it closely. This isn't the sort of thing you want to do while driving so you need to either memorize which port to use or plug in your device while stopped.Overall, this is a good unit at a great price. Recommended.Disclosure: I was given a product to review. This did not influence my opinion or evaluative approach.
summary: A good unit at a great price

reviewText: The Etronic 2.1Amps / 12W Dual USB Car charger is a small device to charge multiple types of electronic equipment to include: iPhone, iPod, digital camera, MP3 player and more.Pros:+ Has a blue light that turns on when plugged in which is a good visual indicator that it is working+ Has two plugs: one 2 Amp port for iPad and one 1 Amp port for phones or other devices. I do not recommend charging two devices at the same time.+ Versatile and can be used with mobile phones, PC's, laptops, tablets, mp3 music players, MP4 video players and gaming systemsCons:- Not strong enough to charge two devices at once. I recommend you only use one plug at a time for best results.- Labels for 1.0A and 2.1A ports are very small and difficult to readOverall Assessment:The Etronic 2.1Amps / 12W Dual USB Car charger is effective for charging one device. I use this for my phone and it works excellent. Although there are two plugs available this unit is not strong enough to effectively provide power to two devices at once. If you are charging only one device it works excellent and will provide you with the needed power that your device requires.I recommend this car charger as long as you use it within its capabilities.I was provided a complimentary sample to review.
summary: Nice Charger for your Vehicle

reviewText: The Etronic Dual USB 2.1 amp car charger is a must have for those who want to be able to charge 2 devices simultaneously in a car.The charger has 2 USB ports. One of the USB ports is labeled “1A”, has a max output of 1 amp, and the other is labeled “2.1A” which has a max output of 2.1 amps both at 5 volts. The 2.1 amps of power are shared between the 2 USB ports. This is a good car charger. I really like this car charger and I plan to use a lot so I don’t have to fight for a car outlet with my family.  This car charger is small for the good amount of power it gives.Overall this is a great car charger. I recommend this to people who need to charge 2 smartphones at once.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation, and I promised that my review is fair and honest.
summary: Good car charger that is good for charging 2 smartphones simultaneously

reviewText: A wall charger is a wall charger is a...True but try to plug the Etronic into your wall outlet and the USB charging ports are going to be pointing either down at the floor and it would be quite difficult to stick your charging cable in or straight up, looking at the ceiling and I am not comfortable with that orientation either because plugging 4 wires into it that way could have some effect on my wall outlet's structural integrity, depending on how strong the various attached wires/devices are going to pull down. On the bright side, the illuminated charging ports could make for a nice 24hr blue night light and they only consume 0.5W.The total 2.1A output is shared by the 4 ports so plugging 4 devices at the same time will result in long charge times which probably defeats the 4-port premise.It's a 3 stars (Okay) not because the vendors sent me this 'for review' unit at no charge but because it does work to some extent and because the price appears to be a little lower than similar devices currently available at Amazon.
summary: It's mostly the design

reviewText: I have many 2-port chargers. All of them have the same issue - one of the ports will charge 2.1 while the other will only charge 1.0. Some are clearly marked, others are guesswork (I plug into one port and see if it charges, if not, I use the other port). Not so fun.In this case, the Quad Port charger is very different from all of the rest. All four ports will charge my iPad. All I have to do is plug it into one, any one of them. As you are likely aware, you can charge your 1.0 on a 2.1 charger but not the other way around, so having this handy little device around is awesome.Why four? Well, yesterday I spent a number of hours charging up my back up batteries as winter approaches. I keep a couple in my car and a couple in bedrooms. They act as both a flashlight and backup to our 2 iPads, iPod touch, and iPhone. The four port charger would have permitted me to charge all of them at once.Even better, when traveling, this will permit you to use that single, inconveniently located outlet in your hotel room to plug in four devices.I am not certain what they mean by the "max output." I plugged in two iPads and my iPhone and all indicated they were receiving enough power to charge them (and they always let me know when they aren't).Because of the way this is made, you can unplug the prongs to carry it more easily in your suitcase. My surge protector is designed for this type of device so I did not have to worry about it covering another outlet, something that could be a problem if you are using it directly on a wall.All-in-all, a very nice device, but again, I particularly appreciated the fact that all FOUR ports will support 2.1.
summary: No more trying to decide which port is which

reviewText: I tested Etronic Quad Port USB 2.1A 10W AC Quad USB Port Wall Charger with Samsung Galaxy 7.7 Tablet (ICS 4.0.4) and iPad Mini.I own several wall chargers and run the same set on tests on each of them, so they can be compared to each other using "apples to apples" comparison. This set of tests allows me to provide unbiased results as the numbers speak for the performance of each unit. These comparison tests I am quite pleased with this charger.My methodology is to charge each mobile device on each port of the unit for 10 minutes and measuring how much each unit was charge in that 10 minute period. I also charged my two devices at the same time. Each line in the table below represents a separate 10 minute test, 20 tests in total.I use Battery App by Elvison to determine how each device recognized the charging source. 'AC' status means the charging is at full charging rate. 'USB' status indicates charging at a lower charging rate. 'Discharging' status means that the charging rate is below the power that the device is consuming so it slows down the discharge rate but does not re-charge.I am attaching a collage of photos as video. They show the charger during the test with various devices. In the photos can also see a close up of the charger itself.The charger is 2" long, 3" tall, and 1 1/8" wide. If you use it on the old fashioned power strips this charger would cover 2 slots. Etronic wall charger has removable prongs for easier packing when you travel. I prefer retractable prongs rather than a separate piece that can be lost. It is also possible that this charger can take prongs for different countries, but I do not see other prongs being sold by Etronic at this time.The four ports of the charger are not marked, so I refer to them as Ports 1,2,3,4 counting from the top in the tables below that show the results of my tests.✔ Samsung Galaxy Tablet 7.7--------------------------Port 1 ----- discharging ............. 0% change in charge in 10 minutes (enough charge to run the screen without discharging)Port 2 ----- discharging ............. 0% change in charge in 10 minutes (enough charge to run the screen without discharging)Port 3 ----- discharging ............. 0% change in charge in 10 minutes (enough charge to run the screen without discharging)Port 4 ----- discharging ............. 0% change in charge in 10 minutes (enough charge to run the screen without discharging)✔ iPad Mini--------------------------Port 1 ----- AC ............. 5% change in charge in 10 minutesPort 2 ----- AC ............. 5% change in charge in 10 minutesPort 3 ----- AC ............. 5% change in charge in 10 minutesPort 4 ----- AC ............. 5% change in charge in 10 minutes➨ Key findings:------------------This charger works well for iPad Mini. It does not work for Samsung Galaxy. I recommend it for iPad Mini users as it shows the fastest charging result for iPad Mini of all the wall chargers I have tested.Ali Julia review
summary: Excellent for iPad Mini, does not work for Galaxy tab

reviewText: The Etonic Quad Port USB 2.1A 10W AC Travel Wall Charger comes in handy when charging multiple items like cellphones, MP3 players, GPS, digital cameras, handheld games, speakers or tablets. Anything that uses a USB cable to charge.You have to keep in mind the more slots you use the more you are splitting the output and less current travels to each device.  That means it will take more time to charge your devices.1 device 2.1 Amps at 5 Volts2 devices 1.05 Amps at 5 Volts3 devices .70 Amps at 5 Volts4 devices .52 Amps at 5 Volts(Maximum output is 2.1 Amps at 5V)The prongs are detachable and can be change for foreign travel needs.  The different wall plugs are not included.  The charger itself is quite large and will take up quite a bit of space on a surge protector or wall socket.This Quad Port USB Charger is perfect to use when charging multiple items overnight while sleeping.  I have mine set up night to my nightstand with my cellphone, iPad and Bluetooth speaker plugged into it.Besides the big size, overall nice gadget to have and offered at a great price.Sample received for review purposes.
summary: Tad big, but overall handy gadget to have

reviewText: After reading the other reviews I was surprised as for me, this unit works fine on the devices that tried thus far. So I was able to get my tablet and other three devices to charge overnight and all charged to 100 percent. Note that I used high quality Samsung USB Cable that is the original cable that came with my devices. Also I plugged in the tablet in the top port. So for me, this unit worked well and I am very pleased with it. For me, I plan to use this for traveling purposes as I can charge 4 devices at the same time.Listed below are the devices I tested:1) In top port: Tab 2 10.1 Tablet (charged very well)and I used Samsung USB Cable to use for charging. Keep in mind that I had three other devices plugged in as well. The amperage needed for the Tab 2 is 1.5 AMP so this charger did a superb job and charged it to 100 percent.2) Samsung Grand Phone - This requires about one amp. It charged right along with my other devices just fine.3) Samsung Player 5.0 - This device charged very well. This unit I selected to test because it is very finicky where charging is concerned and usually will only charge on a real Samsung charger! But it charged to 100 percent on this unit with no problems.4) Samsung Player 4.2 - Same thing here: This device charged very well. This unit I selected to test because it is very finicky where charging is concerned and usually will only charge on a real Samsung charger! But it charged to 100 percent on this unit with no problems.One more thing I will say from my own experience about USB charging cables: All are not made equal. In the past, I tried a cheap cable (no name brand) and the cable was thin and cheap looking. Then I plugged it into my Samsung charger and the device refused to charge at all. Simply would not begin the charge! When I unplugged that cable and inserted the Samsung cable or tried a higher end cable, the charge began. So be sure to use a high quality cable on this device.**Note that I received this unit for testing purposes and I did just that. And I am happy to report that I am happy with this product. This is an honest review that reflects what I discovered with this unit.
summary: This Charged My Tablet and Three Other Devices

reviewText: This four port USB wall charger works, but its bulk and low output when using all four ports just doesn't compare to another four-port outlet that I own. Although this wall charger is designed for travel, you have to manually attach the prongs or leave them attached, which in either case doesn't make for a compact package. I'd much rather have the prongs fold into the body. And if I'm going to have four ports, I'd like to be able to charge four devices at full speed. Other wall chargers that I own have at least one 2.1 amp port for charging an iPad, and this remains constant, no matter how many other devices are attached. Not so with the Etronic Quad Port.I tested this with four devices -- iPad, iPhone, iPod, and Kindle -- all of which had 50% or less battery charge remaining. To mimic what I would do in a hotel room, I plugged them in using the Etronic Quad port before going to bed and unplugged them first thing in the morning. All four had full charges by morning. The sticking point, however, was the iPad, which displayed "not charging" after a few minutes of being plugged in. Still, it continued to charge. This also happens when I plug the IPad into certain USB hub ports because there isn't enough power running through them. It charges, but at a very slow rate. Using the Etronics with the iPad and other devices at the same time was the equivalent of using a low-powered USB port on my computer.This wall charger is okay if you won't include a tablet in your four devices or if you'll always use it overnight. In fact, it's quite convenient to be able to charge four devices from one power source. Note: I received a sample for review-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: A Little Too Bulky and Inefficient For a Travel Charger (3+ stars)

reviewText: As the number of small electronic devices has greatly proliferated in recent years, a great new trend has emerged: almost all of these devices can be charged using some form of the standard USB charger. Even though at the device end of the charging cable there are still many existing standards, the USB plug seems to justify the U in its name - it is becoming pretty near universal. However, the sheer number of such devices that I travel with - iPhone, iPad, Kindle, headphones, et.c - still means that I usually have to remember to take with me at least three or four chargers if I am to be able to charge all of my gadgets simultaneously. This is why I am always excited to come across a solution that can simplify my digital life and make it more tractable. This wall charger is definitely one such device.This charger enables you to simultaneously charge up to four different devices. All four of its its USB ports carry 2 A currents, which means you can simultaneously charge up to four different tablets. I've used this charger several times already, and was indeed able to charge four devices simultaneously. The charger is pretty solidly built, and it seems pretty reliable.I do have one issues with this charger though: The wall prongs are not foldable/retractable. This might not be as much of an issue with the small single/purpose chargers, but putting this kind of charger in your travel bag directly is less than ideal.There are also some external batteries that are about the size of this charger that can serve dual purpose: charging your devices when plugged in the wall AND while you are away from any wall outlets. If you anticipate needing to recharge your devices on-the-go, those external batteries might be a better solution for your needs.
summary: Pretty Good Wall Charger

reviewText: I was provided an Etronic Quad Port USB 2.1A Travel Wall Charger for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ The charger is pretty small for a four port charger.♦ Has four ports ports that share a total of 2.1A output.♦ It had fast charging speeds when charging two devices, but will slow down as you add more devices due to the low total output.♦ Removable prongs for travel.♦ Good trade-off between speed and compactness for a four port charger.Detailed Review:♦ Look - I received a sample product that did not come in a retail package, so I cannot comment on the packaging or if it normally includes an instruction manual. I only received the wall charger. It is a clean white wall charger with a blue company logo on the side and four USB ports pointing downwards (or upwards if you plug it in upside down). The four USB ports share the 2.1A total charging capacity. It also has an LED power indicator light around the ports.  The prongs detach with the press of a button and gives you two separate pieces for travel.  It looks nice and appears to have a nice build quality.♦ Use and Performance - I plugged it into a wall outlet and did some basic testing to see how the Etronic wall charger handles various charging situations.Test #1 (Single Charging) - I first tried charging my iPhone 5 by itself.  It had a charge of 20% at the start and after 30 minutes, the charge increased to 54%.  Better than 1% per minute, which is a very fast charging rate.  The charger performed well when charging a single phone.Test #2 (Simultaneous Charging) - Later that day, I took my iPhone 5 that had 32% charge and my iPad 2 that had 34% charge and charged them simultaneously.  After 10 minutes, the iPhone charge increased to 43% and the iPad increased to 37%.  Again, very good results when charging two devices at the same time.  This is basically the best you are going to get because adding additional devices will continue to eat into the 2.1A total charging capacity.Conclusion:Overall, this is a nice 2.1A Quad Port USB Wall Charger. It is pretty small and compact for such a large number of ports.  It also has a nice quality build.  The total 2.1A output will not give you the fastest charging when charging four devices, but it does very well when charging one or two, and the additional ports can be used as needed.  Competing four port chargers have a much bigger form factor, so you are trading charging speed for compactness.  If you are looking for a quad port USB charger with good speeds in a small form factor, the Etronic is worth a look.
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy!

reviewText: ETRONIC  knows its field and has obviously done extensive research to produce a product that not only does what it claims it will do, but accomplishes that mission in a completely safe and very speedy way.First, the deign is streamlined and easily tucked into your briefcase for travel. The device has a top-sided LED light that indicates when the charger is functioning and the device knows when the charge is complete and shuts off without draining the power form the item being charged.But perhaps the most reliable and best feature of this wall charger (by the way, it goes into any AC outlet) is that you can charge from one to four items all at once. No more individual units that take up every outlet in the room, this single adapter has four USB ports so that charging the digital camera, iPhone, MP3 player, mobile phones, iPad - anything that requires charging can be done simultaneously up to four devices at a time. The warranty puts your mind at ease: the item will not over heat, over charge and stops charge any of the four items plugged in when the charge is complete - and the charge is VERY fast.This is a quality product with no flaws detectible.  Highly Recommended. Grady Harp, October 13
summary: Handsome design, small yet powerful, works very well

reviewerName: Joel Avrunin "Electrical Engineer who loves S...
reviewText: The Etronic Quad Port USB charger works for what it is designed to do which is charge up to 4 devices at a time via USB ports.  All of the ports are recognized by my iPad as valid ports to charge, and they can supply 2.1A to charge the iPad at a full rate.  The problem is that the entire charger can only supply 2.1A, so if you plug in more devices, the 2.1A will be shared and the iPad will charge extremely slowly (as will your other devices).  It is senseless to have 4 ports and only 10W/2.1A of power.The other issue is that the company designed a travel charger, but in an attempt to make it country universal, the plug itself is a large plastic snap-on connection with a US power plug on it.  This saves them money on making different devices for Europe and Asia, but makes it far bigger for travel.I really like the Bolse 4 Port Premium High Output USB Wall/Travel/AC Rapid Charger (4 Amps / 20Watt / Fastest Speed) For iPhone, iPad, Samsung Android Smartphones - White as an alternative as it has a flip-out plug (far easier for packing than the Etronic plug) and has twice the power, so you really can charge 4 devices at once.If you are not going to travel, theEasyAcc 25 Watts 5V / 5A 4-Port USB Wall Charger (5V 2A x 2 & 5V 1A x 2) Multi Port USB Portable Charger battery charger for iPhone, iPad, iPod, Smartphones, 5V Tablets, Gopro, Bluetooth Speakers & Headphonesalso has 4 ports, but with 25W you certainly won't run out of power.I also was not a big fan of the ultra-bright blue light up USB ports.  A small indicator light is fine, but this thing is practically a night light.As I said, 3 stars because it does work as claimed, but is not a great value with only 10W of power, and the shape is a little unwieldly for travel.Note: I was provided a free sample from the manufacturer in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Not much of a travel charger and not much of a 4 port charger

reviewText: I like this four port plug and it's solid design. It does have some limitations though. It is pretty bulky and if plugged into a wall socket, it tends to be heavy and want to tip. It also means that you have to decide if you want the USB ports to be facing straight up or straight down. They are not accessible from the front (or parallel to the wall).It has two LED lights that illuminate it when it is plugged in. It did a fine job with my smartphone and Kindle but will not charge my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet (but really, many wall plugs don't accommodate that tablet).Overall, a nice design with rounded edges and compact USB ports. But the placement of the ports could be trouble depending on where you want to plug it in.I was provided a unit for evaluation and an honest review.
summary: Solid Plug, Easier to Plug into Floor Strip

reviewText: The Etronic USB wall charger has four ports, great for charging multiple devices.  Can it charge four devices at once?  Yes, but it may be slow.The results after an hour of charging an iPhone and three tablets at the same time:iPhone 4S: 59% --> 95%original Kindle tablet: 16% --> 23%Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet: 25% --> 26%7" android tablet: 0% --> 3%I brought the Etronic with me on a trip but found it is better suited to my office.  The blue light is not dimming.  In my office, I don't mind it at all, but it's too bright for a hotel room.  Also, the plug doesn't fold or retract.  All my travel USB wall chargers have foldable or retractable plugs.  That's keeps them from bending or rubbing holes in things.In the office, it functions well.  I haven't had any problem with it.  I like the overheat, overcurrent, and overcharge protection.  They are a must for any USB charger.  I just leave it and forget about it, knowing my devices will be fine when I get back.This product was provided for review by Mega Merchant.
summary: Better for Office Use

reviewText: This is a charger for all your cellphones, MP3 players, digital cameras or any device that plugs on USB. The total for all 4 slots is 2.1A which is on the low side compared to most other USB chargers in the market. You can use all 4 slots at the same time but it will not work if you plug power hungry gadgets like iPads, Kindles, etc.When I first opened this charger, it came in two separate pieces. You first connect the plug with the charger before you can use it. If for some reason you want to detach the plug from the body, there is a small rectangle that you need to press just below the prongs before you can pull it out.At the time of this review, this charger sells for under 15 bucks which is still a good value for a 4-slot USB charger.A sample of this product was sent to me for review purposes.
summary: A good value basic charger

reviewText: The conundrum of the modern life is USB charging. (OK, maybe there are more important things going on...).If you have a family that all have all kinds of USB chargeable devices, you know the annoyance of having all these chargers plugged in and taking up a wall outlet, or all the outlets on a surge protector. In steps Etronic with a very well made, easy to use, 4 USB chargeable at 2.1 A wall charger. Because it puts out 2.1 A, it will charge just about anything you plug into it.iPad, iPhone, Android and my Blackberry 9900 all charge fine, all at the same time, on this charger.The description says it's for travel, which given the weight, if you need the capability and don't have enough ports on your laptop or don't want to carry a larger "Wall Wart" sized device, is perfect.Highly recommended.I received a free review sample from the manufacturer for review purposes. I review everything I receive as if I've paid for it, and if I needed another 4 port USB charger, I'd buy this.
summary: Great

reviewText: These sync cables worked perfectly with my iPad 2. I appreciate the length because I often use them with a plug when my iPad is running low.They stayed tightly connected in my iPad and charged it well.The bright and cheery colors were helpful when I had to use them in the hospital, it made them easy to spot and remember to bring home.
summary: it made them easy to spot and remember to bring home

reviewText: I’m not the iPad user in my family; I have two daughters who have several Apple products, and – as perhaps some of you out there might POSSIBLY have noticed – sisters sometimes “borrow” from each other and “misplace” that which they have borrowed. Following such a RARE occurrence, there is at times the slightest amount of “friction.” Perhaps some might concur?Anyway, this package of three six-foot cables is a godsend: they are really brightly colored and make identification of one’s cable a sure-thing…it’s hard to dispute whose was whose with these. (After having written this, I was surprised to find that the promotion on Amazon’s product page was using the SAME argument!)This package of three cables is a nice product: the cables are supple and reasonably thick, and feel as if they are of a good quality. Their connectors, too, seem well made – both the metal connectors at the extreme ends, and the juncture of connector to cable seems nice and firm and rubbery as well.One of the company’s notes on this page is worth repeating: don’t expect ANY higher-end Apple product to charge from a USB port on a computer: these ports do not achieve the 1.8 amp speed necessary to charge them.NukePak’s cables carry an unconditional two-year warranty.NOTE: I was supplied this product free of charge with no other conditions other than my writing a fair and honest review -- which this is.
summary: Bright, colorful, and durable cables: an end to arguments?

reviewText: This Bundle of 3 Premium Certified 6.5 Feet Extra Long USB cables are decent quality and work well when a really long connection is needed. We use these on our shop point of sale units (iPad based) when the battery is too low. The long cable length is ice as it lets us move around a little more behind the sales counter or allows us to show customers options on the screen.The cables are well made but care should be taken to avoid stress on the ends. We did pull one of the connectors off when the iPad was dropped, but I'm not sure an OEM cable would have survived that either.Recommended!CFHNote: Sample provided to review
summary: Good Long Cables - Recommended

reviewText: This bundle of 3 Certified 6.5 Feet Extra Long Charger Cables are perfect for your Apple iPhones (4, 4s, 3gs), iPod Touches (1, 2 ,3, 4), and iPads (1, 2, 3).  The manufacturer includes a 2 Year Warranty on all its Cables.  I found the cables to be durable and well made.  I am glad I have this product and would definitely recommend it to others.Thank you for reading my review.I was provided with a sample to test and evaluate.
summary: Nice durable cables for apple products

reviewText: These 30 pin USB cables are 6.5 feet long which are longer than the standard cables that come with an iPad or iPhone. The extra length comes in handy at times. You can pick from a variety of different colors and I chose to try the Blue, Pink and Purple combo pack. I like the color of all three cables and the colors would be great to split up among family members. For example your Son might like the blue cable and your Daughter might like the purple and pink cables. All three cables come in a resealable bag. I will say that these cables are a little harder to plug into my iPad than any of the other cables that I have used. Maybe in time it will become easier as they are broken in but right now they are substantially more difficult to plug in. Other than that they seem to be satisfactory cables for both preforming sync and charging.I have tried a variety of different 30 pin USB cables and these are neither the worst nor the best that I have used. In terms of quality they aren't as durable as some of the others that I have used. Having said that I haven't yet had a problem with one of them and they are priced extremely fair. At the time of my review a three pack of these cables is only ten bucks. At ten bucks for a package of three I would gladly be willing to take my chances. If you look for the best deal and not necessarily worried about getting the best quality then these would likely be a good choice for you.Sample provided for review.
summary: Decent quality, excellent price

reviewText: I hate paying full price for iPhone cables, so I've purchased tons of cheap cables for our family's phones.  I've had good luck and bad, but I finally decided that the only way to have a chance of getting a working cable was to buy them in bulk:  Buy five or six and cross your fingers that only one of them will be DOA.I got nervous when I saw all the bad reviews for these cables.  The manufacturer sent me a 3-pack to evaluate, but then I saw that they didn't have a very good track record.  With that in mind, I figured I'd better be pretty rough on these cables.  First I started by just plugging in each of them and making sure that they all worked out of the pack.  Check.  Three working cables.  Then I got rough with them.  I wound them up into tight balls to try to kink them.  I tugged on each of the connectors and couldn't get any of them to come loose.  I got really rough with one of them and pulled really hard (not as hard as I could, but with about the same amount of pressure as when I trip over a cable or drop my phone off the table).So far I haven't had problems with any of these cables.  I treat my stuff with care, but I couldn't really force any errors with these.  The connectors seem solid and the cabling itself is very sturdy (thick coated PVC material).  I can't say for sure based on this batch of three cables, but it seems like they managed to correct whatever problems they had in the past.I was provided this item for review.
summary: Quality problems fixed?

reviewText: But all the reviews--current ones too--that talk of problems, got me to wondering about this company's so-called two-year guarantee.  I wondered why all the people who had trouble with these cables just didn't contact NukePac and have them send out new ones.Well, I found out there is a very good explanation:  Not a happy one, though, but a very frustrating one!  Seems to me there is a lot of big talk, but very little to back it up.  The back of the zip lock package that these cables came in says this:  "We love to hear from our customers and it really helps our business grow when you let us know how we did...  So, first of all, if any NukePak product ended up a dud for you, please let us know and we'll help you out."  Oh, really?  How?  As far as I can tell, the only way to talk to NukePac is through Amazon and the only recourse is to return the product at your own expense.  Been there, done that--and don't like that treatment at all!  To me, that is not a great warranty.  And if you wait more than 30 days, even Amazon's A to Z guarantee program won't help you.  How one would get NukePac to make good on a two-year guarantee is a mystery to me!I tried accessing the NukePac website and reached a "forbidden" site.  I tried the extended web address that I found on the box of another NukePac product (ending in /warranty-registration) and it didn't work either.I'm not saying that there is anything wrong with the cables I received.  These cables work for me--so far, so good.  They are average-looking, and similar in quality to what I have been receiving lately along with the larger external battery chargers that I've been getting lately.  They are adequately made, cable is not thin and connections seem tough.  Pins seem well-seated inside the plugs and neither metal frames nor insides are cock-eyed.  Colors are very bright.So, bottom line with this product:  You put your money down; you take your chances.  So, buyer beware!  Me, I got these cables as a sample from NukePac, to try out and review.  So, I did not pay for these--so no sweat off my back if they stopped working, yet I am still wary for people who will be laying out hard-earned money for these!  My work fine, but will yours?  Just so you know, NukePac advises reviewers on the back of this packaging (poor English is theirs, not mine):  "...we would love a positive feedback on Amazon (Note: only 4 Star and 5 Star ratings are consider positive)."  Yes, they really felt it necessary to add that note...  I guess I blew that!
summary: My only concern: I can't contact seller to confirm warranty

reviewerName: Jeri Zerr "formerly a Road Warrior of the Nth...
reviewText: I am very content with the quality of these cords, especially given the value.  So far they have held up fine for me with moderately light use over a couple months. They would not likely hold up to the rather hard on his devices foster teen, but then again, even the high quality OEM cords supplied with his Samsung devices have usually ended up in pieces within a couple months. I received this pack for reviewing purposes, if my experiences become otherwise I will be updating this review.
summary: Decent quality for the price, not indestructible but neither are the high end cables.

reviewText: I received these as a product review sample and was pretty wary to try them as as I looked at the reviews and found a lot of 1 star reviews. I'm happy to say that I've tried all 3 of them and so far they all work. If any of them fails, I'll come back and revise this.What I like about them:- Colors, nice to have different colors and everyone can have their own,- Price, definitely a selling point.Overall, a nice set of colored 30pin Apple cables that are inexpensive and functional.
summary: So far so good...

reviewText: What I like about theNukePak Bundle of 3 Premium Certified 6.5 Feet USB Data/Sync Cablesis they are a very good length and they perform.
