I have tried a variety of extra-long 30-pin cables over the years and one big problem I often have is getting a fast charge especially if you are using the iDevice while charging.Generally, I have found these cables to work great for charging and are excellent for syncing.  Comparing them to my original Apple cable, I can't really tell a difference in respect to performance. I tested the cables with my iPod, iPod touch 2nd gen., iPad and iPad 2.  Another cool feature of this cable is I find that it doesn't tangle as easily as the Apple branded one I have.Overall, I'm really pleased with the design and performance of this cable.  Getting a three-pack makes this an amazing value.[Sample Provided For Review]
summary: Works As Well As My Original Cable...

reviewText: I have two teenagers who are always misplacing and/or fighting over their USBs. This three pack was perfect for my family. I get one and each of the kids got one. Because they are all different colors, there is no arguing over whose is whose if one gets lost. The wires themselves worked perfectly with our iPods. They are thick and sturdy and should not easily fray. We had no connection issues. The colors in this set are white, black and red. They are also extra long so it's easier to reach outlets in different locations. Getting three for this price is definitely a good deal since I have paid more for a single wire in the past.Complimentary product received.
summary: Great Set of USBs

reviewText: When buying 30-pin cables, make sure they are data cables that can sync. Not all of them are data cables. Some of them are just usable for charging. I have a bunch of those to prove it. These cables can do both, which is great. They are stiffer than the official iPhone cables, and it's a little harder to seat the cables into the iPhone's 30-pin port. I tried them out and all three are able to sync my iPhone 4S. I transferred photos and updated the operating system, but I mostly use them for charging. No problem.This product was provided for review by Kinsale Research._______________UPDATE 3/21/14: No sooner had I published this review that one of the three cords has failed. It no longer will charge my iPhone.
summary: UPDATE: 1 of 3 Failed

reviewText: Good data and power cord.  Works well both ways.  No issues.  I received a number of these in many colors for free.  I find the colors to be helpful when syncing a large number of units at one time.Most of the time we sync using the cloud but during initial setup it works better to do a cable sync.I was able to sync 10 iPads with these through hub to network with out any issues.  They then charged overnight.No worries here.  I received these for free from the manufacture.
summary: Fully functional, sync great.

reviewText: Wow these are brilliant colors. They are a nice length and transferred data quickly with no problems. They are very sturdy and a lot better quality than the one that comes with the phone. They are thicker and sturdier than the ones you get at the drug stores and Kangaroos. They transferred data at the same speed as the original and also my charging time was the same. I love that you get three for the price that one would cost at the local store. I honestly feel that you cannot have too many of them if you have teenagers about. They do stand up to use by the teenagers and they love the colors. I received this product for a fair and honest review.
summary: Love them!

reviewText: I received my first sample of these cords to review a couple months ago, and I was very happy with them. They all worked fine for syncing and charging the iPhone 4 and iPod Touch 4th Gens I tested them on. My initial review is below this and everything holds true for these new cords, except a couple improvements. I rated them four stars instead of five the first time because while they worked, they didn't "wow" me. I wasn't overly happy with the feel of the rubber insulation and I'd prefer the wire have less memory to it. I received three packs of three this time to review... one is a pack of all white cords, one is a pack with white, black and red cords (the red is what my wife would call "tomato soup red"), and one pack with blue, purple and pink cords (the blue is more of an aqua). The big improvement I see in this new set of cords is that they are perhaps 30% thicker than the previous samples and much thicker than any OEM cord I've ever seen. The connectors are very firmly attached to the wire. I pulled quite hard on the ends of a couple, actually hard enough to stretch and discolor the jacketing a little, and the ends held fast and worked like new when I tried them afterward. I have to admit that alone was quite impressive because I'm pretty sure my OEM iPod cord would have easily broken with the force I exerted on the cord. The new cords still have that slightly tacky feel to them and they still have more memory than I'd prefer, but they look very nice and their durability alone has caused me to upgrade my review from four stars to five. They are so nice in fact that in three days I've given one to my brother in-law, one to a friend of my wife, one to my wife's niece and one to my dentist's office girl. They look very nice and their extra length makes people want them badly. Unfortunately I can't post a new review, or a separate review for each product because Amazon only allows one review per reviewer per item and these are all listed on the product as the same item.I usually give away most of the sample products I get for review, but I'll definitely keep a couple of these for myself because they are definitely an improvement over the OEM Apple cords. When I first reviewed these, they were selling for $12.99, and now they're going for three dollars less and they are an improved product. Seems like a pretty good deal to me. I've been ripped off before when I bought junk cords that were DOA, but these kinda make up for that bad experience.***************************************************************** ORIGINAL REVIEW *****************************************************************I received a pack of these to review for NukePak, and so far they are working fine for both charging and syncing for both my friend's daughter's iPhone 4 and my family's two iPod Touch 4th Generation devices. The extra length (over OEM) is a nice feature, and the vibrant colors are a pleasant deviation from the old standard Apple cords.One thing I don't like is the feel of the cords. They are a little stiff, have some memory to them and almost feel a little tacky in my hands. I supposed the one benefit is that my cat, who eats anything that he finds resembling a string, won't touch these cords. He's eaten two sets of Apple OEM ear-buds already, so it's nice to know he doesn't like these.I see other reviewers have reported that these have stopped working within a few days or weeks. While I never feel obligated to post an undeserved favorable review for a product, I do feel I owe a timely review to sellers who provide me a sample . In the few days we've been using these, we've had no problems at all, but if the cords develop any issues, I will certainly update this review, like all my others, to reflect my experience over time. Taking into consideration the price at time of review ($12.99), this three pack of cords is a great bargain.
summary: UPDATED REVIEW, Rating Upgraded Due to Design Improvement

reviewText: I received a 'for review' unit from the makers or sellers of iFLASH. I did not promise them a good review and they did not ask for one in exchange.This iFLASH may be small but at 4400 mAh it carries enough juice to fully power up an iPhone 5 (1,440 mAh) at least twice or a Galaxy S III (2,100 mAh) once with some left to spare - keep in mind that the energy transfer is not 100% efficient so don't expect three iPhone 5 charges. Small size and simplicity is what makes this model different and it can be your favorite battery pack for as long as your phone charges through a Micro USB port (or you can supply your own wire) and you supply your own wall charger.It does come with essential accessories: a charging cable that can be used to either charge your phone and charge it and a nice bluish nylon mesh bag to hold the iFLASH and the USB wire. Besides its ability to charge a phone once you plug it in - and do NOT attempt to use it with anything larger such as a tablet - the only other features are a blue-LEDs charge meter that activates once you press the one white button once and a one-LED flashlight capability that turns itself on or off if you double-tap the white button.I am very found of this model and can't think of any negatives other than the shiny white finish being a fingerprint magnet but I don't know anyone who would spend much time staring at a battery pack. So five stars it is.
summary: Shiny and Juicy

reviewText: Power Bank Evaluation - iFlash 4400 Backup External Battery Pack - WhiteThis is intended as a cell phone charger - not a tablet charger, since it only charges at 1 AmpmAh - 4400#and Amps of Charging ports - 1 Charging port, only 1 Amp (Instructions state that it is intended for digital communication devices requiring a DC5V input). Please be sure your device will charge using this battery pack.Physical size - Small, fits easily in a pocket, less than 6 ouncesHow is the battery pack charged - Uses included micro charger cable. No charger included, you will need your own or will need to charge this battery pack using your computer.What cords/attachments are included - a single micro charger cable is included. It is used to charge the device and can also be used to charge your cell phone. If you need something other than a micro charger you will need to provide your own cable.What other features/items are included - Flashlight- The flashlight is turned on by clicking the on/off button twice. There is a handy mesh bag to carry your cord and battery together (a nice touch).Instructions - The instructions are tiny but readable in relatively clear English. Photos make it clear.Support Information - No support information provided.Special Note - I actually received this about a month and a half before I had a chance to test it out. summary: White - Low Voltage Charger (cell phone)

reviewText: While a large power capacity is helpful, it does have the downside of making a powerbank somewhat heavy and bulky. This iFlash powerbank takes the slim road - very easy to carry, but it offers only 4400mAh of capacity.It is attractively designed with a white plastic case with a blue accent stripe along the edge. The on/off button is also blue, as is the charge level "gas gauge." Nice color coordination. The build quality is solid - no rattles, well-anchored ports, and nice smooth seams on the case. The corners are all rounded to make it more comfortable to slip into a pocket. Although it comes with a carry pouch, it's really not needed since the powerbank is so compact (roughly 3.75 inches long and 1.75 inches wide).In addition to serving as a powerbank, there's an LED flashlight that is controlled with the on/off switch (double press to turn the flashlight on). It's a single LED, but puts out a decent amount of light.The capacity limits the practical use of this for phone or small device (e.g., ipod, mp3 player, etc.) charging. There's not enough reserve to make a meaningful recharge of a fully-depleted tablet. But, in a pinch it can be used to restore some measure of battery charge to pretty much anything that has a USB charge cable.If you're willing to trade a large battery capacity for ease of transportability, this is well worth considering.[sample provided for review]
summary: Slim powerbank that's easy to carry

reviewText: This white-and-blue battery offers a little bit of fun with the color and a more practical 4400mAh charge, about enough to charge my iPhone 5 once fully, with about half a charge remaining.  Not a lot, but enough for most situations.  It is an attractive option for anyone who rarely needs to recharge but who wants the security of having extra power nearby. The construction is solid and smooth. I can't believe I'm saying this about a battery, but . . . I love the way it feels in my hand because of its rounded, glossy case.I am so dependent on my iPhone that I cringe when I see the battery depleting with no options in the near future to recharge, and that's why I never travel without an external battery.  This iFlash battery's capacity is too small for power-hungry devices such as the iPad. It's best to purchase this only if you want to use it exclusively for your smart phone. For tablets, you would be better off with an 8400mAh external battery, although the trade-off is a larger, heavier power source. This iFlash is sized perfectly to stash in a handbag or briefcase.This iFlash battery comes with nothing more than a blue mesh pouch for storage and a USB charging cable. You will have to supply your own device-specific USB cable to charge your device. You may want to get an extra but short smart phone cable to keep in the pouch; otherwise, you may find yourself in need of a charge without the ability to do it. Charging the battery takes a few hours and can be done at home. I do my charging overnight, although it takes much less time than that.  But charging my phone takes just a little more time than it would plugged into a wall.  My iPhone 5 went from 14% to full charge in about an hour and a half.Because of the price, this external battery would make a great stocking stuffer, particularly for teenagers and college students. The white version looks more girly than the black one, but it has the advantage of hiding fingerprints better.  (Note: I received a sample for review.)-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Distinctive Look for Power-on-the-Go (5- stars)

reviewText: When I first tried out an iFlash battery pack, I had no idea of its capabilities.  I've since tried out several of them and have come to appreciate how well they perform.  They are right up there with the best of them and I've discovered that they are quite impressive in the power department.  This particular battery pack is more user-friendly, especially if you only want to have a battery pack on hand to power up your iPhone or iPod.  This unit also comes inblackif you prefer.There are several ways to charge the iFlash including through your PC, an AC wall charger, or even a car charger.  I usually charge this type of battery pack by plugging it into my PC and leaving it overnight.  You will of course, have to provide your own USB cables, which usually isn't a problem. This is a minimalist unit for those who don't want all the extras that sometimes come with the battery packs.When I test any battery pack I usually use my iPad to see how well it performs.  It's rather informal, but is quite telling.  Can this battery pack cut the mustard?iFLASH Performance:Start: 75% (4 LEDs)15 minutes  79%  (4 LEDs)30 minutes  83%45 minutes  87%  (3 LEDs)60 minutes  90%75 minutes  94%  (2 LEDs)90 minutes  97%115 minutes  100%The the performance was really impressive for a 4400mAh battery pack.  Mind you, I didn't sit on it watching it every second as it charged, but was quite surprised at how hard to work to try to get my iPad back up to snuff.  My iPad was 75% charged, but that last 25% can pull a lot of power from a battery pack.  If the 4400mAh iFlash can chug away powering up an iPad, no doubt it will keep your iPhone or iPod in business.This is a small, sleek unit and could easily be carried in a purse, knapsack, or briefcase. The top of the battery pack has the four blue LED indicators. Beneath that on the front side is the small LED flashlight, and one output port.  I suspect that LED flashlight would be able to stay on for more than 200 hours continuously given the power of this battery (just a guess). It's small, but would be great in emergency situations. On the right-hand side panel is the micro 5-pin input port.  The power switch is conveniently on the top face.WHAT'S IN THE BOX:~  Power Bank 4400mAh~  70 cm (27.55") Micro USB 5-pin Cable~  Quick start guide~  Blue mesh travel pouch with an iFLASH logo on a red tagSPECS:~ Weight: 4.1 ounces~ Input: Dc5V/1A~ Output:  Dc5V/1A~ Output: Charging speed for mobiles: 1000mAh/hours~ Input charging time: 5 - 6 hours~ Recycling time: > 500 times~ Six month limited warrantyPOWER INDICATORS:~ One LED light on: <25%~ Two LED lights on: 25% - 50%~ Three LED lights on: 50% - 75%~ Four LED lights on: 75% - 100%Sample provided for review.
summary: The iFlash 4400mAh is a powerful, compact high-performance battery pack ...

reviewText: If your recharging needs are minimal, the iFlash 4400mAh backup charger is definitely worth a look. I tested the charger with my Samsung Android cellphone (1800mAh battery) and my Kindle Fire HD 7" tablet (4400mAh battery), plus my wife's iPhone 4 (1420mAh battery), and it worked fine with each of them. With most cellphones, a fully charged iFlash 4400 should be able to provide at least two full recharges. For 7" tablets, about one full recharge is the limit. The iFlash 4400 will work with larger tablets (typically around 6000mAh battery), but it won't be able to provide a full charge.The iFlash 4400 is packaged with the charger, a USB cable with a micro-USB plug, and a carrying pouch. The micro-USB plug will fit a majority of mobile devices currently sold in the US, but for others, you'll need to provide your own cable and plug. You'll also need to provide an AC wall charger or vehicle charger to recharge the iFlash 4400. (The user guide shows the required input as DC5V/1A. I recharged it with two different AC adapters, one with 0.85A output, the other with 2.0A, and both worked okay.) The iFlash 4400 can also be recharged from a USB port on a computer, but at a slower rate.The iFlash 4400 is one of the smallest and lightest mobile chargers that I've seen. At 3.9"x1.8"x1" and weighing only four ounces, it's small enough to carry in a pocket, and the smooth curved edges won't poke a hole in it. The built-in LED flashlight is a handy feature, as is the automatic shutdown after the unit is disconnected from a mobile device.Summary: If your cellphone only needs to be recharged once or twice a day, the iFlash 4400 is an excellent choice based on capacity, size and weight, and price. It can also be used for recharging small tablets. It's a very handy little device to carry around for those times when your cellphone battery is dying, and an AC or vehicle charger is not available.A product sample was provided by the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: A no-frills charging kit that gets the job done

reviewText: Excellent for use with Smartphones and most Tablets, theiFlash 4400mAh Power Bankcan keep you talking, texting and enjoying your device for much longer.  This unit is compact and easy to take anywhere.Top features for this power bank include a 4400mAh capacity capable of charging most Smartphones multiple times and partial to full chargers to some tablets (such as the nexus 7 and Kindle Fire/Kindle Fire HD).  This unit is also capable of adding hours of life to most larger battery devices like the iPad.  This power bank includes a Micro-B USB cable for recharging the unit and for use with devices that use a Micro-B power supply.  If your device does not use a Micro-B USB cable but can charge via USB, you can use your own USB cable with the iFlash.The iFlash has four blue LED lights that illuminate when you press the power button giving you an idea of the power left.  It also features a Mini LED flashlight great for so many uses, which is activated/deactivated by double pressing the power button.  A light blue mesh carrying pouch is included to keep it all together on the go.TheiFlash 4400mAh Power Bankhas so many great uses and is worth checking out if you are constantly running out of power with you device in the afternoon and looking for extended battery life.  This power bank is available inwhiteorblack.Disclosure: I received a sample product from the manufacturer for the purposes of providing this review. A review in exchange for the review sample was not promised. The views and opinions expressed in this review are my own, and in no way represent the views or opinions of the manufacturer or vendor.
summary: Excellent Product To Keep Your Mobile Gear Charged...

reviewText: I've tried a lot of battery back-up chargers and this one has to be the most chic. It is compact with great colors and soft, rounded edges. It is small enough to tuck in a purse, briefcase or 'everything bag'. It has enough juice to keep a cell phone ready to go for a few charges and will also charge up a kindle.It comes with a USB to micro USB cable, which fits most devices. It only has one USB out port so you can only charge one device at a time. It has the added benefit of a built-in flashlight (which uses very little power so it will run for a long time on a charge!).It also has a mess bag to store the power bank and cord. It does not have a wall plug so you either have to charge it through your computer's USB port or your own USB wall plug.A great little device for compact short uses.I was provided a unit for evaluation and an honest review.
summary: Chic Design, Easy to Pack, Great for Daily Use

reviewText: The iFlash 4400mAh power bank will fully charge most phones multiple times & provide enough power to a power hungry tablet so it can be used again. It's small enough with its slim design & weight of 4.1 oz to toss in my purse for those times I don't have access to any power sources. The built-in LED flashlight also makes this power bank perfect for emergency situations. I really like its white & blue design.This power bank arrived with a 75% - 100% charge so I didn't need to charge it before I used it the first time. I began the test with my Kindle Fire HD (battery size 4400mAh) which had 36% of its power remaining. It took approximately 3 hours for my Fire to reach a charge of 97%. At this point, the power bank's LED began flashing so I knew it would need to be recharged soon. This power bank also charged my iPod Touch 4G & my LG Cosmos prepaid phone. If your mobile device doesn't support a micro USB connection, you will need to supply your own charging cable. The iFlash can be charged by connecting the included cable to your PC USB port & or by using a USB AC wall charger.When fully charged the LED flashlight will operate continuously for 200 hours. Double press the power button to turn the light on/off.Included in the package is the power bank, iFlash sky blue carrying pouch (very nice, refreshing color), a micro USB charging cable which can be used to charge the power bank & also to charge your portable devices which have a micro USB connection & a manual.Approximate measurements:4" x 1.7" x 1"4.1 oz.The iFlash 4400 is also available in blackiFlash 4400mAh Backup External Battery Pack Charger]This power bank performed perfectly for me. I will update my review if my opinion changes.UPDATE: I usually keep my devices charged  & don't often need to use a power bank...but they are definitely a necessity. My iPod's battery was in the red & had 15% power left, when family members 700 miles away decided to Facetime me. I grabbed this battery charger, plugged it into my iPod Touch 4G and was able to 'visit' with them for 40 minutes with no problems. When we finished my iPod's battery was out of the 'red zone' too & was charging while we 'visited'. The thing is, I haadn't used this charger for 3+ months. It held its charge that entire time period.I was provided a sample for an honest review.
summary: Power Bank with built in LED flashlight, I like the white & blue design...Holds its charge see update

reviewText: This iFlash 4400 mAh power bank is one of the cutest of all power banks I have seen.  It is very handy.  Very simple to use with just a single button and one 1A USB slot for charging your devices.  It came with a micro USB cable for plugging it to an AC wall USB adapter and its own mesh pouch for carrying.  What I like about using microUSB cable is that even if you lose it, it is easy to find a replacement; it is just a standard cable.The addition of an LED flashlight is a welcomed bonus.  Just press the button twice to turn it on or turn off.  A full charge of this power bank can charge your iPhone 5 one time with some to spare.A sample of this product was sent to me for review purposes.
summary: Cute as a button

summary: Cell Phone Charger (not for high Volt Tablets)

reviewText: I tested iFlash 4400mAh Power Pack with with Nexus 7 Tab (running ICS 4.3), Galaxy Nexus Phone (running ICS 4.2),  Samsung Galaxy 7.7 Tablet (running ICS 4.0.4) and iPad Mini. Overall, this battery pack performed very well based on the test described below.I received this power bank from the manufacturer for an honest review be it positive or negative. Top reviewers are often asked to review new battery packs and one of the benefits of being asked to test different power banks is that it gives me an opportunity to compare them to each other using the same charging test, so I can compare them using "apples to apples" comparison. This set of tests allows me to provide unbiased results as the numbers speak for the performance of each unit.My methodology is to charge each mobile device on each port of the unit for 10 minutes and measuring how much each unit was charge in that 10 minute period. In addition I tested charging two mobile devices at the same time. Each line in the table below represents a separate 10 minute test.I use Battery App by Elvison to determine how each device recognized the charging source. 'AC' status means the charging is at full charging rate. 'USB' status indicates charging at a lower charging rate. 'Discharging' status means that the charging rate is below the power that the device is consuming so it slows down the discharge rate but does not re-charge.➨ General features:======================iFlash 4400mAh external battery weighs 4.1 oz. Its size is 2" x 4" x 7/8".  It has nice rounded edges and feels nice in your hand.  My husband, who is normally oblivious to such things, said "Oh, it is a cute one!"  It comes in both black and white colors, and the manufacturer of this battery send me both.  This gave me a chance to test both and compare their performance. Ideally, one wants to see identical performance from both units as it would speak to a good quality control at the factory. And this is exactly what I saw testing these two units with my 4 mobile devices.This external battery  has 1 USB output port.  The package includes 21" USB to micro USB cable and a carrying pouch. Galaxy tab connector and lightening cable for iPad Mini are not included.  The battery pack a small LED flash light built into it. The flash light is not very bright, but I found it handy to use in the car while driving at night without creating too much glare for the driver.➨ Test Results:======================✔ Samsung Galaxy 7.7 tablet (using my own Galaxy tab connector cable)~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~White unit: AC ~~~~~~ 2% change in charge in 10 minutesBlack unit: AC ~~~~~~ 2% change in charge in 10 minutes✔ Nexus 7 Tab~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Black unit: AC ~~~~~~ 2% change in charge in 10 minutesWhite unit: AC ~~~~~~ 2% change in charge in 10 minutes✔ Galaxy Nexus Phone~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Black unit: AC ~~~~~~ 6% change in charge in 10 minutesWhite unit: AC ~~~~~~ 6% change in charge in 10 minutes✔ iPad Mini~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Black unit: AC ~~~~~~ 1% change in charge in 10 minutesWhite unit: AC ~~~~~~ 1% change in charge in 10 minutes➨ Key finding:======================✔ This external battery worked very consistently in both units I have tested for all 4 devices I have tested.  It did a very nice job charging the phone. It is not the fastest external battery I have tested for charging the tablets, but it has a very convenient size and makes a good travel companion.  All factors considered this external battery earned a 5 star rating.Ali Julia review
summary: Tested with Nexus 7 Tab,  Galaxy Nexus Phone,  Samsung Galaxy 7.7 Tablet and iPad Mini

reviewText: I have used (and reviewed) a variety of different external batteries over the last 6 months (actually about 20). The iFlash 4400mAh is a small lightweight external power bank that will fully charge your smartphone and provides a LED light. This external battery pack is small enough to carry around for a smartphone, but still can provide several hours of additional power to a tablet.Notes-- 4400mAh power bank has enough storage capacity to fully charge an iPhone almost 2 times - it will also provide about a 50% charge to an iPad 2 and a 40% charge to an iPad 4- Has one 5V 1A output which has enough power output to charge an iPhone and an iPad- Has an LED light built in - on a full charge the LED light will shine for 200 hours- Comes with one charging cable which connects to a USB port to a mini-USB - for charging the external powerbank from a standard USB 5V power source.- Roughly 2/3 he size of my iPhone- Has an indicator to show how much charge remaining - each light represents an increment of 25% charge- A very sleek look- Comes with a blueish padded nylon caseFinal Verdict - The iFlash 4400mAh external battery is a small lightweight power bank that offers enough power to fully charge an iPhone, Blackberry, or Samsung Galaxy for a relatively low price. There are Power Banks that have have more capacity and additional USB outputs, but the iFlash 4400mAh is a small and sleek alternative to the larger and more expensive powerbanks.4 1/2 StarsPlease Note I received this product in exchange for an unbiased review
summary: A Video Review of the iFlash 4400mAh External Battery

reviewText: While this power bank is not suitable for large battery devices such as tablets, the 4,400mAh capacity is more than adequate for at least one full charge (or a couple of partial charges) of a smart phone and a couple of full charges for a more basic phone.The build quality is quite nice, especially given the price. It's all plastic, but put together well, with smooth seams throughout. All the edges are rounded making it easy to slip into a pocket. However, while it is narrow (a bit under 2 inches wide) it is rather thick (about 3/4 inch thick). It's about 4 inches long.The USB output port is on the top next to a pretty bright LED flashlight. The input port for charging the powerbank is on the side. All ports are solidly built and well-anchored into the body of the powerbank.It has a "gas gauge" indicator to display the charge level left in the powerbank, and a nicely done round power switch to turn it on for charging and to use the flashlight.It comes with a decent cloth storage bag and a USB cable. It does not include an AC adapter or adapters for phones that don't use a standard micro USB port.I only have one complaint - the glossy case is a fingerprint magnet. Looks nice when it's clean, but it's nearly impossible to keep it looking glossy. It doesn't interfere at all with functionality, but if you're bugged by seeing fingerprint smudges, this is probably not a good choice.But other than the fingerprint issue, it's a nicely done powerbank with ample power for a typical phone. Well worth considering.[sample provided for review]
summary: Compact and solidly-built

reviewText: I am so dependent on my iPhone that I cringe when I see the battery depleting with no options in the near future to recharge, and that's why I never travel without an external battery.  I own several of them with varying amounts of power for exactly this reason.  This iFlash 4400mAh carries the least charge, but it is also the least expensive, making it an attractive option for anyone who rarely needs to recharge but who wants the security of having extra power nearby.  The construction is solid and smooth.  I can't believe I'm saying this about a battery, but . . . I love the way it feels in my hand because of its rounded, glossy case.I can get about 1.5 charges for my iPhone 5 out of this.  The amount of charge will increase slightly after you charge and drain it a few times, but the capacity/power transfer is too small for more power-hungry devices such as the iPad.  For those kinds of devices, you would be better off with an 8400mAh external battery, although the trade-off is a larger, heavier power source.  This iFlash is sized perfectly to stash in a handbag or briefcase.This iFlash battery comes with nothing more than a blue mesh pouch for storage and a USB charging cable. You will have to supply your own device-specific USB cable to charge your device since the package doesn't contain any adapters.  If you want to charge the battery via wall outlet, you'll also have to supply your own USB outlet adapter.  You may want to get an extra but short smart phone cable to keep in the pouch; otherwise, you may find yourself in need of a charge without the ability to do it.  Charging the battery takes a few hours and can be done at home.  I do my charging overnight, although it takes much less time than that.  But charging my phone takes just a little more time than it would plugged into a wall.  My iPhone 5 went from 14% to full charge in about an hour and a half.Because of the price, this external battery would make a great stocking stuffer, particularly for teenagers and college students.  This black version (there's a white-and-blue one, too) is a fingerprint magnet; however, the sleek look and feel is more important to me. (Note:  I received a sample for review.)-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Extra Power without Extras (5- stars)

It's rather informal, but is quite telling.  Can this battery pack cut the mustard?iFLASH Performance:Start: 75% (4 LEDs)15 minutes  79%  (4 LEDs)30 minutes  83%45 minutes  87%  (3 LEDs)60 minutes  90%75 minutes  94%  (2 LEDs)90 minutes  97%115 minutes  100%The the performance was really impressive for a 4400mAh battery pack.  Mind you, I didn't sit on it watching it every second as it charged, but was quite surprised at how hard to work to try to get my iPad back up to snuff.  My iPad was 75% charged, but that last 25% can pull a lot of power from a battery pack.  If the 4400mAh iFlash can chug away powering up an iPad, no doubt it will keep your iPhone or iPod in business.This is a small, sleek unit and could easily be carried in a purse, knapsack, or briefcase. The top of the battery pack has the four blue LED indicators. Beneath that on the front side is the small LED flashlight, and one output port.  I suspect that LED flashlight would be able to stay on for more than 200 hours continuously given the power of this battery (just a guess). It's small, but would be great in emergency situations. On the right-hand side panel is the micro 5-pin input port.  The power switch is conveniently on the top face.WHAT'S IN THE BOX:~  Power Bank 4400mAh~  70 cm (27.55") Micro USB 5-pin Cable~  Quick start guide~  Blue mesh travel pouch with an iFLASH logo on a red tagSPECS:~ Weight: 4.1 ounces~ Input: Dc5V/1A~ Output:  Dc5V/1A~ Output: Charging speed for mobiles: 1000mAh/hours~ Input charging time: 5 - 6 hours~ Recycling time: > 500 times~ Six month limited warrantyPOWER INDICATORS:~ One LED light on: <25%~ Two LED lights on: 25% - 50%~ Three LED lights on: 50% - 75%~ Four LED lights on: 75% - 100%Sample provided for review.
summary: The iFlash 4400mAh is a powerful, compact high-performance battery pack ...

reviewText: This is my review on the iFlash 4400 external battery pack. The packaging is really nice, it comes in a nice box and is packaged very neatly inside. Included is the power bank itself, a small carrying bag and a standard micro USB cable that can equally be used on the power bank its self to replenish the batter on it. At 4400 mAh this external battery is of decent battery capacity and it is sure to provide enough power to charge most phones today about 2-3 times or more depending on the battery capacity of your phone. I tested this on (3) devices.* Apple iPad 3rd Generation* HTC EVO 3D w/extended battery* Kyocera HydroThe power bank functioned perfectly with all of these devices, although it isn't intended for most tablets due most tablets having a much larger battery capacity than this power bank, but it will provide some extra time on the device. As for the (2) phones that I tested this on It charged them multiple times without any problems at all.Durability seems pretty good, I have tested other power banks, some of them seem fragile; however, this one seems sturdy considering its lighter weight than others. The LED flashlight on this is pretty bright and it's a nice feature that they included in this. It makes the product more versatile and allows it to be used in more situations.Overall I really like the design and capabilities of this power bank, I am sure that you will enjoy it just as much as I did.I ultimately rate this product a perfect 5 stars out of 5 stars!I hope this review has helped you out!I was provided this product for testing & evaluation, my review of this product is completely honest & unbiased, the words stated above are my own.** Note since this has a 4400 mAh battery you might not want to recharge the power bank via a USB cable connected to a computer or a low output charger, I would advise seeking for and using a higher output charger such as one that has an output of 2.1 Amps or greater, this will ensure that the product doesn't take a substantial amount of time being charged. **
summary: Fantastic power bank that works as described!

reviewText: Excellent for use with Smartphones and most Tablets, theiFlash 4400mAh Power Bankcan keep you talking, texting and enjoying your device for much longer.  This unit is compact and easy to take anywhere.Top features for this power bank include a 4400mAh capacity capable of charging most Smartphones multiple times and partial to full chargers to some tablets (such as the nexus 7 and Kindle Fire/Kindle Fire HD).  This power bank can add hours of life to most larger battery devices like the iPad.  The power bank includes a Micro-B USB cable for recharging the unit and for use with devices that use a Micro-B power supply.  If your device does not use a Micro-B USB cable but can charge via USB, you can use your own USB cable with the iFlash.Four simple to read blue LED's give the power supply left in 25% increments with a press of the power button.  It also has a clear Mini LED flashlight great for so many uses, which is activated/deactivated by double pressing the power button.  A light blue mesh carrying pouch is included to keep it all together on the go.TheiFlash 4400mAh Power Bankhas so many great uses and is worth checking out if you are constantly running out of power with you device in the afternoon and looking for extended battery life.  This power bank is available inblackorwhite.Disclosure: I received a sample product from the manufacturer for the purposes of providing this review. A review in exchange for the review sample was not promised. The views and opinions expressed in this review are my own, and in no way represent the views or opinions of the manufacturer or vendor.
summary: Very Nice 5200mAH Power Bank With A Sleek Design, Compact Form Factor...

reviewText: I've tried a lot of battery back-up chargers and this one is sleek and easy to hold. It is compact in elegant black with white accents, and soft, rounded edges. It is small enough to tuck in a purse, briefcase or 'everything bag'. It has enough juice to keep a cell phone ready to go for a few charges and will also charge up a kindle.It comes with a USB to micro USB cable, which fits most devices. It only has one USB out port so you can only charge one device at a time. It has the added benefit of a built-in flashlight (which uses very little power so it will run for a long time on a charge!).It also has a mess bag to store the power bank and cord. It does not have a wall plug so you either have to charge it through your computer's USB port or your own USB wall plug.A great little device for compact short uses.I was provided a unit for evaluation and an honest review.
summary: Great Size, Great Price, Sleek Design

reviewText: The  iFlash 4400mAh power bank will fully charge most phones multiple times & provide enough power to a power hungry tablet so it can be used again. It's small enough with its slim design & weight of 4.1 oz  to toss in my purse for those times I don't have access to any power sources. The built-in LED flashlight also makes this power bank perfect for emergency situations.This power bank came almost fully charged so I didn't need to charge it before I used it the first time. The iFlash 4400mAh charged all my devices. I began the test with my iPod Touch 4G which had less than 20% when I started. After fully charging my iPod, the power bank had enough power left over to partially charge my Kindle Fire HD. The power bank began flashing to alert me that its power was almost depleted & it needed to be re-charged. I also charged my LG Cosmos prepaid phone with this power bank. If your mobile device doesn't support a micro USB connection, you will need to supply your own charging cable.  The iFlash can be charged by connecting the included cable to your PC USB port & or by using a USB AC wall charger.When fully charged the LED flashlight will operate continuously for 200 hours.  Double press the power button to turn the light on/off.Included in the package is the power bank, iFlash sky blue carrying pouch (very nice, refreshing color), a  micro USB charging cable which can be used to charge the power bank & also to charge your portable devices which have a micro USB connection & a manual.Approximate measurements:4" x 1.7" x 1"4.1 oz.The iFlash 4400 is also available in whiteiFlash 4400mAh]This power bank performed perfectly for me. I will update my review if my opinion changes.I was provided a sample for an honest review.
summary: Portable power bank with built in LED flashlight

reviewText: I tested TUDIA USB Car Charger with Nexus 7 Tablet and Samsung Galaxy Nexus cell phone. The charger provides a total of 3.1A, 2.1A on one port and 1.0A on the second port.I received this car charger from the manufacture with a request for an honest review be it positive or negative. One of the benefits of being requested to test different car chargers that it gives me an opportunity to compare them to each other using the same charging test, so I can compare them using "apples to apples" comparison. These test provide unbiased results as the numbers speak for the performance of each unit. My tests show that this charger performed above average compared with the other car chargers I have tested. You will find the details of my tests below.My methodology is to charge each mobile device on each port of the unit for 10 minutes and measuring how much each unit was charged in that 10 minute period. Each line in the table below represents a separate 10 minute test. I use Battery App by Elvison to determine how each device recognized the charging source. 'AC' status means the charging is at full charging rate. 'USB' status indicates charging at a lower charging rate. 'Discharging' status means that the charging rate is below the power that the device is consuming so it slows down the discharge rate but does not re-charge.The charger has two ports labeled "1.0A" and "2.1A".The table below summarizes my findings:Nexus 7 Tablet~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~1.0A port.........AC power source.....4% change in charge in 10 minutes2.1A port.........AC power source.....2% change in charge in 10 minutesSamsung Galaxy Nexus Phone~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~1.0A port.........AC power source.....4% change in charge in 10 minutes2.1A port.........AC power source.....3% change in charge in 10 minutes➨ To summarize:======================✔ The charger has a good firm fit in the car charging port. It did not wobble or became dislodged on bumpy roads.✔ This charger had one of the best performances in car chargers that I have testedAli Julia review
summary: Above average performance for Nexus 7 Tablet and Galaxy Nexus phone

reviewText: We are constantly using our electronical "toys" and we need to be charging them at home, work and on the go.  The TUDIA dual charger can help you simultaneously charge two devices likes a tablet and phone/digital camera or GPS while in a vehicle.The TUDIA dual port Ultra speed charger adapter plugs snugly into a vehicle's cigarette lighter socket or any 12-volt power port.  Output is 3.1A (3100 mAh) which features a one 2.1 Amp and a one 1.1 Amp port.  Constructed of a sturdy plastic with a sleek black finish and rubberized rings surrounding the head for easier grip. The slots are illuminated so you can differentiate between the 2.1 and the 1.1 Amp slots - this is a really nice feature.  Automatically stops charging when the batteries are at full charge.Older vehicles do not have built-ion USB ports and newer vehicles do not have enough.  This gadget is a must have for people who must be charging on the go - great quality construction offered at a great price, you will not be disappointed.Disclosure:  I received a sample unit to test and evaluate in exchange for an honest unbiased review.
summary: Must have for people on the go - this means YOU!

reviewText: TUDIA Dual Port USB Ultra High Speed Simultaneous Charging Car Charger (Black/Blue) by W2 Corporation is a great little charger.  The charger comes with two ports for you to charge your devices while on the go.This charger is compatible with Apple iPads, iPhones, iPod, HTC devices, Blackberrys, MP3 Players, Digital Cameras, PDAs, as well as most other Mobile devices on the market.  The two USB ports are configured a little differently.  One port is built with a 2.1amp max and the other port has a 1.0amp max.  Both ports will charge simultaneously.  The only drawback is that you will have to use your own USB charging cables.  Some of the other features are as follows:* Built in green Ambient LED lights to indicate when a device is connected.* The charger has built in protection technology to protect your devices from over-heating and over-charging.* Charger will be automatically stop when battery is full.* Charger has a build In Intelligent Ventilation Vent to avoid over heating.I am glad I own this product and would definitely recommend to you.Thank you for reading my review.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation.
summary: TUDIA Dual Port USB High Speed Vehicle Charger

reviewText: .If you like cool turquoise bands and bright green lights on your car charger, TUDIA has it covered.Dual port chargers with 2.1 + 1-Amp capacity make a lot of sense.$7 to $10 is the going price on amazon for a name brand unit with warranty, so this one is premium priced (usually).- - - Alternatives - - --Anker Dual USB 3.6A (2.1A + 1.5A) Car Charger-PowerGen Dual USB 3.1A Car Charger-9to5Cables Dual USB 3.1A Car Charger-CoverBot Dual USB 3.1A Car Charger-9to5Cables Dual USB 2.4A USB Car ChargerPROs:- Style is new and boldOKs:- Charges iPhone at full speed. I have not yet tested with tablet + phone together.- Tight, secure fit in your 12v socket (see Note 1)- Differs from picture (see Note 2 or uploaded pic)- More visible, and sticks out further than some competing models.- Bright green port lights (see Note 3)CONs:* Priced higher (usually) than most competing models (delivered price).- - - Pricing - - -Prices bounce around. If you care, "Online Price Alert" will email you whenever this or any amazon product dips below your target price. Google it. It's nicely done. Or try camelcamelcamel, which also shows price history.- - - Disclosure - - -The manufacturer gave me this product for review. I believe my review is impartial.- - - Notes - - -Note 1: Tight fit - I like it. Some other car chargers fit a little loose, and the tip can lose contact with the power source.Note 2: Picture issues. The amazon pics suggest that the USB ports are "upside down" (you would insert your USB cable logo-side down). But the unit I received has them right side up. The TUDIA logo is very faint, compared with the pictured unit.Note 3: When it's receiving power, the port labels (2.1A, 1.0A) are bright green. Some green light spills into the USB sockets, which could be handy for nighttime use.~~~ Comments & questions welcome ~~~
summary: Compared to PowerGen and Anker

reviewText: I have several different brands of USB car chargers, and this Tudia dual port model is one of the more distinctive looking ones.  When plugged into my car's power adapter, the front lights up with labels to indicate which port is 2.1 A and which is 1.0 A.  (The 2.1 is best for charging power hungry devices such as the iPad, although it can be used for phones as well.)  The cyan blue silcone stripes make it easy to find in a console full of stuff.  But, of course, the appearance doesn't matter if the device doesn't work -- and it does.  Beautifully.The Tudia charger fits snugly but doesn't require a lot of effort to plug in.  Likewise, the USB ports seem solid and well-constructed; I don't have to struggle to plug in my power cables.  My iPhone gets charged lightning-quick (with its lightning cable, of course!), just as if it were plugged into a home outlet.  I like that it powers off when a device if fully charged and that it does not get hot or make noise.With people carrying more and more devices on the road -- tablets, phones, cameras, Kindles -- it becomes important to be able to charge more than one at a time, particularly if there are two of you.  Before I had a dual port charger, my husband and I would have to take turns charging our phones, and we usually ended up arguing who needed the charge more.  Now one port belongs to him, and the other to me.  Thanks, Tudia, for the marriage counseling!  (Note:  I received a sample for review.)-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Looks Cool and Works Well

reviewText: This is definitely a sleek little car charger that is capable of charging a couple of your devices on the go. It's very light-weight and actually quite attractive with the blue stripes. It's a dual USB port charger that will support just about any device you need to take with you, including an iPad. You'll have to use your own 30-pin cord because this is the charger only.The Tudia 3.1A Dual USB Car Charger offers up short circuit protection that gives me that bit of extra insurance I like. The ports are marked, but a bit difficult to see in certain lights. The spring-loaded prongs keep the charger in place very nicely. Altogether, it's a sleek little charger for the money. I like to keep a charger in my glove compartment just in case I need to charge on the go.SPECS:~ Input: DC 10 - 24V~ Output: 1.0A for 1st port (top) / DC 5V 2.1A for 2nd port (bottom)~ Material: ABS~ Color: Black w/blue stripes~ Dimensions: 1 1/2" 1 1/8" x 3"~ Weight: 1.0 oz.~ Certificate: RoHs~ RecyclableSample provided for review.
summary: The Tudia is a nice sleek, affordable charger ...

reviewText: With USB charging becoming the default option for almost all small (and some large) consumer electronics devices, it is becoming increasingly important and indispensable to have an easy access to the USB charging plugs when you travel. More and more cars nowadays come equipped with at least one USB outlet, but the older cars are still unable to provide you with that kind of charging convenience. Fortunately, there are many USB chargers out there that can plug directly into the car ligher port, and this Tudia charger definitely has a lot to offer.It is well made, fairly compact, and allows for a simultaneous charging of a smartphone and a tablet. The dual ports are conveniently accessible and easy to use. I've used this charger with my iPhone 4S and first generation iPad and was really satisfied with the experience. This feels pretty durable. It is lightweight and you can easily carry it around with you. (I leave mine permanently in the console of my car.) I like the rubberized grip on the side of it - it helps with inserting the charger and taking it out.One of the main selling points of this charger is its price. From what I've seen you will probably not find a better car charger at this price point.Overall, I really like this product and would recommend it to anyone in a need of a car charger for small electronic devices.
summary: Effective Small Car Charger for your Portable Electronic Devices

reviewText: This is my review on the TUDIA 3.1 Amps Dual USB port car charger. Let me say that this is an amazing little charger! I have used many USB Car chargers in the past, but so far this one is my favorite. The thing I like most about it is its compact size, there are many dual USB chargers in the market, but they all seem to be big and bulky, this one is the opposite its small and compact; however, just because its small doesn't mean its not as good as the others. This charger can charge at either 1 Amp or at 2.1 Amps! The USB ports clearly indicate which one is which, the difference? Well if the 1 Amp output is mostly for your phones, and the 2.1 Amps output is for your larger devices that need more power such as tablets. The four blue lines that you see on the sides of the charger provide grip in order to put and remove the charger from the car. Overall I really like this charger, it looks very durable and it seems that it will last a long time. An awesome product from TUDIA that I recommend you buy especially if you have a smartphone/tablet since they are constantly draining the battery life and having a pretty much universal charger in the car is necessary. I rate this product a perfect 5 out of 5 stars!I hope this review has helped you out!I was provided a sample for testing and evaluation, my review of this product is honest and the words stated above are my own.
summary: An awesome little charger!

reviewText: TheTUDIA 3.1A Dual Port USB Car Chargerperforms well and delivers on expectations.  The dual port charger has a port for 1.0A and one port for 2.1A capacity. The unit is great for charging a tablet and phone at the same time.  That's great for those times when you're on the go and forget to charge your devices before you head out the door.I tested this car charger with my Android tablet and phone and it was able to charge both in good time during my travels yesterday afternoon.  I've tested it with my iPhone and iPad and it was able to charge both devices respectively, as well.The TUDIA Dual Chager has a low profile and a smart venting design to help reduce heat.  The teal color bands give the charger a nice look.  When plugged in, the unit features the charging amperage `1.0A' and `2.1A' illuminated in a light green color by the respective USB port to help ensure even at night, you won't confuse the ports.  These lights are reasonably dulled to avoid distracting during night driving.Overall, theTUDIA 3.1A Dual Port USB Car Chargerdelivers all the necessary features and options you might want from a car charger.  It's reasonably priced and worth checking out.Disclosure: I received a sample product from the manufacturer for the purposes of providing this review. A review in exchange for the review sample was not promised. The views and opinions expressed in this review are my own, and in no way represent the views or opinions of the manufacturer or vendor.
summary: Full-speed Charging for Two Devices, Practical Design, Good Value...

reviewText: I like the looks of the TUDIA Dual Port car charger with its turquoise silicone bands and green LED lights which label each port with their power designation (2.1 or 1.0A). The turquoise silicone bands on the unit make it easier to grip the charger to plug it in or remove it from your vehicle's cigarette port.More important than looks is how this car charger performs...and for me, it performed perfectly. TUDIA Car Charger - Black/ Blue fits securely in my cigarette port & doesn't wobble. I was able to charge my IPod Touch & Kindle Fire HD at the same time. Because each port's power designation is labeled with a green LED light, it was easy to see which port I wanted to use. I really like this feature.Very Important: The TUDIA car charger features over-heated, over-current, over-charging protection, charging will be automatically stop when battery is full & it has a built in vent which also helps prevent over-heating.5 starsThe TUDIA dual port car charger fit our cigarette port snuggly & performed perfectly for me. I like its looks & the green LED labeled ports.I received a product sample for an unbiased, honest review.
summary: Unique/Attractive design, charges 2 devices at once with over-heated, over-current, over-charging protection

reviewText: The TUDIA dual port USB charger is quite sleek with the shiny black casing, four fluorescent blue silicone bands, and LED lighting for the ports when plugged in.  It is easy to insert and remove but stays firmly in place.One port is 2.1A for Apple and other higher-powered devices and the other is 1.0A for other small electronics.  The ports are readily distinguishable and easy to use in the dark because of the soft LED glow from the ports that also illuminates the amperage labels.  The ports are far enough apart to accommodate two standard USB plugs easily.It does a fast job recharging and doesn't overheat.  As with most car chargers, you can use the device while simultaneously charging it without any problem.No problems with this little charger from TUDIA and I like the way it looks.A sample was provided for testing and unbiased review.
summary: TUDIA dual port USB charger

reviewText: There are a lot of chargers on the market right now and the choice can seem confusing.  This TUDIA Dual Port (15W and 3.1 USB) charger is a cut above the rest for many reasons.  The electricity is conducted through a brass metal electro-plating head.  The unit never overheats due to a unique ventilation vent system on the sides.  The unit can be gripped by four blue bands that make for easy in and out use.  There is also a cool built-in green ambient LED light which acts as a power indicator.  This unit is guaranteed to not over-heat, over-charge or over-current.You can easily charge a smartphone and a tablet (I have an iPhone 4S and an iPad) and charging will automatically stop when the batteries are full!  That is a nice relief.  There is a '2.1 A' and a '1.0 A' USB for charging.  Product supplied by manufacturer for an honest review.
summary: Protection At A Low Cost!

reviewText: When I saw the picture I thought it will be just a normal cheap USB car charger.  When I received it, I found out that the picture doesn't  give justice to the actual appearance and quality of the product.  It is sleek shiny black with blue rubber trimmings, which makes it is a lot easier to pull out from the cigarette socket.Two slots on the top are capable of charging two devices at once.  They are also clearly and individually labeled, 1A and a faster 2.1A for iPads and tablets.Cons:I don't see any thing wrong with this charger except that it needs to be more competitive in price.  At the time of this review, many of the competitors are selling for less than ten bucks.Sample item provided by the distributor for evaluation review.
summary: Sleek design. Simultaneous charging

reviewText: The TUDIA Dual USB 3.1 amp car charger is a must have for those who want to be able to charge 2 devices simultaneously in a car.The charger has 2 USB ports. One of the USB ports is labeled "1.0A", has a max output of 1 amp, and the other is labeled "2.1A" which has a max output of 2.1 amps both at 5 volts. This is a powerful car charger. I really like this car charger and I plan to use a lot so I don't have to fight for a car outlet with my family. I have charged an iPad Air and my iPhone 5 using this car charger. This car charger is much bigger than other ones I have that give the same output. I still recommend using this car charger still.Overall this is a great car charger. I recommend this to people who need to charge a tablet and a smartphone in the car.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation, and I promised that my review is fair and honest.
summary: Powerful car charger but is large

reviewText: It's a sweet design.  I like the rounded square look the offered charger.  I like that this charger has two 2.1 amp connections.  Definitely liked that has higher wattage output for what it is which 20 watts.  I've tested it given on my tablet and samsung note 2 at the same time and it worked flawlessly.  It is a nice charger to keep at home.  I do not think I'd simply carry it around but I've had others that are larger and more cumbersome to carry around however it's a nice replacement to what I currently have.  I currently have a very bright LED charger and keeps me up at late at night sometimes.  I received this item for a honest review
summary: Nice design - Good strong charger

reviewText: I tested Bolse 4.2Amp 20W Dual USB Port Wall Charger with Samsung Galaxy 7.7 Tablet (ICS 4.0.4) and iPad Mini.I own several wall chargers and run the same set on tests on each of them, so they can be compared to each other using "apples to apples" comparison. This set of tests allows me to provide unbiased results as the numbers speak for the performance of each unit. Based on these comparison tests I am quite pleased with this charger.My methodology is to charge each mobile device on each port of the unit for 10 minutes and measuring how much each unit was charge in that 10 minute period. I also charged my two devices at the same time. Each line in the table below represents a separate 10 minute test, 20 tests in total.I use Battery App by Elvison to determine how each device recognized the charging source. 'AC' status means the charging is at full charging rate. 'USB' status indicates charging at a lower charging rate. 'Discharging' status means that the charging rate is below the power that the device is consuming so it slows down the discharge rate but does not re-charge.I am attaching a collage of photos as video. They show the charger during the test with various devices. In the photos can also see a close up of the charger itself.The charger is compact it is 2" long, 2" tall, and 1" wide. If you use it on the old fashioned power strips this charger would cover only 1 slot. Bolse wall charger has re-tractable prongs which are very handy for travel.The two ports of the charger are not marked, so I refer to them as "top" and "bottom" in the tables below.  Each of the USB ports can provide 2.1A for a total of 4.2A output.The table below shows the results of my tests. The manufacture offers the identical USB chargers in two colors "white" and "black". I received both for testing and evaluation. I tested both and both chargers performed similarly. I am including the results for both chargers, as seeing consistency in results increases the likelihood that others chargers will behave in a similar way.✔ Samsung Galaxy Tablet 7.7 (black charger)--------------------------Top port ----- AC ............. 3% change in charge in 10 minutesBottom port -- AC ............. 3% change in charge in 10 minutes✔ Samsung Galaxy Tablet 7.7 (white charger)--------------------------Top port ----- AC ............. 3% change in charge in 10 minutesBottom port -- AC ............. 3% change in charge in 10 minutes✔ iPad Mini (black charger)--------------------------Top port ----- AC ............. 3% change in charge in 10 minutesBottom port -- AC ............. 2% change in charge in 10 minutes✔ iPad Mini (white charger)--------------------------Top port ----- AC ............. 4% change in charge in 10 minutesBottom port -- AC ............. 3% change in charge in 10 minutes✔ Samsung Galaxy Tablet 7.7 and iPad Mini together (black charger)--------------------------Top port ----- AC ............. 4% change in charge in 10 minutesBottom port -- AC ............. 4% change in charge in 10 minutes✔ Samsung Galaxy Tablet 7.7 and iPad Mini together (white charger)--------------------------Top port ----- AC ............. 4% change in charge in 10 minutesBottom port -- AC ............. 4% change in charge in 10 minutes➨ Key findings:------------------This charger works well for both iPad Mini and Samsung Galaxy. Both chargers I have tested showed the same results for the most part which speaks well for quality assurance.  Good speed and compact size earn this charger a 5 star rating.Ali Julia review
summary: Compact size and good charging speed for Android and Apple

reviewText: Not one but TWO 2.1Amp USB ports allows universal charging through both USB ports with any compatible USB cable.  Two rapid-charging ports that are powerful enough  for two iPads, or just use it to charge your 1.1Amp devices like an iPhone, digital camera, GPS, etc.~Total Output is 5V, 4.2A (2.1A + 2.1A = 4.2A total amps)~20W for faster charging~Orange LED light active/power indicator.~Charging will be automatically stop when battery is full.~Built-in over-charging protection.Blades fold in for a compact design and making transporting easier.  Just to think that I paid double the price for the apple brand for just a 10W adapter to charge my iPad a few years ago, and now you can get double the wattage for half the price!Also comes in white:Bolse 4.2Amp 20W High Output Turbo Charge Dual USB Port Wall Charger - WhiteDisclosure - I received a sample to test and evaluate in exchange for an honest unbiased review.
summary: Universal charging power for a variety of devices

reviewText: It's good to have geek-gear that simply works as it should. This Bolse 4.2Amp 20W High Output Turbo Charge Dual USB Port Wall Charger does just what it promises - charges (2) devices quickly at 2.1A each. It's compact, lightweight (2.68 ounces), well-made, and easy to throw into your bag and go. It's the ideal travel gadget for charging on the go - assuming you bring your own cables to connect to your devices.When the charger is plugged in, a soft orange glow is right below each USB port.  I noted that this glow stayed 'on' despite unplugging the charger, for about 10 seconds.  Residual power in the device I guess?  Not as bright as some gadgets, I liked this indicator to indicate the device was powered and ready to use.I kind of wish the ports were on the opposite side of the device to make them more easily accessible when the charger is plugged in.  If it's plugged into a wall socket, it's OK, but when I plug it into a power strip I have to find just the right configuration to get to the USB ports with ease.This charger is speedy. I noted that in two minutes of being connected and still on, my iPad mini gained 2% of a charge.  Not bad considering the lock screen was illuminated during the recharging.This charger is safe.  Overheat, overcharge and over-current protection are built into the design.I am very pleased with this charger and have it as my 'go to' charger for my 'i' devices.  I will also be bringing it with me on road trips, as it is so small and works so quickly.  The reason I give it 4 out of 5 stars is because of the placement of the USB ports on the device being so close to the plug-in.  If the ports were located opposite the plug-in, I believe this charger would be more user-friendly.NOTE: I received this item from the manufacturer in exchange for my honest review.
summary: Works well for iPad 3, iPad mini and iPhone 4S

reviewText: Weighing in at only 2.8 oz., this tiny wall charger packs a serious punch! This is not my first Bolse wall charger, but I have to say that it is the sleekest-looking so far. Though it doesn't weigh much, it has a nice quality feel to it. Unlike the black version which I also have, fingerprints won't show up as much on this white version. Bolse sent me this wall charger to try out, this review is my honest opinion.IMPORTANT NOTES:- Provides 4.2A (2 x 2.1A) of power at 5V (20W)- It has two USB ports that can be used simultaneously- Has built in short circuit, overcharge & overheat protection- Will switch to "trickle charge" once battery is charged, allowing it to STAY fully charged despite being on- 110-240V rating means with an adapter this can be used anywhere in the world!WHAT I LOVEThis thing has a tiny footprint, but serious charges quickly! I'm not going to include charging time because my iPhone battery is well on its way out, but I will say that subjectively speaking I did notice an increase in charging speed. The two ports allow for multiple devices to be charged, something that always makes life easier - it has been a long time since I've only had ONE item to charge at night, and for those traveling the extra USB port is a great addition. It looks great - very similar to Apple's style of wall charger (not for everyone, but worth nothing). The LED is not overpowering - I cannot stand overly bright LEDs on devices meant to be used at night - this one is not too bad compared to other Bolse LEDs...nice to know they've been listening to feedback.WHAT I WOULD CHANGEPersonal preference; I prefer white LEDs. Not a big deal, the orange is not unpleasant.OVERALLThis is slightly pricier than others on the market, but Bolse more than makes up for the mild addition in price with fast charging times and smart technology built in to the device. I can honestly recommend this product without reservation.
summary: Good things come in small packages...

reviewText: I love that this compact cube charger has two USB ports, each with 10W of power for faster charging.  That means that I can charge two iPads or an iPad and an iPhone at the same time.  The prongs fold into the body for snag-free stashing in my bag.  It's approximately 2" x 2" x 1", small enough to fit in my palm and light enough to carry everywhere.  Even the construction seems above average.This comes in both black and white glossy plastic.  The black one is worse with fingerprints and doesn't match Apple product cords and cables, but I love its classy look.  (Note:  I received a sample for review.)-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Powerful Wall Charger with Two USB Ports

reviewText: I've been using an older model Bolse dual USB port high output wall/travel/AC charger for quite some time and have been quite satisfied.  My old dual USB port charger was set up with 2.1A and 1.0 ports, but this one is definitely an improvement over the other if you need to charge two tablets at once.  Usually I'll charge many of my devices such as battery packs through my PC, but when I need a rapid charge I've set aside my Bolse for when I need it ... which tends to be frequent.  I do like this charger because it takes the AC charger to a new, more powerful level.The wide range of compatible devices is a real plus because of the wide range we all use.  I like the Bolse name because it spells quality and dependability.  This past week, I didn't hesitate to pull out one of their more powerful battery packs to loan in to someone working outside my home.  They needed a charge for their iPhone5 and needed access to their phone.  In addition to the ability to charge two tablets, I like its compact nature, the flip-down AC prongs, and yes, I like that orange LED light that signals it's charging.  If I'm charging something during the night, I dislike the bright blue LED lights that can be a tad disruptive.  This unit comes in either black or white.PROS:~  Very compact~  Flip-down AC prongs~  Orange LED light which is perfect for nighttime charging~  Short circuit protection~  Overheat protection~  Trickle charge when your device is fully charges~  Compatibility with a wide variety of devices~  High output 4.2A dual USB port charging at 5V~  Ability to charge two iPads at onceCONS:~  None I can think ofSPECS:~  Input:  AC 100 - 240V, 50 - 60HZ  0.5A~  Output:  DC 5V 4.2A MaxUSB Port 1:  Dc5V 2.1AUSB Port 2:  Dc5V 2.1A~  Weight:  2.68 ounces~  Material:  PC material~  LED indication:  Mono Orange~  Safety approval:  CE & FCC & ETLWARRANTY:~  12 months limitedSample provided for review.
summary: This 4.2Amp 20W high-outputw all/travel.AC charger takes charging to a new, more powerful level ...

reviewText: I was provided an Bolse 4.2 Amp 20W USB Port Wall Charger for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ This charger is very small (2" x 2" x 1").♦ Has two ports (2 x 2.1 Amp) that provide a huge total output of 4.2 Amps.♦ Has a large enough output capacity to provide fast charging speeds when charging multiple devices simultaneously.♦ Some of the fastest charging speeds I have ever tested with an iPhone 5 and iPad 2 charging at the same time.♦ Very compact and has folding prongs for travel.Detailed Review:♦ Look -  The product came in a plain box with an information sticker on it.  Inside the box was the wall charger and a small information sheet.  You immediately see that this wall charger is small. It measures 2" x 2" x 1". It is a clean white wall charger with the Bolse name on both sides.  It has two 2.1 Amp USB ports and provides a total output of 4.2 Amps.  It also has an orange power indicator light between the two ports.  The prongs fold into the body of the charger for storage and travel.  It appears to have a nice build quality.♦ Use and Performance - I plugged it into a wall outlet and did some basic testing to see how the Bolse wall charger handles simultaneous charging.  I took my iPhone 5 that had 59% charge and my iPad 2 that had 62% charge and charged them simultaneously. After 15 minutes, the iPhone charge increased to 75% and the iPad increased to 67%. I then switched the ports that the devices were plugged into and continued charging the devices.  After 10 more minutes, the iPhone increased to 85% and the iPad increased to 71%.  The iPhone charged at better than 1% per minute and the iPad charged at better than 3% per 10 minutes.  Some of the fastest individual charging results that I have ever seen, and this was achieved while charging simultaneously.  Really great results.  It did give off some heat when charging, but when plugged in and not in use, it gave off no heat at all.Conclusion:Overall, this could be the best dual port wall charger that I have ever seen.  It has a very large output capacity that charges multiple devices extremely fast.  On top of that it is very small and compact.  It is the perfect travel companion and I will most likely be using it exclusively at home to charge my devices because you don't have to guess which is the fast port, because they both are.  Highly Recommended!
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy!

reviewText: If it comes from Bolse you can depend on the design being clean and subtle and not interfering with the appearance of a room. This very compact system has a lot of power – two USB ports each with 2.1 amps with a total wattage of 20 W. No further cables are needed as it uses your existing USB charging cables to charge most USB powered devices. Of note it has a handy easily readable LED to assure the USB charger is properly connected. It is the answer for the modern commuter that needs power for both iPad and smartphone – it has the capability to charge two devices simultaneously. According to the package insert, it is compatible with iPads (all versions, up to 2.1A rapid charge), Android smartphones - HTC, All Droids, Samsung (up to 1A rapid charge), All iPhones and iPods (up to 1A rapid charge)Others Android phones / GPS / Tablet etc.In addition to Bolse penchant for sleek contemporary design, the safety features of this device and with all Bolse devices are as sensitive as they come – the circuit design protects against overcharging, over heating and over current; when charging is complete the charging is stopped. And with a 12-month warranty you know you are in dependable hands.  Another Bolse winner. Grady harp, October 13
summary: Bolse’s distinctive design matches its very fine functional utility

reviewText: This is a very nicely constructed one piece design sure to last for years. It has fold-away plugs for easy packing or storage.It will charge two USB devices at a time and has a small orange indicator light to show it is plugged in and working.It will not charge my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet but they are pesky and I have hardly ever found a plug or power bank that charges that. Darn you Samsung.But it works well for everything else and stores away easily. I especially like the built-in safety features including short circuit protection, overcharge & overheat protection. It is also great that it switches to a trickle charge when your device is fully charged. Great for saving your battery life.I was provided a unit for evaluation and an honest review.
summary: Solid One Piece Construction, Compact

reviewText: This is a great wall charger that works with all my devices (tested with LG Cosmos prepaid phone, iPod Touch 4G & Kindle Fire HD). Two iPads can be charged at the same time.The wall charger, AC 100-240V 50-60Hz 0.5A, will work in other countries, but you will need to purchase the appropriate plug adapter for the country you will be visiting.I really like the folding prongs & built-in over-heated, over-current, over-charging protection. Charging will automatically stop when the battery is full.The only con I have:The USB ports are close together. Some of my charging cables have chunky USB plugs and are crowded in the wall charger.The Bolse 4.2amp wall charger is available in black & white & has a 12 Month Manufacturer Warranty.LowerPriceUSA provided a sample for an unbiased, honest review.
summary: Works with all my devices...great product... over-heated, over-current, over-charging protection

reviewText: The Bolse Dual Port USB 4.2 A Turbo Travel Wall Charger works quite well as a travel charger because of the small size and folding prongs. It is also ideal for routine use because it doesn't block the other socket in the wall outlet.It is very compact at about 2" x 2" x 1 1/8". It has a beautiful yellow LED to indicate that it has power. The prongs are easy to flip in and out and fit securely in the socket.The casing is a heavy, glossy plastic. Both the black and white models are quite attractive and sturdy.Both ports can be used simultaneously and provide 2.1 A of power, which gives a faster charge to tablets and iPhones. It works perfectly well with other devices such as Kindle Paperwhite or Samsung Chromebook and smaller electronics such as iPod Shuffle or Grace Digital portable speakers.A sample was provided for testing and unbiased review.
summary: Bolse USB 4.2 A travel wall charger--optimized for larger devices including Apple

reviewText: Virtually 2" X 2" X 1", this compact wall charger is one of the best I've seen on the market. Most wall chargers (and car chargers) that have two USB ports will have 2.1A and 1.0A, the 2.1A being the fastest. But this device has TWO 2.1A USB ports, each one being a standard 5V, 2.1A. That's slightly faster than a standard Apple (white) plug in. Because of its size and its neat fold out electrical prongs, you can carry this anywhere you travel.This Turbo Charge will charge just about anything that uses a USB port. The nice features that are reassuring are that is will not over-heat, over-current or over-charge your device. In fact, the charge stops when your device is fully charged. Note that whatever you charge is going to vary greatly in time, depending on what kind of battery you are charging and the device itself. I charged my iPhone 4S from 20% to 100% in about 90 minutes.
