The charge is as consistent as your wall socket. There is a small orange LED light showing whether it is charging or not. The glossy white surface is easily cleaned. Device supplied for review.
summary: Tiny, Powerful & A Bargain!

reviewText: This Dual-port USB wall charger is compact in size but has a high-capacity output that let's you charge to  iPad's simultaneously. Each of the USB ports can provide 2.1A for a total of 4.2A output. Many other wall chargers will only provide 3.1A total output.The folding plug is desirable particularly when traveling. The plug is much less likely to snag on something in your suitcase since the plug folds nicely inside the case.This is a very compact sized charger, attractively designed and powerful. It can be used internationally as it is rated at 100-240V, 50/60Hz. The LED indicator light is not too bright and lets you know that power is reaching the charger.I was provided a sample for review. I agreed to provide a fair and honest review.
summary: Compact size and provides high output

reviewText: The small, compact size and fold up prongs makes the Bolse 4.2 amp USB wall charger is a good travel charger.  It's fast, both ports sport the same amperage (2.1 amsp), so I don't have to stop and think.  All USB chargers ought to be 2 amps or better nowadays.The lights on the ports are unobtrusive enough that it can be left in a hotel room all night without disturbing sleep.  My husband doesn't complain.I would like the ports on the back instead of the top, because I find it easier to reach that way without pulling the adapter out from the wall, and more ports is always better.Those are minor details.  The charger works well.  I've been using it for everything from charging power banks and tablets to cell phones and Bluetooth devices.  It hasn't failed me yet.This product was provided for review by LowerPriceUSA.
summary: Good for Travel

reviewText: This is a nice unit that will charge two devices that utilize USB type chargers, such as just about all smartphones and tablets. The unit is rated at 4.2 amps, delivering 2.1 amps per charging slot. That is quite a lot of current and will provide a fast charge to devices that can handle it.(Bolse also makes a four slot charger, which is nearly as portable, that delivers 1.0 amp per slot. Which one you choose depends on your portable charging needs: how many devices, and what current demand from each.)I like the small size and very easy portability of this two slot unit. While you'll still need the cords for both of your devices, you'll only need this one quite compact plug-in unit.The only drawback is the position and orientation of the plug prongs in the center of the sidewall. This will cause the charger to possibly overlap a second outlet in a narrow power strip or outlet multiplier. However there is no issue in standard US or Canadian wall outlets.I recommend that you take a close look at your needs. If you're only carrying two portable devices, this is the right unit. If you have more than two (or there are two people with two devices each) look into Bolse's four slot unit.Five stars for good performance, portability, and utility.Disclaimer: I received a free review sample of the product. However I write unbiased reviews that pull no punches and tell the truth.
summary: Very portable and practical

reviewText: I recently got to try out the Bolse 4.2Amp 20W High Output Turbo Charge Dual USB Port Wall Charger (that's a mouthful!) and see how well it worked. For something that looks so basic, it's a nice wall charger to have around, as it does more than the ones you normally get by default with your smart phones and tablets.The first thing that stands out is that it has two USB ports for charging, and each one is rated for 2.1 amps. That means that not only can you charge something that draws a lot when charging (think iPad), you can charge TWO of them at once! I tried out charging both my current generation iPad and my Kindle at the same time, and they both charged in the normal time I would expect. Even better is that the charger goes into "trickle mode" when the charging is complete, so you're not continuing to pull a full current when things are topped off. I like that feature. Add in the nice touch where the electrical prongs fold into the unit when not in use, and this is an excellent wall charger.When I go on vacation, I usually end up with more than one device to charge overnight (either mine or someone else's). This Bolse wall charger will make it easy to get every device charged back up to full capacity with no arguments over who gets to use the charger first.Disclosure:Obtained From: LowerPriceUSAPayment: Free
summary: An outstanding USB wall charger...

reviewText: This doesn't feel like it's one of the faster chargers I've reviewed in the past but it definitely feels good in my hand and I do like the size.  I did a charge from 25% for approximately 1 hour on my Samsung Note 2 and after one hour it charged it about 20%.  I was expecting it to be a little quicker but that's okay. I compared this to my other 2.0 battery pack and it charged my phone almost triple in the same amount of time.  I was only able to get about 1.5 charges out of the aon6 but that's what I expected.The size of this is very small.  You can easily carry this around in your pocket if you are a guy without it bothering you.  I like how it felt in my hands.  It's very smooth and slick. The LED indicator on the side made it look futuristic which I liked as well.  This doesn't seem too thick which is about 1 inch in thickness.Overall, great little piece.  I think it will be useful for people who like to travel light. I received this item for an honest review.
summary: Nice design - Very compact charger

reviewText: I tested Bolse AON 6 (5200 mAh) Power Pack with Samsung Galaxy 7.7 Tablet (running ICS 4.0.4) and iPad Mini.  This charger did quite well charging the iPad Mini compared to other external batteries and in the middle of the pack for the Galaxy Tablet.  It cannot handle charging both tablets at the same time.I received this power bank from the manufacturer for an honest review be it positive or negative. Top reviewers are often asked to review new battery packs and one of the benefits of being asked to test different power banks is that it gives me an opportunity to compare them to each other using the same charging test, so I can compare them using "apples to apples" comparison. This set of tests allows me to provide unbiased results as the numbers speak for the performance of each unit.My methodology is to charge each mobile device on each port of the unit for 10 minutes and measuring how much each unit was charge in that 10 minute period. In addition I tested charging two mobile devices at the same time. Each line in the table below represents a separate 10 minute test.I use Battery App by Elvison to determine how each device recognized the charging source. 'AC' status means the charging is at full charging rate. 'USB' status indicates charging at a lower charging rate. 'Discharging' status means that the charging rate is below the power that the device is consuming so it slows down the discharge rate but does not re-charge.➨ General features:======================Bolse AON 6 external battery weighs 5.1 oz. Its size is 3.75" x 2" x 1".The pack has two USB output port, labelled  Output I and Output II.  My test below show that iPad Mini works equally on both ports, and Samsung Galaxy works on both, but gets significantly faster charging on one of the ports.The package include 4 tips, among them micro USB, mini USB, and iPad. I am not sure what device the round connector is for.  The package also contains two cables: a micro USB cable and a charging table for interchangable tips. Galaxy tab connector and lightening cable for iPad Mini were not included and I used my own charging cables for the test below.  Some external batteries include a small flashlight, this external battery does not.I am attaching two photos as video slides. Photo #1 shows everything included in Bolse AON 6 external battery package. Photo #2 shows the battery back during one of the test next to my tablets for size reference.➨ Test Results:======================✔ Samsung Galaxy 7.7 tablet (using my own Galaxy tab connector cable)~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Output I: AC ~~~~~~ 3% change in charge in 10 minutesOutput II: AC ~~~~~ 2% change in charge in 10 minutes✔ iPad Mini tablet (using my own lightening connector cable)~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Output I: AC ~~~~~~ 3% change in charge in 10 minutesOutput II: AC ~~~~~ 4% change in charge in 10 minutes✔ iPad Mini and Samsung Galaxy 7.7 tablet at the same time~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Output I: AC ~~~~~~ discharging, cannot handle both tablets at the same time (iPad Mini)Output II: AC ~~~~~ discharging, cannot handle both tablets at the same time (Galaxy Tablet)Output I: AC ~~~~~~ discharging, cannot handle both tablets at the same time (Galaxy Tablet)Output II: AC ~~~~~ discharging, cannot handle both tablets at the same time (iPad Mini)➨ Key finding:======================✔ This power pack works well with both Samsung Galaxy tablet and iPad Mini one at a time. It did quite well charging the iPad Mini compared to other external power packs, and in the middle of the pack for the Galaxy Tablet.  It cannot handle charging both at the same time, it quickly shuts off. Overall it earned a respectable 4 star rating.Ali Julia review
summary: Tested with iPad Mini and Samsung Galaxy tablet

reviewText: The Bolse AON6 is an attractive compact external power bank - while there are some bigger powerbanks available 5200mAh still offer lots of capacity without the unneeded size. My past experiences with Bolse Power banks have been very positive and that holds true for the AON6.Notes-- 5200mAh of storage which is enough capacity to fully charge an iPhone 5 twice or an iPad 4 at about 50%- Comes with a nice velvet storage case- Two outputs - with each rotated at 5V and 1amp- Nice compact design - will easily fit in your bakcpack - about 75% the size of an iPhone.- Comes with a total of 4 adapter pins - including a 30 pin Apple adapter, but it does not include the new Lightning Adapter.- Has an LED indicator showing how much charge remains- For best results you need to CHARGE the AON6 with a 5V 1Amp output- Dose not come with an LED lightFinal Verdict - The Bolse AON6 supplies 5200mAh of storage in a compact design. I like the dual outputs, and while I would prefer if one of the outputs was rated at 2 amps the Bolse AON6 is still highly recommended.4 1/2 StarsPlease Note - I received this product for reviewing purposes
summary: A Video Review of the Bolse Aon 6

reviewText: The Bolse AON6 battery pack is a basic medium capacity bulky pack. Unfortunately, this pack will not charge a first generation iPad at other than trickle charge rate. If somebody is interested in a pack for charging cell phones only, this is not bad.The pack will fully charge an iPhone 4s just over twice, almost three times. The plastic is shiny and smooth, and the pack has a good feel in my hand. There are two USB outputs and a microUSB port to charge the battery. On the flat side of the battery is a power switch and five blue LED's indicating rough percentage of battery capacity left. This is a chunky unit. On the round side it is just slightly smaller than a C size battery - or more than 2 iPhones stacked up. The width is about half an iPhone and the length slightly less than an iPhone 4.Overall, this is a nice battery pack that is well constructed. I find the blue LED's a bit bright for night time use (on the other hand they can serve as a night light in a dark room). Where the pack fails for me is the physical size, price, battery capacity, and minor features. In the newer world of battery packs, this one is pricey. There are larger capacity packs with more features that will charge an iPad for about the same price. There are also similar capacity batteries that are a much smaller form factor - the kind I can put in my pocket to charge my phone.If your charging needs are for phones only, this is not a bad choice. If you need something that is more universal or compact, you might want to consider other batteries.I was provided a review sample.
summary: Chunky - For Phones

reviewText: The choices in external batteries can be bewildering, and it's not always easy to decide which one to get.  First, it's best to determine your likely use (multiple devices, a power-hungry tablet, only a single smart phone, etc.) and how often you expect to need the extra power.  This Bolse power bank fully charges my iPhone 5 two-and-a-half  times, which really equates into three or four sessions since I plug in my phone when it gets to 25% or so.  While it will charge an iPad, it doesn't have enough power to charge the 3rd-gen iPad more than a third or so.  The 5200 mAh size is perfect if your often run-down your phone, if you travel, or if you want to to give your tablet enough juice to, say, finish watching a movie.  A larger battery is a must for frequent tablet use, and a smaller one might be in order for infrequent smartphone use.  This size is a good intermediate one -- not too large to be bulky but with a large enough capacity for a variety of devices.  It takes about 7 hours to charge the battery using a wall adapter.The dual ports are great to have.  When I'm on vacation, I can charge both my iPhone 5 (with my own cable) and my camera at the same time.  This battery will charge anything that can get power through a USB cable, although, if the included connectors/adapters don't fit, you'll have to use your own cable.  The battery feels and looks solid, with comfortable curves that fit in my hand.  It measures 3.75" x 2" x 1" at the widest points of each dimension.  (Note:  I received a sample for review.)-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Nice Size With Dual Charging Ports

reviewText: I've tested and reviewed several Bolse AON battery packs and they are most definitely up there with the best of them.  What I immediately noticed when I unboxed the Bolse AON6, was the unusual design.  Most of the more powerful battery packs are shaped like a pack of cards, but this one has a nice ergonomic design that makes it comfortable to hold.  There are no sharp edges and the rounded lengthwise body of this battery pack makes it quite unique.  The extra accessories are always a plus in my book because you never know when you'll need them, for yourself or someone else.This small battery pack really isn't made to power up a tablet, but I always try out a battery pack on one to see just what kind of power they have.  The performance of this little Bolse AON6 5200mAh was absolutely impressive.  Mind you, my tests are informal, but are quite telling.  This battery pack really was a work horse and gave an unexpectedly impressive performance.  If it can actually charge up an iPad this well, it certainly has enough power to charge up a couple of smaller devices readily.The only problem I had, and it is a visual one on my part, was that I had trouble seeing where those LED lights were at.  I simply made sure that I was fully charged overnight before I began.  I plugged it into my PC overnight and was good to go in the morning.  Something I didn't know when I started testing, was that the AON6 has a Samsung battery core.  This is definitely a high performance battery pack I'd want to have on hand when I need it.Bolse AON6 Performance:Start: 60% (4 LEDs)15 minutes 63%30 minutes 66%45 minutes 69%60 minutes 74%75 minutes 79%90 minutes 83%105 minutes 88%120 minutes  91%135 minutes:  95%150 minutes:  98%205 minutes:  100%WHAT'S IN THE BOX:~ 5200mAh power bank~ 4 connectors~ 1 USB power cable~ 1 Micro USB power cable~ 1 gray, suede-like travel pouch~ Quick start guideCOMPATIBILITY:~~  iPone, iPod, iPad, Blackberry, HC, MP3, MP4, PSPSPECS:~ Battery core:  Samsung battery core~ Weight: 140g (.30 pound)~ Capacity: 5200mAh~ Input current: 1000mAh~ Output current: 2A total max~ Input charging time: 5 - 6 hours with 5V 1A power adapter~ Recycling time:  >500 times~ One year limited warranty~ ROHS and CE certifiedDIMENSIONS:~  99(L)x44(W)x3.7(H) mm 3.89 x 21.73 x 0.145 inchesPOWER INDICATORS:~ One LED light on: 1% - 25%~ Two LED lights on: 5% - 50%~ Three LED lights on:  50% - 75%~ Four LED lights on: 75% -100%Sample provided for review.
summary: The Bolse AON6 is a high-performance, high quality battery pack with a Samsung battery core ...

reviewText: I have been using theBolse AON6 Dual USB Output 5200mAh External Battery Packover the last week and it has been quite useful and is easy to travel with.  The product provides lots of charging options and is perfect for Smartphones, tablets, and/or just about any device that can charge with a USB cable.In general, this battery had a really good recharge rate.  The unit recharged my Samsung S3 from 30% twice and it was able to run a small USB fan all night on a single charge with about 20% charge left in the pack.  This unit also works great with my Nexus 7 Tablet keeping me powered on longer trips and vacations.  The unit features one (1) 2A and one (1) 1A USB charging port.  That makes it perfect for charging a Smartphone and tablet at the same time.The package includes two (2) USB cables that work with the included tips.  Using the included tips (Apple 30-pin, Micro-B, Mini-B, and PSP), you will be able to charge nearly 90% of the devices out there today.  Should your device not use one of the included adapters, you may use the USB cable that came with your device to be charged.  This product even includes a nice soft cloth bag, perfect for keeping all your accessory adapters and cables together on the go or for storage.  The unit features a quick read display of five (5) blue LEDS indicating the power level in percentages of 20%.Overall, theBolse AON6 Dual USB Output 5200mAh External Battery Packis a great device for a great price.  It appears well made, is quite durable and performs great with the devices I use every day.  I would recommend this portable power bank for business and leisure travelers, the extreme gamer, the gadget obsessed and anyone who has had a device lose power at the most inconvenient time.  The AON6 is a great buy and is a great investment.Disclosure: I received a sample product from the manufacturer for the purposes of providing this review. A review in exchange for the review sample was not promised. The views and opinions expressed in this review are my own, and in no way represent the views or opinions of the manufacturer or vendor.
summary: Great Product; Charge Most Any Device That Uses A USB Cable...

reviewText: This is a beautiful design, nice, sleek curve that feels great in your hand. It has two USB ports and a micro USB input for charging. Five indicator lights give you a clear view of how much charge is left on the battery pack. The device comes with two cables, one standard USB to micro USB cable and a USB to open port to plug the included adapters in. There are four adapters (check out the photo to make sure yours is included).The charger also comes with a velvety drawstring pouch to hold all the parts together.This did a nice job charging my phone and Kindle. It does not charge my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 Tablet but most small power banks don't.It gives me multiple charges on each device before needing to be recharged itself so it is great for travel, long days away from the office, or to pack on an overnight.I was provided a unit for evaluation and an honest review.
summary: Complete Package! Feels Great in Your Hand

reviewText: The Bolse AON6 power bank is less than 3 3/4 in. long so it easily slips into a purse or pocket but will provide 5,200 nominal and well over 3,500 usable mAh of power because of the high-quality Samsung lithium ion battery system.  That’s enough to charge most smartphones, mp3 players, or a Kindle Paperwhite at least twice and to give a good boost to small tablet computers.The AON6 has a unique curved form and white and grey color scheme that makes it look like a prop from the set of “2001:  A Space Odyssey”  and I like the way it fits in the hand.The blue LED indicators show charging activity and remaining power capacity in 25% increments.  There are two power out ports with a total output of 2 A.  TIP:  Don’t forget to push the button to start the charging process!The AON6  comes with a coordinating velveteen pouch to store the power bank, cables, and four adapter tips, as well as an instruction and specification pamphlet with information about the twelve-month limited warranty.Bolse provided a review sample for testing and evaluation.  This is a reliable power bank that is ideal for small electronic devices.
summary: Futuristic power bank for small electronic devices

reviewText: Bolse makes an entire series of power banks ranging from 5,200 mAh and higher.  This model is on the lower end of power, but also the lower end of price.  You don't always need a heavy, high-capacity battery for just smart phones.First the battery pack is about one pound and measures 1" X 3" X 4-1/2". The side of the unit with the power button displays five bright-blue LED lights.  These show you 20%, 40%, 60%, 80% and 100% of charged remaining power.There are also two ways to charge your External Battery. You can choose from a Micro USB power port that has a male USB on the end or the other male USB cable that has a universal female port on the other end for one of the (4) four attachments (one will fit your device).  There is also a nice black pouch that will keep the battery and all the attachments safe and together. It's a real necessity.Just some geek info: "mAh" means `Milli-ampere hour'. It's the rating of the battery. It means your battery is of 5,200 mAh rating.Charging through the Micro to USB port (on my PC) took about (6-7) hours to charge and using the DC charger took about (5-6) hours to charge. So overnight charging will keep you powered for a long time. This can all vary a bit from outlet to outlet and PC to PC.I have an iPhone 4S and it will charge about 2-1/2 times from around 15%-20% of a starting charge.  It charged my iPad mini once from 20%.  Both together charged once and took about (9.0) nine hours.  (Never let your device go below 10% in order to keep the battery capacity at its best).I would suggest charging one device at a time to be sure of a full charge in a faster time. The white color with the almost mirrored surface is attractive, but shows smudges, if that really bothers you. All (4) attachments and the (2) cables are also white.I would suggest looking at all Bolse battery packs to see which one works best for you, as all are different with groups of attachments or simpler.  Please note that all Bolse batteries are different in power, function and capabilities. Product was supplied by manufacturer for an honest review.
summary: Lower Price & Lower Power - Still Great Value!

reviewText: The AON6 is a nice little power bank.  I comes with a beautiful velvet pouch with wooden beads.  There's nothing cheap about it.  Also included are a micro USB charging cord and a power cord with four adapters: 30-pin iPhone, mini USB, micro USB, and a round pin one I guess might be Nokia.There is a quirk related to the indicator lights on the power bank.  It's different from other power banks in that there are five indicator lights all lined up.  They look identical and they are unmarked but one of them on the end is actually a charging indicator light.  So, when charging the power bank, only four lights will light up to indicate a full charge.  When charging a device, the one light on the end will light up.  This is very different from most other power banks where all lights are power indicator lights and they light up to indicate the device is charging.This is a nice power bank.  With it, I can charge my iPhone 4S twice with some juice left to give it one more partial charge.  It will charge two devices at the same time.  While it has a maximum output of 2 amps, I was impressed with how well it charged my iPhone and Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet together.Of course, there's not nearly enough power to fully charge my Fire.  For owners of large tablets, I recommend power banks with 10000 mAh or greater.  Just remember, more capacity means larger, heavier power bank.The AON6 is a great size for cell phones.  I like that it can give more than one charge.  It's lightweight, attractive, and is not too bulky to fit in a purse.  Although men will like it, it does have a feminine appeal.This product was provided for review by LowerPriceUSA.
summary: Beautiful Power Bank

reviewText: The Bolse AON6 is a nice looking, very handy power bank.  If you have a purse, it is the right size and weight to carry with you all the time.  My son and I use iPhones and we have to charge it almost every day.  I carry a power bank all the time and he in his backpack.  My wife would not carry the 10,000+ mAh because the are too heavy in her purse.  The AON6 is perfect for her.It comes with 2 USB cables, one a regular microUSB and the other for attaching the multiple adapter tips for different brands of electronics.  Also comes with a pouch to carry the charger, cable and tips.  You can use any existing USB AC adapters that you have to charge the power bank or a USB slot in you PC (will take longer).This charger is designed primarily for smartphones with a 1A output for each of the 2 USB slots for a total of 2 Amps.  Not that you cannot use it for charging iPads or tablets, but it will take twice as long to do so.  Bolse makes a lot of battery packs designed for tablets.1 year warrantyQuick specs:5200 mAhLife cycle - 500 times
summary: Beauty and brawn

reviewText: I recently received the Bolse AON6 5200mAh External Battery Pack to try out and review. I have to admit I'm a real fan of the Bolse power packs, as I have a couple of other higher powered ones, and they are top-notch when it comes to performance and charging capacity. While the AON6 is on the low end when it comes to capacity, it's still a great choice to have tucked away in a pocket or purse should you happen to run low on a charge before you can get to your regular phone charger.The AON6 has two USB outputs, so you technically could recharge two devices at once if you needed to. The unit comes with one micro-USB cable for charging, and one USB cable with four interchangeable plugs for various devices (figure that means most phones minus the Apple lightning connector). Everything stores in a small velvet pouch so you don't lose all the small bits that seem to go missing of their own accord.For charging my iPhone 4, I ran it down to about 45% and then started a charge from the AON6. In 20 minutes, I had climbed to 65%, which isn't too bad in my book. That'd be perfect for that "just five more minutes" situations you might find yourself in by the end of the day. My iPad 4 was much slower to charge, but that's to be expected given the additional power drain it takes. Overall, it looks like I could get nearly two full charges on my iPhone if necessary. That would make the AON6 a good choice for a lighter weight external battery to carry around on a regular basis "just in case."I've come to believe that you can never have too many external batteries on hand and charged up should you have an extended power outage. The Bolse AON6 is a welcome addition to the collection.Disclosure:Obtained From: LowerPriceUSAPayment: Free
summary: Very good performance for a smaller external battery pack...

reviewText: My friends think I am silly having both a speaker AND hands free phone in my tub. I mean, who would answer the phone in the shower or bath? What would you say? What would they hear?But my friends aren't a pastor who serves an aging congregation. No, I don't need the phone to ANSWER my calls in the tub, but over the years I have had many friends who were injured in the bathroom, particularly in the tub. So having a way to make an emergency call from that location makes perfect sense to me! Push on the button and let Siri walk you through it.I'm too young to have one of those little devices around my neck, much less wanting to pay a monthly fee for the privilege! But this device doesn't make me feel old, it makes me feel young and fun while providing a bit of safety in the tub.By carefully reading the directions before using it, it synched seamlessly AND I knew to push the arrows longer to control the volume. It went WAY up, louder than I needed. The forward, back, and pause buttons worked as well.My iPhone was in the living room (about 20 ft and a closed door away) and there was no problem with the Bluetooth signal. The suction cup worked well when I tested it, but I have many flat surfaces that are also handy on my tub/shower enclosure. And listening to Anne Murray amid the bubbles was a real pleasure.If you are old enough to worry about bathroom falls, but too young to REALLY worry, this might be a great safety device for you to keep handy. Outside of the tub, it also makes a super little speaker phone to add to your phone.I am grateful to Abco for providing me with this nice sample to test out. Now I need to record some messages for my granddaughter to put on iTunes and play from my iPad when she is in there! "Are you splashing?" "Aren't you done yet?" "Did you wash behind your ears?"The things a Grandma can think of with a new toy! Five stars ...
summary: Handier than you might think - worked very well for me.

reviewText: I didn't expect to much from an inexpensive shower speaker. The sound was okay, though a little tinny. The suction cup worked okay, but the charging pin is a very thin wire and it seems to have been bent, so we can't recharge it. I have had good luck with other abco tech products, but didn't love this one.Sample provided for fair review
summary: Charging pin bent right away

reviewText: This ABCO Tech Waterproof Wireless Bluetooth Show Speaker is easy to setup and works great! My wife loves listening to music while in the show and tends to blare it from a docking station in the bathroom, but this great little speaker lets her listen right in shower. Here are my observations:+ Easy Setup; came mostly charged and paired quickly with the iPhone 5+ Great Sound; very impressive base and treble+ Speaker Phone; lets you take calls in the shower (for the "Type A" peronalities) with a decent built in microphone+ Waterproof; while I didn't submerge it, no ill effects were experienced with it being in the shower+ Suction Cup; a full sized suction cup ensures that it will stay where you put itThis is a great little Bluetooth speaker that works like it should!Highly Recommended!CFHNote: Sample unit provided for review
summary: Very Good Shower Speaker - Highly Recommended

reviewText: I tested this by pairing it with my iPod and then using it with the iPod in a separate room about 8 meters distance.  Then I tested with my iPhone.* At this range and despite the signal going through walls and the presence of a lot of metal, the speaker felt like the original source.* The sound quality was pretty good because it's in the shower.  For a lightweight device that stays on the wall with a big suction cup, I could not have expected much bass.  But it's better than using a larger unit that isn't in the shower, given the noise of the water.* The way the unit is sealed makes it obviously waterproof. From appearance of the design, I expect it to last.* It uses a specialized power in connection that helps it stay waterproof.  The cable is provided.* The different taps to play, increase or decrease volume, move the track forward or backward - they are simple that it was intuitive in the first use.* The phone works with this device although the quality of sound on the other side is not good enough for the other party to want to carry on a long conversation.  I think this is a convenience that some may like, particularly young people that always be in touch with their friends.This shower speaker would make a nice gift for many.  Almost everybody likes music in the shower.  I was provided a promotional unit for review purposes.
summary: Introduces to shower: decent bluetooth music plus phone

reviewText: I tried this in my tub first - I didn't wet the suction cup before sticking it to the tile so it fell off after a few minutes and fell into the full tub.  I thought for sure it was ruined, but I pulled it out, stuck it back on the wall and it just kept pumping out the music.  It's not Bose-quality sound, but it's perfectly adequate for the price and purpose.  I also took it out with me on my kayak and having music on my paddle was very cool.  I was able to keep my iphone in a waterproof case and not have to worry about running an audio cable out of it (which makes me nervous.)  I just paired the speaker with my phone and set the music to play.  If you are looking for an affordable waterproof audio solution - this is an excellent choice!
summary: Not just for the shower!

reviewText: I have never been one to enjoy singing in the shower, but I always appreciated being able to listen to the music on the beach. This small and effective portable Bluetooth speaker enables me to partake in both of those activities, and so I've discovered the pleasures of listening to the music in my bathroom.The speaker is very well built overall, with the rubberized outer shell covering most of its front and the sides. I've discovered that the covering has slightly started to peel off on one of the sides, but this has not affected this speaker's look or performance.The speaker was easy to pair up with my iPhone. Once it is turned on it becomes visible in the list of Bluetooth devices. I am not sure how easy it is to pair it up with other smartphones, tablets, and computers but my guess would be that it should not be much of the problem either.The sound quality was pretty good, especially for a device of this size. If you end up mostly using it in the shower room then there will be some entirely expected audio distortions due to the small size of the surrounding space. There are also limitations to the sound quality of any device that uses Bluetooth standard for the signal transmission, but unless you are a very strict audiophile this will not be much of an issue for you.One issue that I have with this speaker is that it's easy to skip tracks or change listening playlists. Once you decide what you are listening to in the shower, you are pretty much committed. Unless you take REALLY long showers, this should not be an issue.I've used this speaker in the shower for a few weeks and so far have not had any problem with the sound damage. If, however, something does go wrong at some point I will make sure to update this review.Overall I am very pleased with this speaker. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a small and convenient speaker to be used in the very wet spaces.
summary: Pretty Good Waterproof Bluetooth Speaker

reviewText: Please note, this review is now a "Amazon Verified Purchase" because my wife liked this so much that she purchased one as a Christmas gift for her brother.  He called and said it was great.ORIGINAL REVIEW:I was provided an Abco Tech Waterproof Wireless Bluetooth Shower Speaker for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ This speaker looks fun with a nice design and vibrant colors (I got a blue one).♦ It sounds great and produces a high enough volume so you have no problem hearing it clearly in the shower.♦ Has basic controls on the unit to play/pause, adjust volume and skip forward and backwards in your song list.♦ Suction cup worked on glass and wall tiles in my walk-in shower.♦ It has a rechargeable battery that charges with a proprietary USB cable (included) that could be a problem if lost or broken.Detailed Review:♦ Look - The product came in a circular plastic display box that showed the product right through the packaging.  Inside the box was the speaker, a proprietary USB charging cable and an instruction manual.  The speaker looks cool and had a nice blue color.  It has rubberized buttons and a rubber cover that closes off the charging port.  On the front, it has a circular grouping of buttons that has a play/pause button, two combined FF/RW and volume buttons, a power button and a speakerphone button with microphone.  On the back there are holes for the speaker and a large suction cup.  It looks like it is built well.♦ Use and Performance - I plugged in the included USB charging cable into the unit and into my computer to give it an initial charge before testing it out.  Once the speaker was charged, I easily paired it to my iPhone 5 a did a variety of tests to try it out.Test #1 (Sound Quality Test) - At my desk, I tried out a variety of music from some Disney kids songs to some Pop Music to Excision Bass Heavy Dubstep (the Destroid album), and the speaker performed very well.  It reached pretty high volumes while still maintaining clarity.  It sounded really good overall for a single speaker setup that is focused on being a shower speaker, not a HiFi speaker.Test #2 (Shower Test) - I then tried it out in the shower.  I started playing a playlist on my phone and left it on the counter about six feet away from the shower.  You have to get the music going on your device first because you can only really do pause/play and skip songs backwards and forwards.  Best bet is to use a playlist or shuffle several songs. In the shower, the sound was really good.  It got very loud at times, so much so, that I had to turn it down by holding down the RW button (which controls volume also).  The controls were great for moving between songs and adjusting the volume.  During my shower, I moved the speaker from the glass walls to various place on wall tile that had minimal texture to it and the suction cup stuck very firmly in all cases.  I then had my wife take my phone out of the bathroom and walk it across the house.  It stayed connected until it got very far away all the way to my office.  I would say it had at least a 20 foot range through several walls.  Plenty of range if you want to leave your phone outside of the bathroom and away from all that humidity.Conclusion:Overall, this was a great little shower speaker.  It sounded great and had great range.  It had nice controls and was fun.  I told my Wife that this would be great for the kids to listen to songs while they were taking their bath at night, and I think she got a little jealous.  I think she wants one for our shower.  Looks like I might have to pick up a second one.  If you are looking for a fun shower speaker that sounds good and works well, this one is a great choice. Highly Recommended!
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy! (Updated)

reviewText: The quality of sound form this wireless Bluetooth Shower Speaker  is really rather amazing. Never in favor of placing devices that might suffer form steam in the bathroom, this well designed little speaker solves that problem very, very well. Very easy to pop on to the shower wall  (or to the mirror while shaving), the installation and charging are a snap. In this particular upgraded version the battery has been upgraded (now holds charge for up to 15 hours) as has the phone volume (yes, you can use it with your iPhone , too- as a matter of fact  this little guy is compatible with any Bluetooth media player or phone - works great with apple iPhone 5 Siri, Android Devices and phones, Samsung S-Voice, Google Music, Pandora and all other audio APPs on your android or iPhone).It is attractive (mine is blue which makes sense with the waterproof aspect scheme), small, easily manipulated while in the shower  (the buttons are large and easily accessed), and it will serve as a surprise for guests if you have one in the guest bathroom, ready to go, when they arrive for the holidays. Or better yet, use it as a stocking stuffer – it is affordable!. Grady Harp, December 13
summary: For those who fear the effect of steam on the iPhone or iPod

reviewText: So, I've had some surprises out of this littleAbco Tech Waterproof Wireless Bluetooth Shower Speaker & Handsfree speakerphone - - Compatible with all Bluetooth Devices, iPhone 5 Siri and All Android devices (Pink)that arrived from the manufacturer one day last week.  I first noticed it while I was streaming music to the unit from my iPad while answering an email.  There was just the strangest noise along with the music - tip tap, tappety tap, tip tip tip, clackety clack - and then I realized that the "typing" sounds the iPad makes when you type on it were also playing along with the Christmas music.  Of course I tried turning down the volume on the iPad to eliminate the the "typing" only to find that the volume of speaker disappeared right along with the clackety-clacks.  (Hint to those who are complaining of low sound volume - try the OTHER button.  This baby is LOUD!)The other surprise?  When I turned the speaker on to pairing mode a while ago so that I could listen to music while I type I discovered that once theAbco Tech Waterproof Wireless Bluetooth Shower Speaker & Handsfree speakerphonehas been paired to a device it will automatically connect to that device the next time it goes into pairing mode if the device has Bluetooth on.  ♥︎  This is the only Bluetooth speaker I've tested that connects automatically like this.The speaker is just about 3 inches across, covered in a brightly colored material that is quite similar to the silicon baking molds in my kitchen and attaches to the wall by way of a large suction cup.  The charging port is located under a gray seal on the bottom rim of the unit to insure that water does not enter the port while you are showering.  Controls are located in the gray center area.  Molded into the plastic, they are a bit hard to see, but luckily there are only five of them, easy enough to remember. TheAbco Tech Waterproof Wireless Bluetooth Shower Speaker & Handsfree speakerphonecomes with a unit-specific USB cable.  While you can certainly charge it directly from  your computer, I keep one of these[UL Certified] iClever 3.1A 15W Dual USB Travel mobile Wall Chargerplugged in for charging a couple of devices at a time more rapidly.While paired your phone is accessible by pressing the phone button.  When you answer a call the music will automatically lower in volume and then resume after you hang up.  ♥︎ Even better, if you have an iPhone or are paired to another i-device with a Siri presence you can do things like place calls, make notes and play specific music selections by pressing the call button.  (Also said to work with Samsung S Voice, but I've not tested that.)Grandma's $0.02 - Fun colors & easy operation makeAbco Tech Waterproof Wireless Bluetooth Shower Speaker & Handsfree speakerphonea much-appreciated choice for music lovers.  The unit comes compactly stored in a clear acrylic box that makes a handy storage case. Great for traveling!Recommended
summary: Fun Colors, Great Sound, Talk to Siri!

reviewText: I've seen some portable Bluetooth speakers that were advertised as water-resistant or waterproof, but the Abco Tech speaker is one of the few that appears to actually encourage its use around water. To test the speaker's watertightness, I attached it to the tile wall below the shower head support while I took a shower last night. It didn't get any direct spray, but it got plenty of splatter and was soaked after a minute or two. It worked fine, though, and afterwards, I shook it and wiped it dry.The speaker paired easily with my Kindle Fire HD. The audio quality playing MP3 music was acceptable for such a small device. The specs don't list the audio output power, but based on my experience with other small portable speakers, my guess is about 3-4 watts. The music can be controlled from either the phone/tablet or the controls on the speaker. [Note that the speaker does not have a 3.5mm audio port, so it can't be hard-wired to an audio source.]I only tested the speaker for playing music from my Kindle Fire. As for using the speaker for phone calls in the shower, I just don't think that I want to be that available.The user guide indicates that the speaker's internal battery can be recharged through a USB port on a computer or from a 5V AC wall adapter. A 39-inch charging cable is included - don't lose it, because the plug is a nonstandard type that might be hard to replace. The charging port is covered by a water-resistant flap that opens to allow access.I have one slightly negative comment, but it's not a deal-breaker, just a small annoyance: The control markings on top of the speaker are a little hard to read unless the light is just right.If you're looking for a small portable Bluetooth speaker, the Abco Tech speaker is definitely worth a look, especially if you need a speaker that will operate in damp environments like the bathroom or kitchen, or outdoors near a lake or pool, or in rainy weather.A product sample was provided by the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: A versatile speaker that performs in wet and dry conditions

reviewText: This is a really neat speaker. It easily paired with my smartphone. The sound quality was pretty good. It is made of a hard, plastic shell with a soft rubber control pad. The input jack is also covered with a soft and movable rubber plug. It comes with a USB cable for charging.I has a great suction cup to adhere it to many surfaces. It could be your shower, kitchen tile backsplash, or even outside if working on a humid or rainy day. The bluetooth connection was good for quite a distance, about 25-30 feet.Controls include: power, volume, forward, backward and phone. The controls are a little hard to use - to push down - so it can make it difficult.The blue is pretty bright, like the photo.
summary: Versitile, Fun, Waterproof!

reviewText: I received a review sample from the manufacturer and after thorough testing can attest that it works as advertized. However, there are a few caveats.First, the suction cup will adhere solidly to any clean, smooth surface. If you are attaching it to tile you need to make sure the tiles are at least 3x3 inches because any seams from smaller tile will not allow the cup to hold.I tested mine in a shower and the water from my massaging-style shower head drowned out the sound. However, the water did not affect the speaker in the least. I moved it to the kitchen where I spend a lot of time and it is my perfect cooking companion. It adhered beautifully to my stainless steel refrigerator. There the volume is more than adequate, and the sound itself is excellent to my ears.What is especially nice about this speaker is you can answer and end phone calls with it as well as redial the last number. The controls are simple and pairing it with my phone was a snap - I held down on the on/off switch for about six seconds and it beeped and started alternating blue and orange blinking lights. I scanned for bluetooth devices with my Samsung Galaxy Note II and it popped up, paired and connected.Here are a few things that I do not like. First, the charging cable is not the common USB-to-micro USB type. It has USB on one end and a small straight jack on the other. I understand why this is used because it allows a watertight plug to fill the charging jack. However, it's an uncommon cable that may be difficult to replace if you lose or damage the one that comes with this speaker.The other thing I do not like is the process for turning the speaker off. Merely pressing the on/off switch will not work. You have to use your device's bluetooth settings to break the connection between the device and the speaker, then use the on/off switch. While this is not a show stopper it is inconvenient.Overall I am pleased with the speaker because of the sound quality and the phone features. I can live with the issues I cited above, and while my shower head drowns this out other models may not.
summary: Waterproof and will work in a shower, but ...

reviewText: This speaker reminds me of a hockey puck. It has such a cute and simple form factor. Just charge it up and suction it to the shower wall. I'm no fan of suction power, but I've had this one up for more than two weeks and the suction cup shows no sign of letting up.Pairing is easy. I paired it with both my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet and my iPhone without problems. Reconnecting is automatic on the iPhone. I just have to choose the device on the Fire.The Bluetooth range is excellent. I took my iPhone out of the bathroom, out the bedroom, down the stairs and the speaker still played.Battery life is great. I charged it once and two weeks later, it's still going. Mind you, I only turn it on while using the shower.All the controls work well. I can skip music, go back, pause, play, adjust volume . . . and answer the phone. I'm not sure who wants to answer the phone while in the shower. I imagine all the noise from the water would make it difficult for the person on the other end. Nevertheless, I tested it -- with the water off, as that's what I would do if I actually answered the phone in the shower. The sound from the speaker is excellent. I can hear the caller like I could directly on my cell phone. It's clear as can be. The other end is much more like from a speakerphone. It's a muddier sound, though it doesn't cut in and out. I suspect the echoing in the shower is the cause of that, but that's where it would be used, so that's where I tested it. Call back last number works. No Siri.The only problem I've discovered is the play button doesn't work on my Kindle Fire when I'm playing the Songza app (it will pause the music, but it won't restart the music). This is just app specific, because the play button does work with the mp3 music I have on the Kindle itself. I also have the Songza app on my iPhone and the play button works just fine there.Music sounds great coming out of this little thing. With the tile in the shower providing reverberation, the sounds are even better. It's an excellent Bluetooth shower speaker. I like it.This product was provided for review by Abco.
summary: Great Music In the Shower

reviewText: Singing in the shower can be fun but, although I hate to admit it, my voice isn't all that great. I get off key, forget the words to the songs and sometimes I sing too loud. It annoys the rest of the household, even the dogs. So when Abco Tech sent me a sample of their Bluetooth waterproof shower speaker, I was kind of excited to try it. Music from this speaker might help keep me on key and would at least help with remembering the words. But, according to my husband, the real beauty of it is that it can be turned up loud enough to drown me out!The speaker comes with an adapter that plugs into a wall outlet and the other end into the speaker. It flashes a red light until it's charged, which goes off when it's full. Then I just pressed the power button and held it down for 6 seconds until a red light alternating with a blue started flashing. That meant it was in pairing mode I turned on my I Touch and went to the settings and turned on the Bluetooth. The shower speaker showed up on my iTouch list of devices right away. I selected it and then went to a favorite playlist to play some tunes.There's a big suction cup on the back of the speaker, almost as large as the speaker itself. I cleaned an area near the top of the shower door with glass cleaner and then just a little rubbing alcohol to make sure it was really clean. The place where I placed it was out of the direct line of the shower spray. It stuck up there easily and seems to be pretty stable. Playing with the volume and phone buttons didn't seem to bother it's sticking ability.It's great to have this little speaker in the shower. Both the bass and the high notes sound very good for a speaker this size. (Even with soap in your ears!) I can put the iTouch up to about 30 feet away, even behind walls, and it stays connected. If I'm using my iPhone to play music and the phone rings amid all the singing and carrying on, I just hit the little phone button to take the call and this becomes a hands-free speakerphone. I told some today that I was taking an iShower! It could come in handy if you're waiting for a call and don't want to miss it in the shower. It's a fun product and would make a good gift because it's useful and probably not something most people would have. (How about wrapping it up with aClassic Yellow Rubber Ducky by Schylling)?These all sound great on this speaker. I'm adding these to my shower playlist:Shower The PeopleRubber DuckiePurple RainRaindrops Keep Falling On My Head (Re-Recorded / Remastered) (as heard in Butch Cassidy & The Sundance Kid)Water Music, Suite No.1 in F: III. Moderato [Minuet]
summary: Takes singing in the shower to a whole new level

reviewText: Let's just say I am NOT a fan of screen protectors. I love the concept, but no matter how easy everyone says they are to apply, I always end up with bubbles.So when Zeetron offered to send me a complimentary sample to use, I actually laughed at them. I informed them I only did EASY and that I would mark it down (severely) if it had bubbles. I don't do bubbles. I hate screen protectors. They promised me I would find it easy. So I agreed to accept a sample for my iPhone 4.This week, I upgraded my iPhone 4 to an iPhone 5s. The following day the screen arrived. OOOPS. Now I had to convince my daughter that I could do it on her iPhone 4s! I promised her that there would be no bubbles. She laughed. I promised her I would take it off if she didn't like it. She finally gave in after I showed her the video Zeetron posted on You Tube. But she watched me.And I was shocked. I put the button on the way they said, and made sure it worked correctly. Yep, it clicked. Siri said Hi when I held it down too long.Next, after cleaning it with alcohol and the cloth, I peeled off side one and placed it loosely onto the surface, making sure the hole was centered over the home button. Then I did what it said in the video, I lightly tapped it. Just one little tap. And this screen attached itself! One bubble in the corner easily was pushed out with the provided Squeegee (covered with the cloth). Voila, a perfect cover!Let's be honest, my daughter is NOT going to let me test the hardness on her iPhone. No keys, no scissors, no rocks. She won't even let me test the waterproof nature of the screen. Such a spoilsport!The things I was able to test (after she unlocked her phone) include the fact that I noticed it did not collect fingerprints as easily. The swiping motion worked seamlessly. When I tried it on Smule, I had no problem hitting the notes. It seems to be totally clear with no glare problems. On the other hand, she tends to type a lot on her cell phone and said it isn't "quite" as sensitive to that type of touch as before.There was one small issue that bothered her. She had a very snug fitting case and it took a bit of effort to get it back on, at first she was afraid it wouldn't fit. Since this is .4mm thick, you should be aware that it could be a problem.I really and truly love this and would buy one for my new phone except that you need to cover the home button, and since you need that uncovered to read fingerprints, it may be awhile before they come out with a shield for me.So, from I hate screen protectors to five stars, quite a journey. I guess that is the advantage of getting an actual sample - you get to see if it works the way they say! In this case, they were right, it worked perfectly ... and no bubbles to worry about.
summary: They changed my mind about screen protectors

reviewText: Zeetron makes lots of products for the modification, accessorizing and DIY repair of iPhones.  This product, the Bionic Shield Premium iPhone Tempered Glass Screen Protector with Oleophobic Coating for iPhone 4/4S, was supplied by the manufacturer to me for the purpose of an honest, unpaid review.I own an iPhone 4S, which generally is encased in aOtterBox Defender Series Hybrid Case & Holster for iPhone 4 & 4S  - Retail Packaging - Blackwhich has a built-in screen protector.  Prior to getting that case I usedTech Armor Apple iPhone 4/4S Premium HD Clear Screen Protector with Lifetime Replacement Warranty [3-Pack] - Retail Packagingto protect my device's screen. Both are acceptable options to me, and both show fingerprints and neither offers substantial protection against some types of scratches.Zeetron Bionic Shield - PRODUCT INSTALLATION:Installing this screen protector is very easy, but you need to take your time.  Go slowly when placing the protector on your iPhone's screen, as lining up the edges is critical to proper placement and installation success.Wipe off any smudges prior to installation; using the included alcohol wipe.  Let the screen face thoroughly dry prior to installing the protector.Peel off the #1 label first, and place the protector on your screen.  If any bubbles appear, use the included squeegee, but be gentle and again, take your time.  If you don't, you run the risk of cracking the protector and/or your iPhone's screen.After you are satisfied that the bubbles are rubbed out, peel off the #2 tab to finish installation.  A bit of rubbing with the included microfiber cloth and/or squeegee may still be necessary.Product should now be installed on your iPhone.OPTIONAL BUTTON INSTALLATION:Included with the protector is a bonus.  Two decorated aluminum buttons - one black and one silver - come with the Zeetron Bionic Shield.  If you choose to install a button on your iPhone, do it before you install the shield.  It will be slightly raised, as it sits on top of the existing Home button on the iPhone.PRO's to Bionic Shield:+ Installation is easy by comparison to the peel and stick variety of screen protector that is flimsy and flops around. See YouTube for a video: "How to install the Zeetron Bionic Shield" prior to installation.+ The 9h hardness offers a nice bit of protection against everyday scrapes and scuffs which come directly at the face of the iPhone.+ Scratch-proof, shatter-proof, and water-resistant per Zeetron. (I didn't scratch at it with a sharp instrument or dribble water on it to test this out!)+ Screen protector is perfectly sized for iPhone 4/4S screen.+ Fingerprints and smudges are almost non-existent when this shield is applied to your iPhone.+ Price is on-point with the quality of the product.+ Touch sensitivity isn't affected, allowing for smooth operation of your iPhone with screen installed.CON's to the Bionic Shield:- It's made of glass, and the tempered glass can crack or break, which could potentially damage your iPhone's screen.- The edges of the screen protector slightly increase the thickness of your iPhone, which undoubtedly will be an issue with some iPhone cases. (0.4mm thick)- The edges of the protector are vulnerable to chips because the shield is tempered glass.- It's unclear whether or not the Bionic Shield can or will be displaced or cracked by a bump to the side of it, which catches the edge of the inflexible edge of the shield.- It's unclear whether the silicon adhesive that works so well to keep the Zeetron Bionic Shield in place will somehow damage the iPhone should you wish to someday remove the Bionic Shield.- Zeetron states the shield's rounded edges help to deflect shock from bumps and drops to the LCD screen on the iPhone. "Huh?" If you drop your phone and it's not in a protective case, it's likely it will get damaged.- No warranty.  Maybe it exists, but I couldn't find any warranty information on the Zeetron site or the Bionic Shield packaging regarding a stated or implied product warranty.CONCLUSION:The Zeetron Bionic Shield Premium Tempered Glass Screen Protector will appeal to iPhone users who don't mind paying a bit more for functional, amped-up of screen protection that also resists fingerprints.It's quality protection, well packaged and easy to install, but there are a few things that prevent me from wholeheartedly recommending this product to iPhone users.Issues may arise with screen protector removal, protector cracking or edge chipping, and iPhone case fit with the Bionic Shield installed.No warranty information was available for this product on Amazon, the Bionic Shield packaging (or insert) nor on the Zeetron site.  This may affect the buyer's ability to receive a product replacement if a cracked or chipped screen is received, or if your iPhone screen is damaged by use of the Bionic Shield - compensation for your expensive device!NOTE: ZEETRON SELLS DIY REPLACEMENT PART KITS for iPhones, iPads and iPods.  A DIY screen replacement kit from Zeetron for an iPhone 4/4S is about fifty bucks, with an iPhone 5 DIY kit being around one-twenty five to one-fifty (on Zeetron site).I would love to see Zeetron offer a warranty where at the very least you would be given a Zeetron DIY screen replacement kit (like shown in the links below) for your phone IF your iPhone screen was damaged by use of the Bionic Shield.Iphone 4S Front Glass Digitizer LCD Assembly Replacement Kit White (Includes Tools, Cloth and Microfiber)Zeetron iPhone 5 Black Premium Screen Repair Kit (Full Tool Kit + Screen Protector + Zeetron Cloth)UPDATE #1: (Same day as review was written I notified Yurly at Zeetron of posting. I received an email with the following response to my review.)From Yurly at Zeetron- "Thank you for your review. Let me just clarify something. If you drop the phone with the shield installed or bash it until your arm falls off it will not, I repeat will not effect your screen. This is the whole point of the protector. Yes the shield may break but your screen will never break. I can even proudly state that if you take a hammer and bash your screen and it your screen cracks I will replace it for your for free.  We tested this many times prior to production. Anyway just wanted to clarify that with you."FYI... take this info for what it's worth.As for me, I won't be be bashing my screen until my arms fall off to test out this claim, as if I did, replacing my screen or screen protector would be the least of my worries!UPDATE #2: (Same day, second email from Yurly at Zeetron after being informed I added his email to my review.)From Yurly at Zeetron - "Thank you. The reason I replied the way I did was because you provided incorrect information. - It's made of glass, and the tempered glass can crack or break, which could potentially damage your iPhone's screen. The screen will not crack. It will crack the shield before cracking the glass itself. I hope you did not take my response the incorrect way. I was only trying to clarify on your review."I stand by my review, and opinion as written.I believe this to be a good product, with issues to be considered by the consumer. I'm not running a scientific laboratory like Consumer Reports (or like at Zeetron) where I can line up iPhones and smash screens to make sure the 'protector' is working. I own one iPhone and since I paid a lot for it, I want to keep it in working order for a long time.I believe that since there is no warranty given by Zeetron for the iPhone's screen (not the Bionic Shield), no representative from Zeetron should claim that the iPhone's screen (not the Bionic Shield) will not crack. **Of course the shield will crack first - it's on top of the screen and impact would come from the front - hitting the Bionic Shield first!**Sometimes reviewer opinions will not please the manufacturer (as it appears in this case...), and if you're a potential buyer of a product and reading reviews, you're certainly smart enough to read them and make your own decision as to whether or not the product is right for you.I posted the emails received to add to the validity that this is an unbiased, unpaid, objective review, written in hopes of helping others to make educated Amazon purchases.IF YOU WISH TO CONTACT ZEETRON:For more information on the Bionic Shield, or to speak with Yurly or another Zeetron rep, go to their website (contact info including email and phone numbers are available) at the bottom of the page.
summary: Very good protection, but a few issues give me pause

reviewText: I'll be honest - I was sure the Bionic shield would end up in my "tech junk" drawer. Screen protectors never last on my devices for varying reasons - I want to give a couple of those reasons . Bionic Shield sent me a sample of this item - this review is my honest opinion.1) YOU CAN TELL THERE'S A SCREEN PROTECTORThere's nothing worse than knowing your phone has a screen protector. Often I have found that screen protectors result in a decrease in tactile or visual quality. Inferior quality plastic or glass will refract light, creating rainbow patterns on your screen (hardly fun wen you're trying to read an email outdoors), and sometimes will even dull colors.2) THEY DON'T GO ON CLEANLYI would venture to say that the majority of issues with applying screen protectors come down to user error. I have still encountered several that just would not apply properly, regardless of how carefully I put them on. I encountered a couple a few years ago that were not perfectly flat and would bubble out despite my having squeegeed the heck out of them.WHAT ABOUT THE BIONIC SHIELDHere's why the Bionic shield went on my phone and hasn't been off since.1) It's super high quality.2) It's HIGHLY protective (I was sent two and had some fun with one of them...)3) You literally cannot tell it is on4) It goes on easily and stays on.5) I could keep my current case with it*6) It came with home button stickers so that there wasn't a dip from the added depth*CONS?The only con I can foresee is that the added depth may be too much for some cases. Being a little bit flexible, my Incipio case went over the Bionic shield, but just barely. Some more rigid iPhone cases may have issues, so I thought it worth mentioning.OVERALLAs I mentioned, I was sent two of these screen protectors and used one for testing. A couple of nails, a knife and a dropped stapler later, and I feel very confident that my iPhone has the best protection a screen protector can offer. I highly recommend this protector - it's going to do a whole lot more than a plastic protector, and it is by far the best quality I have yet seen. With the one caveat that some rigid cases may not account for the extra depth, I have no hesitations in recommending this product.
summary: An exceptional product.

reviewText: After putting the Zeetron Bionic Shield on my iPhone 5, I'm never again going to apply one of those plastic types to any phone-- there is no comparison to the clarity and the ease of application of the Bionic Shield.  All I had to do was apply a home button decal (this is a must, or else the shield won't properly attach), remove the first layer of film, line up the shield with the edges, and tap the shield.  The screen protector attaches itself in a matter of seconds, and it's actually fun to watch it progress across the surface.  If a bubble or two remain, you can use the included squeegee to get rid of them.  When the shield is completely attached, you remove the second film, and voilà!  You have a crystal clear screen protector that looks as good as the iPhone 5 glass screen.  Even better, I find that the Bionic Shield is easier to wipe clean than the Belkin protector I was using, and it also doesn't seem to pick up dirt/grease at the same rate, thanks (I suppose) to the oleophobic coating.  I had forgotten how beautiful the iPhone screen could be.  And because the Bionic Shield sits a little within the lip of the iPhone, I can use it with any case I own.If you mess up the shield application -- it's difficult to get it wrong, but more on that later -- you can pull it off and reposition it as long as you don't remove the second film and take care not to touch the phone screen and the bottom of the Bionic Shield.  Because it's a thin layer of glass, it won't bend, buckle, or stick to itself the way other protectors can.  How do I know this?  Well, I'm one of the rare people who managed to screw up the initial application by not applying the home button.  I thought that because the two included buttons (one black and one silver) were called "decorative" that they were also optional.  When I tapped the screen, everything attached but the bottom, so I knew right away the mistake I had made.  With the help of my daughter since I needed extra hands, I removed the shield, applied the new home button, re-aligned the shield, and tapped.  This time, the screen attached itself completely.  I had one tiny bubble that disappeared with a single push of the squeegee.The Bionic Shield and my iPhone have been knocking about in my handbag -- against coins and keys -- without a single scratch.  There's a YouTube video that shows multiple attempts to scratch it, to no avail, and while I'm not about to try the same tests on my phone, I believe them.  Basically, the Bionic Shield is a second glass screen that protects the first.  Since iPhone 5s (and other models) are known for cracked faces on impact, the Bionic Shield is a great way to protect my investment.  I cannot praise the product highly enough.  (Note:  I received a sample for review.)-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Best Screen Protector EVER!

reviewText: As the new iPhone 5 becomes available one aspect to consider in spending that money for a cell phone is to protect it. So often the screen becomes scratched form pocket carrying (unless you have a case) but now that problem is a thing of the past. There are several screen protectors for iPhones (and for all cell phones) but in general they are near disposable and don't stand up to constant use. Now that is no longer a problem.Zeetron has made a special Bionic Shield for the iPhone 5 (they also have one for iPhone 4) and this shield is chemically treated and processed to the standard of being a transparent tempered glass. The surface is very hard and resists scratches form almost anything that could rub against it. It also has a special `oleophobic' (lacking an affinity for oils) coating that not only prevents fingerprints, but also is easily cleaned. The shield is backed with a silicon adhesive which is completely transparent and while the instructions for applying the shield to your iPhone are included in the packaging (along with other pieces of equipment like two metallic home buttons to elevate the on button once covered for heightened sensitivity to touch, a microfiber cloth, alcohol pad and squeegee), but it also points the purchaser to a site on the You Tube where step by step instructions for installations are given in video format [...].This is a reliable easy to install long lasing up to the moment scientifically designed shield for that iPhone that does not reduce finger sensitivity and is waterproof! Highly recommended, especially for the surprisingly low price. Grady Harp, September 13
summary: Protect your investment with style!

reviewText: My wife gives her iPhone 4 a torture test every day. When she's not using it, it's somewhere in the bottomless pit of her purse, being beat on with her keys, makeup, and all the other stuff she carries in it. The flexible screen protectors that we've put on it help, but none have lasted more than a few months, so I was looking forward to seeing if the Bionic Shield was as good as its promotional video looked [search for "Bionic Shield" on YouTube - it's the 2:19 video].The screen protector was pretty easy to apply. The key is to make sure the screen is completely free of dust and fingerprints before applying the tempered glass protector. The screen protector kit includes a little microfiber cloth and alcohol pad to help with this. Then it's a simple matter of applying the iPhone's Home button and protector, and using the included squeegee card to remove any bubbles of air. A silicone adhesive keeps the screen protector attached. Note: The install guide that's packaged with the kit is very general. Before installing the screen protector, be sure to watch the YouTube video for very clear instructions (it's brief, only about 2 minutes). [[...]The sensitivity of the iPhone's screen to touches and swipes did not appear to be significantly affected by the screen protector. And since the kit included a new Home button, the button worked normally. As far as testing the Bionic Shield's resistance to scratches, I didn't have the nerve to do what they did in the demo video, but I tried scratching the protector with a few household items, and it resisted my moderately vigorous efforts to damage the screen. My expectation is that the tempered glass will last longer and give better protection than screen protectors made of flexible films. If that proves to be true in the long term, this may be your best bet for a real screen protector for the iPhone.A product sample was provided by the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: The toughest screen protector I've seen so far

reviewText: I was glad to have the opportunity to try this for the iPhone4 because it's hard not to scratch your phone since it goes everywhere and is subject to a lot of wear and tear.The application. First of all, it was extremely easy to apply. I did it while waiting to be seated at a restaurant.1) I completely wiped down the face with the supplied wet wipe. The wet wipe took care of any oils but there were some wipe marks left.2) I used the supplied microfiber cloth to clean off the wipe marks until the face was completely free of any marks or oils.3) Removed the clear plastic film marked (1) from the shield, centered it on the phone and placed it on.4) Tapped the shield lightly in the middle and it applied itself squeezing out all the air.5) Removed the blue plastic film marked (2) and used the supplied squeegee to press it down.6) That's it. Because the shield is rigid, it is much easier to apply than protective film. You don't really have to worry about air bubbles or creases in film. But I have to say you should have a steady hand because I would not want to reapply it if it goes on crooked the first time.Function:1) Because it's a rigid shield with a thickness of 0.4mm, it does add thickness to your phone. However it also made the phone more rigid. The whole phone feels more solid. I was also able to fit on the phone's protective case without any problems.2) Protection. Passed the test with flying colors. We tried to scratch it all through dinner with the utensils on the table and none could scratch it. Felt good about that. The shield should also help the phone face from breaking because it's an extra layer on top of it.3) Doesn't reduce touch sensitivity.Overall, there are more pros than cons. The pros are that it's easy to apply and the shield is tempered glass with all its inherent toughness. The con is that it adds a little thickness to your phone. I think that the durability and the toughness of the glass trumps plastic film.If you want a durable and tough shield for your phone then I would highly recommend considering this. I received a sample from the manufacturer to try and I'm glad I did because I would not have considered a glass face until I tried this one.Addendum iPhone5:I also received a sample for the iPhone5 from Zeetron to test and because the page won't allow me to post a review for the iPhone5 I'm adding it to the bottom here.1) Application is the same as above. Very easy to apply.2) Protection:a) I decided to put it to the test and tried all manner of sharp objects to scratch it. I ran screwdrivers, scissors, nail clippers, box cutters, nails and keys across the front and failed to scratch it. I'm very impressed with this. The sharp points basically just slid off the glass. This should definitely stand any normal abuse.b) I also tried to smudge it. The shield is supposed to have some kind of oleophobic coating, and again it works. The shield failed to smudge.Overall, very pleased with it's protective qualities. If you tend to be very hard on your phone, I would definitely recommend this. Put it on a brand new phone and it will stay new. Highly recommended.Final update:With repeated scraping from a knife, shiv, machete, axe and a Swiss Army knife we were finally able to put some small scratches on the face plate. Still the tiny scratches were hard to notice after rubbing with the microfiber cloth and it's fairly unlikely this would constitute normal usage so I would still consider the shield very good protection with normal usage.
summary: Excellent! (Review for both iPhone4 and iPhone5

reviewText: This is the coolest iPhone shield I have seen so far. It comes in a fold out plastic package with an Alcohol rub cloth, a squeegee (bubble remover), two decorative aluminum buttons and EXPLOSION proof tempered glass film. There is a video on YOUTUBE that explains how to flawlessly attach this glass film, but it literally does most of the work itself.First clean the surface with the alcohol cloth, and then remove ANY dust you see thoroughly. This is very critical. Then carefully center your tempered glass unit on top, using the circular hole for orientation. Remove the first peel before applying it. Set it gently and press an area near the button and the tempered film magically attaches itself to your camera covers surface from bottom up. There is no rubbing or worry. It literally attaches itself.Finally, use the squeegee to remove any bubbles (there won't be if you are lucky) and then use it to rub down the corners for a secure and tight shield seal. I will not test this, but it is supposed to protect the corners and surface of your phones glass from hard knocks, drops and particularly sharp objects. Well worth the price.
summary: One Of The Best Protection Shields!

reviewText: UPDATE: 3/1/2014 - I reinstalled a replacement Bionc Shield sent to me by the company. I use a case on my iphone. Within one day of installing the replacement, the screen protector began to get pushed up around the edges by the case on my iPhone. And I've already noticed a thin scratch on the surface.UPDATE: 10/1/2013 - Today I noticed that the bottom edge of the screen protector had "crunched" or broken. There was an area that was crunched and a thin hairline crack radiated away from the crunched area off to the right edge of the screen. So not only did this screen protector become scratched in multiple areas in less than a week, it also cracked.The seller sent me another screen protector which I will now place on my phone. I have already removed the cracked screen protector. It broke in several places and very easily, as I was gently trying to pry it off my phone. There is no "glue" to speak of, just a thin layer of silicone that is what adheres to the iPhone screen like a suction cup.----I've had many different types of screen protectors on my iPhone over the last 3 years. With the exception of the Bionic Shield, they have all been some type of plastic of one kind or another. None have lasted more than 6-8 months max. They usually end up peeling off the phone or developing bubbles underneath.The primary issue has always been that they begin to peel off and seldom last longer than 6-8 months. However all of them have been really good at protecting the screen from scratches.The Bionic Shield by Zeetron is different. It is not plastic but is actually made of a very thin glass. Additonally, it has what is called an oleophobic coating that helps to prevent fingerprints from collecting on the glass. It works splendidly at resisting fingerprints. You also get some aluminum iPhone home button covers. These are not a gimmick, they actually work well.
