Both full-sized USB outlets can charge a device simultaneously. After charging two Bluetooth speakers and topping off my Nexus5, the powerbank still indicated 4 LEDs of power. Charge speed was respectable, similar to wall-wart AC adapters.The power button was kind of stiff at first, but seems to be working better with use. The powerbank LEDs light up automatically when a load is attached, and turn off automatically when charging is completeThe packaging and instructional insert are kind of generic, but operation is so simple that the lack of detailed directions doesn't matter. A short cable is provided, with four adapter ends (including miniUSB and microUSB), similar to other OXA products I've seen. This powerbank also includes a textured cloth carry-bag.Considering how important mobile devices are to modern living, I really like having this kind of powerbank in every bag I use (laptop case, camera bag, airline carry-on, etc). This kind of unit fills the "in transit" gap, such as when I'm traveling and haven't gotten to the rental car or hotel yet, but really need my nearly-drained smartphone battery to keep working.[ A sample was provided to me for review. ]This is a powerful unit with enough juice to service several devices. It's a bit heavier than I'd carry in a purse or camera bag, so this one goes in my laptop case. Recommended.
summary: compact, high-capacity powerbank

reviewText: This is actually a pretty nice little external battery, and is actually quiet powerful. I was able to change my devices without any problem at all and quickly. It is a little bit on the heavy side but not to bad. The initial charge of the external battery only took a few hours and should last quiet a while.The carry case is felt and a nice touch, also if you like OXA on Facebook it automatically extends the included warranty. There are several people I can think of that will like this product and I may have to pick up a few more.**I received a sample of this product to test and review. All opinions are honest and my own.**
summary: Compact and powerfull

reviewText: Disclaimer: I received this product in exchange for a fair and honest review.So, I receive a lot of chargers to review, and the only notable variance typically is in design, charge capacity, the number of ports, and different ampage it's able to charge.This one does all those things well. It doesnt have as great a cpacity as some other chargers I own, but it was sufficient to charge my Vita, Blackberry, and 3/4 of my Kindle before dying out. Speaking of that, it also accordingly passed the versatility test as far as what ampage the devices it could charge have.The LED charge indicator is nice and large, and is a simple as a push of the button. Two pushes turns on the LED flashlight, which is comparable to LED lights on other chargers as well.It has two ports, one for 1A, one for 2A.I do think it's a bit heavy, but on the plus size, the weight also translates into durability as well. The thing can defintiely take a beating (or at least, the one I have has taken a beating and is still functioning properly.The enclosed bag is maybe a little small. It fits the charger like a glove, but doesnt leave a lot of room for charger attachments and cords. Still, it's a nice feature nonetheless.Overall, this has become one of my favorite chargers, and I was glad to have the opportunity to test it out.
summary: A solidly built and effective charger

reviewText: Here's small, elegant-looking charger that holds a lot of energy.  LEDs on the front allow you to know when it's fully charged and ready to power up your phone or pad when you're away from a power source.  It's intelligent as well.  It turns off when your device (or two) has reached a full charge.Four different connectors are included with the cable so you have the appropriate connector for almost any electronic device. Store them easily in the velvety case.Overall, this is a fine travel charger that fits easily in purse or pocket.  I am happy to recommend it.NOTE: A sample was sent me by the manufacturer.
summary: A Velvety Case Houses This ReChargable Battery and Accessories

reviewText: Four and a half FLEXIBLE Stars! This sleek-looking black plastic and silver metallic OXA 7800 mAh Juice Box external battery charger is a powerhouse that charges multiple types of smartphones and smart tablets by way of two outputs: one with a 5 volt, 2.1 mAh port for tablets and the other port with a 5 volt 1.0 mAh port for smartphones. The nomenclature of the ports, unlike some competitors, is clearly and deeply etched into shiny metal, which is an advantage under low light conditions. Similar to the dimensions of a pack of cigarettes, it weighs in at 6.6 ounces. The unit arrived with 50% charge and could have immediately provided power where necessary. Under extensive testing, this charger rapidly and simultaneously charged a number of different types of smartphones and tablets in separate tests. The power levels are denoted by four blue lights which indicate the unit is fully charged when all are lit. These are located on the top of the Juice Box with one button that activates both the charger with one push of the button and/or a small onboard flash light with two pushes of the button.With one full Juice Box charge, three iPhones were fully charged to 100% and a fourth reached 35% before the charger was empty. Charging simultaneously, an iPhone was charged to 100% and a tablet reached nearly 50%. Charging 2 iPhones, the 7800 juice box was one of the fastest external chargers I have tested, powering up two iPhones at a speedy average of 1 hour and 52 minutes, which is faster than charging directly through an Apple power head connected to a 120 volt wall socket and that time is within 9 minutes of `on board' battery charging cases. Over weeks of testing, the battery actually became more efficient in it's output. Cons: there are status lights instead of a numerical readout of the unit's power status,  so the user is never sure exactly how much power total power is represented by the lights, although general estimation is possible. Another Con is the user "Manual" written in very small font. But a definite Plus is the onboard flashlight which casts a narrow beam that nicely illuminates a five foot by three foot main area across a darkened room. It takes 8 hours to recharge the OXA 7800 mAh Juice Box. If you need a speedy battery charge for one smartphone/tablet or if you have 2 items that need to be simultaneously charged, this Juice Box is Highly Recommended. Four and a half VERSATILE Stars.(OXA 7800 mAh Juice Box external battery charger, mini USB charging cable with 4 types of interchangeable heads (one of which charges iPhone5/5S smartphones) a very small font Manual of little utility, and a plush microfiber carrying case with drawstring. 1 year warranty is extended to 18 months with a Facebook "like" at the OXA page. Consult the Amazon.com product page for the exact compatible smartphones and tablets charged by this external battery. 500 estimated charge cycles. This item was provided by the manufacturer for testing and an impartial review.)
summary: EXCELLENT 7800 mAh DUAL PORT SMARTPHONE/TABLET CHARGER WITH FLASHLIGHT

reviewText: There are a lot of external batteries out there. OXA has a whole line of them and I've evaluated some others (as in the other cases, I received a sample for review). All of them are quite good if you understand how you're going to want to use them.Let's start with the basics. Input: 7800mAh, allowing for about 80% efficiency, should charge up in just under 10 hours. I found this unit charges in about 9 hours, a little better than expected and quite reasonable. Output: 7800mAh will give a typical tablet one full charge and a typical smartphone about 3 full charges. My results are in accord with this estimate. I was able to charge my phone about 2.5 times as well as charge an external speaker twice. This is about right. There are two USB output ports, one at 2A and the other at 1A. These are suitable for use in parallel and will charge your devices in a reasonable timeframe. (I don't believe in fast charging unless absolutely necessary; the heat generated can be damaging to both the device and the battery pack.)The unit is small, relatively light, and quite portable. It goes readily in a large pocket or easily in a briefcase, purse, or backpack. It is supplied with a cable and four adapters making it usable with just about any mainstream device. There is also a nice velvety carrying case. The unit has a small "flashlight" that doesn't put out much light but might help in a pinch.The 7800mAh rating places this unit between the larger (heavier, bulkier) 10000mAh and up battery packs, and the smaller (lighter, pocket/keychain size) chargers in the 2600mAh class. What unit you choose depends on your intended use. Do you want something small that will just "top up" your phone once or twice during a working day? Or do you want something that will provide a week of emergency power?This 7800mAh unit will provide emergency power for a phone for 4 to 5 days, from my testing. This makes it very good for camping trips and the like, and also useful at home during a power outage, even a somewhat extended one. If you're concerned only about home use and only an emergency power source, you might opt for a larger unit. But if you want something that will combine home and away use, including long-weekend recreational trips, this one is an excellent choice.I have no trouble giving the battery pack a five star rating. It works exactly as it should and it's very portable and convenient for a variety of uses.
summary: Very convenient for a variety of uses

reviewText: Small with lots of power. It does exactly what it says it will. I have had no problems charging this unit or using it to charge our various phones and tablets.The 4 lights to show how much charge is remaining bug me, I’d like it to be more precise. It is clear about how much you have but I wish there was more information.I had a small issue with the USB connector that came included. The cable is only about 18’ and the switchable connectors feel flimsy. I have not had anything go wrong but I it does not feel like it would hold up under repeated stress.Overall I am very pleased with the Power Bank, it does what it needs to and has been very useful.
summary: Compact and powerful but flimsy connectors

reviewText: The OXA 7800 mAh external battery pack or powerbank is very modern looking and works great. I tried with- Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 8"- iPad Air (2013 edition)- Samsung Galaxy S4 Octa Core edition- Garmin Nuvi 350 (yes, I still have it from 2006)It charged very well and durable. The ruggedness aspect is one I loved on the OXO product. The 4 shining LEDs on the device when it is powered on are gorgeous., Bright and clear. Nice green packaging. I was provided this product in exchange of a honest and fair review.
summary: Love it!

reviewText: OXA 7800mAh Juice Box S1 SAFE External Battery is a perfect solution for those who travel a lot and often not be around/near a wall jack or charging stations. Even if you have access to the wall/AC jack, sometime you don't feel like carrying those AC adapters. Generally speaking, I think most people can use some extra juice on their devices. And this battery pack works well to provide additional power well and compatible with most devices. This product also has built-in LED flashlight (double click the power button to operate the LED flashlight).I was curious on why the two ports have two different amperage rating and after a bit of research, here's what I think the reason is:Q: Can I blow up my device if I plug it to the wrong port (e.g. take a phone with 500mA requirement/wall charger and we plug it into the 2000mA)?A: No. You can plug any USB device into any USB cable and into any USB port, and nothing will blow up -- and in fact, using a more powerful charger should speed up battery charging.Q: So if you can't blew your device, why not make both USB port 2000mA (vs 2000mA and 600mA)?A: Some older devices (mainly pre-2007) will not take high-amperage USB (e.g. 2000mA), so you might need to use the lower amperage option to make the charging work (though as mentioned above plugging it into the 2000mA won't blow up the device)Overall, thisOXA 7800mAh is portable and very handy when you need some extra juice for your devices and you aren't near to any wall outlet or charging station.Thank you OXA for sending this External Battery Pack.Sidarta Tanu
summary: Need extra juice for your devices while travelling?

reviewText: The OXA Juice Box S1 7800 mAh external battery charger is sturdy and compact, the size of a box of cigarettes. Small enough (3  x 2  x  inches) and light enough (6.1 oz) to carry in a pocket or a small purse.The elegant sleek black plastic case with ergonomic rounded edges was designed in California and the unit is made in China, same as all OXA products. The glossy surface is easily marked by fingerprints, smudges and scuffs; a cleaning cloth and a soft velvet pouch (with a bead closure) are included, for shining and protection of the unit.The device is charged through a micro-USB - initially charge may take about 4 hours, when charged via a computer connection but can be much faster through a wall electrical outlet using a plug with a USB port.The power bank can charge two separate devices via its 2 USB ports - 5V/1 mAh and 5V/2 mAh - that can be used with most Apple and Android/Samsung devices. A small flashlight at the end of the device gives off moderate to weak lighting; it is activated on/off by double clicking the button on the back where four LED blue lights indicate the residual battery charge (in 25% increments) while charging the power bank or the portable device. A 100% charge is enough to supply three full increments to a smartphone and a couple to a Tablet.It is always a good idea to fully charge the power bank when first you take it out of the box, before using or testing it. A multi-use USB cable and four standard adaptors are included, to fit most portable devices.The power bank has a circuit protection (no overload/overheat) as well as automatic detection that does not require an "On/Off" button to activate. It also retains its charge for a long time when it is idle.The 18-month warranty is a major plus. The device is intuitive and easy to use.But negatives include an instructions/manual in miniscule print, written in confusing (sometimes nonsensical) English - obviously (badly) translated from another language.Also, the $2 price difference with the OXA S2 10,000 mAh battery, makes the 7800 unit less attractive.A complimentary sample was provided for review.
summary: delivers what it promises.

reviewText: External batteries are becoming more and more of a necessity as society continues to plug itself in to the myriad of electronic gadgets out on the market today. As someone who is notorious for forgetting to charge her cell phone, having an external battery has proven to be quite useful. While I already know that OXA manufactures high-quality products, testing out this battery proved my faith in their manufacturing prowess. So, without further ado, here are my impressions of the OXA Juice Box S1 (henceforth referred to as JBS1).ConstructionI will keep this portion short and sweet: the JBS1 is roughly the size of a deck of playing cards, only thicker. The plastic casing is glossy with a black paint that has subtle sparkles in it. While not heavy, there is definitely a bit of weight to this battery that helps to demonstrate the manufacturing quality of the JBS1. As indicated in the product description, there are two USB ports on the narrow edge of the battery that are set next to a small light. One USB port is rated for 2 Amps; the other USB port is 1 Amp.The face of the product has a silver circle set within a blue circle; there are four lights in a row in the blue area. These lights are used to indicate the charge level of the battery and will flash to indicate how much "juice" you have left. The silver inner circle acts as a power button; while it is textured to prevent your finger/thumb from slipping. The button is not very tactile, so it is not always obvious that it was depressed; if you are successful the charging lights within the blue circle will light up to show their power level. In addition, if you double-click the silver button the small light on the narrow edge of the battery will turn on and act as a flashlight.PerformanceIn terms of its primary purpose, the JBS1 delivers in spades. Once the battery is fully charged, you can use it to recharge your device(s) multiple times before the JBS1 needs to be recharged. From a full charge I was able to use the battery to charge my cell phone overnight for three consecutive nights, as well as using it to keep my phone powered during a phone call when the battery got low, before I needed to recharge it. I was also able to use it to charge both my cell phone and my iPod at the same time without there being a significant drain on the charge!The JBS1 comes with only one charging cable (which is used to charge the battery itself, also); what makes this product nifty is that, included with the battery, are charging adapter tips that plug into the non-USB end of the cord. The two most common adapters, micro-USB and Apple, are included. That way you have the flexibility to charge different devices without needing multiple USB cables! When you factor the excellent performance and construction of the JBS1, you are truly getting a great value.Final SayIf you find that your phone or other electronic gadget is running low on power by the end of the day, this battery is very handy to keep charged (takes about four hours from it being completely discharged) and ready-to-go to keep your devices powered. While a bit bigger than a deck of cards, the OXA Juice Box S1 will fit into your pocket, but may be a little bulky to carry. For this reason I recommend using this battery if you are going to be in the same area for a while.The only complaint that I have is that the micro-USB adapter tip had a little bit of play to it; sometimes I had to jiggle it a little for my phone to detect that it was there and for charging to commence. Overall, though, I never had any problems with any of the adapter tips that were included with the battery. Plus everything was nice and neat to store in the velvet pouch that is included with the JBS1. The only change that I would make to the pouch is to have a separate, zippered section to hold the adapter tips and cable so that they are not smooshed against the battery itself.Overall, if you would like to have a backup battery to keep in your briefcase, purse, or whatever, to know that your devices will be useable at all times, the OXA Juice Box S1 is a great product. With the multiple adapter tips allowing it to charge devices from other manufacturers as well as the sleek, sturdy construction, this battery is definitely worth the money, especially with how long that it lasts between charges! With the nifty flashlight at the end to help you see the ports in a darker room, the Juice Box S1 is worth every penny.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**
summary: A Must Have for Anyone with Lots of Gadgets!

reviewText: The OXA 7800 mAh Juice Box is a great charger. It is, however, not the best I've used.Having used a ton of "power bank" devices, I've got a few things I have come to expect from them:Easy chargingGood indication of power level on the battery2A and 1A charging portsThe OXA 7800 Juice Box has all three of these.Where a "power bank" begins to stand in a pack of its own is when they begin adding features or make design decisions for easy travel and so on.The OXA has a decently bright LED light for flashlight usage, which is a nice to have feature, but not needed. Another added bonus is the ability to charge more than one device at a time. Some of the older devices I've used offered 1A and 2A capability, but only allowed charging of one device at a time, which is a bit of a pain if you're traveling with more than one device and need remote charge capability. This device excels here, allowing dual charging of devices.Where it falls down for me is it's a bit heavier than expected at this capacity. The weight is also not evenly distributed, with the majority of the cells likely sitting in the bottom of the device. The size is also a little thick for what I expect of a device with this capacity, meaning it probably isn't easy to just slip into a pocket. If you carry a bag of some sort, no problem, but if you travel without a bag, keeping this in your pocket might prove a challenge.But that's the thing. It's only the size and weight that give me pause on recommending this one whole heartedly. So if you don't mind the odd weight distribution and can find utility in the flashlight, this is NOT a bad choice of power banks. OXA makes a lot of other power banks that I think are better overall, but there is nothing truly bad about this one.Recommended if the price is right and you can live with the weight/size.I received a free sample for review purposes.
summary: Not bad, but not the best

reviewText: To keep this short, the battery has an adequately sized capacity, the flashlight is very bright, two USB ports are present, and the device can easily be taken on the go. PICK ONE UP
summary: Very Portable

reviewText: I've been playing around with the OXA 7800mAh Juice Box S1 external battery the last few days, and it's a solid addition to my collection of external battery packs. I don't think you can ever have too many :), and this one has a couple of features that make it a good choice to take along on trips or as a regular part of your backpack.I charged the unit out of the box, as it showed it was down to a single LED indicator (0 to 25%). It seemed to be a bit on the slow side when it came to recharging, as it was still flashing on the fourth LED after about eight hours. I'm not sure if that last percentage point or two was preventing it from showing solid lights, or whether I was just impatient. Regardless, I plugged in my iPhone 5S which was sitting at 42% and let it charge off the 2A plug. I was up to 85% 45 minutes later, so it definitely performed as expected in that regard. The unit was flashing on the third LED, so I had somewhere between 50% and 75% of the charge left.The Juice Box S1 comes with its own cord that has interchangeable tips for various devices. Given that there is no single overwhelming mobile device on the market, I appreciate this feature so that I can charge whatever I'm carrying around without having to manage separate cords at the same time. The Juice Box also comes with a 1A and 2A slot, so depending on your device mix, you could charge two devices at a time (albeit one would be a lot slower than the other). Add into the mix the nice touch of a flash light (activated by double-clicking the power button), and this is a handy device to carry around on a regular basis.Overall, I like the OXA Juice Box S1. I still prefer battery packs that have digital readouts so I know exactly how much power I have left, but that's overkill at times. For the everyday "I want to have a backup charge for my phone", this is a very good choice.Disclosure:Obtained From: ManufacturerPayment: Free
summary: This is a solid addition to my battery pack collection...

reviewText: I'm rating this product four stars because it performs as promised and, for no explainable reason, my wife prefers this power supply over the others I've tested; but as the title of my review indicates, OXA offers a better product at nearly the same price. This is almost identical in features asOXA Juice Box S2 10000mAh, except this power supply has 22% less power. They both have 2 amp and 1 amp USB ports, they both have the same cord and tip package, they both have a little white LED accessory light, and they are about the same dimensions. If I were going to choose between the two products, I'd buy the more powerful model for the few extra dollars. My wife disagrees with me, however, which is just par for the course. The only thing I can think of is that this model does have a slicker look to it.It has plenty of power to charge any cell phone or mp3 player, and would greatly extend the life of a tablet as well. With two ports, you can charge a smaller device like an iPod on the 1 amp port and charge a tablet or large smartphone using the 2 amp port. I did this with my Galaxy Note 2 and iPod Touch 4th Generation and the power supply took both devices from less than 10% to fully charged in just a couple hours. My only issue with this and many current power supplies is that you can't effectively charge two high energy devices like my Samsung GAlaxy Note 2 phone and my Asus T100 tablet. Both ship with 2 amp chargers and both need at least 1.5 amps to increase a charge. Anything less and you're basically just keeping the charge of the device at it's current level.All things considered, this is a good product, and at the $21.99 it's currently being offered for, it's competitive with other manufactures' products. OXA provided me with a unit for my review, so I didn't pay for mine, but had I paid $22 here on Amazon, I'd think I got a fair deal.
summary: Works as Described but OXA Has a Better Product for Nearly the Same Price

reviewText: Power banks are rechargeable battery units that are used to recharge other electronic devices, like cell phones, MP3 players, e-readers, and tablets.  They are very simple to use, usually you just connect the device you want to recharge, and turn the power bank on.The OXA Juice Box S1 is a 7800mAh power bank that measures approximately 3.8” x 2.5”x 0.9”, and weighs in at about 6 ounces.  The power button is on the front face, with a set of four blue LED’s below it, which indicate either when the batteries are being recharged, or when power is being delivered to a device.  There are two USB outputs, one at 1 amp, and the other at 2 amps.Juice Box S1 has monitoring capability which causes the unit to turn off, when the device being charged is fully charged.  This helps reduce the chances of damage from overcharging.In what seems to be a trend, the Juice Box S1 also has a small led flashlight.  Rapidly pressing the power button twice, turns the lamp on.  Accessories provided with the unit include a USB cord with a selection of interchangeable connectors, and a carrying pouch.OXA provided a sample for evaluation.  I give the Juice Box S1 5 stars for its high capacity, relatively compact size, and good build quality.  The smaller size and rounded edges make for a device that feels great in your hands, and is convenient to carry in a purse, pocket or backpack.  If you don’t mind a little larger unit, take a look atOXA’s 8000mAh solar powered battery  pack, which is also a very cool product.
summary: compact, palm size battery pack…

reviewText: TheEasyAcc 5000mAh 2.5A Dual Port Fast Charging Ultra-Slim Power Bankis a great product because it balances features, size, and power capacity in a nice neat package.  This product is designed for recharging smartphones, tablets, and other mobile devices on the go.This power bank features a built in Micro-B charging cable.  This is great for most Android devices.  My Nexus 7 and Phone both have this port and recharged very quickly and easily while I was in the park yesterday.  I love how thin and compact this power bank is.  It could fit in your pocket or a day bag with ease.  For those devices that do not charge with a Micro-B cable, the unit also features a 1A-2A USB port.  This is perfect for use with specialty connectors like an Apple Lighting Cable.  Use the USB cable supplied with your original device and you are good to go.The power bank itself is rechargeable and it's easy to see when it needs recharged with the four power blue LED lights on the front.  Each indicated 25% charge up to 100% and you can recharge the unit when necessary.  This unit also features a LED flash light that is both bright and useful for numerous things.Talking about power, this unit is rated at 5000mAh of stored power.  What that means to you as an end user is multiple charges for your phone and full or partial charges for your tablet.  This product is so handy for emergency situations when your phone just died and you need help, or you forgot to charge your tablet just before a big business meeting.Overall, the [[ASIN:B00EK3UHS8 EasyAcc 5000mAh 2.5A Dual Port Fast Charging Ultra-Slim Power Bank] is a sleek device that delivers both in performance and features.  It's a great gift or purchase for the portable gamer, the business travel, or anyone who needs to keep devices charged on the go.Disclosure: I received a sample product from the manufacturer for the purposes of providing this review. A review in exchange for the review sample was not promised. The views and opinions expressed in this review are my own, and in no way represent the views or opinions of the manufacturer or vendor.
summary: Portable, Easy, And A Really Useful Product...

reviewText: I've been able to test drive lots of these types of external battery charger packs recently, and this is by far my favorite for its versatility, features, build-quality and power, all at the right price.  The integrated micro USB cord adds a splash of color and usefulness to the black matte design.  The overall power of 5000mAh with the built in cord and two ports: USB and micro USB, make it extremely useful for all kinds of smartphones, tablets, and Bluetooth devices that always need juice on the go.In my experience this product beats the likes of theDuracell Powermat GoPower Day Trip Battery - Retail Packaging - Black, which costs much more and has a household name trusted for years.  Don't let the 'EasyAcc' name sway you away from this gem!  EasyAcc stands by their products and encourage you to contact them with any issues.This battery with its slim design and features is a pleasure to use.  It works extremely well for charging my iPhone 4S multiple times on one charge, and giving me options to charge another device at the same time. Yes, you will need to provide cords for those items that do not use a micro USB charging cable, but truly, what's the big deal?The LED flashlight that's built-in and the smart looking design that neatly tucks away the attached micro USB cord are great additions to a product that I highly recommend you get for yourself, or give as a gift.NOTE: I received this product from the manufacturer for my honest, unbiased review.
summary: Powerful, versatile with features you want a the right price

reviewText: When Easy ACC contacted me and offered to send me the external battery pack I agreed, one can never have to many charging devices, especially here in hurricane central. The Dual port charger is very thing, like a smart phone, with a glass front. This makes is easy to slip in even my smallest purse. For being so small the charger is surprising sturdy feeling. I charged up my Asus memo with no issues.
summary: Works well

reviewText: This is a very easy-to-like power bank for use in charging a phone.  I received my battery as a promotional item.There is a lot of convenience built into the battery.  First as the product photo shows, it has a yellow USB output cable tucked completely, all the way, inside.  Next, the shape and feel are high-design terrific.  It's sleek and the finish stays clean-looking, not attracting fingerprints and absorbing light rather than reflecting it.The indicator lights work with what seems to me after nearly a month of use to be accurate.  Getting that last, fourth, indicator light to stop flashing so that the device is fully charged takes more time than the other 3 combined.As I rub my finger or thumb along the side, I can in the dark feel the power button that doesn't protrude.  Pressing it twice, the very small flashlight is activated.No input USB cable is provided.  That doesn't bother me as one tend to accumulate those cables anyway as I have.My feeling is that for the price, the size, appearance, 500-cycle life and reliability this is a good deal and will not disappoint.
summary: Reliable indicator lights, great USB charging external battery

reviewText: The EasyAcc 5000MAh battery is about the size and shape of an iPhone 5. It delivered the charging capacity I expected - more than half charge of a first generation iPad.This is a nice battery pack. I have an iPhone 4s, so the form factor is slightly larger than my phone. IPhone 5 owners will be very happy with the size. The exterior of the battery is silky soft rubberized plastic. The bright yellow micro USB cable tucked into the side makes this look like a Halloween device (oddly, I am reviewing this in late October). There is a power button on the side that is just hard enough to press that it won't start accidentally, but easy enough if you just press the soft part of your finger on the button.The unit charges through a microUSB connection. There is a USB port on the top next to the LED light (not really a flashlight in the traditional sense, but a light all the same). There is an attached microUSB cable for charging microUSB devices.The battery charged my first generation iPad at the medium rate (there are three charge rates on an iPad, trickle - very low amperage, medium, and high - over 2Amps are available). This is a good acceptable rate. I was able to get more than half of a full charge out of a fully charged battery. This is on par with what a 5000mAh battery should provide. That is equivalent to almost 3 full iPhone charges.This is a light, well-designed battery.I was provided a review sample.
summary: Good Battery

reviewText: One of the things I liked about this battery pack is the sleek appearance and the built-in USB cord. The only thing that is remotely problematic is having an extra cord available for charging, which most of us do. My favorite thing to do to test the capability of any battery pack, except for ones 2500mAh and below, is to try them out on my iPad. After a partial charge, I started my rather informal test. I don’t sit on the battery pack, but check and record how it is doing now and then.The EasyAcc was fully charged when I began and I expected a good performance and got it. This battery pack is a mid-range pack and if you want a faster charge for you phone or tablet, I’d recommend heading up to the 10000 - 13000mAh range. You cannot expect more from a battery pack than it is intended to do.What surprised me was how well and how rapid the charge was for a 5000mAh battery pack. I test a lot of battery packs and it performed well as expected. The slim, sleek look was very appealing. If you have need for an extra charge now and then, but don’t need a heavy-duty battery pack, the EasyAcc is probably a nice battery pack to put on your wish list.Start: 65% (4 LEDs)15 minutes 68%30 minutes 72%45 minutes 73%60 minutes 78%75 minutes 83%90 minutes 88%105 minutes 91%120 minutes 95%135 minutes: 98%150 minutes: 100%WHAT’S IN THE BOX:► EasyAcc Power Bank iChoc M5► Quick start guideSPECS:► Battery type: Li-ion battery, 5000mAh► Life cycle: ~500 cycles► Charging time: 3 ~ 5 hours► Input: 5.0V / 2.0A Max - Micro USB port► Output 1 Micro USB port - 5V / 1A► Output 2 USB port - 5V / 1A~2A► Weight: 4.51 ounces (128g)► Size: 5.15 x 2.75 x .31 inches (131 x 70 x 8.5mm)► Working temperature: 14F - 122 (-10C - 50C)CERTIFICATIONS:► CE, FCC, RoHSLED Indicators:► 1 LED blinking 0% to 5% charged► 1 LED: 5% to 25% charged► 2 LEDs: 25% to 50% charged► 3 LEDs: 50% to 75% charged► 4 LEDs: 75% to 100% chargedCOMPATIBILITY:The EasyAcc is compatible with most USB powered portable devices, but is NOT compatible with the iPod nano, iPod touch, Samsung Tablets, Blackberry phones, PSP, some GPS and Bluetooth devices.Sample provided for review.
summary: The Ultra-slim EasyAcc is a performer ...

reviewText: There is a whole variety of phone chargers and external batteries out there, so it can be confusing deciding on which one to pick. The choice will ultimately come down to your needs. If you spend most of your time near a wall outlet, then your standard wall charger will be all that you will almost ever need. If you spend a lot of time traveling, especially via a plane, and you tend to carry a lot of gadgets with you, then I would recommend you look into getting at least a 10,000 mAh external battery. For everything in between you can select the battery size closest to your needs and the kind of gadgets you carry around. I would not recommend going below a 5,000 mAh battery though. The smaller batteries will probably not be sufficiently big for a full recharge if you don't remember to charge them up regularly.This is a very nice, effective, and compact battery. It is slightly thinner than iPhone 5/5S and just a bit wider. It can be easily carried around in a small messenger bag, briefcase, or a purse. It can even fit in a pocket (hey, it is the size of a phone), but I would personally not recommend it.The battery doesn't come with its own charging adapter or cable, which is not such a big deal for me: I have plenty of micro USB cables laying around. The battery has two charging ports and a permanently attached charging micro USB cable. This feature makes this battery particularly suitable for those who use that kind of charging input. If you are an i-device user, however, you will have to reach for your own Apple USB cable.The charging time for this battery was pretty quick, as was the charging of external devices. I was able to fully charge my iPhone with plenty of room to spare. I was even able to charge my iPad to about 50% of its capacity. I also tried it with several other micro-USB charging devices (Galaxy S 3, Kindle, headphones, ...) and it worked fine with all of them, although I did not test them fully to ascertain the total charging time.Overall, I am very pleased with this battery and would recommend it to anyone who is in a need of small extra charging while on the go.
summary: Small, Convenient, Effective

reviewText: I was provided a EasyAcc 5000mAh 2.5A Dual Port Ultra-Slim Power Bank for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ Very thin. Thinner than my iPhone 5 with an Incipio case and only slightly wider.♦ Dual Port for this power bank means a 1.5A Normal USB port and a built in 1A Micro USB charging cable for a max 2.5A output.  Only dual port if you have a device that charges with a Micro USB cable.♦ Good capacity power bank (5000mAh) for such a small form factor. Added 50% charge to an iPad 2.♦ Good charging speeds as compared to competing power banks for both iPhones and iPads.♦ Thin form factor that would be great for travel or slipping into a briefcase/purse.♦ The built-in Micro USB cable is for charging a device, not charging the power bank.  Requires a Micro USB cable to charge the power bank, which is not included.♦ Has a built-in flashlight.Detailed Review:♦ Look - The product came in a professional looking box with product information on all sides.  Inside the box was the power bank encased in a form fitting plastic insert to protect it and an instruction manual. It did not come with a Micro USB cable that is required to charge the power bank, so make sure you have one or you will need to purchase one.  This power bank is pretty interesting.  It has a really nice matte finish and is extremely thin.  It has four tiny blue LEDs on the top to indicate remaining capacity.  It also has a power button and a built-in flashlight as an added bonus.  It states that it is a Dual Port charger, but that actually means a 1.5A Normal USB port and a built in 1A Micro USB charging cable.  It has a maximum total output of 2.5A.  You can only use it as dual port if one of your devices uses a Micro USB cable.  Quite a variety of different features.  Overall, it looks very nice and seems to have a good quality build.♦ Use and Performance - It came with some charge to it so I plugged it into my computer and charged it until it was full. The four blue lights stopped blinking and stayed on indicating that the Power Bank was full. After it was full I did some testing.Test #1 (Charging Speed Test) - Since this is a larger capacity power bank, I decided to focus my testing on charging my iPad 2.  I took my iPad 2 that had 30% battery left and started charging it.  After 10 minutes, the charge increased to 32% and after 20 minutes, the charge increased to 35%.  An increase of about 2.5% per minute, which is pretty good for an iPad.  Overall, good results.Test #2 (Charging Capacity Test) - After 20 minutes, I continued to charge it to see how much juice this power bank had. I let it go and checked it several hours later to find that the power bank was empty and the charge increased to 80%, a 50% total increase.  This was very good.  On average, most power banks lose about 30% of their capacity during the charge process, so a 5000mAh battery usually gets about 3500mAh of effective charging capacity into devices. With a battery capacity on an iPad 2 of about 7000mAh, a 50% increase (or 3500mAh increase), is right in-line with the effective capacity of this power bank.  Pretty impressive for the extremely thin form factor.Conclusion:Overall, the EasyAcc 5000mAh 2.5A Dual Port Ultra-Slim Power Bank was very impressive during my initial tests and usage. The charging speed performance was as good as competing products. The product has a good effective capacity in an extremely thin package, making it easy to transport in a bag or briefcase. It looks very sleek and feels very solid. It has some interesting features, like the built in Micro USB charging cable, but the dual charging port feature will only be useful if you have a device that charges with a Micro USB cable.  Overall, it is a nice looking and nice performing power bank that is worth consideration.
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy!

reviewText: With its slim line, built in micro-USB cable and ability to charge two devices simultaneously, theEasyAcc 5000mAh 2.5A Dual Port Fast Charging Ultra-Slim Portable External Battery Chargeris a real champ when it comes to portable back-up power, one of the fastest that I've tried.  With a weight of just 129 grams/4.5 ounces, the unit is a traveler's dream (it even has a built in flashlight)  and small enough to fit into your shirt pocket.The 5000 mAh unit will charge two smartphones simultaneously.● The built in micro-USB cable delivers a 5 V/1A charge for Android & Windows phones.●  A 9V/1.5A  USB port is suitable for charging iPhones, iPads and most tablets as well as various other Bluetooth devices.  Do note that no Apple cables or other USB cables are included.  You'll need to use the one that came with your device.  (I got about  60% charge on my iPad - the most that I've had from any powerbank.)TheEasyAcc 5000mAh 2.5A Dual Port Fast Charging Ultra-Slim Portable External Battery Chargercharges in about 3 hours by way of a standard micro-USB cable input.  Note - no  appropriate charging cable comes with the power bank.  You will need to provide one. I simply used one that "belongs" to another device.Grandma's $0.02 -  Fast power bank that will recharge two devices simultaeneously!Recommended
summary: A Traveler's Dream

reviewText: With 5000mAh capacity, the EasyAcc PowerBank has enough capacity to recharge a dead cellphone 2-3 times or recharge most tablets one time. And with the built-in micro-USB cable and a separate USB port, it can recharge two devices simultaneously. I tested the PowerBank by plugging it into my 7" tablet and my wife's iPhone 4 for a couple of hours. I didn't attempt to measure the charging rate, but both devices were recharging steadily at a rate comparable to other 5000mAh portable battery chargers that I've used.The PowerBank itself can be recharged from a USB port or from a DC 5 volt~2.0 Amp(maximum) source, typically an AC wall charger or a DC 12-volt vehicle charger. The device uses a system of four LED lights to indicate its own charge state. The dimensions of the charger are 5.2"x2.8"x0.3", and it weighs approximately 4 ounces. For most adults, it's small enough to hold in the hand with a cell phone on top, which is convenient for using the phone while it's being recharged. The rubberized finish makes it easy to grip.Note that no cables or plugs are included, although the built in USB cable does have a micro-USB plug. The built-in cable has an output of 1.0A, which is appropriate for recharging cellphones or small tablets. The USB port provides an output of 2.0A maximum, which is great for charging tablets of any size (note: the port is labeled "1.5A," but the specifications indicate it can provide up to 2.0A). A built in LED flashlight is a additional useful feature.The PowerBank is a very capable, compact charger that's ideal for those who need a portable charger, but who don't want the size and weight of a higher-capacity charger.A product sample was provided by the seller for review purposes.
summary: A very compact charger with dual ports

reviewerName: Joel Avrunin "Electrical Engineer who loves S...
reviewText: I have used quite a few backup battery packs, and this design from EasyAcc is one of the best that I have seen. First, it has a ton of power. At 5000mAh, it can probably fully charge your smart phone about 3-4 times. It's not enough to fully charge an iPad, but the USB port on it is recognized by my iPad and it does start charging slowly (1.5A instead of the 2.1A the iPad requires). The battery itself is insanely thin and will fit in most briefcases and pockets. A small power switch turns on the battery, and if there is a load, it will stay on until the device charges. It will turn off once charge is complete. Four blue LED's indicate the charge status, and if you double-click the power switch, there is a white-LED built in as a flashlight.  This was a great little idea.The battery charges through a micro-USB port, but does not come with a wall adapter so you will need to get one (EasyAcc has a nice selection on Amazon). In addition to the 1 regular USB port, there is a yellow cable that is permanently attached with a micro-USB connector. In other words, carry the battery and unless you are charging an Apple product, you probably don't even need to carry a separate charging cable.  This is a great feature that is missing from most other slim batteries.I have been very impressed with the EasyAcc products, from their USB chargers to their other batteries, and this is no exception - it is highly recommended.Note: I was provided a free sample from the manufacturer in exchange for an honest review.
summary: One of the best 5000mAh batteries I have tried - the attached charging cable and LED light are nice touches

reviewText: The first thing I want to say about this external charger is that all the EasyAcc items I've seen are very well designed.Outside: This slim charger is only 1 cm thick at the side and is coated with a matte black plastic. The built-in micro-USB cord on the side is a striking contrasting yellow. It's slim and easy to carry (weight 128g) and looks great.Ports: There's a single micro-USB port for charging this unit. Outputs are the built-in micro-USB cord and a USB jack. This doesn't come with a built-in USB cord, but that's a good thing, because it means you can use the USB jack to charge any device you want, and your device should come with a charging cable.Specs: 1~2A USB and 1A micro-USB. Capacity is 5000mAh.Function: In real terms this is very useful, you can charge any device that is 5V. According to above, the previous version could only charge an iPhone once, but this can do it 2.5x, which is a marked improvement. Apart from that, the nice touches include a small bright LED light and blue LED indicators to let you know how much charge is left.So overall, how is it? I would say that when you're out where there is no electrical connection a battery like this is a must. With it's improved power and capacity, you can charge a large device like an iPad or a couple of smaller devices like phones and iPods. The beautiful design is a bonus. The price is also pretty decent so this is one battery I can heartily recommend. Note: I received a sample from the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: Excellent!

reviewText: This is a sweet design in that it is about as thin and big as your smartphone. It has a built in micro-USB charging cable but does not come with a charging cable (micro USB to USB) but so many devices have that cable that I have plenty hanging around.It charges up quickly and has four indicator lights letting you know how much power is left in the powerbank. It charged my smartphone from about 20% very quickly (about an hour) and after four uses (charges) I still have one indicator light of power left. I really like the slim, brushed finish feel and texture of this powerbank. For the price, it is a great solution for tucking in a briefcase or pocketbook and the built-in micro USB plug is great for most small electronic devices.It also has a built-in LED flashlight - not terribly powerful but enough for a quick look through a dark corner.
summary: Great Backup Battery for the Price!

reviewText: This is one of the thinnest charging banks I have seen which is a great, as it makes it easy to carry around without much weight at all. The output charging port is slipped into a groove along the side of the unit. The appearance is nice with a black flat finish and the power is shown by four blue LED lights that represent 25% each for power. You'll also find a handy built-in flashlight and an on/off button.Pros:Unit is extremely thin. Thinner than my iPhone 4S by half. Easy to carry around.The unit has two ports. One is 1.5A as a normal USB port and the other is a 1.0A Micro USB port with maximum 2.5A output.The battery is 5000mAh which means it can charge a typical smartphone about 2-3 times. An iPad would be charged about 60%-70%.The unit has a built-in flashlight.The unit charges itself and other devices much faster than most Power Banks.Cons:I am leery of built-in Micro USB cables as they can snap or break. This one is just for charging a device that takes the Micro USB input.The absence of a USB cord to charge the device must be an oversight, as it really should be included in the package.The iPod Nano, iPod touch and some GPS and Bluetooth devices are not supported.For the price, it is a good purchase and well worth the investment. Most Power Banks have about 500 total uses. I doubt you will ever come that close to suing it that much before another Power Bank comes on the market. Unit provided for an honest review.
summary: Fast To Charge!

reviewText: I received one of these (in white) as a review sample. For my purposes this is an outstanding 'hedge' on a number of levels, but I want to get the caveats out of the way first.While this will work with an array of Apple and Android devices, including powered speakers, the instructions specifically exclude compatibility with Play Stations (PSP), the Blackberry, and Samsung tablets. If you have one of those this is NOT for you. Otherwise read on.This will work with most other 5 volt devices that require 1 or 2 amp power. There is an input on the bottom for attaching a micro USB connector for charging. I have successfully used my Samsung Galaxy Note II's charger and a generic one. I did not time my first charge out of the box, but am guessing that it took around four hours. Note that the instructions warn against using this to power a device while charging because it will shorten the service life of the battery pack.There is also a second port on the bottom of the battery pack for attaching an Apple USB cable to charge iPhones and other devices that require the 5 volt, 1 or 2 amp output with a standard USB end for the power source and whichever plug configuration works with the device's power in port. To be honest I use this port for my Galaxy Note II instead of the attached micro USB because I prefer a heavier cable. However, the built-in cable is a nice touch because in a true emergency the last thing you need to do is scramble around looking for a cable.I have tested this with my Galaxy Note II, which has extensive battery life (I can use it all day and still have some in reserve.) I also tested this with a friend's iPhone 4S. At 5000 milliamp hours (mAh) capacity this battery has about 40% more the capacity than my Samsung Galaxy Note II (3100 mAh). For the iPhone 4S it has over twice the capacity than the 1420 mAh battery in that phone. This provides a nice margin of back-up for those days when you are out and about and using your phone a lot. It's also perfect for emergency back-up while camping.There is a built-in flashlight that is relatively bright (especially in the dark). However it takes a little practice to turn it on and off: you need to press and hold the power button for a few seconds to cycle it on and off. I noticed that the battery heats up when you use the light so I personally would only use it in a dire emergency.Overall this is a handy - and very inexpensive - source of back-up power. I would not recommend routine using at to extend time for playing around because you will not only go through its reserve quickly, but will also probably reduce the service life. However, for a spare for important calls or sending a critical email on low battery or a true emergency this is cheap insurance. And it's small enough to fit in a tiny purse or pocket.
summary: Inexpensive way to have emergency back-up, but read the caveats

reviewText: I received this at no cost in exchange for writing a review. Here is why I like this.1. This product is a great way to me to keep my iPhone 4S or Nexus 7 2013 tablet charged on the go. No, this is not a heavy duty charger (I have plenty of those) that will bring them to 100% when they get really low, but it will keep them working for the day, which is all that I need.2. This is the size of many smart phones (5 3/8" x 2 3/4" x 5/16") and is definitely light and ultra-slim. This is the new battery pack that I keep in my briefcase when I go to meetings.3. This doesn't come with a micro USB cable to charge it, but I have so many laying around that's not an issue for me, and I suspect most people have a spare cable to use.4. This has 4 indicator lights to show battery status, though to conserve power they don't stay on more than a couple of seconds; but you can just press the power button any time to see them.5. This has a flashlight that is activated by hitting the power button twice in a row quickly. The flashlight is very handy (like when I can't find something deep in my briefcase) so it's a nice feature.6. This also has a wrap around micro USB cable that stores on the unit. This is perfect for charging my Nexus 7 2013 or Kindle Paperwhite. The only cable I have to bring is one to charge my iPhone 4S.7. This has one port rated 1.5A, so if you want to charge an iPad, you need something more heavy duty.Bottom line: This looks sharp, and is great for light duty charging use on the go.
summary: Perfect for my briefcase

reviewText: If you buy this hoping to get the same quality as a headset costing $100+, you'll probably ending up a little disappointed.  No, it isn't a swanky Plantronics device, but it is a very usable, low cost headset.  I don't use a headset often so I don't need a pricey one.  I just need a good headset to use once in awhile and this is definitely it.  The sound quality is fine on my end and people I call say that I sound okay on their end, maybe not as loud as it could be but it's okay.  It's fairly comfortable - I wouldn't want to wear it all day, but for a few hours here and there it's fine.  It would also be an excellent choice for kids or teenagers who might break or lose a headset.  For the money I don't think you could find a better headset.
summary: Excellent inexpensive headset!

reviewText: I'm very pleased with the comfort and quality of this bluetooth headset.  One of my biggest problem with over the ear headsets is that they can be incredibly uncomfortable on the top of my ear.  That's not the case with this Mpow headset, and it's easy to switch from one ear to another.  I paired it quickly with my iPhone 5, and I was impressed with the audio quality on calls, and the control buttons are easy to access.  The description promises 5 hours of play time before needing to recharge, and that seems about right with my use.Note: I received a sample of the product in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Great sound and comfortable to wear.

reviewText: I am not certain why there are two separate products listed under this Amazon setting, but I am reviewing the over-ear headset headphone.First of all, it connected easily and seamlessly with my iPhone. I powered it on (as per the instructions) and my iPhone recognized it.Second - I have very small ears. So I was particularly grateful that it had three different sized plugs that allowed me to choose the small one. Even more, it turns easily and that makes it easy to use on either ear. Important because I have a slight loss of hearing in one of my ears.The sound from the music on my iPhone was clear and easily controlled by the volume buttons. Additionally, the multipurpose button - off/on, accept or reject call is easy to locate next to where the plug goes into the ear.I wear glasses, and as long as I put the headphone on first and slipped my glasses over it, everything worked smoothly for me.It has been raining outdoors, so I wasn't able to test it fully for distance, but it worked well within the confines of my home (1200 sq ft) without losing signal. While the talk / music time is listed as 5 hours, that is probably a max amount of time. In reality, 3-5 hours is more accurate. Still, I use a lot more standby time than I do talk time, so I found it to be well within my acceptable limits.While I didn't use it significantly for phone calls, I did test it and was pleased with the sound on both ends of the call, both incoming and reception from the microphone picking up voice on the home phone I used.All in all, a very nice little headphone, easy to use with well-written instructions. I was given a complimentary set to test for my review and I was very happy with the results. Five stars.
summary: Mpow FreeGo Wireless Bluetooth 4.0 Headset Headphone

reviewText: I have never used one of these in the ear headphones before but I had a good reason to try it.  With trying sell our house to  expecting new babies in the family, I need to be near my phone but can't hear it while I am mowing  the  lawn.Pairing was super easy and quick and we practiced a bit then I got a phone call and I liked having both hands free while I was talking.  But, on to the mowing.  I put the headset on and my phone in my pocket and I actually heard it and was able to take two phone calls (yes, I turned the mower off for the conversations).  I'm rambling but it works great for me in an odd circumstance.  Sound is clear and well worth getting this little headset.
summary: Perfect for on the mower.

reviewText: These Bluetooth headphones are great all the way around, including looks and sound.The design of the headset is simplistic but yet effective. The overall look will put you in the mindset of anOver The Ear Hearing AidOn the headset there are just three buttons, they are pretty unobtrusive. The power button has multiple functions and also serves as the pairing mode, answer/end call, and play/pause music. The volume buttons also double as the previous/next track.Once on the head, the fit is great, almost weightless. The ear tip does not go into the ear cannel, but rest flat on the outside of it. There are three tips to choose from, small, medium, and large. If you prefer one ear over the other, just turn the ear piece over to accommodate the ear of choice, there is no need to add or remove any clips like others on the market.By having Bluetooth 4.0, you are able to get a good 30' from your phone before the signal starts to give out. The microphone is hidden underneath the ear piece and has echo cancellation, which makes clear crisp voice calls. The battery life is pretty good, been averaging 4-5 hours, while the charring time is 2-3.I find myself using it more for listening to music, it pumps out some good sound.I was supplied a sample for the purpose of review.
summary: Great Single Ear Bluetooth

reviewText: This is a very ergonomically and elegantly made little headset. I am not a big fan of bluetooth headsets in general, but if there is one that I would continuously use and recommend to anyone then it would be this small Mpow one.The headset synced very easily with my iPhone 4S. The connection was very stable and without any hitches for the duration of use. The headset turns on and off with a single press of the button.The sound quality was as clear as you could possibly expect from a Bluetooth headset. I was able to hear the person I was speaking with very clearly and with only the most minute of audio distortions. Unfortunately, my interlocutors did not seem to have as clear of a connection as I did. I was also mostly testing this headset in places without much background noise. The headset has some noise cancelling features, but I would not rely on them too much.My favorite features of this headset are its design and ergonomics. The headset is really small, soft and light, and it fits around your your ear very comfortably. The in-ear piece is also very soft and comfortable. The in-ear piece can be rotated 180 degrees, so that it can fit in either left or right ear. I had worn this headset for about half an hour at a time, and had hardly noticed that it was there. If you put a premium on physical comfort then this headset is as good as they come.I really liked this headset, but I am still not going to toss away my "regular" iPhone headphones for phone calling.
summary: Well Designed and Comfortable

reviewText: I received this as a sample for review and gave it a good workout, 3 people in our family testing this.Pros:- Flip arm was easy to adjust, allow people with different sized ears and ear shapes to wear it. Also allows for wearing on either ear.- Different sized tips supplied. I actually didn't like the shape of the tips so I used a spare from an earphone and that fit perfectly.- Easy to sync, Bluetooth works well.- Sound is good.Comes with carrying bag and extra tips. The device is pretty lightweight and once you have it on you forget about it after a while. The connection was good and I had no connection break ups or static.I would say this versatile in many ways. It was easy to use and can be configured in different ways for different people. Overall, very satisfied with the product.
summary: Nice!

reviewText: Of all of the headsets that I have tested the review sample of this one stands out for a number of reasons. Foremost is the clarity on both ends of a call. Even when I use this outside with a breeze in the background the receiving end of the calls have no problems with ambient noise.The second reason why I love this is comfort. I have a low tolerance for in-ear devices, but this one does not bother me at all. No irritation, even after hours of using it. Plus, I have used it for eight hours straight on a single battery charge, with most of the time on the phone. That is a major convenience for me. The specs claim ten hours, and I have no reason to doubt that number because call quality after eight hours was superb. Other headsets that I have tested start to degrade after six hours and become successively muddled after that point.For folks who use two phones this has features than the older headsets lack. For one thing you can pair and connect two phones to it simultaneously.Bottom line: this is a full featured headset what is comfortable, has exceptionally clear sound and is a true workhorse. In addition to all that, although it performs like the high end set it is, it's priced like an entry level set, so it's also a value.
summary: Advanced features and comfortable

reviewText: When I first saw this Mpow Wireless Bluetooth 4.0 Headset Headphone I was afraid it would be uncomfortable to wear, but I was surprised by its light weight and how comfortable it actually is. The arm part that reaches to the ear is flexible and fits very nicely, adjusting to fit in either ear. It comes with interchangeable soft ear cushions that add to the comfort. The sound quality is quite good and the noise cancellation is decent. I've used this primarily for phone calls and have listened to music with it only a few times. It worked fine for music but I think music should be listened to with both ears for proper stereo sound.This device paired easily with my iPhone 4s and with my Kindle HD. It should pair with any Bluetooth device. Controls for turning the unit on and off and answering and hanging up calls, rejecting calls, listening to music and being able to switch to the next or previous song are easy and straightforward to use. The battery lasts anywhere from about 3 to 5 hours, depending on how much I'm using it. Listening to music seems to run the battery down more quickly. It takes about 2 to 3 hours to charge and comes with a car charger and a Micro USB charging cable and a carrying case. It can be connected to a computer to charge but I usually use a wall adapter or a car charger with multiple USB ports. This Bluetooth headset is attractively priced and includes an 18-month, worry-free guarantee. I think it's a good deal compared to some headsets at double the price.I was provided a sample of this product for testing and review.
summary: Comfortable and easy to use

reviewText: If you are looking for a good, low priced, Bluetooth headset that doesn't require full support to be pushed into your ear, this is a great option.I lost my Jabra Wave quite some time ago and just didn't feel like spending the money to get a new one. Thankfully, Mpow contacted me in regards to sending me a free review sample of this headset. I jumped on the opportunity.The headset is well made and I don't really have any fear stuffing it into my pocket. One nice feature is the earpiece swivels, meaning you can use it in either ear.What I liked about the Wave is that it wasn't really IN my ear, it sat on my ear and there was little to no pressure in my ear. I hate that, and it's one of the biggest reasons I use over the ear headphones. The FreeGo sits in my ear a bit more than the Wave did, but it doesn't really seem to create any pressure, meaning I can wear it for extended periods of time.There are 3 headphone tips included, small, medium and large. They are OK in the area of comfort, and I use the smallest in my ear.Pairing the headset is simple. Turn the power on by holding the multifunction (has a phone symbol on it). Keep it pressed in until the light flashes red and green. Enable BT on your phone and it should pick it up. Put the headset in your ear and you are good to go.Audio quality, on both ends, is quite good. The 15 or so people I've spoken to while wearing this headset tell me they don't really hear a difference between this and my old Wave, which is really good.Overall, the headset works well, does what you expect and is affordably priced.High recommended.
summary: Works well

reviewText: Mpow FreeGo Bluetooth headset is solid performer, and a nice option for those who want to have a hands free conversation, or just listen to some type of audio.  The headset can be paired with a cell phone, or other Bluetooth enabled device, such as a laptop or tablet.  The headset has a swiveling center stem, which permits it to be worn on either ear.The headset comes with three silicone inserts of different sizes.  The inserts are designed to rest just outside the aural canal, rather than being inserted inside.  While not the most comfortable thing to have in your ear, wearing the FreeGo is not that bad, and you do kind of get used to it after a while.  Your results may vary, but I don't experience a great deal of irritation, even when worn for a long period of time.  Since the insert doesn't seal in the ear, you can still hear a lot of the ambient sound, so you may need to adjust the volume accordingly.A sample was provided for evaluation, and initially I wasn't that pleased with the location of the "multifunction button", which among other things, is used to connect to an incoming call.  The button is located in the center of the earpiece, right over the aural canal, and I have to feel around a bit to find it.  I have an aversion to pressing directly into my ear, and would like it better if the multifunction button was located on the section that rests on the top of the ear, say below where the volume controls are.Other than the multifunction button, I don't have any major issues with the FreeGo.  The earpiece is pretty light, and is well supported by the ear, without causing pain.  If some discomfort does occur, you can always try switching ears.  Range seems to be slightly better than the standard 30' limit.While mainly intended for use will a cell phone, the FreeGo can also be paired with a laptop, tablet, or other Bluetooth enabled device.  While not the same as true stereo, music remains very listenable.The ideal situation would be to try the headset on before you buy, but that may not be possible, so if you do get one, hopefully it works well for you.  The unit comes with a micro-USB cord for recharging, and a rather nice carrying case.
summary: comfortable bluetooth headset, that can be worn on either ear...

reviewText: Here's why I think these headphones are the best sub-$30 set I've tried and easily worth more.- Rich, resonate sound with deep, surprisingly resonate bass.- Light weight and comfortable.  I have a problem getting ear buds to fit properly.  Sure, theBose QuietComfort 20ifits nicely but it's a tad more expensive than this set and not even Bluetooth.  (It can be and that's another story.)  Otherwise, I usually have to resort to custom made ear gels.  It has me feeling like a secret service agent or musician and can cost as much as the headsetThen, along came these.  They fit.  They're comfortable and secure.  They block outside noise.  They are, in general, very good.- There is no shading.  That's where carrying your phone in a particular pocket puts your body between it and the headset receiver and you start to lose signal.  Usually that's either my right or left pants pocket.  With these it's neither.  I get a clear signal regardless of how I carry my phone.After extensive experimentation I discovered I could shade the signal by sitting on my phone.  I rarely (rear-ly?) do that on purpose.  I suppose that could also translate into a way of carrying the phone which would also cause shading and I'm not going there.  Under normal circumstances you won't have to change the way you carry your phone to get a clear signal.Here's a few issues I have.- They don't have an on-screen battery level indicator.  I realize it's a protocol kind of thing and in this case not an issue because the battery life is... well almost forever.- The buttons are a bit difficult for me to operate with my clumsy, stubby fingers.  I think my parents and the manufacturer share fault for this issue.The headset comes with three sizes of silicon ear tips.  For me, medium sort of worked and I was surprised how much more secure things were when I switched to large.  There's also a handy suede-ish drawstring bag that went into my drawstring bag drawer and a micro USB charging cable that didn't go into my USB cable drawer because it's white and easier to spot at the bottom of my briefcase.In addition to using these during the day I've also found them great for listening at bedtime.  I like falling asleep to music and use earphones so I don't disturb everyone around me.  Cordless is better than corded because turning over won't draw my phone onto the floor.  Between their light weight, comfort, and low profile I can wear them comfortably even if I'm laying on my side.I was sent this product so I could provide an honest review.  I can honestly say there are a very good headset and an outstanding value.
summary: What makes these stand our from the pack.

reviewText: Although I would not use these on a busy street where one needs to hear when cycling or walking, on the trails near my house, I really love them.  I have a speaker that I clip on to my bike that I really like but if I am in an area where I keep the sound down and it's safe to go with the music, such as a trail, these little babies having the speakers on the earpiece means that wind and other sounds don't interfere with my tunes and my tunes don't bother anyone else--even if booming loud.So these are a keeper for the active life--I can take my iPod with me in my bike back and wear these wirelessly as they are synced without having to be tethered to each other or have my iPod tethered to me.I can do yard work and boom the tunes without my neighbors glaring at me over the fence (actually my neighbors are pretty cool and nice but no one lives on the left side of me yet so we'll just nip that in the bud before it starts), and I can cook and groove or clean and dance at the same time, burning calories and having fun while not filling the house with tunes everyone else doesn't want to hear.  And you can't dance when you have to be tethered to an iPod player--now you don't.These are unique--they are the headphones yet they are also the speakers, in one.  And by combining the two together you eliminate the sound disturbance in between.  They stayed in easily and allowed me to rock out, wirelessly.  And that's super fun for biking.Earbuds provided by Brightech.  Review is my honest and unbiased opinion.
summary: Great for the active person--simple ease for biking, walking etc

reviewText: Bottom line: this is not a headset the will wow you with the build quality, sound quality or looks. But, it does everything pretty well, and, more importantly, does it all at a very impressive price point. Well worth a look.Full review:The first thing I thought when I opened the package was "blah." These are not very exciting looking earbuds. They are not ugly, just rather plain looking plastic rectangles. Since there is no product photo at the time I'm posting this review, I uploaded a photo to give an idea of how they look.The second though I had was "uncomfortable." That proved to be my fault - I put them on as I do my other bluetooth buds, with the cord at my neck. After struggling to get them to have some measure of comfort, I looked at the user guide and followed the instructions for wearing them (cord in the back; loop the cord over your ear; position the buds with the cord entry up). Smooth sailing after that, and they turned out to be one of the more comfortable and lightweight buds I've used.The build quality is not sterling, but more than adequate given the price. The on/off switch (called the multi-controller) has a positive click, which is good, but is positioned in such a way that you have to hit it with a fingernail to depress it. The cord is of decent quality, but could benefit from a couple extra inches of length for greater flexibility in use. The volume control "bumps" are a bit hard to find with your finger when wearing the buds.No problems pairing it with a Kindle Fire. The bluetooth range is quite good - about 20 feet with zero dropouts; about 25 feet with only a minor drop out or two.The sound quality is impressive with regard to bass - it puts out far more bass than I expected. A bit muddy, but still more than ample. It does fall a bit short on the mid and upper ranges. The muddiness continues and becomes more apparent. The result is adequate, but not impressive sound quality. It's better suited to bass-heavy music or movie dialog than light instrumentals or vocals. It does excel with regard to volume - you can crank these guys way up!Another area of excellence is sound isolation. The buds fit snugly (it comes with three sizes of tips for adjustment) and do a great job of cutting out external noise. That's important for me, since my primary use will be while exercising, and external noise is always irritating.It recharges using a supplied USB cable. The charge port seems well-anchored and has a rubber flap to keep out dirt and moisture. It also comes with a really nice carry pouch. Sort of a velvet-like material with a drawstring top closure.At the present price point (roughly $30) these are very impressive performers. No, they don't excel in every area, but they hit a performance level that makes them a great choice for "rough" use (e.g., workouts, kids, etc.). A good match for when you want enough performance to enjoy using them, but still keep the cost low so you won't cry if they get crushed underfoot while on the treadmill, or the kids lose them.4.5 stars rounded to 5 since I am quite impressed with the comfort and sound isolation.[Sample provided for review]
summary: Some faults, but very impressive for the price

reviewText: When it comes to working out, I really like Bluetooth headphones/earbuds because they take away the inconvenience of catching the cables running to phone/iPod, but they are not a perfect solution.  The headphones have to stay in place whether I'm running, jumping, or lunging, and they have to provide good enough sound to block out distractions.  And I would like to be able to answer my iPhone if necessary.  These Brightech Active2 headphones mostly fit my criteria.Because the cable linking the two sides of the headphones is worn looped over the ears and worn behind the head, just putting them on can take some getting used to, especially since the angled in-ear pieces seem impossibly oriented.  But once on, they mostly stay put, and that's not only due to the angled earpieces but also to the lightweight build.  My biggest issue with these is keeping the cables looped over my ears.  They won't stay, maybe because I have small ears or because my hair knocks them loose.  This Brightech Bluetooth headset is not the only back-of-the-head set that I have difficulty keeping on; I'm beginning to think that manufacturers don't keep women's smaller ears and heads in mind when they design their products.The sound is pretty good.  I listened to one track that has a singer whispering in the left ear, and it's was clear as could be.  Vocals, bass, and treble are clear, although sound lacks dimension.  They don't have the kind of quality that makes you stop and listen, but then again, the price doesn't pretend that they can go there.  These sound plenty good enough for a workout or just listening to when I'm moving about the house and yard.Besides the loops that keep falling off my ears, the other thing I'm not wild about is the look.  The headphones look a little chunky, although I understand that they need to be big enough to contain the receiver/transmitter.  Bluetooth range is adequate when I use my iPhone, about 20 feet.  With my 3rd generation iPad, it is much better at 30 feet or so.  The build-quality is so-so.  I can't talk about longevity since I've had mine for only a few weeks, but the buttons and body feel cheap.  Of course, they have to be lightweight -- and that's a real plus with these; however, I wish they were more stylish and felt more solid.I like these, but I'm not in love with them.
