Note:  I received a sample for review.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Lightweight and Comfortable, With Decent Sound (4-  stars)

reviewText: Over the past few years I’ve become a bit of an expert on Bluetooth wireless headsets. They seem an almost ideal way of listening to music or making the phone calls. The Bluetooth headsets are ideal for workouts: compact, unobtrusive, and very functional. I have gone through at least five MOTOROKR S9 and MotoROKR S9-HD headsets, four different Jabra Bluetooth headsets, and several headsets from smaller manufacturers, all of which shared one common major shortcoming: they were not sweat-proof and inevitably stopped working after less than a year of use.In terms of functionality, my favorite Bluetooth headsets are the stereo sport variety kinds. They are extremely compact and ideally suited for what I primarily use headphones for these days: listening to music while working out. This Brightech Active2 headset falls in that category. It is a decent headset with a few attractive features, but it still has a fair share of shortcomings. Here are some of my impressions:Pros:- Lightweight and compact. These are the most lightweight bluetooth stereo headphones that I've ever come across. While they are in my ears I can hardly notice that they are there.- Great price. You'll be hard pressed to find a better deal on stereo Bluetooth headphones anywhere. Sure, you can try getting some of the cheap knockoffs on eBay (and I had gone down that route before), but chances are none of those will really work. Or will work for about a week before they completely break down.- Decent sound. I really don't have very high expectations from the exercise headphones when it comes to the quality of sound. I just need the beat to be fairly strong and the music not to be "muddy." These headphones satisfy on both accounts.- Easy pairing. I've paired them with my iPhone without any issues.- Quick charging. It took me a couple of hours to get them fully charged.Cons:- Short cord. The cord that connects the two headphones and keeps them together is very short. It is adjustable, but even at its longest extension it is just barely long enough to have these headphones wrap around my head.- Very loose fit. I tried wrapping them around my ears as shown in instructions, but even still they keep coming out constantly while I am running. They are slightly better for the types of exercise that don't require a lot of fast motion.- Very small and inconspicuous buttons. Those are really hard to reach and press properly, especially while exercising.- Cheap build quality. They don't imbue me with the sense of confidence that they will last a while. I've used them for a couple of weeks, and so far they've done well, but from my prior experience I know that this doesn't mean much in the long run. *Every* pair of bluetooth exercise headphones that I've ever tested has failed in the end. All of the manufacturers try to make theirs sweat-proof, but so far I've not come across one that was actually able to pull it off. The good news about these headphones in particular is that they are pretty inexpensive, so if they manage to last for at least a half a year, they would still be worth it in my opinion.- No battery level indicator. Most bluetooth headsets tell me on my iPhone how much battery charge there is left. This one starts beeping a few minutes before it runs out of power, but other than that it gives you no advanced warning.This could be a really great headset if they addressed some of these issues that I've pointed out. Even so, for the price you will probably not get a better bluetooth stereo sport headset.
summary: 3.5 Stars - They Work

reviewText: I was provided an set of Active2 Bluetooth Headphones for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ Good sound quality when streaming music for a wide range of music styles, but could use a little brighter high end.♦ Has a built-in rechargeable battery that lasts a long time and charges with a standard Micro USB cable (included).♦ Has a good range, at least 20-25 feet. I had to walk pretty far away from my phone before it lost connection.♦ Comfortable to wear once positioned properly and has a strong hold in your ears (don't easily fall out).♦ The cable is a little short for my big head.  Fits, but no slack left.Detailed Review:♦ Look - The product came in a professional looking hanging display box with product information on it. Inside the box was the headphones, an instruction manual, a Micro USB charging cable, some additional ear pieces and a carrying bag. The headphones look a bit big, but they are very light and don't feel big in your ears.  The Micro USB charging port has a rubber cover to protect it and a few rubber buttons around it.  The headphones are attached together by a wire with a sliding clip for sizing it.  I found that the cable fit me fine, but I made it as long as possible, so there was no slack left.  It could have been a tiny bit longer.  The headphones had a decent build quality, not bad for this price range.♦ Installation - The instruction manual was pretty long and informative.  I had no problem pairing the headphones with my Windows 7 PC and my iPhone 5.  Everything went perfectly and reconnecting was automatic. I plugged in the included USB charging cable into the headphones and into my computer to give it an initial charge before testing it out.  Once charged, it took a minute to figure out how they are supposed to sit in my ears.  There is an included picture where they are facing straight forward with the wire going upwards and then back around your head.  I found that they fit more tightly when I twisted them to where the headphones were angled forward and upwards slightly.  That position gave me a tight, comfortable seal.  Basically, you just twist them around until you are comfortable.♦ Use and Performance - Once the headphones were charged and I had them on, a tested them with my Windows 7 PC and my iPhone 5.  Getting everything to work was very easy.  In Windows 7, I just switched my speaker setting to the headphones and they worked perfectly.  On my iPhone 5, I just used the output switching button to activate the headphones, again with no problem.  I played various videos on my PC and music and podcasts on my iPhone and found that the sound quality was pretty good.  I could hear a little heavier low end (bass) which overpowered the high end (treble) a bit.  The big benefit of the headphones is that you are now wireless.  You have complete freedom to move and the range was a very good 20-25 feet away from my iPhone.  Once in your ears properly, they are also very secure.  You can shake your head around quite a bit without worrying about them falling out.  This would be great for running or other exercise.Conclusion:Overall, this was a nice set of Bluetooth headphones.  It didn't have the best sound, but the sound was pretty good.  They give you great freedom of movement and the Bluetooth works really well.  They have a long lasting battery, and are easy to pair and use.  If you are looking for a nice set of Bluetooth headphones at a reasonable price, these are worth a look.
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy!

reviewText: The Active2 headphones don't look like other Bluetooth headphones/earbuds that I've used, but they actually worked quite well, and the sound quality was excellent. I've used Bluetooth headphones that had a "dongle" hanging down below your chin - the dongle held the battery, electronics, mic, and controls. That type worked well, but the dongle flopped around if you were active, and sweat from your face could drip on it. The Active2 headphones have the battery, controls, mic, and Bluetooth circuitry in the left headphone, with the thin cable connecting the left and right earpieces going behind your head. In use, the headphones are very comfortable, and if the silicone earbuds don't fit your ears properly, the kit includes two extra sets of different sizes.The headphones paired easily with my Kindle Fire HD 7" and Nexus 7 with the device name "Active2 Headphones." No pin code or password was required. Having the volume controls on the left earpiece was a little bit awkward at first, but I got used to it after a while. I also paired the headphones with my Android phone, and they worked well for hands-free operation, although with the sound-suppressing of the firmly fitting earbuds, I can't recommend using them for phone calls, especially while driving.To my ear, the audio quality was excellent, with some of the best bass that I've heard from a pair of earbuds. The earbuds fit comfortably and were effective in keeping out all but the loudest ambient noise.The user guide mentions charging the headset's lithium polymer battery through the micro-USB port, but it doesn't say whether an AC charger can be used. I used a DC 5V~0.85A charger, which worked fine. The headset can also be recharged through a USB port of a PC. A charging cable is included. The talk time of six hours is comparable to other Bluetooth earphones that I've seen.THE VERDICT: The Active2 Bluetooth headphones are comfortable, easy to use headphones that provide excellent audio quality for streaming music, gaming, or phone calls. For people who run or do other vigorous activities while using the headphones, they're as sweat-proof as any other headsets that I've used.A product sample was provided by the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: Comfortable earphones with excellent audio

reviewText: If you are used to a different style of earphones, positioning these may take a few extra minutes. It is not intuitive as to the direction of the 'rectangle' but the earbuds are designed to slip in at a good angle. So while they look a little odd, a few adjustments and they sit comfortably and securely.Pairing was very easy and I was off and running, although not literally but I'm sure you could wear them for that. The band from either earpiece is a little short and someone with a large head might find it too tight. It fit fine for me and has a little adjustment clip that can be pushed up to keep the cord with some tension.These are very lightweight and perfect for outdoor activities or just walking around the house. There is no cord to get in the way. The sound, given the price range, is great. I had no troubles at all and found them to be pleasing and easy to use.I was provided a sample for evaluation and review.
summary: May Take a Little Getting Used To, Great Sound

reviewText: This is one of the better sounding Bluetooth headsets (ear buds) set I've heard.  In fact, they sound just as good as a directly plugged line.  The pairing is easy.  Just hold down the power button for ten seconds until the light flashes blue and red.  This will work with just about any device that carries Bluetooth music or phone capabilities.  There are also small up/down buttons for volume.  The Bluetooth sginal will carry up to 30-feet.I turned my set on to full volume on both my phone and headset and the sound never distorted.  It was very loud however, so be careful when listening not to damage your ears.  The highs were very crisp and the mid-range perfect.  The bass was somewhere between slightly punchy and a tiny bit boomy, but I was able to get used to the sound until I found it just right.The microphone is also a tiny hole on the side and when a call comes in the sound is very good.  The music will fade out and fade back in when a call comes in or goes out.  The band is well made with a flat line that won't tangle and there is an adjustable clip that allows you to fit it to your head.I like the fact that the earpiece angles into your ear and are contoured to fit your ears, so they stay put.  They are very light, so it's easy to forget they are even on your head.  The square design is unique and I wish I could find some specifications on how the chamber, voice coil and magnet work.  They are very well made.  They even block sound very well.  They are not noise-cancelling except in a 'passive' sense, which is actually nicer than an 'active' noise cancellation.  They come with extra ear bud pads and a nifty carrying case.  These are well priced for the quality.  Product received for an honest review.
summary: Excellent Price - Excellent Design

reviewText: Two things: (1) I was provided with a review sample from the manufacturer and (2) these are my first ear buds. Normally I am not the type to use ear buds, preferring regular headphones, but these were a revelation to me.What I most love is the rich sound. Honestly when I was testing these out I put on a Herbie Mann compilation and heard notes and nuances in this music that somehow escaped me when listening through my Bose speaker system. That alone makes these worth it to me.Set up was relatively easy, but understand up front that this will not pair with your device out of the box. I had to charge mine for the recommended two hours before I could coax it into making itself known to my Galaxy Note II. In fact I used the Note II's wall charger to get it ready for use. It shows up as Active2 as soon as you press the multi-function button and follow the scant (but clear) instructions.If I have any complaints they are about the button placement. Especially the multi-function button, which is nestled between the charger port and the wire connecting the second bud. On the plus side the charger port has a rubber strip that protects the connector when it's not in use.Since this is my first set of buds you need to factor in that despite my glowing endorsement I have nothing other than external speakers to which to compare the sound. The buds are comfortable in my ears and the sound - as I said - rivals my Bose so I am happy. Indeed, I am so happy that I am getting another pair of these as a gift for a friend who will be going in the hospital for some extensive surgery. She cannot live without music and I am betting that she will love these as much as I. That's the strongest endorsement I can give and it's sincere.
summary: Impressed with the sound and convenience

reviewerName: Richard C. Drew "Anaal Nathra/Uthe vas Bethod...
reviewText: These are a good deal for the price, but take a little getting used to. The trick when wearing them  is to loop the wire over your ears, then pull down as far as possible in the back. The sound is decent, but a little heavy on the low-end.I paired with my Droid phone, iPod and Samsung tablet.Cell phone: Great sound, and worked as a hands-free phone.iPod: I walked over 20 feet away and the signal held. This makes these great for say the gym.Tablet: Used them to watch some movies and play games. Again, good sound.My one complaint are the controls. The multi-function/power button on top, + and - on the bottom of the left earpiece.  The buttons are slightly inset and require some effort to press. More often than not I had to remove the earpiece to use the control.Pairing: Simple and straightforward.Volume: You set the max on your device. The highest volume on the headphones will then be the volume you set on the device.  I maxed the earphones out, then used the device's volume control. I found this easier.Phone: You can use the headset to make calls by speaking the contact's name - assuming your phone supports this.
summary: Good deal for the price, sound decent and they're lightweight

reviewText: The Active 2 headset is decent quality and easy to pair, but for me, the audio quality for music is just not what I would want.Before you use these, ensure you pick the proper ear bud for your ears. Ensure you have a set that won't allow them to fall out and create a good seal in your ear. Even with this seal, the sound quality for music is mediocre at best. Bass is a bit deep, but everything else sounds a touch tinny to my ear.Call quality is good. The people on the other end have complained that I'm not quite as loud as they would like, and this is regardless of how I have the mic pointing towards my mouth.In the end, these are not very expensive, offer OK performance and work well out of the box.4 stars because I think the sound quality could be better, even for something this inexpensive.I received a free sample for review purposes from the manufacturer.
summary: OK for the price

reviewText: I've been trying out the Brightech Active2 Bluetooth Headset / Headphones I received recently, and it's a different experience having headphones with no cords. Overall, they worked well, but I'm not sure I'm completely ready to go cordless in all situations.The Active2 paired up easily with my iPhone when I went through the discovery phase. This is a case when it does pay to read the directions, as there's a single button that does a number of different functions. Once I learned that you really *do* have to hold the multi-function button down for 10 seconds, it paired up almost immediately and showed "Active2 Headphones" in my bluetooth device list. The volume up/down buttons also double as the next/previous control buttons for your playlist, the difference being how long you hold the button down. Again, it pays to read the directions first.In terms of actual usage, I had mixed results. I enjoyed having a set of headphones where I didn't have to worry about snagging the cord and yanking them out of my ears. On the flip side, the additional mass on the earbud made them somewhat more susceptible to slipping out of my ear when I was walking/running (sweat, motion, etc.) Also, I still have to get into the habit of making sure I recharge the headphones every couple of days (which is obviously not an issue with regular cord headphones).These *do* work well, and have good sound quality. For me, it really comes down to a matter of how you're planning on using them. For normal movement, they work well. For vigorous exercise, they're not as good.Disclosure:Obtained From: ManufacturerPayment: Free
summary: Good quality, but read the directions first to avoid some frustration...

reviewText: I have an iPad 2 which has a smaller battery than the later versions (about 6800). As a result, this particular battery will fully charge my iPad 2 and significantly charge my iPhone both without running out of power. However, if you have a more contemporary iPad, this will significantly charge your later iPad but will not fully do so.I am not certain of the stats on this model of battery, but there is ALWAYS a loss of power between the battery and the device, so I usually don't count on an effective charge greater than 85%, which would make this 8500 mAh.I was surprised when this arrived to discover that it was fully charged with no loss of power between the company and arrival at home so I was able to immediately test it. It rather quickly was able to charge up a 2800 mAh battery that was between 50 and 70% full using 15% of the power, which leads me to believe that it has an effective transfer ratio, something important in the battery.It also has a relatively powerful (for this type of battery) flashlight using brighter LED bulbs.Power Bank Evaluation:mAh - 10,000#and Amps of Charging ports - Two ports, one is 1.0 Amp and the other is 2.1 Amp fully capable of charging an iPad.Physical size - Medium sized, slightly larger than a deck of cards. Probably a bit too heavy to carry in a pocket comfortably.How is the charger charged - it uses a standard micro cable (included) to charge and can be used on your own USB charger or can be charged on your laptop.What cords/attachments are included - It comes with a micro cable to charge itself (can also be used to charge anything that takes a micro cable), and a cord with an end that supports various attachments. The three that are included are the 30 pin USB for older Apple products, a micro cord, and a Nokia connector.What other features/items are included - It has a relatively powerful flashlight making this a great emergency bedside battery. You can keep your devices charged as well as finding your way in case of a power outage.Instructions (included/clear) - Yes, instructions are included and are clear (if a bit small for my older eyes).Support Information - I could not locate support information in the packaging. However, the seller (edepot express) has 752 ratings over the last 9 months with a 4.9% rating. I suggest if you have a problem that you contact them here through Amazon.
summary: Percent is handy

reviewText: While nearly every powerbank has some method to display the remaining power level (typically a multi-segment or multi-light LED gas gauge) this is the first powerbank I've seen that has a digital readout of the percentage of charge. That's a very handy feature for people such as myself who like to quantify things - I feel better knowing that I have 43% power left rather than just seeing 2 light out of 4.  The display also counts up when the powerbank is being recharged, so you have a far more accurate determination of how much time it will take to charge up. Very nice feature.There are also some other pluses to this powerbank. It has a significant capacity (10000mAh) but packs it into a pretty compact size, with the powerbank measuring just short of 3 inches wide and about 4.25 inches tall. The weight is a bit hefty at 8.5 ounces.The on/off switch can easily be found, unlike other powerbanks that seem to try their best to hide the switch. It's large, round, located on the top side, and is well-marked with a silver ring around it. It also has a nice click to it. Very well done.It has an LED bulb to serve as a flashlight, and the bulb is located on the side rather than the top. The positioning makes it much easier to use as a flashlight.The overall build quality seems solid, with well-anchored ports and a nicely seamed plastic case. It also comes with a cloth carry pouch, a USB cable and an assortment of the usual adapters.Unfortunately, there are some clear misses as well. On the minor miss side, the case is a huge fingerprint magnet. One of the worst I've seen in it's ability to get smudged and display those smudges. Also, the port labels are embossed into the plastic and are pretty much impossible to read even under good light.The worst issue relates to the best feature - the LCD screen. It's positioned very oddly. To read the digits properly, you have to look at it with the USB ports facing down. The screen is thus at the bottom of the case, making it hard to see. That's a really silly design flub, in my opinion.The case bottom (the end opposite that of the USB ports) is rounded, so the powerbank can't stand up unless you position it on its edges. While a rounded end looks nice, it's just not practical.The size is also a bit of a problem in that it's squat and wide, making it difficult to fit into laptop bag pouches, and making it feel uncomfortable in-hand. Skinnier and taller would have been a better direction to go in when it was designed.Given the price point, these design flubs are a let-down, and drop my rating to 3.5 stars. Hopefully, the next version of this will address these design issues since the digital power level indicator is such a helpful feature.[Sample provide for review]
summary: Love the digital power level display, but some clear design misses on this powerbank

reviewText: This battery pack/flashlight unit is excellent for me to use when traveling or when the power goes out. This handy battery pack comes with the following items:1) Battery Pack Flashlight 2) USB Charging Cable (to charge the unit to the computer) 3) A cable with 3 adapter plugs: One for Apple iPad/iPods, Standard Micro, One that fit my older Nokia phone. 4) This also comes with a handy travel pouch. 5) InstructionsPROS::1) Tablet Charging - My tablet began charging at once. So I timed the HOURLY charge time. After one hour charging the Tablet, it had charged it up by 13 percent. So I am VERY PLEASED because this is one perfect faster than my original OEM Samsung Charger for the Tab 2.2) Phone Charging - Next, I did the same ONE HOUR test on my Galaxy Grand and it charged the phone in one hour 19% (using the exact cable that came with this unit. To compare, I later did another ONE HOUR test on my Galaxy Grand on my Samsung 1AMP charger with Samsung Cable and it charged at 20% so this was very close!(I have another portable phone/tablet charger that only charges about 10% an hour so this charger wins by far).3) Flashlight - Went into a dark closet and turned on the flashlight. And found it to be very bright, in fact, it lit up the closet pretty well. Great flashlight.Highly recommend this unit!
summary: Charger Works Quickly! Also Has A Bright Flashlight.

reviewText: The Etronic Jupiter 787 battery pack is a nicely priced, high capacity, battery with two additional features I like a lot, a flashlight and a battery percentage meter.The battery is a nice package. The ends are rounded, so it feels good in my hand. There is a nice round power switch on one side. One press turns on the pack to charge devices; a second press turns on the nice bright flashlight. The pack is chunky, slightly longer and wider than an iPhone 4, and about two iPhones thick. The plastic is shiny and smooth, white doesn't show fingerprints.With a fully battery, I was able to charge my first generation iPad 100%. There are two USB outputs; one is a 2.1Amp output, designed for charging high current devices like an iPad. The iPad charged at the very high rate just like using the standard iPad A/C adapter. The second USB output is for lower current devices, like an iPhone. Two devices can be charged at once.There is a wonderful LCD display with the percentage battery charge left. I really like those percentage displays over the multiple dot or segment gauges.I have two minor complaints about the battery. The battery does not do pass-through charging. When the microUSB cable is plugged in to charge the battery, devices cannot be charged. The second problem is an odd little one - to me the LCD is mounted upside down. I hold the battery with the output ports on the top of the battery and then plug in my devices. The percent charge is upside down when held this way.The battery charges via microUSB. There is no AC adapter included in the box. To charge this battery, plug it into a computer USB port or the battery charger that came with the phone or tablet.I like this battery. It is a really good price. The capacity is just the right size, a full iPad charge or three full iPhone charges. I like the feel of the plastic. It is a little bit chunky, about average for a battery of this capacity.I was provided a review sample.
summary: Good Battery

reviewText: I was provided a Etronic Jupiter787 10000mAh 3.1A Dual Port Power Bank for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ Has a great LCD Display that shows remaining capacity in 1% increments and additional information.♦ It is a large capacity power bank (10000mAh) that can give phones multiple charges or a full charge to most tablets.♦ Pretty small for a large capacity power bank.  Slightly bigger and thicker than a deck of cards.♦ Has two charging ports (a 2.1 Amp and a 1 Amp) for 3.1 Amp total output and simultaneous charging of two devices.♦ Good charging speeds as compared to competing power banks for both iPhones and iPads.♦ Good capacity. Added 80% charge (until full) to an iPad 2 and 44% charge to an iPhone 5 with a little charge left.♦ Small form factor that would be great for travel.♦ Has a built-in flashlight.♦ Shows a lot of fingerprints on the plastic case.Detailed Review:♦ Look - The product came in a professional looking box with product information on all sides. Inside the box was the power bank encased in a form fitting plastic insert to protect it.  It also came with a small, but informative instruction manual, a micro USB cable for charging the power bank, a multi-tip regular USB cable for charging devices and a carrying pouch.  It is a pretty small power bank that is slightly bigger and thicker than a deck of playing cards.  It has two USB ports (a 2.1A and a 1A) for charging devices, a micro USB input port for charging the power bank, a power button on one side and a built-in flashlight on the other side.  The position of the flashlight and power button makes holding and using it very comfortable.  The unique feature of this power bank is the built in LCD Display.  It shows the capacity remaining in the power bank in 1% increments.  Much more detailed than the typical four LEDs that most power banks have to show remaining capacity.  The LCD Display also shows which ports are in use by showing a 2.1A and/or a 1A symbol.  It also shows if the power bank is charging with an "IN" symbol or if devices are charging with an "OUT" symbol.  Quite a bit of information.  The power bank has a black, plastic case that shows a lot of fingerprints.  Not a big deal for me, but some people are bothered by this.  It has a plastic build, but feels very solid with tight seems and strong port connections.  Overall, it seems to have a quality build.♦ Use and Performance - It came with some charge to it so I plugged it into my computer and charged it until it was full. The LED Display showed 100% and the "IN" symbol stopped flashing indicating that the Power Bank was full. After it was full I did some testing.Test #1 (Charging Speed Test / Simultaneous) - Since this is a large capacity power bank, I decided to do a variety of tests to try out different charging situations. I took my iPad 2 that had 20% battery left and my iPhone 5 that had 58% battery left and started charging them in the 2.1A and 1.0A ports respectively.  After 10 minutes, the iPad charge increased to 23% and the iPhone charge increased to 65%.  Good speed on the iPad, but slightly slower than average on the iPhone.Test #2 (Charging Capacity Test) - After 10 minutes, I removed the iPhone and continued to charge the iPad to see how much juice this power bank had. I let it go and checked it the next morning.  I found that the iPad had a full charge and there was 19% capacity remaining in on the power bank's LCD Display.  With a battery capacity on an iPad 2 of about 7000mAh, an 80% increase is about a 5600mAh increase.  It was good to see that this power bank was able to fully charge an iPad 2 after already adding 10% to an iPhone 5 and having some capacity remaining.Test #3 (Charging Speed Test / Single) - Not being happy with the iPhone 5 charging speed test when doing a simultaneous charge with an iPad 2, I decided to test the iPhone by itself.  This is after my capacity test and not recharging the power bank.  I plugged my iPhone into the the power bank (switching between 1A and 2.1A ports) for 30 minutes and the charge increased by 28%.  A much better result and almost in-line with the 1% per minute charging average for most power banks on an iPhone 5.  Not the fastest, but not bad.Total Capacity Summary - The power bank added 80% charge to an iPad 2 (5600mAh) and 44% charge to an iPhone 5 (650mAh) and had 3% capacity remaining on the LCD Display (200mAh) for a total of 6450mAh capacity. On average, most power banks lose about 30% of their capacity during the charge process, so a 10000mAh battery usually gets about 7000mAh of effective charging capacity into devices.  The results of my testing were a little lower than average, but not too bad for unscientific testing.Conclusion:Overall, the Etronic Jupiter787 10000mAh 3.1A Dual Port Power Bank was pretty impressive during my initial tests and usage. The charging speed was comparable to competing products and the product has a good effective capacity, although slightly less than average.  While it performed pretty well, what I really liked was the LCD Display that did a great job of providing valuable information on remaining capacity and charging status.  I like the true capacity percentage much better than having to guess the remaining capacity based on a couple of LEDs.  The LCD Display is the differentiator here that I feel makes it a great product.  Overall, the power bank performs well and offers some great features that make it worth considering.  Highly Recommended!
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy!

reviewText: More Power for PortabilityEtronics has outdone itself in producing this battery power bank: you have to use this to appreciate all of its features.  For starters the device is handsome, well designed and very easily portable in a pocket or purse or briefcase. When fully charged it owns 10,000mAh of power and can charge 2 devices at the same time. It’s universal compatibility means it is usable for iPhone 5S, 5C, 5, 4S, 4, iPad 4, 3, 2, Mini, iPods; Samsung Galaxy S4, S3, S2, Note 2; HTC One, EVO, Thunderbolt, Incredible, Droid DNA; Motorola ATRIX, Droid; Google Nexus 4, Nexus 7, Nexus 10; LG Optimus; PS Vita, Nook HD+, GoPro  - ins short any other mobile devices that can charge through USB port. The power available allows charging smartphones around five times on one charge, holding that available charge for several weeks. It also can charge an iPad fully.Aside from the power it wallops this device has thought through all the extras – an LED screen that tells you exactly how much charge is left and when charging, when the charge is complete (the battery is a lithium polymer core), a handy flashlight aspect that is very useful when everything else goes out during a blackout!), a carrying case, 1x Micro USB Cable and  1x Universal Cable for Apple (30-pin), Nokia, and MicroUSB.This device takes the worry out of traveling when dependent on electronic devices. It is difficult to believe that a power bank this small could be so reliably powerful. AND the customer service is of the highest quality. It comes with a twelve month warranty. Highly Recommended. Grady Harp, October 13
summary: More Power for Portability

reviewText: I've reviewed several portable external battery chargers, and the Etronic Jupiter 787 is one of the better ones that I've used. The 10,000mAh capacity is enough to completely recharge even the largest tablets at least once, and recharge most cellphones 4-5 times. With two charging ports (labeled "Out 5V 2.1A" and "Out 5V 1.0A), two mobile devices can be recharged simultaneously, a very helpful feature. Another very nice feature: A digital readout for how much capacity is remaining in the charger. Most other portable chargers use a system of colored LED lights, which isn't very exact.After topping off the charger's capacity to 100%, I connected my Samsung phone to the 1A port and my Kindle Fire HD 7" to the 2.1A port. The phone's charge was initially at 61%; the tablet's charge was at 54%. After 100 minutes, the phone was charged to 92%; the tablet to 96%. Both the phone and the tablet were turned on during charging. Compared to other chargers that I've used, this was relatively fast recharging, and I was very pleased with the speed.With 10,000mAh capacity, a built-in LED flashlight, and a digital readout of the current charge state, the Etronic Jupiter 787 impressed me as an excellent portable charger.A product sample was provided for review purposes.
summary: Fast recharging of your mobile devices

reviewText: Jupiter’s power banks come with a whopping 10,000mAh which is a good chunk of power – enough to charge most Smartphone’s about five times and an iPad at least once (fully).  10,000 mAh is really the minimum you want in a power bank.  Anything less will have to going back to your computer or electrical outlet to keep recharging.  The small size is great for packing and in all the power banks I have seen with this much power, the Jupiter is the smallest.This power bank also holds a charge for several weeks at least.  The power bank weighs a meager 8.5 ounces and measures only 4.2” X 2.8” X 0.8”.  It also comes with an emergency LED flashlight which is fairly powerful (Note: this uses power quickly) and a travel pouch that is water resistant.  It is nearly universally compatible with just about any electronic device as the kit also includes an Apple 30-pin adapter and two other DC adapters.  It includes two USB cords with one having a female 3.5mm input and the other a micro-USB output.This device also includes two ports for charging; simultaneously if wanted.  One is a 5V/2.1A for Android and Apple devices and the other is a 5V/1A charge for most other devices.  Factoid:  The battery is a lithium polymer core which is a low maintenance battery.  There is no memory and no scheduled cycling.  That means your battery will last longer than most. In addition, the self-discharge is less than half compared to nickel-cadmium.  Lithium-ion cells cause little harm when disposed.This battery pack is unique, in that, it displays the power in exact digital increments up to 99% (1% - 99%). That means no guessing from 20%, 40%, 80% or whatever. You know exactly how much power is left.  I prefer this much more than a power bank that has, let’s say, four LED lights that represent 25% each.  With this battery, you know exactly how much power you have and how fast you are using it up.I would suggest looking at all types of power banks/battery packs to see which one works best for you, as all are different with groups of attachments or simpler. Some have smaller charge capacities and some are larger (like this one). It all depends on what devices you have and how often you charge. Also, check the prices on all batteries and the power! This will make things a lot easier in charging any external battery. I like this power bank more than any other I own simply for its size and power.  This product was supplied by the manufacturer for an honest review.
summary: Small Size and BIG Detailed Power!

reviewText: I love these new power banks that come with a digital display.  Instead of guess that I have 50 to 75% charge remaining, now I know.  The display on the Jupiter787 not only shows the charge remaining, it also shows whether I’m using the 2.1 amp or 1 amp port or both.  That’s great, because I can’t always see which one I’m plugged into, especially in poor light.The capacity of the Jupiter787 is impressive.  Depending on the conditions, I can get 100% charge on my Kindle Fire HD 8.9” tablet.  The last time I charged from completely depleted, my Fire fully charged and there was 6% charge remaining on the power bank.  Wow.With two ports, I can charge two devices at the same time.  Right now, it’s charging both a 7 and 9 inch Android tablet.  No problem.  And with the 2.1 amp port, I get a very fast charge.This power bank comes with a soft velvet drawstring pouch, a micro USB cable, and a charging cable with three adapters (micro USB, Apple 30-pin connector, and DC2.0).  It also includes an LED flashlight.The Jupiter787 is a winner.  Great capacity and an easy to read display.  I like it.This product was provided for review by Mega Merchant.
summary: Lots to Like

reviewText: My first impression is that it is a good compact size for a 10,000 mAh power bank.What is in the box?- power bank- gray fabric pouch- short manual- 2 ft microUSB cable- a USB cable with replaceable tips- 30-pin tip connector, microUSB tip connector and a cylindrical connector (handheld console?)How to use:- In came with 90% charge, but to recharge it you would need any USB AC adapter that you may already been using to charge your iPhones, iPads, Kindles, etc.- Press the button on the side for 2 seconds if you need to see the remaining charge.- To charge your device, just plug it to any of the two slots. The one on the left is 2.1A for tablets, and the one on the right is 1A for cellphones.- Press the button two times in succession to turn on LED flashlight. Do the same to turn off.Pros:- Just love the flashlight. It is more powerful compared to most power banks in the market.- LCD panel is more advance. Not only has a back-light, it also display more information other than the remaining charge in percentage. It shows which slot are you using whether it is the 2.1A or 1A slot, or both.- Two USB cables are included plus the connector tips.Cons:- difficult to see the markings on the two USB slots. Just remember, if you are looking on the LCD panel, the one on the left is the 2.1A.A sample of this product was sent to me for review purposes.
summary: Powerful and compact - with bonus LED flashlight

reviewText: Most electronic device is practically useless without power. This has 10,000 mAh battery inside it and can be used to charge other devices. You can charge two devices at a time. Has two USB outputs and one microUSB input for its own charging. You can charge the Jupiter using computer or an external power adapter (your own). I let it discharge and charge from 0 to 100% took around 10 hours. Once you charge it, you can charge smartphones for 3-4 times.Absolute blessing when you are traveling in airplanes, camping, trekking etc. We use GPS all the time and it sucks the battery. So having a device like Etronic Jupiter787 10000mAh is incredibly useful. The LED backlit LCD indicator shows the % charging (charging or discharging) very clearly.Input: DC 5V 1AOutput: 5V 1 and 2.1 AVery portable and highly recommended! I was provided this product in exchange of a fair and honest review.
summary: Very powerful gadget ...

reviewText: The nice people at Etronic sent me their black Jupiter 787 power bank for evaluation, and with a capacity of 10000mAh, it provides a lot of charging power, in a relatively small package.  Basically a rechargeable battery unit, used to recharge devices like phones and MP3 players, power banks generally aren't very glamorous, but the Jupiter 787 does attempt to provide a little flair, with an LCD display that indicates the amount of charging capacity remaining, and a LED flashlight located on the side of the unit.Because of the power meter function, you know exactly how much power is remaining, and when the unit needs to be recharged.  The device has two USB outputs, one rated at 2.1A, and the other at 1A, and current flow info is also indicated on the LCD.Pressing the power switch twice, turns  the flashlight on.  You might not think that a flashlight would be useful in a battery bank, but it turns out that it can be quite handy.  It's not super bright, but if the unit is in a dark place, like a purse or bag, it really helps you to see what you are doing.Besides a carrying pouch, accessories include a USB/micro USB cord for charging the unit, and another USB cord with a pin that can be plugged into one of three adapter heads (Apple, Nokia, or micro USB) for recharging.There aren't many major negatives, although as others have remarked, the surface of the unit is a real fingerprint magnet.  I applied a little [[asin: B000HBM5S2 Permatex silicone spray]], and it seemed to help with repelling fingerprints.  The Jupiter 787 isn't compact, and it is a little heavy, but that's really to be expected for a unit with 10000mAh capacity.  The price is in line with comparable products, so if you are looking for a high capacity power bank, this would an excellent choice.
summary: some interesting extras, on this high capacity power bank...

reviewText: I normally don't wear headphones because they are so heavy. Within a few minutes, I normally have a headache, just from wearing them. So I was VERY pleasantly surprised that these are so light (battery included) that I barely feel I have them on my head. Plus, they don't press against my ears and are very soft.When I first tried them, the dishwasher was running in the background, and these minimized the sound. But when my daughter came out to talk to me, I could easily hear her (once I turned the sound down).I enjoy the controls on these, once you get used to where they are on the earphone, it is easy to feel them by touch and operate them. I am using these with my computer and iPad rather than my iPhone, so I am not answering the phone with them and can't speak to how well they work in that capacity as far as clarity. I trust another reviewer will be able to speak to that.While having a multi controller might seem difficult, actually it is quite easy to use - pushing it down to turn it on (or pair it),  pushing it down again to turn it off, one click to answer or hang up a call, two clicks to refuse one. The forward/back buttons on the headphones (for music) are separate, so you won't accidentally skip your song forward when trying to turn the volume up or down.A majority of my music is "easy listening," "country," and "praise," music, all of which are in midrange and played very well. I have some hearing loss in one ear so I turned these around to be certain that the sound was great in both speakers, and it was. What I appreciated was that there wasn't a heavy bass sound even when I was listening to music with drum beats in the background - it was mellow, and yet the sound was clear and sharp.They are, in fact, everything they claim to be! Comfortable, light, and easy to listen to.A quick heads up (something I wasn't aware of), not all apps on my iPad are compatible with Bluetooth headphones - a problem with the app, not the phones.I received a complimentary sample of the headphones from Arctic so that I could check them out for a review. Fortunately they allowed me to keep them when I was done, since these are the only over the head ones I will wear. :-) Nice, very nice!
summary: Very light, easy fitting, easy controls.

reviewText: These headphones have a lot going for them. They are very comfortable and adjust easily. The sound quality is good for headphones under $50. The silver and black design are very modern. They pair easily and the skip forward/backward buttons are placed where even big thumbs can find them.When answering a phone call you press the multifunction button and the music you are currently listening to is put on hold. When you end the call (pressing the button again), the music picks up where you left off. Awesome! The sound quality of the internal mic is acceptable (so said the caller I was talking to!)My only beef, which costs them a star, is the size of the multifunction button. For a button that is used to turn the headphones on/off, answer phone calls and adjust the volume, it should have a larger knob on the end of it. Many times I found it hard to locate and my thumb would slip on the button. Other than that, I liked these headphones and look forward to many hours (up to 30) of listening! They come with a cinch case and a USB charging cable.Sample provided for review purposes.
summary: Needs a bigger multifunction button

reviewText: The ARCTIC P402 BT Bluetooth Stereo Headphones with Integrated Mic are a very good budget option for listening to music, and watching Amazon streaming video and Netflix on your newKindle Fire HDX 7", HDX Display, Wi-Fi, 16 GB - Includes Special Offers. They also work well with other Bluetooth enabled devices like iPhones, iPads,Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 (7-Inch, White), as well as your PC.BUILD QUALITY: Grade 'B'The P402 BT's have a build quality that's on par with their price point.  What I mean by that is that they are good, but not great. For example the thin wires coming out of each earpiece and running into the headpiece are exposed and could easily be pulled out or cut. These headphones do come with a nice carrying pouch, and with care, this shouldn't be an issue but it's worth noting.These headphones have a headpiece (the part that runs over the top of your head) that doesn't have any padding on it.  I can compress one of them, and the other (they run parallel to one another and have about a 1/2" gap) is a bit stiffer (probably contains the thin wire mentioned before).  I found that after a bit of wearing the top of my head hurt.  In all honesty, I notice this with 99% of the headphones I wear, thus I generally wear 'in-ear' to avoid this, so it may just be me?The earpieces are relatively comfortable; well cushioned and covered my entire ear.  I found them somewhat uncomfortable (tight), even after several adjustments, but they did have a nice bit of noise cancelling. It is important to note that the earpieces seem to tilt more one direction than another, meaning you will need to try the headphones facing different directions to get the best fit.  The back of each earpiece has the ARCTIC name etched into on silver colored metal.I could move the metal pieces that connect into each earpiece (four contact points - two on each earpiece).  It felt as if I could easily pull them out, but I didn't want to disengage the headband from the earpieces so I left it alone.SOUND: 'B+'I have a pair ofBose AE2w Bluetooth Headphones - Blackwhich cost 5x's the list price of this headset, and I get more volume out of these, which surprised me!  The sound quality overall isn't bad either, but I did have to work to find the right EQ settings on my iOS devices to not be disappointed.  At first, I was unimpressed.  "Loudness" wasn't cutting it, so I switched around and eventually came to find a warmer, depth of tone that made me happy.These P402BT's won't satisfy audiophiles, but if you're willing to tweak your device's settings a bit, you'll find a 'happy place' with these earphones when using them with your tablet or smartphone for general entertainment use.They also have an integrated microphone, which makes them a good choice for Skype.  Directions for VOIP protocol is outlined in the included User Manual.Diagrams in the User Manual are small and can be tough to read as they are in grayscale, but I think most users will get the gist, and have no problems pairing their devices with these headphones and appreciating the functionality.When paired with your iPhone or smartphone, if a call comes in the music or show you're listening to will mute and you'll hear a ring indicating an incoming call.  One touch answers the call and hangs it up, resuming what you were listening to before the call came in.You can play, pause, and stop music, as well as moving tracks forward and backwards.  Most iOS devices running iOS 6 or higher will have no issues using these functions.Overall, sound quality is good, but adjustments on individual devices within the 'settings' for music or sound, will probably be required.BATTERY LIFE and DIRECTIONS: 'B+'With up to 30 hours of playback time, these are some of the best Bluetooth headphones for one charge and you're set for a long flight, bus or train ride. Charging is easily accomplished with the included USB cable, and takes about 2-3 hours for a full charge. A red LED light will be turned on during charging, and go off when the battery is fully charged. A blue LED appears when the unit is turned on, and it alternates between red and blue when actively pairing with a device.Directions for operating these headphones are fairly clear, but I wish the screenshots of iOS devices were not so dark and/or washed out as they are very hard to read.PRICE VS FEATURES: 'A'You're getting a good bang for your buck when purchasing these headphones. Not only can they be used for general listening, but they can also be used for VOIP calls, Skype, screencasting, and to answer phone calls when listening to music on your iPhone or smartphone.Most will be pleased with their performance and fit, and for general use they should be a good buy. They pair easily, and remained connected to my iOS devices without interruption - no dropped signal.  They'd be a nice gift for a student or traveler with a Kindle, iPad or similar.The ARCTIC P402BT's come with a 2 year warranty from ARCTIC.NOTE:  I received these headphones from ARCTIC in exchange for my honest, unbiased review of their product and my experience with it.
summary: Good choice for wireless pairing with Kindle HDX

reviewText: On the back of the headphone packaging, there is a specifications chart, where they provide the ratings for each of this headphone's features and how they measure up. After trying these out, I've found their chart to be pretty accurate. Below are the ratings they give for each of the features, on a 1-11 scale.~Bass: 8/11~Highs: 8/11~Clarity: 8/11~Noise isolation: 9/11~Comfort: 10/11~Battery Life: 11/11These ratings are just about spot-on. I'm listening to music with these right now and the music played through them is good, about what you would expect from a Bluetooth set in this price rage. The padded ear cups are comfortable and once charged, you can wirelessly listen to music for hours on end without interruption. I've paired these with my iPhone 4s and my iPad Mini and played music with them, having no trouble. Typically I listen to a lot of talk radio throughout the day (news) using the iHeart Radio app on my iPhone, and these have worked very well for that. Plus being light weight, they don't cause head fatigue like some of my heavier headsets do.They come with a micro-USB charging cable and a pouch for keeping everything in when you're not using them. There is a built in mic, so when you're paired using Bluetooth to your cell phone, you can wear these and continue talking on the phone, or even use them for VoIP calls. The buttons to control everything are on the outer sides of the ear cups, so everything is cordless, except for charging up the battery. It's a good headset, and the black and chrome color scheme with the double band head piece gives them a sharp industrial look. Very nice!Sample provided for review
summary: Nice Bluetooth headphones for the price

reviewText: These are pretty good bluetooth headphones. They excel with regard to comfort - the ear padding is plush and they have a nice balance between grip (e.g., staying put when you move) and comfort. The headband consists of 2 plastic rods without any padding, but doesn't cause a significant comfort issue.I had zero problems pairing these with a couple of different tablets (Android operating system and the Fire version of Android). Simple, quick and painless. The operating range is also excellent, with zero dropouts at about 20 feet and only minor dropouts at 25+ feet.The sound quality is quite good. While these open-ear designs don't have the booming bass quality of closed designs, I found the sound quality to be very good, especially in the midrange. They are an excellent choice for movie watching since the dialogue comes through so clearly.I like the operating controls, especially the volume switch. It's a rocker-type design, so it's very easy to use without having to look at the button - just find it by feel, and press up to increase volume and down to decrease. The multifunction button is in the middle of the rocker switch and is very easy to find by touch as well.The overall look is very snazzy, and the build quality appears solid.There is only a modest amount of sound isolation, but that again is an issue inherent with open-ear headphones. It does cut ambient sound reasonably well - I had no problems listening to music while on a noisy treadmill without the ambient sound interfering to any significant degree.Misses are the volume level. These have a rather limited upper volume range. Normally I set my tablet to about the 75% level and the headphone level to close to the upper point to get a good volume that blocks out ambient noise. With these, however, I had to set the tablet sound level to 100% and the earphone level also at 100%, and I still found them a bit lacking in volume. Given the price point, the range should be better.But other than the volume issue, no complaints. Good sound, good comfort, great range and easy-to-use controls. Well worth considering.[Sample provided for review]
summary: Very comfortable, good sound quality, bit light on volume

reviewText: *Disclosure: I was contacted by Arctic and given a sample of this product specifically for the purpose of giving my thoughts on it.*Test Devices:HTC One and EVO 4G LTESamsung Galaxy S2, S3, S4, and NexusGoogle Nexus 7 (original)Tegra NoteKindle Fire HDXiPad Mini, iPad, and iPad AirWhen one thinks of DJ type headsets, the most common image is some dude in a loud dance space with lots of flickering lights and loads of folks moving to the tunes.  While the P402BT headset looks the part, it wouldn't be a set I'd recommend for that type of environment.  As with other Arctic audio products I've tested, the P402BT doesn't have the volume of competing products in the same price range.  This did change depending on which apps I was using, with Audible seeming to be quieter than Pandora.  The sound quality is good, but not great.  There was a definite difference when enabling/disabling Beats Audio, but still not great sound.  I found the fit to be hit and miss; comfy but very loose.  Loose to the point where walking about the house doing chores would dislodge them from my head.  Arctic went with a mutl-function jog wheel type control for power and volume controls, and while it works, the switch itself feels flimsy.  Certainly not what I'd expect of a set of headphones that (currently) cost a couple Jacksons and a Hamilton.  The large LED light to let you know the unit is charging or is turned on is nicely large, the cover for the micro USB charging port not well secured to the housing.  Making calls was an ok experience, nothing worth noting other than it worked.  The included microfiber sack to carry the headsets around in was a disappointment, compared to the cases Arctic offers with some of its other audio products.  I donated the set I was given to a teaching friend of mine, who so far likes when well enough but like me, didn't find the value in them for the price asked.
summary: Hold still and keep quiet

reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised by how comfortable, noise-isolating, and good sounding these Arctic over-ear headphones are. That said, I normally cannot listen to full volume iTunes music on any of my devices because it's too loud, but with these Arctic over-ear headphones, I can boost the volume to maximum without any listening discomfort. If I were (more) hard of hearing, these would frustrate me, but because I'm not and because I don't like to blast music, these headphones are great.They are lightweight enough to wear for hours, and the adjustable headpiece ensures that I get a fit that keeps them in place. The sound quality is not bass-heavy, although it picks up the lower ranges nicely, giving the sound a balanced quality that headphones built specifically for rock often lack. The one criticism I have of the sound quality is that it lacks the depth of more expensive sets and even the company's other Bluetooth headphones, the ARCTIC P311 Bluetooth Stereo Headphones. Despite this, the sound -- instrumental and vocal -- is clear. These are definitely more comfortable and more noise-isolating than the P311 -- as I write this, there's a vacuum running in the next room, and I can't hear it. This is a huge plus.The Bluetooth range is about 30 unobstructed feet or 24 with a wall between. Most people won't range that far from their devices while listening, although if you plan to, make sure you don't need to range farther than the preceding.The controls are a little difficult to locate while wearing them because they don't stick up enough to locate by touch. I can answer calls, thanks to the built-in microphone, and use the voice activation (Siri) feature of my iPhone.  They come with a storage pouch and the cable needed to charge them via USB port.Although I enjoy listening to music through these, I prefer (somewhat) the P311 unless I need to block out noise. They are a great mid-price option for those who love the cordless operation of Bluetooth headphones. Note: I received a sample for review.
summary: Great Sound Quality -- With Some Muted Volume (4+ stars)

reviewText: I was provided a set of ARCTIC P402BT Bluetooth Stereo Headphones for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ Good sound quality with decent treble and strong, deep bass, but mids and highs could have been a bit brighter.♦ Very comfortable and soft cups that feel nice on the ears and can be worn for a while♦ Easily connected via Bluetooth.♦ Has a rechargeable battery that charges with a standard Micro USB cable (included).♦ Can reach pretty high volumes while maintaining good clarity.♦ Frequency and bass response is good with some decent booming bass.Detailed Review:♦ Look - The product came in a professional looking display box with one side of the headphones shown through the box and product information on the inside cardboard case. Inside the box were the headphones, an instruction manual, and Micro USB charging cable and nice carrying bag.  You immediately see that this is a nice looking set of headphones.  The ear cups are very soft and comfortable.  The left side ear cup has a USB charging port, a multi-function button with volume control, FF/RW buttons and a multi-color LED.  It looks like it is built very well.♦ Installation - I had no problem pairing the headphones to my computer on the first try after holding down the multi-function button to get them into pairing mode.  Everything went perfectly and reconnecting was automatic. I plugged in the included Micro USB charging cable into the headphones and into my computer to give it an initial charge before testing it out.♦ Use and Performance - Once the headphones were charged, a did a variety of tests to try them out using my Windows 7 PC.Test #1 (Sound Quality Test) - I tried out a variety of music from some Disney kids songs to Michael Bublé to Excision Bass Heavy Dubstep (the Destroid album), and everything sounded good.  The bass was loud and deep with no distortion.  It handled the variable Bass sounds of the Dubstep with no problems and handled the highs and vocals of the Pop music pretty well.  The headphones sounded pretty nice overall, but could have used a little brighter mids and highs.Test #2 (Sound Performance Test) - After I got past the basic sound quality, I tried out a few more technical tests. I put on the headphones and started playing a Dolby HD Surround Sound test video. They sounded really great with some exceptional stereo and surround effects. I also played a frequency test file that started at 20Hz and found that the headphones started producing sound around the 27Hz range, which is really low.  The sound continued with sound being audible all the way up to 17000Hz. Excellent range for a set of headphones.Test #3 (Use Test) - When wearing the headphones, the ear cups are very soft and comfortable.  They are easy to adjust and you can wear them for a long time without your ears hurting.  The multi-function button plays and pauses music and rocks back and forth to increase and decrease the volume.  There are also fast forward and rewind buttons.  The headphones also have some additional microphone and speakerphone features as an added bonus.Conclusion:Overall, I was pretty happy with the sound quality of these headphones.  They had a great frequency range and sounded good at all volumes, but could have used slightly brighter mids and highs.  They were very comfortable to wear and connected easily to my Bluetooth devices.  If you are looking for a nice set of comfortable headphones, the ARCTIC P402BT's are worth a look.
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy!

reviewText: These headphones are stylish lightweight and have good sound, the only real problem I found is they do not have a audio jack for a computer. So great for any blue tooth item not so good for a traditional tower computer!Pros:Very comfortable and light weight.Good sound qualityEasy to use with blue toothLooks very nice and does a good job holding out ambient noise.Has good bass.Cons:Does not connect to computer sound cards in traditional ways. 9Im a computer nerd that is important to me)Just so you know:I was given a free sample in return for an honest review.Great product, I really enjoyed the sound.
summary: Good headphones for your phone or tablet

reviewText: I received this as a review sample from the manufacturer and have been using them quite a lot since they arrived. I am not going to repeat the information in the product description, which provides all of the specs. I will answer any questions in comments if I missed something that you deem important. I want to disclose what I like and don't like about this headphone set.What I most love is how light and comfortable they are. Unlike over-the-ear phones I used in the past, these are light and unobtrusive - after a few minutes I forget I am wearing them. The adjustments are simple and easy to get a nice fit to your head.Sound quality is excellent, but to be frank, falls short of mySony MDR-NC40 Noise Cancelling Headphone (Black). On the other hand, I prefer this to the Sony because there are no wires (one of my pet peeves) and this is a true hand's free phones/mic combo. In fact, I already gave my Sony phones to a friend after I tried this one out.Paring with my Samsung Galaxy Note II was as easy as holding down the multi-function button until it flashed, then scanning for bluetooth devices on my Note II until P402BT popped up in the list. From there I paired and connected and was enjoying music.  Do note that you need to fully charge this set of phones before you use them for the first time. The process takes about two hours, and once charged they work as described in the instructions.What sets these apart from other phones is this has a built-in mic for hand's free operation. You can answer incoming calls by merely tapping the multi-function button and end them the same way. I tested this feature with a pre-arranged call and my friend had no problem hearing me clearly, and I heard her equally so. If your phone is set up for voice dialing you can press the multi-function button twice and it will invoke that feature on your phone via bluetooth.Bottom line: I have quickly grown to love these phones because although they are not noise-canceling, they allow me to listen to music in stereo while cutting out most of the ambient and background noise. The fact that this also serves as a hand's free phone speaker/mic is a plus.
summary: Comfortable and convenient

reviewText: This is a nice multi-functional bluetooth headphone that was very comfortable, produced good sound, and does not break the bank. Construction seems to be very good, and the included carry bag is a nice touch to help keep them clean and unscathed when on the go.We spent the day playing and testing the headphone's sound and functions, enjoying the experience, and all agreed that the black & brushed chrome design is very stylish and pleasing to the eye. Additionally, for over-ear style headphones these are reasonably sized and fairly light weight... so you do not feel like you are wearing a football helmet. Very nice, well thought out design.These headphones came with a USB power cord that we plugged in to our Samsung phone's wall adapter, and the headset's battery fully charged in about an hour. We listened to music through these headphones for several hours without any sign that the battery was beginning to wear down at all. Excellent!The combination of the perfect tension provided by the headband and the soft, padded ear cups made these ARCTIC P402BT Bluetooth Stereo Headphones extremely comfortable to wear for hours at a time. No heat build up, no discomfort. One of the most comfortable over-ear style headphones that I have ever tried on.Tested with my Samsung Galaxy S3 and our teenage son's HTC Droid DNA, this headset was very quick and easy to pair with our phones. We played a varied selection including Jack Johnson, Chili Peppers, Green Day, Jimmy Buffett and Creed, from sources including Amazon's MP3 Cloud, Pandora and our own audio files. The results were decent; the bass played true though the midrange and treble were initially somewhat flat.  These headphones did respond well to equalizer adjustments and, once we cranked the mid and upper range bars significantly up, their sound popped nicely without noticeable distortion.While enjoying the music, we tested the inbound and outbound call capabilities and were very impressed. The mechanics of the ARCTIC P402BT headphones worked perfectly with our phones to mute the music and enable hands-free answering, dialing and texting (outbound voice text). Call clarity of the integrated microphone was good, though the voice heard through the ear speakers sounded a bit distant (as did the voice heard by the caller over the cell phone - somewhat of a light buzz in the background). The headset's volume and multi-funtion adjustments are easy to find by touch and very simple & effective to use. I would classify the reception on both ends as middle of the road.The documentation notes that there is a two year limited manufacturer's warranty, so if an issue arises before that two year period expires I will return here to update the review and let you know what the issue was and how resolution was handled. I did receive these headphones gratis from the manufacturer, and have put it through the paces to objectively find out how well it performed. My statements here reflect that testing.As with other ARCTIC items we have purchased, we found that the manual that came with this headset was very well written, easy to follow, and includes perfect examples for iOS and Android users to follow for setup and use. Even with their kinda small type, ARCTIC manuals are the best written manuals we have seen for gear like this. Totally appreciate not having to decipher broken English.If you are looking for headphones of this style and price, for use similar to what I have described above, then we recommend these to you. Stylish, comfortable, excellent multi-function mechanics and very easy to pair with other bluetooth devices.Go for it and enjoy.
summary: ARCTIC P402BT Bluetooth Stereo Headphones - Integrated Microphone - Black & Chrome - Good sounding multi-function device

reviewText: WEIGHTThe Artic P402BT Bluetooth stereo headphone is very lightweight. I have used several bluetooth headphones in the past and always found them too tight or press your ears. I was very pleasantly they are very lightweight. The cushions give a comforting feeling on the ears and after some time you don't feel them. High grades on weight. Also since this is USB chargeable, there is no AAA batteries and has a builtin battery. Big plus as well.PAIRING.I tried with Samsung Galaxy S4 and Galaxy Tabs. The buttons are minimalistic on the headphone. The multifunction button is the key. Press it for about 8 seconds and the RED/BLUE LED light flashes. I was able to immediately scan and pair the headphone. Switching on and off is using the same button for 3 seconds.AUDIO QUALITYExcellent quality. I listened to audio books and music and had no issues. I primarily use the headphones in gym on light workouts. Having no cords is great. I kept my phone nearby on a duffel bag and am hands free. I observed no signal disturbances.PHONEWhile playing music, I received a phone call. By pressing the multifunction button, I was able to do phone conversations with built in microphone. I had a good signal on T-Mobile and voice was very clear.DESIGNLooks very polished. Excellent design aesthetics. The enclosed pouch is very nice as well.The Artic P402BT is a keeper and a highly recommend! BUILD QUALITYThe build quality of this speaker is very rugged. It feels sturdy and it can be placed horizontal or vertical. It has a good gripping sides. The buttons feels solid and compact. The enclosed case makes it a notch higherPAIRINGWas very easy. I am not sure if it is because of NFC capability, I switched on the unit and place the phone (Samsung Galaxy S4) on top of speaker, automatically bluetooth switched on and paired with phone and started playing what was in the phone automatically. I was impressed. Note i had paired it for the first time already. Basically very easy to pair and start playing.AUDIO QualityVery good. Volume was really good when I pushed volume all the way up. It was too much I had to reduce it. Will be useful for several use cases, in cars, kitchen, home, if you need for some small house performances etc. No issues. I was able to keep the phne charged and take the speaker to a different room and still play. I tried with a tablet and can keep browsing/doing some work while my daughter listens in a different room.BATTERY LIFEVery good. I was able to keep playing for 6 hours and still it has power. I did not let it run very low. USB charging makes it very convenient to charge this.Overall I am very impressed and I highly recommend it! I was provided this product in exchange of a fair and honest review.
summary: Lightweight, awesome design and sound quality!

reviewText: I was provided some free samples of styluses for review. They were (in case you are interested in other options for a stylus):*Sty-HD 9 pcs Rainbow of Colors Capacitive Stylus/Styli Touch Screen Cellphone Tablet Pen for iPhone 4 4s 3 3Gs iPod Touch iPad 2 Motorola Xoom, Samsung Galaxy, BlackBerry Playbook AMM0101US, Barnes and Noble Nook Color, Droid Bionic*Business Stylus Executive Pen - Capacitive Stylus Touch Screen Cellphone Tablet Pen for iPhone 5 4 4s 3 3Gs iPod Touch iPad 2 3 4 Motorola Xoom, Samsung Galaxy S4 S3, Barnes and Noble Nook Color, Droid Bionic*Sty-HD 2 Pack of Premium Precision Micro-Knit Hybrid Fiber Tip Capacitive Stylus Pens for iPhone 5 4 4s, iPod touch, All iPad: 1st Gen, 2, the NEW iPad, iPad 4th gen with Retina display, iPad Mini, Samsung Galaxy Tablet and Phone Black and Silver Color*Sty-HD 17 pcs Colorful 3 Styles Capacitive Stylus/Styli Touch Screen Cellphone Tablet Pen for iPhone 4 4s 3 3Gs iPod Touch iPad 2 Motorola Xoom, Samsung Galaxy, BlackBerry Playbook AMM0101US, Barnes and Noble Nook Color, Droid BionicAt first I was disappointed in all the styli I received due to responsiveness, but I later figured out that I needed to apply more pressure. If you do not apply enough pressure, it will be unresponsive on some devices, with some devices requiring more pressure than others. While you don't have to apply a whole lot of pressure, just a light touch of the stylus may not work, so keep this in mind. Also, keeping the stylus perpendicular to the plane of the device works better in many cases (though not usually necessary). If these are issues for you, then you may not like using a stylus.My review for this 2 pack of premium styluses/styli is as follows.If you don't like bright colorful styluses, then this is a nice set of darker colors and are generally of higher quality than less expensive styluses. The finish is better and so is the tip of the stylus. The fiber tip of this stylus provides a better feel (smoothness) than more rubber like tips on other styluses, in my opinion anyway.Using a stylus helps keep fingerprints off your device, which is a nice benefit.Overall 4 stars because they are not as responsive as a real finger, but it does work well enough with a moderate amount of pressure applied.
summary: Nice styli, but some quirks

reviewText: I'm not sure what your daily activities are like, but mine include occasional activities wherein I get a little dirty, or sweat, or ash my hands, or anything that leaves my hands in a state that makes answering the phone or touching a laptop IMPOSSIBLE. As the phone rings on and on, I try to wipe my fingertips on ANYTHING that will dry my fingers so I can answer the phone or move the GPS screen or do anything I need to do NOW. But I can't, and the phone call ends, or we've driven by the turn. Frustration mounts.These capacitive pens can be a savior.Why I'm giving this pen a 5 when it's not especially dazzling or hasn't any secondary function (like a flashlight or a pen cartridge, etc.) is that it sets out to do a job and it does it well. PERIOD.The fiber mesh tip is responsive, seems durable, and the pen is reasonably attractive and fits decently in my hand. What else does it have to do?The tip suited all the kind of writing or tapping that I typically do on a touchscreen, and I tried to mimic other motions others might make if they draw or have different handwriting styles or grips. About the only situation where this pen would have a problem would be if one has a style where their grip puts the pen at an especially acute angle: say, thirty degrees (where the pen gets almost parallel to the page). Other than a really odd angle like that, this pen works great.Anyway, I'm satisfied. And it's attractive enough: one pen is black, the other silver, and both shades are muted and not very glossy, which is fine with me. It even has a little nib with a hole in it at the opposite end that would allow it to be held in a lanyard around your neck (or attached to the device) to enable it to always be on hand.I have a Kindle Fire HD tablet and a Samsung s/5 phone, and have also used these on iPads and an iPhone. All worked equally well.NOTE: I was supplied this product free of charge with no other conditions other than my writing a fair and honest review -- which this is.
summary: Not fancy, but work extremely well

reviewText: *Disclosure: I was contacted by a representative for StyHD and given a sample of this product specifically for the purpose of giving my thoughts on it.*HTC OneHTC EVO 4G LTESamsung Galaxy S2Samsung Galaxy S3Samsung Galaxy S4Samsing Galaxy NexusiPad MiniiPad AirGoogle Nexus 7 (original)Tegra Note 7For this review, I'm going to be comparing three different models of Sty-HD styli which I was sent samples of.  This set, theSty-HD 17 pcs Colorful 3 Styles multipack, and theBusiness Stylus Executive Pen.  Of the three, the multipack set is the most generic.  Made almost completely in plastic with some plating to look like metal, this type of stylus, perhaps the exact same stylus, can be bought from a wide selection of vendors at different prices.  In use, they work pretty ok, but not perfectly.  The glide is a little off, especially with matte screen protectors.  During testing, I noted that these tend to not work as well with Apple devices compared to Android models.  Pressing slightly harder on the Apple screens would get better functionality, but rapid movement across the screen didn't work consistently.  Overall, tolerable performance for the cheap price, hence the three stars which matches Amazon's "It's OK" meaning.  Compared to its brethren, they work as well as the Business stylus, but lack the pen.  Speaking of the Business model, though asking a premium price, its performance isn't any better than the one from the multipack as they share the same type of tip.  It looks more business like, true, but even the pen doesn't work great.  After cleaning the tip of the pen to clear off the seal to prevent ink leaking out while in shipping, I found the writing to be uneven and scratchy.  I could literally hear the ball in the tip scratching at the the paper.  To me, not worth the current price of nine bucks, and three stars for it.  That leaves this model with the hybrid fiber tip.  Of all three, these performed the best across the board.  Much better glide and screen response.  Still not perfect, as rapid movement would miss on occasion, but certainly a cut above the others.  Again, the Apple devices didn't these as much as Android devices did, and matte screen protectors deteriorated the performance slightly.  Comparing all three to the stylus that comes with my Tegra Note, the Tegra's stylus is the easy winner in all subjective and objective testing.  This is not a surprise really, as the stylus and screen of the Tegra Note were designed specifically to work together.  In the end, if you're wanting a decent stylus, this is the one I'd suggest buying from Sty-HD.
summary: For a decent stylus, try this
