That's something you can do while in flight on an airplane, for instance (terrific on overnight flights from Hawai`i to the mainland).You can also use this as a running time extender for your phone or other device if you're picnicking or camping somewhere with no ready electricity.There are many battery packs on the market that have more capacity, of course. But they cost more and are heavier and much less convenient. For simple use cases this battery pack is a definite recommendation.
summary: Light, convenient, adequate for the job

reviewText: As usual I received this product in exchange for an honest review. Also as usual I give my candid opinions below despite that kindness.My first impression of this unit was that it was incredibly ugly and frankly rather offensive. The unit I received for review is an obnoxious yellow color with a logo and extensive writing printed directly on it asking for positive reviews online. It's also clearly marked as 'Made in China' which is rather perturbing given it's made by a company called '5 Star America'. I certainly have nothing against China but if you're going to wrap yourself in the flag then you're rather obligated to follow through with the patriotism indicated by your name.On the positive side the unit does seem to be relatively effective at its job and the USB cable included is a nice flat one which resists most of the issues USB cables have. The problem comes in when you compare this to the photos here on Amazon. Other reviews have indicated that these review versions are different from the ones you get if you actually make a purchase. The photos show a normal USB cable so I'm rather at a loss as to what to think. If I tried to buy this I just have no idea what I would end up getting.In summary, I'm not entirely sure what to think because I don't know what relationship the product I received has to the one pictured. If they really are completely different as indicated in some other posts then anything I say is somewhat moot. If the unit is as featured in the photos then that's got pluses and minuses. All that having been said, I'd be really cautious spending money with this company. They seek reviews using one product and hope to apply it to an apparently different product. This makes me wary and given the number of other choices out there it's just not worth the risk.
summary: Review versions different than actual product -- DO NOT TRUST THIS COMPANY!

reviewText: This is a handy little device to have in a pinch. You can recharge your phone without being tied down to a wall or a charger. It's sleek design makes it easy to slip in your pocket, purse or backpack! It resembles an ipod in size and shape.  It charged my devices, Iphone, flip phone, Droid Incredible quickly and effectively. I got two charges before recharging the battery, however my Iphone was at 33% one time and 42% the other. It does require a few hours to recharge the battery pack, but it is definitely a blessing to have it! I also love that it comes in different colors. Mine is purple and it matches my cell phone case. It charges fast and is very portable.I received this product for an honest review.
summary: Very handy and fast!

reviewText: This External Battery Charger is portable (+ has slim profile) and very easy to use.  Just charge this battery up with the included cable and then use it to charge your iPhone/smartphone.  The LED indicator will tell how much ore juice you have on the external battery. I didn't test this battery charger with an Ipad so if you plan to buy this for Ipad, please check for the product info or other reviews to see if this works with Ipad.  Thanks five star america for sending me this product.Sidarta Tanu
summary: Good external battery. Easy to use and portable.

reviewText: I received this at no cost in exchange for writing a review. This is not something I would buy on my own. Here's why.1. This isn't much more powerful than a "lipstick" charger, which is much more compact than this unit.[Update Dec. 7, 2013. Although this is rated as having an output of 2.1A, another review points out that in fact this charges at only 1A. I confirmed this because this unit will NOT charge my iPad. So the 2.1A output listing is deceptive and meaningless].3. I agree with other reviews that the design on the back is not only ugly but deceptive. There is a flag logo that says "Designed for America" yet the product is Made in China. The name of the company and this logo try to create the misleading impression that somehow the manufacture or design of this product is connected to America, which it is not. I find that personally offensive.A second deception is the picture on Amazon, which shows an orange back with a logo and some technical symbols only. But the unit I received had a white back that contained a "billboard" with all kinds of writing, including a solicitation for a review. I don't carry around "billboards" for companies.[The seller sent me an email that the "billboard" version I received was a "review version" but that what is pictured on Amazon is what purchasers receive. But I can review only what I am sent.]4. If you want a very sleek and attractive, not to mention more powerful and versatile, charger for your iPhone that is not much larger than this product, try the EasyAcc 5000mAh 2.5A Dual Port Fast Charging Ultra-Slim Portable External Battery Charger Pack PowerBank. It works great.5. If you want a compact charger that will charge an iPad, try the Gadgets 8400mAh External Portable Battery Pack Charger , which is amazingly compact for such a powerful charger.Note: When I tried to reply to the email that the seller sent me, I found out no responses could be sent to that email address. That always makes me suspicious. I would avoid this seller. And if you believe the "9999 Days Warranty", then I have a bridge in Brooklyn that you might like to buy.Update December 10, 2013: I lowered my rating from three stars to two stars after reading another review that extensively tested this unit and confirmed that not only is the 2.1A output false, but so is the overall claim for how this unit charges. I also note that one or more persons is negging the critical reviews on this product. Please read those critical reviews carefully before you decide to order a product that simply doesn't live up to its promises.Update December 12, 2013: I recently received the ARCTIC Power Bank 4000 Ultra-Slim 2.0A Output 4000mAh Backup Battery/Charger for Tablet and Phone - Black. It's everything a compact charger should be and that this 5 Star product is not. Accordingly I have lowered my rating to one star.
summary: False charging output, deceptive logo, mediocre product

reviewText: This battery is pretty spectacular. I have owned a couple external batteries previously, and comparing this battery to them makes me aware how thin and light this battery is compared to them.The other two batteries I've owned weren't something I would really want in my pocket. This, however, is thin enough to put in your pocket with your phone and not have any issues... except you still need to deal with the cable connecting to the phone. The included cable does a good job of staying out of the way, so its actually not bad in your pocket at all.In terms of recharges, I get two to two and a half recharges out of this fully charged. And that's really good in my mind.Highly recommended.I received a sample from the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: thin, light, powerful and fairly inexpensive - recommended

reviewText: I received this external battery charger for review from 5 Star America recently. I put it through some paces on my iPhone 4, and here's what I experienced with it...Power-wise (3100 mAh), I was able to get the equivalent of one full recharge (with a small bit left over) on my iPhone. In 70 minutes of charging, I went from 22% to 91%, which is right around the minute-per-percent that I usually look for. I then used it again to go from 60% to 93% in 40 minutes later on. The power bar lights went from three (fully charged) down to one. My guess is that there wasn't much juice left in it.In terms of design, it's very light and different than most chargers. It's made to look like a very thin smart phone, and you could be forgiven for thinking it was one on first glance. The front (on mine) is a black glossy surface (again, like a smart phone that's turned off), but it doesn't have any touch functions on it other than to collect fingerprints. The normal USB slot is on the bottom edge, with the microUSB slot on the side at the bottom. The provided microUSB cord is a flat cord which looks and feels very sturdy. The main use would be to charge the battery with the microUSB plug. There are no other cords or plug adapters provided, so you have to make sure you have your own in those cases (like for a lightning connector). I didn't try it out on my iPad (to test out the 2.1A output), but I did plug it in to make sure it was compatible without any errors. My feeling would be that it wouldn't due a good job of recharging the iPad, but it would slow down the drain if plugged in during use.Probably the main negative of this unit is the text in the skimpy documentation and on the back of the unit. The backside of the battery is covered with logos and text pointing you to Amazon to write a review. I've seen some people say that the company says the review units are different than "retail" units in terms of what's on the back, but either way it's a bit much. I'm also not thrilled with the emphasis on America in the company name, ad copy, etc... while it's actually manufactured in China. "Designed For America" does not mean "Made In America".Bottom line... this is a decent external battery pack for "just in case" use. I'll make sure to keep it charged up and in my charger collection in the event of a prolonged power outage. The whole "Designed For America" and repeated pointers to leave Amazon reviews leaves a less-than-wonderful emotional impression on me, and that knocks it down a notch for me.Disclosure:Obtained From: ManufacturerPayment: Free
summary: Decent "just in case" charger, but the advertising text is somewhat deceptive...

reviewText: I received a free charger from the seller to review, and found enough good and bad points that I’m conflicted about what rating to give.The charger itself measures 2.5” x 4.5” x 5/16”, and is just a little bit larger than my iPod Touch 4th Gen. In fact, I tried putting the iPod case on the charger and it actually fit, albeit with a little stretching on one edge of the case. The charger came with a flat USB cable that is 40” long, ” wide and 1/16” thick and in a color that matches the charger housing. The back of the sample I received is covered with a variety of information, part of which asks for a five star review. I see from Stephen M. Charme’s review that the seller informed him that the tacky text is only placed on sample units, but I agree with Stephen that I can only review what I’m given. Additionally, I find the “Designed for America” and American flag logo to be (intentionally I assume) misleading, since the units are made in China. This is the kind of marketing tricks that I find distasteful.With the above things being said, the charger does do an okay job of charging, but it definitely doesn't put out 5 volts at 2 amps. I know this not because I have an ammeter, but because the charger cannot keep up with my Galaxy Note 2 phone while playing one of my favorite games, even with volume muted and the screen brightness turned almost all the way down. Tonight I plugged the charger into my phone and played my game for about an hour. The phone’s battery was at 17% when I started playing and in spite of showing that it was charging, the battery level dropped to 8% by the end of the hour. The Note 2’s giant screen and fast processor make it difficult to charge when it’s under heavy load, but the 2 amp wall charger that came with the phone is able to slowly charge the phone under the conditions I used to test the 5 Star America charger.The 5 Star America charger had much more success when paired with my iPod Touch 4th Generation. I plugged the iPod into the charger with the iPod battery at about 10% and played music for five continuous hours while driving. At the end of my drive, the iPod’s battery was completely charged and the charger was displaying two of its three battery indicator lights.The charger itself can be charged using the included cable or any standard Micro USB B cable and any USB wall (AC) or car (DC) charger. I used a 3 amp wall charger and a 2.5 amp car charger and saw charging times between three and four hours to charge the depleted charger.When I rate an item, I take into account the performance the product offers for the price charged for the item. The charger is currently being offered at $13.99, which is competitive with other similar products being sold on Amazon. The 5 Star America charger does not, however, live up to the claims of the seller. Had I paid $14 for this device, I wouldn’t think I got a deal, but I wouldn't feel like I got ripped off either. In my opinion, it’s an okay buy for someone looking for an inexpensive, 3100mAh charger, but there may be better buys to be had.
summary: Not Great, but not Horrible Either

reviewText: The 3100mAh External Battery Charger by 5 Star America is a sleek power source in a very slim case. I like that the size of the battery is very slim and capable of fitting into a lot of places without taking up a lot of room. I use this for one of my cell phones that has a 1000mAh battery. This battery charger will provide up to 3 charges which is excellent especially for emergency purposes. I keep this in my everyday carry bag as an emergency power supply that is dedicated for a specific phone.Overall Assessment:The 3100mAh External Battery Charger by 5 Star America is a great source of emergency power should your cell phone battery die. It is important not to expect miracles if you are trying to power a device that requires more output than this battery can provide. I use it strictly as an emergency power supply and it is dedicated for this purpose.Although the company is called 5 Star America this battery is made in China.
summary: Emergency Power Supply

reviewText: I received this one to review and I was quite impressed with it. The design is smart it's cool, it feels good in your hands, and it is very modern looking.  I love all the little design features from the impressions on the grill to the buttons on the grill.  The frame uses this rubberized plastic which I really like.  It feels like I can drop it and nothing will happen to it.I used a bluetooth connection first.  Connecting via bluetooth was really easy.  All I had to do with just hold the button down for about 8 seconds and it was ready to pair.  It wasn't hard to do at all.  Sound quality of the unit was actually pretty loud.  I turned it as loud as I could and it's not ear piercing loud but pretty loud for a little box.  I like that you can use this for phone calls and that it has a mic built in too.  The mic picks up my voice from a good distance almost like a speaker phone.Great speaker for the size.  I wouldn't replace my grace digital device but this is a great portable piece to take to the pool or something.  I received this for an honest review.
summary: Good Quality sound for small speaker

reviewText: This is the catchy tag line on the box of this speaker. After a few days with this speaker, I have to agree!After charging via the enclosed Micro USB cable and pairing via Blutooth, I was ready to go. The on/off switch is on the side of the unit. A small blue LED in the middle front of the speaker lets you know that it is on. A red light will flash when the battery is low. The rubberized case is a nice touch and is easy to grip. Sound quality is very good although I would like a little more bass thump. You can also connect via the enclosed 3.5mm cable. The volume up and down buttons double as next and previous track buttons with a longer press of the button.You can also answer phone calls through this unit. You answer/end the call by pressing the center multifunction button. Sound quality was acceptable. More functions are described in the instructions.It comes with a nice zippered case and a 2 year limited warranty. The instructions are simple and easy to follow.Good things can come in small packages...Sample provided for review.
summary: Don't be fooled by the size

reviewText: The ARCTIC S113BT NFC/Bluetooth 4.0 Stereo Speaker is quickly becoming my favorite Bluetooth speaker. The sound from this small speaker is very good. Depth and richness when tried with various genres of music (Pop, Rock, Classical, Country, Adult Alternative, Christmas, Techno), with crisp, clear dialogue when used as a speakerphone and/or listening to shows on Netflix.  For the price, I'm not sure you can do better than this one, and I've tried quite a few in recent months.PAIRING: "Super easy!"This nicely packaged speaker quickly paired with the following devices: Windows 7 PC, iPhone 4S, iPad 3, and Kindle Fire.To pair devices you turn the speaker on, and then hold the center button down for 8 seconds and wait for both red and blue lights to flash, which means the speaker actively searching for a device to pair with it. Make sure the device you want to pair with the speaker has Bluetooth enabled and is in pairing mode too.  The connection is made quickly, and remains solid - no cutting in and out - which has been an issue for me with other Bluetooth devices including my Bose Bluetooth headset.  I suspect this is due to the new Bluetooth 4.0 standard being used in this device, which extends the speaker's range to up to 33 feet.DIRECTIONS: "Diagrams could be better."The User Manual directions for this speaker are on one sheet of paper.  When I first saw this, I thought that there was no way that would be adequate, but it's pretty well done and covers it all in step-by-step form.The only thing I wish was better was the pictures in 'Getting Connected' - 'For iOS' and 'For Android'.  They are small, dark and tough to read.  I think if the directions had been on a larger sheet of paper, or in a booklet form in color versus grayscale, the User Manual would be 5-stars.A diagram of the speaker is easy to read in the User Manual and it's also pictured on the sturdy, attractive blue and white box the speaker came packaged in.In the User Manual you'll find the following:- Package Contents (speaker, 3.5 line, Micro USB to USB cable, Manual and carrying case).- Function Diagram (of speaker and buttons)- Getting Connected (for Bluetooth and NFC One Touch pairing)- Music Operations- Phone Operations- LED Light SignalsNOTE: 2 Year Limited Warranty via ARCTIC - nice perk!FEATURES: "Solid specs that equal performance."+ Up to 700 hours of Standby on 1 charge.+ Rechargeable battery via Micro USB (cord included).+ Accessories included; quality, gray nylon carrying bag, 3.5mm cord and Micro USB cord for charging.+ Omnidirectional Microphone for speakerphone mode.+ Full range driver with Bass radiator - it sounds rich and deep!+ Bluetooth 4.0; latest standard offers extended range and stability. (V4.0 + EDR (Class 2))+ Up to 8 hours of playback time on 1 charge.+ Output: 2x3W RMS, 1x1.5" Full range Drivers + 2x1.5" Bass Radiators.  6W amplifier, 4 diaphragms.+ Supports AAC and apt-X for best in class sound quality.+ 6" long x 2" high x 1.75" deep+ Rubberized edge (soft, semi-spongy feel) gives speaker a no-slip design.+ NFC - One Touch Pairing; works with NFC smartphones.SOUND: "Delivered more than I expected."Whether I was listening to Oingo Boingo or Elton John, the sound from this speaker when paired via Bluetooth with any of my devices (PC, iPhone, iPad, Kindle Fire), was clear, crisp, true and had a warmth and depth that truly impressed me.The sound was equally good when paired via 3.5mm line.Volume levels were easily established going up and down.  A very slight distortion was noted at the highest volume setting, but barely noticeable.CONCLUSION: "You won't be disappointed in this speaker."Without reservation, I recommend this speaker. It's priced right, works perfectly for listening to music and movies, as well as acting as a speakerphone.  It's easy to use and the Bluetooth 4.0 connection has no dropped connections between paired devices.  It's good looking, packs easily into its own bag, has a great battery life and sounds great.The worst I can say about this deal is the User Manual's diagrams are 'dark'.I was unable to test the NFC function, so if you intend to use this function, be sure to check out the other reviews to see if there's info on that function specifically.NOTE: I was given a product sample for review from Arctic, in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Very impressed with this speaker w/ 2 yr wty

reviewText: This has the sound of some of my large speakers, in a tiny and portable unit.In fact, the sound even booms clearly and loudly if you use it outside--nice for dinners on the deck and for entertaining.Use your iPod, get the tunes rolling, and enjoy. I keep it in my bathroom for big sound while I am showering and getting ready in the morning.But, better yet, if you want to use it at your desk and a call comes in, one button and you can use it as a microphone for hands-free calls. Because of this I often tote it to the kitchen and am able to cook while enjoying music and also not have to hold a phone if, say, I am rolling out dough or have my hands in something. Great gift, therefore, for a cook. Great for a dorm because of the portability, and great for an artist like myself as well when my hands are in paint and I still want to take calls.No matter what I played, I heard the words more clearly and it filled the room with sound. Jazz, Broadway, rock, pop, country...it performed.Product provided by Arctic. Review is my honest and unbiased opinion.
summary: Great sound

reviewText: I was impressed with this right out of the box due to what may seem to be a minor issue: the carry case. The benefit of a small bluetooth speaker is the ability to carry it with you and, while some do come with a case, they are usually a thin nylon sack that offers zero protection. This case, however, is really well made. It has padding on the sides that provides protection in transit, a well-made zipper that you don't have to struggle with, and has two mesh pockets on the inside to keep cables stowed.I know it may sound a bit silly to go on about the case to that degree, but often it's the little things like that often make a product so much nicer to use.The speaker case is another strong plus for me. It is a soft, rubbery material that is highly slip resistant. Plus, it looks great, totally hides fingerprints, and feels nice as well. The attractive design extends to the grills, which are metal and look and feel nice as well.The control buttons on the front face for volume are small, but clearly marked. They have a solid click when depressed. The power and connection ports are on the edge and are recessed into the soft cover so that they don't interfere with positioning the speaker on-end should you want to.The sound quality is pretty good. The speaker has the same limitations of any other small speaker in that the bass is, at best, somewhat adequate, and the midrange is on the muddy side. But sound quality is always relative. This sounds 1,000 times better than the internal speaker of any tablet I've ever used, but it won't compare with the sound quality of a high end powered speaker. Given the price point, I consider the sound quality to be more than acceptable.Zero problems with operation - paired easily with a variety of bluetooth devices. It also can be used as a direct-connect speaker using a 3.5mm cable (included). This is where there's a quirk in the design. For some reason the volume controls are reversed when using it in direct connect mode - the minus button makes it louder and the middle button makes it softer. I didn't realize that was the way it was supposed to work until I read it in the instruction pamphlet (which is another high point - the manual is actually well written and helpful!). Strange quirk, but not something that detracts from usage.This is one of the better small speakers I've used, and while it is a bit more expensive than others, the better build quality, nicer design, and extras such as an excellent case make it a better value than most. Highly recommend.[Sample provided for review]
summary: Great case; decent sound; solid build quality

reviewText: *Disclosure: I was contacted by Arctic and given a sample of this product specifically for the purpose of giving my thoughts on it.*Test Devices:HTC One and EVO 4G LTESamsung Galaxy S2, S3, S4, and NexusGoogle Nexus 7 (original)Tegra NoteKindle Fire HDXiPad Mini, iPad, and iPad AirI admit to having quite a collection of Bluetooth speakers, finding them to be very useful devices.  The Arctic model is similar in specification to most others on the market, but with an admittedly higher price tag.  Pairing up with each of my test devices was a cinch, both manually and with NFC (on the devices that support it).  The controls worked fine, but I think Arctic missed two steps here.  With other speakers I have, such as theSatechi BT Touch, the volume controls on the speaker toggle on the device they are connected to, rather than being individual. For example, turning the volume down on the speaker turns the volume down on the device.  The way it is now, the Arctic speaker and whatever device is driving it both have individual volume adjustments.  Secondly, no track control on the speaker itself.  The sound output is good, better than than the el-cheapo models I've come in contact with.  But, there isn't as much bass or total volume as there are in the better models.  The lack of volume seems to be a theme across the Arctic line, as I noted the same in their other products.  The battery life is great!  Though it's only rated at 8 hours, my unit completed 14 hours of playback at mid volume and still have power to spare.  The finish on the unit is something I liked, a matte rubbery finish, very subdued in appearance.  Arctic tries to do some value adding to justify the premium price by including a zipper pouch to keep your speaker in and decent quality cables.  It's a good speaker, that's for sure, but, myself, I'm thinking the current price ($50) is too high compared to the competition.
summary: Doing it right

reviewText: The sound in this Arctic is clear, with good -- not overwhelming-- bass and crisp upper ranges. Although the sound quality cannot match that coming from a quality, high-end speaker, it is amazing for such a small and inexpensive speaker. The box measures a mere 6" x 1 3/4" x 2.5" and still manages to deliver a nicely balanced sound. Yes, when I use the multipurpose button to call up Siri on my iPhone, the Apple voice sounds muffled; however, voices on music tracks sound clear. The volume and multipurpose buttons are both accessible on the front and almost-invisible for aesthetics. The rugged little box has a rubberized frame that sticks it to wherever I place it. And it comes with a gray nylon, zippered case for storage.This small box is perfect for bookshelves, small spaces, and for portability. Note: I received a sample for review.UPDATE: I originally rated this three stars because my iPhone 5 dropped out a mere 8 feet away; however, with my iPad, I get good range, about 24 feet including going through walls and/or staircase. Without obstructions, users should expect a greater range. The problem was obviously with my phone, not the Arctic speaker. Thanks to Ronald Klotzer for encouraging me to try the Arctic on other devices.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Great Sound, Especially for Such a Small Box (4+ stars)

reviewText: I was provided an ARCTIC S113BT Bluetooth Stereo Speaker for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ A solid and compact speaker with a rubberized outside.♦ It sounds really great and has good frequency and bass response for this size speaker, just don't expect booming bass.♦ It has a rechargeable battery that charges with a standard Micro USB cable (included).♦ It had decent range with a straight line of sight to my device, but didn't go through walls very well.Detailed Review:♦ Look - The product came in a professional looking box with nice pictures and product information on the outside. Inside the box was the Speaker, an instruction manual, an Aux Cable, a Micro USB charging cable and a nice zippered case with mesh pockets on the inside for cables.  It looks really solid and nice and has a rubberized outside with an anti-skid feel to it.  It has a multifunction button, two volume buttons, a Micro USB charging port, an Aux port and an on/off switch.  It looks like it is designed and built well.♦ Installation - I plugged in the included Mini USB charging cable into the unit and into my computer to give it an initial charge before testing it out.♦ Use and Performance - Once the speaker was charged, a did a variety of tests to try it out using my iPhone 5.Test #1 (Sound Quality Test) - I tried out a variety of music from some Disney kids songs to some Pop Music to Excision Bass Heavy Dubstep (the Destroid album), and the speaker handled everything I threw at it with no distortion and some pretty high volumes. It sounded very clear and nice.  It had pretty good bass sounds for a small speaker, but not booming bass (this is not a negative because no tiny speaker can produce booming bass). I really liked the sound overall.Test #2 (Sound Performance Test) - After I got past the basic sound quality, I tried out a few more technical tests. I put speaker directly in front of me and started playing a Dolby HD Surround Sound test video. It sounded really great, but produced minimal stereo or surround sound effects due to the close orientation of the speakers to each other. This isn't really a surprise, so no big deal.  I also played a frequency test file that started at 20Hz and found that the speaker started producing sound around the 33Hz range. The sound continued with sound being audible all the way up to 15000Hz. Good range for a small speaker.Test #3 (Use Test) - I tested the Bluetooth range by walking through my house and the speaker had a range of about 15-20 feet and was best with a straight line of sight to my device.  It didn't handle going through walls very well.  Not the best range, but not bad.  Once the sound testing was done via Bluetooth streaming, I tried out the sound from the Aux input cable from my iPhone and it sounded just as good. The speaker also has some additional speakerphone features as an added bonus.Conclusion:Overall, I like this speaker a lot.  It sounds really good and feels really solid.  It could use a little better Bluetooth range, but the sound quality makes up for that in my opinion.  If you are in the market for a small Bluetooth speaker, the ARCTIC S113BT is worth a look.
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy!

reviewText: Some products speak for themselves and this Stereo Speaker does just that. It is a well-designed, handsomely cased stereo speaker designed for Near Field Communication and Bluetooth that makes is idea for Smartphones or tablets or MP3 devices. It also supplies audio video remote control for searching particular songs or skipping ones that you’d rather not hear. The quality of sound (always for this user an important aspect) is exceptional for such a small device: the highs are crisp and the lows don’t rumble. It is attractive enough to place anywhere in the home or office and it comes with a carrying pouch to move it to any location desired. Practical, good quality sound, and flexible, this s a good buy for the price.  Grady Harp, December 13
summary: A fine new stereo speaker

reviewText: This small bluetooth speaker has wonderful sound, considering the compact size.  It's even more lightweight that I had anticipated, and it has a thin rubberized material that wraps around the device for protection from drops.  I very quickly paired this speaker with my iPhone 5 and iPad Air, and I was able to get the advertised connection distance of approximately 30 feet. The controls are simple and accessible - on both the front and the right hand side.  The carrying case is a welcome extra, if, for no other reason than to keep the supplied cords close at hand.Note: I received this speaker in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Wonderful sound in a compact size

reviewText: The best bluetooth speaker I own. Though not quite as good as bose this is a close second in my speaker inventory. I really enjoy this small speaker!Reasons to buy this:The sound the sound and the sound. This is an amazing speaker for being so little(powerful and clear).Very easy to use, my wife who is technophobic(i kid) is quite capable of using this!Playtime of roughly 6 hours!Comes with a carrying case, has multiple colorsSolid buildUses bluetooth 4.0!Works across my living room (roughly 20 feet)Reasons not to:Just so you know:I received this item free in return for an honest reviewA good speaker at a better price if you have the money I totally recommend this product!
summary: Great sound

reviewText: This Bluetooth speaker from ARCTIC is very compact at 6 x 2 1/4 x 1 3/4 in but it puts out an impressive amount of sound with the pair of 1 1/2 in. 3 W drivers.  It has a metal grille front and back.  There is no distortion even at higher volumes, although the higher settings are too loud for personal use.  The bass gets a noticeable boost if the speaker is placed a few inches in front of a vertical service.The design is straightforward and setup is fast and easy.  On the right end are the power port, audio-in port, and the power switch.  On the front are volume buttons and a button that initiates Bluetooth pairing when pressed for a few seconds and also controls telephone calls.  The microphone works very well when used for calls and the music is paused automatically.Bluetooth pairing is a breeze with the device registering as S113BT.  No password is needed and the advanced Bluetooth 4.0 with aptX and enhanced data rate works every bit as well as the the included 3.5 mm audio cable.The rechargeable battery will provide power for at least six hours at reasonable volume when full, so this speaker is great for use on the go.  The zipper case is very nice, too, with mesh pockets inside to hold the audio and power cables.The soft-touch plastic case is very functional and fun to handle and it comes in a choice of several fun colors.  The rubbery surface does tend to attract lint and dust, but a damp cloth will easily clean it up.The only thing I don’t like about this speaker is that a small blue LED inside the front grill flashes every five seconds while in use.  Otherwise, this is a very well-designed speaker that is simple to use.A sample was provided for testing and evaluation.
summary: Little speaker, big sound

reviewText: I received a review sample from the manufacturer (the black model) and carefully tested it. The first thing that distinguishes this speaker from a pile of others that I have tested is this has a microphone for true hand's free operation.Since there are complete specs in the product description I will not repeat them here. Instead I'll highlight my experience and what I particularly like about this speaker. Out of the box I recommend charging it before tying to use it. Mine was shipped partially charged and it took about two hours to fully charge it.Pairing with bluetooth was simple: I turned the speaker on with a switch on the side, then pressed the multi-function button for about eight seconds until I got an alternating orange and blue light. I scanned for bluetooth devices on my Samsung Galaxy Note II and S113BT popped up. I selected that and was playing music as soon as it paired and connected.I tried the near field communication (NFC) pairing, but had to remove my Galaxy Note II from the case I use to accomplish that. Then the pairing popped up my S-voice application, so I abandoned that feature. I'll chalk that up to my phone's fault and my own inexperience with NFC.Sound quality is surprisingly good for such a small speaker. I always test speakers with Miles Davis' Kind of Blue because of the range of instruments exercise the full spectrum of sound. The bass response of this speaker is excellent, as is the mid and higher frequencies.Receiving phone calls is as simple as touching the multi-function button to receive an incoming call, which I pre-arranged for this evaluation. The person on the other end had no trouble hearing me clearly through the integrated mic, and I had no trouble clearly hearing her over the speakers.Overall this is a wonderful speaker that comes complete with a zippered case that actually protects it (it's waterproof), a charging cable and a 3.5mm cable to connect to headphone jacks if you want to use it with a non-bluetooth device. I normally donate my review samples after I evaluate them, but this one is a keeper.
summary: Great sound in a small package

reviewText: Great sound from a tiny brick speaker. As long as I don't crank it up too loud, this speaker produce rich and pleasing music in my bedroom and bathroom. A number of speakers in the market have similar configuration, including the much more popular 130-150$ Jawbone. It has rugged rubber casing and metal grill protecting the speakers. The S113BT competes at a more affordable price.It has a handsome zippered case with pockets for the the included microUSB cable and a 3.5 mm audio cable to attach to the auxiliary input.Quick Specs:- Bluetooth 4.0 (this what makes it possible for the manufacturer to claim 700 hrs in standby mode)- Frequency response - 30 Hz to 20 KHz- total of 6W output from (2) 1.5" speakers- 4 ohms- 1200 mAh battery- 8 hrs playback timeControls:Pairing - press the middle button for 8 seconds until LED lights flashes red and bluePause and Play - short press of the middle buttonVolume - one short press of either button "-" and "+"Music advance - long press of either button "-" and "+"Answer and End call - short press of the middle buttonIgnore call - long press of the middle buttonJawbone no doubt is a great speaker and is superior in audio quality. The Arctic S113BT sounds unnatural when playing at louder volume. Arctic then enters in much reasonable price with similar features and convenience plus it brings in Bluetooth 4.0 for an incredible BT power efficiency.A sample of this product was sent to me for review purposes.
summary: Not bad at all

reviewText: The first thing I noticed about this Arctic S113BT NFC/Bluetooth 4.0 Stereo Speaker when I took it out of the box was that it was packaged in an attractive gray nylon padded and zippered case. This would be nice for traveling or just a place to store it when it isn't being used. But this speaker is used a lot! The sound is quite impressive with 2x3W RMS, 1x1.5" full range drivers + 2x1.5" bass radiators. 6W amplifier, and 4 diaphragms. I have a few favorite sound tracks that I used to test the sound. They are: Symphony No.3 in C minor, Op.78 "Organ Symphony" - 2b. Maestoso - Più allegro - Molto allegro, Washington Bridge (Album Version), I Don't Want To Miss A Thing and also some Halloween sound effects recordings that have good speaker phasing. All of these sounded amazing considering the size of this speaker (6.75 inches, 3.25 inches, 2.5 inches). The sound is CD quality. In addition it features Audio Video Remote Control Profile (AVRCP) for remote control functions such as forward/backward tracking skipping. The controls are on the front of the unit. I usually control it right from my phone or Kindle.Pairing was simple and quick with a couple iPhones, iTouch, and Kindle HD. It was easy to switch from one source to another and as soon as my husband heard some of the music he had stored on his phone, I haven't been able to get it away from him to pair with my phone. It has NFC pairing but we don't have any NFC devices to pair it with so I wasn't able to test that feature. When you get a phone call while playing music, the music pauses and the device doubles as a hands free speaker with its integrated omni-directional microphone. It's compact size makes it easy to bring along in the car and I've used it in the car for this purpose. It's also nice for outdoors. We bring it out when we're eating on the patio. It would be equally as nice for camping or at the beach because it gets about 8 hours of playtime on a single charge. And it's rubberized casing is nice because it doesn't scratch and it keeps it from slipping on hard surfaces like the kitchen countertop.This would make a nice gift because of the nice quality and presentation and also because it's easy to set up and use.I received a sample of this product for review purposes.
summary: Great sound and high quality

reviewText: This is the most interesting speaker that I have tested.It is much more than just a speaker as we were not only able to listen to great music, but we could make & receive calls and even send voice texts with it... all through the speaker! Very cool - well worth purchasing. The unit comes in multiple colors and the one we received is black. It came with a USB power cord that we plugged in to our Samsung phone's wall adapter, and the speaker fully charged in less than one hour.The excellent instructions made it easy to pair with our phones, and pairing was quick and trouble-free.  The phone paired with the speaker was always within three to 12 feet of the speaker, typically about eight feet away, with relatively good line of sight between the two devices.Tested with my Samsung Galaxy S3 and our teenage son's HTC Droid DNA, the first thing that we noticed was how well this speaker responded to the equalizers on those phones. At first the sound seemed flat, but then we began adjusting mixer settings and the speaker jumped to life. Additionally we found that when placed with the rear speaker set down on the counter or table (so that the volume controls face straight up), the impact on bass volume and resonance was outstanding - that position turns the counter-top (table, floor, any solid surface...) into a subwoofer reflector.Through the combination of the speaker's volume button, the phone's output volume setting, and equalizer's settings - we got this speaker to produce all the volume we would need from it. Bob Marley was Jammin' in the kitchen, and I could hear him from the third floor.We played an eclectic selection including Chili Peppers, Green Day, Bob Marley and Everlast, and even a little Eric Clapton, from sources including Amazon's MP3 Cloud, Pandora and our own audio files. The results were outstanding; with a little tweaking from the equalizers for the different mixes of music, we coaxed the ARCTIC S113BT speakers into producing very nice sound for several hours. If I didn't have to concentrate to write this review, I would still be listening to the great tunes right this moment.While enjoying the music, we tested the inbound and outbound call capabilities and were beyond impressed, having never made calls through this type of speaker system before. The mechanics of the ARCTIC S113BT worked seamlessly with our phones to mute the music and enable answering, hands-free calling and texting (voice text).  I took a walk down the lane to our house and then placed a call to my son's phone. He answered the call through the speaker -- we had a couple friends over and they chuckled at hearing me loud & clear over the speaker, and I had no problem at all listening to them all respond back through the speaker. Perfect tool to use as an impromptu speakerphone!By the way - how many times have you purchased electronics and found that the user manual is just worthless? NOT the case here; the manual that comes with this speaker is very well written, easy to follow, and includes perfect examples for iOS and Android users to follow for setup and use. Best manual we have seen for gear like this, and that is completely appreciated.The speaker's carton notes that there is a two year manufacturer's warranty, so if an issue arises before that two year period expires I will return here to update the review and let you know what the issue was and how resolution was handled. I did receive this speaker gratis from the manufacturer, and have put it through the paces to objectively find out how well it performed. My statements here reflect that testing.If you go back to the speaker's main sales page, I uploaded pictures showing details of the unit, the information on the carton, and the excellent manual. These pictures may be found on that main page by scrolling down to where the "Most Helpful Customer Reviews" section starts -- look to the right of that area for the "Product Images From Customers" section.If you are looking for a speaker of this style and size with all of the extra hands-free call functionality, for use similar to what I have described above, then we totally recommend these to you.Go for it and enjoy.
summary: ARCTIC S113BT NFC/Bluetooth Stereo Speaker - Built-in Microphone - Hands-Free Calls - Black - Excellent Multi-function Speaker

reviewText: BUILD QUALITYThe build quality of this speaker is very rugged. It feels sturdy and it can be placed horizontal or vertical. It has a good gripping sides. The buttons feels solid and compact. The enclosed case makes it a notch higherPAIRINGWas very easy. I am not sure if it is because of NFC capability, I switched on the unit and place the phone (Samsung Galaxy S4) on top of speaker, automatically bluetooth switched on and paired with phone and started playing what was in the phone automatically. I was impressed. Note i had paired it for the first time already. Basically very easy to pair and start playing.AUDIO QualityVery good. Volume was really good when I pushed volume all the way up. It was too much I had to reduce it. Will be useful for several use cases, in cars, kitchen, home, if you need for some small house performances etc. No issues. I was able to keep the phne charged and take the speaker to a different room and still play. I tried with a tablet and can keep browsing/doing some work while my daughter listens in a different room.BATTERY LIFEVery good. I was able to keep playing for 6 hours and still it has power. I did not let it run very low. USB charging makes it very convenient to charge this.Overall I am very impressed and I highly recommend it! I was provided this product in exchange of a fair and honest review.
summary: Packs lot of power!

reviewText: I received this at no cost in exchange for writing a review. Here is why I think this speaker is one of the best compact speakers I have seen.1. This comes nicely packaged and has quality written all over it. There is an attractive rubberized protective covering all around except for the front and back. This is nice and compact--.6 lbs and 6 x 2 1/4 x 1 3/4 inches. Perfect for travel. It comes with a carrying case, USB micro cable, and audio cable. Everything you need.2. Bluetooth paired effortlessly on my iPhone 4S, iPad 3 and Nexus 7 2013. NFC pairing is also available though I did not use it since I have no other NFC enabled devices.3. I tested this speaker with a broad range of music, and it sounded absolutely amazing--clear and crisp, with treble and bass reproduced accurately, and instruments and vocals nice and clean. Classical, jazz, rock, R&B;, etc.--all sounded great.Note: I like listening to music featuring the piano since I spent years studying classical and jazz piano. This is one of the few compact speakers where the piano sounds like it should--vibrant and full bodied instead of tinny and squeaky.4. The volume on this is astounding. This speaker easily filled with sound a room on the second floor of my house that is the size of my two car garage underneath. And even at maximum volume on both the speaker and my Nexus there was no "squelch" or degradation of sound quality. There is also a broad range of volume control (I counted 15 different levels), and when you reach the highest or lowest volume there is an audible beep to let you know that.Bottom line. This is one of the best compact speakers I have tested. In fact it performs just as well as my wired iHome IP37, which is a nice desktop speaker, but is much larger and of course requires electricity to work.If you are in the market for a compact bluetooth speaker, I definitely recommend this one.Update November 3, 2013: When this speaker is connected via bluetooth to my iPhone 4S an indicator appears on my phone showing how much battery life is left on the speaker. So I can easily see when it's time to recharge. This is becoming a common feature on bluetooth 4.0 devices.
summary: Excellent speaker

reviewText: This speaker, having tested more Bluetooth speakers than I care to admit or remember, is easily the best sounding of the 10 or so that have come my way for review.The quick and dirty of it is, the speaker sounds great for what it is. Being an audiophile means I always want better, however, there are limitations to the quality based on size, transport and so on, so I resolve myself to accepting these limitations. If you are an audiophile and must have the absolute best quality sound, you won't be happy with this speaker.If you're looking for a, in my mind, best in class audio experience from a portable, small, well built and nicely designed Bluetooth speaker, look no further. Yes, there are less expensive options, but of the ones I've tested, none compare in terms of audio quality to this one.Pairing is bang on simple. If you have NFC and don't mind leaving your phone on the the speaker to keep the connection, it's even simpler. If you want to just use BT, turn the speaker on (first time you power it on it is in pairing mode), go into your device's BT pairing section and let it scan. It will find the S113BT and you should then be off and running.This speaker also has a built in mic and can receive phone calls. The sound quality on the speaker end is good, but on the other end results vary, simply due to distance from the speaker. It's like a speaker phone option on a home phone or at work. Closer you are, the better off you are.The mids, like other BT speakers I've used, are a little lacking. Touching up the equalizer on your phone/tablet/computer you can actually get some nice, punchy sound out of this small package. Bass, out of the box, is deep and highs are, to my ears, a little over accentuated and I dialed them down a bit in my EQ.I will say it again, this is easily the best sounding BT speaker I've had the pleasure to review. Highly recommended.I received a free sample for review purposes by the manufacturer. All items are reviewed based on whether I would pay money for them or not, and in this case, I would.
summary: Good sounding speaker, nicely designed and well made

reviewText: The Arctic S11BT is a compact Bluetooth speaker, that delivers a decent amount of sound.  With small diameter speakers, the tone tends to have more treble than bass.  Fine for most kind of music, these speakers are also well suited for podcasts.  The unit comes with a nice carrying case, and accessory cords for charging, and connecting to an auxiliary audio source.The controls are relatively simple.  There are “volume +” and “volume –“ buttons.  Pushing them once, increases or decreases the volume.  If you are playing an album, holding down “volume +” skips forward to the next track, while holding down “volume –“, skips to the previous track, if there is one.With a rated runtime of 8 hours, the S11BT is a solid performer, capable of reaching a pretty high sound level.  Convenient and portable, the price is competitive, for a speaker unit of this type, and for the fashion conscious, the unit comes in six colors (black, blue, orange, pink, lime, and white).  It is compatible with Windows, Android, and MacOS, and the colored material is actually a type of padding, that provides some level of protection.The distributors of ARCTIC products, kindly provided a sample for evaluation.
summary: compact bluetooth speakers, delivers good quality sounds…

reviewText: I was impressed with this device. I use it with my iPhone, and so far it has performed as promised.=== The Good Stuff ===* The unit is a reasonable size. It is roughly the size of two decks of cards placed end-to-end, and about twice as thick. It will fit comfortably in a coat pocket, but is a bit of a stretch for pants or shirt pockets. It seems fairly rugged, although I doubt it would stand up to moisture. It is relatively lightweight.* The sound quality is surprisingly good. Of course it pails next to the $3000 speakers in my media room, but that is not its purpose in life.  For something that is completely portable, it can put out enough sound so you can hear it over typical room noise. It will fill a small room with speaking level sound before it begins to distort. The bass is "reasonable", but it is not going to shake your walls. I didn't notice any noise or crackle during bluetooth operation, and the pairing stayed intact for at least 20 feet. Bluetooth pairing and discovery has worked flawlessly. There is also an AUX input, allowing you to use a standard wired connector instead of bluetooth.* The unit charges pretty quickly- roughly 2-3 hours from a wall pack USB charger. (It uses a standard USB/Mini power cable). The speaker can play roughly 8 hours at a pretty moderate volume. The front controls (FF, REW, PLAY/PAUSE, VOLUME) worked as expected, although it wasn't obvious that the FF and VOLUME controls were the same button.* I expected the phone function to be a bit of a novelty, but it worked well enough to be used for "quick" conversations. A caller would notice the difference between using this as a speakerphone and a nice bluetooth headset, but it was sufficient for at least short conversations. Sound quality on the phone speakers was about as good as would be expected. The functionality of the PHONE button was pretty obvious.=== The Not-So-Good Stuff ===* It has a pairing of red and blue LEDs to tell you when the unit is on/charging. I am a fan or dark, so more electrical tape.* The phone volume was a lot louder than the music volume. To be fair, I am not sure if this is some setting on my iPhone, or if it is just the way the units amplifier works. It didn't bother me enough to worry about trying to solve.* There is no obvious way to tell how much charge is left in the battery. I miss the battery meter than many of my bluetooth devices now seem to have.=== Summary ===* Despite my expectations of it being a gimmick, this is actually a useable device. I have it installed in my workshop, where it works quite well with an iPhone carried in my pocket. The phone, while not my first choice for long conversations, works well enough for quick hands-free discussion.=== Disclaimer===I received this product directly from the manufacturer as a sample. I have no interest, financial or otherwise, in the manufacturer or its principles.
summary: Kind of an Awesome Little Box

reviewText: Overall, this puts out decent sound quality. The bass is light; the mid-range is muddy, and it clips off the high-end sound. But, considering the price and the fact that it's a bluetooth speaker, it's certainly acceptable. Just don't expect Jawbone-level sound quality, despite the name being referenced in the product listing.I do like the overall design. The case is made of a soft, rubbery material that feels nice and, more importantly, is 100% non-slip. You can put this on a steep incline (such as the control panel for a treadmill) and it will not budge whatsoever. The color is a vibrant blue, which looks nice, and the grill is metal (or at least it feels like metal) with an embossed diamond pattern. It's also compact, measuring only about 6 inches long, 1.75 wide, and about 2.25 tall. That makes it easy to take along, but no doubt contributes to the average sound quality and light bass.Unlike other low-end speakers it includes a slot to take a TF card (a microSD card) to play music directly from it. I don't have such a card handy, so I was not able to test that feature.But all those good points are marred by one really annoying one: it speaks (or rather shouts) its bluetooth status. So, when you first turn it on, a man's voice states "Bluetooth model has been opened." At least, that's what I think he's saying - it's heavily accented English.I can't find a way to turn that off, or even make it softer. It's funny the first couple of times, but quickly becomes a real annoyance.While the features make this a decent performer for the price, and I love the casing material, the loud, annoying voice drops this to 3 stars.*** UPDATE: The manufacturer contacted me and provided me with a way to cut the volume of the announcement. Basically you need to update the unit's firmware using an SD card (download the code onto the card, insert the card, turn on the speaker, and let it be until it has updated).  I have to give the manufacturer credit for following up and addressing the issue.  Based on the update, I changed my rating for the product to 4 stars since the update addresses what was for me a major annoyance. According to the manufacturer, new versions of the speaker will come with the firmware already updated. It's nice when a manufacturer follows-up and improves product performance - kudos![Sample provided for review]
summary: Great case; average sound; one big annoyance (but a fix is available)

reviewText: This DKnight Bluetooth speaker competes nicely in an already crowded market.  The box is a mere 6" x 2.25" x 1.5".  Its rubberized top and bottom give it a sturdy, matte look while the black metal speaker grate in front protects the interior.  It charges with a mini (not a micro) USB port, and has an on/off switch to conserve battery life.  On the top, there are phone answering, forward, back, and pause buttons.  As expected, pairing is easy as long as you know to look for BIGBox on your list of Bluetooth devices.  (Since I have paired many Bluetooth devices to my phone and iPad, I would have appreciated a more readily identifiable name such as MagicBox.)The sound is pretty good, although not great.  At lower volumes, music sounds a little airy, but increased volume levels produce much higher quality sound, suggesting that this would appeal to those who like to crank up their music, especially since it is balanced toward the bass.  Even so, you shouldn't expect to shake the floor -- this is, after all, a small box designed for small spaces.  And you shouldn't expect high audio quality given its size and the single box format.  It's perfect, however, for a dorm room, small bedroom, office, hotel room, or anywhere space is at a premium.  The only thing I don't like about this -- and it's a feature found on most of its competitors -- is the loud, Bluetooth beep when it is turned on, ready to pair, or in the process of pairing.  The jarring sound ruins the experience for me because I'm anticipating my music, not a piercing beep.  Still, especially since everyone seems to do it, it's a small quibble.Given the price and size, the MagicBox seems ideal for a child's or teen's bedroom as well as for anyone who wants better sound for their smart phone, MP3 device, or tablet.  Note:  I received a sample for review.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Nice Sound in a Highly Portable Box (4+ stars)

reviewText: There are many inexpensive decent quality Bluetooth speakers out there. Many of them, however, compromise on the sound quality in order to be incredibly affordable. The DKnight speaker manages to get the sound quality that you would normally expect from much bigger brand-name speakers at the fraction of the price that those speakers sell for.One of the first things you notice about this speaker, and rightfully so, is its incredibly strong and crisp sound. The bass notes were rich and well shaped, and at high volume it was hard to listen due to its incredible loudness.Pairing with my iPhone was a breeze. Bluetooth has come a long way and it's now almost as good as any other wireless transmitting standard, especially for casual listening.The speaker is fairly well built. Th bottom and the top are rubberized, and they grip easily to almost any surface. The sides of the speakers are made out of metal grille and look pretty cool. There seem to be three different color options for this speaker, but to my eye the all-black looks by far the best. As already mentioned, this speaker is really small and it fits easily into almost any environment, especially when used in a completely wireless manner.The speaker uses a micro USB input for charging. You can charge it by connecting it to your computer, or by using a stand-alone charger. Charging speeds will depend on whether you are using the 1 A or 2.1 A charger, and it could take anywhere between two to four hours. Single charge is sufficient for many hours of listening, and it will (naturally) depend on how loudly you use it.The speaker has voice prompts for various states, which is a bit annoying. I would have preferred simple sounds.Overall, this is a great little speaker, especially considering the price. Highly recommended.
summary: Powerful Small Speaker at a Great Price

reviewText: I so wanted to give the Magicbox a full 5 stars, and only one minor annoyance kept me from doing so. First of all, the audio quality is first rate to my ears, especially for such a small speaker. Sound clarity was excellent, bass notes were thumping without getting muddy, and the maximum volume was almost at the hurt-my-ears level. Pairing was quick, with the Magicbox being recognized as "BIGBox" by my Nexus 7 tablet. The controls on top of the speaker worked well to adjust the volume, pause the music, and to advance/go back in my playlist. As for the Bluetooth range, I moved the speaker around, and it played everywhere in my house, even upstairs, without any dropouts. I also hard-wired my Nexus 7 to the speakers with the included 18" 3.5mm audio cable. It worked very well, but in this mode, the volume, pause, and forward/back must be controlled from the tablet or phone.There was just one small annoyance. Whereas most Bluetooth speakers use a simple tone and colored lights to signal that the speakers are ready to pair and when the Bluetooth connection is broken, the Magicbox uses a man's voice (English, with an Asian accent). Moreover, the voice was very loud. The manufacturer emailed me with instructions on how to lower the volume, and when I did so, the volume was lower, but it was still a little weird to use a voiceover instead of a beep to do this. The manufacturer says that they will correct this in new shippings.But that was the only negative issue I had with the Magicbox, although I should mention that the blue color looked a bit garish to me, so I recommend the black color.A USB charging cable is included, but I didn't see any charging information in the user manual. The 800mAh internal battery could be recharged from a USB port, but I also used a 5V~0.85A charger for an hour or so, and there were no problems.A product sample was provided by the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: First rate audio, just one small annoyance - 4 stars

reviewText: This compact speaker packs some nice sound in a small, rectangular box. It has a nice, soft, rubberized top and bottom so that it doesn't slide around on a counter or shelf and it helps to muffle any vibrations from your music.It has a nice, sleek finish with a grill-like front. The sound is good, especially in this price range. Perfect for a kitchen windowsill, a small shelf, dorm room, bedroom or office. It paired easily with my smartphone and comes with a charging cable and an audio cable for non-bluetooth devices.A nice option for listening to your music.I was provided a unit for evaluation and review.
summary: Nice Sound, Sits Solidly on a Shelf or Counter, Easy to Pair

reviewText: The Magicbox is only 6 in. long, but it produces a lot of enjoyable sound for a personal speaker—I can only use it at half volume when sitting at my desk.  The grille runs around the front to the back, and that is part of the reason it can put out so much bass.  It has two 40mm, 3 watt drivers, and the audio is well-balanced, with no distortion or thumpiness.The on-off switch and ports are on the right end.  There is even a TF card slot for playing music without a separate audio source;  few of the portable speakers I have evaluated have had a similar capability.  .  A flashing blue LED behind the front grille indicates activity.I’m not sure exactly how long it takes to fully charge the battery because I just leave it plugged in overnight, but it will play all day at moderate volume, more than nine hours.  A USB power cable is included.Bluetooth pairing is fast and easy;  it shows as BIGBox in the queue.  The Bluetooth connection is excellent, with no noticeable loss of quality. There is also an audio cable with 3.5mm jacks, if preferred over the Bluetooth.The audio and telephone controls are on the soft-touch top for easy access and are completely intuitive.  When the Magicbox is used to answer a paired cellular telephone, voice quality is quite good.I also really like the design, with the faceted and perforated metal grille and rubbery top and bottom panels.A sample of the Magicbox was provided by DKnight for testing and evaluation.
summary: Bigger-than expected stereo sound from a small portable speaker

reviewText: I love a good Bluetooth speaker and I am happy to say that the DKnight delivers on all levels.  First the sound.  At full volume both on the device and my iPhone, there was no distortion and the sound filled a medium sized room with plenty of sound.  The highs were crisp, the mid-range was even and the bass was surprisingly solid.  There are two speakers inside and I wish I could open the box up to see how they are arranged. The two speakers are 1-1/2” wide (40mm) with 6-watt drivers.  Most Bluetooth’s are in the 2-4 watt range, so you get more power.  Somehow, inside the manufacturer has directed the bass to the other side of the speakers, so that it can get a better bass sound by bouncing off a wall.  That’s what they mean by ‘enhanced’.Pairing the device took seconds and I must have a newer model as there was no ‘voice’ announcing the pair, just a loud single ‘beep’.  The blue light also became solid.  The battery is a typical internal Li-ion battery, meaning it will last longer than you will use this product (I am speaking in terms of years).The unit has a non-slip rubberized top and bottom which is nice for using anywhere.  It also has a min-USB port for charging on the end.  There is a USB-micro-USB cord included.  Next to this is an audio in 3.5mm plug for wired use.  The On/Off switch is also on this end.  The top of the unit has fast forward, reverse play and a pause/play buttons that are nearly flush with the top.The Mobile Phone Hands free portion is great and sound as good.  There is a button on top for using that.  When call comes in, the music quickly and slowly disappears.  It does the same when the call is over.  The Bluetooth range is an easy 30-feet and mine worked through one wall.The unit is sleek, smart and sounds great.  These Bluetooth speakers are improving by the month.  Product supplied for an honest review.
summary: Sleek, Smart Sound!

reviewText: Since there are a lot of very helpful and detailed reviews that describe this speaker and its features I will give my personal reasons why I love it. I want to first disclose upfront that I received a review sample.SOUND QUALITY: Excellent. My standard tests for speakers of any kind are are to play a few selected albums through it. I always start with Miles Davis'Kind Of Bluebecause it has high, mid and low range instrumentation. To my ears the album came through clear with all frequency bands distinct. Since that album contains only acoustic bass, I tried a few modern albums with heavy electric bass. To be honest some of the tracks I tried were a little thin, but considering the tiny speakers the sound was still impressive.CONSTRUCTION: I love the soft, rubber feel of the exterior of the speaker. I actually drop tested it to my carpeted floor from waist height and it did not affect it at all. Bottom line here is you can safely use this as an outdoors speaker - beach, hiking, etc. - without worrying about breaking it.FAVORITE FEATURES: I love the fact that I can insert a microSD card into the slot and play songs from it. I have a number of smaller cards with specific playlists, so that is a perfect feature for me. I tested a 32GB card and the device read it and played from it. You can cycle among connected bluetooth devices, directly connected devices via the 3.5mm port or tracks on your SD card with a push of a button.COMPATIBILITY: I tested this by streaming music from an iPad, a Samsung Galaxy Note 3 phone and a Samsung Tab 3 tablet. I also streamed via bluetooth from my old Windows XP laptop via a bluetooth 4.0 USB dongle connected to my USB port. No problems pairing and connecting from any of the devices. Since I recently had a bad experience with a speaker that connected via 3.5mm ports I tested all of the above devices through their headphones out ports into the speaker. My bad experience with a different product involved a lot of static from certain devices, but this speaker was as clear as when connected via bluetooth or directly reading the SD card.Bottom line: this is a relatively inexpensive speaker with excellent sound and some nice features. I would not hesitate to recommend it to friends.
summary: Great sound, portable and even designed to withstand some knocks

reviewText: This got great sound and hard to believe that the volume is coming from such a small brick speaker.  It has a rugged look with rubber top and rubber bottom. The buttons are on top and is completely splash proof.  The front of the speakers have metal grill protection.  It does look like a Jawbone but at a fraction of the price.If you don't want to use the Bluetooth function, it can play music on a TF card.  It won't read AAC files but play MP3s without any hiccups.  And of course it has an 3.5mm aux input.The audio quality is superb.  Well balanced and not a pain to the ears as some cheap speaker does.  The bass is in existence, just don't expect a full boombox experience.The announcement whenever you fire up the speakers, or change  mode to another is loud.  I thought it was kinda funny but when I brought it to my office I realized it is is embarrassing and scandalous.  Fortunately the distributor has issued a quick fix. The link to the file is in the comment section. You will need an empty TF card and download an MP3 file from the website.  Insert the TF (microSD) card and turn on the speakers.  It will boot on the card and fix the problem. Next time you fire it up the announcement will be half as loud as before.I rate it high for its features, audio quality and value for the buck (30$ at the time of this review).A sample of this product was sent to me for review purposes.
summary: Sounds good - also plays on a microSD memory card

reviewText: Want to boost the volume from your iPhone, iPad, or iPod?  This small speaker will bring up the volume and is an easy tote from room to room or at a park, a picnic, or in the car.  Although I do not claim to be an audiofile, the sound is good and clear.  No buzzing or rattling like you get in some small speakers.  So, all in all, this is a handy speaker for any number of uses, good but not great.Why not great?Where is the volume control?  You can back up or move forward on an MP3, but you cannot control the volume from the speaker itself.  You have to go back to the source for volume control.I use this speaker to boost volume so I can listen to my iPod while exercising, and once I’ve set the volume correctly, I have sound I can hear above the noise from exercise equipment.  Although it’s not a perfect answer to my needs, it’s good enough to rate Four Stars!I received a speaker from the manufacturer in return for a review.
summary: Nice Little Speaker for Your Portable Communication Devices

reviewText: It is very compact and the design is great. It has a solid grip on the bottom and the sides are all emitting sound. The controls on top for pause/resume/next/prev are very subtle. The charging is done through USB cables.It is perfect for keeping in various rooms and playing sound through the speaker. I listened to an audio book for over an hour and there was no jitter/breakage etc. Like it!I was provided this product in exchange of a honest and fair review.
summary: Awesome bluetooth speaker

reviewText: This speaker has a nice clear sound. It  pairs very easily.  The feature I like the most is that it remembers the devices that it was previously paired to and connects automatically. It has a sleek, attractive appearance.  It worked for me up to forty feet and was clear for both myself and the person on the other end when making a phone call. The only down side to this speaker was with songs with very high base, the sound became distorted.  Other than that it is a good product.I received this product for an honest review.
summary: Big Sound!

reviewText: DKnight Magicbox Ultra-Portable Wireless Bluetooth Speaker is a great powerful wireless speaker given its size and using battery power.  It is easy to pair/operate and this is very portable. Perfect for travel or picnic. The rechargeable battery last a long time which is nice too (up to 10 hours, and you can see the battery power level indicator from your iPhone next to the bluetooth sign).  You can go to the next song by pressing the button in the speaker which is convenient. Overall, I really like this speaker.  I wouldn't say it is the same bass power or sound quality of the Jawbone JAMBOX but for the value I will choose this speaker any day. Thanks Dknight for sending this speaker.Sidarta Tanu
summary: Impressive sound especially for the size

reviewText: I'm rating it a 5 star not because I received free 'for review' units, which I did, but because just about everything about it other than maybe 'size' is done right. If shopping for the absolute lowest price, be aware that the exact same product is available from several vendors.This is one of the better wall chargers:- Dual USB outputs, one for Apple products and the second, labeled 'UNI' for... non-Apple- Folding prongs make it portable- 15 W, 3.1 A, 5V output is superior to what you would get out of theAmazon Kindle PowerFast for Accelerated Charging for use with the new Kindle Fire or Kindle Fire HD models)- Supports AC from 100-240V and 50-60Hz meaning that you can use it anywhere in the world if you have a plug adapter- Good, minimalist design- Solid (not shabby) built- Good value for the priceMy testing with the Kindle Fires, both regular and HD, Kindle readers, smart phones and in iPhone show super quick charging, probably faster than the 'native' charger do.Small negatives that don't persuade me to deduct one star would be it's rather large size - Amazon's bests it on that count - and... nothing else, really.Just keep in mind that you don't get a cable so you'll have to supply your own USB with a Type A plug at one end for the charger and 'whatever' at the other end to fit the device you are charging.
summary: Well Done

reviewText: This little travel charger has prongs that fold upward then pop down to plug into the wall. When they are folded up, they are almost perfectly flat meaning all of your unmentionables are safe from the prongs when you pack it in your suitcase. If you want beauty in addition to function, the pictures don't really show how nice this charger actually looks with the blue stripe and the blue around the USB ports.What is really nice (especially if you are using this in a hotel room) is that the ports light up once it is plugged in so you can easily plug in your devices in the dark.As you are looking at chargers, one thing to keep an eye on is the TOTAL Amps produced. In this case it is 3.1A meaning you will receive FULL power from the 1.0 and the 2.1 ports. They are marked APP 2.1 and UNI 1.0. APP means Apple and Uni means universal. That isn't as important as the Amps, since my iPhone charges on the 1.0 and my iPad works on the 2.1.Handy to have around, I have had no problems with the complimentary sample they sent to me to test for my review. Five stars.
summary: Won't poke holes in your unmentionables

reviewText: 9to5Cables's Dual USB Car Charger is a great charger that works well with my HTC phone and my Kindle Fire HD. This wall charger can charge two devices at once. The dual ports are 3.1 Amp 15W USB ports which means they can rapidly re-charger all your USB devices.  Both ports can charge most devices from .5 amps to 3.1 amps. The charger is also smart enough to know to only charge your device to the maximum speed it can handle. This car charger has a simple design that will charge almost any device you have. The charger protects devices from overheating. This charger will automatically stops when over current or over voltage is detected, switch to minimal charging current when battery is full.  A one year warranty is also included with this charger.  I really like this device and I would definitely recommend it to others.  Here is a list of what devices this charger is compatible with.* Apple iPhone, iPod Touch.* Most Androids phones* GPS devices* Most TabletsNOT compatible with HP TouchPad, Asus transformer or Motorola Xoom.May not be compatible with some Blackberry & Motorola Phones.Thank you for reading my review.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation.
summary: 9to5Cables Dual USB Travel Wall Charger is a slick looking charger

reviewText: An absolutely perfect wall charger!  It has two ports: one for phones, one for tablets, it doesn't get ridiculously hot (like my Apple charger) and looks great.  I couldn't be happier.
summary: As good as the Apple original that came with my computer!

reviewText: .It's a nice charger at a nice price.Each port is optimized for Apple or non-Apple devices. It should charge your iPad and/or smartphones at full speed (like the ones that came with your devices). However, the UNI port may be limited to 1 Amp (See Notes 1 & 2.)If you want a charger that never blocks other outlets, considerPowerGen's 2.4 Amp dual port wall chargerorAnker's 3.6A Dual-Port Wall Charger.More companies are selling what appears to be the same charger, probably from the same factory. At the moment, 9to5 is undercuttingthe PowerGen model. There are 2 or 3 others.Shop around. Check warranty & seller feedback. Enjoy!PROs:- Designed for Apple and non-Apple devices- Full speed charging for a wide variety of devices (see Notes 1 & 2)- 3.1 Amps available. Charge 2 devices at once- Fit and finish are good. Feels like quality.- Fold-away plug- LED power-on indicator- UL approved (Most competing models are not)OKs:- Nice price when $13 or less- 1 year warrantyCONs:- Blocks other outlets in some situations (see Note 3)- Some nit picks (see Note 4)- - - Alternatives - - --PowerGen's 2.1 Amp dual port wall charger-The Black version of this model-Anker 3.6A Dual-Port Wall Charger- - - Disclosure - - -The manufacturer gave me this product for review. I believe my review is impartial.- - - Notes - - -Note 1: Sometimes you want to charge in a hurry.
