Even if a charger "works with your device" it might be slow.For starters, the "Amps" need to be high enough. That's usually 1 Amp for smartphones, about 2 Amps for tablets. (A higher amp charger is always OK.)Sadly, Apple devices use their own method to decide charging speed. A designed-for-Apple charger may be slow to charge non-Apple devices, and vice versa, even if its Amp rating is high enough. This model has one port of each type, although the non-Apple port may be limited to 1 Amp (conflicting info on this).Note 2: Charged iPad3 about 18% in one hour. That's full speed.Note 3: Blocking other outlets. Seems like small thing, but it can be a hassle. Unplugging lamps, alarm clocks, etc. when traveling. This one may annoy at times, although the non-polarized plugs do provide some flexibility.Note 4: Nit Picks: 1.) The ports are "upside down" (When the charger is "right side up" you insert your USB plug logo-side down. A lot of devices are this way...not a big deal.) 2.) No user guide or warranty info is enclosed.~~~ Comments & questions welcome ~~~
summary: A PowerGen Clone. Nice Price.

reviewText: This 9to5cables Dual USB Charger is very well constructed and the plug folds down to easy travel use. *Note that it does not come with USB cables. So you will need to use your own USB cable or purchase a new one for your device. Below are the reasons why I really am very pleased and will continue to use this charger:PROS+ Dual Ports - The first port which is the top one has more amp power because it is a 2 AMP source - this is the one that I charged my Tab 2 10.1 tablet in and also tried my Galaxy phone - each charged perfectly and FAST! (Note that I use on the top port the Mediabridge Hi-Speed USB 2.0 - (6 Feet) - A-Male to Micro-B Cable which I used this cable for better results and faster charging.+ Charging Time: On both devices (and using good USB cable), I found that from 30 percent to 100 percent both were charged in two and one half hours, which for charging both at the same time is exceptional. On my Samsung chargers it took me about three and one half hours to charge so I saved ONE HOUR and charged two devices.+ Works with so many devices - You just add your own USB cable for your device be it a phone or tablet, or music player and begin charging. The light is blue to show you it is charging. (It works with so many brands as iPhone, iPad, Kindle, Samsung Galaxy line, and many more!+ Small Footprint - So I placed this charger into the bottom outlet and still had room to plug in yet another single micro charger for my MP3 Player and all three devices charged at the same time!+ Travel Function - Because the plug prongs fold down flat, I place them in my travel bag with my two cables and am ready for travel. For me, I put all of this into a double zip lock bag in my purse so I have my dual charger set with me.+ Price - Think about it, this is TWO chargers for the price of one and a very high quality charger at that!+ Overall Use And Value - This charger works almost as fast as my original Samsung 2amp and 1amp chargers! And the fact that I usually charge overnight anyway so I did not notice any difference when I charged overnight. When on the go, I usually charge my tablet or phone in the car with a car charger so this dual charger is perfect for my home or when I travel to a hotel, etc.One last note: This unit was provided to me for testing, evaluation and for reviewing. This is my impartial review that I believe is fair and honest. In fact, I like this unit so much, I highly recommend it to all! It is a superb value!
summary: Outstanding Dual USB Charger--Perfect For Home or Travel!

reviewText: This is a darn nice, good looking, simple USB charger. There are two USB ports and a blue pilot light. The top port is for high amperage devices like iPads, so it outputs 2.1 Amps. The lower port is for standard amperage devices like iPhones and has 1 Amp output (a standard amperage device can be plugged into either port). The adapter can charge two devices at the same time.The charger has hinged prongs so it travels well. It is a nice size, about an inch thick, two inches wide, and three inches tall - a little larger than an iPad charger. The body is shiny black that somehow doesn't show fingerprints - go figure.This would be like just about any other USB adapter in the world, except they added a little blue LED pilot light. I like that a lot - sometimes it is hard to see the USB port in a hotel room or in the shadows. That was a nice touch.This charged an iPad Air and an iPhone both at full high speed. It outputs the amount of current that is on the label.I was provided a review sample.
summary: Nice USB Adapter

reviewText: I've been using dual port USB wall travel chargers for some time now.  I don't have to be on the road to reap the benefits of having one around.  If I need a quick charge for a couple of devices, I've found them particularly handy.  An AC charge is much quicker than plugging something into a port in my PC so I always have one on hand.  The price of this 9To5Cables dual port USB travel charger is very competitive, making it easy to purchase one to tuck away.  Most chargers tend to be either solid black or white, but this one has a bit of panache with the touch of blue.  In fact, in looks like the PowerGen, acts like the PowerGen, but is much less expensive.  A bit of comparative shopping will clue you in on that little fact.The wide range of compatible devices is a real plus because of the wide range we all use. I'm unfamiliar with the 9To5Cables name, but I'm quickly learning that it spells quality and dependability.  Their warranties, for one thing, are outstanding.  They have a lifetime warranty on some of their cables.  I like the compact nature of this dual port USB travel charger, the flip-down AC prongs, and yes, I like that blue LED light that signals it's charging. If I'm charging something during the night.  Some time ago I didn't care for them, but I do want to know if my devices are being charged now.  This unit comes in eitherblackor white to suit your preference.PROS:►  Very compact►  Flip-down AC prongs►  Blue LED light which is perfect for nighttime charging►  Short circuit protection►  Overheat protection►  Smart Technology, trickle charge when your device is fully charges►  Compatibility with a wide variety of devices►  Ability to charge two devices at onceCONS:►  None I can think of, unless you don't care for a bright blue LED indicator during nighttime chargingSPECS:►  Input: AC 100 - 240V, 50 - 60HZ► Output: DC 5V 3.1A / 15W MaxUSB Port 1: Dc5V 2.1AUSB Port 2: Dc5V 1A►  Dimensions:  2" x 2 1/2"►  Weight: 3.2 ounces►  Material: PC material►  LED indication: Blue►  Safety approval: UL listed►  RecyclableWARRANTY:► 12 months limitedSample provided for review.
summary: Nice little travel wall charger that is comparable to the PowerGen ...

reviewText: I was provided a 9to5Cables Dual USB 3.1A 15W Travel Wall Charger for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ Has two ports (a 2.1 Amp Apple Port and a 1 Amp Universal Port) that provide a total output of 3.1 Amps.♦ Has a large enough output capacity to provide fast charging speeds when charging multiple devices simultaneously.♦ Very fast charging speeds when charging an iPhone 5 and an iPad 2 at the same time.♦ Compact and has folding prongs for travel.♦ This wall charger comes inBlackorWhiteto match your personal preference.Detailed Review:♦ Look - The product came in a professional looking box with a picture and product information on it. Inside the box was only the wall charger in a form fitting plastic insert to protect it. This is a fairly small, high powered dual port wall charger.  It measures 2.5" x 2" x 1". It has two USB ports and provides a total output of 3.1 Amps. It has an Apple designated port producing 2.1 Amps and a Universal port producing 1 Amp.  It also has an blue power indicator light between the two ports. The prongs fold into the body of the charger for storage and travel. It appears to have a very good build quality.♦ Use and Performance - I plugged it into a wall outlet and did some testing to see how the wall charger handles simultaneous charging. I took my iPhone 5 that had 39% charge and my iPad 2 that had 66% charge and charged them simultaneously. I plugged the iPad into the 2A Apple port and the iPhone into the 1A Universal port.  After 10 minutes, the iPhone charge increased to 49% and the iPad increased to 69%.  After 20 minutes, the iPhone charge increased to 59% and the iPad increased to 73%.  After 30 minutes, the iPhone charge increased to 68% and the iPad increased to 76%.  The iPhone charged at about 1% per minute and the iPad charged at better than 3% per 10 minutes. Some great results while charging two Apple products simultaneously. It did give off some heat when charging, but not too much.Conclusion:Overall, this is a great travel wall charger at this price point ($13 at the time of this review).  It has a large output capacity that charges multiple devices very fast. On top of that it is small and compact with folding prongs for storage and travel.  If you are looking for an inexpensive dual port wall charger, the 9to5Cables Dual USB Travel Wall Charger is one to try.  Highly Recommended!
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy!

reviewText: AC wall outlet chargers are one of those accessories that every cellphone and tablet owner needs. As chargers go, the 9to5 Cables dual charger is one of the better ones that I've used. On any given day, my wife and I are recharging two phones and two tablets, so the dual output is welcomed. I tested the charger with my 7" Kindle Fire plugged into the 2.1A outlet, and an Android phone plugged into the 1.0A outlet. Both recharged at about the same speed as they do with the two single-outlet chargers we've been using.The charger is bigger than most single-outlet chargers, but it's comparable in size to other dual chargers that I've seen. In any case, it's only 2"x2"x1⅛", so it's very portable, and with its smoothly rounded corners and the folding prongs, it won't punch holes in anything when you pack it for traveling.It's a solidly built device, and with the built-in overcharge protection, it's suitable for charging almost all mobile devices on the market today. Note that no charging cables are included with the charger, so you'll have to provide your own cables.A product sample was provided for review purposes.
summary: A well made dual charger that worked great with our mobile devices

reviewText: This handy little charger will quickly charge two devices at one time. It has a blue LED light to indicate it is plugged in. It charges most devices but it does not charge my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet (most chargers don't charge that). The prongs fold in for convenient packing, nothing to get in the way or bend.The blue accent looks nice (no functionality) and makes this a classy piece. I was provided a unit to test and review.
summary: Solid, Convenient, Great Two Port charger

reviewText: Measuring 2.5" X 2" X 1", this compact wall charger is one of the best I've seen on the market. This wall charger has two USB ports of (APP) 1.0-2.1 A and (UNI) 1.0 A, both at a standard 5V (5.3VDC Max.). Because of its size and its neat fold out electrical prongs, you can carry this anywhere you travel.This will charge just about anything that uses a USB port. The nice features that are reassuring are that is will not over-heat, over-current or over-charge your device. In fact, the charge stops when your device is fully charged. Note that whatever you charge is going to vary greatly in time, depending on what kind of battery you are charging and the device itself.I charged my iPhone 4S from 20% to 100% in about 90 minutes. The charge is as consistent as your wall socket. There is a no glowing light on this device to bother you at night. The glossy white surface is easily cleaned; in fact, it's nice to see `9 To 5 Cables' bother to place a nice design logo on it. Product generously Device supplied for review.
summary: High Speed Charger For Nearly Anything

reviewText: This is a handy little dual USB charger that has two ports, a 2.1 Amp Apple Port and a 1 Amp Universal Port. These provide a total output of 3.1 Amps so I am able to charge my Kindle HD tablet and my iPhone at the same time with enough capacity to charge both of them very quickly. It has an attractive design with plug prongs that fold back inside where they don't get tangled with cords or other thing when you pack them in a briefcase br purse. There's a blue LED light by the ports to let you know that the devices you have plugged in are changing. It's a compact size, just 2.6"x 2"x 1.15" overall so nice for traveling too.This charger will charge most any device that can be plugged into a USB including iPad, iPhone, iPod, HTC, Blackberry, MP3 Players, Digital Cameras, PDAs, Mobile Phones. (You have to have your own cables.)  I've used it with iPhones, iTouches, iPods a Nano, and a Kindle and Kindle Fire. I've also used it to power a little laptop fan and a USB powered lamp. It seems amazing to me that just a few years ago I'd never seen this type of charger and now we have one in many rooms of our home and they always seem to be in use. This one also comes in black9to5Cables Dual USB 3.1A 15w Travel Wall Charger [UL Certified] - with Swivel plug for Apple iPad 2, New iPad 3, iPhone 5s 5 4s 4 3 3Gs, Amazon Kindle Fire HD, Samsung Galaxy Tab - Smart Charge Technology - BLACKif you like that better. Both come with a one year warranty.I was provided a sample of this product for reviewing purposes.
summary: My Kindle HD and iPhone get a charge out of this!

reviewText: This is an excellent charger with dual USB charging capability. I was able to charge my Samsung Galaxy S4 and Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 8.0" as well as a Note 10.1". I am impressed with form factor and smooth edges and that the prong can be folded for compact storage. I have this in my backpack and it was very convenient when I was travelling last week. Especially in airports, this is a big saver as people are clamoring for available sockets.The charger also is 100-240 V 50/60 Hz, so this can be used anywhere in the world where there is electricity. Highly recommend. I should say that I was offered this product in lieu of a fair and balanced review. I would have given same review if I had purchased too.
summary: Excellent form factor and nice charger

reviewText: 9to5 sent me this 'for review' units at no charge but I hope to be as fair and unbiased as humanly possible.When it comes to 'chargers' the competition is fierce, the prices are usually low and so is the product's quality. Perhaps not so in the case of 9to5's product. To my surprise and delight, this one is a well engineered, well designed and solidly built charger that does not scream 'cheap' and it doesn't look like it's about to break or to crack - which doesn't guarantee that it's not going to actually break or crack some day.One of the 2 charging USB ports is a dedicated 'Apple' socket for quickly charging Apple devices only while the other is labeled 'UNI', indicating that anything goes for that one, within reason. Both USB ports work with either Apple or non-Apple hardware but a non-Apple device through the Apple port may not be as efficient as using the UNI port. The charger plugs into your car's 'cigarette lighter' socket and once there it stays in solidly. The relatively small size helps it coexist peacefully with whatever may be in the cup holder next to it.This is what I like about the product:+ The listed 2.4 Ampsseems to be good enough to charge most 'small' electronics, at least those you are likely to use in a car. Had no trouble charging small MP3 players, a PSP, Kindle e-readers and our Kindle Fire through the non-Apple port and an iPhone through the dedicated Apple port. We no longer have an iPad so couldn't test it with Apple tablets.+ Dedicated 'Apple' (for fast charging of Apple gadgets) and 'Not-Apple' ports for everything else - see above for my tests.+ Everything that's listed as chargeable and I tested did charge.+ Good quality, solid build.+ Great design, small size, doesn't look or feel 'cheap'.I wish I could list a thing or two as a negative but other than the lack of a supplied charging cable can't think of anything else. And charging cables should not be reasonably expected at this price considering that they'd have to ship 3 standard USB cables (Type-B, Mini, Micro) plus one with an Apple connector to cover everything.Given the no real negatives and the product's good features, design and quality, this is a solid five stars. This is a good dual-port charger overall and it should be a great car charger for anyone who owns Apple chargeable gadgets. Anyone who doesn't own Apples... not so great.
summary: If you got Apples it's great, if you don't it's only half as great

reviewText: One of the problems I have encountered with many of the USB Car Chargers is that many of them are intended strictly for phones and do not have enough power for my iPad.At 10W/2.1A, this will do both. The only confusing part about it (till I read the description here on Amazon) is that it has two strangely marked USB ports - UNI and APP. If you are as confused as I am, it is intended to be Universal (UNI) for non Apple products, and APP is intended to support Apple products. I guess it makes sense (in a way). I am much more used to the ports being labeled 1.0 and 2.1 based on the Amps provided to the specific ports. My iPhone (Apple) uses 1.0 and my iPad (also Apple) uses 2.1.Whichever case, they both charge correctly, so I assume it is 2.1 amps for the Apple.I'm giving this four stars, not because it isn't a nice product (it is) but because the instructions for which one to use were unclear.The product information states that the total output voltage is 5V and the total output Amps is 2.4. Because of this, and because of the way it differentiates Apple and Universal, I would hesitate to try to charge BOTH my iPhone and iPad at the same time and count on fast charging.I am grateful to have received a complimentary sample for my review.
summary: Yes it will ... iPad charger

reviewText: At the time of my review this is a very affordable charger, making it great to have in your car even if you already have one--I tend to wear out charges and always need a spare it seems, but this one has been going strong for months.With a dual USB port, it allows you to charge more than one device, and do so quickly as well.I have used this with my iPhone, iPod, and iPad.  All with easy and intuitive ability.Charger provided by 9to5cables.Review is my honest and unbiased opinion
summary: charge your iPhone and iPod at the same time, great stocking stuffer

reviewText: 9to5Cables's Dual USB Car Charger is a great little charger that works well with my HTC phone and my Kindle Fire HD. This car charger can charge two devices at once.  The dual ports are 2.4 Amp 12W USB ports which means they can rapidly re-charger all your USB devices.  One of the ports is for Apple products and the other is for non-apple products.  The charger is labeled for which one is which.  The charger is also smart enough to know to only charge your device to the maximum speed it can handle.  This car charger has a simple design that will charge almost any device you have.  The charger protects devices from overheating. This charger will automatically stops when over current or over voltage is detected, switch to minimal charging current when battery is full.  With the high charging efficiency of over 85%, the charger itself never get hot.  A one year warranty is also included with this charger.  I really like this device and I would definitely recommend it to others.Thank you for reading my review.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation.
summary: 9to5Cables Dual USB Car Charger is a great little charger

reviewText: Note that the ports are marked UNI and APP to differentiate only the strength of the charge.  It's possible to use the APP port exclusively, even when charging phones.I found that this charger can be used for an iPad 3 when the screen is off provided the iPad is plugged into the side marked APP.  It's a real slow charge but if the UNI port is used, I think it would take longer than one would normally keep the car running.The UNI port is good for most non-Apple phones.  It's charge level is a bit low for the iPhone, although with the iPhone off it should give it some charge.The iPad 3 has a 42.5 watt-hour battery capacity compared to that of the 25 watt-hour iPad 2.  It just takes longer to charge it.  When there isn't much charge left, turn off Wi-Fi and make the screen a lot less bright to conserve what's left.  But being able to charge it in the car helps a lot.I was not provided a promotional sample.  I think this charger is a bargain and easily recommend it.
summary: How to use this charger most of the time

reviewText: I am so tired of spending a lot of money on things that don't work well or don't last.  This little car charger is the antidote to that: it works really well and costs virtually nothing.  What more do you need to know?
summary: A well-made car charger for a tiny price!

reviewText: .It's a nice compact car charger that re-fuels my iPad at full speed (see Note 1).There are some good 3.1-amp chargers for under $8 (see below). Will charge tablet + smartphone faster in some cases.PROs:- Ports separately optimized for Apple and standard devices- Compact- Nice PriceOKs:- Power status light is not too bright- Styling is plain, unobtrusive.- Ports clearly labeled- Socket fit: OK in most 12v sockets. Tighter fit would be nice (see Note 2).- Gets warm, not hot- 1 year warrantyCONs:- Nit Pick: No user guide or printed warranty enclosure is provided.- - - Alternatives - - -There are some nice 3.1-amp car chargers priced at $8 on a good day-9to5Cables Dual USB 3.1A Car Charger-PowerGen Dual USB 3.1A Car Charger-Anker Dual USB 3.6A (2.1A + 1.5A) Car Charger- - - Disclosure - - -The manufacturer gave me this item for review. I believe my review is impartial.- - - Notes - - -Note 1: Charged iPad 3 from 18 to 36% in 60 minutes. That's full speed.Note 2: Socket fit - It's probably secure enough, but not as tight asPowerGenand some others. The charger may come out of socket when trying to pull the USB cable out of the USB port. Minor hassle.~~~ Comments & questions welcome ~~~
summary: Nice compact car charger. Nice price.

reviewText: This is a nice car charger, especially at the price. It will charge one or two things at a time. I've been using it for my smartphone as well as my bluetooth headset. I really like that it slows to a trickle charge when my device is fully charged. It never gets hot and has been a solid performer for weeks. It stays put in the car charger and has a small LED light to indicate that it is properly seated in the charging port.A compact and well designed unit. I was provided a sample for testing and review.
summary: Fast Charging, Complete Set of Safeguards

reviewText: This USB cigarette adapter has a newer look that is different from the other adapters that I had tried before. Not very low profile, but also doesn't protrude as much as other adapters. It has a solid feel construction unlike some cheap competitors. A small LED light on the side indicates when it is powered up.Total output is 2.4A which divides into 1.2A if using both slots at the same time. The slot labeled App is for Apple devices while the other slot serves as a universal USB output for Androids, MP3 players, etc. Power output is quite capable although I have seen some adapters with two 2.1A. I rate this 5 stars for good quality and function at a very competitive price (around 6$ at the time of this review).A sample of this product was sent to me for review purposes.
summary: Solid performance and solid construction

reviewText: Having a dual charger in the card is a big plus as most of us have multiple phones. I liked the fact that this did not get heated up unlike a different charger I had. This is nice and fits the charger comfortably and does not slip out.Overall highly recommend ! I was provided this product in exchange of a fair and honest review.

reviewText: ..and if you have multiple devices that use the Micro USB form factor: between home, work, car and travel bags, can you ever really have too many data cables.This cable worked fine with both data exchanges and charging. I tested with multiple HTC EVO 4G LTE phones and three Kindles (Fire and e-reader). Worked great.Colorful braided nylon sheath makes it easy to identify in a sea of black plastic.Select with confidence!Note: This product was provided for review purposes.

reviewText: This is a really cool looking cable LOL.  I really light the design of it.  I actually got a brown/tan stripped one but it is so nice.  The feel of it is great, the way it snaps in place is also great and more importantly it works!I can't tell any difference in transfer speeds but that doesn't matter.  The transfer speed is unnoticeable slow or fast to me but I really like is how it snaps into my Samsung Note 2 port.  Some cables feel loose even after you snap it in but this one is great.  I am currently comparing it to my Amazon Basics cord and I'm sorry to say but this is a slightly better cord.  It's a more sleek look and it lives to my expectations of what a cord should feel like when you snap it in.  Amazon Basics cord is really nice too but its not as tight and you can wiggle it a little.This is a great cable and I received this for an honest review.  Really really cool cord.

reviewText: I cannot tell you what kind of annoyances I have experienced in plastic coated USB cables. From breaking at the adjoining points to actually peeling apart (original Apple cable), the very word cable has become a word I dread.This cable (Be sure to notice it is 6 ft long) has all of the others beat hands down. I love the feel and look of the braid, but even more I love the sturdiness. But Frieq has gone one step further. Both ends have a 1/4" stabilizer/cover that ensure that the cords will remain fully attached!Because FRiEQ doesn't (yet) make these for Apple devices I am actually putting adapters on the end to be able to use mine regularly on my favorite devices!I actually received a complimentary sample of these to test a different product I was sent, but I fell in love and wanted to ensure that these received a review from a very satisfied consumer.

reviewText: I hope FRiEQ comes out with colorful USB cloth jacketed cables for every cable type. These are so unique and eye catching. Unlike ordinary cables, it lays flat and the cloth material helps it stay put where it lays. The cool colors get a lot of attention as it sits on my desk. I use it to charge my Verizon Galaxy S4.Very well constructed with a woven nylon material and has rubber ends to make sure they do not fray or unravel. I really like the extra long connector because it makes it easier to connect to my phone.This a really cool cable and hope to see one for the iPhone 5S soon.I received a sample cable to test and evaluate in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

reviewText: Like so many of the other reviewers of this product, I was provided a review sample by the manufacturer and asked to do an honest, unbiased review.This product, a A male(USB 2.0) to Micro B cable which is jacketed or wrapped in a strong decorative fiber, houses a cord that the manufacturer claims is stronger and thus faster than other similar cables.  The bottom line from my point of view - the cable works as intended.The attractive cable is 6' long, which is longer than most I've received when packaged with various items, but there are others available on Amazon at this length.AmazonBasics USB Cable - 2.0 A Male to Micro B (6 Feet / 1.8 Meters)is one I own and have used for some time with great success.When comparing the two cables; Amazon Basics and FRiEQ, I used one to charge a device and the other to charge the same type of device at the same time.  I noted no difference in the charging speeds when charging two power banks which were used for this informal test.Since both the Amazon Basics and FRiEQ cables are USB 2.0 (not USB 3.0), I really noticed only a price difference (with this one costing more...) and the colored jacketing on the FRiEQ cable to be tangible differences.This cable is well made and I like the fiber braided jacketing. I would recommend it as a good option for those looking for a USB to micro cable at a 6' length, if the price is right.
summary: Comparable performance to Amazon Basics

reviewText: You could probably buy a half-dozen cables for what this one costs. So the obvious question is why would you do that? As with most "digital" cables, I doubt that 95% of the typical users would ever see any difference in out-of-the-box performance of ANY USB cable. The only likely difference would be charging time on high current devices, and even that is a bit of a stretch. Digital signals, even for audio and video, are binary in nature. Either they are 100% correct, or the computer they are attached to yells that they are totally nonfunctional. (Yes, there could be some very slight issues with error rates and retries, but even those are unlikely).So why would anyone buy this cable? Quite simply, durability. Over the years I have learned to save myself a lot of cable headaches by buying decent quality cables. I don't go for monster prices, but I am more than willing to pay a couple bucks for a cable that won't be intermittent after a few insertions. As an aside, any new cable that comes into my house gets a "yank test". One or two good hard tugs so that if it is going to fail, it fails BEFORE it gets hooked up to something. A bit of an inconvenience upfront, but a big timesaver overall.These cables passed that test.=== The Good Stuff ===* They are certainly robust looking. They are thicker than the typical USB cable, perhaps the result of thicker gauge wire, but certainly a result of the cloth jacketing around them. In anyone has ever taken apart an old piece of electrical equipment, these wires will look familiar.* The connectors look to be well attached with stress relief built in. Looking down into the connector, there appears to be gold plating, but no idea how thick it is, which is the true measure of expected insertion count.* The cable I received was striped with blue and yellow. Not really a fan of the color combination, but it is certainly easy to pick out in the maze of white cables on my desk.* This cable is perhaps a little stiffer than the vinyl clad versions, but not enough to make much of a difference.=== The Not-So-Good Stuff ===* They obviously cost more. If your USB application is something that gets plugged in once and never touched or moved again, these might not be the wisest investment.* Cloth cables are less able to slide over each other, meaning they can get themselves knotted up a bit easier than the more slippery vinyl.=== Summary ===I am a fan of more robust cables, even if the cost is higher. I place a value on my time, and spending all afternoon fighting with a loose cable, when I should be watching football, is worth something to me. I definitely believe that these cables are more robust, and therefore less prone to failure, then their cheaper counterparts. Based on your circumstances, your tradeoffs may be different.=== Disclaimer ===I received this cable as an evaluation unit directly from the manufacturer. I have no interest, financial or otherwise, in the manufacturer, its employees, or suppliers. For the record, I plan to buy a few more.
summary: Old School Cable

reviewText: This is a nice usb cable.  It fits my kindle fire and a droid phone. It works great as these two devices charge just fine. I like using this cable because it's easy to know that it goes to the kindle instead of checking out the ends on the other black cables that go to the iphones. The blue and yellow colors are pretty cool too.
summary: looks cool too.

reviewText: NOTE: I was provided this product for free for an unbiased review.Before yesterday, I had never heard of FRiEQ or a cloth jacketed usb cable. I was FLOORED by what I received. 6 foot long, and the jacket is actually a very good design. My wife took to it immediately as it was "Better than other cables because it's pretty."I did a full review of this by testing the charging capabilities, transfer capabilities, and by using various USB outlets. The 2.0 A Male end fit nicely in all outlets, and the Micro B end fit nicely into different mobile devices snuggly (I've had some cables that are either tight or too loose).The transfer speeds were normal for any USB 2.0 to Micro USB cables I've had previously.I gave this item 5 stars because it definitely pleased my wife, and that's hard to do!
summary: Awesome product!

reviewText: The FRiEQ Hi -speed Cloth Jacketed USB 2.0 A Male to Micro B Cable is a six-foot long cable meant to charge one unit from the other, or to transfer data from one unit to another. The USB A Male end fits into your computer, or most charging adapters, and the Male Micro B end fits into a cell phone, or a Kindle, or an iPad, or any other smaller device.  Using this cable would allow you to charge your cell phone or Kindle or iPad or similar devices from your computer, or from a similar adapter that accepts a USB port. The same goes for transferring data from one to the other. I use a Kindle Fire HD, and the cable proved itself to be fine at transferring data rapidly.The advantages of a cloth-covered electrical cable are more than visual. The cloth covering is more durable and less affected by static electrical charges, and more resistant to kinks and tears than cheaper plastic covered wires are. (By the way, a six-foot cable is an optimum length: too short to be in the way, or have a great deal of unused cable to slow down transfer; and just long enough to connect units that are not on the same counter together.Visually, I was pleased with the coloration of my cable: an alternating brown and white pattern was attractive and didn't call attention to itself. It also felt heavier and more substantial than typical cables: the technical details specified it to be 2.0 gauge and gold-plated to boot. Heavier gauge wires mean more data transfer, more quickly, and that's good.Lacking the means and expertise to do so, I was not able to put this through any kind of a data transfer test and/or durability and endurance test. But as best I could see the connectors seemed substantially well put together and looked likely to hold up over time. It seemed as durable as claimed.I used this cable for all sorts of data transfer and charging, and I really felt that this was a substantial improvement over other cables. I was using a rapid charger, and the cable handled the load extremely well.I can't imagine you could find a better cable at the price. It comes with a two-year warranty. The specifications state it is compatible with HTC, Motorola, Sprint, Nokia, LG, Hewlett-Packard, Samsung, Sony Ericsson.One final note:  I was supplied this product free of charge with no other conditions other than my writing a fair and honest review (which this is).
summary: A Durable, Attractive, Speedy Cable at a Great Price

reviewText: FRiEQ Hi-Speed Cloth Jacketed USB 2.0 A Male to Micro B Cable (6 Feet) by LowerPriceUSA is a strong cable that won't fail you.  This is a strong and durable cable that will provide high speed output from device to device transfer.  It will allow you to synchronize your smart phone with your Computer.  You can also use this cable to charge Your Smart Phone or PDA Device Using USB Bus Power.  The cable is made from High quality Nylon Fiber cloth jacket surrounds the cord for increased durability.  The manufacturer offers a 2 Year Warranty as well.  I am glad that I have this product and would definitely recommend it to others.Thank you for reading my review.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation.
summary: FRiEQ Hi-Speed Cloth Jacketed USB 2.0 A Male to Micro B Cable (6 Feet)  is a strong cable that won't fail you

reviewText: There are a few things that I look for in a USB cable: reliability, quality and finally manageability. This FRiEQ USB cable scores top points in all three categories. I received a sample of this reader from the manufacturer - this review is my honest opinion.RELIABILITYTo test this cable, I hooked it up to my USB hard-drive and started a 5GB transfer. Speeds were steady (it's USB 2.0 after all) and there were absolutely no issues with the data transferred. I then took out the batteries from my Logitech Performance MX mouse, plugged in the USB cable and gave it a whirl. During a quick round of Battlefield 3 I could find no lag (this seems like an obvious one, but you would be surprised...)QUALITYThis USB cable is above-average in quality. The connecting parts are not flimsy, and the cable is sturdy overall. Of course the main draw of this cable is the cloth sleeving, and I have to say that I am big fan, not only does it give it a really nice look, but it also contributes to its...MANAGEABILITYThere is something about the cloth sleeving that really makes this a nice cable to work with. Routing it behind my computer and through the various cable routing accessories I have was a dream. I find many USB cables to pain to work with, either refusing to be bent into the shape you want or refusing to lay flat. The FRiEQ cables do not have this issue.OVERALLHighly recommended, this is an inexpensive cable that is reliable and great to look at! I would love to see some more variety on this cable, both in design and in terms of USB connectivity - I would buy USB 3.0 versions in a heartbeat!
summary: Very pleased!

reviewText: This review is from: FRiEQ Hi-Speed Cloth Jacketed USB 2.0 A Male to Micro B Cable (6 Feet) (Wireless Phone Accessory)This is the best cable of its type that I own. It's fast.Jacketed cables are superior because:* Longer cable due to greatly reduced shrinkage and substantial environmental stress crackling resistance* They have UV resistance* They resist heat deformation* Allowance of highly efficient processability* Using the cable is easier due to abrasion and scratch resistanceI like being able to replace cheap cables that came with devices for high quality jacketed cables. This is even better than most jacketed cables because the fit and finish is as good as I've seen. I was provided a sample.
summary: Jacketed cable with good fit and finish

reviewText: How crazy is that?  How can you love a cable?  Well, if I were going to design a cable this would be it.  It's solid and well made, but it's also really great looking.  I love the woven fabric casing on the cable.  It reminds me of old electrical cables from, like, the 1920's or something.I've been using this cable for about six months and it has never failed me and it still looks brand new.
summary: I LOVE THIS CABLE!

reviewText: It's hard to get excited about a USB cable. They're one of those essential but pretty boring accessories that you always have laying around. This cable, however, stands out as being one of the nicest ones I've ever used not only in terms of aesthetics, but also in terms of practicality.The main difference is the cord sheathing. Rather than be plastic like most other cables, it's jacketed in a cloth covering. It looks very nice with a green and black mottled pattern, but more importantly, the cloth makes it far more easier to coil - and STAY coiled - when you stow it in your bag or desk drawer. It also feels nicer than plastic sheathing and appears to be more resistant to wear and tear.One end is a standard USB; the other is a micro USB. Both ends are solidly attached and durable.Although I received this cable at no charge for review purposes, I'm buying a couple more. While they are a bit more expensive than the generic cables, they are far more practical and easy to use. Highly recommend.[Sample provided for review]
summary: The nicest USB cable I've ever used

reviewText: A lowly silly microUSB cable, who would ever imagine that a cable could be cool? Yeah, well FRiEQ has managed to make this retro cool looking cable. Yes the cable works perfectly fine, it doesn't have a weird pin out.The two ends are nice, they are gold plated so they should last a long time and make good electrical contact. The plastic part you hold to plug them in is a shiny hard plastic with a sweet twist. I hate microUSB because I can never tell which way is up or down with the stupid things - I end up putting them in upside down. Well FRiEQ helped solve that problem by printing their name in white on the top of the plug. So now I get to figure out, white name up or down to plug this thing in. And then do it that way all the time.Ah but the plugs and the ends aren't the cool part of this cable. It is the cloth covered brown and tan cables that are super cool. I can't decide if this covering is like electric cords from the 50's, patch cords for phone operators from the million years ago, or Fender guitar amp cables. But it doesn't matter, all three of those things are super retro-cool. The cloth doesn't just look nice; it adds some stiffness to the cable so it stays coiled when you roll it up.The plastic ends on the plugs are just slightly larger than normal size. They should fit on most devices.How the heck could a silly cable get me excited? Well this one did. Those other two color combinations look sweet. Sorry I can only vouch for the brown and tan.I was provided a review sample.
summary: Dang Cool Cable

reviewText: I use so many USB-to-microUSB cables that I've begun to have a few favorites, and I now count this Frieq cable among them.  The cloth jacketed cable (more on the wrap later) doesn't tangle, and it curls nicely into a coil for storage.  It charges everything I need -- Kindle, Bluetooth headset, external batteries -- without problem.  I like the six-foot length, too, for when I want to use a device that I'm in the process of charging, although the length can have its issues when you don't need the length; I leave mine coiled when I'm charging on my desk.  The connections between cable and ends seems sturdy, unlike some of my other cables.  The wrap protects the inner wire by preventing kinks and inhibiting damage from sharp objects.For better or worse, this is not a stealth cable.  Although the bright blue and yellow colors make it easy to find in my bag of cables, the cable is not exactly the kind of low-key look most of us have come to expect with electronic accessories.  In general, Frieq's products tend toward a more edgy look (think of the name), and this cable makes its statement with the colors.  After all, the cable would work just as well with a black fabric wrap.  I happen to like it, but not everyone will.  (Note:  I received a sample for review.)-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Frieq-ing Nice USB-to-microUSB Cable

reviewText: In the overcrowded field of USB cables and other accessories, this cable clearly stands out. It is well made, effective and clearly very stylish. The cloth jacket distinguishes this cable from others that are out there. The jacket may not fit everyone's stylistic taste, but it certainly works for me. The cable is also very sturdy and resists tension and stretching. I've used it to charge a power bank external battery and my Galaxy S3 phone, and it has performed really well with both of those tasks.
summary: Stylish and Durable USB Cable

reviewText: I was provided a FRiEQ Hi-Speed Cloth Jacketed USB 2.0 Cable for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ Quality cable with woven cloth cord.♦ It has a Micro USB plug on one end and a regular USB plug on the other.♦ Reliable charging in any situation.♦ Nice 6 foot length at a reasonable price ($8 at the time of this review).Detailed Review:♦ Look - The product came in plain cardboard box with a sticker on it indicating the product and the color.  There was nothing else inside the box.  The cable is made of a woven cloth, not plastic (think heavy duty round shoelace).  It is very flexible and does not kink.  The plugs on either end are attached very strongly and they make a tight connection when inserted into a USB port.  It has a Micro USB plug on one end and a regular USB plug on the other.  It looks and feels like a high quality cable.♦ Use and Performance - I don't really have a lot of equipment where I do data transfers over Micro USB.  My Micro USB use is exclusively for charging.  To test this cable, I basically tried to charge every different gadget I could think of.  The first thing I did was plug it into my Raspberry Pi Mini Computer for use as a power cord.  It worked perfectly.  Next I plugged in my wife's old cheapie slider phone to charge.  It worked perfectly.  Next I plugged in Power Banks of varying capacities and they all worked perfectly.  Next I charged up a set of Bluetooth speakers.  They charged just fine.  Long story short, everything I tried on this cable worked perfectly.  In addition, the woven cloth cable was very nice and bendable.  It seemed much more sturdy than standard USB cables and the plugs make strong and tight connections in all of the gadgets that I tried.Conclusion:Overall, this was a very nice cable.  It does what it is supposed to do and it works in every charging situation I could think of.  It has a nice long length, but coils up very small.  If you are looking for a quality Micro USB cable at a very reasonable price, give this one a try.
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy!

reviewText: From the moment you take this handsomely jacketed cable out of its box you can tell this is a quality product, Every aspect of the cable and connectors are designed to last - corrosions resistant and very heavy gauge wires (it comes with a two year warranty so you know the manufacturer is sure of its durability and performance.Specs: 6FT USB 2.0 Gold Plated A Male to Micro B Cable that will synchronize your smart phone with your computer and charge your smart phone or PDA device using USB Bus power.  It is compatible with HTC, Motorola, Sprint, Nokia, LG, Hewlett-Packard, Samsung and Sony Ericsson. For the money it would be next to impossible to find a finer male to micro cable. Grady Harp, October 13
summary: Dependable, durable, best cable around

reviewText: FRiEQ Hi-Speed Cloth Jacketed USB 2.0 A Male to Micro B Cable (6 Feet) was given to me to review. reviewText: I break my Male USB connectors. A lot. Honestly, it is king of em' all.As for the speed and connectivity, it is standard and pretty good - nothing too special. The look is also great, it pops with the stripe design and it comes in 3 different colors, pretty easy to find.I absolutely love this connector and will buy a few just to make sure I have at least one handy for each device that I need.HIGHLY HIGHLY recommended if you're looking for a great travel or everyday USB Micro B connector.5/5 ALL THE WAY especially if you want something to abuse....

reviewText: The thicker cable and the connections show, as with small-scale custom makers I've dealt with for quality connections, the attention to detail of the set-up, and the heavier substance to the actual cable. I found no problems with either device.

reviewText: I have a basket full of micro USB to USB cables but this one is now my favorite. Solid construction with a reinforced woven fabric cover. The ends are 'gold' and connect to the cable firmly. The 6 foot length is perfect for replacing a short product cable and adding the length that you want to extend from a wall plug to a table or desk.A terrific cable if you have one that needs replacing or you want added length. reviewText: FRiEQ's cloth jacketed cable is 6' long & very durable. It's available in 3 color choices. I received  the green and black cable to provide an honest review. This USB 2 cable performs perfectly for me & I expect it to last much longer than my other cables.It is now my dedicated Kindle Fire HD cable!  It will be tossed around & abused quite a bit.FRiEQ has so much confidence in their cloth jacketed cable that they warranted it for 2 years!I'll update my review if my opinion changes. reviewText: When I received a review sample from the manufacturer I was pleased to find that it's a full six feet long and not some wimpy pigtail that restricted me from comfortably using my phone while it is charging. That was the first impression and the cable continued to impress.That cloth colored jacket is not to give a cool, retro vibe, but has a valid electrical purpose. Most cables use PVC for the jacket and the dielectric properties will cause some signal distortion when they go through their store/discharge cycle. Granted, the amount of charge a PVC jacket will store and eventually discharge is minute and also will not affect charging. However, many of us use our cables to sync to laptops and other devices and with the cloth jacket this effect is so minimized as to be nominal.I love the heavy duty housing for the connectors and how they manage to be both thin enough to be unobtrusive and substantial enough to assure a long service life. There is even strain reliefs on each end of the cable to minimize wear that can eventually cause diminished transmission at the weak points in any USB cable. Whoever designed this cable thought of everything.Finally, the ends mate perfectly with every device with which I've tried them: on the micro end my Galaxy Note II, a friend's Droid, and a plethora of speakers and ear buds. On the USB end this cable fit my laptop, my Acer netbook and chargers and charger ports. Not too tight like other cables, and always the perfect fit with the slight resistance that indicates a plug built to exacting tolerances.Usually when I receive review samples from manufacturers I test and review, then give the product to less fortunate folks. Not this cable - it's a keeper. If I were to lose it I would immediately purchase another.
summary: Well thought out design and size DOES matter

reviewText: I have gone through several charging cables, whether they be for my kindle, iPhone or other device. I travel a lot and these chargers get heavy use and often get packed/stuffed somewhere. I am always looking for a new cable. And, this one came right one time as my Kindle wall charger went kaput.I have to say, I am very happy with this cable. The cloth jacket makes it a bit more durable. To date, I have not seen any of the wear and tear the cables I use usually exhibit after a similar period of use.*The vendor/manufacturer provided me with this product for free for the purposes of an honest review.
summary: Sturdy, durable, great for heavy use

reviewText: Pretty sturdy cable covered in braided cloth with great detail all throughout.  The plugs have effective grips particularly the micro USB end which has a slight flare, makes it really easy to plug and unplug.  It is six feet long which is perfect in my car for charging my Bluetooth adapter.  Just by holding it in your hands you will know right away that it is tangle proof. Golden tips.Judging by the looks and feel, this is a premium cable with not just a pretty face.A sample of this product was sent to me for review purposes.

reviewText: A distinctive, high-quality cable.  The colorful braided-fabric outer jacket feels durable and snag-free, and it's definitely easy to spot amidst my usual tangle of black (and some white) USB cables.The ends are well-constructed with gold-plated connectors.  They fit into various USB ports on my gear without needing any special wiggle.  Six feet is a decent all-purpose length for my uses (the 3-4 foot cables are often a stretch from a wall-wart charger to a table or desk).  The cable feels solid and seems to work well, though I didn't do any throughput comparison tests.[ I was given this product for purposes of reviewing it. I received no other compensation, and my review is my honest opinion of the product. ]Now they just need to make a USB3 cable with a similar nice nylon jacket!  Recommended.

reviewText: This USB cable is one of the nicest I've seen in awhile. The 6 feet in length is so convenient,  and it makes it less troublesome for multiple charging areas.The cloth jacket makes for one tough cord, and it looks really nice as well. I have several USB chargers for the devices in our home,  and this product works flawlessly with them all.I'd recommend this product to anyone in the market for one. Especially since its affordable and comes with a 2 year  warranty.**I was provided this product to review,  all opinions are my own. **

reviewText: Disclaimer: I received this product from the manufacturer in exchange for an honest reviewWith items like this, I find myself wondering exactly how to approach my review, so I'll just go with simplicity and simply tell you what I know and have experienced.The first thing is the cloth jacketing. It really does look nice and has seemed to increase the durability of the cord. I have been running this cord through the ringer in a professional kitchen over the last week or so. This cord has faced a heavy hand (and more than a few boots and kitchen clogs), and has withstood them all admirably. In fact, I've noticed no real change whatsoever.Everything I've used this cord for (which has been an array of devices, all running to a portable wall charger, has taken the signal well, and seems to have charged a bit more quickly. That may be more about the charger, but either way, the cord has certainly done what it is supposed to do, and has worked well with a variety of phones, a Kindle Fire, several portable chargers (and the wall charger), a 360 Gamepad, and a few other devices.So, for looks, durability, and functionality, I have no problem giving this item 5 stars.
summary: Another non-technical review

reviewText: Disclaimer: Although I received a free evaluation product, my reviews are unbiased and pull no punches.Cables are not generic items and cheaper isn't better in this realm. When I buy a cable, there is one thing I want: durability. I am tired of cables and cabled devices that fail after a few months (or less) of use because they are cheaply made, with fragile terminations or ultra-thin, easily torn, and poorly protected wiring.This Bolsa cable, thankfully, is not one of the above. Going back to an older day, it's cloth covered--- if you're really old enough you'll remember when everything was cloth covered--- this makes the cable less flexible than plastic covered units, but a lot more durable and a lot tougher and long lasting under constant use. The terminations--- the USB at one end and micro-B at the other--- are substantial (meaning not tiny and weak) and look well-designed to resist strain and the wear and tear of plugging/unplugging.Finally, the six-foot length makes the cable useful. No trying to make the cable reach; it's already long enough for any reasonable application. It's a little harder to store than the cheaper cables, but if you roll it into a loop you can stash it away conveniently. Just don't try folding it end-to-end; it's too stiff for that (and the stiffness is a good thing).The manufacturer says it uses heavier wire than most cables. I didn't cut it apart to verify this, but the feel is substantial and I'm sure the statement is true. The manufacturer claims this will give you faster charging and faster data transfer. Well ... maybe in theory (I'm an M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering) ... but in practice, at the transfer levels we're talking about here, the claim is a little exaggerated. The real point, though, is that heavier wire will be more durable and much less likely to break. A broken cable transfers nothing at all.I definitely recommend this cable. It is way, way above average in the one way that you really want: it's not going to fail on you after a period of use and/or at some very inconvenient time like the middle of a road trip. This cable is going into my briefcase as my permanent take-along.
summary: Cables are NOT generic ... this one stands out from the crowd

reviewText: As usual, I didn't pay for this because increasingly I don't pay for anything. I was provided a sample of this in exchange for an honest review. So far so good but if it breaks I'll update the review to keep potential buyers abreast of new developments.I used this solely for my Kindle HD and one thing I notice is that this cable, unlike the one Amazon provided, actually fits the USB port.  The standard issue cable is difficult to get in and once you do it has a tendency to come out.  This cable seems very firmly seated.Also, this is the first cloth jacketed cable I've ever owned and I just generally like the feel.  The cable has more rigidity than plastic or rubber wrapped cables and if you have to put it in a specific position for some reason it actually stays there.  It's also nice that this has some color to it rather than just being an ugly black cable laying about.In summary, entirely satisfactory.  Might consider more cables like this one in the future when a need arises.  Seems a good investment as it feels like it will be around for a while.
summary: The cable I didn't realize anyone manufactured

reviewText: I Love this cloth covered cable.  It is heavy, durable and sturdy. I love that the connections are gold plated to help fight corrosion. Which means leaving it in the Jeep overnight isn't a problem. I didn't think that it would really charge my device faster but it did. I charged a portable cell phone charger with it and it only took two hours as opposed to the normal three hours. I love the length of it also. It is long enough to use without feeling tethered but not so long that it gets tangled. I also used it to sync my pictures off my Droid to my computer. It was faster, just remember to use the high speed jack on the computer. I was very happy with the quality and performance of this product. Now I just need to get one for my Iphone.I received this product for an honest review.
summary: High Quality!

reviewText: Micro USB cables tend to be generic looking, but not this product, which comes in different colors (mine is brown and yellow). This cloth jacketed cable looks sharp and works well to connect my devices that require a micro USB connection.The 6 foot length is handy for me in the car because I like to charge my Nexus 7 2013 while I am reading and not have to worry about the charging cable not being long enough. So this cable has earned a spot in one of the USB ports on my Multi-Use Vehicle Charger with Dual USB Ports and Dual 12 Volt Sockets - Magnadyne.And when not traveling, this cable is attached to a USB hub on my desk so I can easily charge my fleet of different battery packs. I don't need more than a 2 ft reach, but I can easily coil the excess cable out of the way. Despite its 6 ft length, this coils easily--in fact more easily than a standard micro USB cable, which is thinner and therefore doesn't stay put as well.I received this at no cost in exchange for writing a review.
summary: Nice cable

reviewText: Preliminary disclosure: I received a free product to evaluate; however, my reviews are unbiased and I feel no obligation to give a good review.Despite what some people will say, most cables are virtually the same. Sure, different companies put their logo on a given cable and the prices really fluctuate depending upon the brand, but when you get down to it, most cables come from a tiny range of manufacturers that actually build the cables.That said, there are some nice features that may be worth paying extra for. For one thing, the cloth jacketing on this cable from FRiEQ is nice because it really increases the durability of the cable. It's not as flexible as some plastic or rubber coated cables, but it will resist damage more effectively. Of course, you can still break this thing by being careless, but under normal usage, a cloth jacket will make the cable tougher.FRiEQ claims to use heavier wire, which theoretically leads to faster data transfer and quicker charging. Heavier wire should increase durability, but I would be shocked if there was a true noticeable difference. What *would* make a big difference is if this were a USB 3 cable (although, it's not really fair to say this because if you want a USB 3.0 cable, then you need to buy a USB 3.0 cable). I consulted a friend who is an electrical engineer and he was skeptical that there would be any noticeable speed improvement.The speed seemed fine in all my tests. I tried copying large files and batches of small files from a USB 2.0 hard drive to my Mac, and I also tried playing six simultaneous videos off of my hard drive. Granted, there are many factors that go into making this performance possible, but the important fact is that it works. Not an insanely scientific test, but it mimics the real-world situations that I run into every day (playing six simultaneous video files notwithstanding).It is handy to have a six foot USB-to-Micro USB cable around. I've got at least 20 little hard drives sitting around for various backup and storage reasons. They all use micro USB and they all come with tiny one foot cables. Now I have a nice, long cable to keep plugged into the back of my CPU. No more reaching around, trying to feel for where the USB port is, and then knocking stuff over on my desk. Sometimes it's the little things that make life so much easier ....Ultimately, I'm not sure that this cable is better in terms of data transfer rates than any other cable, but I do know that it's a good price, works well, and has the added benefit of a cloth jacket. I recommend it!
summary: A solid value with good durability

reviewText: I have had a  my fair share of power banks over the last few years and this one is right up there are the top. The included manual is a little lacking but after a little bit it was easy enough to figure out.The power bank was fully charged within a few hours and charged my laptop very quickly as well. This will come in very handy during travel as it comes with all the necessary attachments and stylish velvet bag.The only problem I have with this product is how heavy it is which would not make it fun to tote around. Overall though I would recommend it especially for business people who travel a lot.**I was provided a sample of this product to test and review,  all opinions are honest and my own. **
summary: Works like a charm

reviewText: The OXA frosted box is a heavy entry into the external charging market. It easily handles tablets, small notebooks, and it charged my Toshiba laptop. Included is 10 adapters to be able to charge almost any device. This is not the charger you want for just a phone, it's large and heavy to have the power to charge notebooks and tablets, but it would be excellent for travel, rving, vacations, etc.Oxa sent for review
summary: worked as advertised

reviewText: This huge battery can charge my devices all at once. I do wish that it had a mac charger output, but alas, Apple rules everything and makes you buy theirs.The USB charging is quick and GREAT for camping. It's small size can fit in a backpack so you always have battery if you ever get lost!
summary: Great device, small design, lovely output

reviewText: I charged this right out of the box. It appeared to have some power, but I charged it to 100% before testing it. It works really well for charging my Galaxy Note 3 and my iPad, with leftover power for another charge. This is especially good as an extra battery for my laptops. I am impressed by how well built this appears to be. The blue light display lets you know when it is on and what percentage of battery life is left. It didn't heat up while being charged nor while charging.It has a little bit of heft to it, which may be an issue while traveling if you're already maxing out your shoulder-power when hauling your laptop bag. But I do feel the extra life would be worth it for lengthy flights or trips where there is little opportunity to re-juice your essential electronics.I received a sample of this product without any obligation to post a review. This is my honest opinion of this product.
summary: Awesome Power

reviewText: This power from OXA has enough energy (30000mAh capacity) meaning it can charge your iPhone 5 or 4 about 18 times, your Galaxy S3 or S4 about 10 times, your laptops or iPad mini 5 to 6 times without having to be recharged.  This powerbank comes with its own charger, so all you have to do is when the powerbank itself needs to be charged you just have to plug it into a typical wall socket.  I really liked the flat design and bright LED lights to indicate when it was within the charging process.  The system comes with the following items: (1) 30000mAh External Battery, (10) different Laptop Connectors so that you should be covered no matter what type of laptop you have, (5) Phone Connectors, an AC Adapter, (1) DC Power Cable, and a User Manual.  Each unit comes with a 1 year warranty.  I am definitely glad I have this product and would definitely recommend it to others.Thank you for reading my review.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation.
summary: OXA Frosted Box powerbank is great

reviewText: One of the hugely frustrating things about most external batteries is that they will not completely charge my iPad.  This OXA 30000 mAh battery is the only battery I have that can do that, and it still has power left over when it's done.  It can be used to charge a PC (not a Mac -- more on that later) or any one of a number of devices that use either USB cables or one of the ten power jack adapters in the box.  It comes with a power pack with an extra long cord (yeah!), a drawstring pouch, and a USB cable with various adapters (but not Apple's newer lightning connector.)I was a little disappointed that my iPad didn't charge more quickly when connected to the battery, especially since the USB output has 5.1 V output, more than enough for the 2.1 V iPad charging cable.  Still, the power is there, and I can run a depleted iPad off the current supplied by the battery.  The output for the laptop port (non-USB) is 19V.  I imagine that you could run a depleted PC off that kind of output.  Unfortunately, I can't run a MacBook off it because of the specific cables required to charge Apple laptops.  There's no adapter that will work.The OXA Frosted Box feels built to last.  It measures 7.75" x 5" x .5".  It's roughly the dimensions of my Kindle Touch, but, of course, much heavier.  I like that the battery is made to lie flat on a surface, with the output and input ports next to each other in the back.  The only thing it's missing is a second USB port for people who want to charge multiple devices at the same time.If you want lots of stored power for a PC laptop or a tablet, this battery is an excellent choice.  Note:  I received a sample for review.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: A Huge Charge Ready and Waiting

reviewText: I've used and tested many external batteries, and OXA Frosted Box F1 is the largest one I've ever come across, larger even than the 26000 mAh external battery which was the previous record holder for me. As you would expect from such a device, it can hold a LOT of juice. I've tested it with several small and medium electronic devices, which I had previously completely depleted. I was able to fully charge first generation iPad, iPhone 4S, iPhone 5S, Galaxy S3 and iPad Mini - all from a single charged Frosted Box F1 and with plenty of leftover charge. I have not tested it with the latest generation iPad Air, but my guess would be that Frosted Box F1 would be able to fully charge it at least three times.The battery comes with its own power supply and all the cables you'd need in order to connect it to most PC laptops. I've tested it with two of my older laptops - an Acer and an HP models - and it was able to fully charge both of them. As you can expect it charging a biggish laptop can take a while, so this is not a battery that will get you to full charge in an instant. Fortunately it can still be relied upon to power your laptop while its own battery is being charged. I've also discovered Frosted Box F1 takes a really long time to charge - I recommend having it charged overnight.Unfortunately, I have not been able to use this power bank to charge Mac laptops. It doesn't come with cables and connectors that will enable it to connect to a Mac. This is not just the problem with this battery - Apple is notorious for being very proprietary with their accessory connections, and I don't think there is an independent battery manufacturer out there with a product that will work with Macs. There are some hacks that will allow you to get around this restriction (you can buy an Apple power cord or appropriate one from your old charger), but all such tricks require certain level of familiarity with electronics and willingness to improvise.If you have any "regular" PC laptop, chances are that this battery pack will work with it. The battery supports several different voltage outputs (5V and 19V) and comes with a gazillion adapters that can fit pretty much any laptop power input that I've come across.This is a beautifully made external battery. Its metal casing is stylish, elegant and very sturdy. It is, as you would expect it, fairly large and heavy. It weighs 634 grams (not including the power brick) or almost a pound and a half. This may not be an ideal emergency battery that you carry with you everywhere in your messenger bag, but it is a great backup resource to have if you find yourself on a long business trip or vacation. In many respects this is a standout product that is in a class of its own.One last caveat: batteries of this size can get pretty hot. Make sure you are in a well ventilated space and away from all possible flammable hazards. Personally, I would recommend having a small fan somewhere near this battery while it's in use.
summary: Monster Power Bank

reviewText: My family of 4 and I fly quite a bit and the best way to keep the kids busy is to let them use their iPads. In my arsenal, I have a handful of different external batteries that I use to keep us going. Up until now, my 20000mAh was the king-of-the-hill but it's lost its spot at the most powerful. As you already know, this beast has 30000mAh, which is a whopping 33% more.What I love about this one is that although it's big, it's not too thick, so it's more like an iPad Mini or Kindle Fire than most of the other ones I own, which are generally smaller but thicker. This is great because it can just slip into the laptop sleeve on my carry on and not add a big heavy brick to my bag. I also like that I can charge my laptop with this as well, which will unfortunately allow me to work further into my flight, but at least I'll land having more accomplished.All in all, it's a great battery that works well. I've never been able to run it down all the way, which means it's the perfect capacity for my family and me!
summary: The new king of the plane!

reviewText: It keeps my Toshiba KIRA 13.3" laptop going. It works on my ASUS P1801, which is an AiO with a detachable 18.4" monitor that turns into a tablet with a touch of a button.  And this power bank's ability to charge up these two laptops is why I love it. Of course, it will charge our phones, my big Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" and other smaller devices, too, but I can use a smaller battery for those tasks. I'll save this big boy for charging my laptops. And that is exciting news!The charger comes with an adapter to plug into a wall outlet for charging it up. Five blue LED allow you to see the status of the charge in the power bank.  It has two ports, one for smaller devices (5V) and one for laptops (19V).The product also comes with 15 adapter tips to fit the devices and laptops mentioned on the product page.  Check out the bottom picture on the product page, it shows the ten laptop adapters.  My Toshiba KIRA uses "C", and my ASUS uses "G".  The other five adapter tips are the usual ones that work with smaller devices.The battery runs very cool, both charging in and charging out.Batteries are inherently heavy, but this 30,000mAh is smaller and lighter weight (1 pound 6.3 oz.) than I expected. I have noticed with other newer OXA batteries, that the company seems to be making an effort to design lighter-weight batteries. And that is a very good thing.I like the feel of this charger:  It is solidly-made and both sides have a rubbery, anti-slide surface.  It feels good in my hand, and even with it weighing over a pound, I can easily and comfortably hold it in one hand.  It is nicely balanced.Length of cord from wall outlet to adapter is 6 feet.  Length of cord from adapter to charger is five feet. Length of cord from charger to device is 9".OXA has a one year warranty, expandable to a year and a half. They have a decent web site, and they are very willing to help and answer questions. If you run into problems with one of their products or have an issue, they almost bend over backwards to make it right for you.This power bank supersedes my needs!**I received a sample product from OXA.
summary: Huge power and 15 adapter tips

reviewerName: Jeri Zerr "formerly a Road Warrior of the Nth...
reviewText: The ultra high capacity power bank is PERFECT for those high demand electronics - both during summer storm season, winter storm season and all those summer treks to the park, the beach, or the cabin where power is not as readily available.  Having worked in disaster work and been a road warrior, I find devices such as this invaluable.  I keep several USB LED lamps handy - it's a great emergency lighting system when the power goes out! Though I received the OXA external battery for reviewing purposes, it's been working great, I highly recommend!
summary: Use with a USB LED light for emergency lighting - no more fire hazards from candles!

reviewText: This is a beast. 30,000mAh will recharge a cell phone at least 15 times before needing a recharge. But really, it is designed for laptops and other small tablets and netbooks. I've been using it on my son's netbook and it does a great job keeping it charged when it is not plugged in. Five lights let you know how much is left in the powerbank and when you need to recharge it.The OXA Frosted Box comes with just about everything you could need for charging just about any device. Ten different laptop connectors, an AC power cable, 5 phone connectors, a bag for holding the powerbank safely and a DC connector.I will say that it doesn't work for my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet but most powerbanks don't have the right output for that.If you need a lot of power, whether you are traveling or need to keep things going during a power outage, this is a great investment to cover many devices.I was provided a sample to test and review.
summary: Powerhouse of a Powerbank! Works for Our Netbook

reviewText: The 20000 mAh power pack and the 30000 mAh pack are reviewed together here, as I found similar observations apply to both. Where there are important differences, these are noted. I received samples from OXA for review purposes, but as you will see, my reviews are independent and straightforward.The idea of these high capacity power packs is to provide power for a laptop, well in excess of that which would usually be provided by the laptop's battery. The power packs are more or less portable; that is, the whole thing, including charger, will go into a travel bag or briefcase, but it will take up some room and add some weight. If you are on a day trip and leave the charger home, it's much more portable, but still not feather-light; power packs with this much juice has got to have a least some density and weight.Why would you need such a power pack? Wouldn't a spare battery do as well? Probably not; the power pack will give more than double the power of a typical single battery, and will do so without interruption or the need for a shutdown, battery swap, and restart.These battery packs, as noted above, comes with its own charger, and charges from the bottom in about three hours (not one hour as advertised in the little instruction sheet). Other accessories include a large selection of plug tips. It's very likely that one will work with your laptop. You push the tip onto the end of the supplied cord. One end goes into the laptop and the other into the "out" port of the power pack.On the 30000 mAh pack, you press a button to turn on the juice and then set the output voltage. You will want 19 volts for a laptop, but other voltages are available for cameras and other devices. A series of four LEDs shows the state of charge of the pack in a very approximate manner.THe 20000 mAh pack has no voltage selection and no need to press a button to start it. There is a button to press to check the state of charge, as very roughly indicated by a series of four LEDs.Both packs offer 5-volt USB output for charging phones and tablets. OXA says there will be less efficiency using this output, but I didn't find a great difference, though it's fair to say I spent the majority of my time testing with laptops. I don't think you'd buy these packs to charge phones and tablets (though you could); there are better alternatives.The real question is: just how much run time do you get? I struggled with this and ended up doing significant testing with an older Acer laptop, complete with add-on laptop cooler, a combination that draws significant power, much more than with a new and much more efficient unit.The Acer runs for an hour (that's it!) on its 7500 mAh battery. So, if efficiencies and residual power levels are roughly the same for the Acer's battery and for the OXA power packs, the 30000 mAh unit ought to get 4 hours of run time and the 20000 mAh unit ought to get just under three hours. But I didn't get that. I got 3 1/2 hours and 2 1/4 hours, respectively, and these results were quite reproducible over multiple tests (I spent a LOT of time on this).What was wrong? I contacted OXA and told them my results were showing the packs didn't give the expected output. They sent me some stats about efficiency and residuals; the packs are about 66% efficient, which is not impressive (I expected more like 75%), and would "quit" with about 6% of their power remaining (pretty typical).It took me a while and I got the answer, which should have been obvious, but if you buy one of these packs, it's something important for you to take into account.When using these packs, the laptop thinks it is on AC power, not battery power. It will therefore use a power profile that is less conservative, and run times are reduced. I found that this accounted for the discrepancies I was seeing.What it means to you is that you should retune your AC power profile to look more like your battery power profile when you're using these power packs. It will give you 15-20% more run time, maybe a little more depending on your settings.There was one other interesting observation. You should try running with both the internal battery in place and with it removed. Results depend on the laptop; I got different results with different laptops and it was hard to generalize. What this is all about is the power packs having a shutoff feature. They will shut off if there is no load on them for a short period of time. This means that if the laptop battery is in place, and not much is going on, the power pack may shut off and you've got to unplug it and plug it back in again.
