Doing this repeatedly is a hassle.On the other hand, one of my units would not start with only the 20000 mAh pack in place. I had to have the laptop battery to get it started. The power pack kicked in after startup. I have yet to figure this out.Before you take either of these packs on a "critical" outing, I strongly urge you to do your own experimentation at home, so you know what works and what doesn't. You especially should do a measurement of run time, as this is hard to predict. And be sure to take along a laptop battery, just in case.I give these packs four stars (same rating for both). You may think this is an over-rating, and perhaps three and a half is a better estimate of value, but these can be incredibly useful. I get several hours at a coffee shop with my old Acer, without the need to find an outlet; it's made it usable again as something other than a desk-bound unit.I can run my netbook all day long with these packs, a great thing when on a long trip with lots of hours on an airplane, airport layovers, etc.So I'm rating these mostly on utility. But there are the quirks mentioned above. (I could also have mentioned the instruction sheet, which is written in the most unintelligble gibberish English I've ever seen.)Four stars for high utility, one (or more) off for usage issues.
summary: High utility; requires attention to usage quirks

reviewText: I have seen battery packs of 4000 mAh, 8000 mAh. When I saw 10000 I was like Wow, then I saw 17000 mAh. This beast is 30000 mAh. wow wow. Incredible. It is a heavy (as expected)but astounding beautiful. Whatever laptop you have this seem to be future proof.Ok, this one charged my phones, tablets. The very impressive thing is it has adapters for virtually many laptops. I was able to charge HP, Dell and Lenova. This is very good considering you don't have to take chargers for many devices while on vacation trip. take the battery pack, charge it and use for several devices. The way they have pulled it off is very good for laptops. Highly recommended! If you are a business person, traveling to roadshows, tradeshows this is indispensable.  This may not appeal to everyone, but there is a niche audience for sure.I was provided this product in exchange of a fair and honest review.
summary: Ultra King of portable charger. How far can you go!

reviewText: I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this!!! It comes packaged very nice. The package came with a carrying pouch and a nice variety of cords and connectors, including an iPhone connector. It would make the perfect gift for an tech savvy person, it has a connection that fits my laptop too! It is very powerful! We use it every day charging our cell phones on the go! My granddaughter tosses it in her backpack and loves it. The best part is I don't have to charge it every day! I charge it about once every other week when it's just used on the phones and sooner if I charge the laptop. It is my go to charger for everything! It has a USB connection for power out so your possibilities are endless! A must have!  I received this product for a fair and honest review.
summary: A MUST HAVE!

reviewText: I come late to this review, so this will be brief.PROS : Compact, Sturdy and very portable.Comes with many appropriate cables and connectors.3-in-1 charging cable with standard, iPhone 5/5s and micro USB terminals.Magsafe 2 works seamlessly with my MacBook Air 13”.Charges my Samsung Galaxy Note 3 while I use the phone.Five LED lights indicate residual power in battery.Port with DC 14.5 V/3.1A - for larger devices.CONS: Only one USB port (DC 5V/2A) - major deficit.All cables/connectors fit perfectly. The power bank fully charged in 6 hours (thru wall adapter). It charged the Samsung phone in 4 hours and the MacBook in about 8 hours, but I was able to use the Mac while it was charging.A complimentary sample provided for evaluation and review.
summary: Should have more than one USB.

reviewText: The OXA 30000 mAh battery is designed to charge your laptop, tablet or cell phone. For phone charging, let's get something straight - 30000 mAh is probably MASSIVE overkill and you are spending money for something that you can use, but there are less expensive options available. To be clear, an iPhone 5s is something along the lines of a 1500 mAh battery. If you had 100% efficiency in charging (you don't - it's the nature of battery charging of ANY kind, not just OXA), you would have TWENTY recharge cycles for your phone. Let that sink in. For some people, that would be 20 full days of recharges. That's just... insane. If you want this for your phone, I hope it's because you will be doing some crazy travel, say the African Savannah where power isn't readily available. Otherwise this is overkill.Where this battery is NOT overkill, and where you are likely to get a fair amount of use from it, is for laptop or tablet charging. For an iPad Air, which sports an 8000+ mAh battery, you could easily get three full charges from the OXA 30000 mAh behemoth. That's a lot of recharges for a lot of time you can spend on your iPad. The other place this battery comes into its own is charging your laptop. The 30000 mAh is generally less than one full laptop charge, but if you are spending time on a plane or other travel and trying to work, and you routinely go longer than your laptop's battery can handle, you might just find this OXA battery can eke out the last remaining of hours you are spending on the plane with an active and live laptop. It's a life saver in these situations.Included in the box are adapters to plug into your laptop. There is one for Lenovo, HP, Dell, Asus, Acer, Toshiba and Sony. If you have a Samsung laptop, there are adapters available and I believe you could get one at a local Radio Shack if needed. This means you have everything you need in the box (assuming you have one of the supported models) to charge your battery during your travels.If you just want to charge a phone, be sure you have a real need for something of this capacity given the price. If you have the need for charging a laptop or tablet, then this device will likely be within your short list of things to purchase. It works well, charges quickly (well, relatively) and offers a lot of usage.Highly recommended if you have the need.I received a free sample for review purposes from the manufacturer.
summary: Wait--- what? 30000 mAh? SWEET!

reviewText: I am going to keep this review very concise. The capacity is stellar for keeping devices charged, but the quality of the battery is cheap and the inclusion of only 1 usb port is a major downside. If you'd like to watch a full review of this device, please go to Youtube and look up "Technoscoop." I have a video review of this device.
summary: Awesome capacity, cheap quality

reviewText: The OXA Frosted Box F1 30000mAh Ultra-High Capacity Multi-Voltage Safe External Battery is simply awesome. I love that it has a whopping 30,000mAh and provides a lot of power in a relatively small package. This external battery is going to be dedicated to my emergency kit. It is a bit too large and heavy to carry with me all of the time but it is perfect for my home or auto. It is also a good option to use when car camping although if you are camping you should be unplugged from your electronics!There are a lot of options for external battery power that provide a smaller amount of power under 10,000mAh. Currently, there are not a lot of options for 30,000mAh’s of power. This is a market that is rapidly advancing and battery power is constantly improving. This is a product that I highly recommend and I have been very happy with the quality and utility of this external battery.
summary: Simply Awesome

reviewText: OK, I love having the dual port car charger ... since I often charge BOTH my cell phone and my tablet. This is super because it really does charge both at once.BUT, since the ports aren't clearly marked, especially for those who are wrestling with cords in the car, it is a bit less convenient than other dual chargers I have tested.The one thing I have found that works is to keep one of the cords plugged in (even when the charger is unplugged) so that I can quickly know which port to use.It is fast charging, as advertised if the items are plugged in correctly.I received a free sample to use to test this product in order to produce an unbiased review.
summary: Two is nice ...

reviewText: I don't have to tell you why this is terrific: just look at it.Sleek, streamlined, white, beautiful, well appointed, lights up when used...it has one port for fast 2.1 mAh iProduct charging, the other 1.0 mAh for Androids -- charge two different wholly different products at once. Makes perfect sense, then, doesn't it?Yes, but for one thing, and then another. The one? neither port is labeled. So I took off a point.Hey, you say, just look at the picture on this page: the 1.0 is on the top, and the 2.1 is on the bottom. You see? There's even a little indentation right above the 1.0 USB port. So there.But then look at the the box: it's right there...the little indentation is right there, right next to...what? The 2.1 USB port.Minus two points for that.It's a great product, and I love devices like this one. And this one is ALMOST perfect. But NukePak has got to get their own directions right.NOTE: I was supplied this product free of charge with no other conditions other than my writing a fair and honest review -- which this is.
summary: Just A Little Teensy Flaw...

reviewText: This is a dual port charger.  I have an iPod and a Samsung Galaxy Note 3 that I charge simultaneously with this.  It works fine.  Another reviewer mentioned the ports not being labeled, but they both work for both devices, so it wasn't an issue for me.  Perhaps if I was trying to charge a tablet or a larger device it would matter.Is feels solid and well worth the money.  I've paid far more for similar devices while traveling at places like Walgreens.  Good value and works well so far.I was supplied a sample for honest trial and review.  I update my reviews frequently if circumstances change, so if this blows up or breaks, I will update.  So far so goodSample provided for unbiased review..
summary: Works Perfectly

reviewText: This USB car charger has two ports on it. The first port is for charging higher powered devices like an iPad and it charges at 2.1 Amps. The second port is for charging lower powered devices like a cell phone and it charges at a much lower 1.0 Amps. The design of it is simple and it's all white. It fits snugly into the cigarette lighter adapter in my Mitsubishi Lancer OZ Rally Edition and it doesn't wiggle around. My only complaint is that it doesn't light up on the front to indicate its on and make it easier to plug in when it's dark. Oher than that It works well to charge our iPad, iPad Mini and cell phone. The price is very fair so if you are looking to same some money and just need a basic dual USB charger then this may be a good choice for you.Sample provided for review.
summary: Simple but works well, I wish the front illuminated though.

reviewText: Certainly no bells and whistles with this one! No where on the charger does it list which port is which. (It does show you on the box and one of the pictures on the product page. If you have your magnifying glass out you can see the tiny indented oval on the front face of the charger, and the 2.1A is closest to that oval.)It seems to be nicely constructed and it is sturdy. There are no seams on the sides to make it rickety, and it slides in and out of your car port just right.But at the time I wrote this review, this type of car charger was available from many distributors. So, my advice is to check prices before purchasing this one. Also, at the time I wrote this review, this company has a defunct website and I can't find a phone number for them. So, you can't contact them except through Amazon, and if you have to return this for any reason, the cost will be your obligation.*I received a sample product from NukePak.
summary: Nothing special with this car charger

reviewText: I haven't had any trouble with this dual charger. It's simple and works fine in my cigarette lighter. As others have mentioned, it would be nice if the ports were labeled, but a thin Sharpie can take care of that, too. Fair price for a convenient item.
summary: Works fine

reviewerName: Jeri Zerr "formerly a Road Warrior of the Nth...
reviewText: Great charger - just be aware that only 1 port is a higher 2.1 amp port (apple, android, galaxy, etc).  If you need to charge a lower power device (such as a gps or an mp3 player and a higher current device, this charger is perfect.  Just be aware if you have a bustling family of Galaxy and Apple devices, you'll want to keep looking for a different dual charger with both ports as higher power (such as TopG if NukePak doesn't offer one...) A quality device, I recommend.  This charger was supplied for reviewing purposes, I've tested and reviewed MANY chargers in various configurations, this is indeed a quality reliable charger (again, just one high power port, though.)  Since it is marketed as such, no stars were deducted.  (Yes, I realize they failed to indicate which port is the higher power port - I just marked it with a sharpie, no big deal...)
summary: Great charger - just be aware that only 1 port is a higher 2.1 amp port (apple, android, galaxy, etc)

reviewText: In the car, I'm always in need of charging something while I'm out and about or on the road for business.  TheNukePak Dual Port USB Car chargeris a truly affordable option for me to keep in the bag for the unexpected while on the road.Designed in solid white plastic, this unit is quite durable and features plenty of power for the typical user.  The unit features 2 USB charging ports; one rated at 1Amp and one rated at 2.1amp.  The dulled blue indication light is great for insuring the unit is plugged in right, but not too bright as to distract during night time driving.  The unit is very compact making it perfect for cars that have the cigarette lighter located in inconvenient spots.To test this charger, I used the USB cable that came with my phone and the one that came with my Nexus 7 and was charging immediately.Overall, this is a fantastic budget charger and is great for anyone that needs to keep a spare in your bag for any random occasion.  Just yesterday, I found the charger extremely useful in a rental car I had that did not have any USB charging ports.  That made this product a true life saver.[Sample Provided For Review]
summary: Affordable, Extremely Useful, Nice Charger...

reviewText: This does the job.  It is capable but lacking.  It is NOT marked.  You do not know which is the high powered and low powered....The box shows that the higher powered plug is at the top which does have a little nob above it...so you know which way is up.....But how many of us will remember that when driving down the road and the kids in the backseat want to know which one is which.That is pretty big issue.I received a free sample.
summary: Works but is missing iD marks on the plugs.

reviewText: Disclaimer: I received this item in exchange for an honest review.The whole lock and load thing is probably a play on words. It definitely doesnt lock in place. It will come loose from your car lighter port fairly easily. That is actually the only complaint I have regarding this item though. It really does charge very quickly, and after two months, still works great. You could do far worse than this charger without a doubt.
summary: Good charger

reviewText: When you're traveling on longer car trips, your electronic devices may loose power before the end of your trip.  This little charger can fix the problem.  I can charge my iPad and my juice box at the same time, so I don't miss a word of my audible book.  It would be helpful to have labeled the ports on the charger itself.
summary: Adequate Charger for Use in Your Car

reviewText: I've been using similar charger's in my vehicles for four or five years, so I was happy to accept one of these from NukePak to test and review.This one does the job as good as any in its class, but the trend for this type of charger is now two ports both putting out at least 2 amps. Today's newest smart phones, like my Galaxy Note 2 and Asus T100 tablet, ship with a 2 amp charger and require 2 amps to charge them effectively, so with this charger you'd have issues if you needed to charge two high energy devices at once. You can still use the 1.2 amp port to charge a high consumption device, it will just charge more slowly, or simply maintain the current charge.Why did I only rate this charger three stars is it lives up to its advertising? The answer can be summed up with a single word... VALUE. Yes, this charger does indeed perform as promised, but similar products, one of which I just reviewed yesterday, are being sold for 20% to 50% less than this charger. For many people this charger will do just fine, but if you are looking to charge two high energy devices at a time, you might want to look at a charger that puts out at least 2 amps to each port. With the competing product I recently reviewed, I felt it deserved 3.5 stars, but rounded the score up to four because I felt the product was competitively priced for what it offered. The NukePak charger puts out 1/2 amp less, and at the time of this review is priced nearly 50% higher. I would be inconsistent for me to rate this charger as high as the less expensive, better performing products, therefore... three stars it is.
summary: Performs as Advertised, but...

reviewText: The NukePak Dual USB 3.1 amp car charger is a must have for those who want to be able to charge 2 devices simultaneously in a car.The charger has 2 USB ports. One of the USB ports has a max output of 1 amp, and the other has a max output of 2.1 amps, both at 5 volts. This is a powerful car charger. I really like this car charger and I plan to use a lot so I don’t have to fight for a car outlet with my family.  This car charger is surprisingly small for the high amount of power it gives.Overall this is a great car charger. I recommend this to people who need to charge a tablet and a smartphone in the car.I took off 1 star because the USB ports are not labeled with their amp specification. On the amazon listing, in one of the pictures, it tells you which USB port has the 2.1 amp and the 1 amp specification.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation, for free to keep, and I promised that my review is fair and honest.
summary: Great car charge that works but has one minor issue

reviewText: I have a number of this type of device, and all seem to have their own niche. This unit is fairly compact and lightweight, so you can't expect too much capacity from it (battery life is directly related to weight, at least across common technologies).=== The Good Stuff ===* The unit has a nice form-factor. It is about 3 3/4" long, and a little less than 1" on the other two sides. It weighs about 2.5 ounces, which is pretty light. As a result it can sit in your pocket all day without you really noticing it.* It connected to my iPhone4 without any issues, and provided charged it from 20% to 80%. Not the greatest battery performance, but quite good considering the size and weight. It is certainly enough to help get me through a long day of phone use.  The unit recharges in a couple hours.=== The Not-So-Good Stuff ===* The instruction (not the greatest) indicate that a red LED will glow when charging, and a blue LED will glow when discharging. Mine did not do that. Instead the red LED glowed while charging, the blue LED lit when fully charged but still connected to the power source, and no lights at all when discharging.* There is no way to know how charged the unit is.* The unit ships with an assortment of power cords and adapters. Based on previous experience, I just toss these things and make sure to have a dedicated cable. Otherwise I am plagued by poor and intermittent connections.* There is an attached ring to connect the charger to a keyring. Frankly it is larger and heavier than anything I want attached to my keys.=== Summary ===For what it is, it works great. It will never be my primary external battery, but instead works great as something to carry on a daily basis if I need a little extra juice to get me through a long day. Time will tell how reliable it is.=== Disclaimer ===I received this unit as an evaluation sample direct from the manufacturer. I have no interest, financial or otherwise, in the manufacturer or any of its principals.
summary: A handly little charger

reviewText: This review is from: Bolkin S-100 2600mah High Capacity Portable Rechargeable USB Power Bank External Battery Charger Pack for Iphones, Ipods, Ipads, Samsung, Htc, Blackberry, Sony, Nokia, Motorola, Mp3, Mp4, Lg and More (black) (Wireless Phone Accessory)I think one has to compare this external battery to others in the same market segment. When I make that comparison, the battery is 5-star.It would be nice to have a power indicator so we can always check on how charged it is at the moment. But for the price, one cannot expect that.There is enough power for size and weight - 2600 mAh is great for charging phones. It's about 160% of the power stored by my iPhone 5. With this battery and my phone's battery, I have more than enough power for my use. Sample provided for review.
summary: inexpensive keychain power bank

reviewText: Overall, this is a decent powerbank. I like the compact, square shape – very easy to take along on the road without feeling weighed down. It’s only about 4 inches tall and weighs only 2.4 ounces, so it’s easy to toss in a bag without a problem.The case is all plastic but seems well put together, with tight seams. The input and output ports are well-anchored. It also has a lanyard of sorts (a small cord with a key ring at the end) which can aid in keeping this attached to something in a bag. But, if you don’t like it, it can be easily snipped off.This offers only the basic functions. There’s no power level indicator – just one USB output port (1A) and one micro USB input port. Both are located at the top end. There’s an indicator light to show it is charging a device. The light goes out when the device is charged or the powerbank is empty. There’s also an indicator that comes on when you plug the powerbank in to charge it, and it also goes out when the powerbank is full.Given the small capacity (2600mAh) this is strictly for low-powered devices, such as mp3 players, phones, etc. It’s not at all suitable for a tablet. Even with small devices, 2600mAh doesn't go far – basically one full recharge and the powerbank will be empty.But, when you’re low on power something like this can be very handy. The small size makes it easy to take along so you’ll have it when needed. It’s not feature-rich, but for the price, it’s a great value.[Sample provide for review]
summary: Nice compact shape for a basic powerbank

reviewText: The Bolkin 2600 mAh power bank is a good simple battery. It is a very basic battery with no bells and whistles (that can be a good thing).This is the lipstick case size battery, square and about the length of two lipstick cases. The body is plastic giving it a kind of funky rugged look. The body will take a lot of abuse.There is a permanently attached key ring dongle thing. If you love that kind of thing, it serves its purpose. It wouldn't be too hard to cut the nylon cord that attaches it to the battery.The battery charges through a microUSB port. There is no AC adapter included in the box. You can use either the AC adapter packaged with most phone or a USB port on a computer to charge this (it will charge easily with a standard USB port at only 1Amp, the high powered 2Amp ports are not required). When charging the unit glows with a bright red LED. Once charged the lamp changes to green.There is no indication of how much charge remains in the battery. When charging a device there are no lights to show it is working, or that the battery still has any charge remaining. I said this is a simple bare bones battery. That lack of pilot light is a bit annoying.The battery only outputs 1Amp. It does a great job charging my iPhone 4s at the standard rate (there is one faster rate that this battery doesn't achieve). It will only trickle charge an iPad Air. You know in a way, there isn't really enough energy in this battery to make much of a difference with an iPad, so that isn't really a big deal. Just be aware, it doesn't do much for high powered devices, this is designed for cell phones.The box includes a universal charging set. These are strange little cables and kind of hard to explain easily. There is a main USB cable that has a female jack on one end. There are four different tips in the bag. Plugging in the tip determines what can be charged. The kit includes a 30 pin Apple connector, a microUSB, miniUSB, and Nokia micro tip (not as prevalent in phones now).A fully charged battery gave me about 3/4 of a full charge on my iPhone 4s. That is roughly what I would expect from a battery this size. The battery roughly doubles the power of an iPhone.This is a decent, inexpensive battery. I wish it had a lamp to tell me it is still charging. Charge level would also be a nice addition.I was provided a review sample.
summary: Decent

reviewText: There are many external batteries out there that can help you recharge your portable devices, and which one you choose will depend on your particular needs. This 2600 mAh external battery/charger is one of the smallest I’ve seen, both in terms of physical size as well as charge capacity. The battery looks similar in shape and size to an elongated lighter. The battery is charged from an USB port, and it comes with its own micro USB cable with several different charging attachments. You can charge it by plugging it into a spare USB outlet on your PC (slow), or by using one of the wall USB outlets from your cell phone or a similar device.I’ve been able to use this battery to fully charge a Samsung Galaxy S3 phone and iPhone 4S. It took me a few hours to charge both of those devices. In order to charge an iPhone I had to use my own iPhone cable – Apple is very restrictive when it comes to allowing third party manufacturers using their proprietary designs.Since this battery is very small it is ideally suited for an emergency backup charging. It can easily fit in your pocket along with your smartphone, although I wish that it came with a small bag into which to put it.This is neither a particularly stylishly designed nor remarkably well built external battery. It has a very utilitarian look and fee to it. It gets the job done, at least for now. I have not tested it long enough to see how durable it is in the long run, and if I discover anything noteworthy about that I'll update my review.Decent small external charger, especially for the price.
summary: Convenient Portable Power Bank

reviewText: This is a very fine portable small power bank - it is small so it doesn't pretend to promise the power of Bolkin's other larger power banks. This handsomely designed, comfortable to carry key chain like bank comes with charging cable that has removable ends for both mini and micro USB connectors. It has safety protection mechanisms that prevent overload, overcharge, overcurrent and short circuiting. Once charged it has more than enough energy to re-charge a cell phone on the go: Input is 5V 1A, output is USB 5V 1A -2.1A. The other nice aspect is that it has multiple uses depending on the system you hae - iPhone 5/5s/5, 4/4s, 3GS most Samsung galaxy series and HTC series and tablets as well. Inexpensive, comfortable to carry, and dependable. Grady Harp, March 14
summary: Keeps its promises

reviewerName: Joel Avrunin "Electrical Engineer who loves S...
reviewText: This little battery pack is inexpensive, but that is about the limit of its use.  I was able to charge it up and use it to get some charge on my iPhone 5S, but it ran out of charge quickly before my phone was fully charged.  In terms of user feedback, there is only a red LED to indicate it is charging.  I got no visual indication when it was done charging, and no visual indication when I plugged in my phone to see it was operating.  Most competing batteries have color changing LED's to led you know when they have started charging, when they are done charging, and when they are in use.  I was surprised at the lack of any sort of feedback as to battery status.Overall, just not a great solution despite the low cost and small size.Note: I received this as a free sample for the purposes of review.
summary: Just not one of the better products on the market

reviewText: For the price, this is a great emergency power bank. It is not meant to be one that will completely charge a dead phone or charge it numerous times. It is only 2600mAh which will take my Samsung S4 from a low battery to fully charged very quickly.It does get a little warm but not necessarily too hot that I am concerned using it.It is small and rubbery with a 'key chain' end in case you need to keep it handy at all times. The only problem with that is that the power cable is not built in so you would need to keep that somewhere handy too. It does come with a USB to open ended cable with plugs for micro USB, mini USB, Apple 30 pin (old style) and Nokia which provides a way to charge it through any USB wall charger or your computer as if you flip it, it will charge your device if they use one of those plugs (or you can use your own USB cable). A power bank this size will not charge a table all the way through either and may have trouble with devices that require more output. I can't charge my Samsung Galaxy 10.1 tablet but most power banks can't touch that. But I can charge my Kindle and smartphone.For the price, this is a great one to keep in a glovebox or pocketbook.I was provided a unit for testing and review.
summary: Small and Great for Quick Charge-Ups

reviewText: The review sample that I received by no means a capacity winner as far as power banks go, but it's not priced as one. What it is, though, is a cool keychain that can give your phone or other device a boost if it runs out of juice. And it's small enough to work as a keychain as long as you are the sort who wants one that has a relatively large block of plastic attached. Some folks do like chains like that because it makes it easy to find misplaced keys.At 2600mAh, this will more than double the use time of an Apple iPhone 5S, which comes in at 1560mAh, but will probably not add more than two extra hours to an Apple iPad 2's internal 6930mAh battery. Still, it may add just enough to make a difference for a critical task.I love the charging cable that has removable ends and includes mini and micro USB ends, plus an Apple 30 pin connector for all but Apple's newest phones. It also provides a mini barrel connector end for other devices (I have a speaker that is powered through a barrel connector that this one fits perfectly.)There are a few areas that would make this battery pack a better deal. First, is the lanyard with the keyring. It looks and feels strong, and was intelligently designed to allow the battery to hang clear of a steering column when your car key is in use. I do think it could be a little beefier though. Another improvement I would love to see is a built-in flashlight like some battery packs have. That would increase the functionality significantly because many folks already have a small light attached to their keychains.As long as you know up front that this is more of an emergency charge than a primary battery pack this is a bargain. Think of it as being like that funny spare tire most cars have - not designed for anything but short term emergencies. Plus it's a cool keychain.
summary: Excellent concept and functional

reviewText: If you are searching for portability in a power bank, this is it. It's so small and lightweight, like a lighter. The design is simple, very basic -- just power in a bar. It comes with a key ring attached and a charging cable with four adapters (micro USB, mini USB, 30-pin connector, and one that looks like possibly Nokia). There's no user guide.I love this power bank because it can give my iPhone 4S a full charge. I'd like the maker to include power indicator lights, though. I can't tell how much charge is remaining. Red or blue lights up when I plug it in, but that's not entirely useful. Four or five lights and a button to check is better. Other than that, it's perfect.This product was provided for review by Bolkin.
summary: Almost Perfect

reviewText: This was beautifully designed. Very well made. I was able to charge- Samsung  Galaxy S4- iPhone 4- MP3 player- A GPS device- a 7" tabletNo issues. It is a life saver on long trips/camping.  I was provided this product in exchange of a fair and honest review.
summary: Excellent Product!

reviewText: I got an opportunity to try out the Bolkin S-100 2600mAh external battery back, and overall it works OK. I used it to recharge my iPhone 5S, and it supplied the charging power I expected. The charging time was slightly more than 1% per minute, and I was able to get from 25% left on my phone to 100% in approximately 75 minutes.The downside with these types of chargers (no charge remaining indicator) is that you never know quite how much power is left. I was hoping to get some indication of how much was gone by how long it took to recharge it. Unfortunately, the indicator lights don't seem to work the way they're described on the package. The red indicator light should turn off once the unit is fully charged. In my case, it was still on after being plugged in overnight. There's also supposed to be a blue indicator when it's charging a device, and it's supposed to turn off when the device is fully charged. I never got the blue light (it was red), and it stayed on even though my device was at 100%.I would definitely use the Bolkin as an "around the house" charger (if I wanted to refresh the charge on my phone without being tied to an outlet). I'm not sure I'd want to trust it for more than one full charge without plugging it back in overnight, but it's OK for a basic charger.Disclosure:Obtained From: ManufacturerPayment: Free
summary: The indicator lights were completely off based on the instructions...

reviewText: I was asked to review this external power bank, and since have a lot of experience with these types of devices, I figured I'd accept.I'll get right to the meat of my issue with this charger... the product description leads one to believe that this will put out 2.1 amps and it definitely doesn't do that. Inflated performance claims are one of my big pet peeves with sellers. As a shopper, I simply want the facts. The seller states "USB Output: 5V 1A ~ 2.1A". I am assuming that means the power bank will put out 2.1 amps if needed, and that just isn't true. I do not have an ammeter, but I do have my OEM supplied AC charger that I'm sure does put out 2 amps, and it charges my Galaxy Note 2 considerably faster than this power bank does.If the manufacturer correctly advertised this as a 1 amp charger, I'd be rating it four or five stars, because it does a good job for what it really is. This is great for your iPod or older cell phone, both of which would do just fine with one amp output. I just can't rate this thing more than three stars when it is being over promised.
summary: Better than Some of the Competition, but not Perfect

reviewText: If you want a small, very portable power bank, you might want to consider the Bolkin S-100.  It only has a single USB output, but with a maximum output of 2 amps, and a capacity of 2600mAh, the unit has enough juice to handle many basic recharging tasks, including devices that require higher output like the iPad, or Kindle Fire.The device has a hard plastic cover that provides a decent level of protection.  A micro-USB cord is included.  A light comes on when the device is being recharged, and switches to blue when it is fully charged.  No light is visible when the S100 is recharging another device.  There is supposedly internal circuitry that prevents overcharging, but you will need to check your device, to verify when it is fully charged.A sample was provided for evaluation.  While I have several power banks, I carry the Bolkin S-100 with me to work each day, because it is small, lightweight, and has enough capacity to handle basic recharging tasks, like my cell phone or MP3 player.  It is very affordable, available in several colors, and is an excellent option if you are looking for something small.
summary: a compact and very portable, backup power source...

reviewText: This is a really nice heavy duty looking charger. All the ports are universal so you don't have to worry about sticking anything into the wrong port.  I've used them all at once - charging 2 phones, 2 headsets, and 1 mouse.  It worked like a charm.  What I really liked most about it was that it isn't one of those charges that hang right on the wall.  It's got about a 5 foot length cord that you can plug into the wall and be able to move the charger where you please. I honestly can't think of anything negative.  It's a really good charger and I would carry this around when I travel.  I liked the fact that the LED light isn't too bright.  I remember I had this Bolse 4 port charger that had such a bright LED light that it was more like a night light then a charger LOL but this one is a much improved charger.  Great great improvement.  I received this charger for a honest review.
summary: This is a great heavy duty charger.

reviewText: With the large number of power hungry devices that most of have now, finding a place to charge them all can be a problem. The Bolse 5-port USB charger is a solution to your charging problems.It comes with a 5 foot cable that is plenty long for you to place it where you need it. A small slit glows yellow on the front of the unit to let you know that it is ready to go. There is one port on the left and right sides (1A each) and three (2A) ports on the bottom. The manual says 2 are for iPad/iPhone and the last one is for Samsung. They are universal, except the manual says the Samsung port will not charge an iPad, which after testing found was accurate.The white color will go well with your Apple devices. There are rubber feet on the bottom that will help hold it in place if you are plugging in multiple devices. I like the fact that there are ports on three sides although your preferences may vary. This product does its job very well! Thanks LowerPriceUSA for providing me  this awesome wall charger.Review sample.
summary: iPads and Kindles and Phones, oh my!

reviewText: Since everything in the world now seems to need a USB charging port, USB chargers have become ubiquitous in my house. I have tested a number of them, and this is actually one of my favorites.=== The Good Stuff ===* It is well designed electrically. I was able to charge my iPad, two iPhones, and two other USB devices at the same time, and the charging times seemed about the same as with each items "native" charger. I didn't actually measure the output currents of the ports, but they seem sufficient for the devices they claim to support.* The unit seems to be finished well. The outside is a nice, smooth plastic, There is a yellow/orange LED that lights up the oval shaped indicator on the top of the device. This light comes on whenever the unit is plugged in. The glow of the LED also shines through the USB ports, which make them easy to find in low-light conditions.* The power supply is built into the unit, meaning no big wall-wart to plug into the wall, it is a standard plug. The unit comes with a five-foot power cord, which is about right. It accepts 110/220 volts, so it should travel well.* While the unit is a fairly good size, and has some heft to it, it is relatively flat, so it packs well into a suitcase of computer bag. But the cord does take up as much room as the charger.=== The Not-So-Good Stuff ===* There is no practical way of shutting off the light. Even if you tape over the yellow oval, light still leaks through the USB ports. This is problematic, at least for me, in bedrooms and hotel rooms. I like to sleep in the dark.* My application for this unit is to affix it to my entertainment rack so that it can't move or fall. For that application, I would have preferred the 5 ports to be on one side of the unit rather than 3, and it would have been nice to have some way of mounting it (screw holes). For just sitting on the table, the unit's arrangement works fine.=== Summary ===The unit seems well designed and made, and so far has performed as advertised. Electrically and mechanically, it works well. Based on my own specific use, the ports could have been designed a bit different, and I am not a fan of yet another LED trying to light up my life. If none of those things bother you too much, you will be happy with this charging unit.Disclaimer: I received this unit as an evaluation sample direct from the company. I have no interest, financial or otherwise, in the company or its principals.
summary: Works Great, But Make Sure It Is What You Want

reviewText: This is such a nice charger. We have two iphones, an ipad and a kindle fire and now only one charger!  The cord is long enough to reach behind the table.  Our devices charge up just as quickly as with the other chargers.  I really like the one cord more than anything. The charger looks nice too.  If you want to dump all the chargers for just one, this is the one to get.
summary: Takes the place of several chargers.

reviewText: I absolutely love this charger. Using this daily, I can say that I've went from using 3-4 outlets to charge our devices to 1! The longer cord makes this even better. I couldn't ask for a better in house charger for all my devices.
summary: A brilliant yet simple device

reviewText: There’s an old story about a man considered the best traveling salesman in the world, and because of this people in a very rural town used to lock their doors when he came by. One day a baker slipped and left his door open, and when the salesman appeared he feared the worst. But the salesman said he had nothing to sell; since he was about to travel through nearby hills he only asked if he could drop off a grandfather clock and come back for it on his return a week later. Well, the townsman thought and thought and could think of no way this could hurt him, as he had no need for a clock. So he accepted the timepiece as long as the salesman promised to pick up the clock upon his return.Well, during the first few days the baker cared little for the clock, taking notice of it only when it chimed the hour. But soon he found that he began to predict the when the clock would chime, and before long he grew to expect it, and finally he counted on it. By the time the fourteen days was over he was timing when the sun would rise, then how long his bread baked, when he went to bed and when he woke up.  As you can guess, when the time came for salesman to return the townsman practically begged him to sell the clock to him—of course, he could no longer do without it.I bring up this story because, well, my experience with the Bolse went a bit like this. When it arrived I thought it a bit extraneous: after all, don’t all the electric devices I own – my smartphone, my Kindle Fire, and so on – come with their own chargers. Wasn’t a thing like this a little unnecessary?This might be true; the devices do have their own chargers. But setting them is only one inconvenient aspect of them…finding a socket that will accommodate several at a time, and at the right setting, is not always an easy task. Not to mention KEEPING all of those chargers around, and accessible, and using them for the correct device, and so on…In the case of the Bolse 40W (5V/8A) 5-port USB wall/desktop charger, the task is made simpler. Just plug this into a wall socket and five ports await. And they’re labeled, so there is no problem with identification… two are labeled universal; two are labeled iPad and the final one is Samsung (the final three are also universal).And they’re fast. Every time I hooked up my smartphone, or any other cellphone, or my Kindle, or any other device, the charging went extremely quickly. I was very impressed, and believe that the charging went every bit as rapidly as it did with the device’s original charger. And it charges several devices at the same time, just as fast.Another thing I liked about the Bolse is the simple and elegant design: it’s a sleek, compact device in basic white that fits anywhere – the floor, desktop, on a counter… It has a five-foot cord, so one doesn’t have to worry if the socket is just a little too far away. And while it’s charging it has a bright yellow light that is easy to identify.Anyway, it’s a great little device that looks and works great. And, like I said, now that I’ve gotten used to it I don’t know how I ever did without it.NOTE: One final note: I was supplied this product free of charge with no other conditions other than my writing a fair and honest review -- which this is.
summary: A Great Little Device You Won't Want To Do Without

reviewText: The Bolse Newpower 5-port USB charger by LowerPriceUSA is a great one-stop shop charger.  I put the charger in the center of my kitchen island to act as a central hub to charge all my devices.  I was able to charge my phone, my Kindle Fire HD, and my wife's phone with no problems.  Before installing this device I could have 3 or 4 regular cell phone chargers sitting on top of my island.  This device eliminates all of them down to one.  The charger is exactly how it is pictured and the charger's rubber feet allow it sit firmly onto my kitchen island's surface.  I especially like the fact that the charger has over-voltage protection for my devices.  The cord is a little long (5ft) for my island but I was able to tie it up nicely with a rubber band.  I am enjoying this product and would definitely recommend it to others.Thank you for reading my review.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation.
summary: Bolse NewPower 5-Port USB charger is great for all devices!

reviewText: Single-piece chargers that plug into the wall are great for traveling since they are so compact, but a pain to use in the house since it requires clear access to an outlet. This charger is far more practical to use on a desk or table top since it has a separate cord that plugs into the wall, allowing you to place the charger on a desk.The charger itself has a lot more heft than I expected. It feels very solidly made, and the plastic case is nicely molded with good seams. It’s pretty compact, measuring about 4 inches long and 2.75 inches wide. It has 4 non-slip feet on the base that kept it firmly in place even when I pulled a bit on cables that were attached.It has five USB outlets. Two are positioned on the sides (one per side) and are labeled as “universal.” Those are rated as 1A. The remaining three are on the end. Two are labeled as “iPad”; the third is “Samsung.” Those are rated as 2A.The power cord plugs into the end opposite the USB plugs, and has a molded end that’s easy to grip and insert. The 5 foot cord  is very stout and well-made. I had no problems positioning the charger on my desktop and plugging it into a power strip that was on the floor.While this is more bulky than a travel-style charger, the ability to position it on my desk makes it a lot easier to use. The build quality is solid, and it works well with everything I plugged into it to charge (a variety of tablets, some power banks, and a phone). Zero complaints, and I would highly recommend this.[Sample provided for review]
summary: Practical design that works well; solid construction

reviewText: With the many electronic devices a lot of us own, finding a spot to charge all of them at once can be a challenge, and that's where this Bolse charger comes in.  It plugs into the wall or surge protector with an approximately 5' long power cord and sits on a desk, table, nightstand, or any other flat surface.  It has small rubber bumpers on the bottom, both to keep it in place and to protect wood surfaces.  Two of the USB ports are powerful enough to charge an iPad while the other three are designated Universal (2) and Samsung (1).I've tried various charging stations with mixed results, and my favorites are strategically placed throughout the house.  This Bolse one has such a small footprint that it's great for tight places.  You can easily toss it inside a drawer when not in use.  And it frees up USB port space on your computer for charging when you don't need to sync or otherwise connect the device to your computer. Its downside is that the cables sprout out from its sides, much the way they would when plugged into a USB hub.  If you want something more organized, explore charging stations with places to hold devices.I like this charger for its small footprint, ease of storing, and power.  Note:  I received a sample for review.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Fantastic Compact Charging Station

reviewText: USB charging has become somewhat of a standard in recent years. Almost all portable electronic devices can now be charged using a standard USB outlet. The only difference being the size of the output current, with higher currents usually more appropriate for tablets, while the lower ones are used primarily with smartphones and other low-power accessories (headphones, e-readers, smart pens, etc.) However, with the proliferation of USB-powered devices, we now face a problem of cable clutter. This is where multiple USB port come in handy. They are compact, occupy just a single wall outlet, and allow for charging of multiple devices.Bolse 5-port USB charger is compact and versatile enough to be a great travel companion. You can just pack this one charger for a trip, and will have enough outlets to help you charge all of your compact electronic devices. It is an ideal USB charger for charging all of your small electronic devices without the help of computers or stand-alone individual chargers. It can also be used in an office environment where access to the wall outlets is not very convenient - just a single power cord enables you to put this small charger on your desk where it will be accessible by all of your other devices.I have used this charger with my iPhone, Galaxy S3 phone, iPad, Kindle, and my Bluetooth headphones. It charged all of those devices quickly and efficiently.This charger looks and feels very solid. It will probably sustain many years of repeated use. It is also fairly elegant, and it will not be out of place even in the more aesthetically demanding office environments.
summary: Compact, Elegant, Efficiant

reviewText: I was provided an Bolse NewPower 40W (5V/8A) 5-Port USB Wall/Desktop Charger for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ Extremely powerful and fast.♦ Has five ports (2 iPad, 1 Android and 2 Universal) for a huge total output of 8 Amps.♦ I was able to charge 1 Pad 2, 2 iPad Minis, 1 iPhone 5 and a Bluetooth speaker all at the same time at high speeds.♦ iPad 2 and iPad Mini charged in 4 out of 5 ports (not Android port) and iPhone 5 charged in all ports.♦ Nice desktop design that doesn't have you attached to the wall due to a good length cord.♦ Perfect solution for a multi device home.Detailed Review:♦ Look - The product came in plain cardboard box with only a small sticker on it, no wasted packaging here. Inside the box was the charger, a power cord and an instruction manual.  The charger has a clean desktop design with a decent length cord and little rubber feed on the bottom.  It has a total of 5 Ports and 8 Amps of charging power.  It has 2 iPad Ports, 1 Android Port, and 2 Universal Ports.  In addition, all ports are marked as "Universal".  It appears to have a nice build quality.♦ Use and Performance - I plugged it into a wall outlet and did some basic testing to see how the Bolse wall charger handles charging multiple devices.I plugged in five devices as follows:- An iPad 2 in an iPad port.- An iPad Mini in an iPad port.- An iPad Mini in a Universal port.- An iPhone 5 in a Universal port.- A Bluetooth speaker in the Android/Universal port.I checked the charging speed at found after 10 minutes the iPhone added 11% charge, the iPad 2 added 3% charge, the iPad Mini in the iPad Port added 4% charge and the iPad Mini in the Universal port added 3% charge.  I checked it again after another 10 minutes and the iPhone added 10% charge, the iPad 2 added 3% charge, the iPad Mini in the iPad Port added 4% charge and the iPad Mini in the Universal port added 3% charge.  Very fast and very consistent results for so many devices charging at the same time.  Speeds were right on average for chargers that I have tested.  The one interesting thing was that the iPad Mini in the iPad port charged faster than the one in the Universal port.  Not a surprise, just something to note.  I also tested the iPhone and it charged in all ports and I tested both the iPad 2 and the iPad Minis and they charged in all ports except the Android port.  The charger did get warm during testing, but nothing out of the ordinary and stayed cool when plugged in but not charging.Conclusion:Overall, this is a great charger that offers a lot of flexibility, power and speed for charging many devices at once.  This has a good balance between power and size with great design.  It is really a great solution if you have a ton of power hungry devices like I do with three iPads to keep charged.  If you are in the market for a high powered multi-port charger, this one is a great choice.  Highly Recommended!
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy!

reviewText: While there are many fine chargers on the market (Bolse makes others, too) this is the first that has the ability to be a charge source for 5 USB ports and is run on AC 1110/220 V wall plug. Is it compact, handsomely designed, and has its own 5 ft power cord that is detachable and accepts extension cords for use away from the wall source of power – perfect for shared office spaces.Plug and play simplicity of ‘installation’, you immediately can power up 5 separate devices for a total of 5V/8A: two of the 5 orts are for iPads and iPhones, one port is for Samsung, and there are two universal Apple/ Amdroid ports – more charging power and outlets than most people have. And a big plus is that while using all of the ports the charge is at full speed for each for iPad, iPhone, Kndle, External Battery, Bluetooth speaker and headset and receiver, etc. As usual Bolse builds in protection form over charging and short circuit problems, so safety for your devices  (and your desktop and wall plug) is assured.How such a small device can perform so many things is due to Bolse’s trademark engineering. Highly Recommended.  Grady Harp, November 2013
summary: A FIRST – a desktop charger that is heavy duty in a very compact space

reviewText: Bolse Multi port charger works for me. I used this product to charge my Samsung Galaxy s4 my wife’s and our two tablets.Pros:Comes with a long cable so you can set it up where you like.It charges from all 5 ports quite well.Allows for 5 devices from one wall socket instead of just 1 (huge benefit in my household)Is not an eye sore of a device.Prongs fold into product making it easier to store / travel without breaking anything.Ports face 3 different directions allowing you to charge while still separating your products.Cons:The charge light is a bit bright but that seams common in these products.Disclaimer: I received a product in return for an honest review.Suggested products to go with this device:FRiEQ Hi-Speed Cloth Jacketed USB 2.0 A Male to Micro B Cable (6 Feet)The multiple colors will help keep your cords organized.Overall a good solid product that will get the job done in a fast and reliable way. 3 stars without tape 4 with simple cheep fix.
summary: A good charger

reviewText: This is a great charger for people with lots of devices. You can 5 charge all your devices at once - and at full speed. It comes with a long power cord which makes it easy to plug into a wall outlet and still be able to set the charger on a table or dresser and plug all of your devices in to it. The charger is light and small - easy to carry in your purse or briefcase when traveling. A great buy!
summary: Great Charger

reviewText: I have a lot of devices clogging up my tech station and I needed a very slim and nice way of having all of my devices charged.The Bolse 5 charger works great with my Ipad, Iphone, and my work Samsung phone really well and I've never had issues with charging items quickly for on the go.The length of the cord is perfect and the charger itself is quite durable and very portable and is easily wrapped up.The look of the product is very clean and simple with the packaging done in a green friendly and frustration free box.For the price, the Bolse 5 port charger is a great addition to my work station for a clean and powerful device!Highly recommended! 5/5
summary: Compact and attractive and great connected power!

reviewerName: Joel Avrunin "Electrical Engineer who loves S...
reviewText: My desk is covered in devices that require USB chargers, and my power strips have gotten overloaded with single outlet USB bricks for charging all of those devices.  This Bolse charger solves that problem, providing 5 USB outlets in a single device.  I have tried other similar products from travel charges to other 5-output chargers, but the Bolse is probably one of the best ones I have tried.First, the total device can supply 40W of power.  What does that mean to you?  If you have another charger with the same number of ports, it means that it might not be able to use all 5 ports at once.  An iPad requires 10W to charge at regular speed and an iPhone requires 5W.  I have seen other devices with 20W-30W of charging power, which means that despite having two iPad ports, they can't really charge two iPads and an iPhone.  With the Bolse, you get two ports for an iPad, one for a Samsung, and two universal ports.  I was able to charge my iPad 4, iPad 3, iPhone 5S, Plantronics Headset, and Garmin watch simultaneously on this one charger, an impressive feat.The charger itself sits flat on your desk on 4 rubber feet, and plugs into the wall with a normal power cord (thank you!).  The cord is secured with a velcro strap.  Another great feature is that the Bolse charger has an LED indicator of power - many competing products do not.  Even better, the LED indicator is not so bright it lights up a room (it is a deep amber), so you can even keep this in a bedroom.The charger is a little bulky for travel, but Bolse does make a nice 4-port 20W travel charger you should consider as well.My only complaint (and why the 4 stars instead of 5) is that the two universal ports are on opposite sides of the charger.  This means that fully loaded, I have cables sticking out of 3 of 4 edges of the charger, making it a bit unwieldy.  I would far preferred to have all 5 ports on one edge so I could save space on my desk.  Looking at it now, it looks a bit kludgy to have cables coming in from 3 directions.That being said, it's an excellent charger and recommended.Note: The manufacturer sent me a complimentary sample of this device with no promise of a positive review.
summary: Tons of power to charge all of your USB devices including iPads and iPhones - love the amber indicator light as well

reviewText: I have reviewed Bolse products recently and find them reliable, well-designed, and affordable. This 5-port USB charger for wall or desktop as the title promises can charge iPhone, tablet, Droid, Samsung, or other such devices at once. While two- or three-port chargers are common, it's not as common to find one that by its "brick" nature can either plug in a wall or sit on a desk.It's quite small, and therefore will not weigh down a wall charger as much as you might expect. Still, if multiple USB connections are in use, I'd recommend setting it down on a surface to ease any possible strain on the socket. Three ports are at the top and one each per other side, so this spreads out the plugs. It can get a bit crowded at the three-port end, but all can fit. A small light (a feature I like about Bolse products for its inconspicuous nature) shows the unit is in use.While I thought this would be much larger, its portability makes it a carry-on if necessary for a case or purse. It is useful for a desktop as a central charger. I was provided a sample to test and I can report this as with other Bolse products fills the need it's meant to do.
summary: Sensibly designed, and a tiny powerhouse

reviewText: TheBolse NewPower 40W (5V/8A) 5-Port USB Wall/Desktop chargeris a great product for putting USB charging ports in a more convenient place, where you recharge your devices the most.  I setup my charger by my bed since I often recharge my tablet, phone, and kindle e-reader there as I like to have them in reach, even while charging.Designed in white, the charger has five (5) total charging USB ports; three (3) on the front and one on both the left and right sides. The five foot power cable is really great for reaching those hard to reach and often inconvenient wall outlets.  This allows me to place the USB ports in a more convenient to reach place, rather than right on the outlet.  A yellow indication light appears when the charger is plugged in letting you know it is functioning properly.  Since I'm using this charger near my bed, it's nice to see the light is dulled and not bright like typical blue lights on other chargers.I have tested this charger over the weekend with the earlier mentioned devices and found it work as well as my original device chargers.  The unit is designed with an 8A total capacity between the five ports ensuring your devices get optimal charging speeds, no matter how many ports are in use at the same time.  All five ports are universal allowing for a greater variety of use, and the three ports on the front are designed with circuitry to accommodate finicky Apple and Samsung devices.Overall, I do like theBolse NewPower 40W (5V/8A) 5-Port USB Wall/Desktop chargerbecause it lives up to the expectations it sets, and it is very accommodating for placement of the hub.  Perfect for those who have too many gadgets to charge at one time, I find the charger to be a good value and a great investment.Disclosure: I want you to know I received a sample product from the manufacturer for the purposes of providing this review. However, a review in exchange for the review sample was not promised. The views and opinions expressed in this review are my own, and in no way represent the views or opinions of the manufacturer or vendor.
summary: So Many Useful Applications...

reviewText: This solidly constructed charger is a huge plus in our house. I am often charging a smartphone, Kindle Fire and Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet at the same time. I like to have them all together. The problem is with the Samsung tablet which charges differently that the other products. Most wall chargers don't work for the Samsung but this one does. It has a nice long cord and the charger has rubber feet to help it stay in place on a desk or table. That's a really nice touch since other chargers tend to slide around. It has an LED light to let you know it is plugged in and working. Five ports (some on the sides) allow for charging a lot of devices at once.I'm not sure if it slows down if all devices are charging but it is fine for me doing three items at once.A very nice feel with rounded corners. Well thought out product design.
summary: Solid Construction, Charges a Large Variety of Electronics

reviewText: I was able to charge my iPod 4G, & 3 Kindle Fire HDs at the same time.  None of the devices' charging time was noticeably affected or slowed down. However, my LG Cosmos prepaid phone would not charge. I used the phone's USB cable & tried all the ports on the Bolse NewPower 40W charger.The Bolse NewPower 40W 5V/8A charger will charge most devices that use a 5V DC power source between 1 & 2 amps. It has a 5' detachable power cord & 5 USB charging ports.  3 ports are rated 2A (2 of these ports support Universal & Apple devices using the old legacy, the other port supports Samsung & Universal), & 2 Universal ports are rated 1A for a total of 8 Amps output at 5V.This charger is equipped with over-voltage, over-current, & short-circuit protection.Set it up on a table, desk, etc. and use it as a charging station. It has a nice weight to it, and grips on the underside so it won't slip around on your desk.If my opinion changes, I will update my review. Right now this is a 5 star product.Sample provided for honest, unbiased review.12 month warranty
summary: Charge 5 devices at once...three devices at 2 Amps & two devices at 1 Amp for a total of 8 Amps of power at 5 Volts

reviewText: The Bolse NewPower 5-Port USB charger looks sleek with the shiny white finish and yellow LED indicator light.  It has four little rubbery button feet underneath so it doesn't scratch my desk.  It has a removable power plug and NO wall wart.Best of all, it has five USB ports with a total of  8 A that can be used simultaneously.  There are two 1 A ports and three 2 A ports.  Two of the 2 A ports are optimized for Apple devices like iPad and one is optimized for Samsung devices, though of course all are universal and can be used with pretty much any other brand, as well.I am using this on the bookshelf as my charging station.  Rather than replacing the Belkin SurgePlus travel surge protector that has three two-prong electrical outlets and two USB ports, I plugged this right into it to maximize USB ports.A sample was provided for testing and unbiased review.  This is an excellent USB charger and I definitely recommend it.  It even ships in frustration-free and mostly recyclable packaging.
summary: Five USB ports to charge everything all at once

reviewText: With five feet of cord, you’ll have no problem placing this charger anywhere on your computer station. When plugged in, a one-inch long yellow power light glows. On the sides are two Universal USB ports, while on the end are two iPad (Universal) and a Samsung (Universal) charge ports.The best way to power devices is though an AC 110-220V input (50-60HZ) in a wall socket as opposed to a USB port on a computer. The output to the devices is 5V and 1A for the Universal port; 5V and 2A for the iPad and Samsung ports.You can charge all five devices at FULL charge without fear of a short-circuit, overcharging or overheating. Not all multi-port chargers can do all of this.I was able to charge my iPhone 4S, my iPad 2, my iPhone 3, a small external battery (3000mAh) and another external battery (11000mAh) with no worries. This is due to the fact that all five ports are Universal. Some of the devices obviously charge fully faster than others simply due to battery requirements.For the price and the convenience and assurances, this charger is one of the better ones on the market. Plus, I really like the clean white appearance. Product supplied for a review.
summary: Universal Charger - No Limits!

reviewText: I received a review sample from the manufacturer and took my time testing it.It indeed does exactly what the technical specs claim: charge five devices at once with an impressive 8mA of simultaneous output. This was tested with a Samsung Galaxy Note II at 50 percent, an iPad and iPhone 4S at about the same levels, and two brand new 2400mAh battery packs out of the box. The Note II and both Apple devices fully charged in about the same time it would have taken using their OEM chargers, and the battery packs were fully charged in less than an hour.I've reviews more than my share of multi-port chargers and have never seen results like this. More importantly the body of the unit did not get hot (or even moderately warm.) While I loved the fact that this will fully charge five devices at once, I especially like the fact that the design includes electrical protection for over voltage and current, and short circuits.Another thing I appreciate is all of the ports are marked for specific brands, but also can double as universal ports. I have other multi-port chargers that have Apple specific ports, but it was never clear that I could use them for other devices. On this one every port will work with practically any 1A or 2A device except the Samsung port that will not work with an iPad.There are two 1A ports, plus three 2A ports (two for iPads and iPhones or universal and one for Samsung tablets).Physically this is a large unit at over 4.5x2.5 and 1.18 inches. However, it's not a wall wart because it has a heavy-duty cable that is just a tad short of five feet long. For me the size does not detract from this charger because it's easy to tuck out of the way. Plus in the open it's actually attractive.The main thing, though, is this will simultaneously charge five devices at full charging rate as claimed. And it does so with some built-in electrical protections that many other chargers that I have tested lack. If you have a household full of smart phones and tablets, or other devices like bluetooth speakers or battery packs this is well worth the price and will do the job like no other charger that I have tested.
summary: Fiaally - a charger that has no technical shortcomings

reviewText: The Bolse USB charger is useful for when the wall outlet is in an inconvenient location for a USB wall charger.  This charger has a power cord that allows the charger to be placed away from the outlet.  It has overheat, overcharge, and overcurrent protection, which is great, since I am a plug it and forget about it kind of gal.Five USB ports are included:- 2 universal ports: 1 amp each- 2 iPad/universal ports: 2 amps each (made especially for Apple devices)- 1 Samsung/universal port: 2 amps (made especially for Samsung devices)I am partial to the 2 amp ports for the faster charging speed and I use them interchangeably.  However, if you encounter problems charging your iPad or Samsung device, try plugging them into the ports made especially for that device and see if that helps.I have charged my power banks, my dash cam, tablet, Bluetooth speaker, and iPhone without any problems.  It’s been very handy, and I don’t have to reach down to the tangle of cables near my outlet to use it.This product was provided for review by LowerPriceUSA.
summary: Convenient Alternative to Wall Chargers

reviewText: A compact design for desktop USB charging. Using it is much easier than stooping/crawling to use the wall-plugged USB chargers in my home office.The yellow power-on LED is a welcome change from the glaring blue LEDs that seem popular on recent small electronics. The flat design is nice (I set my laptop mouse on top of it when I'm not using it). It also comes with a flat power cord. The power supply is internal (no wall-wart, and a normal plug into the wall) and the 100-240V input means a simple pin-change would be enough to use this unit during your global travels.According to a power meter, I was able to draw a respectable 5-6W simultaneously from each of the Samsung and Universal ports (tested against a Samsung Galaxy Nexus and a Motorola Moto G), though the amount tapers off as the battery fills up. Although some amount of AC power is lost in conversion to DC 5V, those numbers make the 40W specification seem achievable if you're charging tablets on the 2A ports.My only real complaint is having ports on 3 sides of the unit (and power cord on the 4th side). If both universal ports were on one side (instead of one on each side) I'd be able to push the charger back against the the wall. Since I don't usually use more than 3 ports at a time, this isn't a big deal, but still non-optimal.Other thoughts: The Samsung/Apple ports aren't as well explained as I'd like-- they're designed to provide higher power flow when they detect certain types of devices on the basis of a particular USB signal. A per-port LED showing that the device is drawing power would be nice, even nicer would be some indication that it was drawing power at the "higher" setting.[ I was given this product to review. I received no compensation, and this review is my honest opinion. ]Recommended for desktop USB charging.
summary: nice desktop charger

reviewText: This is not my first multi port wall/desk charger, however I really like this one in comparison.The other one that i recieved was a Sabrent 6 port charger. While i enjoyed the Sabrent it is much bigger and bulkier than this model. With this model the ports are all well labeled with the device type so there is no guessing, with three slots on the bottom and one on each size.The bottom is equiped with slip resistant padding so it doesnt slid all over the place. I find the device to be aestheticly pleasing in comparison to the huge black one i got previously. Even my kids think it looks cool ( and you know how hard kids can be to please).The overall size and weight is very excellent, nice and compact without compromising its overall effectiveness.I was able to charge my SG4 my husbands SG3 my step sons iphone 4 my kindle and my camera all at the same time. The charge times were relativly quick considering everything that was plugged in.This would make a great gift for the multiple device friends and family in your life. I know that this will come in handy at my house for the holidays when everyone is over. Since no one will have to battle over outlets during gatherings it will also leave them open for crockpots, warmers and the like.**I was sent a sample of this product to review, all opinons are honest and my own.**
summary: Bolse is better

reviewText: Disclaimer: I received this product in exchange for an honest review.Really, this is a simple device that excels at functionality. It has a little sensor that lights up when it is powered (represented by the yellow line on the product page pic. All five ports are clearly labelled and the instruction manual is quite thorough on how to use this device if you werent certain. It is the same size as a cell phone with the exception of it being much thicker (about an inch). The power cord is long enough to plug in on the wall and still be able to keep this on you desk. All in all, a very nice product that I have no problem giving a high recommendation for. Glad to have tested this one out.
summary: Simple functionality in a USB charger.

reviewerName: Richard C. Drew "Anaal Nathra/Uthe vas Bethod...
reviewText: I prefer the Bolse 4 port charger - it's about half the size of this version. The only differences are the addition of an additional high power port, and a cord. If you have multiple devices that draw more amps when charging, then you'll need more high power ports. This five port charger has three higher amperage ports (in the front) and two standard - one on each side. So if you have three tablets, this is an ideal choice.It's not much smaller than five compact chargers, but since it's on the end of a six foot cord it only takes up one outlet. The configuration of three in front and one per side is a little strange. That's why four stars. Because of this it takes up more room than it should. I'd prefer five along one side.There's an LED stripe on top so you know when it has power.
summary: A bit large, but has three high power ports plus two standard

reviewText: This is a versatile and powerful charger contained in a high-impact white plastic case. It's a little large to put in a briefcase but it certainly would go in a suitcase. The charger is supplied with a power cord which runs from the unit to a wall socket.A total of 8 amps of output is provided, with some 2A and some 1A sockets. All sockets are standard USB, and can be used "universally" for most devices. Special positions are provided for the unique needs of some Apple and some Samsung products.The charger works as you would expect, and provides a reasonably fast charge to most devices test. I say "reasonably fast" and I mean this to be a positive statement, because there is such a thing as "too fast" which might reduce battery life or even damage your device. In any case, if you're going to charge multiple devices at once you probably are doing it overnight, so there is no problem at all.Of course, you don't need to charge everything at the same time. If you keep this unit at home, you can leave the USB cables more or less permanently attached and just plug devices in when you want. This provides a convenience factor that you don't appreciate until you try it. You might have to unplug if you're going on a trip, or you might just get some extra cables. I have done this sort of thing and it makes life much simpler.So why 4 stars, not 5? One reason: the power cord doesn't fit well into the unit, and if you don't push it in really tight, or disturb the unit very much, it will pop out, and that's quite annoying if your devices suddenly aren't charging. I advise plugging it in, leaving it, and checking to make sure the charging light is on (you can't miss it) when in use.Overall an excellent unit with many practical uses.
summary: Practical and useful; your charging worries are over

reviewText: As usual I received this product in exchange for an honest review.  Despite that kindness my candid opinions appear below.To the positive side, this unit is powerful and reasonably compact.  Aesthetically, white isn't my personal first choice, but the yellow LED is a vast improvement over other models with the blue LED that basically act as a nightlight.  Also, like many other chargers, this one offers multiple output ratings in different ports but in this case they're clearly labeled as to purpose rather than just giving an amperage rating.  Finally, the introduction of the longer cord makes this an easier to use device since it's not tethered 12 inches off the ground directly in an outlet.The only negative I can really give is that having the ports facing in three different directions makes this a bit unwieldy if multiple ports are in use.  If they were all on one side or on the top then this would be less of a spider.
summary: Powerful and compact unit that's very easy to use.

reviewText: I want to say right up front, I love this wall charger. I used it on vacation this week. It was nice not to have to carry multiple chargers!  I charged two Iphones, a flip phone and two external battery packs every night. It worked great and it was so convenient. It is about the size of an Iphone just thicker. It is an asset for anyone with multiple devices, and I give it my highest recommendation.I received this product for an honest review.
summary: Great Product!

reviewText: The Bolse NewPower 40W is a very powerful charging station with a number of nice features. It has an array of USB ports with different power ratings, which allows you to charge whatever you happen to have most effectively. I tried charging an iPad, an iPod, an iPhone, and a backup battery charger, all at once. The Bolse seemed to handle all of this easily. The unit is well built and heavy enough to stay relatively stable on your desk, even with various cables exerting pressure on it from different directions.The downside is that the unit is fairly big. This is probably out of necessity, but it IS bigger than some similar multi-charging stations, even from Bolse. I have a different model that plugs directly into the wall and while it doesn't charge quite as quickly and only includes four USB ports, it's substantially smaller. This unit is going to be overkill for many people.
