I don't know many people that need to simultaneously charge five things at once, but if you find yourself in this situation frequently, then the Bolse is a great option.I could see this coming in handy when traveling, if say, you have multiple people staying in a single hotel room. There never seem to be enough outlets in hotel rooms and often times you want to charge things like laptops, camera batteries, phones, iPads, and whatever else. This sort of multi-charging station will ameliorate the situation.Overall, this is a well-built unit at a good price. Recommended.Disclosure: I received a unit for review. I did not allow this to sway my opinion or color my review.
summary: Well-built and a good value

reviewText: This comes in a nice heavy plastic box and is handsome enough to give as a gift--whether to yourself or someone else.One black charger, one white one, you get 2 outputs for charging a device with a USB cable and you even get a non-slip dash mat so that you can lay your phone down on your dash and have it stay there even during a rough turn.Charges quickly, looks nice, lets you know whose charger is whose and who borrowed one for couples..or just let you switch up colors as suits your fancy.Some devices stop working on an Apple but this one has worked for months.With so many devices now being charged with a usb cord, it not only gives you one, but you get a spare as well.Charger provided by VoltRanger
summary: Nice enough for a gift, car charger duo

reviewText: One of the best features of this product is a non-slip pad that can be placed on the dashboard of your vehicle and where your phone will be securely held and always in sight. This will eliminate the phone getting lost by sliding into a crevice or reaching blindly for it when you need it. The pad is also easily removed from the dash, leaving no residue, even after a few hot, sunny days.The adaptor has two USB plug-ins, so you can charge two devices simultaneously. The charger cord is longer than that of other such cords, giving the user added flexibility regarding the location of the devices being charged. It takes the charger a little less than two hours to deliver a full charge, which is average. One potential drawback is that the adapter is small, which increases the probability that it will get lost. However, on the good side it also means that there are more places where it can be tucked away.Overall, this is an excellent product.Review prepared with the assistance of Caytie Ribble
summary: A great product for the person on the go

reviewText: This is a six-foot long lightning cord for the latest generation of Apple products at essentially the same price Apple charges. So why bother with the VoltRanger? Three bonuses are the reason; a nice cigarette car adapter that can charge 3Amps of devices at once - one 2Amp port and a 1 Amp port. The 2Amp port is full Apple compliant, so it charges an iPad at the high charge rate. The second 1Amp port will charge phones or an iPad at the medium rate. The second bonus I like a lot - the plastic box this comes in is a great storage container. I love it when a company makes packaging that is not just recyclable, but can be repurposed and used for something else. The box is a thick clear plastic box with a snap lid that will hold all kinds of odds and ends. The third bonus is a nice convenience, a gooey sticky mat to hold your phone in the car.The lightning cable is exactly that, Apple certified so it works in either direction (some off brand lightning cables only work in one orientation). It transfers data and charging exactly like the genuine article. The insulation is about the same as the standard Apple variety. The cable ends have nice strain relief on them. Hey, bottom line, this is a high quality cable that will last a long time.The 12V adapter is plastic and fits standard 12V outlets in a car. It worked fine in slightly deeper sockets and the ultra short ones in Mercedes. The sticky mat is a strange little beast. If your car has a flat area around the console, this is a great thing to lay out and then toss your phone on it. It does prevent my phone from flying around and is easy to remove my phone when it's time to leave.All in all, what a great box of stuff. A standard lightning cable, a sticky mat, a USB jack for my car, and an odds and ends plastic storage box, all for the same price Apple charges for a cable all alone.I was provided a review sample.
summary: Car City

reviewText: And the new devices just keep pouring in. The nice thing (I should say, one f the nice things) about this car charger kit is that is will not be obsolete as Apple continues to put out new variations of its superb products. That alone makes it worth the investment.The VoltRanger has dual USB charging ports that enable you to charge both phone and tablet simultaneously at the fastest speed possible. There are several built in safety factors: it has smart circuitry, sensing when your device is fully charged to prevent overcharging, and the design of the socket portion is discreet and low profile, making the appearance in your car unnoticeable. Another of the many fine features is the 5 foot MFI Apple certified lightning to USB cable - people in the back seat can comfortably tend to their own devices. And the kit includes a non-slip silicon mat for resting the cell phone on the dash while charging it.The kit includes a 2-port car charger - one port provides a 2.1A output the other port provides 1A of output. Both ports can be used at the same time so you could charge an iPad and an iPhone. In all this is a very smart looking, reliable, Apple certified device that is well worth the price. Grady Harp, July 14
summary: This VoltRanger by Minzos Lightning cable is Apple MFI certified

reviewText: The Apple accessory kit includes a dual port car charger, a 60" USB-Lightning cable, and a non-slip dashboard mat. Note that the included cable has a Lightning plug for newer Apple products. The charger can also be used for charging older Apple products that use the 30-pin plug, but you'll need to supply your own cable.The dual USB ports of the car charger are marked "2.1A Tablet" and "1.0A Phone." With the overcharge protection that's built into the chargers, it should be safe to plug any phone or tablet in either port. I tested the charger during a drive with a friend who has an iPhone 5, with his phone plugged into the 2.1A port. I also plugged in my Android phone, using the 1.0A port. Both phones were turned on, and both were being recharged during the drive.The kit also includes a non-slip dashboard mat as a bonus item. The mat has an adhesive back that sticks to a vehicle's dashboard so you can place a cellphone on top to keep it handy. If you decide to move the mat, it's easy enough to remove - just peel it off (it doesn't damage the dashboard). The top surface of the mat is pebbled and has enough tackiness that a phone isn't too likely to slip off, but even with my phone in a protective case, I'm not sure if I would feel comfortable enough to risk having it bounce off on a rough road. You may feel differently, however.This is a nice accessory kit for owners of newer Apple devices that use the Lightning cable, but with the proper user-supplied cables, the charger could be used with any phone or tablet.A product sample was provided to me by the seller for an honest, unbiased review.
summary: An essential accessory for Apple mobile devices

reviewerName: Joel Avrunin "Electrical Engineer who loves S...
reviewText: In this package from VoltRanger, you are getting both a USB car charger with 2 ports (one for 2.1A to power an iPad and the other with 1A to power an iPhone).  You also get a USB to Lightning cable and a silicone pad to keep your iPhone from sliding off of your dashboard.  The USB car charger itself works nicely.  It is a small charger that barely sticks out of the cigarette lighter.  Of course, you can easily get triple-USB outlets now, but for a dual-USB, it is nice.So why 1-star?  The lightning cable it came with did not work.  Despite having a slightly larger plastic shroud on the lightning connector, it would mate with my iPhone 5S in the AmazonBasics case.  However, my phone kept flashing charging-not charging-charging-not charging. I tried the same cable with another car charger, with the Apple OEM charger, and with my iPad.  Sure enough - it's the cable.  I likely got a defective one, but I have ordered so many 3rd party cables in the past that worked, I'd advise not risking this set.Note: I received a free sample for the purposes of review.
summary: Nice car charger set, but the lightning cable didn't work

reviewText: This is a fantastic car charger kit. It includes a dual port USB car adapter, an 8 pin cable, and a nonslip dash mat. This all has been very useful to me. The dual port allows me to charge 2 things at once, which  is very useful. The cable in the kit is a plus so you don't have to carry around one cord. You can instead leave this cord in the car. The dash mat is also very nice because with other car kits I've gotten, I had nowhere to stick my phone. This allowed me to glance at my phone instead of leaving it in my side pocket. The kit has been very useful to me and I would definitely get it for a friend. Sample was provided for review purposes.
summary: Excellent!

reviewText: The VoltRanger kit is a clever combination of an automobile charging adapter, a nice long USB to lightning cable, and a grippy dashboard mat.The charger fits easily into the socket and stays in place.  It has an LED indicator for power plus smart circuitry to prevent problems like overheating and shorts and stops charging when a device's battery is full.  It has two USB ports that can be used simultaneously with a total possible output of 3.1 A, one at 1.0 A, and one at 2.1 A.  Use the one that best suits a particular electronic device's needs.  The 2.1 A port is optimized for faster charging of tablets and other higher-powered electronics.  It is compatible with standard USB A cables to charge almost any device.The USB to lightning cable functions perfectly for power and data transmission both.  It is a nominally a generous 60 in. (1.5 m) long, with strain relievers at both ends.  It can be used with wall chargers and other USB ports as well as with the included auto adapter.The grippy mat is not just practical, but lots of fun.  It keeps an iPhone or an iPad mini in place on the dash or center console even when braking or zipping around corners.My only criticism of this set is that it is packaged in plastic rather than recyclable cardboard.  However, the clear styrene box can be reused for storage.  It measures about about 7 in. by 4 1/4 in. x 2 3/4 in.Minzos provided a sample for evaluation and review.
summary: Complete automobile accessory kit for Apple devices

reviewText: I received a review sample and was immediately impressed with the overall quality of the charger and cable. Both are certified under the Apple MFi (Made for iPhone/iPod/iPad) program. The level of quality that earned this certification is clearly evident.The cable is 3.5 feet long and is every bot as good as the OEM cable that ships with Apple products. Each end has a strain relief and the cable itself is heavy-duty. The Lightning and USB connectors mate perfectly with their respective ports.A key feature for me is the charger includes built-in protection against overcharging. Another feature is these chargers will accept 12 to 18 volts DC input and maintain a steady 5 volts DC output on each port.Since the rated capacity of each of the two chargers is 3.1A total (1.0 for a phone and 2.1 for tablets) this will simultaneously charge both devices (or two phones if you are traveling with a passenger.This kit also ships with a clear adhesive non-slip mat that you can affix to your dashboard to sit your phone on. Frankly I am not inclined to use them in my brand new car, but I did test one on a tabletop. They stick firmly, but can be easily peeled back and removed - and they are truly non-skid.I can honestly say that after testing numerous chargers and cables for a variety of devices the ones included in this set are truly five star.
summary: Ideal for dual devices in your vehicle

reviewText: I say this is a good deal for an iPhone5/5S accessories.  The Lightning cable is about three feet long and is made of thicker gauge cable.  I tried flipping the 8-pin connector and it worked on both direction, which is what it supposed to be like the original Apple Lightning cable.I really love the dashboard no-skid pad that came with it.  I bought one before and you just lay your phone on top and it won't budge an inch.  If it gets dirty, you just wash it with soap and water and it is sticky again.The cigarette car adapter works universally.  iPhone or Android.  It has two slots that you can use at the same time.  Total amperage is 3.1A.The only thing I didn't like is the excess packaging. I like it more minimalistic with less foam and less plastic.  It does looks good though if you want to give it as a gift.A sample of this product was sent to me for review purposes.
summary: A nice iPhone car accessory set - MFI

reviewText: As many of you are aware there has been a rash of poor quality chargers causing all kinds of issues around the world.  Some fires and some destroyed devices.Keeping this in mind you have to be very careful who you trust.  This device has all of the correct certifications that indicate it is well made.One way to determine this all is simply order one and see.....They are proud of this device.  It comes in an extreme amount of packaging....quality packing...not just fluff.  They want you to SEE that what you are getting is not your average run of the mill set up.All of the components are well made....heck the lightning cable is twice the normal thickness you see with apple devices.......Why does this matter....... HEAT.  If you leave this in the car heat is the enemy of electronics...and electric cables.  Heat can cause all kinds of failures.Living in the summer heat belt I can guarantee you that this is the case.It works with all of my apple devices.  call me very impressed in Oklahoma.I received one of these for free...but I can tell you this...had it been a normal plug in or cheap I would NOT have taken the time to write out all of this.
summary: THIS is it.  buy this one.

reviewText: There are less expensive car chargers on the market. If you want cheap, look elsewhere and be aware that these other devices are so much less expensive is they are not Apple MFI certified.If you want Apple MFI certified charging, and you want it with the utility and ability to charge two devices at once, then the VoltRanger is a great option.There are two ports for charging, one is a 2.1 A port for power hungry devices like the iPad, the other is 1 A and is for phones. You can use both interchangeably of course, but just be aware some phones don't like being charged quickly over the 2.1 A port.The thing is, you really don't have to use this JUST with Apple devices. The two ports are USB charging ports, meaning you can charge an Android device, a Windows Phone or whatever else you have that can be charged via USB. There is NOT a cable included for this purpose, but any USB charge cable you have that already charges your device will work.The included cable is lengthy, which is great. This means you can put the phone just about anywhere while charging. I actually put mine in the back of the car so I avoid reading email/texts/iMessages while driving.As an added bonus (I'm sure it's built into the price), you receive a nice little pad that can be put on your dashboard and you then put the phone on the pad. It is a non-slip pad, so your phone should stay in place (if you drive like a maniac and make wild turns, maybe it's best not to use this pad!).The build quality is good, the charger charges like it claims and it works very well.Highly recommended if you want Apple MFI certified.I received a free sample for review purposes from Minzos.
summary: Very nice!

reviewText: The Minzos truCord accessory bundle comes with a lightning charge/sync cable, car charger, and an anti-slip mat for a device in a car.Pros:-The Lightning cable is 5ft in length-The Lightning cable is Apple certified-The Lightning cable has a thicker cable than most other lightning cables-The car charger has 2 USB ports and has a max output of 3.1 amps-The car charger has 1 USB port is 2.1 amps and the other USB port is 1 amp (labeled on the car charger)-The car charger is very well built-Nicely packaged in a quality hard plastic boxNo cons.This is a great accessory bundle and I highly recommend it.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation, for free to keep, and I promised that my review is fair and honest.
summary: Great accessory bundle for anyone with a lightning chargeable device

reviewText: I just received this came today to review and I was really excited to try it out.  The led light was a really cool concept.  LED light indicators are very attractive as a ipjone user.  It worked as promised - it was red while charging then blue when it was fully charged.  As a standard cable there really isn't any thing negative to say because it's just a cable.However from a design stance,  I see two flaws. The first flaw is the led thickness.  It's so rich that it won't fit to all phones with thick cases. I tested this on two different cases.  The thin black case was able to charge just fine without any issues.  The thick case I used next was too thick and it wouldn't connect fully.  I had to remove the case in order to charge it. This I can see is a major nuisance and I personally wouldn't use it if I had to take my case off if I need to charge it every day.  I buy a case for protection and looks. I don't think I need a cable to look good when charging.The second flaw was the LED light.  Even when not plugged in,  the LED light was on.  I feel that it should only be on when plugged in.  I realize it's very little wastefulness of electricity but I still find it as a waste of energy and led bulbs lol.It's a really nice looking cable when plugged in but it's just a cable...a cable that doesn't fit all phone cases.  If this fix this issue alone,  I would have given it 5 stars.  I received this item for a honest review.
summary: really nice cable -not meant for phones with thick cases

reviewText: This particular cable is actually very nice when I am charging my iPhone 5s, especially in the car, or when charging on my computer, since I can use the light to tell when my iPhone is fully charged, and when I can switch to another device.One thing I like best on this cord is that it fits snugly into the lightning port, unlike other lightning cables I have tried in the past.The cord is very nicely designed, and appears to be very sturdy around the areas where my cables normally have problems - where it enters the USB port and the lightning port.While I received a complimentary sample to test for a review, I am happy with the product and will likely purchase from this company if I need additional cords for my iPhone.
summary: Lights up when charging ... and done charging.

reviewText: The manufacturer says they have resolved issues with the older model. I was sent a sample of the newer model for review. I am reviewing the "Micro to USB" cable, not the Lightning one.Bottom line: I really like it.The cable seems of very good quality and the LED status light is a great idea. You can tell how much power a device is sucking up. If enough power to charge a battery, then the LED should be red, and if not, then the battery is probably charged and the LED will be blue.I currently have it plugged into my Nexus 7 and the battery is now charged. The LED light is mostly blue, but every now and then it flashes red. I suspect the Nexus 7 is keeping the power topped off, hence the occasional red flash. I think it's really pretty cool. UPDATE: I hooked it up to my USB power meter and can confirm that it is flashing blue/red because the Nexus 7 is dropping to near 0 power for a bit, then jumping back up to about .2 amps for a bit, so it's working correctly.Note that when the cable is not plugged into a device, it still lights in blue, showing that the cable is plugged in and ready to charge. It also makes the cable easy to find in the dark.Overall 5 stars. If the cable breaks or something changes, then I'll update this review.UPDATE 2014-07-19: I am really liking this cable for charging my Android phone and Nexus 7 and even an occasionally battery pack. The LED charge indicator is a really nice feature and something that you'll miss once you get using to having it. The LED light at the end of the cable also helps me easily find the cable I want (I have a lot of wires around!).
summary: Great cable - LED status light is great to have

reviewText: In many ways as long as it is functional, one charger of handheld devices is as good as another. This one certainly works very well in charging iPhone and iPad devices. One end is a USB connector while the other plugs into the device. The charging end is blue when it is ready to charge and turns red when the device is being charged and turns back to blue when the charging cycle is complete. The cord is approximately 36 inches long and can be folded down into a tight bind so that it can be squished into a small space.The charging is compatible with the following devices:*) iPhone 5*) iPhone5S*) iPhone 5C*) iPod 5th Gen*) iPad Air*) iPad MiniThis is a handy and effective way to keep your devices charged and the built-in lighting scheme makes it more useful than some of the other chargers.
summary: Very functional with a visual notification when the charging cycle is complete

reviewText: Ah, the Apple ecosystem, with its seemingly never ending pile of whizbang add-on products.  All those new devices have the new(ish) Lightning connector, so a whole new generation of those add-ons is growing.  Ok, yeah, as an Android user, I do get a little jealous.  But anyhow, everyone needs a charging cable, right?  Zeetron's offering isn't a simple cable with the right connectors on either end, but instead a cable that lights up to indicate it's plugged in, something is plugged into it and is charging, and/or or that something is now fully charged.  Nifty enough, but does it work?  To find out, I borrowed a pair of iPhones, a iPad, and an iPad Mini.  As I pretty much expected, the cable performed it's job just fine across all four devices.  And also as expected, given Zeetron's own admission to it, proper fit with cases was a variable.  The housing at the tip is just a little too fat for the opening in some cases.  That leaves a few choices - skip this cable, remove the case for charging, get a different case, or modify the case you have so the cable will fit.  I know which I would do (modify), but not everyone is going to be up for that.  As a unit, the cable is solidly made, and I have no concerns over its longevity and ability to take some abuse.  While I don't particularly *need* a cable with such a gizmo on the end, I admit I'd love to have a similar product for my pile of devices that use micro USB connectors.  Besides, nothing about the aforementioned ecosystem is about need - it's about want.*Disclosure: I was contacted by Zeetron and given a sample of this product specifically for the purpose of reviewing it.*
summary: Lighting the way

reviewText: This cable is fantastic. It is very substantially made and priced just right. One of my pet peeves about my iPhone 5 is that I can't find affordable aftermarket cables. I refuse to pay top dollar for Apple's cable, but I've also been burned a couple times with cheap knock-off cables that don't work or fall apart.This Zeetron cable is very well built. Plus it has a really nice glowing LED indicator that glows blue while the device is charging and red when it's done. The LED works great and looks really nice. It's great to be able to glance at your phone on the counter and see whether it's done charging or not. That's so much faster than unlocking the phone and looking at the charge indicator.Warning though, if you use a bulky case, like Otterbox cases or the Lifeproof cases, the oversized LED connector won't fit with your case on. I'm already used to that with my Lifeproof case. I have to take it off every time I plug anything into the headphone jack.Anyway, this is a very substantial cable and the LED indicator is a fantastic bonus. The low price is even that much better.I was provided this item for review.UPDATE:  I've been using this cable for about two months now and it's fantastic.  It's durable and always easy to find because the end is lit up.  I love it!
summary: Great cable (if it fits)

reviewText: This nicely constructed lightning cable has the added benefit of a red/blue charging light that alerts you with the charging status.  And unlike many knock-off lightning cables, of which I've had the unfortunate experience of owning, this Zeetron one actually works, in both orientations no less.  While this may not seem like a big deal, it is to anyone (me!) who has purchased inferior ones.  This Zeetron lightning cable is the real thing.  That said, it does not fit into an iPhone in a case unless the case has a large opening on the bottom.  When I accepted a sample for review, I was warned by the manufacturer that this lightning cable would not fit into an iPhone 5 in a "thick" case.  I had hoped that my case was not considered thick.  Too bad.  In fact, none of the iPhone cases I own would accept the Zeetron because they have cut-outs for the charging port instead of completely open bottoms.  I keep waiting for a lightning cable of sufficient quality (like the Zeetron) to fit my phone when it's in a case.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Cool Cable, But With a Short Connector: for Bare iPhones

reviewText: I honestly love this cable. It is a very innovative design, where the cable will light up red while it is charging and blue when it is done. I up just have to glance at my charging station to know if my IPhone is charged. It is so convenient!The light is not that bright, but if you don't want any light at night in your bedroom, leave this charge in another room, or what I do is stick it in a draw while it is charging.This is now my favorite cable. It is made well, and it is Apple certified! which is very important to me. I hate when i buy some cables and I plug it into my phone and I get the message that the cable is not operating.So, I can recommend this cable...A sample was provided for review, but the opinion is my own.
summary: Works well...

reviewText: Always something new with every advance in the communications system! This little durable USB charger is a lightning charging cable, adaptable to either a wall adapter or computer USB port, makes it easy to know if the charger is active (it lights up blue). When connected to the device you wish to charge the LED turns red and once the charge is complete, the LED turns blue.This device seems to be somehow based on Apple products and only the new ones at that. It is compatible with iPhone 5, 5S, 5C, with iPod 5th generation, with iPad Air and iPad mini.  It is inexpensive, good looking and very handy - if you have stepped into the Apple advanced zone. And it is actually so advanced that it may just be the step toward converting to the iPhone 5...Grady Harp, December 13
summary: Another incentive to get an iPhone 5!

reviewText: For the first month that I had this cable, it worked.  I did have some concerns because, starting with the first use, it took up to a minute to recognize my iPhone 5 before it started charging.  But it eventually started charging, so I had no complaints. Soon, about a month or so after I received it, it started taking longer and longer to start charging.  Sometimes, it would not charge at all, and now, it has completely failed.  I've held off on writing this review until I was certain it was no longer working, and I think it's safe to say it's at that point now.  This is the second non-Apple USB cable I've attempted to use with my iPhone (the other was a Belkin), and both failed in approximately a month.Note: I received a sample of this product in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Stopped working after about a month

reviewText: My wife has an iPhone 4 that will be off contract in a few weeks, at which time she'll upgrade to an iPhone 5. I was interested in trying the Zeetron Lightning cable, which is compatible with the iPhone 5, so we invited a friend over who has an iPhone 5, and offered to recharge her phone while we had lunch. Using the Zeetron Lightning cable and one of our AC wall chargers, her phone recharged in about an hour. The cable fit perfectly in the charging port of the phone. (I should note that the phone was not in a case.) It worked as advertised, with the red light glowing when the cable was plugged in, and the blue light coming on when the phone was fully charged.The cable appears to be solidly built. With my wife's two previous iPhones, she used Apple charging cables that came with the phone, and each of the two cables came apart at the plug end well before her 2-year contract was up. For the first one, we bought a new and hugely overpriced Apple charging cable. The next time, we used a third-party cable that cost half as much and was a better cable. As I write this, a 3-foot Apple Lightning charging cable is $19 plus shipping at the Apple store, and it only gets two stars in the Apple reviews. At $10 and free shipping from Amazon, the Zeetron Lightning cable is a much better alternative.A product sample was provided by the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: A very well-made Lightning cable

reviewerName: Joel Avrunin "Electrical Engineer who loves S...
reviewText: This neat little product is a charging cable for your Apple products with a twist - it lights up red while your device is charging and blue when the device is done charging.  The cable itself is very high quality with good flex, and the lightning connector itself appears very well manufactured.  Many third party manufacturers have struggled to make quality lightning cables, and this one works fine.  Plugging it in either way, it works, and I was able to sync to my PC via USB both my iPhone 5S and my iPad 4 using the cable (so no issues with data connectivity).I had two issues with the cable I will note here.  First, as the description states, it is rather large and will only work on a near naked Apple product.  It plugged right into my iPad 4 which is clad in an extremely thin Amzer silicone skin jelly case, but my iPhone 5S in an Amazon Basics case did not work with the cable.  I had to remove my phone from the case to use the cable.  It would have been nice if Zeetron could have tapered the light-up end so it would work with most cases.  Second, the red for charging and blue when charged feature did not work with my iPod Nano 7th generation.  I plugged it in to charge, and while it does charge properly, the light stayed blue the entire time.  So the cable works fine as a cable, but part of the premium is the visual charging feature, and that doesn't seem to work with the iPod Nano.Overall, the cable is a fairly good price and the light up feature is neat.  I especially like it in the car when I can lose the end of my charging cable in the console.  If you don't have a thick case it's a worthwhile tool to have, but if you have any sort of case you don't want to remove, consider a different cable.Note: I was sent a free sample from the manufacturer in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Cable charges and communicates perfectly, light up feature is cool, but will not work with most thicker cases

reviewText: Review for micro-USB cable:This is the second Zeetron light up USB cable I've received from the manufacturer for review. I love this cable because of the lighting. The light tells you the status of the charge.When plugged in to the wall, it's a blue light. When charging the device it's red. Once fully charged, it goes blue again. So convenient! No need to check the device to see if it's fully charged or not, I can see it from a distance. Highly recommended.------------------------------Review for Apple 8pin cable here:I love it! I'm using this to charge my iPad. First of all, it's well made and high quality even down to the box. You can tell it's not a cheaply made product. It fits well into the ports and doesn't wiggle. Best of all is the LED light. I don't know why people hadn't thought of this before. At one glance, you can tell if the device is charging or is full. No more having to looking to find out if it's done and we all know we all do that too often. At this price, it's a great purchase and I'll be using this for charging from now on. Note: Sample was received for review purposes.--------Edit: February 11, 2014. 8 pin head is now broken. Since multiple people in our household has used it, it is unknown to me (and no confessions forthcoming) whether the failure was due to hard use, misuse or product failure. The metal around the head is all loose and the ceramic looking stuff inside has crumbled exposing the pins. And since this product was received as a sample for review, I have not contacted the manufacturer for a replacement.
summary: Review for both Apple 8pin and micro-USB cable

reviewText: I have tested the newer version. It is about three feet long but it improves on the usual USB-to-mini set up with a red light when an item is charging, a intermittent one when it charged, and a blue light when the charger itself is set up but when no product is attached. It's very straightforward. The smaller mini-plug is recessed as the light goes on around it, but it fit into my devices fine.I see many past reviewers complaining but in my examination of this, the plugs seemed secure and the fit was adaptable for both a Kindle and my HTC One M7 phone in its case. It's a nice update of the USB cable as it allows you at a distance to monitor the progress of charging without having to rely on turning on the item charged over and over or looking as on the Kindle and phone for a smaller light to change. With the light around the plug itself, it's much more visible. I was asked to review this item.
summary: Newer model appears to be improved

reviewText: I received a review sample and tested this with an iPhone 5C. I enlisted the assistance of a friend who has a 5C to test this. Like others have noted the lightning connector end did not fit the charging port cutout on a bumper style case, but the connector itself fit the port perfectly once the phone was removed from the case.As soon as you plug this into a charger the ring on the lightning end flashes a second, then turns solid blue. While charging the ring will flash red, then return to solid blue once the phone is fully charged. On the 5C the phone was verified to be 100% charged when the indicator returned to blue. The test phone was relatively new, so the battery had not begun its gradual deterioration that happens to every battery regardless of phone or tablet brand. That may account for the disparity between my results and the one reported in the excellent and helpful December 9, 2013 review posted by buru buru piggu.The cable is a bit short at three feet, but well constructed. The lightning connector end is the culprit that prevents this cable from plugging into most cases and certainly the one on the phone with which this was tested. Had the light indicator ring been moved to the rear part of the connector the small jack of the lightning could be scaled to be a perfect replica of the OEM cable. Perhaps version 2 will incorporate that design. All other aspects of the cable indicate solid design and manufacturing, including close tolerances on the connections and strain reliefs on both ends of the cable.As with most review samples I donated this one after I completed my testing and review.
summary: Tested with iPhone 5C

reviewText: Since I am on my computer working a lot, this charger is just what I needed.  When I plug my Samsung Note two into this charger, the LED is red.  And when my phone is fully charged it turns blue.  I also use this charger for my Note Two tablet and my Kindle.The white cord that plugs into my compute/wall charger is sturdy.  It stays firm in my phone. And I really like that if my phone rings while I am on the computer, I don't have to get up and go to where I would normally charge it to answer it.We live in a town where some of the homes are older have very few wall outlets.  This is a must for anyone with the similar situation in their home.I would definitely recommend this Zeetron Micro USB Charger.
summary: Light Up Cable

reviewText: This micro USB cable lights up blue when it's plugged in but not charging. It's red when it is charging. That's wonderful when considering the number of devices I have that don't have a charging indicator light. No longer to I have to turn them on to see if they've stopped charging. I just look at the end of this cable. It's very handy for charging things like my Kindle Fire HD and Android tablet.Obviously, if you need a sleep in a darkened room, a lighted cable is not for you. For people like me, this is a great invention.This product was provided for review by Zeetron.
summary: Love the Charging Indicator

reviewText: UpdateStopped working within a few months.Can no longer recommend this product.There are a lot of usb to lightning adapters out on the market.  You have the original equipment that comes with all of the Lightning adapter products.  So why should you buy this one?First and foremost it is a quality product.  Strong cables and plugs.  Comes well packaged with clear instructions on how the Light works.Secondly, the addition of the light is just pure genius.  How often I have had to pick up my iPad air to see if it was charged.  No more.First you just plug it in to a powered usb port and the blue light comes on saying go ahead charging is ready.  Then you insert the Lightning cable and it changes to red.  When you come back later you will see it has returned to a solid blue.  Your device is ready to go.  100% charged.I use a book like case for mine so all of my ports etc...are easy to get to.  I just lay it down in the book case and wait.Do not know if anyone else has thought of this yet.  Regardless Zeetron has.  A worthy addition to your cables.I was provided with a free sample of this product with the understanding that I would write and honest review.  That is what this is!
summary: NO!!  Convenience=A+, Form and function=A+, speed is fantastic and the color aspect is why you want it.

reviewText: A basic USB to MicroUSB cable, with a twist.The micro end lights up (blue) to show it's plugged-in and ready-to-charge, and lights up red while an attached device is charging, then returns to blue when it's done. That little bit of bling dresses up what would usually be a plain cable. And it has a practical purpose also-- you can tell when the USB port is powered, and see at a glance if the device has finished charging yet without having to pick it up and press a button.Fit + finish are good.[ A sample was provided to me for review. ]The packaging is pretty nice too, so this would make a nice inexpensive addition to a gift of mobile electronics-- especially since the white cable matches Apple accessories.
summary: a little cable bling

reviewerName: Richard C. Drew "Anaal Nathra/Uthe vas Bethod...
reviewText: It's a cute idea - when the device you are charging is full, the cable end turns blue. If it's charging, it's red. Reading all the other reviews (well, glancing) it seems that people are having problems with Apple devices. I did not see any complaints for the Droid version of this cable.I gave it four stars because the micro-USB end of the cable - the part that lights up - is fatter than most.  This means that you may have a hard time plugging it into a device with a case (unless the case has a large opening!)  It fit my Droid phone with case, but not my GF's.
summary: Works great on my Droid devices

reviewText: Zeetron has put out a USB to micro USB charging cable that tries to distinguish itself in a very crowded market. To some extent they've succeeded.The cable, suitable for use with many smartphones, tablets, and auxiliary devices, is white and about one meter in length, which is fairly typical. The build quality looks good; the cable is substantial and the plastic exterior looks strong. The usual point of failure--- the terminators at the ends--- look good, too. The cable should have an above-average service life with ordinary care.So what's different? In an interesting twist, Zeetron has put a light in the micro-USB end, at the very tip of the casing, where the plug goes into the smartphone or what-have-you. When the cable is plugged in (at the other end) to a USB charging source, the light is blue. When charging is happening (current flowing) the light turns red. On completion of charging, the light turns back to blue as current no longer is flowing.The genius of this is that you can see at a glance, from across the room, even, whether or not your device has finished charging. That's great if you're not charging overnight; the possible downside is that if the charger is in your bedroom (very typical), the glow may or may not bother you.That wasn't a problem for me. What I myself didn't like is that the blue light is always on when the USB end is connected to a power source, even after I've removed my phone. It's just sort of odd to see this unattached cable happily glowing blue at the end.What's the bottom line? If you don't care about stray lights and if you do want to see if your device is done charging without going over and turning it on, this is a great invention. Independent of the light feature, of course, it's a decent enough charging cable. So it's really up to you.Four stars for a solid product; it falls short of five stars because I'm not enthralled with the always-on light.Disclaimer: the company sent me a sample for review, but my reviews are 100% unbiased as I'm sure you can see above.
summary: Good cable; the light is a mixed blessing

reviewText: i received this for free in exchange for a review.  Despite that kindness I give my candid thoughts below.* As cables go it's a good-fitting one.* Interesting feature to color-code the charging statusIn summary, a good, though simple improvement on a standard cable.
summary: A cute idea and a handy one

reviewText: Excellent idea! I tried with an iPAD Air. is compatible with the iPhone 5, 5S, 5C, iPad Mini, iPad Air, iPod touch 5th generation, and with anything that has a lightning 30-pin port. This product will light up blue when it is on, and turn red once the device is charging. Once your device is fully charged, it will turn blue again, indicating the phone is at 100%. Very nice concept and well implemented!I was provided this product in exchange of a fair and honest review.
summary: What an idea!

reviewText: This product is a high quality durable charging USB Cable. It feels somewhat thicker and more rugged than the chord you receive with your phone. I love the little indicator lights.  When you plug the cable in it glows blue, but once you plug it into your device it turns red.  Once your device is fully charged it turns blue again. I really like it, especially that it allows me to see that it is fully charged without having to pick up the phone and turn it on. I also like that the chord is white, it makes it easier to distinguish from my other chords. It fits snuggly into the Port on my phone and charged my phone at the rate expected. I am happy that I received this product for  fair and honest review.
summary: I Like It!

reviewText: Aftermarket cable for charging Apple 5S. Although not Apple certified is works just fine when properly connected. Some protective cases interfere with proper insertion into the charging port of iPhone because the connector needs a minimum 12mm slot within the box to be fully seated. It worked flawlessly with my Otterbox Defender and I received no error messages.Tested it on different devices as indicated on promo - iPhone S5, HTC, Samsung Galaxy S3,S4 and Note 3 - without any problems.A nice convenience is that when the cable is plugged to a power source, a blue LED ring turns on, and then turns red when plugged into and charging a device. When fully charged the LED turns blue again.The 3.3 feet long cable is pliable and sturdy, the end plugs are well fused with the cord; there is nothing flimsy about the product (Version 2). It comes in two different configurations; lightning USB or micro USB. The price is very competitive. Highly recommended.A complimentary sample provided for review.
summary: LED light very convenient.

reviewText: In a busy world, having the option to look across a room to your charging cell phone (or other electronic device) and quickly ascertain whether it is fully charged without having to interrupt your current task to get up, walk over to the phone, and then check the display, is a small but wonderful perk. Alternatively, if a device uses a micro USB charging cable but has no display to alert you to when it is fully charged, having a charging cable that offers a notification function is almost a necessity. In either scenario, Zeetron has stepped up and offered their version: the Zeetron Light up USB Cable.ConstructionI will not insult your intelligence by describing a charging cable. The Zeetron Light up USB Cable (or ZLU, for short) is 3ft long (91.44cm) with a standard USB adapter at one end and the elongated micro USB adapter at the other. It is the micro USB end of the cable that houses the two LED lights that indicate the charging status of your device; the housing for these lights is a very lightweight plastic that almost feels TOO light. While I haven’t done any experiments to determine what kind of force would be required to break/crush the micro USB adapter end, I can say that it endured abuse in a suitcase during a flight and still performed admirably, so the lightweight feel of the case is best taken with a grain of salt.Usage/FunctionalityAs the product description indicates, this cable is designed as an improvement upon other micro USB charging cables in that it shows you, via a combination of LED lights, the charge status of the electronic device that it is plugged into and charging. There are three basic indicators:1) Once the USB end is plugged in to the power source, but the micro USB end is NOT plugged into anything, the micro USB end will glow Blue to indicate the cord is receiving power and is ready to charge your device.2) Once the micro USB end is plugged into your (presumably uncharged) device, it will glow red, indicating that it is charging.3) Once your device has reached a 99% charge, the LED lights will alternate between Red & Blue flashing lights until the device is at 100%; at that point the light will remain solidly Blue.First and foremost, the ZUL performed exactly as described in the product description on this page. The micro USB adapter end of the cable lit up with no flickering. The stages listed above did occur, with the lighting turning Red, Blue, or flashing at the appropriate moment. In terms of the speed of the charging, I did notice my devices (one was a portable battery charger and the other my Samsung Galaxy S5 cell phone) charged a bit faster than usual, but I admit that this is a bit anecdotal and my observation was not done under rigorous test conditions.OverallIf you are looking for a charging cable that provides the convenience of knowing if your device is completely charged without having to walk over and pick it up to check the screen/some other indicator on the device, this cable is a great product. At 3ft (91.44cm) in length, it is long enough to snake behind a desk or a bed to keep out of sight, or small enough to slip into a bag for travel. The only complaint that I have is that the micro USB end of this cable does feel lightweight and that it could crack if it was crushed or otherwise had a bit of excess weight placed upon it. Since this is a relatively minor point, though, I still recommend this product and feel confident that you or a friend/family member will love this cable for any of your micro USB devices.**Disclaimer: This cable was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**
summary: You...Light up My Life...

reviewText: This is such a good idea that I'm surprised I haven't seen this sort of thing before. Sure, you can pick up your portable device, click it on to see if it has charged, and that sort of thing; or, if you have this Zeetron light up cable, you can just glance over at your device to see if it has fully charged. It's pretty cool.
summary: Good quality, inexpensive

reviewText: I really like this concept as well as the execution... the Zeetron Light up Micro-to-USB Cable. This not only works well as a regular cable, but it's perfect for letting you know when something is fully charged (when it may not be totally obvious). Having the cable plug change from a red glow to a blue glow when the charge is complete is a great feature.There's two primary devices I use this cable on. The first is my Kindle. I like how I can use this light-up cable to tell when it's fully charged without having to open the case and check. The *very* useful "use-case" is on an external battery I have that uses LED lights to show how much juice is left. I charged it the first time with a regular cable, and unplugged when the battery showed four lights. However, I don't think it was fully charged as it only supplied two full recharges to my iPhone (and it should have been significantly higher). Using the Zeetron light-up, I just let it charge until the cable went from red to blue. With THAT as my full-charge indicator, I'm now getting the full number of recharges for my iPhone that I would expect. This cable was the difference between thinking I had a faulty battery and understanding that I was just interpreting the LED lights incorrectly.It's not always the case where I *need* this type of visual indicator. But as a cable to have plugged in by my desk as the go-to charge option for micro-USB devices, it's hard to beat.Disclosure:Obtained From: ManufacturerPayment: Free
summary: I like the concept and execution of this feature...

reviewText: Zeetron offered one of these to me to review, and since I can never have too many charger cords, I gladly accepted.With 200 reviews already posted, there's not a lot I can say that hasn't been covered by other reviewers, so I'll keep my review brief and to the point.The cord works perfectly as advertised. The Micro-B end stays lit blue at all times when the cord is plugged into a USB port even when it's not connected to a device. When you plug it into in a device, the light will change to red to indicate the device is charging and then when the device is fully charged, the light will turn back to blue again.Some people may not like how bright the lights are... I wouldn't want this in my truck as it would annoy me while driving at night; but I love it in my living room and at my computer desk. Now I can tell from across the room or even down the hall whether my phone or power bank is fully charged.Reception of the cord by friends and family has been very favorable. Pretty much everybody has walked over to check out the cord when they've seen it, and everybody has done some version of "oooing" and "ahhhing" over the thing.One thing shoppers should take into consideration before deciding to buy this cord is that the Micro-B end is considerably wider than most other cords, and because of that, it might not fit some some phones or devices, especially if you have minimal clearance with a standard charger plug.All things considered, I really like this cord, and at the current price ($9.99 at time of review) it's a decent value.
summary: Love this Micro-B USB Cord

reviewText: I was provided a sample of the Zeetron  Light USB cable with a micro USB connector, for evaluation.  The most notable feature is that the cord has colored LED indicator lights in the connector fitting.  When the cord is plugged into a USB port, a blue LED comes on to indicate that power is available.  When the cord is plugged into a device for charging, the light will turn to red, if the device is being charged.  When the device is fully charged, the color switches to blue.The indicator lights are mostly a handy feature.  The lights consume a small amount of power, so you probably want to disconnect the cord, when it is not being used.  It sometimes seems to take a long time for the light to switch from red to blue.  Whatever sensor is involved in controlling this function, is probably rather sensitive, and only switches when a device is actually fully charged.I was provided a sample of the Zeetron  Light USB cable with a micro USB connector, for evaluation.  The most notable feature is that the cord has colored LED indicator lights in the connector fitting.  When the cord is plugged into a USB port, a blue LED comes on to indicate that power is available.  When the cord is plugged into a device for charging, the light will turn to red, if the device is being charged.  When the device is fully charged, the color switches to blue.The indicator lights are mostly a handy feature.  The lights consume a small amount of power, so you probably want to disconnect the cord, when it is not being used.  It sometimes seems to take a long time for the light to switch from red to blue.  Whatever sensor is involved in controlling this function, is probably rather sensitive, and only switches when a device is actually fully charged.While some are reporting problems with the Apple type connector, there are no such issues with the mini USB connector.  The Zeetron cord appears to be well made, and the indicator lights are both cool and functional.  If that feature interests you, I recommend that you give this product some consideration.
summary: the LED indicator lights are quite helpful...

reviewText: The Zeetron Lightning to USB Cable is a great replacement cable or just a great extra one to charge you device. The cable is quality made and can last a long time if you take care of it. The cable is not Apple Certified/MFi Certified but it gives no errors on iOS 7. Some other 3rd party cables give an error and work or they just don’t work. This cable gives no errors on my iPhone 5 or iPod touch 5 on iOS 7. This cable is unique because when it is not charging the lightning tip lights up blue and when it is charging the device the lightning tip lights up red. When the device is fully charged, the lightning tip lights up blue signaling that it is fully charged. The lightning tip does not work with all cases but the product page states this.I recommend this lightning cable. It simply works.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation, and I promised that my review is fair and honest.
summary: Great lightning cable that works with iOS 7

reviewText: One of my greatest issues with smaller batteries is that they won't give my iPad the boost it needs, when it needs it. I don't mean charge it fully, I mean charge it at all. This DOES! The 2.1A output means that I can stick it in my pocket and add a couple of hours use (if I need it) for my iPad. It also means it will charge my iPhone at a maximum speed.If you want to charge your device while charging it, sorry, No pass through, but this is still an awesome battery to keep on hand.I keep these handy for power outages, so having a nicely bright light is a great feature. Best of all, it is easy to carry in the hand as a small flashlight! Which brings me to my favorite feature - the shape. It describes itself as "lipstick," but for more masculine types, it is much more small flashlight shaped. Having the lanyard and wrist strap just makes it better. Probably the only thing they could have done is to have a pop out connector for the phone so you wouldn't need a cord.But alas, cords are the nemesis of our life ... this one comes with two that will fit the battery and most phones. One is shorter and the other longer. Both have the micro connection, so iPad/iPhone users will need to provide the correct cord for their device.I did notice that it got warm while charging, but not overly warm, I kept it next to my computer for charging to monitor the progress and was happy.Because of the small size, and the nice gift packaging, this would make a great gift to go with the cell phone you are giving your loved one. Just be sure they either have an extra USB port to charge it OR pick up one of the USB plugs that are so readily available today so they can charge both their phone and the battery concurrently.I really do love the convenient shape and easy use of this particular battery!
summary: I love the Shape - Even will charge iPad (not fully)

reviewText: This "lipstick" battery-flashlight is perfect for especially to carry with to work.  Here's why I love this:* It is a fast charger at over 2A - you cannot easily find something in this size that can charge a cellphone quickly.* It's a true flashlight.  No more need to carry the old and probably bigger flashlight.  One can use all the battery power for the flashlight and still come out ahead.* The lanyards are cool.  I used a bent paperclip to work the neck lanyard through and it looks and feels great like that.  There's also a wrist lanyard for more specialized use.* The cables are great - two sizes with one conveniently short for cell phone charging.  Use the same cable to power up battery that use to power phone from battery.  It can hardly be simpler.I received a promotional sample.  My wife uses this daily and loves it.
summary: Lovable lipstick flashlight and charger

reviewText: Normally I look for the maximum mAh when getting a powerbank since it gives me the ability to recharge multiple small devices, or even a couple large devices without running out of power. However, the large capacity ones are basically like carrying around a brick. This powerbank, while only offering 3000mAh, comes packaged as a very easy to take along format.It's weighs only 2.5 ounces and is about 4.25 inches long and less than an inch thick. The case is plastic, but the quality is quite good, with nicely matched seams. All the edges are rounded so it feels comfortable to hold. The bottom edge is flat, and allows it to stand upright without toppling over.Although it's small, it still has all the main features of a powerbank. It has one USB output (2.1A), a micro USB input for charging (with each port next to each other), and a 4 LED "gas gauge" that shows the charge level. On the end opposite the port it has an LED flashlight. Normally the flashlight feature is of minor use on a conventionally-shaped powerbank, but in this case it actually works very well as a flashlight. In fact, I could see people buying it mainly to use just for that. The flashlight lens is recessed and has a nicely designed surround.It comes with two USB cables, both of which are stout and durable. It also comes with two lanyards: one that is long enough for neck use; another shorter one for (I imagine) wrist use. Since the powerbank is so small and light, wearing it on a lanyard is very feasible. The lanyard construction is just so-so, but decent enough for general use.  It also comes with a user guide that is actually helpful and well-written. Don't see that much anymore!Operation is fine - works just like any other powerbank. But, to be useful, a powerbank has to be carried along with you. The size makes that very easy to do, and the flashlight performance and design makes this even more useful to carry with you. Despite the fact that it has only a 3000mAh capacity, I would recommend this highly.[Sample provided for review]
summary: Nicely built; very convenient form factor

reviewText: This very portable 6000mAh ultra slim charger (with built in flashlight) is very high powered and even has a built in VERY BRIGHT flashlight. This unit I have tried on my Samsung Galaxy phone and on my Samsung Galaxy Player. Since I carry around a tablet and a phone, what I do is charge one and get it fully charged and then place the other into this so that each one stays charged and ready to go. Note that this comes with two USB charging cables, neck strap, hand strap, and excellent instruction manual.  Below you will see my testing results and suggestions:+ My Testing Results on Charger: Each device charged up VERY QUICKLY from 50 percent to 100 percent in just 1.5 hours! Therefore you can purchase that is full confidence because it has a FULL 2amps, which is just what most newer tablets require for the fastest charge! And it also benefits newer and larger phones (such as the S4) because it charges just about as fast as their wall connection counterparts!+ My Testing Results on Flashlight – To fully test this, I went into a very large and totally dark closet and turned on the flashlight part. WOW! Everything in the closet as vivid. Then I went outside in a dark area of my yard, shined the flashlight and I could see very well, in fact just as well as my big and bulky regular flashlight (now retires)!+ Do you need a high powered portable charger with a flashlight (but just need one port)? Then I will suggest this to you as it will charge your tablet or phone very fast. However, there is ONE port. If you are looking for one like this WITH 2 PORTS with 2 amp, with a flashlight also, then I suggest to you the EasyAcc PowerBank 9000 (which I also own and reviewed). It has dual ports for your tablet and for your phone and also a Flashlight! (For me, I take both with me now because I need a port to charge my Bluetooth headset).Very highly recommend this totally portable charger to ALL!
summary: Flashlight and Charger in one superb quality compact unit. Charges my phone or tablet quickly!

reviewText: This is an elegant simple small battery pack for phone recharging. A full charge will do just about one and a half full charges of an iPhone 4s. I was able to boost my iPad Air roughly 30% with a full battery charge.This is a well thought out battery. I like the flashlight on the end; it is very bright and slightly on the blue color side. Two presses of the power button turns on the flashlight. The silver power button is just hard enough to press that the light won't go on accidently, and at the same time I can easily press the button with my finger. There are four blue LED's to show the state of battery charge (the LED's are nice and dim like an indicator light should be). The battery has a standard microUSB charging port and a standard USB output, meaning it can charge anything you have a USB cable for.The battery is lightweight. It is the same length as an iPhone 4 and about twice the height. It is about one inch wide and nicely rounded. It feels really good in my hand.Charging was excellent with this battery. It charged both my iPhone and iPad at the highest charging rate. The battery will do a full 100% charge of an iPhone 4s, and then a bit more. This isn't the battery to charge an iPad, but in a pinch it can give a boost of about 30% charge (in a pinch that's pretty nice really).The box includes a few accessories. There is a neck lanyard (along with the required yellow EasyAcc advertising on the lanyard) and a short wrist strap made of soft fabric. They are both attached with that thin nylon thread loop trough material. There are two microUSB cables, one a short nine inches long and the other two feet long. Oddly, these are really high quality cables with thick insulation and strong plastic ends.This is the perfect battery to toss into a purse. It is a bit larger than most lipstick cases, if lipstick came in industrial size, this would be it. It does fit in a pocket nicely. It is small enough that people won't necessarily notice, or if they do they will be disappointed - it is pretty thin and short.This is a good battery, given the nice size, the good battery capacity, the good flashlight, and the reasonable price.
summary: Elegant

reviewText: `EasyAcc' is a perfect brand name for devices so unique as this one. This power bank/flashlight combo is small, lightweight, easily portable either by the enclosed rope or simply in the pocket, briefcase or purse. The Ultra Bright LED Flashlight is powered at  0.5W with  40-50 lumen. It gives a Super Fast charging speed at both input (DC 5V 2.0A)and output (2.1A Output ). It has a very smart design and it is widely compatible - ll three Output Ports are universal and compatible with almost any smart device with an input of DC 5V, e.g. smartphones, tablets, PSP, Bluetooth speakers & headphones, Google Glass, MP3 / MP4 players, but NOT compatible with Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0, Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1, Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 7.0, Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1. Keeping with the reputation of EasyAcc  this is a dependable and highly desirable addition to your armamentarium. Grady Harp, January 14
summary: Tiny but Mighty

reviewText: The EasyAcc 3000mAh portable battery charger is a bit bigger than most lipstick tubes, but not by much. In any case, it's the smallest, lightest portable battery charger that I've personally used. With 3000mAh capacity, even allowing for normal electrical losses in the internal circuitry and cables, the charger should give at least one full recharge for cellphones, and perhaps half of a full charge for most 7" tablets. That's enough to extend talk time or operating time by several hours. To test the charger, I used my Samsung smartphone and my Kindle Fire HD 7". With the Kindle Fire, the charge increased from 56% to 88% in seventy-one minutes. Then I connected my phone, which charged from 74% to 100% in sixty-five minutes. These times are comparable to the results I've had with other portable battery chargers. At the end of that time, the battery charger still had enough reserve capacity to top off the charge on my wife's iPhone 4. To recharge the battery charger, I used an old Kindle AC adapter with an output of 5V~0.85A. The manufacturer recommends an input of 5 volts at 1 Amp maximum. Two USB cables with micro-USB plugs are included, but you'll need to use your own AC adapter (or recharge from a USB port on a computer).Like many other portable battery chargers, the EasyAcc U-bright 3000 uses a simple system of four LED lights to indicate its own charge state. It also has a very bright built-in flashlight. An unusual but welcome feature is an included lanyard that fits through a small opening in the case.The portable charger is ideal for someone who needs an occasional boost to extend their talk time or get a few more hours use from a tablet. It's not suitable for someone who's away from an AC power source or vehicle charger for hours or days (such as hikers and campers), but for the typical cellphone/tablet user, 3000mAh should be sufficient.A product sample was provided by the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: A very compact portable battery charger suitable for many users

reviewText: Review for the 6000mAh powerbankAs with the 3000mAh powerbank, I love this design. It's small and yet fits perfectly in the hand.Pros:1) 5V 2.1A output that allows you to charge larger devices like the iPad.2) Charges very quickly and charges stays for a long time on reserve.3) Very nice LED flashlight.4) Comes with neck strap, wrist strap, and two charging cables.5) Excellent designCons, none that I can think of.The 6000mAh powerbank is a more powerful charger and can large larger devices vs. its smaller brother.Overall, nice and compact powerful charger.Review for the 3000mAh powerbankReally great design! I have several power banks but I easily like this one the best. My other ones are all flat, but this is a stick design. It's easy to store, hold and carry.The other things I like most about it are:1) Powerful penlight. This LED light is really bright.2) Output is 2.1A for fast charging.3) Comes with wrist and neck strap, and charge cord.Overall, high output charger that is very convenient and portable and doubles as a flashlight.Note: Samples for both chargers provided for review purposes.
summary: Excellent!

reviewText: This small but powerful powerbank charges devices quickly. It has a nice feel to it: soft, rounded edges that help when you are using the built-in flashlight. It has a four light display that shows how much power is left in the bank. It comes with two charging cables, (USB to micro-USB), one is short and one longer but it will only charge one device at a time.It also has a really nice lanyard in case you want to hang it around your neck while charging or if you are walking with it and want the flashlight feature handy. I had a lot of trouble getting the lanyard threaded through the little corner hole but a little ingenuity and thread and I made it work.It charges a dead phone about three times and a Kindle Fire a little less than that.A really nice unit for basic needs.I was provided a unit for evaluation and an honest review.
summary: Compact and Packed With Features

reviewText: This very very light little `lipstick' styled powerbank is a cool new invention with lots of extras.  First, the power is 3000mAh which is enough to fully charge a smartphone a little more than once, but not twice.  In fact, it will charge just about any electronic device.The hand-sized design has the input charging slot and the USB charger slot on one end and a very bright flashlight on the other end.  The light will provide plenty of safe lighting in the dark.  It is very bright (note that this also uses up a lot of power).  It just takes two clicks of the `flush' button on the side to turn it on or off.  Next to this button are four blue LED lights to show if you have 25%, 50%, 75% or 100% of power.The kit also comes with two different cables.  One is about eight inches long and the other is about twenty-four inches long, depending on your needs.  There are also two lanyards included. One is for the wrist and the other is a neck lanyard which is convenient for freeing up your hands. You can charge your smartphone totally hands free while having them on your person.For the price and convenience, this is a nifty invention with the right accessories.  Product supplied for a review.
summary: Powerful "Multi-Use" Lipstick Styled Power Bank

reviewText: After using this case for a couple of weeks, I am very impressed.This battery case comes in two pieces - the one that fits over the back, and then the front that snaps onto the back. That makes it easy to put on and take off.The charging mat works seamlessly - I never had a problem with the case not lining up correctly.The mat comes with a micro USB cord which can be used to keep the mat "alive," but it also can be used to charge the battery (and phone) by plugging it directly into the battery. So there are TWO ways you can easily charge your battery - nice if you are on the road and don't have the pad.But here is the best part. The micro USB cord will also allow you to connect directly to your computer using the USB cord - no lightning cord required.The on/off and volume buttons are covered, but the external buttons line up perfectly and I had no problem with those. If you use earphones, you will need to use the included "dongle" to slip in and plug it in. While it is a bit unwieldy, just slipping the dongle onto the buds (instead of the iPhone) allows you to easily use them when you want, and not have something hanging out the bottom when you don't.I am grateful to have been supplied a complimentary sample of this case so that I could test it for my review.Edited: After using this for even longer, I am impressed with how long the battery lasts even when I don't sit it on the charger when I come home. It is still the easiest and nicest addition to my cell phone I have.
summary: Great Features

reviewText: Finally a wireless charging option for the iPhone 5.  Before I acquired the iPhone 5S I was using the Samsung Galaxy S4.  One of the many accessories I missed was the wireless charging capabilities the Galaxy S4 had.  You also were able to choose from so many different covers and cases that worked with the Qi receiver (wireless charging pad).  I checked what was out in the market for the iPhone 5 but nothing seemed to really "fit" what I was looking for until I had the opportunity to test the Unu Aero Wireless Charging Case and Pad.The case itself is soft to the touch and comes it two separate pieces.  It does a tiny bit of bulk and weight to the phone, but not too much to make much of a difference.  The case has raised buttons for the volume and power controls.  However, it has an open area for the mute switch.  Even though it does not have an open area in the bottom for the speakers, it  has two slots located on the front of the case for sound and microphone use.  The camera cutout on the back is quite large, so expect no interference troubles there.The receiver (Qi) pad is extremely lightweight and automatically begins charging you phone as soon as it makes connect with your phone.  Believe it or not, this charges faster the normal lightning cable.  I was so impressed with how fast it charges and how long it holds the charge, I ended up acquiring two additional charging pads to have in my office and another in my vehicle instead of using a lightning cable.  Keep in mind besides using the wireless pad to charge the phone,  you can always a  micro USB cable to charge the case as well in case of emergencies.  The only thing you really need to get use to is using a headset extension adapter.  Since the headphone jack sits far into case, a headphone plug will not be able to fit correctly.  I don't use the same headsets all the time, so I have to make it a point to remember to carry the included headphone jack adapter with me when I plan to use different headphones.One really great feature is the battery usage indicator located on the back of the case.  It has four tiny blue lights to tell you how much battery life is left.  It is pretty accurate too because I have the battery indicator on my phone and I am always comparing the two.When using it to sync to iTunes, you just need to use a micro USB cable instead of the Apple Lightning cable.  This way you don't have to take the case off.This is truly a terrific product and works great.  If you are interested in extra pads here is the link:uNu Aero Series Wireless Charging Pad (Single Mat). Like I mentioned before, I used one in my vehicle by placing it in one of the cubbyholes in my Dogde Durango - works great!UPDATE:Since I kept taking the case on and off to test and review other cases on my phone, I broke one of the tabs on my uNu Aero case and wanted to cry because this is my favorite and pretty much the case I use everyday.  I emailed customer service (services@myunu.com) and they quickly issued me a replacement.  So besides being a great wireless charging case, they have wonderful customer service as well.Sample provided for review.
summary: A must have for the iPhone 5/5S - you will LOVE it!

reviewText: This case is cool looking and pretty sleek. It adds some weight to the phone, but it is an extra battery so that has to be expected. The extra weight is minimal and is so worth the extra life that I am hesitant to even mention it.We just took a week long trip to Disney World and this extra battery life saved the day almost every day! We used the phone for videos, pictures, phone calls, texting, Internet and Disney now schedules your rides and sends you the fast passes. There is no way the phone could have endured all of that on a regular battery charge. With this groovy case, the phone lasted all day and night with no problem. It was so convenient to charge it too. The charger slipped easily into the laptop bag and takes up very little space. It was great.On another note, the case is STURDY. It got banged around, hit and dropped more than once. Not a scratch nor a problem. I can't recommend this product highly enough.I received a sample of this product for an unbiased review. This is my honest opinion of this product.
summary: Adds some weight but SO MUCH POWER

reviewText: For the purposes for which it designed, this charger for iPhone devices works very well. The iPhone is placed in a hard plastic case that has the male component of the charger that will slide into the female part on the iPhone. That case is then placed on a metal surface that has a connector to a USB port. When the phone is placed on the base the charging of the phone will begin automatically. In the tests that were run, charging a phone took slightly less time with this device than it did with one that plugs into a standard wall socket.This charger would be ideal in a business that allowed for bring your own device (BYOD). If a person is using an iPhone to contact customers in their cubicle then it would be easy to drain the device. This charger could remain plugged into a USB port and when the charge is low the phone could simply be placed down on this charger. That way, it could be charged while the worker takes a restroom or lunch break and be ready to go when they return. Or the phone could be put down on the charger between calls when the worker is updating the customer information on the company database.
summary: Great for people that use their iPhones heavily at work

reviewText: This review is from: uNu Aero Series iPhone 5S Battery Case / iPhone 5 Battery with Wireless Charging Technology - (Black, Fits All Models Apple iPhone 5S & iPhone 5) (Wireless Phone Accessory)It feels good to have enough power to go all day with my phone. This battery does that because its battery is 2000mAh. The iPhone is a battery hog and Apple has a new battery in development that will modify energy usage based on the user's habits. Until then, I believe this uNu Aero iPhone battery is the best solution outside of charging one's iPhone here and there during the day.The main attributes of an external battery are weight and volume. This battery case has a small footprint in both regards. In fact, it serves as a protective case that doubles as an extra battery. I like the feel and look of the case.This leads to a different and better routine. Place the phone down on the charging pad. It's slightly magnetized so it will hold in place correctly. Let the phone and battery charge as if they're one unit. In the morning, take off the plate and go. Don't recharge all day. This cycle will also lengthen the battery lifespan.Truly I could not find any fault in this product. As for the lack of a longer cable, it doesn't affect me because I have too many extra cables. I was fortunate to receive a complimentary sample. This is my honest review.
summary: A lot of power for very little extra weight

reviewText: *Disclosure: I was contacted and given a sample of this product by uNu*I see lots of battery packs, as well as plenty of extended life batteries w/cases.  This one, designed for the iPhone, tries to make a balance between adding size and being of value, while at the same time trying to work within the limitations of what what can do with the fruit of Apple.  I think uNu did a good job at meeting their goals with this product, but could have done a couple of things better.  The case itself is a nice snug fit, not easily dislodged once it's wrapped around your phone.  The lighting connector on the inside of the case lines up just right, and the fit is secure.
