But for whatever reason, uNu decided against using a lightening connector on the outside of the case for charging and syncing, instead using the common micro USB.  This change doesn't reduce any functionality, but if one has invested in extra iPhone specific cables, those are useless once this case is on.  It makes sense for uNu's similar product aimed at the Samsung Galaxy 4, which already uses micro USB, but not so much with this.  Due to the limitations of the iPhone, no user removable battery, the uNu pack acts as its own entity for the most part.  If one reads the clearly written instructions, it's made plain that in order to use the extra battery, one must turn it on.  For those that...uhm...don't read instructions, it's not at all obvious.  The friend I asked to give this a try on her iPhone came back to me a couple days later all disappointed that it didn't work at all.  When questioning her, I found that she hadn't read the manual, just charged her phone like usual, and was expecting the extra battery life to work seamlessly.  Once she was shown how it was supposed to be used, it was a whole different story.  Now she's in love, other than needing to get some micro USB cables for when she isn't near the charging pad.  I agree that it would be nice if the whole things worked together a bit better.  Like maybe an app that could monitor the phone's battery and then kick on the extra one as needed.  My guess is though, not being an Apple developer myself, that Apple does not allow this level of access to the hardware.  Also worthy of note, when charging, the phone's battery charges first, then the external.  Always.  Further, the external battery has its own charge level indicator.  There is no other way to check if the pack is fully charged or only partially.  Again, if only it were more seamless.
summary: Foolproof, depending on your fool

reviewText: I have tested and reviewed many battery cases -- ever since I had my first iPhone 3 -- and I can't believe I'm this excited about the uNu Aero. I love the Aero mostly because of the charging mat (more on that later) but also because it adds minimal bulk and weight and because it feels great in my hand. With my iPhone 5 losing power at a sometimes phenomenal rate, this case has saved me several times over the past week alone.The Aero weighs 2.75 ounces, and it adds about a half-inch to the phone's length. The battery on the back is thinner, shorter, and slightly lighter than another uNu case I own (uNu Power DX External Protective Battery Case for iPhone 5s / iPhone 5), although that case carried 2300 mAh of charge while this one is only 2000 mAh -- still more than enough to give my phone a full charge. The back is curved, with a soft matte, almost rubberized, feel that keeps it solidly in my grip.But the most distinctive aspect of this case is the charging mat. Yes, the case can be conventionally charged using a micro-USB, an essential feature if I'm traveling without the mat, but it is easily charged by simply being placed on top of the mat with the mat connected to power via USB. I keep the mat flat on my desk, and all I have to do is put the phone on top of it to both charge the phone AND the case. It can't get any simpler!This case is not only competitive with other brands, but it raises the bar. I love it! Note: I received a sample for review.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Wow -- A Great Combo with Battery and Charging Mat

reviewText: I was provided a uNu Aero Series iPhone 5 Battery Case for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ Nice battery capacity increase for your iPhone without adding too much bulk.♦ Fits an iPhone 5 perfectly, but case provides mostly cosmetic protection, not protection from major drops.♦ The Apple Lightning connector passes the "Does it Work" test.♦ Charges wirelessly with an included charging pad or with an included Micro USB cable.♦ Key Feature: The Charging Pad/Micro USB cable charges the iPhone and the case separately (iPhone first), meaning you are not always using the battery case to charge the phone.  This puts much less strain on the battery case and should extend the life of the battery.  This feature is not available on all battery cases.♦ Key Feature: This battery case has a "sync-through" feature that lets you sync your iPhone through the Micro USB cable. This means you do not have to remove the case to do a wired sync of your iPhone.  This is a critical feature, and a deal-breaker for me for cases that do not support this.♦ The case covers the headphone jack, so you will have to use the included headphone extension to use regular headphones.Detailed Review:♦ Look - The product came in professional looking box with nice pictures and product information on it. Inside the box was the battery case, a charging pad, a Micro USB charging cable, a headphone jack extension cable and an instruction manual all wrapped in a form fitting plastic holder. It is a very nice looking battery case that doesn't add a lot of bulk to your phone, while giving you a nice battery boost. It has a matte finish that offers a little bit of grip.  The case is built more for protecting from light bumps and scrapes, not major drops. The back of the case has a power button to turn on the case battery, four capacity gauge LED's and two metal charging studs for the charging pad. Overall, it seems to have a nice quality build.♦ Installation - Installing the case was pretty easy. You slide your iPhone onto the Lightning Plug and carefully slide a frame over the phone to hold it in place. No problem at all and it had a nice fit.♦ Use and Performance - To activate the battery case, you press and hold a button on the back of the case and the battery turns on. My phone immediately indicated that it was charging and everything started working as expected. The battery did a great job of charging my phone with no problem and the case felt good in my hand. It was a little larger and heavier than I was used to with my typical Incipio Dual PRO Case, but not too much. The charging speed was great adding a little more than the average of 1% per minute of charge to my iPhone 5.  Overall, it worked very well.♦ Key Feature #1 (Charging)  - I have tested a few battery cases, and this one has some great features that were not available on the other cases I have tested.  First and foremost, it has a great wireless charging option with an included charging pad.  You just lay the phone on the charging pad with one of the charging studs on each side of the pad and it starts charging right up.  An important item to note about the charging.  The charging pad (or charging via the Micro USB cable) charges up the iPhone and the battery in the case separately with the iPhone being charged first.  This is different than some cases that charge the battery case only and you have to charge the iPhone with the case all the time.  Charging the phone separately puts a lot less strain on the battery case and should make the battery case last a lot longer.  This is a great feature of the uNu Aero case.♦ Key Feature #2 (Sync)  - The other cases I have tried do not allow you to sync your iPhone through the Micro USB cable.  That means you either have to rely on WiFi/Cloud sync, or you have to remove your phone from the case every time you want to sync it with a normal Lightning cable.  What sets the uNu Aero case apart from its competition is that it supports "sync-through technology" that allows you to sync your phone right through the Micro USB cable with the case still on.  This was a great feature that really made this an awesome case.  One item of note, the uNu Aero must come with a higher quality Micro USB cable, because a generic cable that I had didn't work for sync and gave me the unsupported device error.  When I plugged in the Micro USB cable that came with this case, it started working perfectly.Conclusion:Overall, this is an amazing case.  It does a great job of charging your phone, and it has some unique features that really make it stand out from the crowd.  It is not a case that will protect your phone from major drops, but it offers some basic protection and performs great as a battery case.  If you are looking for a battery case for your iPhone 5, this is the one to get because of the key features mentioned above.  Highly Recommended!
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy! (with Key Features)

reviewText: This battery case and wireless charger is quite literally in a class by itself. It looks great, is well-built, protects your phone, adds a full charge on to your device, and allows you to be lazy and charge your device (and after that, the battery) wirelessly. In other words, it does the work of several other products, all in one well-designed product.And, with all these features, you'd expect it to make your phone into a big brick. And this is what pushes the uNu Aero over the top: it really doesn't add too much bulk to your phone at all. In fact it's not much more than a regular case, and certainly less than an Otterbox. More specifically, it adds about three credit cards in thickness (above a standard case) and a little over a centimeter in length.I love mine and will definitely be recommending it to my iPhone friends.[manufacturer provided review sample]
summary: In a class by itself!

reviewText: uNu Electronics has a winner on its hands - and it should be in YOUR hands! This beautifully designed Aero wireless battery case and charging pad complete the iPhone picture. It is a very thin, wireless fully integrated battery case that allows you to charge your iPhone 5S/5 simply by resting your iPhone on the charging pad and the charge starts immediately. And as the manual states, `With a 2000mAh built-in battery, the Aero is powerful enough to provide an additional 100% charge to your iPhone 5 and 85% to your iPhone 5S, which means more talking, texting, and browsing. In fact, the Aero can add up to 10 hours of additional talk time, or 270 hours of stand-by time.' The pad provides easy access to all functions, camera, and headphone jack.But given all the pluses of its use, the feature that is so compelling is the actual design. This is a very handsome device that is sophisticated and so beautifully engineered that it becomes an art piece! Easy to care for, easy to carry around (you should have several in various locations for ease of mind that you may need a charge...) and something that speaks of quality every inch of the way. Highly Recommended on every level. Grady Harp, December 13
summary: Finally, someone got this right!

reviewText: They don't mention it on this product page, but after first trying out this nifty charging case on my 5S, I noticed it seemed like it might fit my iPod, 5th Generation. Sure enough, works for it, too, with just a touch of wiggle room.  I know this case and charger was really developed for the 5 and 5S, and using it for the iPod was not their primary intent, but because no one has mentioned it before me, I wanted to highlight that in my review. So, for those people--like me--who really give their iPods a workout, this is a plus.I've not seen anything like this charging design before, and I'm impressed. This one, both protects and charges in one fluid, concise and easy-to-use design:--The case is a lightweight, quality plastic that can take abuse without showing wear. It has a soft, smooth "feel" to it (without being soft), is matte black and melds nicely into the look of both my black 5S and black iPod. I love the slimness of the 5S and this case keeps a low profile and maintains the slim design of the phone while protecting it. In most instances, the protective case will keep your phone safe, but if you are prone to dropping your phone and stepping on it, you probably should look for a tougher case, (but you'll lose the slimness of the 5S by doing that). The case comes in two pieces, top and bottom/back, that snap--tightly--together to frame your phone. (With all the color choices that they show for the Galaxy, I would expect the color selection to expand for the iPhone, too.)--The battery is incorporated into the back of the case, how clever is that? And it is a potent, powerful battery at that. Even though it is part of the case, it is not secondary to the case: The battery charges quickly, holds the power, and provides enough oomph to keep your device going for an extra 10 hours. Cords come with the set.--The back of the case has two tiny silver metal "bumps" that act as connectors to the charging mat. Plus, you can buy additional mats and leave one at home and one at work, or wherever is convenient. Keep your mat plugged into a USB hub and toss your phone onto it to charge. You don't really appreciate how easy and convenient it is until you try it once!This is a top quality, well-constructed case and charging mat. Its design works with the look of your 5S, 5 iPhone or iPod, 5th Generation (latest). It is so convenient and effortless to charge up with this new uNu design. I love it, and highly recommend it! This company has a hit on their hands! In my opinion, good value for the money.I received a sample product from uNu Electronics.
summary: What a terrific idea! Plus it fit iPod 5th well enough, too

reviewerName: Joel Avrunin "Electrical Engineer who loves S...
reviewText: This battery case is a great way to provide a little extra charge for your iPhone 5S when you are far from a power cord.  The case itself comes in 2 parts.  You snap off the outer ring, slide your phone onto the included Lightning connector, and then snap the outer ring back into place.  The case itself has a rubberized outside and feels good in the hand.  The power switch and volume switches are covered with rubber, but there is a cut-out for the silent toggle.  The bottom of the case has a micro-USB plug, so an added benefit of the battery case is you can now charge your case and your phone without having a lightning connector nearby.One downside of the case is that the headphone jack is so recessed that most headphones won't fit in it.  The manufacturer provides a "stub" cable which you will need to keep with your favorite pair of headphones.I was also a bit surprised to find that the charging isn't wireless in the sense that it is inductively charged.  Instead, you get a pad with 2 metal contacts on it.  The back of the battery case has another 2 contacts on it.  When the two touch, the phone charges.  So in fact, it's not exactly wireless, but it plugs it with gravity instead of a cable.  In that sense, however, the system does work quite well.My only real complaint is that the case doesn't really bump out in front of the screen at all, providing minimal impact protection if you drop your phone on the screen.  If they were to add some lip in the front, this would be a perfect case.  Since I am a little concerned here, I rate it 4 stars overall.Note: I received a free sample for review.
summary: Great way to keep your iPhone charged for hours, but the case should provide a bigger front lip around the phone

reviewText: This is a handsome product, durably encased and well-designed. It does not add that much bulk to the iPhone, as it charges it in tandem. The case is thick enough to protect the phone, yet light enough that it does not feel heavy. The smooth, curving back fits neatly in the palm, too.Allow sufficient time to charge the charger before using it to charge the phone. If you don't, this means the phone won't, logically, get much of a push past 50%, which defeats its purpose.I was offered this to review, and so far I can say it is easy for my family to use, and that the charge works well. The fact it's can be also used as semi-permanent piggyback on the phone does not detract from it, but adds to the reliability and portability of the product. As an investment, it's a great combination of case and charger.
summary: Does what it's designed to do

reviewText: The UNU Aero Battery Case and Charging Platform is a perfectly integrated system to hold your iPhone in a case that contains a 2000mAh battery. The included charging platform enables you to charge your iPhone while in the case merely by placing it on the platform. It is wireless charging.A USB to MicroUSB cable is included and this is what you'd use to connect the battery case to your computer for charging/syncing. While your phone is in the Aero case, you no longer need a Lightning cable to charge or sync your phone. The case has a MicroUSB port on it and it is the MicroUSB that is now used for syncing and charging.The case is comprised of two parts: the battery/case and a frame. The iPhone5 plugs onto the Lightning plug at the bottom of the battery/case and then the frame snaps around the iPhone5s and connects both to the bottom battery/case. When everything is snapped together it is a very nice looking, integrated solution that protects your iPhone5s and acts as an attached battery.The battery has a 2000mAh capacity which is enough to basically double your normal iPhone5s battery life.The charging platform is sort of a bonus. It does not contain a battery and is used soley for charging your phone when it is placed on the platform, wirelessly. The platform has a MicroUSB port on it and when that is connected to a USB power source, it is ready to charge your iPhone5s battery whenever it is placed on the platform (while in the AERO case of course.)I like the appearance of this AERO case. It does not look like something added on to your phone, it looks like it came that way. I no longer have to wonder whether my iPhone battery will get me through the entire day now because my battery life has been doubled with the addition of the AERO battery case. When I get home, I simply place my phone on the platform and it recharges my iPhone5s.I was provided a sample for review.
summary: Well integrated battery case fits iPhone5s like a glove

reviewText: I received a review sample of this battery and charging system and was thoroughly impressed. Not only does this significantly increase the battery capacity of an iPhone 5 or 5S, but the case affords more protection than other cases I have tested. This system was tested with an iPhone 5S.Here are the key features and advantages as I see them:EXTENDS CAPACITY: While the packaging indicates that this will double the use time of an iPhone 5 and provide 85 percent more for the 5S, the actual results are a little better than claimed. For the iPhone 5 the battery pack provides 138% more use time and for the 5S the figure is 127%. This is based on the fact that this battery pack adds 2000mAh (milliamps per hour) to the 1440mAh that the iPhone 5's battery has, and the same addition to the 1570mHa for the 5S.Note that increasing battery capacity increases use time, which is completely dependent upon how you use your phone. If you normally get ten hours between charges, with this battery you will at the very least double that for an iPhone 5 and add another minimum of 8.5 hours to a 5S. Those are conservative numbers that go along with the manufacturer's claims. In practice you will get more with a newer phone since the battery has not deteriorated from multiple charging cycles.FIT AND PROTECTION: The battery assembly is also a protective case with a soft synthetic back that cushions and absorbs shock. All of the cutouts are perfectly placed and all buttons and ports are available with the battery in place.Do note that the case is a two piece assemble that consists of a back (battery) and bumper that you snap in place after you mate your phone with the lightning connector. Once your phone is encased you will charge the battery with a standard micro USB cable (one is provided with this battery). This has pros and cons. On the plus side you can ditch the proprietary cable the iPhone 5/5S uses; on the minus side any investment you have made in extra lightning cables is negated.You can charge and transfer data simultaneously, which is a feature that sets this battery apart from the competition. Plus you can charge it via a computer's USB port. Not all batteries on the market will allow that - many I have tested would not charge that way.CHARGING MAT: An added bonus is the wireless charging mat that is included with this battery. It actually does work (I was a bit skeptical at first). In fact, it will charge up the external battery pack in almost the same time it takes to charge it via the micro USB connection from a regular charger. This adds not only convenience, but value because some of the iPhone batteries I have tested in the past were in this one's price range and did not include a charging mat.Overall this is a solution that is superbly engineered and manufactured. Everything from the precision fit of the battery case to the way this solution performs to or exceeds claimed specifications warrants a solid five stars.
summary: Outstanding engineering

reviewText: Battery cases are pretty common now, making it hard to choose between them.  uNu sent me this one to review, so I'll try to quickly outline what it offers.First, it does add some bulk and weight.  However, I have found iPhones so fragile that I wouldn't think of using one without a case anyway, and this is less bulky than something like a waterproof Otterbox.  For a battery case, it is pretty thin and looks nice, if not super sleek.  Importantly, it is sturdy plastic and does a good job protecting the phone.To charge the phone, the case plugs into the phone's lightning port.  What I love is that, rather than sticking a lightning port on the case for charging or syncing, uNu went with micro-USB.  This is the universal standard for almost everything other than Apple products, so I have plenty of those cables around.What about wireless charging?  Well, it is not the usual Qi or similar standard of inductive charging.  In fact, it is a bit of a misnomer to call it wireless at all.  The charging pad consists of two metal plates with magnets.  The back of the case has two metal pins, which extend via the magnets to touch the plates.  So, it is basically using pins rather than wires, similar to a standard phone cradle.  With that said, it works well and I do like the convenience, apart from the magnets occasionally wanting to stay stuck and attach the mat to the phone.  The downside is that a standard wireless charging mat will not work with the phone, so if you already have a nice one for your gadgets, that could be something to consider.Overall, the uNu Aero series case is an impressive and simple way to keep your iPhone safe and juiced up.
summary: Not Too Bricky, A Bit Sticky

reviewText: Five EFFECTIVE Stars! The UNU Aero Wireless Rechargeable 2000mAh External Battery Case and Charger Pad for iPhone 5 and 5S is an excellent system, providing substantial additional power to the iPhone PLUS it is a wireless way to recharge both the iPhone and its charging case by placing it on a charging pad. After having already tested a couple of these general type chargers from competitors, this is the best iPhone 5/5S charger, so far. The 2.6 ounce Aero case unit adds one half inch in length to the iPhone and consists of a nice 2 piece protective battery case which contains a 5 volt, 2 amp (the Aero case tag cites 500mA) input/5 volt, 1 amp output max 2000mAh capacity reserve power rechargeable battery for the iPhone from within its surrounding protective case: the manufacturer claims 6 hours additional talk time and 8 hours of video playback from the case battery. On the back of the case, there is an`on' button and '4 blue LED status lights' showing charging status of the case battery itself. When both the iPhone power and the case power are depleted or when a full charge is needed, the phone can simply be placed on top of the included Aero wireless "charging pad", which itself is connected to a power source via its micro USB to USB cable: I hooked the "charger pad" to a standard A/C wall connection via an Apple USB/AC plug (not included) for faster charging.Right out of the box, I easily mounted the iPhone into the 2-piece snug-fitting case, pushed the "on" button, felt the iPhone vibrate twice, and the case battery charged a fully power-depleted iPhone up to 43% of capacity and stopped charging at that point. Then I placed the phone onto the charger pad to continue charging the iPhone, and the power percentage immediate jumped from 43% to 49% and continued to charge to 100%. At that point the battery case had only 2 LEDs of the 4 lit, so I continued the charging process until all 4 LEDs were lit; the entire charging process for both was about 6 hours. Conclusion: the battery in the Aero case charges AFTER the iPhone battery is fully charged, so users should continue charging the Aero case to 4 light capacity. I then depleted the entire power of both the case and the iPhone battery and repeated the process by stressing the charger and iPhone: I looped my iTunes library and music played continuously for 33.2 hours. Since the iPhone lightning adapter port is hooked directly to the Aero case power supply, access to the iPhone for 'iTunes computer syncing' is through a provided cable. The manufacturer also provides a headphone extension cable because while inserting the headphone plug is no problem, removing the headphone plug could damage the cable wiring. Highly Recommended. 5 EXCELLENT Stars! (UNO Aero Battery Case, Charging pad, micro-USB to USB charging cable, Headphone extension cable, instructions on the box and a separate users manual sheet. One year limited warranty. Note: this item was provided directly from the manufacturer to me for an independent test and review.)
summary: AN OUTSTANDING IPHONE 5/5S WIRELESS RECHARGEABLE SYSTEM: 33 HOURS OF MUSIC

reviewText: One thing that stands out in the uNu Aero series battery cases are how well they are designed. I was quite surprised how it worked on my wife's phone 5S. It was very easy to install, and the wireless charging makes it a winner. This makes one use the phone for easily 2 days. The design and aesthetics are just perfect.2000 mAh battery makes for enough juice not to worry for days when you forget to charge or when going on long drives. Convenience of wireless charge is a big plus. The added case is another bonus. so this solution consists of multiple factors that makes the case a winner.  Overall I did not notice any issues like heating/USB data transfer issues. No problems and I highly recommend this solution for its unique design.I was provided this product in exchange of a fair and honest review.
summary: Very good design

reviewText: uNu Aero Series iPhone Battery Case is a great battery case for Iphone 5/5S. It doubles your battery power and now you can also charge the battery and phone wireless-ly with the wireless mat (included) which is very convenient.  You can also use the traditional micro usb cable and adapter to charge this battery. This case also has slim profile so it doesn't make your iPhone bulky. It does make your phone a bit longer since iPhone doesn't have an easy/direct access to the battery except through the charging pin at the bottom therefore all iPhone extended battery will access the power/battery through the indirect way. When you want to activate the external battery (i.e. when the main battery is in low power or whenever you want to charge the main battery) you press the power button on the battery case and the battery pack will start charging your main battery. All in all, this is a great battery case for iPhone and thanks uNu for sending this uNu Aero battery product.Sidarta Tanu
summary: Slim profile and wireless charging

reviewText: If you are looking for extra battery life for your iPhone, and you want contact charging (instead of having to plug in), this is a great battery and case design.The design is quite exquisite. It does add weight to the phone, since you can't really get more battery power and not add weight, but it's evenly distributed over the surface of the case. The case itself seems to melt around your phone. One down side you MIGHT have is that now you can't see the Apple logo or the color of your phone. Yes, it's something silly, but if you buy a phone with color to it, don't you want to show the color off instead of covering it in black? For me, this is inconsequential as a useful phone with a charged battery is more important than the "form." Function over form for me.The battery itself is 2000 mAh which means you get just a touch more than a full charge added to your iPhone. This should be enough to get just about anyone through an entire day, whereas without I was finding that I would get about 6-9 hours of use before needing a charge, and right around 10 hours before the phone died. Having this case on the phone is a life saver for sure.The contact base is well designed, and to charge the phone you just drop it on the base and it starts to charge. Ultimate in lazy convenience, since now I don't even need to bother trying to plug the phone in at all.To charge your phone, you must press a button the case to begin feeding power to the iPhone. This is fine with me, and I believe this is as designed so that the battery case isn't providing a constant trickle charge which can shorten the life span of the batteries.One down side is that while charging the phone, the battery can become pretty warm. During the winter this is good, since it means you have a hand warmer.I really like this case. Definitely worth the money.Highly recommended.I received a free sample product for review purposes.
summary: Works well, works as expected and has a great design

reviewText: And that might sound like I don't care about how quickly it charges.  But I do care how quickly it charges:  It charges pretty much like most all of the other external chargers out there right now--and, wow, are there a lot of them to choose from!For my use, I plug my devices in and walk away for a few hours, or overnight.  I don't watch my device as it charges and I surely don't get my timer out.  I have more important things to do.  So, for me, this external charger does a fine job in comparison to the 10 or so others I own.  Suffice it to say that I can use it to charge my device and still have time to re-charge the charger all in one work day.I think you should know what sets it apart from the other chargers:--It has a built-in flashlight.  Cool beans!  I think that is a great idea.  So, I am not only tossing a charger into my bag, I am tossing in a flashlight at the same time.--It is built solidly:  In the hand, it feels like a small, "old-fashioned" cell phone.  It weighs 4.45 ounces, which is bigger than a quarter-pound hamburger.  (So, it's really not light-weight:  Almost 5 ounces sounds light-weight, but there is some heft to this charger.)  It feels good in my hand.  (On the other hand, it may wear a hole in your pants pocket...)--There are four LED lights that alert you to the status of your charge:  That surely gives you a better heads-up than one, two or three lights.  (I know that is just common sense, but common sense does not always raise its head when you need it to...)--If a charger is going to offer only one output, it better be a 2.1 Amp output--and it is.--It holds a charge for a long time.  If you are using it as an emergency charger you won't need to check the charge every week.--It comes with a cheapo velour bag to protect its shiny finish.  I'm not proud of the bag, mind you, so I don't use it.  Which allowed me to witness that the shiny black and silver is a nice quality and does not scratch and dull easily.An observation on the pictures on the product page:  The front of the charger is not black and white.  It is all black.  The triangle of white is just a reflection.  Also, in one of the pictures it appears there is a dull rubber-like band around the side:  No, there is not.*I received a sample product from Energen.
summary: I like the flashlight feature

reviewText: The Energen Light Mini 5600mah Portable External Rechargeable Charger is great for a smartphone, especially for someone like me that forgets to keep it charged.  Several times I have had it in my purse and used it to give the phone a charge when I was out and about and need to make a call.The other thing I like about having this battery charger with me in my purse it that if I get home later than expected and didn't turn on a porch light, I have it in my purse to use to get to my door and the keep in the lock.  We live in the out in the country where we do not have street lights, so it gets pretty dark getting from the parked car, up the steps and into the house.  It comes with a soft carrying bag that makes it easy to find by feel in my purse in the dark too.The manufacture supplied me with a sample to test; this review reflects what I found.
summary: Energen Light Mini 5600mah Portable External Rechargeable Charger

reviewText: A great portable battery charger. At a very competitive price.Why to buy it:1) It works very efficiently in charging your phone.2) It is easy to understand and work with3) Amazing price at 15$4) Comes with a nice pouch to hold it in5) Seams to be very durable6) Holds charge wellWhy not:1)You don't have mini usb2) you want an incredibly fast charger. In which case you want a 8400 mah not this 5600 mah3) You don't want to carry one more thing.Just so you know:I received this item free in return for a honest review.Overall a great product I would recommend to anyone I knew.
summary: amazing battery charger

reviewText: Excellent product to have in a jiffy if your phone runs out. I suggest charging the battery 10-12 hours before using so that it can hold a full charge.I used this product for my iphone 5 and it did wonders and saved my social life in a pinch.I would highly recommend this product for anyone that might need that extra charge on the go.Pros:+ Charges well+ Slim and stylish+ Excellent price+ Durable+ Easily understoodCons:- Did not come with AC adapter or miUSB (not too big of an issue)- Needs a bit of time to charge initially but works well after
summary: Excellent Charge, Quick, Stylish, and Powerful!

reviewText: The Energen Light Mini comes with a velvet drawstring pouch and a micro USB cord.  You can use any USB charging cord you own.  I used a 30-pin cable for my iPhone.This is a small power bank.  It fits in the palm of my hand, small enough that it's comfortable to hold and make use of the single LED bulb flashlight embedded onboard.  At 5600 mAh, it can charge my iPhone 4S twice, with enough left over for another 33% charge.The 2.1 amp output means a fast charge.  Nowadays, I expect nothing less, though small power banks don't always offer it.  2.1 amps (as opposed to 1 amp) means less waiting for my cell phone to finish charging.The only drawback for me is the glossy, fingerprint magnet surface.  It scratches easily and quickly loses its newness.  I prefer matte finishes.  Otherwise, it's an excellent charger for cell phones or other small electronic devices.This product was provided for review by MyEnergen.com
summary: Good Capacity, Fast Charge

reviewText: Disclaimer: I received this for free in exchange for a fair and honest review.So, this is actually one of my favorite chargers (I probably own 20 or 30 chargers at this point), mostly due to it's small size and relative versatility. It wont charge my Vita, but it does charge all my phones and my Kindles well enough. It has enough of a charge to recharge my Blackberry almost three times fully. It has a simple LED light and 4 circle charge display. That's about it really. It isnt the fastest charger in the world, but it's absolute portability and decent charge bank make this a nice item in my opinion.
summary: Decent little charger

reviewText: I received this unit free in exchange for a review but I'll give my candid thoughts below.* Design is small and sleek especially considering the size of other similar units.* Has a handy and rather blinding LED flashlight built in* Charges my iPhone at about the rate of 3 minutes per 1% of battery charge* Charged to 100% in only a couple of hours* Has a handy carry bag for battery and cord* Charging is via micro-USB cable and about 6 inches longCan't really find anything to complain about; a great unit for the price and you'll be glad you have it in an emergency.
summary: Smallest unit I've seen with this capacity and a great flashlight feature

reviewText: It is small, like little bigger than an iPOD Mini and thicker. Just slide into pocket easily.Simple design. Has 4 small circles, LED indicators. Has a USB and a microUSB port as well as a flash light. Charge through the microUSB. You can charge devices using the USB port. I tried and was able to charge- Samsung Galaxy S4- iPad AirVery easy to charge this device and in turn helps other devices. Whenever you go out, this is highly recommended. Especially camping, driving etc. I was provided this product in exchange of a honest and fair review.
summary: Amazing Charger

reviewText: Energen Light Mini 5600mah Portable High Capacity External Rechargeable Battery Power Pack is a convenient source of extra power when needed. Mr. Murphy is always waiting for the worst time that your cell phone battery will die. The Energen is the answer to keep Murphy at bay.Pros:+ Small and compact+ Comes with a small carry case+ Has a built in flashlightCons:-Long initial charge time. It would be nice if it came prechargedOverall Assessment:The Light Mini 5600mah Portable High Capacity External Rechargeable Battery Power Pack is small, lightweight, and easy to carry for those times when your cell phone battery dies. It is nice to have a backup form of power especially for emergency situations. While the initial charge takes a while subsequent charges do not take as long. The flashlight is a nice touch as well. I also like that it comes with a carry case to protect the unit when in my bag.
summary: Small, Lightweight, and Easy to Carry

reviewText: The Energen 5600mah battery pack is a great sized battery to keep your smartphone powered all day.Box contents:-Energen 5600mah battery pack-Micro USB cable-Carrying case-Instruction manualThe battery pack has 5600mAh lithium battery inside meaning that you can charge your devices around 2-3 times. The battery pack has 1 USB port, a micro USB port and an LED flashlight. The USB port has an output of 2.1 amps/5 volts which is great for smartphones and tablets. The micro USB port is used for charging the battery pack and can be charged at 1 amp/ 5 volts. The LED flashlight works fine but is not bright. It will work if you need to find something close by. I like this battery because it is small and also powerful. The size is perfect for a backpack. The battery pack is glossy black with some chrome on the side. The battery has a 4 LED battery gauge. Each LED ring means 25% of the batteries capacity.Note: if you are looking for a battery pack for a tablet for 1 full charge, do not get this one because it has a low capacity of 5600mAh which is only good for smartphones and other small non-tablet devices.This is a high quality battery pack and I recommend it.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation, and I promised that my review is fair and honest.
summary: Great battery pack that looks good and it works great

reviewText: As advertised and extremely convenient.  It really does fit into a credit card slot in my very compact [[ASIN :B000BJDPM0Geoffrey Beene Men's Mirage Slim Passcase Wallet]].  (Check out the review, it's one of my favorites.)Anyway, even though it fits in my wallet I would recommend carrying the wallet in your front pocket.  That's where I carry it even when it doesn't contain electronic equipment.The USB input and micro-USB output cords are permanently attached with understandably short and nicely flexible cords.  When not in use they clip firmly to the body of the "Charge Card."  (Hey, I just got it!)The built in flash light is discretely bright.  It shins enough so you can find your seat in a theater of place on a map and not so bright as to incur the wrath of your fellow theater goers or driver.Sabrent sent this to me to review.  About the only way they could make it better is if they made an iSabrent iSlim iCredit iCard iSizeed... you get the idea, something for the apple products that seem popular with a certain segment of society.
summary: You can have it without knowing you do until you need it and then you'll be glad you did

reviewText: This tiny black battery charger is, technically, pretty much what it tells you in the bulleted description at the top of the page. It's extremely small and lightweight -- it's not much bigger than a credit card in any dimension but depth, and there it's about as thick as a two or three of them. If you're ever in an emergency and you think of how cheap and easy-to-use this product is, it's no doubt you'll wonder why you didn't buy it.While it's tiny and is indeed billed as an emergency charging solution, understand that this little Sabrent is more than a "last-ditch" device: it will provide you with hours of extra cell phone life. It's rated at giving four more hours for ordinary cellphones, and three more hours of use to a smartphone. And, naturally, your phone can be used WHILE it is being charged, so there's no waiting (unless your phone has to reach a minimum charge level first).And, as I mentioned, Amazon is selling these at quite a savings at the time of this review: about $10, delivered (if you have Prime). That's an EXTREMELY respectful price: I have two daughters, and I know can only imagine how mad I'd be at myself if my two daughters were to be left without a phone when such an economical and easily transportable device is available.  As it can fit wherever three or four credit cards can, this is an extremely practical wallet or purse-sized device that can save you immeasurable hardship if you are left without a phone.And, as the pictures at the top of the page display, it doesn't require any link-up cables: the links are provided within the tiny charger.It also comes with a tiny flashlight (or "torch," if you're British). If it's lying flat with the SABRENT logo on top one activates it by pushing the switch away from the "S" and toward the "T" it's activated by turning the power switch to the right when it's facing AWAY from you. (While the light won't exactly light up the night, it WILL burn holes in your retinas if you point it at your eyes.)The only problem I really see with this is in the charger's connectors: While they are not flimsy, the contacts are relatively small and look as if they might be subject to any consistent wear. (Pass your zoom bar over the photo at the top of the page that displays the extended filaments and you'll see the wear the display product has undergone.) So, while this is an excellent and inexpensive device, my advice is to keep it as what it is: a terrific backup to be used for emergencies.One final note: I was supplied this product free of charge with no other conditions other than my writing a fair and honest review -- which this is.
summary: A Great Little Emergency Solution

reviewText: .It boosts your smartphone 10-20%. It works as a Micro-USB power cable (when USB power is available), and it's a data cable as well.I works fine with my iPhone 4S, using aLenmar Micro-USB-to-Apple-30-pin Converter Tip. It boosted the 4S a full 20%...more than I expected. Phones with larger batteries will get a smaller percentage boost.Honestly, I like to have enough juice for 1 to 2 full smartphone charges when I'm away from power, and at those times I've got room in my backpack or briefcase for a "real" battery pack. But if you want small, this is for you. It does small extremely well.►Note: It's 5.70 to 5.90 mm thick. (.225 to .232 inches). That's as thick as 5 credit cards, not "Only slightly thicker than a credit card."PROs:- Beautifully designed for compactness- Fit and finish are very good- Weighs less than one ounce- Works as a cable or a battery- Nice price when selling for $10OKs:- The tiny switch is a little hard to use, and the labels hard to see (a cost of compactness)- Small flashlight (but your phone already has a small flashlight)- It recharges my iPhone at about 75% of normal speed (no big deal)- When used as a cable, it charges iPhone at full speed- Can charge your phone while itself being recharged (did not test speeds)CONs:- Fattens your wallet. It's like adding 5 credit cards. May not make sense for most people.- User manual is funky and confusing in places.- Warranty? No warranty info is provided with the product or (last I checked) in the amazon listing.- - - Tip - - -- You could put it on your key chain. Just loop a piece of thin cord or shoelace through one of the card's holes.- - - Disclosure - - -The manufacturer gave me this item for review. I believe my review is impartial.~~~ Comments & questions welcome ~~~
summary: A Miracle of Compactness. Nice price.

reviewText: What a great little charger for the safety-minded individual--or concerned parent!  Send this little packet of power with anyone headed out the door and into a situation that might take them away from normal, dependable power sources or into unfamiliar places.Better safe than sorry, right?  And considering all the outdoor enthusiasts in my family, I can think of many situations where another power source might not be available:  Hunting, fishing, hiking, rock-hounding, biking, etc.  It is just a simple, small piece of insurance to take on any road trip, any travel-event, any recreational trek.  I think it is a terrific idea for a stocking stuffer!It took less than 90 minutes to charge, so it shouldn't be hard to keep it fully charged if you check it once in a while.It would have been nice if it came in a little carry case.  Without protection, knocking around in a backpack, purse or gym bag can dislodge both the charging end and the micro USB.  It will fit in a business card holder, but a snack-size baggie will work in a pinch.I received a sample product from the seller , but when I need an add-on item to bring an order up to qualify for free Amazon shipping, I'm going to get another one of these.
summary: Safety insurance at a small price

reviewText: The Sabrent Slim Credit Card Size Charge Adapter of Smartphones worked perfectly for me when I forgot to charge my phone.  I needed to make two calls before I could get home to recharge my phone and the small extra charger saved me from getting doubles at the grocery store.  My husband had already picked up what we needed; it wasn't a big emergency but one that made life easier.The charger and phone are both fully charged for now.I was given this charger by the manufacture to test it and what I found is how it honestly worked for me.
summary: Sabrent Slim Credit Card Sized Charge Card Adapter

reviewText: Amazingly small extra battery/ phone charger great for emergency use or while out camping.  It comes with 2 ports a micro usb and a  Usb the usb is plunged into a computer to recharger the battery then the micro usb is plugged into your phone to charge it. Its amazingly small and rocks!Pros:Very easy to use.Lightweight and small so will fit great with any survival kit when out hiking.Cons:Just so you know:I received this test product for free in return for an honest review.This micro usb charger will be added to my hiking kits for the next year that’s for sure. Great product!
summary: Small lightweight micro charger

reviewText: This has to be the most compact (and cute) set-up for a back-up battery. It is credit card sized - except for the thickness. It has the cords built-in and flush with the inside case. So it makes it great to have it all together at all times. It has a USB plug on one cable for charging it and a micro USB plug for charging your devices.It will not charge my cell phone one full time but will get me out of a low battery pinch by getting me at least 50% higher than I began. It has a one-sided USB plug that must be put in the USB port properly to charge. So when it is plugged in, make sure the charging light is lit or you have to reverse the USB charging plug.A low price for a small, emergency back-up.I was provided a unit for evaluation and review.
summary: Compact and Good for a Quick Emergency Back-Up

reviewText: I wasn't sure what I was expecting with this product, but I can tell you that i'm impressed to say the least. With a dead battery this charger gave my Samsung Galaxy S4 about a 20 percent charge. More than enough to make an emergency call, text, or play a few more rounds of Subway Surfer. (To each their own in what constitutes an emergency).The size is great, however it is fatter than a credit card for sure. This emergency charger is super light weight which makes it easy to store in your purse, pocket, wallet, on your boat, in your car, or even in your B.O.B.As far as the manual goes, the writing is super tiny. This isn't an issue for me but if i was to get something like this for say my mom she would have difficulty with it. The LED light is surprisingly bright which is a feature you can never go wrong with. There is also the feature that allows you to charge the charger and a device at the same time.Another important note is before you store your emergency charger anywhere make sure its charged. All you need is a USB connector ( which most of us have) and your good to go.Peace of mind is priceless and the Sabrent Slim Credit Card Charger makes that possible. This product would make a great gift this season for a very reasonable price.**I was provided a sample for review, all opinions are honest and my own.**
summary: Great for what it is

reviewText: Disclaimer: I received this product in exchange for an honest review.Okay, this is the third Sabrent charger I was sent to test and review. Unfortunately, unlike the other two, I did not find this charger to be very useful at all. I really had high hopes for this one, being as how it is truly credit card sized and fits easily in your wallet. It did charge my cell phone a bit more than half way, which was great for what is essentially a last resort item. The problem was in actually recharging the device. I plugged it into a Sabrent USB hub to recharge it. It did not however charge, nor did the LED indicators light up like they should have. That basically made the device I received a one use item, and as such, I can not recommend it. I will revise this review if anything changes.
summary: The one I received was only functional once.

reviewText: Firstly and as usual, I received this product free of charge in exchange for a review.  Also as usual my candid opinions appear below.On the positive side, this really is tiny and just a bit thicker than stated in the description; it's more in the neighborhood of 5mm than 3mm.  If you tried to keep this in your wallet you'd have a fairly hard time.  Ladies will find it just right for carrying about in a purse though.  The design is clever as the cords all nicely tuck away inside the body of the device with no need for carrying anything else around.  Everything you need in one handy package.  The price point is also a great one though I wouldn't imagine paying more than about $10 for this one.To the negative side, it must be stated that this is purely an emergency unit that's not likely to withstand frequent use.  While the design is clever, it's cheaply made and isn't going to hold up over time.  Also, the battery does seem to hold a charge fairly well when disconnected but it's only going to be good for a couple of calls if your phone is truly dead.  This unit will get you out of a jam but only if you have a fairly short list of people to call.In summary, a great unit for getting out of a totally dead phone situation but only once or twice.  It's worth the price for a little extra security.
summary: A clever, though cheaply made unit that would serve in a pinch

reviewText: Incredible charger. I cannot believe a charger comes in this size. It is very handy for emergency use. The charger has wires and USB/micro USB ports tucked away neatly. It can be charged from a computer. There is a blue LED indicator.  There is a toggle switch --- 1) flash light  2) off 3) on.  On ON position I was able to charge Samsung Galaxy S4. Turn to flashlight mode for a powerful beam in cars and outdoors.Overall a very handy piece of gadget and very well made. I was provided this product in exchange of a fair and honest review.
summary: Incredible for a device so compact.

reviewText: The Sabrent External Backup Battery is a high-speed portable charger that really packs a wallop.Powered by a lithium ion battery, it's an extremely user-friendly charger with one input port and two output ports. The input uses a micro USB cable, and the output hooks up using a standard USB cable. A cable is provided, but I considered it the only weak link in this product...more on that in a  second.Here's the basics (which is about all I can explain, electrically): there are three ports, one of which is an input port, and charging an uncharged battery charger will take about 5-6 hours. The other two are output ports: one that is labeled "Output 1A" and another that is labeled "Output 2.1 A." Both output ports fit a standard USB (female) cable, whereas the input uses a micro USB cable. About a foot-long USB to micro USB cord is provided, but it was, quite frankly, of pretty lousy quality - unlike the rest of the unit. The standard USB cover fell off the second time I used it, just as I was bragging to my wife what a great charger this was. And it took me a minute or two to get the darned thing off once the plastic cover slid off its housing. I almost immediately threw it in my "USE ONLY AS A LAST RESORT" drawer.Back to the output of the charger: the total output is listed at 3100 mA, or 3.1 amp hours, but that would take using both the output ports hooked up to separate devices. I think this is a viable option if you are charging smaller units, but I would not try charging, say, a smartphone AND an iPad at the same time and expect similar speeds. A nice feature is that it shuts itself off when the device it is charging reaches its limit. No overheating.As to those speeds and capacities: the unit can charge smartphones by the half-dozen, one after the other, and maybe more...and that's not a stretch. Or, it can charge a couple of Kindles - that is, a fully charged Sabrent 120000 mAh can do so. I do not have any concept of whether it can charge more than one iPad in succession...I would doubt it, but I cannot supply that information with any veracity.This Sabrent is a powerhouse, that's for sure.  Other than the really crummy USB cable, the only other down side might be its weight: it feels dense and is heavier than it looks...it is about 2  x 6 inches, and no thicker than about  inch, yet it IS weighty. However, it is a life-saver for the person who finds him or herself without a charged electrical device, and can not only fully charge items like cellphones, tablets, Kindles...anything that can be connected by a mini-USB cable, but it can also allow you to speak on or otherwise use the item WHILE it is charging. (Obviously, such use will slow down the charging speed.)It can itself be charged from a computer, or from any device hooked up to standard current that has an output port that takes a standard (female) USB.It is a sleek device: like its younger sister the Sabrent 6100 mAh (model # PB-BCBG), the 120000 is stylish and glossy and looks very polished and high tech. When it is charging it has blue lights that indicate its remaining capacity, and the blue-on-black is very appealing.I can say this for Sabrents, as well. I unintentionally dropped its companion (the 6100 mAh model) on both wood and concrete floors  over period of just a few days and nary a mark was on it (though I did have to snap the upper and lower sides of the unit together after they separated a few millimeters. There was, remarkably, no damage done.I will tell you this, too: I did not know how helpful and essential these devices would come in my life until I began carrying them, and since then I have run into many times where I, my wife, my daughters, or others needed a charge. I think this is today's modern equivalent to the sink garbage disposer, or the ice-maker in the freezer or, heck, smartphones and tablets: you could get by before you ever used one, but once you do you will not be able to remember how you got by without them.One final note: I was supplied this product free of charge with no other conditions other than my writing a fair and honest review -- which this is.
summary: A Great Security Blanket for Almost All Your Battery Needs

reviewText: .Beautifully designed and crafted. Nice size and shape, if you need this much juice.At $30, this Sabrent model is 5-star impressive, compared to the best alternatives I could find.Prices are bouncy and coming down. It might pay to look around.PROs:* Beautiful design, fit, and finish (see Note 1)* Nice price, when selling for $30OKs:- No embedded cables (see Note 2)- It boosts my iPad3 +74%- Warranty: 1 year, I believe (see Note 3)CONs:- The Micro-USB cable end pulled apart. Other reviewers had the same problem..- - - Minor Points - - -- Charging starts automatically (nice!)- The 2 output ports are "upside down" (cable logo will face down)- User Manual is brimming with factual errors, and very goofy English.- - - Alternatives - - --PowerAdd 13000(includes AC adapter)-PowerGen 14000(has 2 embedded cables)- - - Notes - - -Note 1: Fit and finish are excellent. It's a pleasure to hold and look at. The tiny status lights, the easy-to-read port labels, the matte finish are all things they did right.Note 2: Embedded cables are a big plus. Save space. No tangle, mess, or leaving behind. iPeople can use converter tips.Note 3: No warranty info is provided with the product or (last I checked) in the amazon listing. Sabrent says it's 1 year and intends to update the listing.- - - Disclosure - - -The manufacturer gave me this item for review. I believe my review is impartial.~~~ Comments & questions welcome ~~~
summary: Beautiful Design, Nice Price

reviewText: If you ask me my top two favorite technologies to arise in the past 2-4 years, without a moment's hesitation I would tell you that my favorites are these external power banks and portable Bluetooth audio devices.  I just LOVE these power banks and the freedom they give me when I travel and commute.This external battery pack gives 12,000mAh of power.  That's FANTASTIC.  This charger is perfect for long trips (car rides or flights) or for trips where you'll be away from power for more than one day (camping).A power bank like this takes hours to charge.  I typically plug mine in overnight to get a full charge.  Then the power pack holds its charge for many days/weeks until I use it.  Once I use it, I can charge my iPhone and my tablet at the same time.  The number of charges I can get from a pack like this is hard for me to gauge, because I typically use them and charge them at the same time.  Ideally I would turn off the device and charge it.  That would make it easier to tell how many charges I could get out of one fully charged power bank.  However, I typically plug in my phone & tablet and use them both at the same time while they're charging.These power banks come in different physical sizes and power capacities.  This one is definitely the big daddy.  I've used many different chargers like this, and this is the largest capacity that I've ever used (but not necessarily the largest physical form factor).If you don't need this much power capacity or don't want to carry something this large with you, consider these smaller chargers:Mama Bear:Sabrent 6100mAh High Capacity External Backup Battery Charger Power Bank Charger with Dual USB Port (PB-BCBG)(roughly half the capacity of this 12,000mAh charger)Baby Bear:Sabrent Slim 3mm Credit Card Sized Charge Card Adapter for Micro USB with 400mAh Emergency External Battery Backup Charger Power Bank Charger (PB-RSCC)(roughly 1/30th the capacity of this charger).I was provided this item for review.
summary: Big Daddy Charger

reviewText: It is always a concern of mine:  Whether I can find a plug-in if I have to re-charge.  It is especially worrisome when I'm headed to the airport during a high-volume travel time.  And there is plenty else to worry about when one has a plane to catch, right?  Who wants to worry about charging up if you are stuck in an airport with throngs of people due to bad weather?  With this product, you will worry no more.  I am so glad to have it this holiday season!  You can bet that this baby will be in my purse tomorrow when I travel for Thanksgiving!It is a simple charger and does just what it claims to do on this product page.  The amount of charge that is promised and the length of time that it takes to charge is the max that it can do, and from what I've tested, your observations may vary--only slightly--depending on your device and how long you've been able to charge the power bank.  But what more do you need?  I think this charger is more than adequate for any challenging situation.So nice looking, too!  It is very svelte with its checkbook-slim-size, its matte black finish, its brushed silver metal trim and blue LED lights.  So right up my alley!Like way too many products--especially electronics--coming from China, the instructions are a joke and a mish-mash of English.  Sabrent is obviously aware that the the minimal "manual" (if you can call it that) is lacking, and they have provided easy-to-access technical assistance from their web site.*I received a sample product from Sabrent.
summary: Worried about finding a plug-in?

reviewText: Sabrent 12000mAh High Capacity External Backup Battery Charger Power Bank Charger with Dual USB Port (PB-W120) charged and the four indicator lights showed when it was fully charged.  I used to charge two Kindles at the same time to see if would live up to the description. One Kindle was a basic Kindle and the other was an 8.9 Tablet and both charged within an hour or maybe a little longer; I didn't time them but it wasn't very long.  Both were new and Christmas presents to I wanted to charge them before I wrapped them. The charge still showed three lights with power after this charge, so it appears to be able to be used on another devise if I had one that needed charged.  I am not a technical person but the charger worked for me.The charger was a gift to me from a friend.
summary: Sabrent 12000mAh High Capacity External Backup Battery Charger Power Bank Charger with Dual USB Port (PB-W120) by Sabrent

reviewText: Small extra battery/ phone charger great for emergency use or while out TravelingPros:Looks sleek and professional.Very easy to use.Lightweight and compact so easy to pack.Holds enough power to charge my phone multiple times.Cons:The instructions are poorly translatedJust so you know:Comes with one micro usb to usb power cord.I received this free of charge for an honest and fair reviewOverall a great product. I highly recommend it and give it 5 out of 5 stars.

reviewText: This product really packs a lot of power. it charged multiple smartphones at my workplace, MULTIPLE times before running out.It's generally meant for larger devices such as tablets and Ipads and you have to know which port is meant for which.I was pleasantly surprised of the quality and finish of the product and also the professional packaging.It's great that it has a dedicated port for both Apple and non-Apple products with indicators for when items are charged.The only down side is that it does not charge as fast as I would have hoped for but always nice to know that it is in the office just in case. Excellent Solid product! 4/5Pros+ Can charge smart phones multiple times+ Charge indicator+ Great packaging+ Excellent qualityCons- Does not charge as fast as I expected but still great to have.
summary: Powerhouse! Excellent Product to have around, great value!

reviewText: This powerbank has a lot of power for the price. 12,000mAh will charge my Kindle a few times as well as my smartphone and iPod. It will not charge my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet but most powerbanks do not have that ability.It has two USB ports for charging two devices at once. This feature works fine for me. It also has LED lights to let you know how much power is left in the powerbank.It has a very nice feel to it, a smooth but textured finish. Corners are rounded so if you put it in a briefcase or bag, it is not likely to scratch a leather folio or anything else.I was provided a unit for evaluation and an honest review.
