reviewText: The Sabrent 12000 mAh power bank has enough juice to give both my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet and my iPhone 4S a full charge and then some. It can charge two devices at once with its 2.1 amp and 1 amp ports.I like its slim profile, light weight, and matte fingerprint-free surface. It comes with a micro USB cable, the most universal of all connectors. It's a very simple design, not many bells and whistles, but I like it. Easy to carry, lots of power, and it charges quickly.This product was provided for review by Sabrent.
summary: A Solid Performer

reviewText: Disclaimer: I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.Okay, I actually received three chargers from Sabrent with mixed results. This one was the best of the three. In fact, I'd say this is the best external charger I've ever tested out. As has been stated in previous reviews, it is larger than the average charger. It will fit in your pocket, but more likely, you would keep it in your pack, briefcase, purse, etc....The appearance of the charger is quite sleek and wont look out of place regardless of where you keep it.But...the most important thing is its ability to charge devices. It does so like a champ. I was able to charge my Kindle Fire and my Samsung phone (both had been drained completely) and afterwards, still had 3/4 of a charge left in the charger. Most chargers hold enough to charge one device between half to all the way, whereas with this charger, you will definitely be able to charge upwards of 8 or 9 phones/devices before the charge is depleted. That makes this potentially the best value for an external charger you will find out there. I cant recommend this one enough.
summary: A true powerhouse.

reviewText: As is my usual preamble, I received this product free of charge in exchange for a review.  Also as usual my candid opinions follow.To the positive side, this is device that I never knew existed before it showed up on my doorstep.  It has a compact and sleek design and if you're a person who has need of such a thing, I'm not sure you can beat the exterior profile.  It's as simple as simple can be as it's basically just a battery in a box with a couple of output ports.  It doesn't get much simpler than that.  Lastly, the battery does seem to retain its charge well when idle.  The documentation states that it needs to be charged at least once every three months but that seems optimistic.  It did arrive in the package with a 75% charge out of the box.On the negative side, I do have trouble imagining how you could charge your iPhone "six to seven times" on a single charge of this battery as stated in the description.  In a couple days of testing I could see squeezing out four charges but certainly not six.  Also, the translation of the documentation is bad to the point of being funny: "Please charge your fully before using", "It is normal phenomenon when the product is a slight fever during charging."  Those looking for a good laugh may find this a positive thing rather than a negative.In summary, for those in need of such a thing this seems a reasonable choice.
summary: Compact, sleek and powerful

reviewText: Giant power supply with you in a compact form.  12000mAh of power packed in your backpack or purse. You can charge the Samsung Galaxy S4 multiple times. The unit is very slick and can be dropped in your backpack or car. Never leave home without one of these. Incredibly useful. When you are at work or home, just plug the battery charger power bank onto laptop and let it charge to its heart's content. When you are outdoors, this will be a lifesaver. I see maximum value when flying/long drive/metro rail commutes/camping etc.Not going into the detailed specs as it is in this Amazon page. 2 ports to charge - a tablet and a phone.. Highly recommend. I was provided this product in exchange of a fair and honest review.
summary: Take the power with you!

reviewText: The Sabrent 12000mAh High Capacity External Backup Battery Charger Power Bank Charger with Dual USB Port is my new “go to” power supply due to its high capacity and flat shape. The external backup battery market is one that is rapidly changing. Companies are providing more power in smaller packages which provides a lot of utility. Over the past year I have been doing a lot of research on these products. The Sabrent 12000mAh battery is one that is going to be an integral part of my go bag.Following are my observations on this unit.Pros:+ Provides a whopping 12000mAh of power+ Has two outputs: 1A and 2.1A+ It is long and thin making it easy to store in my go bag+ Has blue LED lights to indicate the amount of power that is remaining+ Lithium ion battery+ Can be used with many types of devices+ Comes with a micro USB cableCons:- It is a little heavy (8.96 ounces) but this is in no way a deal breaker- I wish it came with a little sleeve to store it inOverall Assessment:The Sabrent 12000mAh High Capacity External Backup Battery Charger Power Bank Charger with Dual USB Port is highly recommended due to the amount of power it provides and its sleek profile. This is an easy unit to store in your gear for those times when you require extra power. This unit provides piece of mind knowing that I have a lot of power for unexpected emergencies. Over the past few years there have been many disasters that have taken place where people have been without power for extended periods of time. It is only wise to have a backup power supply should the need arise. Even if there is no disaster your phone battery, iPad battery or other device can die at the worst possible time. The Sabrent is the answer to power you back up and keep your devices going.I was provided a complimentary product for testing and review.
summary: A Lot of Power in a Sleek Package

reviewText: ...and then start adding their portable devices. Yeah, you'll soon appreciate the convenience of the USB ports available to charge mobile devices (even more so on a longer trip or with riders you'd prefer remain quietly engaged with their electronics instead of asking you "are we there yet?").LED confirmation of DC power connectivity, and clearly labeled ports for one 2.4A and two 1.5A outlets.Nice charger.Note: this item was provided for review purposes.
summary: Take one car...add two or more people...

reviewText: This is great.  I am now able to charge 3 devices at once and the lowest charger is a 1.5a and the strongest is a 2.1a port. What is great about it is the size. Bolse has great designs and this one is much more compact then its last one and it has an extra port.  Very sleek looking too. I'm able to charge my note 2 in less than 1 hour for a full charge.  I received this item for a honest review.
summary: Awesome compact car charger!

reviewText: There never seem to be enough USB ports in the car. Two people with cell phones, headsets, a GPS, and who knows what else. So a 3-port car charger seems like a great idea.=== The Good Stuff ===* It was able to charge my iPad3, which is always my ultimate stress test for USB chargers. It was even able to charge my iPhone at the same time.* The iPad (high current) output has a black interior to the connector, so it is very easy to find, even in my Jeep where the cigarette lighter connectors are somewhat recessed.  The connectors are also labeled with small type, but if you remember that the black one is the high current, and the Android is at the bottom, you are good to go without ever trying to read the little type.* The "nose" fits far enough into the lighter so that it tends to stay well connected. My Jeep is 12 years old, so the lighter sockets are fairly well worn, but the springs on this adapter are snug enough to keep it in place.* There is no LED light. Feeling on this may vary, but I am all for stamping out annoying little "status" LED light pollution.= The Not-So-Good Stuff ===* Not really a negative of this particular device, but 3 cables can begin to get cluttered and tangled. Not a great thing to deal with at 70 mph on the freeway.* While the unit "flares" out a bit where the connectors are, plugging or unplugging the middle connector (with two other ones installed) is a bit of a trick. Most likely you will need to pull the whole assembly out of the lighter jack and then deal with it. Again, not a great idea at highway speeds.=== Summary ===It is a well designed and thought out little product. I have used it since the day I got it, and really appreciate the extra connectors in my vehicle since it means that I can leave cables connected even when I don't use them.Disclaimer: I received this unit as an evaluation sample direct from the manufacturer. I have no interests, financial or otherwise, in the manufacturer, suppliers or anyone associated with this product.
summary: Works As Advertised

reviewText: The way this device powers three mobile devices at once, yet have a small non-bulky design. The design was well thought out in the compactness for vehicles with multiple car ports in a small area.
summary: Small but powerful

reviewText: The Bolse 3-port USB car charger is a well-conceived tool for powering up several devices at one time – while you drive.The charger is stylish, solid, and clearly marked for the kind of charging designed for tablets, phones, cameras, or a variety of other small electronics that draw their charge through USB cords. Bolse boasts that their 27 watt/5.4 amp output is the most powerful USB car charger on the market, and I’ve found no evidence to the contrary.All ports are listed as “universal” with the following notations: Port 1 (1.5 amps) is meant for Apple devices, Port 2 (1.5 amps) for Android devices, and Port 3 (2.4 amps) is designed to take on tablets. There are two LED lights that inform the user as to whether the charger’s cords are properly connected. (Cords are not included; but in my experience that is standard.)It can fit in the palm of your hand, and therefore can easily be stored in a glove compartment or console.I’m extremely impressed with the “look” of the Bolse charger; frequently chargers are boxy and square. Such is not the case with this charger…it has a very classy white casing, and any 90-degree edges are encased in shiny aluminum. The charger looks terrific.The “insides” are well designed too: the circuitry is configured to shut off when charging is done. It cannot overheat; battery power is conserved.As for compatible devices, I used the Bolse to charge my Kindle Fire HD, my Motorola android, my daughter’s Samsung Galaxy, and my other daughter’s iPhone and iPad. Check the advertised specifications on the homepage to see what other gear might also be compatible.A 12-month manufacturer warranty is included.All in all I have found the Bolse to be an attractive, high-quality unit that delivers excellent worth for the price, which at the time of publishing this review was just under $13, delivered (with Prime membership). I can hardly imagine doing better.NOTE: I was supplied this product free of charge with no other conditions other than my writing a fair and honest review -- which this is.
summary: A Sleek, Well-designed Charger at a Great Price

reviewText: This review is from: Bolse High Output 3-Port USB Car Charger 27W / 5.4A for iPhone 5, 5S, 4S; Samsung Galaxy S4, S3, Galaxy Note 3, 2; iPad Air, 5, 4, mini; LG G2; Motorola and HTC (Wireless Phone Accessory)This is my third car charger and replaces the others without doubt. It's a Bolse 5.4A charger, so it puts out enough power to get the job done as quickly as possible. That's enough power to charge three devices at once.I charged my iPad, iPhone and earpiece all at the same time.Despite its power, this is a small device. I have no issues plugging it in or storing it in the car.For the price, I believe it's a great deal and excellent accessory for one's car. I was provided a sample for this review and have provided my honest opinion.
summary: Outstanding car charger

reviewText: With more and more things that need to be charged while driving (phones, cameras, iPads, etc.) Having a charger with multiple outputs has become essential.  This one is excellent.  It has three separate ports: one for tablets and two for everything else.  It's super-high quality and, like all Bolse products, it looks great.  I ordered a second one for my other car.
summary: The best car charger EVER!

reviewText: I was provided a Bolse High Output 3-Port USB Car Charger for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ This thing is very small for a 3 Port Charger. It only sticks out of your car's charging outlet about 1 inch.♦ Has three ports for a total of 5.4A output (a 2.4A Tablet port, a 1.5A Apple port and a 1.5A Android port).♦ Fast charging speeds for charging two devices concurrently, including an iPad.♦ Very compact for travel if you need to take a car charger with you on trips (renting a car at your destination for example).Detailed Review:♦ Look - The product came in tiny cardboard box with only a small sticker on it, no wasted packaging here.  Inside the box was the charger and a small instruction manual.  You see right away that this charger is surprisingly small for such a powerful 3-Port charger. It is the smallest one I've seen with these kind of specs.  It has three USB ports on the front, a 2.4A Tablet port, a 1.5A Apple port and a 1.5A Android port for a total of 5.4A output. It appears to have a very nice build quality.♦ Installation - As with any car charger, you basically just plug the unit into you car's charging outlet. Once plugged in, I noticed that the spring pushed back a little, but not enough to make it fall it.  Once in, the fit was pretty snug and secure.  No problems.  This charger makes most other 3-Port chargers look giant. My Pathfinder's charging outlets are on the side of the passenger area where a knee can easily bump the charger. This much smaller charger gives the passenger a little more leg room in my vehicle.♦ Use and Performance - Once installed, I did some basic tests to see how the Bolse car charger handles various charging situations. During my work commute, I took my iPhone 5 that had 48% charge remaining and I did a stand alone test using all ports for 5 minutes each.  The results are as follows:In the 2.4A Tablet port for 5 minutes increased the charge to 53%, or +5%.In the 1.5A Apple port for 5 minutes increased the charge to 58%, or +5%.In the 1.5A Android port for 5 minutes increased the charge to 63%, or +5%.Back in the 1.5A Apple port for 5 minutes increased the charge to 68%, or +5%.All ports worked great with my iPhone 5 and increased the charge on my phone by 1% per minute, which is right on par with most other chargers that I have tested.  I then plugged in my iPad 2 in the 2.4A Tablet port and it charged up just fine with my iPhone still in the 1.5A Apple port.  Individual and simultaneous charging tests were great.  I also plugged in my Bluetooth Music Receiver into the third port just for good measure with no problems.  For my situation, this was great with having several devices in my car on a regular basis.Conclusion:Overall, this is an amazing 3-Port Car Charger with really high power and great charging results.  It is really tiny and works great for multiple device vehicles.  At the time of this review, the price was $12.99 which really can't be beat with these kind of specs.  Highly Recommended!
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy!

reviewText: High amperage, solid handsome design, 3 ports!Bolse keeps bettering itself. This new car charger beats them all. Not only is it slick in design, it practically disappears when placed correctly in the cigarette lighter position. But the biggest advantage is that is has three ports, one at 2.4 A max and two at 1.5 A max – and for the novice at port insertions, each of the ports is labeled for tablet use, Apple use, and android use. The charge is fast and the device has built in protection circuitry to prevent overcharging, over heating and over current: when the charge is complete it just turns off and there are LED lights to indicate state of function.Bolse just keeps upping the ante as far as sophistication for devices to make management of your various devices more reliably manageable. Grady Harp, December 13
summary: High amperage, solid handsome design, 3 ports! ...

reviewText: I was surprised at how small this car charger is, given that it has the ability to charge three devices at once.  The ports are clearly marked for either tablets (2.4A), Apple (1.5A), or Android devices (1.5A).  Now that I have this device, I have little use for my chargers that have only one port.  I've used two of the ports simultaneously to charge my iPad and my iPhone.  It charges quickly with no noticeable decrease in speed with multiple devices attached.Note: I received a sample of this product in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Small in size and quick in charging

reviewText: Bolse 3-Port High Output USB Car Charger is a small charger that works great to charge up to two devices (all I had with me when I tried it). I liked that it was small and compact and did not take up extra space and was flat against the dash where it was in the cigarette plug. It is white, compact and sturdy and the smallest charger I have seen that will charge up to three different devises at one time as you drive down the road, which makes it very convenient for trips.I received this charger as a gift from a friend.

reviewText: I've tried a number of 2 and 3-port car chargers and most end up being big and bulky and in the way. This little charger is a gem. It fits snugly in my car and easily handles up to 3 phones/tablets charging at once. A great value for the cost!

reviewText: How many times were you sitting in a long road trip with all of your passengers using their phones while you driving peacefully and am confronted with a request in union from your friends:"Can we all charge our Ipads/Iphone/Smartphone/Tablets/Cameras/and every device known to man?"God bless the Bolse 3 port USB charger.I went on holiday with friends and ran into this exact situation.The charger is slick, efficient, and incredibly easy to use. You plug it into your car's adapter and you'll be charging 3 devices in no time at all.They are marked for your convenience and I was immediately charging multiple different devices out of the blue. I highly recommend any person looking for an everyday charger great for multiple devices or people.I'm going to say that this charger is one of the BEST ones in the market for the price and dependable quality and design make it no joke.Do yourself a favor and pick one up for your car.Pros:+ Easy to use+ Fast charge+ Great design (3 ports)+ Incredibly affordable+ Excellent qualtiyCons:- None
summary: Affordable, Simple, Convenient, and a Must have for your roadtrips!

reviewerName: Joel Avrunin "Electrical Engineer who loves S...
reviewText: Bolse has really outdone themselves with this high output car charger.  I have a drawer full of USB car chargers, and this has them all beat for size, power output, and style.  First, it is really small, just sticking out enough from the outlet to have 3 USB connectors.  It would be hard to imagine a USB cable plugging into anything much smaller.  Second, the housing of the USB connectors appears to be a brushed aluminum, giving the adapter a high quality look and feel.When you plug it in, two amber indicator lights let you know it has power.  This is especially useful when your car isn't running so you know if you are on a switched outlet.  The top port has 2.4A and is able to easily charge an iPad, while the bottom two are labeled 1.5A Apple and 1.5A Android.  I suppose if you had an Android tablet that required >1.5A, then it might not charge quickly.  But for Apple products, it works great.Given the low price combined with the functionality, this gets my unequivocal recommendation.  It is an excellent car accessory.Note: I was sent a free sample by the manufacturer in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Stop looking elsewhere - this is the car charger you want - Great styling, high power, small size, low price

reviewText: This is a small charger, about the size of a dual port one, but it offers three ports. Each is clearly labeled: 1 amp each for Android and Apple, and 2.1 for a tablet. The design is attractive, too: brushed steel surface for the ports and a plastic body.The charger sits in the car's charging port firmly, once you make sure it's pushed in securely. It lights up with two small amber LED lights in the middle of the unit, discreet but visible. This helps as it confirms the plug is actually in and working. This feature's a plus as some chargers lack this LED and you aren't sure if the unit's on or not.Finally, it's compact, barely bigger than a single or dual port charger. I like the dual 1 amp output as my wife has an iPhone and I have a Droid, for instance, and the tablet port can also charge a Kindle. It works well and fits easily for storage, but it's not so small it's easily misplaced. Even with more than one port filled in, the unit stays securely in place in the plug.
summary: Fits three devices in the ports at once

reviewText: TheBolse 3-Port High Output USB Car Chargeris the ideal tool for keeping charged in the car for the road warriors out there. This charger features 3 (three) total USB charging ports allowing you to charge up to 3 (three) devices simultaneously.  With 27W and 5.4 total Amps of power, this charger is meant to get the most power to your device, getting you charged quicker and on your way.The charger features three USB charging ports one rated at 1.5A with special circuitry designed for picky apple devices, one at 1.5A with special circuitry for picky Android devices, and the third at 2.4Amps powerful enough to charge most tablets. All three ports are clearly labeled and easy to see which is which.  With a total output capacity of 5.4A, you are able to use all three ports without any slowdown.  I did so this past weekend charging my Android tablet, Android phone and my friends phone during a long car drive.  We were all powered up by the time we got to the destination, which is quite impressive and speaks to the power of this car charger.Overall, theBolse 3-Port High Output USB Car Chargeris built well and functions as it should. It's a good investment for anyone who travels often and needs to keep powered in the car.  It's perfect for long trips with the kids to keep all their gear powered in the backseat.Disclosure: I want you to know I received a sample product from the manufacturer for the purposes of providing this review. However, a review in exchange for the review sample was not promised. The views and opinions expressed in this review are my own, and in no way represent the views or opinions of the manufacturer or vendor.
summary: Really Compact, Great Amount Of Power, Excellent Solution...

reviewText: I've tried out one port car chargers and two port but the last three port charger I used was huge. Bolse has created a solid three-port charger that takes up the least amount of space as possible. It works really well charging my phone and bluetooth. I did try my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet and that didn't work but it never usually does on a car charger. And really, I don't usually need to charge it in the car anyway.There is an unobtrusive LED light to indicate that it is plugged in and working.Well made and works great!
summary: Very Compact, Works Great!

reviewText: I'm impressed with the Bolse 3 port High Output car charger. It is designed with over-heated, over-current, over-charging protection & will  automatically stop charging when your device's battery is full.It fits snugly in the cigarette lighter outlets of our Civic, Malibu, & Toyota. The compact design, which measures about 2 1/8" long, assures that it doesn't get in the way like a longer charger does. Because  of its high output, 27W/5.4A, I was able to quickly charge  my iPod Touch 4G, Kindle Fire HD & Kindle Fire HDX at the same time. The two tiny LED lights assure the car charger is plugged in correctly & working. The 3 ports are clearly labeled (2.4A tablet, 1.5A Apple, 1.5A Android)sample provided for an honest review
summary: Wow!  Compact, High Output, 3 port USB car charger

reviewText: The Bolse 3-Port USB Car Charger is different from other car chargers I've used.  The exposed portion is a brushed aluminum with a polished rim, very precisely manufactured and very attractive.  It's also only about 1 7/16 in. tall and 3/4 in. wide.  It sticks out about 1/2 in. when in use.It has three ports, one at 2.4 A max and two at 1.5 A max.  They are labelled clearly, "Tablet", "Apple", and "Android", top to bottom, and all three can be used at the same time.  The higher-than-usual current provided will give many electronic devices an extra-fast charge, but it has protective circuits to prevent overcharging.This charger fits into the cigarette lighter port easily but stays firmly in place.  There are tiny LEDs to indicate that it is operative, very unobtrusive even at night.A sample was provided for testing and review.  This Bolse USB car charger has a unique design and high amperage and with all those advanced features, it really can't be compared fairly to any others that I have used—it's definitely a top-quality charger.
summary: Unique triple-port charger with high amperage and aluminum face

reviewText: I've had many car chargers and most are good, but rather large.  This new Bolse charger only sticks out from the charger by less than one inch. With 3-ports (2.4A for tablets, 1.5A for Apple products and 1.5A for Android) you can fully charge three devices at once.  Note that the only drawback is finding place in your car to place them all.  Of course, each one would need its own USB connector cable.It's also very light and the grip is tight with expandable shaped bulbs.  Even though it says it can charge 5.4A at once, it depends on the capacity of your car charger output.  Some don't reach more than 3.0A, so check your vehicle.  Regardless, it will charge.  It's also nice to know that the circuitry is designed so there is no over-heating, over-current problems or over-charging.  Plus, the charging will be automatically stop when the battery is full.  It is a bit of a higher price than most, but then again, there are not many chargers that can accomplish what this one does.  Product supplied for review.
summary: Three USB ports For All Options!

reviewText: I received a review sample and was surprised by the size when I unpacked it. Overall the body is a tiny two inches long and the oval portion that houses the three USB ports is a mere one and half inches across. After inserting in your lighter receptacle it protrudes an inch and a quarter. So a big plus to Bolse for designing a multi-port charger in a form factor that will fit even the most cramped space.The ports are sufficiently spaced to allow me to insert three very heavy-duty USB connectors with wiggle room to spare (albeit, not much). I use these cables to test multi-port chargers and hubs because in many cases they are too large to fit tightly spaced adjacent ports. Surprisingly all three fit into the charger.At first I was peeved that this charger did not provide access to an internal fuse (the body is solid). Upon reflection I am not sure that is an important feature on modern charging systems. I cannot recall the last time I actually replaced a fuse in a charger, but I have vivid memories of cheaply made ones coming loose at the threaded section that housed fuses. I think I like this design better than the old style. A further advantage is I spend a lot of time on the Atlantic coast and the salt air rapidly deteriorates electrical and electronic gear. For my locale this sealed unit is perfect and will assure a longer service life.This tested perfectly in my 2008 Mazda 3's charger socket, including a Samsung Galaxy Note 3 with GPS active, an iPad and iPhone 4S. All three devices simultaneously charged at the same rate thy did when plugged individually into my old single-port charger. That test validates the claims made in the product description. However, do heed  Martin A Hogan's very helpful December 9, 2013 review regarding car lighter socket output. If yours does not put out the full 5.4 amps that this one needs you are not going to get the full benefit of this charger's design capabilities.
summary: Conmpact and well constructed

reviewText: I have tried Bolse products in the past; some have been hits (themicro USB cord, so very well made and sturdy) and some have been misses (theBolse 4 Port Wall Charger, I think it was a manufacture issue). Well, this one is a hit. I have long commutes for work everyday and I live off my e-devices, by noon my iPhone battery is depleted. At any given time whilst driving I am trying to charge my iPhone, iPad andEnergizer iPhone Charging Case(this thing is a life saver). The problem is that I only have one car charger port and one USB port in my car. Well, this item has made my life a lot easier. I can charge all three devices in one port. I still leave my iPhone connected to the car USB port so it connects to the car stereo.The car charger is small, very small. My center console is already crowded as it is, so I appreciate this greatly. I also appreciate I can get rid of several bulky car chargers in lieu of using this device with the much slimmer USB cables.The charger works very well. To date I have no issues and everything is charging quickly. It has designated ports for apple, android and tablets. You may ask yourself why this is and you will find out as soon as you get an non-apple brand charger for your phone or tablet. Apple devices are very picky when it comes to chargers and I have had several which it refuses to recognize. No such problems here.Overrall, a quality device, a fast charging device and a small footprint.Ii received this complimentary item from the manufacturer for the purpose of an honest review.
summary: Good quality 3 port charger with a small footprint

reviewText: This USB car charger stands out from the rest because it has three USB ports: one 2.4 amp port, two 1.5 amp ports.I've been using the charger all over town, but today, I decided to charge three tablets all at once. It handled them all with ease.This is a small charger. Though it does not sit flush with the dashboard, it does not stick out too much either. My biggest problem with it is it sometimes falls loose. I have to make sure to push it in and check that it stays connected. For that inconvenience, it loses one star.This product was provided for review by LowerPriceUSA.
summary: Charges 3 Tablets at Once

reviewText: A compact design with sufficient power and a good density of USB ports, but the small size is a bit awkward in my Honda Civic's 12V socket.Three outlets is a good number, for his-and-hers mobile devices and a possible third item like a tablet or headset. I was also pleased by the 1.5A (non-tablet) ports, since on on many chargers, it's only 1A.  The higher power is handy for devices like my Nexus5 (whose native charger is rated at 1.2A instead of 1A like my previous phones).The compact size keeps the unit out of the way, but it's almost too small for my Honda Civic's power socket-- the charger doesn't extend past the socket's flip-down cover, which makes it a little awkard to plug/unplug cables. I also found the charger pulled out of the power socket too easily if I tugged on the USB cables.[ I was given this product to review. I received no compensation, and this review is my honest opinion. ]Nice features: LED's illuminate when the charger is correctly plugged in, and the unit is designed to prevent over-charging.
summary: high power, enough outlets, but small design is a bit awkward

reviewText: Disclaimer: I received this product in exchange for an honest reviewI've actually gone through a few car chargers from a variety of companies. So far, the average life (for the one's I've used) seems to be around 3 months. This is one thing I cant report on with this charger yet. I will update this in April accordingly.However, for now, what I can report is that the charger actually works very well. I was actually able to bring my phone from dead to 100% charge in about 35 minutes, which I thing is pretty fast, at least based on my experience. The device itself is pretty tiny. It definitely wont be obtrusive at all. When it's plugged in, there are blue lights highlighting the ports, which is great for nighttime use. Each of the ports is also clearly labelled, also a nice feature.That's pretty much it. I've used it to charge my phone (a Blackberry), my wife's phone (same), our Kindle Fires, and a few external chargers actually. It's been great so far. Glad to have tried it out.
summary: Quick charging beast.

reviewText: If you find yourself on long road trips, like I do, this is the perfect charger to keep that iPod or iPad charged.  I frequently make 10-hour trips, and it doesn't really matter if I start out with a fully charged device or not; I'm going to need a charge at some point during the trip.  This does the job.  It fits perfectly in the lighter socket, and I can continue to listen to my iPad while driving.I have not attempted to charge more than one device at a time, but I feel sure I could do so when necessary.This is the third Bolse device I have owned, and I am coming to be a big fan of Bolse.  Their devices work like that should without a hitch.  I am happy to recommend it to others who make road trips.This review is made on the basis of a sample sent to me by the manufacturer.
summary: Great Little Charger to Have on Long Road Trips

reviewText: This unit has three ports; one of them delivers a hefty 2.4 amps and the other two deliver a respectable 1.5 amps each. What is very interesting, though, is that all three can deliver full power simultaneously. (I would only do this for very long if the car engine is running, as you're drawing 27 watts plus losses. Not recommended for overnight use unless you want to really drain the battery.)This means you can charge three different items at once at a good rate of charge, for instance a tablet and two cell phones. Just watch the wires!The unit has overcurrent, overcharge, and overtemperature protection. I consider all of these important for protecting your devices and especially preventing a fire.The biggest problem with car chargers is fragility. The plastic on the housing of this one looks pretty solid. I think it will last with normal care. Be careful plugging/unplugging both into the car's power socket and USB terminations into/out of the unit, and you should get long service from this device.The second biggest problem is size and awkwardness. This unit is quite compact and doesn't stick out too far from the socket. That is a bigger deal than it sounds; it's less likely to be broken by accident, it's easier to plug/unplug your devices, and it looks better.This is a very good unit at an attractive price. It does what it says it does, which is providing lots of power to lots of devices.Disclaimer: I received a sample for review, but my reviews always are unbiased and direct.
summary: Compact design and delivers a lot of power

reviewText: As usual I paid nothing for this item but I'll nevertheless give my candid thoughts below.OK, so this is a simple car charger so I'm not really sure how you can mess it up.  It fits snuggly in the socket and does the job of charging without complaint.  The magic of this thing is that it's got three ports which I can see ending so many car-based arguments.  A few months ago I spent $20 on a single-port charger and then this 3-port comes along.  Now I can charge my phone at the same time the kids charge their 47 random things.  Quite a lifesaver and cheaper than the 1-port charger I bought in the store.The only remotely negative thing that has occurred so far is that the USB plugs themselves aren't particularly snug.  Charging from the back seat with a cord that's just barely long enough we had a few instances of the plug pulling free a bit.  Just something to keep an eye on.
summary: This is going to stop so many car arguments!

reviewText: This car charger is the best one that I have found! I love that it has three ports. I have a small car that only has one accessory plug and it tends to be the one thing in the car that the grand children love to fight for. This fits three separate lines. Although each port is labeled differently, Apple,Tablet and Android, I plug three Iphones into it and they charge with no problems. The tablet slot is for 2.4A devices and the other two slots are 1.5A. I also love the sleek design. It fits nicely and does not protrude out very far. It is the smallest one I've seen with three ports. It packs a punch though. It doesn't slow down when charging more than one device. It has an LED light to show that it is connected and working but my favorite part is the fact that it stops charging when your battery is full. That is awesome. I love this company, they are always doing more to save our devices and bring out standing products! All in all this is the only car charger I will ever need because it is enough to fit all my needs. I received this product for a fair and honest review.
summary: A must for those with multiple devices

reviewText: Lets face it: most homes today have a plethora of portable electronic devices that require periodic charging. In addition, I would say that most households also have at least two cell phones (if not more), and maybe an e-Reader. And if anyone knows the joy of traveling long distances with children, you know that it is of the utmost importance to keep them occupied and their toys charged so that they won't resort to "MOOOOOOOOOOooooooooooooooooooom, Brian's touching me!" every five minutes. The complication is that vehicles tend to only have one cigarette lighter/port, meaning that you can only have one thing charging at a time.That is where the Bolse 3-Port USB Car Charger comes in. The idea for it is so simple: why only have one USB charging port when you can have three?ConstructionThe Bolse High Output 3-Port USB Car Charger (henceforth abbreviated as B3PCC) is sleek, simple, and feels durable. I used it successfully in the two cars of my household: a 2008 Dodge Caliber ST and a 2007 Chevy Silverado. In both instances I was able to push the charger so that the back of the USB port housing was flush against the dash. The three USB ports were easy to access and they accommodated each USB device that I attempted to charge.The B3PCC is designed to offer different amperages through the ports. From top to bottom:Port 1: 2.4A (Tablet)Port 2: 1.5A (Apple)Port 3: 1.5A (Android)While you will get the best performance results by using the port that is optimal for your device, you can still use any port on the charger without fear of damaging your gadget. As indicated in the product description, this charger will stop itself when it detects that the battery is full, so no worries! And, as an additional perk, the ports are easy to identify: the first port has a black outlet stop (the part that prevents the plug from going too far into the port), and the bottom two have white stops. When you’re driving and cannot take the time to read the port labeling (it is rather small text), this is indispensable.PerformanceTo keep this short and sweet, the B3PCC is WONDERFUL! I obtained the best results when I went on a trip across the state to take care of some appointments. While only a three-hour drive, the flexibility of being able to charge both my boyfriend’s cell phone and mine, as well as my Kindle Fire HD, at the same time was liberating. No more jockeying for who can charge their device first, or remembering to switch out one device for another. All three devices hooked up, and the best part, all charged VERY quickly!I also tested out my iPod Touch (4th gen) with the Apple port; I like to plug my iPod into my stereo on long trips and being able to keep it fully charged so that it will work for the entire trip is important. I just plugged it in and left it there the entire day. With the auto shutoff feature to prevent overcharging the battery I was able to safely keep my iPod charged and had excellent music for the duration of my trip!OverallThis item is a must-have. It is simple in design but big in use. If you have multiple devices that require charging and you know that you will be on a long car trip, the Bolse 3-Port USB Car Charger is a must-have. It has room for three devices, is easy to operate, and will actively protect your battery by cutting itself off when it detects that the gadget is at a full charge. Keep your entire family happy and charged up and purchase this charger; I guarantee that you will wonder how you ever lived without it!**Disclaimer: This charger was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**
summary: Indispensable & Functional; What's not to love?

reviewText: I received this at no cost in exchange for writing a review. Here is why I like it.This charger looks nice, is extremely compact (only 2 1/4 inches long), and packs a lot of punch. With a 5.4A output it permits me to simultaneously charge an iPad, iPhone 4S and Nexus 2013 tablet. Of course you have to supply your own charging cords.The ports are all clearly labelled, so I know exactly where to plug in each gadget.Bottom line: A quality product that delivers what it promises.
summary: Excellent charger

reviewText: My car has a built-in USB input that allows me to play my iPod through the stereo; however, its charging function is somewhat limited. I go on a fair amount of road trips with friends who navigate via apps on their phones, but this quickly drains the battery and my car's USB input doesn't always charge their devices. Thus, Bolse's cigarette lighter adaptor is a welcome solution.It offers three options for charging so that you can get the fastest, most effective charge for your particular device. It claims to be "high output," although I'm not entire sure if it's more effective than anything else. It does a good job charging my iPhone, but I wouldn't characterize the speed as extraordinary or anything. I'm not sure what sort of power it is able to draw from my cigarette lighter, so your results may vary. It's certainly not a slow charge, but it's not fast enough for me to tell if it actually IS charging my phone faster than other methods.The unit is very small and well designed. It's unobtrusive and you can leave it in your car without devoting a lot of space to it. The price is excellent, which is pretty typical of Bolse products.The only downside is that you need to have the necessary cables to actually connect your phone or tablet. This isn't Bolse's problem, but it is a downside to this type of car charger. I have a different cigarette lighter charger that terminates in an Apple 30-pin connector, which has come in handy a number of times when my phone was dying and I didn't have its cable with me. With a USB charger, you need to plan ahead (or keep an extra cable on hand) if you're going to use it. That said, this type of car charger may or may not be right for you.If you like the idea of a USB charger and you're okay keeping a spare cable or two in your car, this is a great device.Disclosure: I received this product to review. I did not allow that fact to influence my review.
summary: Well made, good price, nice design.

reviewText: The Bolse 3 USB 5.4 amp car charger is a must have for those who want to be able to charge many devices simultaneously in a car.The charger has 3 USB ports. 1 is 1.5 amps for Apple devices, another is 1.5 amps for Android devices and the other is 2.4 amps for tablets. This is a powerful car charger. I really like this car charger and I plan to use a lot so I don’t have to fight for a car outlet with my family.Overall this is one of my favorite car chargers. I recommend this to anyone who goes around with many USB chargeable devices or a family who fights to charge their devices on long car rides.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation, and I promised that my review is fair and honest.
summary: Very powerful car charger with 3 USB ports

reviewText: For the price range of this speaker, it has a 4 star value.  Personally,  I don't think I would buy this particular speaker but that doesn't mean it is a good one. Let me give you the pros and cons of it and it should help anyone planning to purchase it.Pros:Good sized speaker with a hook to it on the shower arm.  The volume cab be quite loud when it's turned up all the way and I almost never found the reason to turn it up that high except to test it. I gave it a few days to let the speaker stretch and hear the sound when it stabalize and I noticed that the treble was high and clear. The fm radio works like a charm too. Volume control on it was very responsive too.Cons:The power button had too many functions.  Depending on the length of the hold-it can be turned on, off, fm or Bluetooth,  and Bluetooth pairing.  Way too many functions for me.  I kept getting confused on what function I was on.  There is no led indicator to trek you what station you are on in fm mode.  The bass quality was a little lacking but understandable for the size and price range of the item.I think that about covers it.  My main beef with it is the power button controls.  They should have split up the functions some more which is my real Nain reason I had to drop it a star.  I would have really liked it more if they just either added another button or simply make it just as a Bluetooth speaker.I received this item for a honest review.
summary: Nice speaker for the shower for the price range

reviewText: I love waterproof Bluetooth speakers like this Abco one for listening to the news in the morning while I'm getting my shower and doing my hair and makeup. I listen to my morning news talk radio station via my iPhone using the iHeartRadio application. Before using a Bluetooth speaker, I would just listen through the speakers on my phone and try and set my phone close enough to the shower I could hear it, but far enough away it wouldn't get splashed with water.Now it's not an issue. I can pair my phone with this shower speaker and not worry about keeping my iPhone close enough to me that it might get damp. I can set my phone on my towel shelf in the bathroom, several feet away from the sink and the shower. I've had no trouble pairing the Bluetooth with my phone, and it holds the connection without any troubles. I leave it running even when I'm done in the shower and doing my hair and makeup. Even playing the audio from inside the shower it's still clearer than listening to it through the iPhone speakers. The hook on the top makes it easy to hang from things like towel racks, shower heads or the little hook in the bathtub you might use to hold your poofy back sponge on.Very handy for using in the bathroom so I can listen to the morning news. Sample unit provided for an unbiased review.
summary: Listen to your morning talk/news radio while getting ready for the day

reviewText: Our expectations have been set a little low with shower speakers, but the abco tech waterproof speaker was a very welcome surprise. The volume control makes it loud enough for a shower and the sound quality is great. It also has FM radio. I was listening to queen and was honestly surprised at how good the quality of the sound was.This is the shower speaker I'll be keeping in my shower. I also like the hook, which works better than the suction cups for us.Product provided for honest review
summary: Shower music

reviewText: This device is definitely cool, it has a plastic large plastic hook that allows you to hang it on a shower head and you can listen to your favorite FM station in the morning while you shower for either weather reports or your favorite morning DJ. You can link it to a Bluetooth device to listen to music or even to answer the phone. It runs off of an internal battery charge so there is no danger of electric shock.There are four buttons on the front, a power button for the FM radio, two buttons to adjust the volume up and down and a call key for the phones. The device worked very well although to be honest, the phone feature was not tested. I have a fundamental aversion to talking on the phone while I am in the shower.Some people will find this device completely uninteresting because they consider time in the shower to be too private for anything but the cleaning process. However, if you are like me and enjoy listening to music in the shower, then you will love it.
summary: Great for listening to music or your favorite morning show while in the shower

reviewText: This is a terrific little speaker designed for the shower.  It paired with my iPad quickly and easily over bluetooth and allows me to listen to music, and even answer phone calls while taking a bath or shower.  I had an older shower speaker that cost about the same amount but was difficult to use and didn't sound nearly as good as this one.  The old one also used batteries where this one recharges conveniently with a usb cable (I love usb rechargeable electronic devices!)Not only can I listen to music over bluetooth and answer calls, but I can also use it as a stand-alone FM radio.  The first time I used this I accidentally dropped it into a full bathtub.  I thought for certain that it was ruined (there's a difference between splash-proof and waterproof - and I assumed this shower speaker was splash-proof,) but I pulled it out and it was still playing music and has kept on working perfectly.  I would definitely recommend this shower speaker to anyone looking for a sound system for the bath or shower.
summary: Excellent shower speaker

reviewText: This combo Bluetooth Speaker is great for listening to FM Radio or Songs in the shower. It has many advantages that I list below.PROS:1) Pairing/Connecting - Once I pressed the correct function from the multi-purpose Power Button, it did pair with my tablet and my Android phone just fine.*Helpful hint: Be sure to turn on your Android device's Bluetooth FIRST before you attempt to pair/connect it with this Bluetooth Speaker. Then turn on the Bluetooth speaker and let your phone or tablet search for devices. This makes it so much easier to pair/connect. Once it is paired for the first time, the next time connecting is so easy!2) Sound Quality / LoudnessLOUDNESS - For a smaller speaker, in the shower even with the water on full force, the sound is VERY LOUD (can be turned down).*Helpful hint for you about loudness: First, if you plan on listening to songs from your Playlist from your phone on this, adjust the phone's sound FIRST to your liking and louder than you think because you will need it kind of loud in the shower. Also you can turn the volume UP OR DOWN on the Bluetooth speaker by using the top or bottom (on the left side)buttons.SOUND QUALITY on this speaker:The sound quality is very good to excellent for such a small unit. So I compared this to a larger Bluetooth Speaker that I own and use (that is not waterproof one like this one is) that I have and the sound was very, very close in sound quality and loudness. The overall Treble is quite good and for me, the Bass is pretty good as well. This is a huge plus for this Bluetooth speaker!3) FM Radio - Since I live on top of a hill and near a mountain and lots of trees, usually I cannot get FM that well in Bluetooth types of devices/radios. However, this one was able to CLEARLY pickup two of my favorite stations loud and clear and they stayed on while in the shower.CONS:1) The device's Power On has many multi-purposes on it. Personally, I would have preferred to see a dedicated BLUETOOTH ON/OFF button and also a POWER ON/OFF Button. As it is now this ONE BUTTON does all of these:--Turns on the device--Turns on Bluetooth.--Turns off Bluetooth--Turn on the FM Radio.--Serves as a charging indicator (when you turn it off and then plug in the USB cable, then the light changes to a NON BLINKING RED. This unit took some patience on my part because of the Power Button doing too many things at once, but I was able to get it working fine and this is just a very minor thing really for me personally.Overall, I like this speaker OK, it is loud and clear, but there are two things I really DO NOT LIKE AT ALL:1) The charger that came with this is propriety, and should I misplace or lose this, I cannot charge this speaker.2) The unit is really too loud in my opinion. It always begins VERY loud and does not keep the level of loudness where I last set it.
summary: Works OK but has a proprietary charger

reviewText: For not a lot of money, this funny waterproof Bluetooth speaker delivers pretty good sound. Just don't lose that USB charging cable - it is a unique cable and you don't have one laying around the house.The sound is reasonably good. There is some bass - you shouldn't expect to thump in the shower. Highs are well controlled and work well to fairly light volume. Frankly, this speaker surprised me.This is a three trick pony: simple Bluetooth playing from a compatible device - iPhone / iPad works great, FM radio, and speakerphone (yeah exactly what I want to do, talk to somebody while I'm naked in the shower - that just seems all wrong - fortunately it isn't a four trick pony with added camera). Bluetooth is fairly straightforward - press the power button and the unit starts in pairing mode. Turn on your device, look for BTS-19 in the Bluetooth control panel, select that device, and after a few seconds the two will pair. When you press the track forward or backward button music will play. This is where things get weird - quickly press either button to advance tracks, hold down the upper button to decrease volume and hold down the lower button to increase volume. This is tricky to master, but eventually you'll get the hang of it.If you get a phone call the music will mute, the phone will ring, to answer the call press the phone button on the right side. Be ready, they will hear the shower and anything else you're doing in there. Enjoy talking to people naked and wet.The last function is a weird little bonus - FM radio. If you tap the power button once, the speaker will change to FM radio. When you press the track forward or backward the radio station changes. There's no way to tell what station you've dialed in, it just goes to the next strong station with every press. The reception was surprisingly good. Quick press the power button to return to Bluetooth.To turn off the speaker you have to hold down the power button for a good five or six seconds. The little LED will turn white / purple.The charge port is on the rear and covered by a rubber flap. The charger is via USB but the business end is a round jack that looks like a small laptop charger connector. If you lose the cable, you'll have to go to Radio Shack and buy a universal AC adapter - dial it to 5V and find a tip that fits. Honestly, this is the single worst design feature of a really good product.Curiosity got me - I had to see if this speaker can be taken apart. Turns out it was pretty easy to get inside - the rubber shoulders remove easily and the case is held together with four screws. The construction is quite good. There is an O-Ring that seals out water from between the two halves. The speaker has a rubber cone, so it can take a lot of water and still work. I recognized the electronics from the little barrel speakers, this is a good thing. There is a big beefy battery. The antenna are really long and wrap all the way around inside the speaker - that is why the FM reception is so good.The price is right, the sound good, and you get good tunes in the shower, or other wet area.I was provided a review sample.
summary: Fun

reviewText: I was provided an Abco Tech Waterproof Wireless Bluetooth Shower Speaker for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ This speaker looks fun with a nice design and vibrant colors (I got a pink one for the kids).♦ It sounds great and produces a high enough volume so you have no problem hearing it clearly in the shower.♦ Has basic controls on the unit to play/pause, adjust volume and skip forward and backwards in your song list.♦ Hook rotated and adjusted to be able to hang in various locations (towel bar, shower caddy, shower head).♦ It has a rechargeable battery that charges with a proprietary USB cable (included) that could be a problem if lost or broken.Detailed Review:♦ Look - The product came in a plastic display box that showed the product right through the packaging and had product information on all sides.  Inside the box was the speaker, a proprietary USB charging cable and an instruction manual.  The speaker looks good and had a nice pink color.  It has rubberized buttons and a rubber cover that closes off the charging port.  On the front, it has various buttons that have a play/pause button, two combined FF/RW and volume buttons, a power button and a speakerphone button with microphone.  The hanging hook moved from side to side and rotated to give multiple hanging options.  It looks like it is built well.♦ Use and Performance - I plugged in the included USB charging cable into the unit and into my computer to give it an initial charge before testing it out.  Once the speaker was charged, I easily paired it to my iPhone 5S a did a variety of tests to try it out.Test #1 (Sound Quality Test) - At my desk, I tried out a variety of music from some Disney kids songs to Michael Bublé to Excision Bass Heavy Dubstep (the Destroid album), and the speaker performed great.  It reached pretty high volumes while still maintaining good clarity.  It sounded really good overall for a single speaker setup that is focused on being a shower speaker, not a HiFi speaker.Test #2 (Shower Test) - I then tried it out in the shower.  I started playing a playlist on my phone and left it on the counter about six feet away from the shower.  You have to get the music going on your device first because you can only really do pause/play and skip songs backwards and forwards.  Best bet is to use a playlist or shuffle several songs. In the shower, the sound was really good.  It got very loud at times, so much so, that I had to turn it down by holding down the RW button (which controls volume also).  The controls were great for moving between songs and adjusting the volume.  During my shower, I hung the speaker in various locations on the shower caddy facing forward and sideways and over the shower head pipe.  I then had my wife take my phone out of the bathroom and walk it across the house.  It stayed connected until it got pretty far from the bathroom, at least a 15 foot range through a few walls.  Plenty of range if you want to leave your phone outside of the bathroom and away from all that humidity.  I also tried out Siri by pressing the phone button, which worked pretty well, but not really something I would do much due to the shower noise.Conclusion:Overall, this was a nice shower speaker.  It sounded great and had nice controls.  It has a lot of hanging options and works well in my initial test.  I also tested out the Abco Suction Cup Model Shower Speaker and bought a second one as a gift.  Both types of speaker work great.  If you are looking for a fun shower speaker that sounds good and works well, this one is a great choice. Highly Recommended!
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy!

reviewText: ABCO has come up with another waterproof speaker for Bluetooth media players - one that comfortably hangs from the showerhead without the fear of shortage or impairment. It has a built in rechargeable lithium-ion battery that maintains its charge for a surprisingly long time. The speaker is designed to receive music from all Bluetooth media players (iPhone, iPad, Smartphones, etc with a working distance of about 30 feet) but it also has two unique functions: it can receive (and play back in high quality sound) FM stations via auto-scanning radio function from hybrid radios FM stations of your choice which can be substituted for music from Bluetooth devices, and if has a high sensitivity microphone so that should you wish to answer telephone calls from your phone while showering, that is also possible.About the only feature not added to this device is video - and let's hope ABCO doesn't decide to advance (or regress!) to that state of the art reception/transmission!  But kidding aside, this wireless Bluetooth/FM shower speaker is a welcome device to any home, especially for the guest bath. For excellent safe reception of music, radio and telephone signals in an aqueous environment this little gadget is a great success. Grady Harp, December 13
summary: Shower Music to start your day on key!

reviewText: I received one of theseAbco Tech Waterproof Wireless Bluetooth Shower Speaker Auto FM Shower Radio Compatible with all Bluetooth Devices, iPhone 5 Siri and All Android devices (Aqua)to try last week and it has been making the rounds.  My daughter and I have used it in both the kitchen and the bath (hers and mine), paired it with a couple of different cell phones and an iPad, scanned for radio stations, taken phone calls and even talked to Siri.  Here's what we found -The unit is great in the shower - not bothered by the moisture, clear and very loud.  We found the controls easy to learn and use.  The hook made it very easy to hang from either the shower head or the shower curtain rod.  I also hung this over my sink in the kitchen for music while I was doing dishes.  It has an IPX4 rating.▶︎ IPX stands for Ingress Protection Rating or International Protection Rating, a code published by the International Electrotechnical Commission.  It classifies the protection a device provides against things like dust, water, and accidental contact. IPX4 means that  water splashing against the outside will have no harmful effect.  To achieve an IPX4 rating a device is tested for 5 minutes with a water volume of 10 liters per minute under 80-100 kPa pressure.The speaker comes with both an AC wall adapter and a USB cable.  The jack inlet is located on the back of the unit under a waterproof seal.  A full charge takes 3-4 hours when using the AC wall adapter.  A single charge provides 7-8 hours of listening time.Pairing the unit with your device is easy.  Turn on Bluetooth on the device that you wish to use, then press the Power button on the right front of the speaker until you get a pink light (on) and then continue to hold another five seconds until you see alternating red and blue, indicating that the device is in pairing mode.  You can then choose the speaker from the list of devices in your phone or tablet.  Single tap the backwards and forwards buttons on the left side of the front of the unit to go to the previous or next track.To switch between Bluetooth and the FM radio, press the power button once.  Use the backwards and forwards buttons to the left of the unit (single tap) to auto-search for channels.  (We got surprisingly good reception and more channels than we had any idea were available here in the wilds of Vermont.)Volume is controlled with the same buttons on the left front of the unit that are used to change tracks or stations.  Press and hold to increase or decrease the volume.Answering calls is equally easy.  Simply tap the Call button.  Additionally, we tested placing  calls through  a Bluetooth-connected iPhone 5C with good results.  Press the call button once, then tell Siri who to call.  Easy-peasy!  The unit also makes a tone if you receive a text message.Grandma's $0.02 -  TheAbco Tech Waterproof Wireless Bluetooth Shower Speaker Auto FM Shower Radio Compatible with all Bluetooth Devices, iPhone 5 Siri and All Android devices (Aqua)is remarkably full-featured and provides good sound with lots of flexibility for a reasonable price.  Four thumbs up!Recommended
summary: Great Flexibility, Easy to Use

reviewText: Pairing the shower speaker with my Kindle Fire HD was simple enough. It paired as device "BTS-19" with no code required. The audio quality was surprisingly good for a shower speaker, and the maximum volume was loud enough to hear a couple of rooms away. It's definitely the advertised 3 watts of sound. My biggest issue with the speaker are the controls - they're not overly intuitive. The Backward and Forward track buttons also adjust the volume. Often when I was trying to adjust the volume, the track changed. A quick press on the power button changes to FM mode, and I had the same issue with trying to adjust the volume, but instead the radio scanned to another station. Eventually I got fairly adept at using the controls, but it took longer than I expected.I did use the speaker in the shower, and even with a lot of water spraying on it, it played on without hesitation. The large plastic hook was ideal for hanging it from the handheld showerhead support. Afterwards, I shook the water off and left it hanging in the shower.Before using the speaker for the first time, I charged the internal battery with a 5V~1.0A wall charger and the included charging cable. The charging cable has a circular plug that mates with a waterproof jack on the back of the speaker. A red LED light on the front of the speaker indicates that it's charging.The audio quality and water resistance are good enough to make this a pretty good shower speaker. Unfortunately the controls should be improved to make them simpler to operate and more intuitive. But for the shower or any rainy or damp conditions, the Abco Tech shower speaker would get the job done.A product sample was provided by the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: Good sound but controls are not too intuitive

reviewText: You are instructed to completely charge the battery before first use. I plugged the included charging cable into my AC wall adapter, but you could also charge the speaker using your PC or laptop. The included charging cable has a jack on one end & a  USB connection on the other.The Abco Tech Waterproof Wireless Bluetooth Speaker features a swivel hook which makes it easy to hang  and adjust the speaker so the controls face you.  This speaker gets loud & is easily  heard while showering. The audio quality is average and what I would expect from a small speaker. The included instruction sheet is thorough & easy to understand. I tested the FM radio function & Bluetooth pairing.I had no problems pairing my iPod Touch 4G with the Abco Tech Waterproof Speaker. It pairs as BTS-19.It picked up several FM radio stations. The frequency/callsign is not displayed.When paired with your Bluetooth device, the Back/Forward buttons control volume & are also used to change  tracks.When listening to FM radio, the Back/Forward buttons are used to change the stations & also for volume control.You can also use this speaker to answer phone calls or redial. You'll even hear a tone when a text message is received.I really like this speaker, but had trouble using the Back/Forward buttons to control the volume. Instead of adjusting the volume, I changed the FM station or, when using Bluetooth, I changed the track. Even though adjusting the volume became easier for me as I continued to use the speaker,  I still struggle with it.All in all, this is a great Shower Speaker which is IPX4 Grade Waterproof*. I need more practice using the buttons to adjust the volume.*IPX4 Grade Waterproof means the device is  splash proof from all angles.  Be sure to push the protective  plug into the jack connection before showering.Sample provided for honest review.
summary: Good sound...Pairs easily...Great FM reception...Very loud...Love the swivel hook

reviewText: This rechargeable speaker has Bluetooth and FM radio and it is water resistant for use in the bathroom or kitchen as well as outdoors by the pool.  It has a soft-touch plastic body and is pretty tough—when I dropped it on the bathroom floor, it wasn't damaged at all.  It has an attractive rounded pear-shaped form and comes in several bright colors as well as neutrals.  There is a hook that swivels all the way around and tilts from side to side in a 90 degree range.  This lets it hang securely from the neck of the shower head or faucet handle, a towel bar, hook, or pool chair.The shell is IPX-4 rated, which is splash-resistant for five minutes.  I let water from the faucet run over it for two minutes without any problems—just make sure the plug on the charging port is sealed tightly.  When the speaker holes are full of water, the sound is dampened, but this is not a problem during actual use and it is easy enough to shake the water out.It took me a few minutes playing around with it to figure out the controls although there is an instruction sheet included—think of it as a little puzzle to solve. There are four buttons with icons and the trick is that quickly pressing or holding down a button initiates different functions.  The power button also changes it from speaker to radio and the volume buttons change the track.The battery charges fully overnight and then will last well over two weeks if used for about half an hour daily.  It pairs instantly with Bluetooth as BST-19, no PIN needed, but it's less fuss to just use the radio, which is perfect for news in the morning.  The LED flashes when in pairing mode.The three watt speaker is more than loud enough for use in the shower. The sound reproduction is not audiophile quality, of course, but there is no noticeable distortion at normal volumes.  Overall, it is very good for a mono 3 watt speaker and works just fine for music, talk radio, and for the telephone function.  I was not expecting it to have a telephone function, but when paired with a smartphone, it allows calls to be answered.A sample was provided for testing and unbiased review.  It has been lots of fun to listen to this radio in the shower.  It would also be nice for listening to audiobooks or even language lessons to make good use of time spent in the bathroom.
summary: Fun for use in the bathroom

reviewText: I received a review sample and put this through its paces right after I charged it. The first thing I noticed is the sound quality and the volume. My test music isKind Of Bluebecause it has multiple instruments in the low, mid and high ranges. This speaker passed that test by allowing me to hear each instrument. I will say that the low end of the frequency range is a little thin. Not terrible, but I want to point that out.For overall volume, this beats two other shower-type speakers I have tested in the past. The previous ones could not be heard clearly with water spraying and cascading in the background. This one can. It easily cut through the ambient shower noise and I was able to enjoy music in the shower.The instructions consist of a single-sided sheet of paper that is clear and concise. Pairing this with my Samsung Galaxy Note 3 took seconds. Switching to FM radio is as simple as depressing and holding the On/Off button after you have turned the device on. I get poor reception no matter which radio I use in my area, but I did manage to find a clear station, so if you listen to FM radio that feature is as rock solid as the bluetooth speaker feature.This is definitely waterproof. The power cable is a hybrid with a standard USB connector on one end and a tip type DC connector on the other. I tested it with a few wall chargers in the house and all work. The included cable is relatively sturdy, which is a plus given its non-standard configuration. Of course that configuration is one of the keys to ensuring that this speaker is waterproof.Overall this is the best shower-style speaker that I have tested to date. The sound quality is a cut above most on the market, and the unit itself is perfect for listening anywhere. For example, the hanger hook would make this ideal for hanging off a rear view mirror in a car for hand's free calling, which this speaker also supports.
summary: The best shower-style speaker I have tested

reviewText: The Abco Hybrid Bluetooth Speaker is a combination FM radio and Bluetooth speaker in one.  It is rated IPx4 waterproof.  What does that mean?  I means splash resistant.  Do not try to submerge this.This is a hanging speaker, which in the end is better than suction mount, because most suctions eventually fail.  You will need a place to hang this, though.The radio is a useful feature, since I don't always remember to have my phone nearby when I shower.  I can just turn on the radio.  It gets good reception and great sound, not a lot of static.  It skips to the stations that come in well.  I just can't tell what station I'm on.  It needs some sort of dial or display to let us know.  Once I got a channel I liked, I just left it there.Pairing with my iPhone was easy and it always reconnects automatically when I turn it on.  The Bluetooth has a great range, comparable to my other Bluetooth speakers.  I can place the phone two rooms away and still have a solid connection.Music via Bluetooth is great in my shower, and though I don't ever want to receive my calls there, I had my son call me just to see how calls come through.  I assume anyone using this in the shower would turn the water off first, so we did not try this in the shower with the water on.  Phone calls are softer than the music, so I turned the volume all the way up.  Conversation was easy.  I could hear him without problems.  We switched so I could listen to the caller's end and found that it was good from that angle, also.  There was no problem with the speaker cutting in and out like it sometimes happens on speakerphone.Siri works, also.  Hooray for that!  I'm finding him more useful by the day.Battery life is excellent.  I charged it once via USB using the proprietary cord (included, but don't lose that cord).  It's been a couple of weeks of use every morning and the battery is still going strong.It's a good speaker.  I like it.PROS:+ FM radio/Bluetooth speaker combined+ makes and receives phone calls (works with Siri!)+ splash resistant+ long battery life+ good reception, sound qualityCONS:- no way to tune to specific radio station (scan only)- proprietary charging cordThis product was provided for review by Abco Tech.
summary: Good Water Resistant Speaker

reviewText: Multi-port, multi-power chargers are the way to go.  For example, my favorite travel charger is the Bolse 4 Port Premium High Output USB Wall/Travel/AC Rapid Charger.  Thing is, for around the house I've found that four ports doesn't always cut it and also it would be nice to bring the ports to someplace other than the wall outlet.That is were this thing shines.It charges my iPhone, my iPad, my Kindles, my Samsung tablet, pretty much anything I can  throw at it.  The long cord with a standard plug means it only takes up one outlet (without covering others) and I can place the actual charger pretty much where ever I want.  There are even mounting holes on the back if I want to hang in on the wall.I'm glad Sabrent was able to provided a sample so I could provide an honest review.and recommend a new standard for a home/office multi-port USB charger/power supply.
summary: Lots of options in this solid, well designed charger

reviewText: This is essentially the same thing as a power strip for electric plugs, but in their stead we have six USB ports ready for charging units of all kinds...according to Sabrent, the charger can handle six devices simultaneously. The devices they suggest are iPads, iPhones, iPods, tablet PCs, smartphones, wireless hotspots...but could also include Bluetooth devices, cameras, and a host of other items.The unit has six ports, but four different configurations or speeds: it has two 800mA ports, two 1000mA ports, one 1500mA and one 2100mA.  Herein lies one of my problems..but I thought I would handle the positive aspects I see with this unit, and then the negative. First...THE PROS:+ Good price: $20 delivered (if ordered through Prime)+ All devices can be charged at one station+ Functional design+ Switch makes it easy to tell if the device is on/off+ Good long plug--helps when trying to centrally localize your device between several devicesTHE CONS:- Ports are labeled, but the labels do not specify what devices those cover. Along those lines...- There's no manual. I'm not an electrical genius and the makers of the device need to be more explicit about what these numbers mean: what devices can be charged by what ports? I believe I'm no different from most people with devices nowadays...we don't mind learning, but don't just throw numbers at us and expect us to understand it all.- No feature for auto shutoff when item is fully charged.- Two outlets did not work with my Kindle, but did with my smartphones: the right-hand 800mA, and the 1500mA.- The ports, and their interiors, seemed to wobble a little over time...like the device was no longer as tight as it was when I first got it.All in all, this is a good device that could use some tweaking. It has the right idea: centralize a multi-port charging station, and make it work with as many devices as it can, simultaneously. Though the device does desperately need a manual or a cheat sheet to specify JUST HOW THOSE PORTS ARE TO BE USED.Still, for the price this unit is being offered for is indeed a bargain, one that should make many people overlook those flaws in favor of the benefits it offers.NOTE: I was supplied this product free of charge with no other conditions other than my writing a fair and honest review -- which this is.
summary: Functional, and at a Great Price...But Needs a Manual!

reviewText: .Sabrent made some real improvements over the 6-port model that shipped prior to April 2014.- The ports have a nice fit...not too loose.- Smart Ports: Use any port for any device.- The cord is much more sensible. Lightweight, detachable, 2-prong.Sabrent did not update the model number, so all the reviews here of the 6-port version say "This review is from: [Upgraded Version & All Smart Ports]..." even if they are reviews of the old version.- - - Summary - - -It looks and feels like quality. Good for charging lots of devices at once.PROs:* Smart Ports - Use any port for any device.* Up to 7 amps (35 watts) total output- On-Off switch- Looks like quality.- Keyhole mounts on base (for fixed mounting)OKs:- Blue power-on light seems too bright (you can cover it with tape).- Warranty: 1 year (No written warranty info is provided with the product.)CONs:- A little expensive (when selling for $30)NIT PICKs:- Ports are not all oriented in the same direction, and the orientations are not marked.- No owner manual.- - - Listing Correction - - -- Power cord is 4.6 feet, not 6 feet.- - - Alternatives - - --Vinsic 5-Ports 40W USB Smart Charger(usually under $20)-Anker 40W 5-Port Family-Sized Desktop USB Charger with PowerIQ™ Technology- - - Disclosure - - -The manufacturer gave me this item for review. I believe my review is impartial.~~~ Comments & questions welcome ~~~
summary: 6-Port Model is Much Improved

reviewText: I’m finding this to be a very handy item to have to recharge the many, many items that need to be plugged into a USB port for charging. Rather than tying up my USB hub on my PC, this plugs directly into a wall outlet and provides three USB ports for charging.I have the three port version. There are two ports on the top of the unit.
