One is rated at 2A, the other is 1A. There’s a third 1A port on the front face. There’s also an on/off switch on the top of the unit so I don’t need to have to unplug it from the wall to turn off the ports.The build quality feels very solid. All the ports are well attached, and the power cord is nice and stout. The cord is permanently attached to the dock, and is well anchored.The dock is roughly 3 inches wide and 3.5 inches deep. It has a very slim profile so it’s easy to find space for it on my desk under my monitor.Performance has been fine. No problems at all using all three ports at the same time (charged a tablet, a phone and an mp3 player). The ports are spaced far enough apart that I didn't have any problems getting all the cords in and out.Zero complaints![Sample provided for review]
summary: Convenient size; good build quality

reviewText: Picture a surge protector / power strip that you plug a bunch of devices into, except this one has all USB ports.  How genius is that?!?!I love this charging base.  Our kitchen counter has a big dish of chargers and it's survival of the fittest to see which two devices get to use the available outlets.  I've considered putting in an adapter to allow more than two devices to be plugged in, but I don't like the look of all of the little USB blocks.  This charger totally solves this problem by supplying USB charging outlets for up to six devices.I love the fact that all six ports are labeled with their capacity.  The ports include:* 2100mA (1):  Perfect for large devices like iPads, Kindle Fires, and other similar tablets.* 1500mA (1):  Good for a quick charge for iPhones or a slower charge for larger devices like Kindle Fire tablets.* 1000mA (2):  Perfect for iPhones, Android phones, or other smart phones.* 800mA (2):  These are useful for lower-rated devices like older phones (is "dumb phone" a real term?) or other devices other than phones.My only complaint is that there is only one 2100mA port, so you can only charge one iPad or tablet at full high-capacity rate.  The 1500mA port still works OK, but at a slower rate.  Other than this small complaint, I LOVE this charger.  What a great solution for my family.I was provided this item for review.CORRECTION:  The 800mAh ports work for iPhones too.  They won't charge an iPhone as quickly as the 1000mAh ports, but they still work just fine.
summary: Sheer genius!

reviewText: For all the charging units available at this time, too few of them allow you free up available USB port and actually charge other units somewhere other than on the desk! This is a very heavy-duty device that plugs into the wall, charges 3 USB devices such as iPad, iPhone, Smartphones, and tablets etc in a central location - not taking space on the desk. The cord is 6 feet long so that any available outlet by a convenient table or other flat surface can be used. It has an on/off switch so when not in use charging your multiple devices, leave it plugged in and simply turn it off. Always ready, always handy, always reliable.  Another winner from Sabrent (as always). Grady Harp, January 14
summary: Finally, a stand-alone charger to plug into wall

reviewText: I have both the three-port and the six-port chargers.  I’ve had the 6-port charger for several months now, and I use it daily.  I’ve found only one short-coming with the 6-port:  Too few 2A slots.  So, I still needed a few more chargers.  What I end up with, then, are enough 2A slots and too many 1A and lower slots.Enter this new-for-2014 model with 3 slots.  Perfect!  In my mind, the best “family” set-up is two or more of the 3-slot models, set around the house in convenient locations.On both the 3- and 6-port chargers, I really love the fact that they have thick, pliable, 6 foot cords. I had been looking for chargers like this: I can plug these chargers into a low wall outlet and still sit it on the corner of my desk--any corner of my desk. You can set it on top of a four-drawer file cabinet and still have some cord distance with which to work. You can set it on a hall table or other convenient-to-you locations (as opposed to a convenient-to-the-charger location).  And when I say pliable, I mean pliable: The rubber is tough, but gives up its memory rather quickly.Does it work? It works for our AT&T; Unite cards, our phones, our old phone, blue tooth speakers, and our tablets. My Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 can take more than this charger can give it, so I give it exactly what it wants and plug it into the surge protector separately.The 3-port charger has a nice neat look to it:  It is definitely compact at 4” (including the unbending part of the cord) x 2 5/8” x 1” (including the on/off toggle switch).  I like the classy look of a panel of shiny black set into matte black sides and bottom.  My USB cables fit in nice and tight—no wiggle.The 6-port charger has a orderly look to it, too: It is a fairly compact 2 3/8" x 7", and at its highest point it is only 1 1/4" tall and is a nice compatible matte black with some curved corners. My USB cables do wiggle a bit in the ports and the orientation is opposite for the top three and bottom three ports. The blue LED light is bright enough so you can work with it in the dark.*I received a sample product of both the 3-port and the 6-port charger from the seller.
summary: If you need more 2A slots, two 3-port chargers is better than one 6-port charger

reviewText: Sabrent (5V/5A) 6-Port Family-Sized Wall Charger Multi Port USB Charger was a lifesaver over Thanksgiving with our adult children and adult and almost adult grandchildren visiting. Someone had a devise plugged in most of the weekend to keep everything charged for all 10 of us.The core is nice and long so it went from the outlet to an area where we could connect everything and have room to safely leave everything on a side table. It was out of the way but convenient to grab phones and tablets for the crowd. When you have a crowd of iPhone, iPad users this is a handy strip to charge the devices.  I am taking it with us to go to my daughter's house for Christmas when we will all be getting together again.The distributor supplied me with a sample of this devise to try but did not request a review. My experience with the charger strip is my opinion of how it works.
summary: Sabrent (5V/5A) 6-Port Family-Sized Wall Charger Multi Port USB Charger

reviewText: NOTE: This review is for the Sabrent 3-Port USB Portable Charging Station.Although the appearance of the Sabrent 3-Port USB Portable Charging Station is considerably different from most of the AC chargers that I've seen, it functions very well. I charged three devices simultaneously in the charger: a Kindle Fire HD in the 2A port, a portable battery in one of the 1A ports, and a smartphone in the other 1A port. The Kindle Fire was running a video, and the smartphone was going through a music playlist, but both devices as well as the portable battery steadily increased their charge during the two hours that they were plugged in to the charging station.This is the first AC charger I've used that has more than two output ports, and with a scarcity of electrical outlets in our old house, it's a welcome feature. Also, all of my other AC chargers plug directly into a wall outlet, whereas the 5' power cord gives a lot of flexibility in locating the charging station. (Note: The product description mistakenly lists a 6' cord).The charging station appears to be solidly built and durable enough to give good service for a long time. I'm very pleased with its performance.A product sample was provided by the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: An excellent 3-port charging station

reviewText: I have to say that I was very impressed with not just the packaging of the product but also the immensely and well built product.For the price point, I would have to say that it is absolutely the best one on the market for what it does.I've used it for quite a bit now and I bought one for my sis and she loves it.My only concern were the usage of the ports and some confusion. Noticed that certain [Apple] chargers didn't go through and that might be somewhat obvious.Pros:+Durable+ Mountable+Clean+Affordable+ Great connectionCons:- Kind of confusing for which port is which (Need to do some testing to figure out)- Certain Apple products don't work :(Overall an excellent product worth giving to the techie friend who just can't seem to keep things tidy near the wall.4/5 Strong purchase!
summary: Clean, Tidy, Sleek, and Great Quality.

reviewText: Sabrent 6-port charger (AX-USB6) is a very sturdy. The cord is about 5 feet long, thick enough, and it looks well insulated. The whole thing looks/feels like a regular power strip which gives it a sturdy appearance and feel.The ports are individually marked to let you know which port to use for charging tablets and phones. As previous reviewers have explained, each device requires different amperage for proper charging. The bigger device, the higher mA as a general rule.The only thing I can complain about is the one blue LED power light on the surface near the ports.  The LED emits a bright blue light strong enough to be a night-light and can be a distraction if you have the charging port in your bedroom or next to your bed.
summary: The bigger they come, the higher they charge

reviewText: This is basically a power strip for your devices except this one has 6 USB ports. Its sheer awesomeness to be able to plug everyone's device in and not use every outlet in the immediate area. This is going to come in very handy for the upcoming Thanksgiving as well as Christmas.We all know how many outlets get used up around the holidays for sure. Plus there will be all types of devices in the house Ipads, phones, Androids, Kindles (i was also able to charge my camera) so this bad boy will ensure they can all be charged at once. All the devices I tested charged fairly comparable rate to really any other charger I've had.All the ports are labeled very easily as long as you know mA needed for each type of device. I really enjoy this 6-Port  family-sized wall charger as it also helps to keep the counter top more organized. Since i know several homes that could benefit from having this ill be grabbing some for Christmas gifts.**I was provided this product to review, all opinions are honest and my own.**
summary: Free up your outlets

reviewText: Very unique idea. Usually we have surge protected power adapters, and the power chargers are big and clunky. If there are 6 outlets, depending on what type of device you connect everything is crowded. Now think of a scenario where magically things are merged into one. This device is a big space saver and clutter remover. I was able to charge 2 Samsung Galaxy S4s, a Kindle DX and a Samsung Tab 3 8" tablet. Very rugged and I keep this under a table and bring USB cables through a hole on the table. Very near and worked very well. Recommend!I was provided this product in exchange of a fair and honest review.
summary: Very unique idea.

reviewText: I have quite a few Sabrent products for my computer. I have always found them to be of great quality. I was impressed to see that they were now selling charging stations. This is a small black sleek box, 3.5  x 2.75 inches that you plug into the wall with a 57 inch cord. You can plug up to three  devices at the same time, in one of the three ports. One port is 5V 2A and the other two are 5V 1A.  It says up to 3A but I charged  a 5A speaker with it. The instructions are clearly printed on the outside of the box, just plug and play. Too many times my grandchildren have unplugged my phone to plug in theirs.  Now I can charge my phone while my grans are charging their toys. My favorite feature is the on/off switch. I can turn the power off when we are not using it without having to unplug it. I was given this product for a fair and honest review.
summary: Quality and Convience

reviewText: The Sabrent 3-Port USB Portable Charging Station is a nice device to have when you need the ability to charge multiple devices at once. This has one port for 2A and two ports for 1A. It has an on/off switch for when not in use. The device is sturdy and well made. With so many devices being compatible with this unit I rank this as a must have item. I have not encountered any problems with this unit.Overall AssessmentThe Sabrent 3-Port USB Portable Charging Station is an easy to use charging station that is effective and highly recommended.
summary: Very Effective

reviewText: This dual charger is a good idea. Now, we can charge two phones or one phone and my Kindle at the same time.  It seems to charge fairly fast too.  I'm happy with this charger. Anything to bring convenience is great. Wonderful gift.
summary: charges great

reviewText: I received this charger because I just purchased a new car. I was tired of switching it out between the cars so when I was offered to review this, I jumped at the chance.The quality of this is really nice. Having two 2.1A ports is really nice because now my kids can watch their tablets on road trips without worrying about their batteries dying.It is bulky at the head of the ports, but I have plenty of room for it to not be a hassle.Note: I was provided this product in exchange an honest and unbiased review. This has, in no way, changed my views about this product.
summary: Good Quality car charger

reviewText: This USB car charger adapter has a circuit design that automatically stops when the device battery is full.  I used it to charge an external battery and it stopped once the battery was fully charged.  That's an important feature so that neither the battery nor this adapter gets overheated.The adapter converts DC input to 5V/4.2A output to power two devices or batteries at once.  Out of its packaging, the charger itself weighs 62.1 grams.I especially like having this adapter in the compartment that houses my car's cigarette lighter, where I plan to keep it.  I was provided a sample and this is my honest review.
summary: Automatically stops charging once battery is fully charged

reviewText: This superb OXA 2 Port USB Rapid Car Charger is everything it says it is. This charger did a fine job of charging my tablet and my phone and did so faster that I thought it would. What I like about it is that this unit has 4.2 amps of power, which is so much better than my older car charger that were rated at 1amp or so. There is plenty of power to charge my tablets and phone quickly. And I found that it charges very, very fast as it seems to charge devices in both ports in 1/2 of the time as it really is a rapid charger.**The reason that I suggest this charger to you over the other Dual car chargers around is that I found that I charges faster than other dual car chargers that I tried. And this charger is not too big and does not protrude like some dual charges do.One thing to know before you buy this charger: It does not come with USB cables (yet few of this type come with cables). The great news is that the cables are available at such a low cost.Highly recommend this charger!
summary: Charges my phone and tablet faster than other car chargers do!

reviewText: This very inexpensive portable car charger is a real boost to families who need to charge phones or iPads etc while on the road. This slick little charger plugs into your car cigarette lighter and has two USB ports for charging two devices delivering simultaneously charges for 2 devices - iPad, iPhone, Samsung, and Android devices at full speed - and it automatically protects the items being charged with premium protection - charging is automatically stopped when the device battery is full. The sophisticated circuit design protects against over-heated, over-current, and over-charging.Smart, compact, inexpensive, and reliable. What more could you ask for in a car charger? Recommended. Grady Harp, January 14
summary: This USB car charger delivers

reviewText: When I need to charge a device while in my vehicle, it is usually not for my phone.  So, having a charger with two 2.1A ports is super handy.  Speedy charging, too!This charger is sturdy and well-constructed.  It grips well in my vehicle's charging port.  It is made a bit differently than other power adapters in that it has metal tension clips on each side of it and a substantial metal contact point.  There is no doubt that this charger will give you a solid connection.  I can even pull out the USB cord one-handed, without dislodging the charger.*I received a sample product from OXA.
summary: Having two 2.1A ports is better than one!

reviewText: Incredibly useful product when you're on a trip. I had two buddies who (stupidly) forgot to charge their phones before a long road ahead.One needed it urgently for something to do with work and the other needed it for girlfriend troubles -- both equally dangerous and important.The OXA dual charger can charge two devices QUICK. And I mean QUICK. The best feature is that once it is done fully charging the device, it stops. So it doesn't drain your car or burn through the battery.Great price point and must have for cars who often have pressing recharge requests.5/5 STRONG purchase
summary: Very durable, High quality, Affordable. QUICK charge

reviewText: I am really impressed with this dual port car charger. I have rarely come across anything that will charge my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet and this baby does. So I can keep a bluetooth headset, my phone, my tablet or anything else that charges through a USB  port charging while I'm out and about. It solidly built and charges two devices at a time at quick speeds.I'm very impressed with the ability of this low cost charger. Highly recommended.I was provided a unit to test and review.
summary: Great for All My Devices!

reviewText: How do you solve a problem like Maria?  I don't know, but when it comes to charging USB devices, you don't need to go grabbing at moonbeams.  There are many options, and this device OXA sent me to review is a good one.  While it has no fancy features, it is compact, attractive, and provides proper protection for your devices.  A simple solution for a good price.
summary: Solving Problems

reviewText: A car charger is always something I like to have multiples laying around. Especially if it is a  dual charger like this model then my husband and I can charge our phones at the same time.This model is somewhat bigger than some of my other ones, however it seems to charge quiet quickly so its something i'm willing to over look. This charger is very easy to use and has an led indicator light that lets you know when its properly installed.There is no included cord with this either so you'll want to make sure you already have one or you'll want to buy one. So if your looking for a dual USB charger and don't need the cords then pick this one up.**I received a sample of this product to test and review. All opinions are honest and my own.**
summary: Does the trick

reviewText: This device is handsome and sleek. It does not stick out real far and doesn't take away from the sleekness of the dashboard. It performs with outstanding quality. I was able to charge two iPhones at the same time effective and efficiently. I like that it is 5v/ 4.2A. Most of my devices need 1.5A but this offers 2.1A per USB connection. So when I am using my larger devices I have the power at hand. I received this device for a fair and honest review.
summary: Sleek, sturdy & high quality!

reviewText: I had two other wall chargers with multiple ports and my kids took them.  I am so happy to have this one and I am keeping it!  It works great, charges my kindle and two phones at the same time. Yes, four ports but I only have three devices right now.  I think there is another tablet in my future and I can still take just one plug in and charge all devices at the same time.
summary: Charges quickly

reviewText: I have noticed that some devices that have a USB cord don't get fully charged when I use my computer--when the computer powers off, or goes to sleep, they do too.Plus, with so many items now charging with a USB cord, from Kindle to workout calorie counter, to desk lamps, to GPS and more, a few USB ports on a computer are just not enough.I even have a soap dispenser that charges with a USB cord!This makes it easier--keep it anywhere you have an outlet and out of the way.Have you noticed things dangling from your computer in order to charge are always IN the way?No more.Charges fast, easy, well, flawlessly.  It's just a must have as more and more devices morph their charges to USB cords.Charger provided by OXAReview is my unbiased opinion.
summary: Don't tie up your USB hubs on your computer--this makes them wall charged

reviewText: This wall charger white and has four USB ports on the front. Three of the ports are 1 amp for charging lower powered devices like the iPhone. The last USB port is 2.4 amps for quicker charging of higher powered devices like the iPad. Combined it has 5.4 amps so you can use all four ports at the same time without slowing down that charging time. I have a couple similar wall chargers that will slow down if there are multiple items plugged in at the same time. It’s made solid and seems to work very well. The plug flips down or closes into the body of it for travel and storage. The face of it is a blue panel that will brightly illuminate when in use. This makes it stand out from similar wall chargers and I like the look of it.I found out the other day that it has a built-in safety mechanism that can sense if there is some type of short or problem. I has plugged in one of my devices to charge and the USB cable that I use to charge it had a short in it. I saw a spark and smoke roll up from the cable and then the wall charger immediately shut down that port and the light on the front of the wall charger kept flashing to indicate there was a problem. I never thought of that before but it’s good to know that it will shut down if there is ever a problem.Overall I think this wall charger is reasonably priced and seems to be good quality. I like the safety feature and the LED lights that illuminate the front face plate in bright blue light.Sample provided for review
summary: Works great, has safety shut off in case of a short and I like the bright blue face plate.

reviewText: This outstanding OXA Quad 4 port charger set is EXACTLY what I have been search! So I plugged in my two Samsung Galaxy tablets and my two Samsung Galaxy phones and was amazed to find that they charged just a quickly as my original Samsung Galaxy chargers!What I love about this most is that only use one outlet (the bottom one) and the top outlet is free now. Before I had to use 2 outlets for charging my four devices!*You will need to have your own charging cables for this unit because it comes with the wall base charger part only, no cables are included.PROS:+ Build quality/ Portability - This is the best I have seen in travel chargers. And the plug fold neatly into the base so it will not scratch things when you pack it for travel.+ Charging Power - The top port has a 2.4 amp for charging larger tablets like a 10.1 size which require 2amps. The other three ports are all one amps, yet I found this plenty of power to charge my Tab 3 8.0 (which charges fine with just 1amp) and 1amp is enough amps for my two phones.Everything seemed to charge just as fast as it did on regular chargers. For me, I placed my devices in this charger at night at 10pm when the batteries were at about 35 percent and the next day at 7am, all my devices were at 100 percent battery (fully charged).Sometimes if my tablet or phone gets down to say 60 percent during the day, I plug them into this charger and in just about 1 hour, I check and the devices are on 100 percent charged.Unit provided to me by OXA. And I am happy to report that I fully recommend this charger to you as I am really impressed with this charger!
summary: This OXA Quad 4 USB Port Charger charges 4 of my devices at one time and charges them very quickly!

reviewText: I love this quad portable wall charger because its compact size makes it easy to take on the road with me.  Three out of the four port charge at 1A, and the other charges at 2.4A, more than enough for an iPad.  The total output is 5.4A, which means that all four ports charge as expected even when all are in use.  At only 2 3/4" x 2 1/8" x  1", it can be stashed easily in any bag.  The prongs fold up into the body for even more easy transport.  It's the perfect accessory for anyone traveling -- or even at home -- with multiple USB devices in need of charging.I like to insert all my necessary cables into this so that I'm sure of taking all the correct ones with me when I travel.  Note:  I received a sample for review.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Compact, 4-Port USB Charger

reviewText: What better way to review a product like this excellent device from OXA than to say it does exactly what it purports to do? The major difference between this wall charger and the others is its power and speed. For one thing, it is very handy to tuck in the briefcase or suitcase to take on trips where facilities for recharging your multiple devices simply aren't available. With is Universal 4 USB Port charger you just plug it into the wall socket , add the 4 USB cables (not supplied) that go with your devices and relax while this powerful little charger quite rapidly charges your iPod, iPhone, iPad, Samsung, HTC Smart Phones, Amazon Kindle and more. In other words this Quad USB Wall Charger  simultaneously charges 4 devices and offers complete protection, stopping the input when the charging is complete and protecting against over-heated, over-current, over-charging protection.This is a very impressive, very small, very powerful and very rapid charger. Highly recommended. Grady Harp, January 14
summary: Little but Mighty

reviewText: This four port charger sits firmly in a wall socket and offers a nice blue LED illumination from the four ports. It has a lot of versatility in that it will charge a wide range of devices from smartphones. It has fold down plug prongs for storage making it great for taking to a hotel or airport where wall plugs are at a premium.I had no trouble charging phones and Kindles but it won't charge my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet, although in all fairness, most wall chargers won't charge that device.A really nice, solidly built charger. I was provided a unit for evaluation and review.
summary: Love This! Versitile, Nice Design

reviewText: In a house with six people and dozens of devices, there is often a battle for the available outlets. This wall charger makes things much easier for our family. You are able to charge up to four devices at once using only one outlet. It works with a variety of devices including ipad, ipods, kindles and several types of phones. The LED light makes it easy to tell if the device is connected properly. Even when charging multiple devices, it doesn't take long to power up your electronics.  It takes only a few hours and for me the charge lasted for several days since I don't use my phone that often. This is a great way to save outlet space and still get a reliable charge.Complimentary product received in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Wall Charger

reviewText: You can never have to many USB wall chargers especially ones with multiple device capabilities. This particular model has room for 4 at once, you can charge smart phones, iphones, ipads, ipods, or what have you at full speed. I used this for my tablet, 2 cell phones and an ipod, and all four were charged very quickly.I like the look of the device as well a sleek white square is a great switch from the normal black. So far OXA has been a pretty decent company to work with and if you "Like" them on Facebook you get your warranty automatically extended. If your looking for a multiple device USB charger then give this one a try.**I received a sample of this product to test and review. All opinions are honest and my own.**
summary: Looks and works great

reviewText: Note: I received a review sample, but my reviews are most definitely unbiased. I say what I think!There are a zillion USB chargers out there. I found this one pretty impressive for these reasons.1. It delivers full power simultaneously on all four ports; 2.4A on one port and 1A on the other three. This means charging a tablet, two typical smartphones, and an auxiliary device can be done all at the same time without extending charging times. Some other units won't deliver full power; this one does.2. All the ports face out (or up, depending where you plug it in). This is SO convenient. The ports are easily accessible and there is no problem inserting the USB plugs.3. The AC power prongs fold in for transport instead of sticking out when not in use.4. The unit is slim (see the product photos) and takes up just ONE outlet position or ONE position on a power strip. No worries about putting it at the end of the power strip, covering up two outlets, or anything like that.5. The unit is lightweight and made of sturdy plastic. Short of downright abuse it should last and provide a lot of service.6. It has built in overheating/overcurrent protection, which I judge as essential.7. It works on a range of input voltages, up to 240 volts (although for European use, you'd need one or more plug adapters).What are the downsides? You can find units that cost less, but you often get what you pay for, and I don't like buying something twice. I'd rather spend a little more up front to get something that lasts.Highly recommended. It's the best I've seen, and I've evaluated many of these.
summary: The best design I've seen so far

reviewText: Very practical device that allows charging four units simultaneously in a relatively short time.Sturdy, hard plastic shell with two prongs that fold in; compact size (2 ” X 2” x 1”) and weighs 3.5 oz, which makes it very convenient to carry around in a purse or attache case.It has four standard USB ports: The top one is 2.4mAh and the rest are 1mAh each. Recently this came in handy on a trip, when I needed to charge an iPad and three mobile phones, and there was only one wall outlet available. I plugged all devices simultaneously in the unit and left them to charge. All were fully charged within 4 hours.The price and one year warranty (extended to 18 months if you “like” OXA on Facebook) make this a very good value.
summary: Very handy wall charger.

reviewText: The OXA 4 port USB charger does exactly what it says - it charges up to 4 USB charging devices at a time from a single wall outlet. It can be used on 90-240 V connections, meaning as long as you have the ability to convert the plug to another country's power outlet, it should be able to accept the electricity. This is very nice for people who travel internationally, as now you can take this and a plug converter and charge your phone, tablet and so on without needing to bring a bunch of separate chargers (you still need the cables, just not the wall wart portions).There is a single 2.4 A port, which is good for phones that can "speed" charge or heavier duty tablets (like the iPad) that really need the extra power to charge at a decent rate. The other 3 ports are all rated to 1 A, so they should be able to charge phones and other USB chargeable devices without any issues as well. This allows you one 2.4 A tablet, with 3 other devices, rounding out the 5.4 A output.I have charged an iPhone 5S, a Lumia 1020, my work Blackberry and an iPad without any issue, all at the same time. I usually plug in at night and as expected, I wake to fully charged devices.Highly recommended if you have the need.I received a free sample from the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: Charges 4 devices at once - bring your own cables

reviewText: 4 ports; 1 2.1 amp, 3 1 amp. The device is sleek, light, but compact, and does exactly what it advertises. I'm not going to waste your time discussing every single detail of this product; it works, and it is cheap. In all honesty, I love it.
summary: Does exactly what I need it to!

reviewText: The TOTALLEE Slim Skin iPhone 5/5S Hard Shell easily snaps onto the iPhone and is so ultra thin that it feels like it is molded right on the phone.  Made of a super soft material that is anti-slippery so you don't have to worry about losing grip.  The cut-outs for the volume buttons, mute and back camera are perfectly aligned and provide easy access.  The top and bottom are completely open for full access to the power button and ports.Slim cases protect against scratches, dirt or grime and scuffing the sides, corners or back of our iPhone.  They are not meant to offer protection against drops.  I extremely recommend using a high quality screen protector to protect the face of your iPhone.My daughter uses Michael Kors and Vera Bradley wristlets purses which are really small and she can not use thick cases or her iPhone will not fit in it.  This type of case is perfect!  It does not add bulk but offers protection against the items in her tiny purse like keys or coins.Great slim case offered with a 60 day warranty.MADE IN THE USA, California based company.Sample provided for review.
summary: Perfect slim design - MADE IN THE USA

reviewText: This is a great little case in many ways:> it is extremely lightweight weighing less than a 1/2 ounce,> it snaps right on and fits tight,> it has a sleek design,> it protects the outer shell of your phone,> it fits superbly, allowing nicely for all buttons and tabs,> it comes in a wide array of colorsBut the ONLY complaint I have is that it protects all but the one surface I worry about most: the front. Granted, a good screen protector is ALWAYS a smart thing to buy, as it helps provide all sorts of protection from fingerprints to oils to little nicks and scratches, etc. But a screen protector can only do so much. So, while this case does a fine job on five of the six surfaces of your phone, I do wish its front edges provided just a bit more heft.So, if you do buy the Totallee case, AT LEAST get a good screen protector. It will certainly provide some protection to the one remaining and relatively unprotected surface.Otherwise, the Totallee case is a light, slim case which protects the back and four sides of a phone with style and strength.NOTE: I was provided a review sample of this product on the sole condition that I provide a fair review, which this is.
summary: Totallee worth it as far as it goes

reviewText: When it comes to selecting iPhone 5 covers, people tend to fall into different camps, and this minimalist case is for those who want the most basic protection for the back and sides of their phone.  This Totallee case is the thin, snap-on kind; it has a little more flexibility than most snap-ons, making it easier to get on and off.  But the real advantage of this case is its feel:  it feels almost velvety in my hand, thus offering a good grip.  Of course, this kind of case is not going to offer much drop protection; the case does not even have a lip to curve around the screen edges.  This is designed to protect the back and sides from scratches and to feel like a bare iPhone 5.  For that, it is excellent.The bottom is completely cut out to reveal the speakers, headphone jack, and charging port in one space; this makes it easy to plug into a lightning cable dock station or to use wide-base earphones.  Because the case is so thin, all controls are easy to access and operate.If you drop phones a lot, you'd be better off looking for a case with more protection; however, if you want a little protection while preserving the original elegance and size of the iPhone 5 (or 5s or 5c), then this case may be for you.  Note:  I received a sample for review.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Great Feel For Minimal Protection

reviewText: I must have at least 50 cases in my house, for,my IPhone 5s. I know what I want, but no one has even able to give me a case that I think is perfect. Finally, this case comes very close.This is a very nice case with clean lines, which is like having on no case at all.  It has a small lip on the case so you can feel safe that the screen is protected. It also allows the phone to have a very slim profile, with an easy grip and access to all ports.The case does not remove or scratch my screen saver, which is a real plus to me.Thank you Totallee, for allowing me to review your case!
summary: Wonderful case that has a very low profile...

reviewText: TOTALLEE  is a new California company that shows great promise. The concept behind this snap on hard shell case for the iPhone 5/5S is to provide a lightweight, non-cumbersome protection for the iPhone and that is exactly what it delivers. It is so light that it hardly feels present, except that the grip of the protective case keeps the iPhone from slipping out of your hand. It protects your investment, has cutouts for the camera function, flash and speakers exactly where they should be. It is lightweight, thin, comes in eleven colors, and is perfectly designed to snap the iPhone into place with ease. At this low price buy several - for yourself and as little gifts for those friends who are bound to notice the smart design of this protector. Let's see what this company will come up with next. You can be sure it will be smart! Grady Harp, January 14
summary: Simple design, excellent protection

reviewText: This is a very nice slim iPhone 5 snap on case. It's made of a very light plastic with a matt anti-slip surface. It's minimalistic and snaps on perfectly. It fits good and all the openings are in the right places. Sometimes you just don't want a bulky case and this fits the bill perfectly! Looks great. (A sample was provided for review purposes.)
summary: Excellent!

reviewText: This little case from Totallee for iPhone 5 and 5S is very minimalist, just a thin shell of hard plastic with a soft-touch finish that provides an excellent grip and protection against minor bumps and scratches.  It feels good in the hand and doesn't detract from the design of the iPhone.It is very easy to both apply and remove yet fits perfectly.  It doesn't cover up anything it's not supposed to and it shields all the corners and the back as well as providing a slight lip to protect the glass if the phone is set down on its face.The intense colors are lots of fun.  I know several people who bought an iPhone 5S because they wanted the advanced features but who wished they could have gotten it with one of the colors of the iPhone 5C;  this case makes it possible to have both.A sample was provided for testing and unbiased review.
summary: Minimalist case for iPhone 5 and 5S

reviewText: I received a review sample and at first wondered why this was even a product. However, after snapping an iPhone 5S into it the value became immediately apparent.This case is slightly raised to protect the screen if you drop your phone on a flat, hard surface, so that is one level of protection that fits a value proposition of an inexpensive, minimalist case that is functional. Note that if dropped on uneven surfaces, or worse, stones, neither this nor many other cases on the market are going to be of much use.The material from which this case is constructed is interesting in that it's rigid enough to protect against hard surfaces and objects, but is also pliable and capable of absorbing (or at least mitigating) shocks from short distance drops.Another factor is the precision cutouts for your phone's buttons, camera lens and flash. Everything fits as though this was an integral part of the phone itself.Add in the fact that this is truly feather light and unobtrusive and you have the best of both worlds: nearly invisible protection that actually works.  The only thing that would make this an even better value is if the manufacturer finds a way to include a screen protector without raising the price point. However, as is, this is a great value in my opinion.
summary: Feather light protection

reviewText: This is an excellent case for those who prefer the minimalist look in terms of protection for the phone. If you are looking for a cheap but good case that doesn't add much bulk, then this is for you.This case is small and so lightweight it is nearly negligible. The case covers the back and hugs the corners if the phone thereby protecting those areas. I wish the case had offered a but new protection so that it could cover the screen. A bit of depth would have worked.Otherwise an excellent alternative that comes in many colors to fit your style.
summary: Excellent case without the bulk

reviewText: I received this product free for review but nevertheless I will proceed to be scrupulously honest about it.+ the outside has that smooth but very grippy feel to it. Almost a satin-like feel but when placed on a surface it does NOT want to move.+ except for the 'totallee' name on the back, this case is passionately and completely black. Light falls into this thing never to escape.+ amazingly light; it's almost like it's not there+ considering the weight, this sucker is still a pretty stiff case. It's not likely to break, nick or go anywhere+ what an amazing price point- The edges of the case barely extend above the surface of the screen. It'll offer some protection to the front but not a lotIn summary, this is a great going-to-be-in-the-office sort of case. Not one I'd take out hiking or anything but it's amazing when you consider how little it costs.PS: It is always my endeavor to provide helpful reviews. If you find my review helpful then great! If you do not, then please leave me a comment indicating what you want to know and I'll be sure to do better next time.
summary: Silky, totally and immaculately black

reviewText: If you like your cases to provide only scratch protection, not the ridiculous drop and other phone killing event protection of say, an Otterbox, the TOTALLEE slim skin is great. The back of the phone is protected and there is a very small amount of overhang so that when you put the phone screen down, in theory it shouldn't scratch either. I still recommend a great screen protector to go along with this though.The case itself is a rubberized backing on a piece of sturdy plastic, which adds grip to the phone meaning less droppage than if you were running your iPhone 5s "naked." This is good.The cut outs for the camera, volume and headphones are perfect sized and spaced, so it's almost like not having a case on your phone at all.One thing this case has that many of the cheaper cases on Amazon don't is... .this one is designed, manufactured and sold from the USA. Nothing from China in this one, so if you want to support an American company that is attempting to do a small part in bringing manufacturing back to the USA, I would highly recommend the TOTALLEE Slim Skin.Overall, that case works well, stays out of the way and keeps the phone from being scratched.Highly recommended.I received a free sample for review purposes.
summary: works as expected

reviewText: *Disclosure: I was contacted by a rep for OXA USA and provided a free sample for the purposes of giving my thoughts on it.*Test devices:HTC OneHTC EVO 4G LTESamsung Galaxy S2Samsung Galaxy S3Samsung Galaxy S4Samsing Galaxy NexusiPad MiniiPad AirGoogle Nexus 7 (original)Tegra Note 7NVIDIA ShieldHere we are with yet another external battery product in the "lipstick" size category.  Let's be up front here, this product has but one thing going for it - price.  Currently it' s 11, even though OXA is shipping another product of the same capacity for a buck less.  The difference?  The other one has a keychain and no buttons.  Frankly, if it were me, I'd get the other one.  But let's look at this one, just because.  Metallic outer cover with a cheap plastic button and an LED hidden under another plastic cover.  What's the button for?  You have to press the button to turn the power on to your device.  Further, if you accidentally hit the button, because it's in your pocket, purse, or something, the LED comes on.  But guess what - it doesn't turn off until you press the button again.  This can lead to the battery getting drained, making the unit a useless weight.  That's just plain silly.  If it must use a button, then it should have an automatic off feature when it's not being used.  Better yet, ditch the button entirely and let the thing figure out when there is power draw or not like so many other products of this type do.  (Is it a surprise the other model I mentioned does that?).  The output is a bit disappointing.  First, it's supposed to be 1A.  The sticker on the bottom states it's 800mA, or, 0.800A.  So, which is it really?  Even at the 1A specification, 2A would be better.  Many new tablets, phones, and other devices use 2A input power, and the extra boosts how fast a device can charge.  Of the stack of external batteries I have, this OXA charges devices the slowest and depletes quickly compared to similar capacity units.  This causes me to question just how efficient the unit is, as it should give the same amount of charge.  I noted other reviewers state that their units broke down after a few uses, which doesn't surprise me.  I've had this one since March, used it quite a few times for testing, and it's still going strong.  This alone is the reason I rate it as an "Ok" product, that it actually works.
summary: A little bit of power

reviewText: If you want to carry around an extra charge for your phone, this is one way to do it. It is not too heavy at 2.5 ounces and a little bigger than a lipstick case. The other way to get this double-your-charge power is to buy a combo phone case/charger. Most of those give you about 2400mAh. This little power bank gives you a little extra umph at 2600mAh. Plus, I believe you will find this little baby to be less expensive than the difference between a phone case and a phone case with attached battery.It is a matter of choosing to add a bit of bulk and weight to your phone itself, or with this, search for it when you need it at the bottom of your bag or backpack. Plus you also have to find the USB cord, too. I think this little rectangular box is a bit large to fit in your pants pocket comfortably. I also think it has enough "edges" to it to quickly wear out your pocket lining.My observations after experimenting with this mini "juice box":--The enclosed USB cable is short: 12".--It has one IN, one OUT port, which I think is more than adequate.--It does not have a flashlight feature.--The IN/OUT ports are 5V, which is good.--There is no LED gauge showing how much charge you have left.--The ON/Off switch is raised off the surface of the box.While I like this little "juice" box, (it does perform by charging quickly and providing 2X power), I don't love it. Why? Because I found that the raised ON/OFF button is too easy to "bump" on while sitting at the bottom of my bag. As a matter of fact, the button turned itself on during shipping!Personally, maybe because my fingers are long, I don't mind--and prefer--a phone case/ battery charger combo. I don't mind the tad bit of extra bulk and weight in my hand as I hold my phone. And if I want to take extra charge power along on a road trip, plane ride, or outdoor activity, I take a battery with 10,000 to 15,000mAh.*I received a sample from OXAUSA.
summary: Nice, small, basic double-your-charge external battery at a good value

reviewText: Overview: This is a mini-external battery, used to charge your mobile device when no wall or car charger is available. It's tiny, unobtrusive and easy to carry as a backup. With such a small size, you can easily keep it in your purse or backpack.Specs: 2600mAh capacity. 5V at 800mA.Overall, a compact and unobtrusive external mini-charger.A sample was provided for review purposes.
summary: Excellent!

reviewText: TheOXA 2600mAh Mini Power Bankis an ultra-slim and compact power bank you can take anywhere for emergency power. At 2600mAh, this power bank is designed for emergency situations and for smaller type devices (like Smartphones, MP3 players, etc).  The OXA power bank is capable of providing full charges to most phones and hours of talk time and use to most others.  The charging port on this unit is 1A output.  The OXA powerbank is super-slim in design and is about the size of a lady's lipstick.  Perfect for tossing in your purse, day bag or just carrying around in your pocket for when you need it most. In the package you have the OXA 2600mAh Battery pack, a USB Micro-B recharging cable, and the instruction manual.Disclosure: I want you to know I received a sample product from the manufacturer for the purposes of providing this review. However, a review in exchange for the review sample was not promised. The views and opinions expressed in this review are my own, and in no way represent the views or opinions of the manufacturer or vendor.
summary: Ultra-Portable Emergency Power For Your Smaller Devices...

reviewText: This "lipstick" power bank from OXA is less than 4 in. long but will provide a good boost for a smartphone or other small portable electronic device, such as an mp3 player or Kindle e-reader whenever and wherever needed.  It is ideal for keeping in a purse or bag for a recharging when on the go.It has a sturdy metal case with ports for power in & out on one end.  There is a button to initiate the charging process and a blue LED to indicate activity.A USB-to-micro cable is included for charging the power bank from any USB port or USB wall adapter, and the smartphone or other device's cable is used for charging it via the USB port.This power bank is incredibly simple to use, with necessarily limited storage capacity balanced against the compact size and good value.A sample was provided for testing and evaluation.
summary: Compact power bank

reviewText: First, I want to disclose that I received a review sample, and second, there are excellent reviews already that I have no intention of repeating. I will provide my take on this battery and some of the reasons why I rated it so highly.There are two trends happening in the portable battery market: (1) high capacity for power users and (2) smaller, low capacity models for when you are low on charge and need a convenient and portable battery pack. This is the latter and at around ten bucks is a bargain if you are using one of the more power hungry phones like the iPhone 5S.In fact, at 2600mAh, this will add about 150% to the use time of an Apple iPhone 5S, which comes in at 1560mAh. On the other hand it will probably not add more than two extra hours to an Apple iPad 2's internal 6930mAh battery. I am basing my estimates on worst case scenarios where there is power loss from temperature changes, repeated battery use and other factors. Out of the box in a stable environment this battery should perform much better than my conservative estimates.Think of it as an emergency source that will easily fit in a purse or pocket. In that context even a tablet user will find that it can add just enough juice to make a difference for a critical task.My reasons for awarding this five stars are:- price versus value: at the time of this review this pack was hovering in the ten to twelve buck range, which is the price of two fast food lunches. Considering that it does provide a lot of use time to some of the power hungry phones on the market it's definitely functional. Do not forget that this is perfect for cameras and other devices, so it's handy on vacations, hiking and beaches.- solid construction: it's practically indestructible, with no real moving parts (although the input and output ports are exposed).- charging cable  has removable ends and includes mini and micro USB ends, plus an Apple 30 pin connector for all but Apple's newest phones. It also provides a mini barrel connector end for other devices like a bluetooth speaker I own. It's an all-in-one solution as long as you are not expecting the newer Apple Lightning cable.- size: it's fits purses and pockets as I mentioned, and is a functional keychain as well. True, the battery is a oblong block, but the size does make it easy to find misplaced keys.I am thoroughly pleased with mine for the reasons stated. If you are a constant tablet user you may want to consider the less portable, but higher capacityOXA Juice Box S2 10000mAh Safe External Batteryinstead.
summary: Convenient and portable

reviewText: This portable battery is really handy when you're on the go. It's small enough that you can toss it in your handbag or you can even attach it to your key chain. A key chain loop is actually included. It's lightweight so it won't weigh down your chain.  The charger works with a variety of devices including MP3, iPod, Bluetooth, certain game consoles, and mobile phones. I got mine for my son's iPod and he loves it. He attached it to his book bag with the key chain. I feel more confident knowing he has extra battery life since we'll communicate through face book messages when he isn't home.Using the battery is simple. To charge it up, just plug it into your computer. Once it's full, you can carry it around until you need it. It comes with several different USB adapters so you can hook it to different devices. It gives you at least a few additional hours of battery life.  A blue light indicates it's in use. This is great on long trips when you might not have access to a outlet and also great for emergencies. I am very happy with this charger and would definitely recommend it.***Complimentary product received****
summary: Mini Battery

reviewText: The OXA 2600mah Mini is a tiny battery for recharging phones and other electronic devices while you’re away from home.  It arrived precharged but had lost a little charge in transit.  Bringing it back to full charge (indicated by the change in an indicator light from red to blue) took only one hour.Included in the package is a charging cable with a USB connector.  It easily snapped into my battery charger, and was ready to go in a hurry.This is a good-looking silver metal unit that is only slightly larger than a lipstick, so it won’t take up much space in pocket or purse.Having spent so much time and effort on design of this portable battery, I am surprised at the odd English in the instruction pamphlet.  Sentences like this, “Do not put this product on the water, Light or damprain Cream,” indicate a need for a first-rate translator who will make the instructions as nice as the product itself.Odd English aside, this is a great little battery to keep your phone charged while you’re away from home.  Give it as a gift.  Get one for yourself.Note: The manufacturer provided a sample in return for a review.
summary: Keep It in Purse or Pocket for Emergency Charges

reviewText: The OXA mini-power supply is intended for charging your smartphone or tablet when an AC outlet isn't available. It's small and lightweight and will go easily in a briefcase, purse, or even a reasonable sized pocket. OXA did a really good job of providing a variety of cables and adapters so the unit will work with your device without you having to go buy something. For the price, this is just amazing. Most companies let you fend for yourself for the most part.What are the use cases? Keep in mind that this is a small power supply. At 2600mAh and allowing for losses, it's not going to give a full charge to your tablet. It might give a full charge to your smartphone, depending on the battery size. What it will do, though, is "top up" your smartphone or give a boost to your tablet, when AC power isn't readily available, and it can do this right in your pocket or briefcase while you do something else. This is especially useful if you've got a smartphone that doesn't allow the battery to be replaced and the 2nd battery strategy isn't an option.I found that the unit gave three "top ups" to my old Droid X phone (which I had run down to about 65% battery capacity each time). That's equivalent to perhaps one full charge. I maybe would have expected a little more, but all in all it's probably about right. Again, remember, this is a small, lightweight, and highly portable unit. Don't expect it to do more than it's designed to do. "Top up" time with the unit's 1 amp output was less than an hour.Charging time is a little over three hours on a 1-amp circuit, again, just about what you'd expect at a rough 80% efficiency.I would ordinarily recommend a unit with a little more capacity so it would be able to charge a tablet a little more effectively. However, there would be a cost, weight, and portability trade-off. If your goal is ultimate portability while still retaining reasonable utility, this little unit, which comes at an amazingly low price, will work for you.Disclaimer: I received a review sample, but my reviews are fair and unbiased.
summary: Very convenient and handy for certain use cases

reviewText: OXA 2600mah Mini Power Bank is a very compact battery pack. It charges one device and charge your device (iPhone) only one time before you need to re-charge this battery pack. For the size and portability, I can't complain much. The 5000mah and 10000mah battery pack are usually much larger and heavier although those are more convenient since you don't have to keep charging the battery pack after one use. So this is probably more for short travel and suitable to carry in your pocket or purse, while the bigger capacity battery you carry it in your laptop bag or backpack. I do wish this OXA battery pack comes with LED flashlight just like many other battery packs have (it does have LED to indicate charging status). Thanks OXA for sending me this ultra-compact battery pack.Sidarta Tanu
summary: Not as powerful, but it's much smaller and lighter than 5000/10000mah battery

reviewText: OXA 2600 Ah Model A 5.In these days of deceptive advertising, hyperbole and exaggerated claims, it is refreshing to come across a product that delivers what it promises and more. This item is it.The OXA 2600 Ah is sturdy, made of light metal coated with non-slip thin layer of rubber that is scratch resistant. Yet, it is small and compact (3.8 inches x 0.9 inches x 0.9 inches) to comfortably fit in a pocket or purse, or even a key ring. It weighs 2.56 ounces. Has a 5V/1A USB port. The box includes the charger, standard USB cable and an array of adapters to fit any portable device; mobile phones/pads/pods of major makers.Be aware that the unit produces 2600 Ah but (as any charger) by the time the charge reaches its target it loses about 30% (because of heat loss etc.). If you are charging an `iphone 5 S' - that has a capacity of 1560 Ah - the device will deliver one full charge. However, `Samsung Galaxy S4' requires 2600 Ah for a full charge, and this charger can only deliver a maximum of 1820 Ah or a partial (70%) battery charge on this phone. It is always a good idea to know the capacity of your device. The power bank is easy to recharge by connecting it to a USB of a computer via the included cord. An LED light indicates when fully charged, and the same light signals when it is charging a device.This terrific little charger would come in handy in emergencies and any time your portable smart device runs out of juice. Great quality and value at a very fair price. Highly recommend it.A complimentary sample was provided for review.
summary: High quality mini-charger.

reviewText: First, let me state the obvious. The device can easily be taken on the go; it is also very compact and light. With 1 USB port, this device is ideal for a one time charge, meaning after one full charge of your device, especially android, you'll need to recharge the battery. For the price, I would recommend it.
summary: Ideal for a One Time Charge

reviewText: I received the OXA 2600mah Mini External Power Supply Battery to test and review, and it's well designed for the targeted use. It's light-weight, provides a good backup charge, and looks classy on top of it all.On my iPhone 5S, I got almost two full charges before I had to recharge the battery. That gives me the ability to be away from a power outlet for a day and to use some of my iPhone applications that draw more power than normal. It easily recharges overnight, so it was ready to go the next day when I left the house. It makes it easy to get into the routine of "recharge and go" on a daily basis.I would like it a bit more if it came with some sort of indicator as to how much juice is left in the battery, but it's not quite as important in a smaller unit such as this. I know I'm going to use it for a little less than two full charges, and and I'll recharge it on a regular basis. On the positive side, it's REALLY hard to beat for the price. Overall, this is an excellent option and value.Disclosure:Obtained From: ManufacturerPayment: Free
summary: A very good option for the price...

reviewText: While this power supply seems to live up to its description, it isn't the best fit for all charging applications, and shoppers should make sure they are buying what they actually need before deciding on what to buy. Let me explain.This mini power supply has a 2600 mAh capacity, puts out the usual 5 volts but only at 800mAh. First let me explain my use of the word "seems" in the paragraph above this one. Because I don't have a proper battery tester (the ones that accurately test capacity are in the $300 range), I can only give anecdotal testimony about the power output and capacity of a battery. Because I have an extensive collection of devices and a variety of batteries for my devices, I have a pretty good idea what "x" amount of capacity and "y" amount of amps output are. My best guess is that this OXA power supply meets or possibly exceeds the claimed power output by a small measure.Now, why do I say this power supply isn't ideal for every application? The answer is that many larger and high end devices consume much more energy than what this OXA product can supply. Two examples are my Samsung Galaxy Note 2 and my wife's Kindle Fire. My Note 2 ships with a 2 amp charger and even that is barely enough to charge the battery if I'm using the phone as a GPS with the screen on full brightness. This OXA would certainly extend my usage time, but my phone would continue to discharge even while plugged into the charger. I did leave the phone connected to the power supply overnight with the screen off, and it did raise my battery level from 32% to 56% by morning, but my phone has a massive 9300 mAh battery, which explains why the power supply didn't charge it much.I plugged my iPod Touch 4th Generation into the OXA power supply and it took it from 8% to fully charged, while I was listening to the iPod over the course of a 5 hour drive. At the end of the trip, my iPod was fully charged and the power supply still had some juice left. The reason for this is that the iPod has a much smaller battery and consumes a fraction of the energy my phone burns through.So before buying this OXA mini power supply, think about if it will do what you need it to do. OXA sells a wide array of larger power supplies, and of course there are other manufacturers out there as well. I'm satisfied that this charger does what it claims, and it is priced lower ($10.99 at time of review) than competing models in the same size and power output classes. For me personally, because of my energy hungry devices, I probably would want a more powerful supply. If you're looking to charge an iPod or more energy efficient phone, then this model is one you might want to consider.I didn't pay for my test sample, but had I bought this for $11 here on Amazon, I'd be happy with the value I received.
summary: Not OXA's Best Work, But not Bad

reviewText: This 2200mAh portable 'juicer' is great for times in a pinch. It's small enough to fit in a purse and will charge a phone without any issues. The battery life on this is quite a bit smaller than what I'm used to, but I'm also used to larger power banks.The feature I like most is it's ability to be a micro SD reader/flash drive. Really easy to insert/remove the microSD.Note: I received this product for free in return for an honest, unbiased, review. This has in no way altered my views of the product.
summary: Small size, great value

reviewText: This is a great little charger. This small little charger provides 2,200mAh of power for recharging your portable device. This isn't a very big battery, but it should fully recharge your phone at least once, which can be a real life-saver.The best use for this power pack is charging small devices that use micro-USB connections. If your device doesn't use micro-USB, you'll have to use an adapter to connect the cable end to your device. It comes with a great little cable to convert from micro-USB to Apple connector for iPhone 4 or older.The charger also has a small LED light that's great for lighting up the inside of your handbag if you're looking for something in the dark. The charger's case has ridges on its case so you can feel it in your bag.To recharge this battery, pull off the top cap to expose the USB connector and then plug it into a wall charger or the USB port on your computer. If you plug it into your computer, you can also plug a micro-SD card into the slot near the USB connector and use the device as a card reader.This charger isn't exactly a powerhouse, but it still packs a lot of power into a small container. The added light and the SD card reader are two bonuses.I was provided this item for review.
summary: Cute little charger

reviewText: The design is unique, but powers your phone with ease. The body is round and cylindrical like other on the market, but that is where the similarities stop. The size is similar to aSmall Keychain MaceTucked inside is a 2,200mAh battery, which easily fits into your pocket. There are three LED lights that represent the battery life. Yes, this is a small battery for a backup, but the fact is so small and pockeable is a great bonus.What separates this charger from the others on the market is the attached Micro USB charging cable, which is great for Android Phones. The days of having to carry a charging cable are now over.There are some hidden features that are not easily seen. First is the built in flashlight, which can come in handy. Second is the hidden USB connector, just insert it into a computer USB port to charge it, not wall charger needed. Lastly is the SD card reader, which gives added value to the battery pack. This is far from a one trick pony. This battery pack can walk and chew gum at the same time.I was supplied a sample for the purpose of review.
summary: Battery Pack Meets Swiss Army Knife

reviewText: A 2200mAh battery pack is what most people have dubbed a “lipstick” pack, most likely because of its compact size. OXA has tried to pack a bit more into this battery pack by offering up a TF reader, something I’ve only seen in one other battery pack. A bit extraneous for most people, but it does work and is a nice bonus.There are three USB connectors included with the package, including a Lightning connector. I couldn’t get the 30-pin connector to work with my first generation iPad. Admittedly, it’s fickle, but if it doesn’t work, there’s no port for using your own cables. The Lightning connector immediately connected and worked on boosting my iPad Air’s charge.Speaking of iPads, if you are looking at this small capacity OXA, you may wish to take a pass and head on up to something with at least 10000mAh. For example, some of the iPads can be power hogs and the iPad Air has a capacity of 8820mAh. If you’re looking at the OXA for your iPhone, you’ll do well and get a full charge. The battery capacity of the iPhone 5 is 1440mAH. That will give you a good idea as to the capacity of this pack.Another nice extra is the lanyard, a convenient one if you are an on-the-go person. There are three blue LED lights to indicate charge, a built-in 5-pin micro B USB cable (I like this), and a small flashlight. The flashlight won’t light up a room, but will get you where you are going in the dark.FEATURES:► Designed with advanced and intelligent microchips to ensure safe operation, over 500 recharge cycles test► Integrated battery capacity status LEDs provide a visual indication of the battery life► Includes a high intensity flashlight and 1 micro USB cable(5V/1A output)► Stylish brushed metal anti-slip surface ensures light weight, scratch resistance and durability► Built-In SD Card Slot could be used as a portable card reader for your convenientSPECS:~► Size: 90*26.7*24mm~► Capacity: 2200mAh~► Output: 5V =1A~► Input: 5V=1A~► Working temperature: -5 ~ 50C~► Support: iPhone, Mobile, PSP, iPadSample provided for review.
summary: Sleek small capacity battery pack with a Lightning connector that works with my iPad Air ...

reviewText: If what you need is a micro USB plug, this power bank has one attached and tucked out of the way. You are good to go without any extra paraphernalia. I love the looks of this battery! I've always appreciated the shape and size of this type of charger: It fits in your purse, in a pocket, just about anywhere; they don't come any smaller than this for an 2200mAh. So, it is specialized--and there is nothing wrong with that.But if you are going to have to add an adapter onto the micro plug, you will lose the intent of this design; you will negate the efficiency and the compactness that this design provides by having to drag around the adapter--because there is no hide-y-hole for it. If you have to cart around a USB cable and adapter, you'd be better off checking out the OXA Perfume 2600mAh SAFE External Battery 18M WTY Premium Samsung Cells Key Chain charger external portable power supply (Check Amp for tablets) for Smartphones and other electronic devices that has the same shape and size and a little heavier because of the extra battery power). Plus it has a slot for an SD card.Back to this 2200 mAh power bank with the nifty aluminum siding: I like that the cover/cap comes off and reveals the USB port inside. I like the added touch of a slot for the SD card (also under the cap). I also like that you cannot lose the cover: The carry cord is strung through it, so when you lift off the cover it hangs on the cord. It does not have any sharp edges to wear a hole through pants pockets or the bottom of a cloth-lined bag. It is well-balanced and seems really light weight, too, at only 2.8 ounces. The ribbed aluminum wrap-around siding gives it eye-catching allure.*I received a sample product from OXA.
summary: Some nice extras!

reviewText: This power bank stands out from the pack by offering a TF reader, as well as a micro USB cord attached onboard. Also included are a 30-pin connector and a Lightning connector. If you require something else, like maybe a mini USB connector, you are out of luck. There is no USB port for charging using your own cable. Two inches is all we get.There is a cap that covers the USB plug (used for charging the device and reading the TF card). It's easy to lose, but that's where the lanyard comes in.Does it work? I've had varying experiences. The first unit I received will not charge my HTC One. It will not charge my small Android tablet. It will charge my large Android tablet, my iPhone, and my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet. The flashlight works but the TF reader does not.I received a replacement and the second unit won't charge anything. It's a dud, but the TF reader and flashlight work.I'm sorry to say my experience has not been positive.This product was provided for review by Oxa.
summary: Duds

reviewText: This 2200mAh unit is a metallic cylinder that reminds me of pepper-spray. A trio of blue LEDs indicates charge/discharge and remaining capacity, and holding the power button turns on a small white-LED flashlight.A very short captive USB cable is used for discharge (charging a load), but the unit has to be plugged into a USB outlet (as if it were a huge USB thumb drive) for charging. That's painfully inconvenient if your chargers are below the desk or at the wall (you can't plug a USB cable into this powerbank).On charge/discharge, the cylinder gets warm to the touch. However, I noticed my phone reported "charged", but was still charging from this powerbank. I worry that means it doesn't have an auto-shutoff (overcharging can damage the battery being charged). I haven't observed this behavior with other powerbanks (Oxa and other brands). 2200mAh is enough to charge up smaller phone batteries, but typically the entire powerbank's capacity can't be discharged. So this unit will, at most, top-off modern phones like my Nexus5 (which has a stock 2300mAh battery).There's a microSHDC card-reader slot to turn this unit into a thumb-drive, but no onboard flash memory.Considering how important mobile devices are to modern living, I really like having a powerbank in every bag I use (laptop case, camera bag, airline carry-on, etc). This one is compact enough to fit "anywhere", but its design is quite limiting. The barrel shape is convenient to hold, and I like the integrated flashlight and captive discharge cable. But it's awkward to actually use (particularly for charging), and the microSDHC slot is not a compelling reason for this strange design.[ A sample was provided to me for review. ]Not recommended unless you really need to have a microSDHC reader on hand at all times.
summary: convenient but limited, in a strange formfactor

reviewText: I took this power bank out of its package and even though there isn't much for instructions its easy to use.After leaving it plugged in for a few hours it was ready to go.  The flash light works Jay fine and the charger works adequately.I like to have spare power banks in multiple places,  from my bug out bags to my purse and car.  This ptoduct is something I would recommend for everyone as long as your phone works with this one.**I received a sample of this product to test and review. All opinions are honest and my own. **
summary: It does work

reviewText: This is a small, highly portable charger for your smartphone or tablet. At 2200 mAh, it's hardly a powerhouse, but its small size and light weight are a satisfactory tradeoff. The charger will give more or less a single charge to many phones, a 2/3 or so charge to larger phones, and maybe 1/3 charge to a tablet. It's really best used with phones.It's clever. A micro-USB cable is integral and folds into a recess in the unit's body. That necessarily means that the cord is very short, maybe two inches, but it's still usable. Charging begins with pressing a button. The same button also shows state of charge when the unit isn't in use (little LEDs give an approximate idea), and turn on the flashlight  feature (see below).The cap of the unit pops off to expose a USB plug, which is how you recharge the unit itself (plugging into a USB charger). There is a TF card reader, which I wasn't able to test with my setups, but it could conceivably be useful in some circumstances. Finally, there is a tiny flashlight which won't light your way along the beach but will help you do things like put your car key into the car door on a dark night.Charge-up time is about what you'd expect, something over an hour on a 2 amp USB charger. Charging times for your phone or other device are also pretty much as expected; a half-charge top-up on an iPhone took something less than an hour and a half.So far so good. The unit is supplied with a couple of adapters for phones (like iPhone) that don't use micro-USB. Of course, this affects portability a little (you need to carry the adapter too).The one issue? Please carefully read the list of supported devices before you buy this. It would not work on my old Droid phone. I contacted OXA and they politely pointed out that Droid is not in the list of supported devices. Fair enough, but don't buy this blind; take a few seconds to check.Four stars overall. It doesn't make five because it isn't universally usable and it doesn't pack a lot of power. But it's definitely a handy device, and it can save the day if you forgot to charge your phone and it's running out on you.Disclaimer: OXA gave me a review sample, but I write unbiased reviews, as I hope came across above.
summary: Works nicely if your device is supported

reviewText: Combination micro flash card reader, phone charger and flashlight in a compact sturdy unit; 3.5” x 0.8” irregular cylinder-shaped device made of aluminum and hard plastic. It is a 2200mAh rechargeable power bank.At one end is a USB and a slot for micro flash card covered by (an unwieldy difficult to remove) cap. On the front, there are three LED lights that indicate when it is being charged (Red) and (Blue) when charging phone; and an ON/OFF button when pressed and held, turns on the mini LED flashlight that is only adequate to find keyhole or items within a purse/bag. No indicator of residual charge in power bank.A male micro USB, attached to a 1.75” cord, is at the other end and can be folded within a groove when not in use.Also included in the package are - micro to lightning and micro to 30 pin converter plugs. A small hand strap is provided.The power bank takes about 5 to 8 hours to be fully charged; wall plug USB is much faster that from a computer. It can charge most smartphones twice before needing a “refill”. Can also function as a memory stick (in conjunction with micro flash card  for data transfer from phone, computer and some digital cameras.Tested it with Samsung S3 and S4, Note Tablet and iPad 2. Used a Kingston 32G micro flash card; data transfer quite good and fast.It is a great device for phones that can be charged with a micro USB and if you are using micro flash cards. Not useful for tablets - can only “top off” but not fully charge the device.Convenient portable multi function charger with limitations, which restricts its general appeal.A complimentary sample provided for review.
summary: Efficient but of limited use.

reviewText: As the title notes, this device is a stellar backup. As the capacity is quite miniscule, this device will be ideal for a one time charge. Otherwise, the built in micro usb is wonderful. Not having to worry about carrying an additional usb is a blessing, especially when you forget to bring one. Otherwise, although the capacity can be quite limiting, the incorporated micro usb is very helpful.
summary: Stellar Backup Device

reviewText: When I first turned this little thing on it played 2 notes to let you know it is working. That was the first indication this was not a normal little speaker. The sound just vibrated my hand and sounded like a much larger speaker. After putting it on the table it made a few more sounds and went right into the pairing mode and my phone connected right to it.Of course the first thing I did was find a song and crank it up until the family yells,"Turn that thing down!" two rooms away. Nice! Since it is made for phones and has a mic in it as well, I then called my unsuspecting spouse who said it sounded fine on the other end, but on my end it sounded great. Nice full bass tones and much preferred over the phone's speaker phone.The practical side of me then kicked as I thought what I would really use it for. If I had to do a long conference call I would use the MOSOUND in a heart beat. The sound would be very easy on the ears and would free me up to do other things, like shop Amazon, during those long pointless calls we all get sucked into. I think it would easily pick up my, "uh huh" and "yes, of course I am listening."We connected both a Galaxy 3 and my iPhone to it with no problem.On a day to day basis though it will not see much phone time. I have better plans. Anyone with an iPad knows the speakers are less than amazing, pretty much useless.
