Here are my observations:Pros -+ Quality; this is a tough case that has taken a falls without any damage to case or iPhone+ Battery; the extended battery is nothing short of amazing, bring the phone from 5% to 75% power on a single charge+ USB; uses microUSB instead of the Apple Lightning port, so all of my old chargers and data cables work+ Speakers; plays through the bottom of case, which is a huge improvement+ Charging; the case can be charged by itself or with the phone in place+ Protection; this has performed well in spontaneous "drop tests"Cons -- Earphone Jack; case has a deep pocket to allow access to the jack, but 90-degree cables will not fit in and nor will devices like "Square" credit card readers. Will be getting an extension cable to fix this issue.Overall, this has been a great accessory that has allowed me to untether from chargers!Highly Recommended!CFHNote; sample provided for review
summary: My Favorite iPhone Case - Highly Recommended

reviewText: My battery has gotten a little weak on my iPhone so this case is an absolute lifesaver!  It extends the life of my battery considerably (my phone was barely making it through a day without dying, but with this case it will last into the next day.)  It's very low-profile so it doesn't add to much size to my phone, but it just about doubles the weight.  An added benefit is that it provides nice protection for my phone.This is an absolute no-brainer if you need extra battery time or if your phone is starting to lose it's battery power.  It will extend the useful life of your phone so you don't have to replace it as quickly which is a huge benefit.
summary: A lifesaver!

reviewText: This is a very attractive-looking battery case. Instead of looking like a wart on the side of the phone (as some battery cases can look) this has a very sculpted look to it that blends in very well with the iPhone.The case has a rubberized-like feel to it that is very fingerprint resistant. The fit is excellent – tight enough to avoid any slippage but not so tight that you need the jaws of life to get it off the phone. It’s a two-part design (top and bottom halves) which makes it very simple to put it on the phone. The access ports are perfectly aligned and have smooth, rounded edges.The capacity is 2300mAh which, considering the slim form factor, it pretty impressive. I very much like that there’s a 4 LED “gas gauge” on the bottom corner which shows the battery level left in the powerbank. It’s easily visible but not glaring.I also like that you can recharge both the case and the phone with a single cable. It recharges the phone first, then the power bank.Nice design and function - highly recommend.[Sample provided for review]
summary: Sleek design; good battery life; secure fit; easy to put on

reviewText: When the folks at LifeCharge asked me to take a look at this case, I was happy to do so, but I was also slightly guarded. I've heard good things and bad things about case/charger combos.If you glance through my reviews, you'll notice that I'm kind of a geek about chargers. I love having a way to charge my electronics when I'm not near a wall outlet. So right away I was interested in this case.I'll address my major misgiving first: the charge/discharge issue with portable chargers. This isn't usually an issue with larger chargers, but this problem is magnified with smaller chargers. With chargers smaller than about 3,000 mAh, or even with larger chargers that aren't fully charged, you can get to a point where the appliance you're trying to charge (your iPhone, in this case) has more power left in its battery than the charger does, so the charge actually goes in the wrong direction and your phone ends up getting drained until the charge in the phone and the charger reach equilibrium. That's not good. Even though the battery and the phone still have some charge left at that point, the slow reverse drool of power between the two batteries works against you and ends up draining both batteries. I've done the same thing with my Kindle tablet and a larger power bank that wasn't fully charged.Anyway, that's a geeky point, but it's a crucial issue with a small 2,300 mAh charger and an iPhone. LifeCharge's solution is simple and effective. They put a power switch on their case. That may not seem like a big deal, but it's huge. Just use your phone normally until the battery gets down to whatever percentage you're comfortable with (say 10%-20%). Then press the power button on the charger case to begin charging your phone. The charger will quickly charge your phone back up to nearly 100% again. Awesome!My second misgiving was that this would add too much bulk to the phone. I'd seen a couple of guys in the past who had charging cases and they looked awful. This one isn't as bulky as I'd feared though. It adds about a quarter inch to the thickness and a half inch to the length of the phone. It's really not bad. I don't leave mine attached to the phone all the time, but I keep it in my briefcase. If I know I'm going to be working late or stuck in a meeting, I can grab the case and not have to worry about my battery life.The case has two parts: a top and a bottom. The two pieces slide apart and make it very easy to install/remove the case if you don't want to leave it on all the time.It feels kind of funny to charge it with a micro-USB cable (provided). I'm so used to connecting a lightning cable to my phone, but the case uses the more common micro-USB cable. I guess the nice thing about that is if time is short I can actually use two cables to quickly charge my phone and this case separately before I have to run off again.The case also provides decent protection for the phone. It is made of a rubberized hard shell that protects the back and all four corners (but not the face). Everyone is different, but that's just how I like my cases.So I initially had my doubts about this case, but they were all addressed in the product itself and I was really worried over nothing. This is a good case. It's useful to me and does what I need it to do: It gives me about one good charge (plus a little extra) for my iPhone. Well done.I was provided this item for review.
summary: Pleasantly Surprised

reviewText: Ever since I bought my first iPhone, I consider a battery case a must-have accessory, and this LifeCharge case fills that need.  There seem to be two common designs of a case like this, both two-piece:  one that detaches at the top third of the case, and the other that uses a top frame to secure the phone.  This LifeCharge case uses the first design.  I like this design best over the two because the iPhone can be slid out in a straight line instead of approaching the lightning connector at a slight angle.  I don't have to worry about damaging the lightning connection in my phone.  The only disadvantage to this design seems to be a slightly longer case by about 1/4".Yes, a battery case will make your iPhone longer, thicker, and heavier.  After all, you are attaching an extra battery to the back of your phone.  The good news is that batteries are getting lighter and thinner, and so are the cases.  I can fit this in my back pocket without a problem, although people who carry their phones in their front pockets will likely find it uncomfortable.I get about 1.5 charges out of this case.  I like that it has an on/off switch on the back so that I can preserve the charge for emergencies OR charge my phone throughout the day until the battery charge is depleted.  This case charges through the included (or any other) microUSB cable, and plugging it in will charge your phone first and then the battery.  All the cut-outs match well and allow accessibility to all the controls, although you'll likely have to use an audio jack extender if you plug in earphones.This is a strong competitor in the battery case marketplace, especially if you like the slide-off top design and don't mind a little extra length.  Note:  I received a sample for review.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Nice, Solid Case with Much-Needed On-Board Power

reviewText: Even though the battery capacity of an iPhone has not increased over the years (and has in fact slightly decreased), thanks to the clever design and many iOS improvements iPhones last much longer today than they did when the first generation of this revolutionary device came out. Nonetheless, I am rarely able to go for more than a day without recharging my phone, even with a very light telephony use. I have several external batteries and power banks that I carry around with me at all times, but they can be annoying to pull out and use, especially if I am constantly on a move. Life Charge is an ideal product to have for iPhone power users, but only if you don’t mind the extra bulkiness that it provides.The LifeCharge Case looks and feels very well designed. It sits comfortably in your hand, although you will certainly notice the extra bulk. All of the iPhone’s ports and controls are easily accessible. The case channels the audio output from iPhone’s own speakers to the small speaker-like openings of its own. The case was easy to use, and iPhone 5/5S slides into it very easily.The 2300 mAh battery capacity is substantially more than iPhone’s own battery, and it’s on par with some high-end Android phones, such as Samsung’s Galaxy line. Use of this LifeCharge Case will more than double the lifespan of your iPhone. Charging itself was very quick and effective.What distinguishes this battery case form some of its competitors is that it’s MFI certified by Apple. This means that you will not have to worry about whether it will stop working with your iPhone if Apple changes its specifications in some future version of iOS ar the phone firmware.One issue that I have with this iPhone case is that it uses the micro USB port for its charging. This is an odd choice of charging input, especially considering that this case is Apple certified. iPhone charging case that doesn’t use the lightning cable is also not a very appealing marketing move. This choice of charging input will mean that you will not be able to sue any of the iPhone specific accessories and stands (like some external speakers for instance) that you might have. Many of them, however, would have been made useless thanks to the thickness of this case anyways.**** Product provided for review purposes. ****
summary: Slick And Effective iPhone Charging Case

reviewText: I was provided a LifeCHARGE ONT-PWR-35171 Battery Case for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ Nice battery capacity increase for your iPhone without adding too much bulk.♦ Fits an iPhone 5/5S perfectly, but case provides mostly cosmetic protection, not protection from major drops.♦ Great design that allows you to slide in your phone and then slide on the top, no forcing or snapping bumpers around your phone.♦ Passed the "Does it Work" Test with flying colors and MFI certified to work with Apple iPhone 5/5S with Lightning Connectors.♦ Charges with an included Micro USB cable.♦ Has "Sync-Through" capabilities that allows you to sync your iPhone without removing the case.♦ The case covers the headphone jack, so you will have to use the included headphone extension to use regular headphones.Detailed Review:♦ Look - The product came in a nice hanging box with a lift up flap that showed the contents through a clear plastic cover. Inside the box was the battery case, a Micro USB charging cable, a headphone jack extension cable and an instruction manual all wrapped in a form fitting plastic holder. It is a nice looking battery case that doesn't add a lot of bulk to your phone, while giving you a nice battery boost. The case is built more for protecting from light bumps and scrapes, not major drops. The back of the case has a power button to turn on the case battery and four capacity gauge LED's. Overall, it seems to have a nice quality build.♦ Installation - Installing the case was great.  It was much easier than most where the top slides off, you then slide in your phone, and then slide the top back on.  There are no bumpers to force around your phone and no twisting or snapping to get your phone in the case.  It locks together pretty solidly.  Much easier and better design than some of the other battery cases I have tested.  No problem and the fit was nice and tight.♦ Use and Performance - To activate the battery case, you press and hold a button on the back of the case and the battery turns on. My phone immediately indicated that it was charging and everything started working as expected. The battery did a good job of charging my phone with no problem and the case felt good in my hand. Charging speed was as fast as typical chargers and added 10% in 10 Minutes and 15% in 15 Minutes of charging.  Right in-line with your average charging speed.  In addition, it did a great job of syncing my iPhone with iTunes right through the included Micro USB charging cable without having to remove my phone from the case.  An essential feature that working well.  It was a little larger and heavier than I was used to with my typical Incipio Dual PRO Case, but not too much. Overall, it worked very well.Conclusion:Overall, the LifeCHARGE ONT-PWR-35171 Battery Case performed very well. Installation was great with one of the better designs on a battery case that I have tried out.  It extended my iPhone's battery significantly while only adding a little bit of bulk. It charged quickly and synced my phone without having to remove the phone from the case.  If you are looking for a battery case for your iPhone 5/5S, this one is a great choice.  Highly Recommended!
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy!

reviewText: First of all:Wow, when they say this is a custom fit, they're not joking. This thing fits so snugly on my iPhone it's like second skin! And this is a great because keeps my phone feeling solid-state, which I really like.The case is great and gives my phone a full extra charge and some pretty solid protection as well. Plus it doesn't add too much bulk to the phone so it's still highly pocketable. I also love the little led lights that show how much battery is left. It's just a nice touch that adds to my impression that this is a high-end unit....All this, and it's MFi certified, which makes this even easier to recommend! Great product!
summary: Well-built power pusher!

reviewText: These days there are so many battery-included phone cases from which to choose that sometimes I have to get down to the picky, nitty-gritty details to differentiate one from another, because they all work.  And if you compare cases with equal amounts of mAh capacity, they will deliver equal amounts of power for your particular phone and your particular usage patterns.This case with incorporated extra battery power is nicely made.  It performs as stated on this product page.  You can buy it with confidence; it will perform.What makes it different from the many others that I've reviewed in the past few months?  Two things:  One of which I like, one which I don't like.  Turns out, after giving it a lot of thought, I dislike one feature more than I like another feature:  Hence, a four-star rating, rather than a five-star rating.  You, on the other hand, might feel that my dislike is no biggie.  Anyway, I'll make the point and you decide.  I just want to help you decide.As far as size goes, this case is so minimally heavier than the last case I reviewed as to be a non-issue:  It weighs a tiny one-tenth of an ounce more than some other battery-included cases I have been experimenting with.  Move the phone from one hand to the other and you cannot notice extra weight.  Comparing dimensions, this case is a little longer than some, but no thicker.  Yes, it is thicker than a regular case, but the battery has to go somewhere.  It is definitely a more convenient and lighter-weight and less bulky choice than a separate external battery.This is my nit-pickiness:  I do not like the angled edges compared to rounded curves of other cases.  It is not bulkier, the "faceted" edges just make it feel bulkier and not ergonomically correct.  I just don't like to hold this phone.  My complaint has nothing to do with the case's performance, which is great.  (I have long, thin fingers; not meaty at all.)This is what I consider a very nice feature, and I've not seen it done this way before:  The top third of the case slides off so that you can slide your phone in.  It is very secure.  Other cases have a removable frame around the whole phone.Another nice feature are all the speaker holes that go across the entire bottom-front of the case.  Other cases have  limited holes or a cut out for where the phone's speakers are.*I received a sample product from Ontrion.
summary: Quality battery phone case; not as ergonomically easy to hold as some others

reviewText: This case really performs! It's excellent both for protection and for its "real" purpose of doubling battery life.The iPhone 5 fits perfectly and it's easy to get the phone in and out of the case. You don't need to charge your phone and case separately-- you just hook a cable up to the case and it charges both (phone first).It's not much bigger than my Otterbox case, feels good, and is not attracting dust/fingerprints. I was pleasantly surprised by the fact that it really doesn't add bulk or weight.You'll still need a screen protector because the case doesn't cover the screen (Otterbox does).This is so handy to have on days when you don't know if you'll be able to charge your phone, or when traveling. You can use it as an everyday case or just as needed. It charges quickly and reliably and seems to be built to last.I was provided with this case for review.
summary: Great Case

reviewText: This is an excellent charging case. The case has a matte texture and feels very nice to the touch. The case is in two pieces. You insert the phone to the bottom half which has the Apple 8pin head, then slip on the top of the case to secure it. The fit is good and all the openings are in the right places. The phone case also gives a little protection due to the thickness of it.To charge the case you just use a universal charger and you plug it in at the bottom of the case. The case stores a lot of power. It has enough power to give your phone a full charge. So basically if you have a full charge on your phone and battery case it should last you all day.I love using these battery cases. On a day to day basis it's a lot more convenient to carry around just a charging case rather than a cable and an external battery.Overall, if you need to use your phone all day get something like this. Highly recommended. [Sample was provided for review purposes.]
summary: Excellent!

reviewText: This battery case for iPhone 5 or 5S has a soft-touch plastic finish that feels nice in the hand and is easy to grip.  It is slightly under 5/8 in. thick and has beveled edges.It is dead-simple to install:  the top section just slides off, the phone is slid into the case, and then the top section slides back in place.  It doesn’t interfere with use of the phone as all the openings are in the right spot.  It provides good protection to the back and sides of the phone and has a slight lip to protect the touchscreen, as well.  It even has a speaker grille at the base.The battery has a nominal 2,300 mAh capacity to effectively double the length of use of an iPhone.  There are four blue LED indicators for remaining capacity in 25% increments.  Just press the recessed button on the back of the case to show remaining capacity and to start drawing the reserve power.A USB-to-micro charging cable is included as well as a short 3.5 mm audio jack extender cable and an user guide.  With this case, the included charging cable eliminates the need for the sometimes-finicky and usually expensive Lightning cables.A sample was provided for testing and review.
summary: Doubles iPhone 5 or 5S battery life

reviewText: The Apple 5-series (5S) with which I tested my review sample has less than spectacular battery performance, so I have more than a casual interest in this case. Let me say up front that there is a trade-off, but one I am glad to make: this takes the sleek 5S and adds a little extra size to it. Width wise the increase is nominal as is the weight. It does make it about a half inch taller, so if you love the phone's original size this will detract slightly from the aesthetics.Looks aren't everything, though, because use time is more important to me and I am not always around a charger. The 2300mAh capacity of the integrated battery is almost 1.5 times that of the 5S' internal 1560mAh battery. Even accounting for loss from charging that is still twice the use time of a 5S without this case, which is why I love it.Another feature I love is the way the case protects the phone. While Apple builds their phones to withstand a lot of abuse, this case adds another layer of protection. It is shock resistant, and the way the outer lip is slightly raised gives the screen more protection if you drop the phone in a carpeted office.Others have described how this case works and fit and form, so I am not going to repeat that information. I will say that the final selling point for me is this case earned Apple's MFi (Made for iPhone) certification, which gives me peace of mind. There are too many products on the market that are of shoddy quality or from fly-by-night outfits, so the certification is not only meaningful, but worth a premium price to me. Considering that this case is competitively priced is yet another value point and one of the reasons why I awarded it five stars.
summary: A solution for iPhone 5 and 5S battery issues

reviewText: First this gives you the ability to basically double your battery life on the iPhone 5 which is a prolific user of power.But this case is much more than an extra battery.  You also have a case that just feels right in your hands.  The case helps keep me from dropping the phone and if I do it will help protect it....as long as it does not fall on the screen.... :)I REALLY like the fact that I can charge both the phone the battery backup at one time with the provided cable.  Just plug it into a usb charger and all is taken care off.  You never need remove the case.  All controls are easily reached and with the case on it still syncs just fine to the cloud.  No interference.I think this is a high quality case.  I have gone through two cycles and it seems to function spot on.  You have four blue lights on the back and when you push the little button it clearly indicates how many of the four bars you have left.I have twice gone down to one bar on the LifeCharge.  Did not notice any hiccups when my phone switched over to the battery.  so it is a smooooooth operator.Just based on this short text time I can find nothing I dislike about this little helper.So if you are tired of looking for power jacks during the day this is the answer.  You can go easily a whole day with very heavy usage and still have some spare life left in the charger.Get one and I promise you will be a very happy camper.I received a free sample of this product for writing an honest review.  I WILL update this if I have any issues and you should feel free to contact me with questions via my profile email address.
summary: Just amazing.  Very solid and performance is off the scale.

reviewText: As usual I received this item free of charge in exchange for a review. Also as usual I will give my scrupulously honest opinions about it.* This is a very solid and very protective case. Between the case and the battery as protection you could probably run over your phone with a truck after putting this on.* The instructions, while not especially necessary, are actually well-written, easy to understand and attractively designed.* The case is a delightfully deep and satiny black color.* Exterior of the case case has a firm non-slip grip* The case charger takes a standard USB plug charger and comes with a data cable. This means you don't have to have the Apple-proprietary charger any longer to charge the phone. That's brilliant all by itself!* The packaging of this device is just immaculate. Easy to unpack and even with magnetic closures on the packaging cover.In summary, a truly professional product from an exterior evaluation standpoint. I leave the technical specs to the other reviewers but as a simple user I'm pretty impressed with this.
summary: An exceptionally solid-looking device

reviewText: This LifeCHARGE extended battery case is awesome. This is for use with Apple iPhone 5 and 5s. The Polycarbonate case has a satin rubber. 2300 mAh lithium-polymer battery augments the iPhone beautifully. LED indicators make it quiet easy to monitor. This has USB connectivity to recharge.MFI (Made for iPhone) Certification) should give everyone peace of mind as this is an approved case! Sine several apps are resource hogs, the case makes sure iPhone is really on full charge. Absolutely great as it doubles as a protection. Obviously I did not drop the phone in concrete to test, but I can say the design is rugged and definitely looks fine. I really count not find any con with this unit. very well made!I was provided this product in exchange of a fair and honest review.
summary: Excellent Build

reviewText: If you are looking for a great on phone battery extender, there are plenty of options. I have reviewed a few other extended batteries and have used them all. The LifeCHARGE doesn't bring anything outstanding or innovative to the table, but that's hard to do when these things are pretty close to perfection as it stands.That being said, the LifeCHARGE is a great choice if you need an extended battery. The price is good and the performance is just what you expect. The internal battery is a 2300 mAh battery, a little more than the iPhone itself. This extra bit is actually wasted energy as no battery is 100% efficient. So that extra bit of power ensures you get 100% more phone time than what you have now.In terms of using the battery, slide the case apart, slide your phone in, connecting the Lightning connection into the port. Slide the piece back on and now you have a phone cover and 100% more battery life with the ease of USB charging.When you want to use the battery, you actually have to press a button on the back of the case to begin charging the phone's internal battery. All of these cases are designed like this and I believe this is to extend the life of both your phone battery and the charge case battery by only charging when needed. The 4 bars on the back of the case indicate charge level, and once charging is complete they shut off.A nice feature that some of the original cases I used didn't have is that this is designed so you don't need an extender on a headphone jack. One less thing to carry is one less thing to carry.And the one less thing to carry goes with not having to carry a Lightning charger. Chances are pretty high you have other digital devices in your life that charge with micro USB. This means if you travel you can just take one USB micro charge cable and you can charge your phone, the extended battery and whatever else you need. And of course, that assumes you don't need to charge more than one device at a time, in which case you will be carrying multiple cables anyway...Overall this is a really well designed case that fits on the iPhone 5s perfectly. Highly recommended.I received a free sample from the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: Great on-phone battery case

reviewText: I was able to charge 2 tablets and two Samsung phones at the same time. Great charger!  Bolse actually made this exact charger maybea year ago with a blue led light and I loved that charger but I hated the led light they put on it.  I even emailed them telling them how much I hated that led light because it was so bright it acted like a night light.  This light is much more subtle and it still has all that power.  This is a much improved multi charger with such a slight modification.  It was really nice to see that companies like this listen to their customers.  I received this item for a honest review
summary: very nice,  very strong charger

reviewText: Everything now a days is charged via USB cables. Sad part is the adapter to charge those nifty gadgets most of the time are not included. That is where the Bolse Rapid 4-Port 20W USB Charger comes in. Now you can simultaneously charge your smartphone, digital camera, iPad or tablet and Bluetooth on one adapter.Take it along with you anywhere. With it's convenient flip down prong, it can easily go in a purse, carry-on bag or suitcase/messenger bag. Has power LED light to let you know unit is correctly plugged in, and has built-in over charging protection. That means when your electronic gadgets are 100% charged, the unit stops charging it so it does not become over charged or over heated.Ports are listed as follows:Port 1 and 2: (Universal) 1 Amp eachPort 3: (iPad) 2 AmpsPort 4 (Samsung/Universal) 1 AmpThe iPad does require 2.1 Amps for amble charging, but because this charger has rapid charging rating at 20W with 4Amps at 5V, that means it does a fine job at charging my iPad Air since it is doing it a faster speed than most other USB chargers.Bolse is becoming well known as a great company offering a wide variety of portable power needs, and this just proves they just keep looking for better ways to make charging faster and more portable.Comes with a one-year limited warranty.Sample provided for review.
summary: Perfect for home and travel use

reviewText: I’ve been using an older model Bolse dual USB port high output wall/travel/AC charger for quite some time and have been quite satisfied.  My old dual USB port charger was set up with 2.1A and 1.0 ports, but this one is definitely an improvement over the other if you need to charge several items at once.  Many companies are stepping up to the plate and realizing that we now live in a world where we need to charge more than one or two items.  I’m sure there will the other 4-port USB chargers, but this is the first one I’ve tried out.Usually I’ll charge many of my devices such as battery packs through my PC, but when I need a rapid charge I’ve set aside my Bolse for when I need it ... which tends to be frequent.  I do like this charger because it takes the AC charger to a new, more powerful level with four ports.  All four ports are labeled “U” for universal, but two of them are specific to optimized the charge of your iPad and Samsung devices.  I’ll list the specs and port capabilities below.  The fastest charges are through AC and even though I do charge through my PC frequently, I prefer the faster, easier AC method.The wide range of compatible devices is a real plus because of the wide range we all use.  I like the Bolse name because it spells quality and dependability.  In addition to the ability to charge four devices, I like its compact nature, the flip-down AC prongs, and yes, I like that yellow orange LED light that signals it’s charging.  If I’m charging something during the night, I dislike the bright blue LED lights that can be a tad disruptive.  The best thing is that I no longer have to plug two Dual AC adapters into a socket where this single 4-port will do just fine.PROS:►  Very compact►  Flip-down AC prongs►  Orange LED light which is perfect for nighttime charging►  Short circuit protection►  Overheat protection►  Trickle charge when your device is fully charged►  Compatibility with a wide variety of devicesCONS:~  None I can think ofSPECS:~►  Input:  AC 100 - 240V~►  Output:  DC 5V 4000mA~►  Weight:  3.95 ounces~►  Material:  PC material~►  LED indication:  Mono Orange~►  Safety approval:  V & FCC & ETLWARRANTY:☼  12 months limitedUSB PORTS COMPATIBILITY (taken from the quick start guide):►  Ports 1 & 2 (Universal):  Designed based on latest USB charging standard and will charge almost all device including Apple & Android devices►  Port 3 (Universal / Device Legacy):  This port will also charge most devices (including iPad) but this port has support legacy / old Apple devices.  If you face any problem charging your Apple devices with Port-1 and Port-2, use this port.►  Port 4 (Universal / Samsung Optimized):  This port is specifically designed to charge Samsung devices (e.g.) Samsung Tab).  Many other phones can be charged as well as using this port.Sample provided for review.
summary: This 4-port AC charger takes charging to a new, more powerful level ...

reviewText: Bolse seams to make quality chargers as all of theirs i have reviewed have worked and i am yet to have a negitive reposne to any.Bolse Multi port charger works for me. I used this product to charge my Samsung Galaxy s4 my wife’s and our two tablets.Pros:LightweightFlip out pluginIt charges from all 4 ports quite well.Allows for 4 devices from one wall socket instead of just 1 (huge benefit in my household)Is not an eye sore of a device.Prongs fold into product making it easier to store / travel without breaking anything.Disclaimer: I received a product in return for an honest review.Overall a great product that works. A++
summary: charging!

reviewText: The average person has multiple devices and not enough space on your PC or the conventional charger to make anything count. The Bolse 4 port USB charger changes the game and you'd be wise to listen.The Bolse charges quickly in a convenient and clean package, you can't help but fall in love with having this.I was a little suspect of how it would charge with multiple devices plugged in (Iphone, Ipad, Samsung Gal3, and another misc device) and it did excellently and without fail. I normally would not charge with all 4 slots but I needed to test it.Solid product, I'll update this review if I find any other issues, concerns, or notes.Pros+ Powerful+ Simple+ Compact+ Widely Compatible+ Warning LightsCons- None thus farDisclaimer: I have received this product for the purposes of reviewing and have provided my unbiased opinion after using the product for a solid week.
summary: Simple, Powerful, and Portable. A must have for a home!

reviewerName: Joel Avrunin "Electrical Engineer who loves S...
reviewText: I don't know where this has been all my life, but it is a truly awesome device for the frequent traveler. I recently upgraded from my regular Apple power bricks to a dual-output one, but this takes it even a step further. From this single device, I am able to charge my iPad, iPhone, Bluetooth earpiece, and one other device (my Kindle, my Garmin Forerunner, etc). In terms of size, it is a little bigger than twice the size of the iPad charger from Apple, but it still features a flip-out plug (making it perfect for travel). I had the last version from Bolse which had a bright blue LED.  The problem with it was that I would use it for travel, and the bright blue LED would light up my hotel room.  I often had to throw a pair of socks over it.  This new version has a nice subdued amber LED.  I love it - it lets me know it is powered, and the ports are all clearly labeled, but it does not light up my whole room.Only 1 port is labeled as being good for the iPad which is fine for most uses. I had no problem getting it to charge 4 devices without getting too warm. The size is really a marvel. When I started traveling a lot, I was carrying 4 USB wall-warts all the time. I replaced two of them with a Bolse 3.1A 15W Dual USB Port High Output Wall/Travel/AC Charger - Black, but this quad charger is replacing everything. Now I only need 1 outlet in the airport or hotel and I can charge up my whole bag of gear.Note that competing units with 4 outputs often are not 20W, so they can't really charge 4 devices at once. Also, many competing units don't have the hand flip-back plug which makes it fit easy in my carry-on bag. Highly recommended!  This is Bolse's second version of the travel charger.  This one is a little more square and has a bit more space between the connectors.  It's a nice upgrade, especially with the amber LED.Note: I was provided a free sample from the manufacturer with no promise of a positive review.
summary: Frequent travelers rejoice - all of your devices can charge with just 1 outlet - new version has subdued light

reviewText: I've used the Bolse 3-port charger for the car, and the 4-port charger (black) for travel, both with reliable results. This 4-port charger (white) adds a green light to verify it's plugged in. While it does not change color when the device charging is ready, it does advertise that it stops charging at that point. That's a feature I wanted to have when I purchased my newest phone.Like the black travel charger, this could also serve as such, although it's bigger due to the light. Not much more, so it's portable. The plug folds into itself easily.There's no problem fitting in multiple devices to charge. I doubt if anyone needs all four ports at a time, but the USB cords can slip in and out as needed, with care. The spacing suffices.I welcome the fact that unlike some other brands, Bolse labels its ports not only with the amperage in clearer to read fashion. It also adds "universal" or "Apple" or "Samsung" as the case may be, and this info can be seen at a distance. A nice touch for a reliable line of products I've been trying out for a while now from the manufacturer.
summary: Like the travel charger, but a light's added

reviewText: Prior to the newly designedBolse 4-Port High Output USB Rapid Charger, I would need to carry multiple USB wall chargers; one for my phone, tablet, e-reader and MP3 player. This would not only take up room in my travel bag, but in hotel rooms with so few outlets, lead to tough choices on what to charge first.With this charger, I can not only charge four devices at once, but I get a substantially quicker charge versus using an OEM charger.  With a 4A total capacity, this unit has double the capacity you will currently find available elsewhere for most 4 port USB wall chargers.  Typical chargers like the very popularAmazon Kindle PowerFast chargerare only rated at 1.8A and 9W and can only charge ONE device at a time; for roughly the same price you can get this Bolse 4 Port wall charger that is rated 4A and 20W and can charge simultaneously up to 4 gadgets.One feature I really like about this newly updated charger is how it is designed.  Yes, the fold up outlet prong is fantastic, but the best part is that each port is labeled for what it can charge.  Often times you will see the outlets described in the user sheet that comes with the product, but lose that paper, and your outlets are no longer identified.  This charger has 4 universal ports you can use to charge anything, but 2 of those ports have special designations as well.  It has been found that some iDevice's and Samsung Android products require specially designed charging ports to draw a charge.  This unit has 2 of its four ports label "iPad/U" and "Sam/U", indicating those respective ports are universal but were also specially designed with Apple or Samsung hardware charging needs in mind.  This unit also features a dulled amber power indication light, wonderful for those who don't like bright lights on their chargers.  This is a fantastic design change from the previous model by this manufacture which had a brighter blue light.Considering all options available on the market today, TheBolse 4-Port High Output USB Rapid Chargeris a tremendous value for the price.  It's well designed for the gadget obsessed to keep all your gear powered at home and on the go.  I would recommend this product to anyone who seeks to simplify their device charging methods, truly a must have.Disclosure: I want you to know I received a sample product from the manufacturer for the purposes of providing this review. However, a review in exchange for the review sample was not promised. The views and opinions expressed in this review are my own, and in no way represent the views or opinions of the manufacturer or vendor.
summary: Incredible Value, Charges All Of My Gadgets At One Time, Compact And Portable...

reviewText: I have used Bolse products for quite awhile now. They have become some of my favorite for charging and power banks because they are well-made, well-designed and last. This unit is no exception to that rule. It is nicely constructed with four ports for charging a large variety of devices (using your own cables). I can charge my Kindle, Kindle Fire, smartphone and best of all, my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet - which is always a hassle with many chargers.This is a wall plug unit that has all the ports at the top or bottom depending on how you position it in the plug. This is a nice feature because you won't have cords popping out on the sides as well, they will all hang down in the same direction.It charges quickly even with multiple devices plugged in and it has a nice LED light (not too obtrusive though) to let you know it is powered.I was provided a unit for evaluation and an honest review.
summary: Perfect for All My Charging Needs - Even Samsung Note 10.1 Tablet!

reviewText: I  charged 3 tablets (7" & 8.9" Kindle Fire HD & 7" Kindle Fire HDX) & my iPod Touch 4G at the same time using theBolse Newly designed 4 Port USB portable AC Rapid Charger - 20 Watt. I was surprised to find everything fully charged when I checked 3 hours later. (The 7" Fire HD began with a 25% charge, the HDX began at 37%, the 8.9" Fire HD began at 64%; I didn't record the iPod %).  My  prepaid LG Cosmos prepaid cell phone  needs to be charged slowly & cannot be charged using the Bolse Rapid Charger.I had some problems the first time I tried charging my Kindle Fire/s 7", 8.9" HD & 7" HDX. I plugged them in using their charging cables, but they weren't charging. I turned them off then back on & they charged just fine. I don't know why this happened, but thought I'd mention it.  The next time I charged them, I didn't have any problems.I'm charging my 7" Fire HD & HDX right now.In the 1 1/2 hours they've been charging,the  HD has gone from 15% to 70%;the HDX has gone from 11% to 72%.(They've been charging 2 1/4 hours now: the HD is @ 93%; HDX @ 96%)The HDX is charging faster...I'm using the iPad port & Frieq's High Speed USB cableFRiEQ Hi-Speed Cloth Jacketed USB 2.0 A Male to Micro B Cable (6 Feet)for the HDX which might be the reason it's charging faster.This Bolse Rapid Charger features:- 4 ports usb charger charges your iPone, iPad, Samsung Phone, HTC, Digital camera & other USB devices.- Orange LED shows when charger is receiving power.- Highest Power rating at 20W/4 Amps output 5V. Intelligent overheat, overcharging and over-current protection built-in.- Compact Design and Flip Down AC Prongs make it easy to carry on travel.- This charger charges tablets at 2 Amps and most phones at 1 Amps current.- Port 1 & 2(Universal) will charge almost all devices including Apple & Android devices.- Port 3(Universal/iDevice Legacy)  will also charge most devices including the iPad. This port supports legacy/old Apple devices.- Port 4(Universal/Samsung Optimized)  is  designed to charge Samsung devices(e.g.Samsung Tab). Many other phones can be charged as well using this port. This port will not charge an iPad.The Bolse Rapid Charger is not compatible With HP TouchPad, Asus Transformer, Motorola Xoom Tablet, & some Blackberry phones.It might not support charging / or slow charging with some devices...for example, my LG Cosmos prepaid cell phone can't be charged using this rapid charger.One-Year Limited WarrantyI received a sample for reviewing purposes & will update my review if my opinion changes.Excellent 4 port rapid charger.5 stars
summary: Excellent Rapid Charger!  Charge 4 tablets at the same time!

reviewText: The new 4 port USB Wall Charger from Bolse puts out 4 A per port at 5 V for faster charging of electronic devices.  People who use the USB ports on the computer or older wall chargers with only 2.1 A will really appreciate the faster charging times for devices that can accommodate 4 A.  The higher output is maintained even when all four USB ports are in use.Those ports are underneath to ease cord tangle and strain and are clearly labelled. All are universal for use with most devices including the newer ones from Apple.  One is also designed to also be compatible with older Apple devices and another with Samsung devices but not with iPad.  It sounds confusing, but iPad and Galaxy owners are familiar with these issues!To get the best use from any USB charger, it is important to understand the requirements of each device and its battery. Manufacturers provide this information; Apple's website, for instance, provides a full page of information about each device's battery. iPad batteries should be completely discharged and then fully recharged monthly, while iPod batteries don't need to be cycled. Some electronics should be turned off or put in sleep mode for charging under certain circumstances. It definitely is worth the time to learn about these requirements.This Bolse wall charger works very well as a permanent charging station but it is also convenient for travel.  It weighs 4 oz. and is just a tad over 3 in. long.  The offset non-polarized prongs are well-protected but are easy to unfold, and they are secure in the wall outlet or power strip.  It will accept 100 V to 240 V.  There is a yellow LED indicator for power.The quality of construction is very good and there is a one-year warranty.A sample was provided for testing and unbiased review.
summary: A full 4 A output per USB port, even when all four are in use

reviewText: I've been using this wall charger for all my charging needs - from tablets to Bluetooth headsets to iPhone and power banks.  It charges all quickly and without a problem.  All four ports are universal, but one is especially for Samsung and one for iPad.  I, of course, never pay attention to which I plug in and I've never suffered any problems for it.Everyone should own a wall charger for travel.  This one has fold up prongs - an absolute must to prevent holes from being rubbed into suitcases and bags.There's an amber light to show it's on, but it's unobtrusive.  It survived the husband test.  He didn't demand I unplug it at night.I like the over heat, overcharge, over-current protection, especially since I like to plug it and forget about it.  This is a great charger at home or on the road.This product was provided for review by LowerPriceUSA.
summary: Perfect for Travel or Home

reviewText: This compact 4-port USB charger can be plugged on a 110V wall outlet or 220V outlet.  You can bring it with you on your travel overseas and you don’t have to be worried if you can find an outlet to charge your USB devices.  The first two outlets are universal and supposed to work on both IOS devices and Androids.  I plugged my Mini Ipad there and it worked without any hitch.  The third port is also labeled as universal but is designed more for IOS devices.  If your IOS device doesn’t charge on the first two ports, this port should handle it without any problem.  The last port is for Android devices and will not work on IOS devices.Rated at 20W and 4A total, this charger is powerful enough to charge 4 tablets at normal speed. Another feature I like is the foldable prongs.  After you are done using it, flip down the prongs and put it in your pocket.A sample of this product was sent to me for review purposes.
summary: Nice compact travel USB charger

reviewText: A nice, compact wall-charger with four USB ports. It allows me to consolidate multiple wall-chargers into one "charging station". Since I don't like to crawl under tables or behind desks, I mounted this unit over a kitchen counter for a charge spot "on the way out of the house".The yellow power-on LED is a welcome change from the glaring blue LEDs that have been recently popular on small electronics. The unit is sleek enough to fit onto a standard US wall outlet without obstructing the other outlet. The plug's prongs are identical, allowing it to mount with USB ports facing up or down. The 100-240V input (50-60HZ) means you only need a simple pin-adapter (at most) to use this unit during your global travels.According to a power meter, I was able to draw 15W through this unit (while simultaneously charging a Samsung Galaxy Nexus, a Motorola Moto G, and an Ipod Touch), making the advertised 20W specification easily achievable. With no attached loads, draw was less than 1W, meaning this unit won't add to the "vampire draw" of electrical devices in my house (my power meter only registers 1W and up).The only issue I experienced was that my unit's folding power prongs unfold to the 45-degree mark very easily, essentially pulling out of the wall if I tug on the USB cables. Since there's enough slack in my cables, this doesn't happen very often, but it would be nice if the prongs would lock into place when fully extended. Other than the prong-locking issue, the unit feels solid and well-made.Other thoughts: The Samsung/Apple ports aren't as well explained as I'd like-- they're designed to provide higher power flow when they detect certain types of devices on the basis of a particular USB signal. A per-port LED showing that the device is drawing power would be nice, even nicer would be some indication that it was drawing power at the "higher" setting.[ I was given this product to review. I received no compensation, and this review is my honest opinion. ]Recommended for consolidated wall-charging of USB devices.
summary: compact and useful 4-port charger

reviewText: Disclaimer: I received this product in exchange for an honest review.Really, this is a simple device that excels at functionality. It has a little sensor that lights up when it is powered (represented by the yellow line on the product page pic. All four ports are clearly labelled and the instruction manual is quite thorough on how to use this device if you werent certain. It is the same basic size as a cell phone with the exception of it being much thicker (about an inch). All in all, a very nice product that I have no problem giving a high recommendation for. Glad to have tested this one out.
summary: Simple functionality in a USB charger.

reviewerName: Richard C. Drew "Anaal Nathra/Uthe vas Bethod...
reviewText: This is the charger I use for travel and at the office. It accepts four USB devices. The higher amperage ones work for all devices, but are marked for specific devices (iPad, for example.) This is to make things simple, but I'd prefer more details. Maybe iPad/.5 amp.All four ports are marked "U" for universal. The two higher amp ports are marked iPad and Sam.This essentially replaces four chargers, saving space and energy.  Great bang for the buck.
summary: Compact and handy way to charge multiple devices - great for travel

reviewText: Disclaimer: I was given a free sample for review purposes, however my reviews are unbiased and frank.I'd previously reviewed a similar Bolse product; this one appears to be an update. It will charge up to four USB devices at once, and outputs up to 4 amps, or 1 amp per device. This is in my opinion the right way to do things; it will charge devices fast enough but not too fast (other devices offer 2 amps on a single port; this is fine for quick charging but I do not think fast charging is so good for battery longevity).The unit has overload, overheat, and overcharging protection, which I consider a must-have feature, as potentially damaging your devices is not acceptable.The charger is quite portable; the prongs fold down for storage and transportation. It's relatively small and lightweight, though a little bigger than the earlier similar product (and there's a good reason for this as I'll describe). It enables two people to charge their phones and tablets all at once and all from one electrical outlet position. This is incredibly convenient for travel (just don't forget to bring all the cables).The difference between this unit and the older one, and the reason for the larger size, is that there is a little more room between the USB plug-in positions on the front of the unit. This makes it easier to insert and remove cabless; the small increase in overall size is a reasonable trade-off.Note that if you're using a power strip, you'll have to put this at the end. I don't consider that a drawback; most likely you'll plug it into a standard outlet in most cases. A small tip: use the upper position in a standard 2-outlet fixture, as that makes it much easier to insert and remove the USB cables.Five stars and definitely recommended.
summary: Nice update of an excellent earlier product

reviewText: I received this unit for free in exchange for a review. I have just a few observations about this particular unit:* Previous Bolse products I've reviewed have included a really bright LED that doubles as a nightlight; this one is a much subtler simple yellow one* USB ports are very snug, no chance of pulling this one out of the wall* Fits very firmly in the wall socket as well* I don't have a way to measure the exact amperage output of the charger but in some simple testing it does seem to charge a bit faster than any of the other charges I have about the house* Very compact unit given the total output. Despite its tiny size, I did verify that you can in fact get four things plugged into it at once.
summary: Sleek little unit with plenty of power

reviewText: This is my second Bolse USB “Rapid Charger” and it seems to be as good as the first. Some reviewers of the initial model complained that the unit burned out after a short time, but mine has continued to function for months. I would guess that, amongst other modifications, Bolse new rapid charger is more reliable. Again, in my experience, so far, so good.I still don’t have any Samsung products to test it on, but I do have a number of Apple devices, all of which charged just fine. I’m not convinced they charged faster than normal, but they did charge.The unit feels slightly larger than the previous Bolse charger, and it’s now white instead of black. I liked the design of the old unit, but it had this blue LED that was incredibly bright. The new model features a tamed orange LED that won’t illuminate a dark room the way the old one did.As with all Bolse products that I’ve tested, it’s well built and offers good performance at a great price. I’m not sure if the “rapid” charger works faster than Apple’s wall outlet adaptors, but it’s certainly not slower. Recommended.
summary: Good improvements and an excellent value

reviewText: The bolse quad USB wall charger has so much power to give out to charge any USB chargeable device. This wall charger has 4 amps of power. I was able to charge my iPad Air, iPhone 5 and my iPod touch 5 at the same at a good speed. I really like that I do not have to go around my room and use 4 different single USB wall chargers because now I have this to solve my problems. This is great for charging external battery packs as well. I have a bunch of battery packs and I can use this to charge 4 of them at once at 1 amp or 2 of them at 2 amps. This is great for airports too. You have a family of 4 with smartphones and you can only find 1 outlet to use. You can use this to charge all of them at once at 1 amp which is the right amount of power to charge a smartphone like an iPhone 5.The USB ports:2 USB port labeled “Universal (U)”.  These USB ports are made to charge Apple and Android devices like iPhones, iPads and Galaxies.1 USB port labeled “iPad/U. This USB port is for Apple devices and for charging older apple devices too. This USB port can charge an iPad too.1 USB port labeled “Sam/U: This USB port is made for Samsung devices. This port can also charge Apple devices as well but not an iPad.No amp specs for each USB port was in the package. I do like to know at what rate my devices are charging at (-1 star).I really like this USB wall charger. I can go home and plug in my iPhone 5, iPod touch 5 and my iPad air. I like that I can do this only using 1 outlet. This is a very useful product.Overall this product is very useful and is very handy for when multiple devices need to be charged. I highly recommend this product.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation, and I promised that my review is fair and honest.
summary: Great wall charger that works well

reviewText: The first thing I care about in a speaker is the sound.  In this case the sound is very good, not great, and better than what I would expect for a speaker in this price range, let alone one that is designed for “rough” conditions.  It definitely provides sound that is clear enough and loud enough for outdoor events.Pairing with my iPhone was immediate.In use this is a no frills, no nonsense speaker.  You can’t use it to make calls, receive calls, or play Angry Birds.  It doesn’t even have a volume control; you are expected to control volume from the device you’re using.  That’s fine for me as not having a volume control keeps the cost of the speaker down, means there’s less for it to break, and one less thing for the manufacture to make weatherproof.The great thing about this speaker, aside from the sound and convenience, is the hole in the middle of the speaker and the cable/clip supplied to go through that hole.  It’s not a simple clip; it is a clip that you can keep shut with a screw down cover to prevent it from opening by accident.  The cable, metal sheathed in plastic, has loops at either end and if you can use a padlock in place of the clip to make it less likely the speaker will “wander off”.I like having a small, durable, rechargeable speaker that can produce good quality sound at a decent volume level.  I love that there is an integrated and reliable way to secure it so I’ll have it for a while longer.The manufacturer provided a sample so I could provide you with this review.…and if you’re wondering what I meant by “what’s not there” it is the place in the center of the speaker where they put the hole.
summary: A well designed as a portable, durable, outdoor speaker.  What makes it special is what’s not there.

reviewText: .It sounds like a good mini-speaker, which may delight or annoy you.It's missing a few features that some other Bluetooth speakers have. See "OKs" below.It seems like a solid all around product. No hassles or problems.- - - The Sound - - -I listened to a challenging tune on this and 3 other small speakers many times over. The sound quality is pretty good for it's size. It's way better than laptop speakers (including my MacBook Pro 13"). It's better than my golf-ball sizedXBOOM Mini Capsule Speakeror the baseball sizedMOCREO MOSOUND Bluetooth Mini Speaker.It's about on par...maybe a half notch below the (larger and not waterproof)PLEMO Magic Cube.Of course it's much worse than your average headphones or larger speakers.Background hiss is faint (when using Bluetooth). I don't think you'll hear it unless your ear is within 12 inches.For mid-range vocals, podcasts, or your average movie, the sound seems very good. For tunes with significant bass and highs...not as good.The volume seems adequate for a 10-20 foot listening range in a quiet outdoor setting (depends on the music), or in a large quiet living room.PROs:- Weather Proof: IPX-4 rating means it can handle rain and gentle splashes- Rugged- Solid all around -- no hassles or nit picksOKs:- No volume control or mute button.- No microphone or phone call capability- Not stereo- No significant delay (matters when watching video)- Volume seems adequate for 10-20 foot listening range in a quiet outdoor setting (depends on the music)- Bluetooth range is as expected. Some dropping out at 25 feet- Connect with Bluetooth or 3.5mm cable (included)- Charging cable is Micro-USB (the most common type)- Fit and finish are perfectly fine- Classic good looks (or good enough)- User Guide is helpful and well written.- Affordable (when selling for $30)- Warranty: 1 yearCONs:- No problems found so far- - - Listing Corrections - - -Size is:  7.2" x 3.2" x 2.1"Playtime on battery: User guide says 5-6 hours vs "up to 10 hours" in listing. Not sure which is correct.- - - Disclosure - - -The manufacturer gave me this item for review. I believe my review is impartial.~~~ Comments & questions welcome ~~~
summary: Nice Little Outdoor Speaker

reviewText: This is a well-designed outdoor speaker. It looks far better than I expected given the price point. Nicely molded plastics with perfect seams. I’m especially fond of the way they put bumpers on both the top and the bottom, so you can flip it over and still have non-skid feet on the bottom.It has a novel design feature in that there’s a large slot through the speaker through which there’s a lanyard (which is included). Great feature for ease of carrying this around.The sound quality is pretty good. It’s a bit muted sounding, but the bass response is excellent – better than expected given the small size.The controls are all on the same end, and consist of an on/off button, a micro USB input for charging, and a 3.5mm input jack for direct connects. The ports are covered by a rubber flap that is sturdy and well-anchored to avoid it getting lost.I had no problems pairing this with a couple of tablets and a phone. The bluetooth range is very good, with zero dropouts at about 25 feet. As expected, the direct connect option worked perfectly.The only negative is that it lacks volume control. But that also eliminates a set of buttons on the speaker, and thus eliminates a potential point of water entry.I think this is an excellent value for the price point. Solid construction, very respectable sound quality, and an innovative design that makes it easy to take along. Highly recommend.[Sample provided for review]
summary: Nice size for portability; solid build quality; respectable sound

reviewText: I was provided a Sabrent Bluetooth Outdoor Wireless Speaker for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ Rugged, heavy duty design with a cable for hanging the speaker.♦ Great sound quality with good frequency and bass response for this size speaker, just don't expect booming bass.♦ It has a rechargeable battery that charges with a standard Micro USB cable (included).♦ It does not have a volume button, so your device controls the volume of the speaker.Detailed Review:♦ Look - The product came in a professional looking box with nice pictures and product information on the outside. Inside the box was the Speaker, an instruction manual, an Aux Cable and a Micro USB charging cable. The first thing you see is the rugged design of the speaker with the cable for hanging the speaker.  It has rubberized feet on the top and bottom and a rubber cover over the Micro USB charging port and the aux port.  It is made for outdoor use.  It looks pretty impressive. It has a single button for power and pairing.  It does not have a volume adjustment so your device fully controls the speaker volume. It looks like it is designed and built well.♦ Installation - I plugged in the included Mini USB charging cable into the unit and into a USB wall charger to give it an initial charge before testing it out.♦ Use and Performance - Once the speaker was charged, a did a variety of tests to try it out using my iPhone 5S.Test #1 (Sound Quality Test) - I tried out a variety of music from some Disney kids songs to some Pop Music to Excision Bass Heavy Dubstep (the Destroid album), and the speaker sounded really great in all situations.  It had no distortion and reached some pretty high volumes. It had really good bass sounds for a small speaker, but not booming bass (this is not a negative because no tiny speaker can produce booming bass). It sounded really good overall.Test #2 (Sound Performance Test) - After I got past the basic sound quality, I tried out a few more technical tests. I put speaker directly in front of me and started playing a Dolby HD Surround Sound test video. It sounded really good, but as you would expect, there are no real surround or stereo capabilities from a single speaker setup. I also played a frequency test file that started at 20Hz and found that the speaker started producing sound around the 33Hz range, which is pretty low. The sound continued with sound being audible all the way up to 15000Hz. Great range for a small speaker.Test #3 (Use Test) - I tested the Bluetooth range by walking through my house and got really far away, more than 20 feet around several walls, before the sound dropped out. Walking back started the sound back up immediately. Overall, the range was really good and better than many Bluetooth speakers that I have tested. Once the sound testing was done via Bluetooth streaming, I tried out the sound from the Aux input cable from my iPhone and it sounded just as good. The hanging cable has a carabiner hook with a locking mechanism that is really secure.  It can be used to hang the speaker from a hook, a tree branch, or just about anything else up to about 3 inches in diameter.  The speaker can also just be set on a table.  Lots of different use options.Conclusion:Overall, this speaker not only looks cool and rugged, but it sounds great.  It has a solid build and it gives you a lot of different options for placement.  That combined with a long Bluetooth range make it a great outdoor speaker option.  If you are looking for a rugged Bluetooth speaker, this one is a great choice. Highly Recommended!
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy!

reviewText: This is a snappy little (albeit a bit heavier than expected) durable, almost indestructible speaker to transmit Bluetooth wireless music. The rechargeable Li-Battery battery holds 10 hours of power and the quality speaker (highs and lows, believe it or not - though I haven't tried Mahler or Wagner on it yet) is amazingly excellent. It is compatible with all audio player and multimedia devices with a Universal 3.5mm Audio Jack. If you're a hiker, this is an excellent full range speaker to tuck away in your backpack, or to put by the pool, or tennis court, or patio barbeque. But it is not limited to outdoor use. Take it along when washing the car, working in the garage or just doing regular gardening - it has a carrying hook that feels fine on a belt. To make your music more mobile, this is a fine means to the end. Grady Harp, January 14
summary: For the sports-minded or outdoor party people

reviewText: I find it inconvenient that there is no volume control on the speaker.  I suppose that is not a big problem if you are using this speaker in a party atmosphere and you want to control the music from a distance, but I want to leave my device in one location and carry the speaker around with me as I work and play outside.  Except for an on/off button, there is no way to control your music from the speaker.I am impressed with the distance I can move away from my device--in my test case, a laptop where ALL my music is stored.  The manual claims 10 meters (about 33 feet), but I think that is being very modest.  I was able to move at least 60' away, through a wall and a closed glass window without the sound breaking.  Yes, it broke some as I moved out the door and into the yard, but I was able to find a convenient place to hang it 60' from my laptop (that was sitting on my desk inside the house).The sound is not bad at all for a "mono" and actually has nice depth and dimension.  Bass and treble cannot be adjusted:  There is no "music" or "party" mode.  It is what it is--and it is easy listening.This speaker will play for 5-6 hours.  It comes with a cord to charge through your device or USB hub.  It does not come with a cord with a wall plug-in.It was simple to set up.  It is nice looking with its shiny dark gray finish, (with some sparkle in it).  It is not the smallest bluetooth speaker you can find, but it is sturdy and lightweight enough to not be cumbersome and it carries easily.  It comes with a one-year warranty.  Waterproof level is IPX4.**I received a sample product from Sabrent.
summary: No volume control on speaker, but works up to 60' away from device

reviewText: Here's another entry in the water resistant portable Bluetooth speaker category. It's a good one, although it lacks some of the features that other comparable speakers often have. To test the speaker, I used a playlist on my Kindle Fire HD 7" tablet. The speaker quickly paired as device "Sabrent BYTA" with no code required. Music sounded very good, and lyrics were clear. Instrumental songs were also good, with decent bass sound for such a small speaker.The speaker does not have some of the features that other portable speakers often have. There are no volume, run/pause, and forward/back controls on the speaker - those must be controlled from the audio source. Also, the speaker cannot be used for hands-free cellphone calls. If the audio source has no Bluetooth, an audio cable (included) can be used to connect the speaker with the source if the source device has a 3.5mm audio jack. In the hardwired mode, the volume and track controls must be set from the source (this is always the case with any Bluetooth speaker, however). The specs indicate that the usable range of the speaker is 10 meters (33 feet) from the source. I found this to be fairly accurate, although I did notice an occasional brief hiccup at distances less than 33 feet.The speaker has a built-in rechargeable battery that when fully charged will give 5-6 hours of play, according to the user guide. (The product description page shows up to 10 hours, a discrepancy.)  I recharged the speaker with a 5V~0.85A AC wall charger overnight, and it worked fine.One very appreciated feature is the rubber-coated steel lanyard with a locking carabiner clip. This would be good for hanging the speaker or for attaching the speaker to your belt. Either way, it's not going anywhere.With 2 watts of output sound, the Sabrent speaker won't replace a boom box for big sound, but for lesser needs, especially in damp, humid conditions, the speaker would be a good choice if you don't mind controlling the sound from the audio source, since the speaker lacks audio controls.A product sample was provided by the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: Good for indoor/outdoor use, especially in damp conditions

reviewText: This speaker is much much nicer than I was expecting and the cobalt grey really sets it off. My first Bluetooth speaker this is not but it is the first time I've actually used the Bluetooth feature and I'm hooked.Just turn your speaker on ( you'll see the light flash and you'll hear the start up music) once its on its ready to connect to your device. Sabrent popped right up on my phone I turned on Pandora and I was listening to music no problem. I love that I can still control the volume songs ect just like it was plugged in via audio cable. Now I don't have to "forget" where I left my phone if I choose to use this around the house ( its loud enough for it).Now of course the Bluetooth only works if you have a signal, and since I plan to use this when out boating that may be an issue. The carabiner clip seems to be pretty tough so that will make it easier to hang it on something like a slim tree branch while camping. I also like to hang it on the door in the bathroom while I take a shower and I clipped on my bike for a quick ride and I really liked it.Its also weatherproof so that's always nice just remember that doesn't mean its waterproof and submersion would probably damage this device. Charging this bad boy is also very easy as it has a USB port so most phone chargers will do the job. A 1 year limited warranty is also included and customer service seems very easy to reach.So far i'm impressed and look forward to using it while out camping and boating when the weather warms up. The only bad aspect of this item that I can see is that it was made in China other than that its great.**I was provided a sample to test and review,  all opinions are honest and my own. **
summary: A nice compact durable speaker

reviewText: I received this item for free in exchange for a review.  Despite that kindness I give my candid thoughts below.  Also, other reviewers have done a great job of summarizing the technical aspects of this device.  I'll focus on the more practical in a punctilious bullet format.* When I got the box I was admittedly a bit put off but after opening it this thing is built, as my grandpa would say, like a brick s*** house.  It's heavy, durable and you could probably drop-kick it across a parking lot and it would still work.* Charging is via micro-USB and the cord is very short so hopefully you have a longer and handier one laying about.* It comes with a simple security chain, I suppose so you can padlock it to something and not have it stolen.  This is the only electronic device I've ever seen that has anti-theft considerations built in.* Sound quality was great considering the size of the speaker with a solid mid-range.My impression of this thing is exceptionally positive from a practical standpoint.  If it performs as well as the techies say it does then it seems like a sure winner.
summary: Built so you could defend yourself with it if you had to

reviewText: If there is one gadget that is popular in 2013 and leading into 2014 it is the bluetooth speaker. I was amazed so many of them in stores and even popularized by general media during 2013 December season.Sabrent's bluetooth speaker is rugged and reasonably heavy, has to be for outdoors, otherwise a wind will blow these puppies away. Bluetooth pairing worked perfectly with Samsung Galaxy S4 phone. This has 800 mAh Li Battery. microUSB charging makes sure you don't need any batteries. Volumes was good for a outdoor setting. I used it for a birthday party in a park and the songs were controlled from the phone. In fact had fun when kids neared the speaker, I increased volume, decreased volume, changed tracks etc.!I give these speakers very good rating and volume and the build quality attest to that! I was provided this product in exchange of a honest and fair review.
summary: Nice little speaker!

reviewText: This speaker is rugged and fun. It has a very handy snap hook which hooks to your back pack, purse or bag quickly and easily. It is sleek, sturdy and heavy for its size. It has great sound quality for the money! The Bluetooth connects easily! Just turn on the speaker and pair your device. I was able to play it more than ten hours without the battery dying. It has a 3.5mm audio jack to connect to all types of music players or anything with a headphone Jack. I left it outside overnight to see how the dew would effect it and it worked fine the next day! It also has a micro usb cord for charging. You can charge it with the computer, car or wall plug depending on what you have available. Powerful  sound that take a beating, a must have for teens. Especially if you want to only have to buy one speaker that will last them! I was given this product for a fair and honest review.
summary: Rugged and Powerful

reviewText: The Sabrent is a small speaker offering mediocre sound quality with a bit more power than you might expect from something this small. The portable Bluetooth speaker market is being flooded with options, and since I’ve recently had a chance to review three similar models, I’ll provide some points of comparison.First off, I’ll say that the sound quality of tiny speakers like this is marginal at best, but sound quality isn’t exactly the point when you’re dealing with this sort of thing. If you’re expecting deep bass, detailed midrange, and crystalline highs from a tiny speaker in a plastic enclosure, then you need to revisit high school physics because it’s just not possible. When I compare sound quality between the following Bluetooth speakers, keep in mind that quality is relative. Even the best sounding portable Bluetooth speaker is going to sound shallow and anemic when compared with conventional speakers.Second, the Bluetooth functionality works reasonably well. Syncing is as straightforward as it can be. However, I’m not a big fan of the control interface. There is only one button and it’s used to control power and syncing. I wish there was a separate button for syncing, but it at least offers a better experience than the Antec SP Zero, which I mention below.Third, the Sabrent is very ruggedly built. It’s made for outdoor use, so it can be around some water without getting ruined. I’m not in love with the design because it seems like a lot of space is wasted on the carabineer snap hook, but whatever. It’s so inexpensive that it doesn’t matter.Now for the comparison.Antec SP Zero (approximately $50-70). The Antec sits right in the middle of the pack both in terms of price and in terms of sound quality. The bass gives the impression of being punchy, although on a smaller scale than you would find with larger speakers. The mids and highs are reasonable, but nothing too amazing. Anyone telling you differently either has very low standards for aural excellence or has not had a chance to audition the competition.Sabrent Mini Outdoor Portable Bluetooth Speaker (approximately $20). The Sabrent model is the cheapest by far and it actually plays louder than the Antec. It’s bass extends slightly deeper as well. The highs are duller than the Antec and the Edifier, but sometimes volume can make up for quality, especially if you’re using this outdoors.Edifier MP260 Extreme (approximately $80). The Edifier is the most expensive option, but at only $30 more than the Antec, it’s actually a huge step up in sound quality and volume level. Sure, it’s a bit bigger in size, but it’s still very portable and weighs about the same as all three models. It actually has some decent bass response, partially due to the larger enclosure. It uses two drivers where the Sabrent and the Antec use only one.Since each of the above speakers are similarly sized and share the exact same functionality as far as Bluetooth connectivity, the real question is: how much do you want to spend and what level of sound quality are you satisfied with? The Sabrent is a great value and plays louder than the Antec. The Edifier is more expensive, but the sound quality and volume are superior to the others. Unfortunately, this means the Antec is not remarkable in any capacity. Compared to the Sabrent, it’s too expensive and doesn’t do anything to justify its price.Overall, I can recommend the Sabrent to anyone who wants a very affordable, durable Bluetooth speaker. The sound isn’t amazing, but at this price, it sounds better than one would expect.Disclosure: I received this product from Sabrent to review. I did not allow this to influence my judgment and opinion.
summary: Another great value from Sabrent

reviewText: The Sabrent Bluetooth Speaker Mini Outdoor Sports Portable Wireless Speaker is a small package that provides good sound for its size. Do not expect it to perform like top of the line Bose speakers but it is not bad for a lower priced speaker. Pairing it with my iPod was extremely fast and easy. I also like the design which is small yet stylish. This is a good speaker to use on an outside patio or for a bedroom. If you place it outside do not expect it to provide great sound over a long distance. It doesn’t come with a lot of bells and whistles which I view as a benefit if you are looking for a small unit with decent sound that is easy to use. For the price this is a great deal.
summary: Simple, Stylish, Effective

reviewText: Note: I received this bracelet in return for an honest review.
