Key parameters are as follows:- Functionality (what is mAH and how long it takes to charge)- Durability (how durable)- Portability (size, look and feel)In these respects this charger performed very well in all aspects. Packaging is very good and a non-frustration type package. This has TWO USB port and one microUSB port. You connect the USB cable to microUSB and charge the device. You should connect the cable to regular USB and other end to phones/phablets/tablets etc.This power bank comes in a stylish aluminum case. The box comes with a USB cable and also an adapter for iPhone 30 pin. I have charged multiple devices using this- Samsung Galaxy S4 phones- Samsung Galaxy Tab PRO 12.2"The microUSB is used to charge this powerbank and the USB itself to charge other devices. I had no issue charging these with the External Battery power bank. 12000 mAh is strong enough to charge the phones multiple times.Overall excellent value and great powerbank. Just throw it in handbag or backpack and you are all set! Sample provided for a fair and honest review.
summary: 12000 mAH is super good!

reviewText: I normally love Jabra products but this time this product was way below my expectations of craftsmanship and sound quality.  The presentation was beautifully laid out in the hard see-through plastic case.  Comes with a variety of ear plug sizes, ear hooks, carry pouch, and micro-USB charging cable.  It also comes with a tiny cable connector in case you want to connect the cables together to make hang shorter.Pairing was so quick that I think it took less than 5 seconds.  As soon as I removed the Earbuds from the case the blue light was blinking to pair and I could hear the voice commands giving me instructions to go to my phone and find the Bluetooth device in my Bluetooth menu.  Once it connected to my iPhone 5S I went to my iTunes app and I quickly notice scratchy static noises every time I touch my phone and selected a function.  When the music started to play it sounded dull and flat.Where the multi-function switch is on the cord is located makes it uncomfortable to use.  I really like the idea that the earplugs stick together magnetically making it easier to store.  As soon as I tried putting the earbuds in the carry pouch they turned back on again.  This happened several times after turning them off using the multi-function button.  I finally just turned my Bluetooth off on my phone.Wireless is best is my opinion because it means less wires and freedom of movement.  Overall, these are okay but they can use some major improvements to make them a 5 star product.
summary: I hear static and constantly turns back on

reviewText: Good sound qualitywell designed- charging mechanism under the cover of the left ear makes a sleek appearance. Lighter weight than other comparable products with no loss of sound quality.comes with a variety of ear tips for comfort and a good fitswapped to a different set and got a better sound quality than the ones on it originally because they sealed the ear canal better.Synching is quick and easy. Synched to ipod with no issues.Not seeing the volume control takes a little experimenting with. Everything is in a tiny package with layout, making them lighter but less intuitive until I got used to using them.
summary: Jabra earbuds

reviewText: I liked the fit, especially with those EarWings.  They hold the earphones in my ears securely and with reasonable comfort.Sound was ok, just OK.  It certainly did not produce the rich bass I was expecting from the description.  It got a bit better when played through the free app you can download and more on that in a bit.Controls and usability are a mix.  The volume control actually controls the volume on my phone rather than adjusting the headset amplification.  It also provides an on-screen indication of battery level.  On the downside is there is now way I can figure out to activate Siri to accept voice commands or fill the void in moments of loneliness.The magnet standby is a nice touch… though, it’s not really “standby.”  You take the earbuds out of your ears and place their backs together.  Small magnets hold them together and some internal switch-y thing turns them off.  Pull them apart and the headset powers back on and the Bluetooth connection is re-established in a few seconds.The Bluetooth reception is affected by body shadowing.  By that I mean you could experience annoying signal interruptions depending on where you keep your phone.  In case, placing my phone in my right front pants pocket and letting my right arm hand down caused the signal to break up.  I realize this is easy enough to avoid… just don’t do that.  However, for a headset in this price range I shouldn’t have to worry about that kind of thing.Now, about the app…  It is free and requires a super-secret Product ID, unique to each device, for activation.  Supposedly it’s included with the headset and I couldn’t locate mine.  The problem was solved easily enough though.  I called Jabra customer service at 800-327-2230 (a number that is *not* prominently displayed on their site) and a very pleasant customer service representative generated a number for me.  She was also kind enough to tell me it was only good for two devices; I would need to call back for another number if I want to activate the software on a third device.The Dolby processing provided a considerable sound improvement, more than simple boosters and equalizer like the one I received with my Denon headset.  The downside is that it only works with preloaded music and YouTube.  If you listen to Pandora or a similar service, you’re out of luck.
summary: Nice fit, clear and somewhat tinny sound, poor Bluetooth signal

reviewText: I like to use Bluetooth headphones or earbuds when I am working in our yard. Wired headphones/earbuds always seem to get caught on things and ripped out of years. Once the wire from my headphones got caught on a tree while I was mowing, ripped off my head, and promptly (and accidently) run over by lawn mower.The Jabra Rox is a relatively high-end set of wireless/Bluetooth/NFC earbuds. They are very lightweight, easy to pair, and have top notch sound performance. While I very rarely used earbuds for making phone calls the Jabra Rox due offer nice functionality and cancelling ability.Notes-- Very nice sound quality – a full sound stage with both nice highs and full depth in bass. While they are not necessarily for audiophiles (and I doubt ANY bluetooth earbuds are for audiophiles)- Efficient sound performance – despite their size they are definitely loud enough to be worn on airplanes and lawn mowers- Fully rechargeable – the battery life is very good. I am able to get several hours of playback even at high volumes- Nice carrying case- Relatively comfortable + they comes with several other sets of inserts- I do have a bit of a tough time getting them into my ears – It takes a bit of practice (and I know that sounds crazy)- Very durable – no worries about dirt, grime, or sweat ruining the Jabra Rox- Paired very easily with my iPhoneFinal verdict – The Jabra Rox are now my favorite set of Bluetooth earbuds.. hopefully I can keep them away from my lawnmower blades!4  Stars
summary: A Great Performer - Great Performance with the Convenience of Bluetooth

reviewText: I was expecting a lot from these given the brand and price point. However, they were rather disappointing on a number of levels.The best feature about them is the comfort. They fit well, are lightweight, and the cord is easily managed even when moving around (such as on exercise equipment at the gym). You know they are there, but I could wear them for an hour or so without any ear fatigue or irritation. The "ear wings" that hold them in place are fussy to keep attached, however.The sound quality is decent but not anything out of the ordinary. I have bluetooth buds that are less than a quarter of the price of these that put out pretty much the same sound quality. These sound a bit tinny with little depth, and the bass is muddy. Nothing special or even a little outstanding about the sound quality. The volume range is limited compared with other earbuds – even at the max volume it did not put out the volume I was looking for.While they paired up with my tablets easily, they disconnected several times each time I used them. This may be due to the fact that I was using them at the gym, which has a lot of other people using bluetooth systems plus a lot of machinery. However, I nearly always use bluetooth headphones (or bluetooth-connected speakers of some sort) there, and this is the first time that has happened, so I am attributing the problem to the Jabra equipment.Given the problems with connection, the only average sound quality and limited volume, the best I can offer these is a below average rating. There are better choices available at this price point and, if you’re willing to live with something that’s less stylish, you can get the equal sound quality and better/more stable connectivity for a lot less money. Not recommended.
summary: Not a standout on any metric

reviewText: These Bluetooth Earbuds come in a hard plastic case with an assortment of earwings to hold them in your ears and an assortment of different size ear gels so you always get the perfect fit regardless of the size of your ears.  It also includes a small little carry pouch with a drawstring that can easily fit in your pocket and be taken anywhere.The right and left earbuds are connected together with a wire and that wire has a small control panel. The control panel allows you to turn it on and off and also turn the volume up and down. Other than that there are no wires to connect to your device. These headphones connect with Bluetooth technology and they can receive a signal and stream crystal clear music for nearly 30 feet. The signal is very good up to about 25 feet and then it may start to cut out after that. It was very quick to sync them with my iPad the first time. It took about twenty seconds and it has never disconnected since the original sync.The sound quality is excellent with these earbuds and being totally wireless is really nice. I use them all the time to stream music from my iPad to these earbuds. It’s nice because I can walk around the house and do chores like laundry or doing the dishes and be free from carrying my iPad around. They stay in my ears very well and don’t move around for the most part. I also like that only you can hear them. With most earbuds other people around you can still hear the music a little bit. With these earbuds you can’t hear them unless they are in your ears.They have a LED indicator light that tells you when they are turned on or off and they have a magnet in each of the earbuds. When not in use you can connect them and they will automatically turn themselves off.When the battery is low it’s easy to charge. Simply connect the included USB cable to the earbuds and your computer or your USB wall charger. Once fully charged you can get hours of use out of them.Overall these are a great sounding set of earbuds that give you the freedom to listen to your favorite music without being connected to your iPad or similar type of device.
summary: Great sound, strong battery life and wireless. What's not to like..

reviewText: I've owned many pairs of Bluetooth earbuds and BT dongles for wired earbuds and this set of Jabra ROX BT earbuds is BY FAR THE WORST I've ever used.  The BT connection is simply horrible.  The range is bad enough that if I put my iPhone in my pocket the signal starts to cut out.  Oddly enough, it's even worse if I'm not sitting still.  I take a lot of public transportation (commuter train from home to work with a bus connection) and when I'm walking from one leg of my trip to the next, the signal skips really badly.  I have no clue why motion would interfere with the BT signal, but it does.  I don't keep my phone in my pocket, because that causes signal problems.  So walking along the signal skips with almost every stride (every time my foot hits the ground).  At first I thought maybe this was from swinging my arm while I walk (which definitely made it worse), so now I walk with my phone in the same hand that I hang from my shoulder bag strap and that cuts down about 75% of the signal skips.That is ridiculous.And that's just walking down the street.  I can't imagine how much worse these would be for exercise.Honestly, this is a horrible implimentation of the BT standard.I have another set of BT earbuds that have incredible range.  More than once I've accidentally left my phone on my desk and walked over to the kitchen about 30' away and still had a decent connection.  I don't demand that same level of connectivity from these earbuds, but I shouldn't have to be bedridden to make them work either.So that's my primary complaint.Next comes the fit and comfort.  These aren't comfortable for me.  The charger and BT radio are in the earbud themselves, which makes the body of the driver pretty massive.  To fix this they give you some rubber barb thingies that are supposed to hook the earbuds into the folds of your ear.  I really don't want that.  I tried to make them work, but I couldn't find a combination of earbud size and barb size that would fit into my ear.  I have pretty big ears, but that's a lot of rubber to try to wad into my ear hole.  And then what happens to all that bulk when you take them off and drop them into your bag or pocket?  Nothing good happens, that's what.The sound quality of these drivers is good, but who cares about fidelity when the signal keeps breaking up and skipping?For this price (currently about $130) I would expect something utterly spectacular.  This is just the opposite.  This product is a failure.
summary: So disappointed

reviewText: This is the fifth set of Jabra headphones that Iv'e tried and tested. Jabra has a really cool line of headsets that are nicely designed and generally function really well. However, in my experience none of them are really durable, especially if you use them for sports or with other physical activities. I have not owned these long enough to attest how durable they are, but right now based on my prior experience with Jabra products I am highly skeptical. On the plus side, though, Jabra has perhaps one of the best customer service departments that I've come across, and replacing the broken headphones has been really easy and straightforward. Nonetheless, I'd much prefer never to have to deal with the customer service department if I can help it.the sound quality of this headset is pretty good, but it's nothing spectacular. It's a bit better than average for a bluetooth headset, but IMHO that's not good enough for a headset of this caliber. I don't expect any bluetooth headset to match the quality of sound form the dedicated wired headphones, but I feel that there is a lot of room for improvement over the standard Bluetooth headset.The headset was really easy to pair up with my iPhone. That seems to be the case with most Bluetooth devices these days. Gone are the days when the Bluetooth connection was extremely finicky and intermittent. We are almost starting to become complacent about the reliability of the Bluetooth connection.I have not tested these headphones as a proper telephony headset. I hate using wireless headsets for my phone calls, and am still to find one that is not completely useless from my standpoint.I really like the look and the design of this headset. It is very elegant and stylish. The headphones start getting uncomfortable after a prolonged use, but that's pretty much the case with all headsets.If you are looking for a pair of lightweight and comfortable bluetooth headphones that deliver pretty good sound, then this a very good headset that will probably keep you happy. However, if you primarily use these kinds of headphones for exercising, and the highest level of audio quality is not of a paramount importance to you, then I would suggest the following strategy: buy a pair of inexpensive off-brand headphones (many pretty decent ones can be bought for $20 or even much less), use them for as long as they last (some of the ones I've tested can last you up to a year or longer), and then replace them with a new pair once they break down. I hate throwing away things if I can help it, but from my seven years of experience with stereo bluetooth headsets in the gym I feel that this is the
summary: Good Quality Bluetooth Stereo Headset

reviewText: PRESENTATIONThe presentation is excellent; packaging is well thought-out and would make for a nice gift.PAIRINGCouldn't be easier. It actually talks you through it and went without a hitch.FITThere are lots of options for both ear "wings" and ear buds. I didn't find one that I felt was perfect, but I had no problem feeling like they would stay put in my ears, which is often a problem for me. The wings worked well to keep them in place.SOUND QUALITYHere's where I differ from some reviewers. I am not at all impressed with the sound quality. Too much treble, not enough bass, and lacking in depth. A tinny sound, not at all robust. I know that it's hard to get Bose sound from wireless earbuds, but this isn't acceptable to me. The search continues.EASE OF USEPretty great. When you take them off, the earbuds magnetically clip together and disconnect from your device. When you put them on again, they automatically connect.BATTERY LIFEAbout 2 hours to charge, plays for 5 continuous hours. The USB port is under the magnetic cover of the left earbud.
summary: Sound Doesn't Impress Me

reviewText: Obviously, these are some of your more expensive Bluetooth earbuds. So what do I expect out of high priced earbuds? Great sound, great features, durable quality. These seem to fit all categories. They are a heavy duty rubber but not too heavy. The connecting cable is soft and flexible and doesn't snap or catch. It is long enough to tuck under my hair and have enough give to turn my head without things pulling.They charge quickly using a USB to micro USB cable (provided) and the charge lasts quite awhile. It comes with a variety of earbud sizes but my favorites lately have been the squishy foam ones which aren't included. It also has some positioning wings but I don't use them. A small drawstring case will hold the earbuds and charging cable together. For the price, I actually thought that the case could have been a little nicer. In fact, when you pull on the drawstrings, it doesn't stay closed. I am tempted to take a star off the rating for that but it should be easy enough to find another bag to keep them safely in.The sound is great and there are controls on the cable for volume and call control. It pairs easily and also has the benefit of NFC communication (you usually have to enabled it on your phone) which allows for quick pairing.
summary: Wonderful Sound, Comfortable

reviewText: Everything looks great.  The box is cleanly designed and the plastic container holds the Bluetooth ear buds in an almost jewelry box design.  There is a nice travel bag and several ear bud cushions to choose from.  From the variety of the buds, I expected truly fantastic sound range.  It is important to get the ear buds to fit tightly to get the best sound.  When the buds are hanging around your neck, they have magnets that clasp them together so they form a loop that won't fall from your neck.The Bluetooth picked up just as fast as any Bluetooth I've used.  The unit charged in about two hours and it also comes with a USB - Micro USB wire for charging.  But there are too many problems for a product of this price.The sound is fair at best.  The treble is good, the mid-range is adequate and the bass is about what you would get from an Apple ear bud.  I really expected more sound quality, given the size of the earpiece.  There are other Bluetooth earphones out there that sound great, like the `Brightech Active 2 Bluetooth Stereo Headset' at one-fourth the price.  So between the lack great sounds for the price, I was very disappointed, as the box presentation looked great.
summary: Bluetooth Sound Could Be Better

reviewText: Most of the time when I wear earphones, I have to think about whether I like them and what I like about them.  Honestly, some I know at the outset.  They are horrible or they incredibly good.  When I get a gut reaction . . . ahhhhh . . . then love is in the air.Ahhh.  Oh, what a feeling.  These earphones are wonderful.  The music envelopes me.  It is so crystal clear, great sound separation and depth.  I feel like I'm swimming in a world of song.Love the earbud wings.  They keep the earphones in my ear from falling out and they position them perfectly.  I don't have to keep adjusting anything.  I've never that that sort of success with the over-ear variety or stabilizers.Bluetooth range is pretty good.  I can go down the hallway around a bend and still have a connection.  I get almost as far as I do with most of my devices.I can get voice commands on my phone and also last number redial through the cord controls.Phone calls are good.  I get a mild echo of my voice when I'm talking.  On the other end, the caller experiences a similar mild echo, but the conversation is unaffected as the voices are clear for all.  I can talk to my daughter without having to repeat myself or asking what she just said.The only problem I've had is the occasional crackle (like it's breaking up) when I'm streaming music.  It's very occasional and could easily be my cell phone signal breaking up.  I wouldn't hold it against the earphones.  They are the best I've had in a long time.  Very nice.
summary: Best I've Had In a Long Time

reviewText: I really like this charger.  It's small, powerful, and light.  I think this is probably one of the best ones I've had in a long time too.  The led percent screen is great to have to see exactly how much you have left to charge.  I'm able to get about nearly 2 full charges for my Samsung Note 2. I was able to charge my phone from approximately 33% to a near 90% in about an hour. The cord it came with is nice too.  The adapter for the iphone/ipad was a smart touch.This is small enough to go in my backpack without putting too much weight on my back or it can go in my wife's purse too.  Great overall.  I received this item for a honest review.
summary: Awesome charger!  It worked as promised with style

reviewText: Many of the small external battery packs I've tested in this size range don't usually have anywhere near the capacity this Maxboost Electron Mini does.  These small packs are what many have dubbed "lipstick" packs, primarily due to their size.  They can easily be thrown in a purse, briefcase, or desk drawer for whenever a charge is needed.The size of the Electron is slightly larger, but the capacity is really decent.  For example, an iPhone 5 has a battery capacity of 1440mAh while the iPad Air has one of 8820mAh.  You could fully charge your iPhone a couple of times and give the iPad a really decent boost.  Keep in mind what you want to be using the Electron for and take not of the battery capacity of the device or devices you may wish to charge.I've been playing with this one for a while and am quite satisfied with the performance.  I often like to boost my iPads because I work with them continually and even as small as the Electron is I was able to keep my iPad Air going without depleting it during the day.  I've got a scarcity of receptacles in this old house and the Electron Mini came in handy several times.One interesting feature is that the Electron can identify which type of device you are using, thus eliminating the need for dual ports (2.1A and 1A).  It makes it into a plug-and-play (in this case charge) battery pack.  Simplicity does help a lot of people.  No second guessing which port to use, thereby enabling a faster more efficient charge.The flashlight, or rather the small directed beam of light, won't light up a room, but will enable you to find a lock or help you make your way across that room.  It's not intended to be a torch, but I do find the addition quite handy.  With the quick tap of the power button on the side of the Electron, a digital display comes on.I'm fine with LED display bars, but many of my friends like to see exactly how much charge they have left to work with.  This is a real plus for many people.  The Maxboost Electron Mini has performed quite well over the month or so I've had it and I'm quite pleased with it.  I've used Maxboost in the past and would not hesitate to recommend this high quality brand to anyone.WHAT'S IN THE BOX:~► Electron Mini USB Battery~► Micro USB Charge~► User ManualFEATURES:►  The world first power pack with digital display window that is capable to exhibit power level within 1% and monitor the input and output charging state.►  This ultra-portable battery pack ships with a surprisingly large 5600mAh battery, which can charge almost any portable electronic devices up to 3x. i.e. iPhone 5/4,4S/3GS, Samsung Galaxy Series, iPad, iPad Mini, and almost all tablets, camera, and MP3s.►  Featuring [SMART PORT] USB output, the Electron Mini can properly identify attached device and provide the maximum charging current to any Apple and Android devices up to 2.1A.►  The Electron Micro features an ultra portable and stylish design and equipped with a super bright emergency flashlight that helps you through any power outage scenario.SPECS:~► Battery type: Li-Polymer~► Capacity: 5600mAh~► Input: DC 5V 1A (Max)~►  DC 5V 1A~► Dimensions: 4" x 1.7" x 0.8"~► Weight: Approximately 4.3 ounces~► Input interface: Micro USB~► Charging time: Approximately 4 - 5 hours~► Charging cable: Micro USBCERTIFICATIONS:CE, FCC, RoHSWARRANTY:► 1 year limitedSample provided for review.
summary: Easy charge and with a 5600mAh battery, the Maxboost Atomic will more than double your talk time ...

reviewText: For the amount of power from a potable battery pack it will be difficult to match this new MAXBOOST devices. It is so much smaller than the earlier generations of batteries. It is compact, well designed, fits easily into pocket, purse or jacket, and has a very handsome display that shows the percent of charge, but also if it is being charged or charging another device - a big plus!.But the shocker is the capacity. This very small battery pack with a capacity of 5600mAh. If you use an iPhone this in enough to triple your use time.  And as the PR says, this is the world's first power pack with digital display window that is capable to exhibit power level within 1% and monitor the input and output charging state. The battery pack can charge almost any portable electronic devices up to 3x. i.e. iPhone 5/4,4S/3GS, Samsung Galaxy Series, iPad, iPad Mini, and almost all tablets, camera, and MP3s. It features a smart port USB output and can properly identify attached device and provide the maximum charging current to any Apple and Android devices up to 2.1A.All this in a tiny bundle. More power here than imaginable from a little device. Grady Harp, May 14
summary: Tiny but Mighty!

reviewText: With this Maxboost Electron Mini, there are two things that impress me and help it to stand out from the rest: Its USB output port is "Smart", which means that it can identify the device that is plugged into it and provide the exact maximum charging current that the device requires (up to 2.1A). The second feature that is outstanding is its digital readout display: I have never seen a digital display so bright, so readable, and so descriptive and easy to understand exactly what the charger is doing at any given moment.The bright blue digital readout will flash either "IN" or "OUT" and shows the exact percent of the charge left in the battery pack.This 5600mAh power bank will charge your phone about 2.5 times, which will give you 25 hours of talk time, 22 hours of web browsing or video play, or 80 hours of music play. It is powerful enough to give a half-charge to your tablet, which translates into about 5 hours of web browsing, 6 hours of video play, 14 hours of music play.Power banks are heavy--batteries will be batteries. This little guy weighs in at 4.3 ounces. Because it is heavy for its size, I like that it has nice, smooth, rounded corners: The rounded corners are easier on pockets and purse linings. (Also easier on your toes if you happen to drop it there....never mind, that's another story...)This battery comes with a simple (white) micro USB cable, no pouch.*I received a sample product from Maxboost.
summary: "Smart" charger recognizes device and provides exact current; I like that!

reviewText: I received this from the manufacturer as a review sample. Size wise, this is very convenient. It's tiny at just 4 inches long and just about the size of a candy bar but wider. 5600mAh means you will get about 3x the charge for most phones because of conversion loss. This is assuming that each phone will take about 1300mA to fully charge and this charger is 75% efficient.It only has 1 USB port so this is more of a personal charger than one you can share or charge two devices at once. It has a LCD display which shows the percentage of charge left. Another thing which is pretty standard is the LED flashlight. It also will determine the max current your device will take.It comes with a single micro USB cord that will allow you to charge this battery or charge your phone.Overall a compact and handy personal charger.
summary: Excellent!

reviewText: Another solid product in the Maxboost line of chargers. Like the bigger versions I've reviewed, this mini 5600mAh offers two ports for charging and a digital readout. That distinguishes this Maxboost line from its competitors. It allows users a visual confirmation of the charge and so replaces the need to keep tapping on the device charged to see how the battery icon is showing the progression.Controls are also easy to use and find. This fits in the hand well and also a pocket. backup or purse. Rugged enough to endure some travel. Small enough to be portable, which after all is the reason to take along such an external battery. Recommended.
summary: Recommended for its digital readout

reviewText: I've tested a lot of powerbanks over the years. The thing that makes them stand out is finish (does it look well made) ease of use and extra features. This one has it all. It is nicely finished with smooth edges and a solid feel. It is very easy to use with one USB and one micro USB port. It comes with its own cable as well. There are two nice features on it. One is the onboard LED flashlight. The other is the clear, blue display that shows the amount of power left in the powerbank. This is not a bar reading of one to four bars but an actual percentage reading. This will charge my phone about 4-5 times before needing to be recharged itself. Tablets and larger devices will use it up much faster though.So this meets and exceeds my expectations for a unit this size and this price range.I was provided a sample for testing and review.
summary: Great Display on this Medium Sized Powerbank

reviewText: I have other chargers that hold a lot more power, but they're much heavier than this little thing. This took me about 1.5 hours to charge from zero. Out of one charge I can fully recharge my Galaxy Note 3 or get about 80% on my iPad from nearly zero.I used this while using the iPad to play music and surf and it obviously charged much more slowly when I did that, but it still continued to have an upward charge. It got me from 20% to about 45% while doing that over the course of a couple of hours before I drained the charge from this unit.Great for lightweight travel or to have in your purse during a normal day. I have the larger Maxboost which is better for long trips or traveling where I need more charges and have fewer opportunities to get to an outlet.Sample provided with no obligation to review.
summary: Great Size

reviewText: I've owned a number of battery packs, both from this company and others, so I was expecting yet another battery when my review sample arrived. I was surprised by the size, which is smaller than the earlier generations of batteries. This one also had a nice display that not only showed the percent of charge, but also if it was being charged or charging another device. To me that is a big plus over batteries that have no display or use four small LEDs to indicate the approximate percent of charge remaining. This one is exact to one percent.What impressed me is the capacity. Last year a battery rated at 5600mAh was like a brick compared to this one. Before I go on, let me explain rated capacity. There are a number of factors that make it misleading in much the same manner that US EPA ratings for MPG are pie-in-the-sky. Factors such as heat, wear on the battery from repeated charging and even loss from poor quality cables and connectors reduce the rating. Out of the box I multiply the rated capacity by .9, and in the case of this one you can realistically expect about 5040mAh. As time goes on the wear on this battery will reduce the figure to about 3920, but that is probably twelve to eighteen months of hard use.Assuming that this is realistically rated at 5040mAh here is what you can expect from a few common devices:  For an iPhone 5S with an internal battery rated at 1560mAh you can expect to more than triple your use time. For my Samsung Tab 3 10.1, which comes with a stock 6800mAh battery I can still get well over an additional seventy percent more use time. You can do the math on your own device and see how well this will or will not fit your needs.Another feature that impressed me is the charging port will detect the rate your device can be charged and adjust the output accordingly. The range is between 1.0 and 2.1 Amps.A convenience is the built-in flashlight. It's actually handy because of the compact size of this battery. But that it icing on the cake. The unit itself does a great job quickly charging my devices, and with the integrated circuitry to detect charging rates and guard against over charging I feel safe with it charging my Note 3 and tablet, both of which were on the expensive side.
summary: Clever design with some useful features

reviewText: 5600 mAh is enough to give my HTC One M8 a full charge with 29% power left when it's done. Yes, there's a digital meter to tell me exactly how much oomph is in it. I prefer it to power indicator lights that leave me guesstimating. The 2.1 amp port is great for a fast charge. That's so much better than 1 amp.Yes, 5600 mAh is the perfect size for charging larger smartphones like mine. It's not too heavy nor bulky and it does the job. The only thing I don't like is the glossy, fingerprint magnet exterior. I prefer matte finishes myself. Glossy finishes mar too easily.This product was provided for review by Maxboost.
summary: Plenty of Power for HTC One

reviewText: The size is perfect to slip in your purse as an emergency power for your cellphone. Its 5,600 mAh capacity is enough to charge an iPhone5 fully as much as two and a half times. The backlit LCD is one of the most precise I have seen. It tells you the percentage in capacity so there is no guessing.Two quick presses of the button will turn on the LED flashlight; same procedure to turn of the light. Not super bright but useful enough to light your path or find something you dropped inside the car. A microUSB cable is included.A sample of this product was sent to me for review purposes.
summary: Powerful Boost

reviewText: Five USEFUL Stars. Maxboost's small, sleek, black, plastic 5600 mAh Electron Mini charger (the little brother to the two bigger Maxboost chargers: the Maxboost Pulse 10000 mAh and the Maxboost Electron Plus 15000 mAh) weighs in at 4.6 ounces, fits nicely in the palm of the hand, and can be slipped easily into a briefcase or a pants pocket. It has a single USB charging port, boasts and delivers the ability to charge 2 and a half iPhones, one after the other, before needing to be re-charged. It has the expected on-board blue LED digital display window which shows the exact percentage of power available, when the USB charger port is active, and the power on the port. It also has the expected on-board LED flashlight which casts a 3-foot beam of light across a dark room.This little dynamic charger arrived already charged to 45% capacity so it can immediately give a charge to any USB device within its capabilities. Some other dual chargers have to share power between ports, but this charger concentrates on only one port at 2.1 amps and it is fast, starting out at about 1% per minute and then increasing that rate before slowing down at the 95% of charge level. After charging the Maxboost 5600 charger itself up to 100%, I charged up an iPhone in a quick 1 hour and 52 minutes with 63% capacity remaining in this Maxboost Mini 5600 mAh charger, then charged the 2nd iPhone with 43% charge still remaining in the Maxboost, and then charged a third iPhone to 54% of the phones capacity as the Maxboost was finally depleted: 2 and a half iPhones, exactly as advertised. That initial charge of 1:52 is among the fastest times of the many chargers I have tested. Very Highly Recommended. Five QUICK Stars! (Maxboost 5600 mAh Electron Mini Charger, micro-USB charging cable, User Manual. 1 year warranty. This item was provided by the manufacturer for testing and an impartial review.)
summary: VERY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED 5600 mAh PORTABLE EXTERNAL CHARGER

reviewText: When you are looking at a power bank, you look at multiple factors. Key parameters are as follows:- Functionality (what is mAH and how long it takes to charge)- Durability (how durable)- Portability (size, look and feel)In these respects the maxboost performs very well in all aspects. Packaging is very good and a non-frustration type package.  This has one USB port and one microUSB port. You connect the USB cable to microUSB and charge the device. You should connect the cable to regular USB and other end to phones/phablets/tablets etc. Very portable device ! I was provided a sample in exchange of a fair and honest review.
summary: Charges well

reviewText: If you are looking for an external battery pack to charge your phone or other USB chargeable device, and you know you want a 5200 mAh battery in it, the Maxboost Electron Mini is a very nice device.With 5200 mAh, because of the efficiencies of energy exchange, you are looking at actually pulling off more of a 2.5 charge of an iPhone 5S. Doing the math, I should actually get 3 charges... BUT... there is that pesky thing I just mentioned of the efficiency of energy exchange - you always lose some power there, this 2-2.5 charges. And in practice, as I own an iPhone 5S, I can attest that the claim is true.I also own a Lumia 1020 with a 2000 mAh battery. The Electron Mini can charge that twice, and maybe 1/6 of another before needing a charge.Why do I prefer the Maxboost batteries to all of the other competitors I've used? Simple. The display. Instead of having a series of lights to tell you how much charge is left, they have a LCD display that gives you the percentage of charge left in the battery. No more guessing! When it reads less than 40%, I know I should charge it if I plan on taking it anywhere and expect to get one more full charge from it.The display also tells you what the output is, either 2.1 A or 1 A, depending on the device connected, and it tells you if the power is being output (charging a phone) or input (battery is being charged)Also included is a flashlight. It's nothing amazing, but pretty much on par with your phone's "flashlight" capabilities.Overall, the Maxboost offers the better functionality of an LCD display and gives you more information because of the display than other devices. This alone sets them ahead of the pack. If you need a higher capacity battery and want the display, Maxboost also makes higher capacity devices as well.Highly recommended.Pros:Fairly light weightLCD displaycharges a phone 2-2.5x, extending your phone's capabilities if you are on the roadflashlightCons:weight isn't evenly distributed (seems to be a bit bottom heavy)I received a free review sample from the manufacturer.
summary: Works well, does what you expect and the display is great

reviewText: The Maxboost Electron Mini 5600mAh external battery pack fits well in the category of mid-range charger for your mobile device. It has all the features that I like, and the performance is solid.The 5600mAh size gave me two full charges on my iPhone 5S, which is what I would want from a battery pack with this capacity. It's light, so carrying it around isn't a problem. I could see this being something that just normally ends up in your backpack/purse/jacket pocket for daily use if you're a heavy mobile user. I love the digital display in the Maxboost devices, as they give you all the information you need to determine how much juice you have left. It even has the built-in LED flashlight in case you need a little extra illumination on something. :)This is a good combination of price and power for the peace of mind of knowing you won't run out of power on your mobile device at a critical moment.Disclosure:Obtained From: RetailerPayment: Free
summary: Nice combination of price and power...

reviewText: This integrated three (3) port USB car charger is in a class of its own.  Besides it's sleek sophisticated look in silver and white, it easily allows you to recharge your favorite mobile gadgets in your car by offering 3 ports with different amperage to suit your needs.25W or 5.1A shared by three ports as follows:One port is 2.1A which is perfect for iPad or iPad Air.One port is 2.0A which is suited for Android, Kindle and Samsung TabletsOne port at 1.0A which is perfect for any smartphone, digital camera, MP3 player etc.Comes with a blue LED light to show power is on and best part it is not too bright so no need to put a piece of black electrical tape over it!  Intelligent circuit design that is built to protect against over-heating, over-currents, and over-charging. Best of all charging stops when battery is full.Comes with a one-year manufacturer warranty.Link for gold option:UNU AX Tri-USB Port Car Charger - [Black / Gold] 5.1 A / 25 W Portable Travel Charger Rapid Car ChargerSample provided for review.
summary: In a class of its own

reviewText: No matter what device you have, this car charger that plugs into a cigarette lighter has got you covered. There are three separate USB ports on one end:*) A 2.1A/12W USB for charging an iPad*) A 2.0A/10W USB for charging an Android*) A 1.0A/5W USB for charging an iPhoneThe other end of the device plugs into the cigarette lighter outlet of an auto and it is solidly constructed. An LED light on the charging side will inform you regarding the status and the device comes in black or white. Convenience and efficiency are the two best words to describe this charger. It allows you to charge any device in the convenience of your car, which will be of great value when you were either forgetful or in a hurry and didn't plug the device in the night before. It will also be valuable to people that spend a lot of time on the road or do a lot of work out of their vehicle.
summary: An excellent value if you need such a device

reviewText: This car charger has a nice finish and weight - it's sturdy and looks good.  I have to use a car charger because I use an external GPS, but I also want at least one other port.  With 3 ports, my needs are certainly met.  Sample provided.
summary: High-end USB car charger

reviewText: Companies are definitely stepping up to the plate as they listen to what buyers need and want, including uNu, a company that is now leading the pack with their innovative design. There are households with two cars who may only need a simple car charger, but most households need and want dual port car chargers.  However, uNu is offering a three port charger to accommodate different needs.  You can charge a iPad, an Android, and a smartphone all at once.Not everyone in the same family has the same kind of device and if you carpool the uNu will be very much appreciated.  The charger is a spring-loaded, attractive one that fits snugly in my 12V DC lighter socket. It's only 2.5" long with a compact size that doesn't interfere with anything in my vehicle, but you may wish to check your possibilities. The uNu is one of the more compact ones I've ever tried to date. One thing I especially like are the very clear markings on the interface, 2.1A at the top going down to 1.0A at the bottom.Simultaneous charging is a real plus with the uNu. You simply use your own USB device cables.  The uNu  is very solid and stable even though it is quite lightweight. A blue LED light on the interface indicate that a charge is in progress. The strategically designed circuit will prevent over-heating, over-charging and excessive current.The input and output specifications are on a labeled on the charger. The uNu high-performance, three port charger that is perfect for charging more than one device.  It's a bit pricey, but with the ability to charge three different types of devices, it's worth it.FEATURES:► Charges up to three devices at once while you are on the road► Small and subtle soft, blue-colored LED power indicator is easy to see, but will not cause a distraction while on the road► Compact, lightweight and simple design - perfectly portable and unobtrusive► Durable, high-quality materials provide long-lasting function and reliability►  Intelligent circuit design protects against over-heating, over-currents, over charging and short circuit. Charging stops when battery is full.SPECS:►  DC input voltage: 12 VDC to 18 VDC►  iPad USB Port:  5V / 2.1A►  Android USB Port:  5V / 2.0A►  Smartphone USB Port:  5V / 1.0A►  Total Output:  5V / 5.1A►  Material: PC, aluminum framing►  Color: Black with a gold aluminum frame►  Power indicator: Blue LEDDIMENSIONS:► 2-1/2" x 1-3/8" x 1" (this charger has an unusual shape so these measurements hit the widest, longest areas)WEIGHT:► 0.9 ounce (25.51g)CERTIFICATIONS:CE, FCC, RoHs~ 1 year limited warrantyCOMPATIBILITY:Apple: iPhone 5S, 5, 4S, 4; iPads (Up to 4th generation);iPods touch (Up to 5th generation); iPod nano (Up to 7th generation)@ 1 to 2.1 A Max.Android Phones: Samsung Galaxy S5, S4, S3, S2, Galaxy Note 3, 2 / HTC One Plus, 2, M7, M4, X, V, S / Nexus 5, 7, 10 / LG G Flex, G2, G2 Mini, G Pro 2/ Motorola X, Droid Razr, Maxx@ 2.0 A.Sample provided for review.
summary: You get what you pay for and this uNu three port car charger is worth it ...

reviewText: Depend on UNU to provide quality and style in a small package. This Universal USB car charger his three USB ports that allows for three devices to be charged simultaneously - the ports have input of 12-24 volts and an output of 5volts divided into 2.1A, 2.0A and 1.0A that allow charging of Apple iPhone 5S 5 5C 4S 4, Samsung Galaxy S5, HTC One, HTC One Plus, HTC One 2, iPad Air 5 4 Retina 3 2 1, iPad Mini Retina 1 2, Google Nexus 5 4 7 FHD 2, Samsung Galaxy S4 3, Note 3 2, and other Android Smartphone/Tablets.Inside this little charger the circuit design protects against over-heating, over-currents, over charging and short circuit. An LED lets you know if the charger is inserted properly. Charging stops when battery is full. Safe, smart looking, well designed - just what we've come to expect from UNU. Grady Harp, April 14
summary: 3 In 1 for more service

reviewText: I always wondered why they didn’t make a charger with circuitry that could make the most of the power coming from a vehicle's battery? Why couldn't I charge three devices at once? It was not beyond the realm of possibility.Well, color me happy! Here, finally is a charger that pumps out enough power to handle three devices at once--and two of them can be tablets. And color my vehicle happy too! The golden color on the aluminum face of this charger is the closest match for the beige in my truck as I could ever hope to find, and the shiny aluminum trim is just like the chrome trim in my truck.The charger works as promised on this product page, it charges quickly, too. The charger is quality made; it seats firmly in the charging vehicle's port, and the USB cable plug seats firmly in the charging port. There is a single (blue) LED that lets you know you've got in plugged in correctly and orients you in the dark to plug it in right-side up. There is a line of four LED inside the top port to help guide your placement.I really like uNu: Its product pages tell you exactly what you are getting--with no misleading phrases and in correct English, too. The info is always straight-forward, the company provides a one-year guarantee, and there is an accessible website. If you need their help, you can find them. With a lot of these products made in China, you don't always find the Seller to be so visible and with such accurate product descriptions. If you run into trouble with a product, it can be very frustrating when you can't figure out a way to contact the Seller.*I received a sample product from uNu.
summary: About time someone designed a three-port car charger!

reviewerName: Joel Avrunin "Electrical Engineer who loves S...
reviewText: I have gone through quite a few car chargers for my USB powered devices, often with mixed results.  It is important that a car charger sit firmly in the cigarette lighter, has an LED so you know it is powered, and that it doesn't take up too much space.  On top of all of that, just because a charger has 2-3 ports, it does not mean you can actually use all of those ports.  If a charger can only supply 2.1 total A, then if you plug in an iPad and an iPhone, both will charge slowly.This UNU charger meets and exceeds just about all of my expectations for a car charger.  It sits firmly in the cigarette lighter, and has plenty of power for both my iPad, my iPhone, and another device that I might need to charger as well (in this case, my bluetooth earpiece).  The outside is not just metallic, but is a solid chunk of aluminum alloy that looks and feels high quality and professional.  It is unobtrusive while also looking elegant.On top of this, the color is quite unique for these chargers.  The black plastic housing blends with many car interiors, and the gold toned aluminum reminds me of the champagne iPhone 5S cases.  There is another one from the same company which is white, but I like this one much better.Note: I received a free sample for review but all opinions here are my own.
summary: Perfect car charger for your portable devices from iPhone to iPad

reviewText: This is a small and compact car charger with lots of features:Things I like about it:- Has 3 ports. They are 2.1A, 2.0A and 1.0A ports. It's very useful in that they've fitted 3 ports into such a small space but also that two of the ports are 2.0A and above and useful for charging your larger devices. I received this as a sample and I've used it to charge my iPad and Kindle. It's a very fast charger.- Compact.- Has safety features that prevent over heating, over charging, short circuits and stops when the device is fully charged.Overall, just a very nifty and functional car charger. Highly recommended.
summary: Excellent!

reviewText: This car charger has a state-of-the-art design with several unique features.It has an aluminum alloy face that is very sleek and attractive and very unobtrusive on a dashboard.  There are two color choices for different interiors:  white with silvery accents and black with champagne accents.There are three USB ports that can be used simultaneously with a total possible output of 5.1 amps, depending on the socket’s capabilities:  one at 2.1 amps, one at 2.0 amps, and one at 1.0 amps.  Use the one that best suits a particular electronic device’s needs.It fits easily into the socket and stays in place.  There is a discreet blue LED to show that it is powered.  It contains smart circuitry to prevent problems like overheating and shorts and stops charging when a device’s battery is full.The combination of appearance and function really can’t be beat.A sample was provided for testing and evaluation.
summary: Combines appearance and advanced function

reviewText: I received one of these as a review sample. Honestly I have reviewed so many chargers that I have become somewhat jaded, but this one stands out for a few reasons.First, two of the three ports are among the fastest charging ones I have ever tested, and that is saying a lot because I put this to the test. I charged an iPad (second generation), Samsung Tab 3 10.1 and a Galaxy Note 3 simultaneously. The iPad and Tab 3 were plugged into the 2.1 and 2.0 Amp ports respectively, and the Note 3 into the 1.0 Amp port. Although the Notre 3 chugged along fairly slowly, the two tablets charged quickly. Of course the Note 3 was plugged into the slowest port on this charger, so the fact that it was slow is not a detriment. In fact, that was the expected result.Second, this charger has an array of protective features that lesser ones lack. It detects and protects against over heating and over voltage, and will also prevent overcharging. In addition there is short circuit protection. Considering the total cost to replace the devices I tested, this feature alone is worth the premium price of this charger.Although this is capable of safely providing a full 5.1 Amps simultaneously, be aware that if you have an older vehicle that cannot provide that level of current this charger cannot perform miracles. It worked flawlessly in my 2014 Mitsubishi Outlander.If you need high speed charging of expensive devices this charger is an investment in ensuring their safe charging. I would recommend it to friends and family without hesitation.
summary: Top quality and worth every penny

reviewText: The uNu USB car charger has three USB ports: 1 amp, 2 amps, and 2.1 amps.  Yes, I've used them to charge three devices at the same time (a dash cam, a power bank, and an iPhone) and it works like a champ.  The best thing about it is there's always a USB port available when I need it, and there is a plenty of power.This charger makes no effort to blend in with its surroundings or sit flush with the panel.  In fact, it juts out like a sore thumb, but it won't be easily lost.  I don't even have to look to find it.The only drawback are the ports are close together.  If the USB plugs are standard size, all three will fit; but I have one USB plug that's a bit on the thick side.  Sticking it in the middle port means the port on one side is obstructed.  Still, most of my USB car chargers have only two ports at best, so I'm happy to have three.  It's so handy to have in my car.This product was provided for review by uNu Electronics.
summary: 3 Ports!

reviewText: This 3-port USB cigarette adapter is one of the the most powerful I have used in my car.  It can handle a total of 5.1A. What is amazing is that it is also very low profile. Each slot is labeled appropriately with a teeny weeny LED light to indicate it is properly plugged. The top slot is 2.1A for iPads, the middle slot is 2.0A designed for Androids and the bottom 1.0A for iPhone.A sample of this product was sent to me for review purposes.
summary: Small and powerful

reviewText: I have other port car chargers but this is the best.  WHY?  Simple.  The quality is top notch and instead of having one or two plug ins  or propriety plugs this one works with anything that can charge via usb.You have three ports each with different outputs.  The top is the most powerful and works great with iPad retina.  The others work with power bricks, iPods etc.....It is clearly marked so you can find the right plug in.  Plug into the wrong plug....and your ok.....just check your device...is it charging? then your ok.....not charging? move up a plug.It shuts off when devices are charged so you can leave your devices plugged in and leave them in the center console.  I now have my portable iPod, and GPS plugged in all the time....safely......nice touch.I received one of these for free from the seller.
summary: WOW this is useful.

reviewText: Five FUNCTIONAL Stars! This white/silver color uNu AX Tri-USB Car Charger works great and is the best of the four car chargers I own: one of which is difficult to remove from the outlet as well as too small, one of which is an excellent similar dual-USB port car charger, and the third is too large and cumbersome. This uNu charger for automobiles provides the convenience of charging three items simultaneously, for items such as smartphones, coffee cup warmers, GPS units, radar units, and smart tablets (via 2.1A, 2.0A port and 1.0 A ports) while driving around, eliminating the need for "pre-charging" the gadgets, swapping gadgets around, or carrying a bulky charger in the car. Plus it is just the right size to allow access to other areas around the center console ashtray area. The big difference with this equipment is it has a bright blue LED that lights up when plugged into the cigarette/power charger outlet to "confirm connection". This is a bonus at night when driving: one quick glance and the user can locate and plug in the smart gadgets for charging, although it is preferable to do so after starting the car but before driving to locate the correct port. In addition, when stored, the white color makes it stand out in a glove compartment or center console, amid all of the other darker objects stored there. Chargers should be used after the car is started to prevent power surges from the car's battery and the ports are designed to stop charging when the devices have reached full charge, although I prefer removing the cable from the outlet once the gadget reaches 100% charge. Highly Recommended. Five MOBILE Stars! (uNu Tri-USB Port Car Charger, 0.9 ounce, gadget connector cables are not provided. This item was provided by the manufacturer for testing and an impartial review)
summary: UNU AUTOMOBILE TRI-USB PORT CAR CHARGER GOES A PORT AHEAD OF MANY OTHERS

reviewText: I used this on a trip for 2 hours charging an Android phone, a iPhone and a Android tablet. This is great when you have multiple devices and charge in the car while driving. Excellent for sales person and people on the road. Very high quality and excellent materials. The contacts are nice and it is great to see chargers with 3 USB ports.  I was provided this product in exchange of a fair and honest review.
summary: Excellent Charger

reviewText: The Uni AX series charger is a great device. It is higher priced than similar devices, however it offers 3 ports to charge and can easily charge 3 devices, including an iPad, at one time.There is a 2.1 A port for Apple products, 2.0 A port for Android devices and a 1 A port for everything else. Every port works, though depending on the device you may have a slower charge time if you use a lower than expected port, but they all work. I've plugged my Lumia 1020 and iPhone 5s into every port, and while the 2 and 2.1 A ports charge both faster, they charged in all three ports.The styling is nice, and if you decide on the Unu, you have to make a choice between white and silver or black and gold. I like the look of the black and gold, but the reality is the devices are exactly the same except for the color.I am not a huge fan of blue lights in my car - I find them distracting. For me, red would be the best choice, however, for most people red means "bad," so I am OK with the blue.Overall, the Uni Ax series is a great 3 port USB charger and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a low profile, pretty device that brings great performance.Highly recommended.I received a free sample for review purposes from the manufacturer.
summary: Great - works as expected

reviewText: The uNu AX Series 5.1 amp 3 USB port car charger is one of the highest quality and highest output car chargers on the market.Pros:-5.1 amps of output power (this means that when all the ports outputs combined they add up to a max output of 5.1 amps)-1 of the USB ports, labeled "2.1A", has a max output of 2.1 amps which is great for charging tablets like an iPad Air (this port is designed for Apple devices like an iPad but will still work with other tablets and smartphones)-1 of USB ports, , labeled "2.0A", has a max output of 2.0 amps which is great for charging tablets like a Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 (this port is designed for Android devices like Galaxy Tabs but will still work with iPads, smartphones and other tablets)-1 of the USB ports, labeled "1.0A", has a max output of 1.0 amps which is great for charging smartphones like an iPhone 5/5s (this port is designed for all smartphones like an iPhone 5/5s or Galaxy S4)-Comes in 2 cooling looking colors (it comes in white with silver metal where the USB ports are and it comes in black with gold metal where the USB ports are [both look amazing but I like the gold one better, in my opinion])-LED status lights indicates that the car charger's USB ports are ready for use and it is not bright to light up the car (in other words, it will not distract the driver)-Tight fit in the cigarette lighter socket which means it will not slide out easily during use-Tested on a car ride and it worked great for charging an iPad Air, an iPhone 5 and a Galaxy S4-Small for its very high output of 5.1 amps-Protects against over-heating, over-charging, over-current and short circuits-Overall, this is a high quality car charger that has a very high output that works very wellNo cons that I can find about this car charger.My wishes:-Add multiple LED's so the USB ports are visible in the dark (LED do not light up the car, just the USB ports)-Make it have a 7.2 amp output, so 3 tablets, like 3 iPad's, can charge all at once at full speedThis is an excellent car charger and it works great. I highly recommend this wall charger!Watch my video review.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation, for free to keep, and I promised that my review is fair and honest.
summary: Excellent car charger with a high output and it comes in 2 cool looking color combos!

reviewText: ...between an iPod Nano (7th generation) and whatever is on the USB end.This cable is slightly thicker than the Apple OEM. If you need an extra for the car or your travel bag, it will keep your iPod charged and your tunes flowing.Usually aftermarket cables offer significant savings over similar offerings from Apple. In this case, the savings are modest, but I feel the beefier cord makes it likely to last longer in demanding environments.Select with confidence.Note: this item provided for review purposes.
summary: Passes the basic test: moves data and power...

reviewText: Finally I can enjoy the benefits of using my iPhone 5S and iPad Air in comfort on my bed and couch without restricting my movement.  You know exactly what I am talking about.  Those 3 foot lightning cables just are not long enough to allow me to prop my feet up on the couch and move around let alone lay in bed and play around with my iPhone while it charges.  Now with the AYL 6 foot 8-pin lightning cable I am able to feel more relaxed and be able to use my IOS devices while charging.The cord is quite thick and heavy duty.  Comes with a one-year warranty.Sample provided for review.
summary: Freedom at last

reviewText: I've been using using this AYL lighting cable with my iPad mini for a few weeks now and it's works great. It's long, so I can have my iPad plugged in and charging and still use it. Something I can't do with the charging cable that came with my iPad. Also it's pretty thick as far as cables go that one usually uses with Apple products. The cable for my iPad and my iPhone are both pretty thin and short. So it's nice to have a cable that's longer and a bit thicker, since the thickness keeps it from getting tangled as easily.It charges my iPad just as well as the cable that came with it and my device has no issues with not recognizing it. It works perfectly and now with the extra length, I'm able to use my iPad even while it's plugged in.Sample provided for review
summary: Works with my iPad Mini

reviewText: Great cable for my iPod.  I know it's small, but I get tired of bringing my one cable from car to computer so I am very happy to have this cable.  It stays on my desk and works great.  It fits into the iPod even when it is in the case.  Works great and does everything I need a cable to do.
summary: Works great!

reviewText: I've had no issues with this cable, which is "certified by the developer to meet Apple performance standards" per the packaging.Compared to my genuine cable, the AYL cable is longer and actually seems better built with a thicker wire, so I've switched to using this cable over the Apple one, and I am keeping my Apple cable as a backup.I can potentially see an issue with the width of the Lightening connector end of the cable as it's wider than the Apple cable. If your device is in a case that doesn't allow this extra width then you may have a problem with this cable, but that's not the case (pun intended) for me.Other Lightning cables I have tried and that I recommend:* 7 inch cable:dCables MFi Certified Short USB Cable* 3 foot cable:[Apple MFi Certified] Anker Lightning to USB Cable 3ft / 0.9m* 6 foot cable:[Apple Certified] NOOT MFI 1.8M/6ft 8-Pin Lightning Cable (6 Feet)* 9.8 feet (3 meters):[Apple Certified] Elka 8-Pin Lightning to USB Cable Cord (10 Feet / 3 Meter)Should any issues or problems develop with this cable, then I will update this review.UPDATE 2014-03-26: I just tried it with my iPad mini after updating to iOS 7.1 and again it works fine (no errors/warnings from iOS).
summary: Works great - recommended!

reviewText: A really nice cable that actually works better at charging my iPhone 5 or iPod touch.  Why?  Because its longer than the one that comes with the devices that require the new cords.This is especially handy when you need to have your phone charging but talk on it at the same time, or when one is in the car--it has far greater reach.It charges just as fast as your Apple cord, so there is no lag time, it just gives you greater length.And the fact that, at the time of my review, it's far cheaper, is a great benefit as well.I can't seem to have enough of these cords for charging upstairs, downstairs, or in the car.  A nice benefit to be able to do so at a better price and with greater benefits.Cord provided by AylReview is my unbiased opinion.
summary: Longer charging cord for iPod touch and iPhone 5

reviewText: I hate paying Apple prices for cables, but in the past the third-party cables I've gotten have been pretty shady quality and usually stop working fairly quickly.  I was so happy when I pulled this one out of the package - it seems every bit as high quality as the original Apple cable.  I am very happy with this cable!
summary: Apple-quality for less!

reviewText: .You could like or dislike this cable. Thick cable & fat connector.Cable Diameter: .160" (Apple's cable is .103") -- This AYL cable is less prone to kinking, and maybe stands up better to abuse. But you might think it clunky.Lightning Connector Dimensions: .238" x .460" (Apple's is .183" x .304") -- That's a problem with some iPhone cases (most are OK).My cable works fine.The cable material is smooth, rubbery, satin finish.If you spend a lot of time with your iDevice in bed or on the couch, keep it plugged in. You'll save battery cycles...it will last a lot longer.- - - Pricing - - -This cable has sold for $10 to $20. You can stalk it by setting an email alert on CamelCamelCamel.Or check out...- - - Alternatives - - --iFlash 6ft Apple Certified MFi Lightning cable(often $12)- Non-certified (not MFi) (often $5 to $6) Are you feeling lucky?- - - Disclosure - - -The manufacturer gave me this item for review. I believe my review is impartial.~~~ Comments & questions welcome ~~~
summary: How Thick is It?

reviewText: My biggest problem with third-party lightning cables, even those like this one that are certified by Apple, is the thick housing around the pin itself that precludes use with cases that have individual cut-outs on the bottom.  (If your case has a single, long opening that exposes everything at the bottom, you should be fine.)  That one piece is the only thing that keeps this Ayl cable from being a five-star product.  The lightning pin is correctly manufactured so that it can be inserted in either orientation and still work.  The casing for the cable itself is thick enough to protect the internal wires, and the USB and lightning pin ends are firmly installed, with no evidence of corner cutting.  I especially like how flexible the cable feels, thanks to the coating, because I never fear that I will break it.  I've bought cheap ones that feel as though they might last six months at best.  This one feels even more sturdy than the cable that came with my iPhone.This is a quality product.  It's just a (slight) shame that I cannot use it when my phone is in its case.  Note:  I received a sample for review.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Great Build-Quality, But Not For Use With Certain Cases (4+ stars)

reviewText: This lightening cable is a perfect replacement for the Apple charging cord.There have been mixed reviews about this cord, but it works with and iOS 7, without any hiccups. In the hand it feels just the same as the OEM cord, and you will not be able to tell a difference. This cord might be just a bit thicker than the original.If you are looking for an extra cord, when you are in the car, then look no further. This will do the job and for the price it can't be beat.Contents:AYL 8-Pin Lightening Cable (6Ft)I was supplied a sample for the purpose of review.
summary: Perfect Apple Replacement

reviewText: I am weary of third-party iOS cables and docking stations – most of them are not Apple certified and either don’t work properly with your i-device or stop working once Apple makes an upgrade to iOS. From the experience I've learned to trust and value the official MFI-certified Apple accessories, like this AYL lightning cable. I am happy to report that so far I have not had any issues with it. The cable overall looks very elegant and well designed. It comes in a small box that is easy to open. I’ve tested it with iPad Mini running iOS 7 and the latest iPhone 5S, and it has worked both for charging as well as for data sync. The cable's length of six feet (1.8 m) is also very convenient for all sorts of situations. Highly recommended to all owners of iOS devices.
summary: Works Great With All of my iOS Devices

reviewText: I was provided a AYL Apple Certified MFI Lightning to USB Cable  for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ This is a 6 foot cable, twice as long as a standard Apple Lightning cable.♦ Passed the "Does it Work" Test with flying colors and MFI certified to work with all Apple Lightning Devices.♦ Was able to sync and charge my iPhone 5S, iPhone 5 and iPad Mini with no problems whatsoever.♦ It is a high quality cable with solid connections from wire to plug on both ends.♦ The Lightning plug end is larger than the standard Apple Lightning cable plug and could have problems fitting into some cases, but it fit my Incipio Dual PRO case perfectly.Conclusion:Overall, the AYL Apple Lightning Cable was great. It has a good look to it and a solid build. It did a great job charging and syncing several different Lightning devices. The extra length is also great.  I was able to plug it in behind my nightstand and had no problem using my phone in bed with it still plugged in.  The Lightning end of the cable is larger than the standard Apple Brand version which could give you some problems if you have a case with a small opening for your lightning port, but I had no problem at all with my Incipio Dual PRO case. If you are looking for longer Lightning cable, this cable is a great choice. Highly Recommended!
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy!

reviewText: AYL  solved an ongoing problem - offering a decent sized cable that transfers for charging Apple Lightning. It is very well made, the cable is sturdy, more than adequately long, the connectors are clean and easy to manipulate - and best of al it works for all the apple products with Lightning connector devices. Another convenient if not indispensible product from AYL. Plus, it has a 1 year warranty! Grady Harp, July 14
summary: We knew someone would resolve this dilemma

reviewText: All the reviews above and below me are right. This is the cable you need, the cable we DESERVE.Regardless of the Iphone (#?) I had, each and every cable was decimated by even the slightest of wear and required me to buy many throughout the phone's lifetime.The AYL Lightning cable is a GAMECHANGER! First off, it is Apple MF certified meaning the quality is UP There. Price is adorably affordable and the durability of the product is what makes this head and shoulders above the competition.Pros:+DURABLEThe main selling point of this cable -- it lasts! I've battle tested this cable from home, travel, work, and just all around and it definitely ranks #1 on my list when this category comes to mind+QUALITY/CERTIFICATIONIt is inspected, qualified, and cerftified to be sold as an Apple MFI product. What does that mean to you or I? It means it's a solid product for ipods and many apple products.+AFFORDABLEFor being Apple MFI certified, the price is brilliant at under $20. I bought one for home, bag, and work just because.CONS:- LENGTH OF CABLEFor being 6 feet, travel purposes are a bit more difficult. This is by no means a negative or a con as being 6 feet may be necessary for many situations. It just was not ideal for me as I had a lengthy cable running through my media center at work or in my bag. This can be a plus to many!This cable is now my GO-TO Iphone cable. Not even a shadow of a doubt. The minute you pick this up you will notice the quality and will be ecstatic that you will not have to buy another cable due to damage or wear.*DISCLAIMER* I was provided a sample of this product. I try to provide a non-biased view of the product I am reviewing and would only provide a stellar or rave review if I truly feel the product lives up to my and the communities standards.Brilliant product, I will look out for many products from AYL to purchase or review.5/5 ***** A MUST-HAVE
summary: ONE WORD - DURABLE: The must-have Lightning cable for home, travel, or work.

reviewText: This is a well built Lightning to USB cable. There are several pros about this cable.1. 6 feet long. For me, this makes it perfect for my office where there are not that many plugs. The plus is far from the place I rest my phone (bookcase) and I don't want to leave it on the floor (someone can step on it! Gasp!). So, this is the perfect solution. So, this has officially become the office cable.2. Well built and well built. This cable is sturdy and thicker. Much more so than the original which starts fraying within a couple of months (this has been my experience). I've gone through a lot of cables. So, I will update this as time passes.Things to note:1. The connector part is a little bigger than the regular Apple cable. So, if you have a small opening in your case, this might be an issue.It has been working great since I started using it. I will keep update this later as to longevity.* Sample provided for review.
summary: Works great

reviewText: The AYC"s  cable is thicker and longer than any other that I have had.  It is durable, and the connector stays securely in my IPhone five and my son's mini ipad.  Love that it is six foot  in length.  I can sit at my dining room table, and my son can play on his mini ipad while it is charging and not be pulling on my  lap top.  Great that when we are driving in the car my son can still play his mini ipod with this long cable.  I haven't had any problems with syncing my Ipone five with this product.  I would recommend this.Reviewed by Elisa for New Age Mama. Complimentary product received.
summary: USB Cable

reviewText: When the original cable for my husbands Ipod broke i figured id have to go out and get another one at my local store. However I got offered this one and I'm so glad. It works very well and seems quiet sturdy.One of the best parts is that is very affordable compared to the apple brand and from what I can tell actually works better. I had no problem charging from a wall unit, or syncing and charging from my computer. So if you need a new one or just need a back up I would recommend this model.**I received a sample of this product to test and review. All opinions are honest and my own.**
summary: I needed a new one

reviewText: This cable works perfectly with our daughter's iPhone 5c. It was delivered right on time as she recently lost her OEM cable and needed another one. It seems to be very high quality, and she likes this cable very much. Would recommend it to anyone looking for this type of cable.The Amazon sales page notes that this cable includes a one year warranty, so if an issue arises before that period expires I will return here to update the review and let you know what the issue was and how resolution was handled. We did receive this cable gratis from the seller and put it to immediate use to objectively find out how well it performed. My statements here reflect that testing.If you are looking for a high quality, Apple certified, 6 foot long lightning cable for your Apple equipment, based on our daughter's experience with this one we highly recommend this AYL product.Excellent trouble-free cable so far.Go for it.
summary: AYL 8-Pin Lightning to USB Cable - 6 Feet - White - Works perfectly with iPhone 5c

reviewText: If you want an Apple Certified Lightning cable to USB, for plugging you iPhone 5s into a charger, then the AYL works great and is a good price.I've been using the cable for about a week now and have had no problems at all. It charges my phone and works exactly as you expect a charge cable to work.Highly recommended.
summary: Works perfectly

reviewText: Lightning cables aren't cheap, but it's nice to start finding non-Apple cables at a slightly lower cost. There isn't much to say. It's a lightning cable and it works just fine. Some reviewers have complained about the quality of the cable, but in my experience, it has held up perfectly well. If you need a nice, long lightning cable, save yourself some money and give this a shot.
summary: Inexpensive and works well

reviewText: AYL 8-Pin Lightning to USB Cable is a 6 foot long heavy duty cable that can be used on a variety of Apple devices such as the iPod, iPad, and iPhone 5 series. The first aspect about this USB cable that is noticeable is that it is significantly thicker than the cable that came with my iPhone. My hope is that this will mean that this cable is more durable and will stand up to abuse. I am dedicating this USB cable to my everyday carry bag to be used in conjunction with external back up batteries for my phone. This cable will ensure that I do not run out of power with my electronic devices. Because I am dedicating this USB cable for emergency situations I need to have confidence that it is durable and will work when needed. I have no concerns with this cable.Overall Assessment:I am very happy with the AYL 8-Pin Lightning to USB Cable as it is a thicker cable and at 6 feet long it will provide plenty of length. I have confidence that this USB cable will provide me emergency power when needed. Highly recommended.
summary: Durable and Functional

reviewText: I like the keyboard!  It works well and I found that it is useful when typing long emails but it's pretty rare.
