I can't imagine keeping my bluetooth on just to use my keyboard instantly and it would be a hassle to turn on and off the bluetooth everytime I use it.  The keyboard itself works great.  I received one for the Samsung S4 and that one worked just as well but that one had problems with the magnet messing the screen up when it is attached to the back of the phone.  This one works much better.  I think the case is thicker and really helps.  I receive this item for a honest review
summary: Magnet is too strong for screen

reviewText: I am over 40.  Well over.  And my eyesight ain't what it used to be.  I used to be a mad texter -- I could fire off text messages, drive from Pittsburgh to DC and file my nails all at the same time.  Now I hold my iPhone a mile from my face just to see the buttons.  This helps a lot.  It gives me a more tactile experience with the keys (Braille?  Not yet.). It reminds me of the sliding cell phones of about five years ago.  You have a full keyboard and a case and it all slides together nicely.I was afraid the magnet would interfere with my reception or screen, but so far no problems.Sample provided for unbiased review.
summary: Makes your iPhone a Slide Phone

reviewText: Touch-screen keyboards are a revolutionary development in the evolution of mobile devices. They have managed to reduce the size of smartphones significantly, and they did away with a lot of complexity of physical design. The touch-screen keyboards also enable you to have a lot of flexibility when it comes to the various keyboard options - you can toggle between different languages and input styles with a simple press of a (touchscreen) button. However, they also have their limitations. The biggest one is the tactile feedback - being able to feel the keys as you type is a great aid in efficiency of typing, especially for all the touch-typists out there.The first generation of Galaxy S phones had a sliding physical keyboard, but all the subsequent S phones ditched it in favor of screen-only keyboards. This little OXA wireless keyboard enables all of the Galaxy S4 owners of getting a physical keyboard. The keyboard is well made, attaches easily to the S4, and it's fairly easy to use. It also doubles as a case for your phone. The bluetooth pairing was quick and straightforward. The keyboard has a nice enough key action, but I would have preferred a little bit more of tactile feedback - something along the lines of what Blackberry phones have. Nonetheless, it's a very good keyboard ot have for longer typing sessions.
summary: Decent Physical Keyboard for Samsung Galaxy S4 Devices

reviewText: Even though with this unit in place you would never notice that your iPhone 5/5s was any thicker than that nice slim design that prompted you to buy the iPhone 5 or 5s in the first place, this device adds a wireless Bluetooth keyboard for far better visualization of the letters in a position that make texting easier and faster. The keyboard can either slide or rotate from the phone (it is attached by magnet only) or the keyboard can actually be detached and placed beside the phone. (Ah, Bluetooth!). There is a rechargeable lithium battery with a long charge hold (the insert says 55 hours) and the degree of charge is recognizable by the LED indicator lights which also lets you know when the battery is engaged for working.Easy to charge (just follow the instructions in the enclosed pamphlet), easy to use,  and best yet, easy to see the keyboard!  This is a very fine addition to the iPhone armamentarium. Grady Harp, March 14
summary: An excellent addendum to the iPhone 5, 5s

reviewText: I'm a little torn about this keyboard and case. The case fits nicely (minimal protection) and the keyboard adds a small amount of bulk to the back and is magnetized to stay put. The keyboard looks nice and hooks up via Bluetooth easily. But for me, I found that using this keyboard was more of pain than just using the on screen keyboard. And it has a shiny metal surface so fingerprints show up quickly.However, if you are used to a slide out keyboard on your phone or a Blackberry, this could be a great product for you since it does just what it is supposed to.I was provided a sample to test and review.
summary: Works Well, Leaves Fingerprints

reviewText: Disclaimer: I received this for free in exchange for an honest review.Okay, so this does in fact work as intended. The magnet is a nice feature.The clip on case works well and the keyboard also works well. The blutooth works just fine. In fact, on the surface, this is a really nice item. However, the problem is in the keypad itself.Because the keys are necessarily small, and are actual buttons, I found this to be more difficult to navigate than the digital keypad on my phone. I think this actually makes the keypad average at best. I think it would have benefited from either digital keys or keys that didn't require full depression to work (meaning, you shouldn't have to actually click the keys....it should be smoother). Anyway, for me, it wasn't really useful and kind of got in the way. I went back to the touchpad after trying this out. still, it is functional, and this might be something you will appreciate more than I did.One further note....this does effectively double the weight of your phone as well. Something to consider before purchasing.
summary: Great idea, but functionally average

reviewText: This case + keyboard combo is a very innovative design for Samsung Galaxy S4. The case is sleek and not too big/small. Snaps cleanly and quickly. I was able to charge wirelessly using Qi charger also with the case. The Bluetooth keyboard was awesome. It attaches magnetically. With the magnetic keyboard, Qi charger does not work. But the keyboard is an awesome design. I was able to pair easily by pressing the Power button and entering the 6 digit password. It was easy to type in the mail and long emails using the tactile feel. This almost feels like a mini keyboard I had on older phones. This gives the best of both worlds. Excellent, sleek design. I was amazed they have a charging port on this thin keyboard. Metallic, and very stylish is the best way to describe it! Highly recommend if you are a heavy user of creating stuff on phone.I was provided this product in exchange of a fair and honest review.
summary: Innovative design

reviewText: This is neat little device. If you are someone who uses your phone as much as your computer, it certainly comes in handy. It fits like a case onto the back of the phone. Therefore, another case is not necessary and would not fit. The keyboard is connected magnetically and it slides out, but it is not totally connected and it can come off. It is super thin, you would not know that there is a keyboard connected to your phone. It connected to Bluetooth with no problem. It has an indicator light to let you know that it is connected, also to let you know when it is charging. Charging is super easy, you simply place it on the charger that comes with it. There was a bonus stylus and cleaning cloth in the package too. I received this product for a fair and honest review
summary: Clever and Handy!

reviewText: Disclosure: I was sent a product to review. As you will see, this did not affect my judgment.Everything about the OXA bluetooth keyboard is amazing. Except for the keyboard. It’s incredibly thin, it’s got a convenient charging mechanism, the battery life is first rate, it’s lightweight, and bluetooth pairing is simple. OXA thought of everything, except for the keyboard itself, which is unusable. The keyboard is metallic and features actual buttons that need to be not only touched, but pressed. They’re so small that unless you have strong fingernails, it’s tough to press them. However slow you are at typing on Apple’s on-screen keyboard, I guarantee you will type 80% slower on this. Imagine typing on a keyboard where it took great effort to press every key. Imagine if you needed to type an email and it took something like one second to press every key. That’s what this is like. Moreover, you actually have to *find* the key you want to press because the keyboard uses a non-standard layout. I guess OXA is too good for QWERTY. It’s just the worst typing experience imaginable.Normally, OXA makes nice, inexpensive electronics, and I’ve been very pleased with other products they offer. This is a fairly major exception. Again, they’ve done a great job with basically every part of this except for the keyboard itself. You’re better off skipping the typing all together and using Apple’s speech recognition functions, because even if that takes longer, it still doesn’t compare to the experience of this.
summary: Awesome! Except for typing.

reviewText: At first, I had mixed feelings about this product. However, after reviewing it, I have to say, it is really cool! First things first, I love the build quality; it is very solid and sturdy. Also, the plastic case fits well on the iphone and all of the ports are easily accessible. Otherwise, setting up the device is very simple and only takes a matter of seconds. As for the keyboard itself, the keys are flat against the plate, but they are very clicky and responsive. However, one thing I disliked was the placement of the space button, which was off to the side in comparison to the standard center layout. In the end, for 20 bucks, this device is a great deal for those looking for a keyboard case for their iphone. Definitely recommend it.
summary: Really Cool Device

reviewText: This is a really neat little product that makes a lot of sense, but it comes with a couple little eccentricities.Certainly, the need for a USB-to-USB connector is ever-present nowadays: whether we need to charge a device, or synch it, or transfer files, we're always looking for the cables - and having to carry one along with you wherever you take your devices is often a big hassle.So along comes the Zeetron, and their really clever solution to the problem is what you see before you. It's attachable to a key chain, and no trouble at all to carry around with you...not even as big as a half a pack of Tic Tacs, this little device contains a cable that with male connections for a regular USB to a micro USB, this small device is there for you as a regular connector or an emergency one.I have only one real bone to pick concerning these devices: they are a little difficult to take apart and reassemble. The secret is to first lift UP the end above the word "Zeetron," and once it is free to take apart the other end...either way, when you pull one end, the cable slides along with it, giving that end extra to work with. (To close, reverse the process.)The fact that the connector is quite small and the two devices will by necessity need to be quite close to one another (scarcely more than 3 inches) is not really a huge drawback. By its very nature this really should be considered more of an emergency cable, after all, and this "drawback" should be quite apparent by its size.Still and all, give Zeetron credit for coming up with a clever solution to a nagging problem.NOTE: I was provided a review sample of this product on the sole condition that I provide a fair review, which this is.
summary: A compact micro connector that fits on a keychain

reviewText: When compacted, this device is less than two inches long, slightly over an inch wide and one-quarter of an inch thick. There is a hole in one end where one can place a metal loop for keys, the loop is not included. Each of the two connectors snaps into a slot on an end, the cable that connects them is slightly over three inches long. One connector is a USB and the other is a lightning connector compatible with the iPhone 5 series, Ipad 4, Air, Mini and Ipod Touch.While the short length of the cable is limiting, the compact structure allowing for it to be used as a keychain, or simply be placed on a keychain makes it a valuable product. It is easy to keep with you, allowing you to charge your compatible devices any time a USB port is available. There is also no cable to unwind or keep track of, as long as you have your keys, it is possible to charge your device. It is very handy and convenient.This product was given free in exchange for a potential review.
summary: Small, easy to keep handy and priceless when needed

reviewText: UPDATE: I received an email from the manufacturer who stated they would be revising the description to address the potentially misleading info. They did revise it, and they deserve kudos for doing that.  While I still don't think this is a truly compelling, must-have item, I'll change my rating from 3 to 4 stars since the product does what it should, and could be handy for people who don't remember to bring along a charging cable. The build quality keeps it at a 4 star, rather than 5 star rating.ORIGINAL REVIEW:The product name and description is a bit misleading - this is just a USB cable (either a USB-to-micro USB or USB-to-Lightning version) that folds up into a plastic holder that you can hang on a keychain.I have the micro USB version.The build quality is OK. To unfold it, it's best to unlatch the micro USB end first, then the USB end. Do the opposite when refolding it into the case. Otherwise it can be a struggle to get the ends out of the holder.It works fine - no difference than using any other cable. It is very short - the total length of the cable is about 4 inches.The advantage is that since it is so compact and comes in a plastic holder, you can easily keep this with you with your keys (or hang it onto your backpack, etc.). But, since many powerbanks come with attached cords these days, I can't recall not having access to a cable when I needed it when not at home. At home I have dozens of cables so having one on my keychain is not much of an advantage.Given the price this is an average value. It would be a more compelling purchase if it did more than just serve as a cable, or if the build quality was more robust.[Sample provided for review]
summary: A compact cable to hang on a keychain

reviewText: I like to keep a spare battery in my purse in case my iPhone 5 dies during the day, but sometimes I forget to bring the cable to charge it.  This tiny keychain cable is a lifesaver, even if it's not perfect.  It's small enough to fit on my keychain or in a pocket inside my handbag or briefcase so that it's always there when I need it.  I like that I can pull the cable through the body to lengthen it on one end or the other, depending on where I need the most clearance.While the Zeetron emergency cable is useful, it does have some drawbacks.  The USB end doesn't have the typical enclosure to help guide it into a USB slot; the electronics are completely exposed once you remove it from the fob.  Also, the lightning cable connection is a bit tight on my iPhone.  The construction seems like it might not last long, although, of course, this is meant to be used in an emergency, not with daily use.Despite the cons, I find this little charger to be very useful.  It now goes everywhere with me.  Note:  I received a sample for review.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Handy Little Lightning Cable Charger

reviewText: I have a home filled with IPhones and iPads. We have USB cables everywhere, but can never find one when we need one!Problem solved and for just 6 bucks! This USB cable actually fits on (and will live forever) my key ring.We now know where a cable is all the time, and especially when we are out of the house.This is a brilliant idea that appears to be made well. My husband is buying another one! Highly recommend.
summary: Great idea and a great product...

reviewText: This review is going to be an easy one!Have you ever got to work only to realize that your phone is almost dead? I know, the HORROR (ha). I'm a teacher and this happens at my school so often that I've gotten used to my colleagues calling around asking if anyone has a charger with them. Of course no one does, but they still try. Well let me tell you that this is all about to change!The Zeetron is an amazing "why didn't I think of that" product that is small, simple, and effective. It's about the size of a car fob, fits on your key-chain, and allows you to charge your phone anywhere you see a USB port. Simple as that. It works great and doesn't bulk up my key-chain either.Also note: another reviewer mentioned that they dinged it a star for not including a metal keyring with it. I was thinking the same thing but then returned to the packaging and found it folded up in the paper, so don't accidentally throw it out.[Zeetron provided sample for review]
summary: Just what the doctor ordered!

reviewText: Just a 3 3/16" USB cable in a nifty little case. So, if you think you could use a handy, very short, cable for emergency use--and are afraid it might get tangled or damaged floating around in your bag or pocket, this is for you.This is NOT a key chain: It goes ON YOUR key chain. So, a bit inconvenient that you have to set up the key ring yourself, but no big problem, you can either slide a ring onto it, or add this little mini case to your current key chain. The fourth picture shows this USB cable/storage case with a ring, but that is deceiving. It DOES NOT come with a ring.This is NOT a battery charger either. The second picture makes this USB cable/storage case look like it is charging a phone, doesn't it? But it definitely does NOT contain a battery. I'm more than a bit confused as to why they included a picture like this. The wording on the back of the packaging claims that this is a "battery charger", but it is not. It is small enough that I wouldn't expect this case to contain a battery, but I've seen some very small chargers that hold enough power for an emergency phone call, so this wording may confuse some people. In fact I have a tiny charger the size of a business card and it fits in my wallet, so there are tiny chargers, but this is not that.I questioned a rep from Zeetron about this, and he said they would not be able to change the wording on the packaging until the next run. (The claim, that it is a charger, is mentioned twice on the back of the package.....) (At least they removed it from the product page.....)As it comes from the easy-to-open package, this is a handy little case that protects a short (3 3/16"), flat USB cable and its plugs. The cable moves freely back and forth through the case when the plug-ins are not tucked into the case,which makes it a little easier to maneuver. But the cable cannot be removed from the case . When the plugs are tucked into the case, the cable is taut against the outside of the case. With everything tucked in, the case is 2 7/8" x 1 3/16". On my unit, the plug-ins are nice and sturdy and seem quality-made.I knocked it down a star, because I think if Zeetron wants to call this a "key chain" they really should have included some kind of a key chain ring--even one of those simple ones where the metal coils around to form a double circle, or maybe a lanyard, or a screw-open ring. And they should get rid of the two misleading pictures on this product page. Oftentimes, people buying on Amazon are in a hurry and hit the gimme' button with just a cursory look at the product page. Personally, I think vendors should be exact and explicit on their product pages. I reserve my five-star ratings for vendors with a thoughtful and determined commitment to providing the best and for those who have a deep-seated and active conscience--from the get-go.*I received a sample product from Zeetron.
summary: A handy cable n' case for emergency use

reviewerName: Joel Avrunin "Electrical Engineer who loves S...
reviewText: I had a chance to test both the Lightning and Micro-USB versions of these cables.  Both are neat little stubs of cable which enable you to always have a USB charging cable with you in your pocket.  Full sized cables get tangled, but these little cables tuck into themselves and fit easily in a pocket, on a keychain, or in the bottom of my backpack.  Since the connectors themselves are shrouded in the plastic housing, they don't get damaged or dirty.First, I tested the Lightning version because the Lightning connector is the most often poorly copied by non-Apple OEM vendors.  Zeetron did an excellent job with the lightning connector.  Not only did it work immediately on my iPhone (and provide USB communication to my PC), but it is narrow enough to fit through my AmazonBasics iPhone 5S case!  Yes - even the AmazonBasics lightning cable is too fat to easily fit in my case, but this one does just like the OEM lightning connector.  I am quite impressed.  Second, I tested the micro-usb version to charge my Kindle and found that worked easily as well.The only issue I had is that it can be a little tricky to get the connectors tucked back into the housing, but honestly, it's not that hard and once they are in, they don't seem to work out on their own.  This is a nice solution to always have the right cable with you.  They are recommended.Note: I received these as free samples for the purposes of review.
summary: Nifty little cables that are super useful for the frequent traveler - both Lightning and Micro-USB

reviewText: This is a handy little fob for charing or connecting on the go. It is not designed for and should probably not be used as your only connection cable. I have the USB to micro USB cable and at first, I had trouble getting the ends out of the holder but the key is to open the micro USB plug first and then the tension lessons and you can get out the USB end.This does a good job for just what it is intended. It is a quick connect cable packaged in a little plastic fob. The USB plug is not a standard but only the inside portion so you have to be aware of making sure you put the connection end to the inside as you plug it in.I was provided a unit for testing and review.
summary: Just in Case...

reviewText: This is a mini charging cable, you will need to use your laptop,  an external battery charger, or etc. along with this cable to charge your device.On all three cables (micro to USB, 30 pin to USB & Lightning to USB) the USB end is unfinished on one side, this unfinished side would be the side of the cable that normally has the USB icon on it.  The actual cable measures about 3" long without the end adapters. When the device you're charging is is being recharged, there is about 4 1/4" between the device being charged & its recharging source (laptop, external battery charger, etc.)I  tested the micro to USB keychain cable & the 30 pin to USB keychain cable and was able to recharge my Kindles with the Zeetron Ultra Compact Emergency Keychain micro to USB cable using my external battery charger, laptop, AC USB wall adapter, etc.I didn't have any problems charging my iPod Touch 4G using this compact 30 Pin cable along with my laptop, external battery charger or etc.At first I had trouble inserting the unfinished USB end of this compact keychain cable into a USB port, but it gets easier the more I use the cable.This is a compact/short charging cable, add it to your keychain & use it for the times you forget your cable. Each cable I tested  (30 pin & micro USB) worked for me.review sample provided
summary: Micro & 30 Pin worked for me..Attach to your key chain & never misplace your charging cable again-unless you misplace your keys

reviewText: Up front: I received mine as a review sample. At first I was a bit put off by the short cable length, but have come to see it as a major plus. One reason is the short cord is strong and because it's flat it's also tangle-free. But the main reason is the longer the cord, the easier it is to snap unless it's super thick, which defeats the main feature: portability.The model that I received is strictly for folks who have devices that use a micro USB input. The brand also has Apple 30-pin and Lightning models, but this one is for Android phones. It's also mainly for charging. I would not want to attempt data transfer for a few reasons. First, my Samsung phone is particular about which cables it transfers over, and second, it's too short for much more than emergency use. But that is another reason why I gave it five stars: it fits on my keychain and is always available.Bottom line: if you are looking for a charging cable that you will be using all the time, this is probably not it. If you are looking for a handy, emergency use charging cable that will fit on a keychain, this merits serious consideration. Personally I think this is one of the best ones I have tried and I have tried more than a dozen.
summary: Handy and straightforward charging cable

reviewText: I have both the 30-pin and micro USB versions of the Zeetron cables.  At first glance, I thought they were retractable cables.  They are not.  They go through the pod, out the other side and are only long enough to allow the ends to wrap around and attach to the pod in a neat, almost oval shape.  The cable is very short, so you need the device and whatever you are connecting to be right next to each other.The pods are cute and very convenient to carry.  They are easy to lose, if you don't have them on a keychain.  I like them, but I wish the cables could be a little longer somehow.These products were provided for review by Zeetron.
summary: Compact Cable

reviewText: The regular USB end and the microUSB actually are on the same cable. If you pull one end the other one retracts. It is very light that you hardly feel the weight in your keychain. You can also just throw it in your purse or in the car for emergency use. It works great with a battery pack or wherever you can lay it on a desk with a nearby USB slot. Not practical in a car where your phone will just hang from a cigarette lighter USB adapter or a PC tower.I think this would even be better if the hole is made a carabiner. The hole has a thick loop that it is hard to insert in a keychain.A sample of this product was sent to me for review purposes.
summary: Nifty microUSB

reviewText: They have three versions of this product so make sure you pick the correct one.I received a free version of the usb to lighting adapter.  It is very handy to have.  You can put it on your keychain or as I did place in on a climbing hook that I have attached to the outside of my small gadget bag.With so many different types of plugs for synching and charging it is easy to be without the needed plug.  I need to find one like this that has the three most common....micro, lighting, and 30 pin.This little baby though does what it advertises and will charge up your device easily.
summary: READ the description and PICK the correct keychain.

reviewerName: Richard C. Drew "Anaal Nathra/Uthe vas Bethod...
reviewText: I doubt this will ever see a keychain. I like it because it's compact, the cable can't get tangled or damaged, and I have a portable cable to charge my iPod that I can just toss in a case or bag.  It can't be beat for convenience. Works with my Lightning port iPod.
summary: Simple concept, compact and handy

reviewText: This is a great USB charger, compact and powerful. You can slip it inside your pocket. This is not a keychain, hence I give it a one star less as per specification. But it works great as a USB charging cable.I received the unit in exchange of a fair and honest review.
summary: Excellent USB charger

reviewText: Handy little device that is used to connect iPhone/iPod/iPad to a power source via a standard USB on one end and a 30-pin or micro connector on the other. An Android version is also available.It is NOT a charger. When plugged in, at full extension it is only 3“ long. It is small enough to hang on a key ring but is also awkward to close back up - (you should insert the USB first ).Best use is as a charging cable but not very efficient to transfer data.A complimentary sample was provided for review.
summary: Compact and efficient.

reviewText: There is nothing quite like that feeling of reaching into your travel bag and realizing that you forgot your cell phone charger when you are nowhere near your home. It usually happens shortly after checking into your hotel, exhausted from traveling; early enough to order a pizza, but late enough that most stores are closed. The panic sets in; your eyes glaze over. How did this happen? No more texts to your BFF Jill? OMG!What Do I Do?This is where the Zeetron Ultra Compact Emergency Keychain USB Cable. A gloriously simple idea, this compact device acts as a facilitator (read: it's a short charging cable that is wrapped around a chassis) between your phone (or other micro-USB powered/charged device) and a USB port. As the product picture indicates, simply pull the two ends out of the homes that houses each metal tip and push the appropriate end into the appropriate device (i.e. - micro USB-to-phone and USB-to-USB port). Voìla! Your device should be happily regaining power.Now, with all of this being said, there are a few flaws that prevent the Zeetron from being the perfect backup for everyone. They are:• The length of the cord is very short, measuring in at 3 inches from the near edge of each charging tip. So, no making a garrote, much less a phone call either. Fortunately, the housing does slide along the cord, so you can give yourself more "wiggle room" if you need a bit more space to work.• Also listed in the product description is the fact that the ZEK USB (for short) is very lightweight and is compact enough to be worn on your keychain with very little interference. The product IS light; by my measurements it comes in at 0.28 ounces. When closed up in its oval shape it is smaller than the average electronic key fob for a car; the downside is that you will have to thread your own hook/jump-ring through the gap to get it to hang from your key ring. This is not an easy task.• There is not much "give" in terms of pulling out the charging tips or in putting them away. I suggest 1) when taking them out for use, start with the smaller side first. When putting them away, start with the larger end. This gives you a little bit extra room to pull/maneuver the charging tips into position for insertion/removal.• In re: inserting the micro-USB tip: until the cord has a bit of flexibility, I ended up rubbing the corner against the side edge of the body when putting everything back together for storage. Over time this becomes less of an issue, but you initially do need to take care so that you do not damage/snap off a piece of the tip.• Also in re: the micro-USB tip: on the underside of the tip itself, the two prongs that stick out to help "lock" the adapter into place while charging are a bit taller than the prongs on my charging cord. This resulted in a bit of difficulty while inserting the ZEK USB into my Galaxy S5 (needed more pressure). It didn't damage my phone and it still charged it, but I felt uncomfortable using it for that purpose after a week or so because I was afraid of damaging the tip, my phone, or both.So What is the Final Verdict?The idea behind this product is great, and I can see it go far. There are a few growing pains to work out, all of which are easily solvable. As such, I am keeping the rating high, as most of the flaws that I see are easily rectifiable and not necessarily intrinsic to the design itself, rather, something that can be corrected without having to alter too much else. Just knowing that you have a device handy as backup should you ever forget to pack a charger is great, but keep in mind that this backup has a very short cord and can take a big of wiggling about to get it to do what you need to do, not to mention requires a USB power source. So I give it an "A" for a great idea, "A" for utility, a "C" for design, and a "B" for effort. All in all, a great entry point and one that I believe is handy to have around.**Disclaimer: This unit was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**
summary: Great for When You Forget Your Charging Cable

reviewText: This is an extremely small USB-to-Lightning cable. It's about 2 inches long, so that limits its functionality in certain instances. If, say, you're driving and using your iPhone as a navigator, but the battery is dead, the phone will need to sit somewhere within an inch or two of the power source, which means that it's probably not going to be easily visible and useful as a navigator. Another problem could occur if you need to use a wall outlet. Since the cable is so short, the phone won't be able to rest on the floor and you risk damaging the cable if you try to make it support the weight of the phone (which I obviously don't recommend trying!). However, if you're in a bind and you can sit with your phone near the power source, this works just fine.Lightning cables are still fairly pricey, so it's nice to have this as a backup. I wouldn't use it every day or anything, but it could help in an emergency. I doubt I would ever put this on my keychain, as it's too bulky for that. It does fit easily in a tiny pocket in my computer bag, so that's basically just as good.Overall, this is kind of useful, depending on the circumstances. It certainly performs as advertised. If you want an inexpensive backup lightning cable and you don't want to spend too much, try out the Zeetron.
summary: Tiny, convenient, works

reviewText: OK... this is a cool little gadget to have tucked away for those "just in case" situations... the Zeetron Ultra Compact Emergency Keychain USB Cable. It's a 3.5" (approximately) cable that is contained in a clever housing that will fit on your keychain or in some other small pocket.The USB and device plugs tuck away into the housing, and the short cable simply slides through the center of the unit. It's easiest to remove the device plug first and then the USB plug, as it'll need the extra cord slack to get the USB plug to clear the unit. When putting it back together, just do the reverse, and everything fits easily.This would be perfect for those times you need to recharge your phone, but you didn't bring a spare cable along. With this tucked away, you'll always be able to connect to a USB plug *somewhere* to get your charge back. Great idea...Disclosure:Obtained From: ManufacturerPayment: Free
summary: Very clever and handy...

reviewText: The Zeetron Ultra Compact Emergency Keychain USB Cable is one of the items that you do not realize you need until you own one. I love that it is very small and compact. I can put it in my pocket and know that I pretty much always have a convenient way to charge my cell phone. With this USB cable I do not need to carry a wall charger with me that is larger and a bit more unwieldy. I can also use this unit with a host of backup battery chargers that I use for my phone. This is very handy when I am camping or backpacking. The connections fit well into my phone, computer, or backup battery. The cord is not to long which is not a problem.Overall Assessment:I am very satisfied with the Zeetron Ultra Compact Emergency Keychain USB Cable. I carry it with me all of the time and can effectively use it whenever I need a power supply. The unit is small, durable, well-priced, and very effective. Highly recommended.
summary: Compact, Convenient, and Effective

reviewText: zeetron provided a sample for review.  I didn’t do much product research prior to receiving this, and mistakenly assumed that the cord was retractable, but that isn’t the case, as the cord is fixed, and only about 4” long.  For what it is, the device works well enough.  The center housing is designed to protect the contacts, and has an opening through it, so it can be attached to a keychain or lanyard.While a 4” long cord may work well for some, it is a little too short for what I usually require, and the housing attached to the middle of the cord, adds to the awkwardness when using it.  A cord this short, would probably work better with a laptop or power bank.  For me, attaching a lanyard to it might make the most sense, as I would never attach this device to my regular keychain.If you need a cord in a compact package, this device could be a solution.  The word “emergency” is part of the product description, which might be a fair characterization of when this cord could be utilized.  It is available with micro-USB, 30 pin Apple, and Apple Lightning (not “Lighting” which is a typo) type connectors.
summary: portable, but very short USB cord…

reviewText: I am not a huge techie - so I was particularly excited that the Bluetooth on this worked perfectly the first time on both my iPad and iPhone!To say that this is beautiful is a HUGE understatement. When it is off it sits like a diamond (I guess that is why it is called that) and makes a huge fashion statement. But when it turns on, randomly in any of the settings, it shines like a star. It even has three different settings for playing your music allowing it to gently move with the mood or pulsing in and out.I actually use a meditation based on color and enjoy playing it through this using the setting to focus on a single color (the one I am using in my meditation) while the meditation plays through the speakers.But this goes beyond just being beautiful. The speakers are awesome and I found that they played all of my music with good sound, even some of the more subtle tones that I don't always hear.The Bedtime Social App (listed as iPhone only, but works with iPad) has all of the same settings as the remote PLUS it allows you to set your BlackDiamond as an alarm and as a timer. The settings are easy to use - in fact the timer is an hourglass. You can even record your voice (or a loved one) to announce your wake up time.I received a free sample of this speaker to test for my review. I have found it to be awesome and am fully enjoying it. Because of the wake-up feature, I am keeping this plugged in (using the USB cord) next to my bed so that I can fully enjoy it.Highly approved ... would make a beautiful gift.
summary: Truly Beautiful

reviewText: This has to be the most stunning Bluetooth speaker I've ever seen. The photos make it look nice, but seeing it light up in person is amazing. The colors are so much nicer looking than I ever thought they would be. These aren't disco ball type lights coming from it. It's not just a black casing with rainbow lights behind it. The rainbow colors sparkle almost like shimmering frost or glitter from inside the speaker. It's gorgeous.I set this speaker up in my office to use with my iPhone. I can plug it in and just have the lights rotating or subtly shimmering, using the speaker as a light. Or I can sync my phone with it and play music through it as a speaker. The rainbow lights have several settings that let me change the color scheme of what colors pulse or play when my music is on. The lights can pulse with each beat of the music. And different volume levels for different parts of a song can make one color glow brighter of pulse faster than another.The speaker's volume can be set really loud if needed. Probably a lot louder than many would even use normally. Today my husband was using this speaker in the living room and had his music up loud on it, and I could hear it playing in the basement where I was doing laundry. It produces a lot of sound for something about the size of a small grapefruit. So If you want something to take outside to play music, this can handle it.On the back of the speaker there is a 3.5mm auxiliary cable. So if you want to use a device that doesn't have Bluetooth, or want to save the battery in your device by not using your Bluetooth, you can plug the cable into your device's earphone jack and the music will play through it the same way it does when it's wirelessly synced.There is even an included remote control with buttons on it for controlling all the light functions and also the volume and power controls. On the back of the speaker there is a little slot that's perfect in size for sliding the remote into when you're not using it, so you always know where it is.It's an awesome speaker that is unlike any other one I've ever owned or seen. The lights and colors are stunning and the sound is clear and loud. It's a great size and not only works well as a speaker, but looks good running even when there's no music playing!Sample provided for review
summary: So gorgeous!

reviewText: This review, like most others submitted before mine, was based on samples provided by the manufacturer in exchange for an honest review.  Amazon, btw, requires this disclaimer, in these cases.  Anyway, here is what I found:The speaker paired easily and immediately with my iPhone 5, iPad Air, and iPad version 2.  Once paired it sounded great and looked great.  (Actually, it looked great before pairing and better once I saw the light show... more on that later.)The sound was rich and full.  There was plenty of volume to fill several large rooms.  Unlike some admittedly less expensive speakers, there was no loss of Bluetooth signal as I wandered well over the 33' Bluetooth standard limit.There are no controls on the speaker; you control everything using the included remote.  I like that the remote can be stored in a special slot in the speaker so it is out of way, out of sight, and still be where you can find it.The included remote provides full control over the speaker.  You can change its volume, have it relay Pause/Play/Forward/Reverse commands to your device, and make any needed adjustments to the light show.  (More on that later.)If you like, you can also download a free app, as described in the instructions that come with the speaker, which mirrors the controls provided by the speaker.  The app also provides some additional functionality not related to the speaker such as setting a sleep timer and a wake up time.  I already have those additional capabilities in my phone and to me the value is knowing that if ever do lose the remote the speaker remains just as useful.Now, on to the light show!  And it *is* a show.  There are many options for display.  You can have it cycle though its eight colors or select one of several modes where several colors are displayed at the same time in different patterns and change along with the audio.I agree with you that this is not the least expensive Bluetooth speaker available.  However, when you consider that by itself ambiance lighting can be expensive, for example theCielux LUNE Ambiance lightor thePhilips Living Colors Iris Table Lamp, this device with its great sound could be considered somewhat of a bargain.
summary: An outstand (and unique) Bluetooth speaker

reviewText: This little speaker had great timing.  I had a big cooking party with private band booked and planned. The band was double booked, so I decided to see what this little guy could do now that I was left with an iPod.In some ways, I think this is actually WAY more fun and I am talking a party for adults (I started to type "adult party" but then figured I was about to start incorrect rumors about my dinner parties and worry the neighbors so...nice catch on my part, huh?  But I digress.) Anyway, if this can make a fun light show and create a mood on top of your music when you entertain and no kids are in attendance, just think of what it could do for a dorm party, a slumber party, etc.I do suggest dimming the lights in your room, or even enjoying it outside while you grill and entertain.There is simply something magical about lighting effects making you want to dance, making you feel "up" and happy and creating that mood.  This does it for you--way cheaper than hiring some lighting effect dude to go with a band.This one is a keeper for me---because the SOUND is FANTASTIC for the price, and it's clear enough to use outside it's so good.  And on top of that you get the light show and effects.As far as effects, they can be done how you want with the remote--a rainbow, randomly, set to play to the tempo of the song, or more.Even better, it has an Android or IOS app that allows you to use it programmed with this to wake you up with a gentle sunrise and whispers.  Seriously.  There is nothing more glaring than a radio or beeping alarm clock going off to wake you up.  But a gentle sunrise that nudges you asleep with soft whispers?  It is FANTASTIC.I expected this to possibly look hokey when not lit, but cool when lit.  It's far from the truth. It actually looks like a real crystal rather than plastic. Very nice and super shiny and cut in a cool manner with a color that is not clear like plastic but slightly amber or brown so it looks like something far more natural--meaning it looks pretty wherever you put it, at all times, unlike most speakers.The remote fits right in the back of the speaker.I can't stop playing with it!Speaker provided by YantouchReview is my unbiased opinion
summary: The band cancelled but the speaker kept the party going

reviewText: The sound is good. But my favorite thing about this bluetooth speaker is the light show. There are lots of colors and so much variety is how the colors are presented. That makes this speaker fun and I think just about anybody will immediately like it. Sample provided.
summary: Nice light show

reviewText: Oh my GOD - This is such a great speaker!  It is absolutely beautiful - it looks like the Northern Lights except in sync with your music!  Even if it wasn't a speaker it would be a very cool thing to own, but it's actually a really good speaker, too.  Unlike a lot of smaller speakers it has very nice bass response and very clear highs.  There's no muddiness in the sound like you find in many little bluetooth speakers.It's really well designed and tasteful.  The colors aren't disco-ball bright, instead they are slightly muted, like jewel tones which gives it a very sophisticated look and goes very well with the faceted surface.  The light show is completely customizable - I prefer the rainbow one - but it can fade from solid color to solid color or any number of other modes, if you prefer.  It's controlled by a remote, and there's a slot in the back of the speaker to store it so it doesn't get lost (thank you.)  A friend stopped by the other day with her toddler and he thought this was magic!  I had to kind of agree with him - it really is pretty magical looking.
summary: Coolest speaker EVER!

reviewText: Bottom line: This is an rather unique take on a wireless mini speaker. It offers excellent sound quality and solid build quality. On the flip side, the user interface has a couple of (for me) major downsides. Depending on how you feel about the light display, this can be either be a unique speaker or something that’s a poor value.Full review: This takes the typical mini bluetooth speaker a step further by building in a light display that can be tied to the music being played.My initial impression was very favorable – it feels solid and well-built. It’s all plastic, but the plastic is of good quality. It is also very well packaged, which is a departure from the usual “just toss it in a box” approach that’s typically seen. Unfortunately, the brief user guide that comes with it is very sparse and doesn’t really go through the product features or explain them very well. A better guild should have been included given the price point. Also included in the box is a cable (more on that later) and AC plug adapter for recharging, and a very nice cloth carry bag.The sound quality is excellent. The upper and mid-ranges are clear; there’s ample bass that doesn’t sound muddy or boomy; and unlike other bluetooth speakers the volume range is excellent – you can really blare this puppy! Zero complaints about the sound quality be it in bluetooth mode or direct wired mode.The built-in battery is 1300mAh which gives it a longer run time than pretty much any other speaker I’ve used. Excellent!The user interface is tied to the remote. I don’t like that since I’m prone to losing remotes. Granted, this has a slot for storing the remote but should you lose it you’ve also lost pretty much all functionality from the speaker since there are zero controls on the speaker itself. For me, that’s a major negative.The remote is small and thin, with well-marked buttons that provide a good amount of tactile feedback. No complaints about the remote – I just find it problematic that it is a mandatory item to use for speaker control.In addition to the remote you can download an app for iOS or Android for control options. I found the app unwieldy to use versus the remote, but it’s an option, and also serves as a “backup” should you lose the remote.As is usually the case with recent bluetooth speakers, zero problems pairing this with a device. The operating range is also very good with zero dropouts at 20+ feet.You can also direct-connect the speaker to a device, but instead of using a standard 3.5mm to 3.5mm cord, you have to use a cord (which is supplied) that has a 3.5mm plug on one end, and a mini USB plug on the other. That’s not a problem except for the fact that you have to remember to bring that cable along – a traditional 3.5mm to 3.5mm cord (of which I have a bunch of) won’t work.The advantage to the unique cable is that it can also be used as a charging cable (the included cable has 2 ends: one is a standard USB plug; the other is the 3.5mm plug). So, while it is unique, it means you only need to carry one cord to both charge and direct-connect.The light show is what really sets this apart from other speakers. That’s hard to judge in terms of value. Personally, I didn’t care much for it. Yes, it was fun for a short time, but I use speakers for the benefit of my ears, not my eyes. After a few minutes of playing with it, I turned it off (in addition to a variety of lighting options, it can also be turned off completely).So, if you find the lights distracting or unwelcome, you can turn them off but you’re paying a lot more for a speaker than you should – there are a number of bluetooth speakers that sound as good as this at far lower price points since they don’t include the light show.My ratings:Build quality = 5Sound quality = 5Instructions = 2User interface = 2Direct connect approach = 3Overall value = 5 (if you’re into a light show); 2 (if you just like to listen to speakers)Overall rating = 4. It is worth considering, but if you’re main goals for a speaker are good build quality and good sound, you can accomplish those goals by spending less than what this costs.[Sample provided for review]
summary: Great sound; difficult user interface; uncertain value

reviewText: This speaker easily paired with my Android phone and tablet, so easy to get it setup. And I must say that this is by far the BEST sounding Bluetooth that I have ever used and I have tested many Bluetooth speakers!This particular speaker is different because it has a richer sound as I heard bass and treble notes that have much depth and richness much more so that other Bluetooth speakers I used before. Also, it is plenty loud enough to carry the sound into several rooms -- hence a great party speaker.About the lights: It gives out a dazzling light show with the lights that can be changed to different colors.Love that this has a handy remote control as one can control the volume, move to next song and more from far away from this speaker. The remote fits back into the unit when not in use.[Unit provided for testing and review purposes].
summary: What a full sounding and remarkable Bluetooth Speaker - Superb sound on this speaker!

reviewText: Quite honestly, when I agreed to test and review this product, I had no idea how much fun it would be. I even thought, Oh, just another Bluetooth speaker.  I couldn't have been more wrong.  First, the sound is really good for a single speaker device.  You can crank up the volume and still enjoy the music with only minimal distortion.  And it sounds just as good at a low volume.  But the real kicker is the light display, something I wasn't sure I'd like but which won me over immediately.  You can even set the light show to match the tempo of the music.The BlackDiamond looks both futuristic and retro, a bizarre mix, I admit.  The light show is reminscent of disco, but the shape looks like some sort of crystal in a sci-fi movie.  The included remote control is a blast to use to control the light effects, but, of course, it also controls volume, skipping and returning to tracks, pause/play, mute, and power.The speaker comes with a storage pouch, a USB/wall charger, and an attached aux jack for wired connections.  This speaker is great fun for parties, and I imagine it would be a hit particularly with the preteen and teen sets.  But as an adult, I love it, too.  Note:  I received a sample for review.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Tons of Fun -- and Great Sound

reviewText: I was provided a Yantouch BlackDiamond+ Bluetooth Speaker for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ Amazing Sound.♦ Great lighting effects with vivid colors and several different lighting modes to choose from.♦ Excellent remote that controls all functions of the speaker, but would be a problem if lost.♦ Can be connected via Bluetooth or the included stereo cable.♦ Good Bluetooth range of 15-20 feet.♦ Has a rechargeable battery that charges with a standard Mini USB cable (included).♦ Frequency and bass response is very good for this size speaker.♦ Caused a spontaneous dance party to break out when my two young daughters stole the speaker and played with it for about two hours.Detailed Review:♦ Look - The product came in a professional looking box with product information and pictures on the outside. The speaker was securely packed with plastic inserts to protect it. Inside the box was the Speaker, a multi-function remote, an instruction manual, a combo USB cable charging cable and stereo cable, a wall plug and a carrying pouch. This is a fairly compact Bluetooth speaker with a clear dome on the front over the lighting elements.  The back has a bass tube and a storage slot for the remote and the sides have a speaker port on each side. It looks really cool. It has no buttons and only a mini USB port for charging, so you must use the remote to operate this speaker and the included combo stereo cable if you want to attached this speaker directly to your music source instead of via Bluetooth. It looks like it is designed and built well.♦ Installation - I plugged in the included Mini USB charging cable into the unit and into a USB wall charger to give it an initial charge before testing it out.♦ Use and Performance - Once the speaker was charged, a did a variety of tests to try it out using my iPhone 5S.Test #1 (Sound Quality Test) - I tried out a variety of music from some Disney kids songs to Michael Bublé to Excision Bass Heavy Dubstep (the Destroid album), and it sounded absolutely amazing.  The entire range of sound was great with crisp highs and decent bass response for a small speaker.  It handled all of the different types of music that I tried and sounded great with each of them.  It is probably the best sounding Bluetooth speaker I have ever tested.Test #2 (Sound Performance Test) - After I got past the basic sound quality, I tried out a few more technical tests. I put speaker directly in front of me and started playing a Dolby HD Surround Sound test video. It sounded great, and had some stereo effects due to the separate speaker ports on each side of the speaker.  Not perfect, but you did hear some stereo separation in the playback. I also played a frequency test file that started at 20Hz and found that the speakers started producing sound around the 65Hz range. The sound continued with sound being audible all the way up to 15000Hz. Decent range for a small speaker.Test #3 (Use Test) - I tested the Bluetooth range by walking through my house and got a good distance away, about 15-20 feet around a few walls, before the sound dropped out. Walking back started the sound back up immediately. Once the sound testing was done via Bluetooth streaming, I tried out the sound from the Aux input cable from my iPhone and it sounded just as good.  Next I tried out the lighting effects.  Now this is where this speaker really stood out.  The speaker came with a pretty detailed remote with 18 different buttons.  The remote was very responsive and had buttons for the usual playback and volume functions as well as several different lighting functions.  The colors of the speaker were amazing with lights that could change into just about any color in the spectrum.  The colors were extremely vivid and looked great.  It had some cool functions for different lighting effects.  My favorite was the tempo based lights that would flash with the beat of the music.  It looked great and was really fun.  When I was testing the speaker, my daughters (ages 4 and 7) came running to see it.  They each took turns playing with the remote and kept pestering me to let them play with it more.  After I was done with my testing, I connected it to my daughter's iPad Mini and the two girls disappeared with the speaker for about two hours.  They closed all the doors and windows in their room and the hallway to make it dark and had a dance party.  It was easy to use for them and they loved it.Conclusion:Overall, this speaker sounds amazing.  On top of that, the lighting effects are really great with extremely vivid colors and cool lighting modes. While this is an expensive speaker, it is pretty impressive in my initial testing.  If you are looking for a great sounding Bluetooth speaker with cool lighting functions, this one is an excellent choice.  Highly Recommended!
summary: What You Should Know Before You Buy! (Caution: May Cause a Spontaneous Dance Party!)

reviewText: This is really a neat looking speaker, that gives you a light show as you listen to your music.The unit is not at all tiny like most bluetooth speakers, at ~ 4" x 4.5". However, the base is just about 3", and very stable. I do not find the size of the unit an issue at all. In fact, I think it is a very good size so you can enjoy the color show. Also, I doubt you could get the quality of sound this unit has with a very tiny unit.Setting up the bluetooth was totally intuitive and took less then a minute. The unit has it's controls on a remote control, and not one the unit at all. I really like the remote, as it has a lot of features, including light changes. My only worry here, is I can seeing loosing the remote. Luckily, there is a place to store the remote on the back of the unit.The Yantouch Black diamond has an Iphone 5 app that I downloaded. However, I am not tech savvy and have not really figured out how to all the functions. I can turn it on and off, change the volume and changes the light shows, but there are no instructions so I don't know what else I might be missing. I consider this issue a user error and not a device error. ;-)I was given a sample for an honest opinion.So far, I really love this unit and have it set up in my living room on tune in radio. The battery lasts 10 hours, which I am also happy with.I am going to use the unit the next few days and add to my review if necessary. So far, I consider this a 4.5 star unit, a half star taken off for no controls on the unit. If I find out I can control the unit from my phone, I will give it 5 star.
summary: Very neat speaker...

reviewText: This is a great speaker with wonderful set of fun effects.There are two parts to this speaker: the sound and the lighting effects.So to start with the sound, it is great. It really carries and fills a room. The bass is good, detail is great, vocals are clear and close.The lighting effects are so much fun. There are a lot of settings available and all are controlled by a remote control. You can set a color, rotating colors, etc. It keeps to the beat and sometimes has a life of its own! You can also control the intensity (brightness) of the colorIt has a wonderful sparkly lens that dissipates the colors to sparkly points, like it is covered in crystals.It sits firmly and makes a statement when looking at it and comes with a carry case for storage.It comes with a hefty price tag but I've seen plain speakers at this price and this one has the added features of the light show.I was provided a unit for testing and review.
summary: Wonderful! Fun! Great for Parties, Dorms, or a Business

reviewText: Daisy S' helpful and informative April 26, 2014 review covers the basics very well. I certainly concur with most of her points, but some of my experiences and observations are different.The sound quality is almost at the same level as an in-ear monitor, which is truly impressive.While you can only control this speaker from an external source (either the included remote or an iPhone or Android smartphone app), you are not fumbling with multifunction buttons that are both small and in some cases confusing. For me this feature is right up there with sound quality. If you lose the remote (or it gets destroyed by a pet), you can still control the speaker via your phone. Of course at this time there are only apps for IOS and Android, so if you are using a Windows-based phone you are going to be out of luck. As for finding the app, it's ironic that it is not available in Amazon's app store at the time of this review, but I found it by searching the Google Play Store using yantouch as the keyword. The app name is BedTimeSocial. More about that below.One feature that I immediately loved is how easy it is to connect this via bluetooth. No weird button sequences to navigate: press the bluetooth button on the remote, scan for new devices with your phone, tablet or PC, pair and connect.When I received my review sample I was a little perplexed by the unit. The split cable with a micro USB and a 3.5mm connector threw me, but I discovered that one was for powering the speaker and the other was to plug in a hardwired sound source, like a non-bluetooth MP3 player or sound out from your PC. Here is the catch: you cannot power your speaker from the same source that provides the sound signal. In other words, you cannot connect both ends to a PC - out for sound and the other for power. The signal quality doing that is terrible (I had to try.) But that is clearly cited in the instructions, so it's a non issue for me. This speaker works with any USB cable with a micro USB end and a separate 3.5mm cable, so the split cable that ships with it is a convenience, not a requirement. You can also use any USB wall charger that is rated at 1.0 Amps (it will not work with anything below that, which includes a lot of PC USB ports.)The remote is a major convenience. There is even a slot for it in the speaker itself. Since downloading the Android app, though, I prefer using my phone to control it since that is where I am streaming music from anyway. I am currently using a Samsung Galaxy Note 3 running Android 4.3 and the app provides me with all of the features on the remote as well as using the speaker as an alarm clock.Overall I am totally pleased with this speaker based on the sound quality alone. When I factor in the convenience of being able to control it from my phone I feel it raises the bar for all higher end bluetooth speakers.
summary: Better than anticipated

reviewText: This portable wireless Bluetooth speaker has very nice sound, but the thing I like best is the light show. This comes with a remote control that gives you several choices for how you want the lights to display. You can set it to cycle through the different colors, use a single color, or my favorite: pulsate all different colors to the beats of the music. I love sitting and watching it. The lights are just as much fun to watch when it's playing classical music as it with rock or rap. Using it to listen to meditation music gives the experience a whole new dimension.This speaker comes with a 3 way USB charging cable that has a 3.5mm Aux plug and a USB plug on one end and the other end is a MiniUSB plug. So you can charge it while plugging in an MP3 player at the same time. I usually leave it plugged in when I'm playing it in the house. Of course I normally connect using the wireless Bluetooth. It pairs almost instantly to my iPhone or my iPad or Kindle Fire HD. There's a storage slot in the unit for the little remote which is nice because there aren't any controls on the unit itself so I don't want to lose it. It also comes with a carrying pouch but I like leaving it out on a shelf because it has such a cool look.It has an Android app that can be downloaded that will mimic a sunrise with different colors, gradually going to a bright white. It even has bird sounds and whisperings in the background to make for a pleasant gradual wake up experience. I like that the lightshow can be enjoyed even without music, or it can be set to a single color light. The speaker has a vey nice look, even when turned off. On one hand it looks futuristic and the other sort of retro with all the pulsing colors. It certainly gets a lot of attention when we entertain. I love watching it while listening to music. It makes me want to get up and dance!I was provided with a sample of this product for testing and an impartial review.
summary: Makes me want to get up and dance!

reviewText: If you have ever been caught without a USB charging cable for your iPhone, you will appreciate this little gizmo. It will never be your everyday cable, but in a pinch, it might come in very handy.=== The Good Stuff ===* It is small. It its "stored" configuration, it is 1 7/8" x 1 1/8" x 3/16". Easily small enough to keep on a keychain, and it has a hole cut in for just this purpose. It weighs 0.2 ounces, barely enough to notice. When extended, the cord is roughly 4" long, just enough to connect between a USB port and an iPhone.* The connector fit well into the iPhone 30 pin connector and a USB port, providing a snug fit both times. It seemed to charge in the "normal" amount of time. I was unable to sync my iPhone using this cable- the rear panel of the package says it will "charge", so that may be expected behavior.=== The Not-So-Good Stuff ===* The plastic of this in 3/8" thick, which means that it is a big of a struggle to get on and off a keychain. The cord is so short that using it while attached to my car keys was problematic. The struggle to get this on and off a keychain ruined some of the convenience, although that could be solved with some sort of easy-separate keychain- something like people use for a valet key.* When putting the cord back into the case, you have to remember to put the USB connector in first, otherwise it won't go together. it resulted in a few choice words until I remembered the secret.=== Summary ===* While it may not be the 100% most convenient design, if you need one of these cables in a pinch, this isn't a bad thing to have on hand. Rather than my keychain, I ended up putting it on a loop of string inside my computer bag, attaching it to one of the many metal loops. While I won't use it everyday, I am sure someday it will prove itself very useful, especially considering the small weight and size penalty for carrying it.
summary: Convenient, but somewhat limiting

reviewText: This is a good idea for people who often find themselves needing a short charging cable for micro USB or Apple Lightening devices. I tried it with my iPad mini and Android smartphone and it worked fine with both, though one issue you may run into is difficulty plugging it into devices that have large cases that interfere with the plug.The variety of colors this is available in is also a plus, and the material feels durable and of good quality.I do wish they provided some instructions and illustrations with it, but it's not too hard to figure out how to get the cable out and use it. When done charging, put (by pushing) both connectors back in the hippo for protection and to hide them (pulling on the keyring may be helpful as well).You probably wouldn't want to use this as your regular charging cable, but it's a great idea for anyone who often wants or needs a charging cable and finds that they don't have one immediately available... so for that reason I am rating it 4 stars (but if this doesn't apply to you (i.e. you hardly ever find yourself in need of such cabling), then this key chain may be of little use to you). I decided to deduct one star due to potential problems with the plug design and not easily being able to plug (fit) the cables into some devices with large cases.NOTE: I was sent a free product sample for review.
summary: Good if you often find yourself needing a charging cable

reviewText: *Disclosure: I was contacted by a rep for Zeetron and provided a free sample for the purposes of giving my thoughts on it.*Ok, whoever decided this item was a hippo needs to have a look at a cow, because seriously, it looks far more like a cow than a hippo.  Anyone ever see a hippo with a different colored ring around one eye?  Or a hippo with pointy ears or horns?  I'm thinking no.That aside, what we have here is a little dual function USB cable.  Dual function in that it works with most every iOS and Android device.  I'd call it an emergency cable, given that it's fitted with a key ring and the cord length is tiny.  Not something I'd want to use every day, but would work in a pinch.  A serious pinch, unless connecting up to an external battery, laptop, tablet, or, you have a USB extension cable/hub within easy reach.  The material used is of good quality, and the whole assembly is done well.Really, this is a cutesy product I'd never buy.  However, the moment my work wife saw it, she was all over it.  It's on her keyring now, where she likes to show it off to her friends.  Something tells me she's never actually used it....
summary: Cute!

reviewText: This cute little keychain is perfect for young kids and maybe some adults. It's basically a multi-function cable that has USB on one end and lightning and micro USB on the other end. The cable is wrapped up inside a cute little blue Hippo that is made of silicone. It's really quite adorable and I think most kids would get a kick out of it.The cable itself is about 6 inches long when not in use it's held inside the Hippo. When you need to use it you pull it out of the Hippo's mouth and stretch it out. Don't worry the Hippo is tough and you won't hurt him. I have used it to charge my phone with the micro USB cable and it has worked fine. It also works well to charge my iPad Mini but it may be difficult to use while your iPad or iPad Mini is in a case.This cable is inexpensive and the Hippo is so cute. It works well and I think it was a brilliant idea. I would recommend this for your young ones; I think they will enjoy it.Sample provided for review.
summary: So very cute and it works well. Includes USB to Lightning and Micro USB cable.

reviewText: This is an adorable cable, whoever came up with this idea is genuinely creative. This is a short microUSB / Apple Lightning cable stuffed inside the head of a hippopotamus. Go figure, a hippopotamus.Cute design aside, this is a good solid cable. The flat cable is made with really thick insulation. The cable ends are big and rubbery, so they will take a lot of abuse. The input side of the cable (the rectangular USB plug) looks big but in fact is just about the standard size for a cable end. You shouldn't have space issues with the connector. The business end is another story - they insulation is also big and rubbery. There are two connectors on that one end and they are in a Y formation. If you have a thick case, this connector might not work. If the connectors were 90 or 180 degrees apart, case thickness might not be a problem.OK, on to the fun part of this cable. When you take it out of the package, the hippo head is pulled down over the connector ends, and a key ring is visible. You slide the hippo head toward the key ring. Once the ends are visible, simply grab them and pull them apart. The hippo head will slide up over the key ring and allow you to use the cable straightened out. With the hippo head on the key ring, it looks like a frog that is grabbing lunch.This is an adorable cable that works well if you don't have a thick case.I was provided a review sample.
summary: Adorable

reviewText: This cable is sooooo clever!This is a short cable with a USB connector on one end and two connectors on the other end:  micro USB and Lightning for Apple devices.  All this is bundled up in a keychain with a cute hippo head on it.  What a clever way to ensure that you have your two most-used cables with you at all times.The first thing I noticed when I tried this out is that I didn't get the nagging message telling me that the cable isn't compatible with my Apple device.  Most of my Lightning cables are cheap third-party knock offs.  I've gotten used to this annoying message; it's fine with me as long as the cable actually charges my phone.  But I'm much happier when I don't get that message, because sometimes the phone truly doesn't recognize the cable and doesn't charge.  I have a couple other Zeetron cables and they are all very reliable like this one.Honestly the design of this keychain fob doesn't really fit my personality.  It just doesn't go with my big diesel pickup truck.  But I'm also a geek who works for a major technology organization.  At work, geeks are cool.  So I put a little clip on it (search for "trigger hook" here on Amazon to see what I'm talking about, or see the link in my comment below) and clipped it onto my laptop bag.  Now I have a handy-dandy dual use charge cable right at my fingertips whenever I'm at work or travelling.This is a super clever design and incredibly useful.  And even if you don't love the hippo motif, just cut it off and still use the handy little cable.I was provided this item for review.
summary: I love this cable

reviewText: ZEETRON selected a clever name for this portable USB charger. Though it is bulky for a key chain, for the contents of this rubber Hippo head the services are compact. It serves as a connector for charging via the USB end for devices using USB and a two headed Lightning USB for iPhone 5S, 5, and iPod devices and a micro USB for Samsung, Nokia, HTC, Blackberry, and LG devices. The only item missing from the kit is a charging source! But of course with all the power banks, wall chargers, and car chargers floating around, everyone has plenty of sources for power - just not enough readily available connectors. This little gadget helps correct that problem. Take it anywhere, charge multiple devices while in the car or on a trip. Works well and is clever to boot. Grady Harp, June 14
summary: A `Hippo' not only because of design, but of possibilities

reviewText: I wouldn't normally review a non-Apple USB cable immediately after trying it out for the first time, but the problems with this cable occurred immediately. Here's the dealbreaker: this charges extremely slowly. Unacceptably slowly. I first tried it with my iPhone 5 by connecting this cable to my laptop, which is how I almost always charge my phone. Results: In 20 minutes, it charged 2 percentage points. Yes, 2. Also, when I first connected it, I got the "This accessory might not be supported." That's never a good sign, because in my experience, that's a good indication that the cable will completely fail in a month or less.I then tried it with my iPad Air, and the results were even worse. This time, I connected the cable to the iPad Air wall charger (again, this is how I typically charge this device with other cables), and after 12 minutes, it had not charged at all.The lightning connector also has a worryingly tight fit. It takes a bit of force to get the connector into my phone and my iPad, but disconnecting it is even harder. I have to pull quite hard, and I'm genuinely concerned that the force that I have to use could cause the connector to break off in my device.When I look closely at the tip of the lightning connector, I can see some very small scratches and one gouge. Could that be causing the problems? My Apple cable, which I've had for more than six months and use on a daily basis, doesn't have a single visible scratch.This is a shame, because this cable could have been uniquely useful. I was looking forward to having a cable that I could keep stashed in my bag, without worrying that it would get damaged.Note: I received a sample of the product in exchange for an honest review.
summary: SLOOOOOOW Charging

reviewerName: Joel Avrunin "Electrical Engineer who loves S...
reviewText: Perhaps I am spoiled, but I recently evaluated a great little Zeetron keychain charger and was hoping this would be a cuter version of the same.  It's a great idea, but I'm not totally sold on the execution as I will explain.What you get here is a short USB to both lightning and micro-USB cable (both on one end) that is looped through a keychain.  A hollow flexible hippo-head slides down the cable to cover up the cable ends.  By pushing the cable through, you can easily plug it into a USB port or a charger and charge up your Apple product with lightning cable input (iPhone, iPad, etc) or a device with a Micro-USB input.  For those of us who have a bluetooth headset with Micro-USB, it is nice to have both on 1 cable.  The cable itself seems high quality and sturdy with enough flex to make it easy to reach between devices.The problem I had is that the lightning cable is not extended off of the plastic block at all - it is flush with the block.  That means if you have any sort of case on your phone at all, even a thin one, the cable won't work (my phone is in an Amazon Basics case).  Zeetron addressed this already with theirZeetron Ultra Compact Emergency Keychain Usb Cable - Black Lighting to USB (For Iphone 5, 5c, 5s, Ipad 4, Air, Mini, Ipod Touch 5th Gen)by having the lightning cable on a small extension block.  This extension was good enough to get past the thin case on my iPhone.  Unfortunately, this design feature didn't make it onto the hippo.So ultimately, it's a really really cute keychain and a great idea, but I can't carry it because the lightning connector won't mate with my iPhone while in the case.  If you carry a naked iPhone, then this is a great way to always have a cable by your side.Note: I received a free sample from the manufacturer for the purposes of review.
summary: Cute little keychain but I prefer my other Zeetron keychain charger - tough to connect to iPhone in case

reviewText: This is a quality charging cord, I received this as a review sample from Zeetron. It is a very cute hippo head that has the charging cord coming out of it's mouth. When it is closed, it looks really cute. It is a light blue silicone material that feels and looks really nice.The cords themselves work nicely and is a good combo for me because I can charge my iPhone with the Apple 8 pin and something else with the universal micro-USB.Unlike some of the other cords I bought, this one connects to my computer and let's me sync stuff from iTunes. On top of that, it's a useful keychain and is very compact.So, overall it's cute, compact, can charge two types of devices, is a keychain and a conversation piece. What more can you ask for? Totally recommend this!
summary: Fantastic!

reviewText: It's hard to find the sweet spot between USB-mini USB cords which are three feet long and ones that while shorter can be lost easily. This attempts to bridge that gap. The Zeetron Cute Hippo 2 in 1 USB cable, as it says, is cute and it's rubber.
